harmonie vpon three euangelists matthew mark luke commentarie iohn caluine faithfullie translated latine english e p whereunto also added commentarie vpon euangelist iohn authour londini impensis geor bishop 1584 renowmed pieres noble lordes consul whole senate famous citie frank • ford caluine euer seemed expedient pageant vertues shewed openly imitation others might bee spurre well lasie lingerer restie runner surely slouthfull dealing sluggish behauiour whiche vsed corrupt dayes maketh seeme necessarie greater part men rather start back willingly step forward shold bee constrained least shame negligence doe dutie see euery man busilie bent certaine contention shall excell wicked practises priuate publike affaire monarche doth seeme inferiour nation border vpon either policie vigilancie power bolde attempt whereby may enlarge boundes empire citie common weale doth giue place craftinesse captious dealing man second subtletie among proud ambitious finally man hath conspired companie way contention slilie incite rest becke vitious vanitie ringleader naughtinesse sonest stirreth vp lewdnesse whereas rankest route ribald scarce one found fauoureth honestie maketh thinke profitable rare vertues sometime raigne noble personage bee aduaunced loftie theater stage due commendation intent spied farre might allure greater number like liue accordingly confesse right honorable chiefest cause moued publish labour abroad vnder title name although shall persuade selfe haue profited wel beginne owne accorde creepe forward shalbe incouraged runne faster yet muche respect might persuade ioyn hand least tread path notwithstāding haue purposed recite rolle godly quality wherewith throughly furnished shall suffice time set forth one vertue wherewith haue bound honour holy bond aswell mee diuers faithfull seruants iesus christ one thing worthie highly prayed fiue yeeres since horrible feare affrighted mindes men euery place whenas ouerthrowe enemy giuen v threaten miserable ruine church throughout germany almost vtter extinguishing gospel euen time beeing placed fore front battaile stood stoutly free confession faith hated death retained constancie sincere doctrine pietie receiued manifest argument tossed greuous care dangerous turmoyles desired nothing fight manfully vnder christes banner▪ followeth surely make name immortall doe set amongest selues true worship god imploy faithfull labour cōteine citizen within sheepfold christ also gather togeather dispersed relikes church thrust nation member rent pulled peeces doubtles greatly reioice hart cōsidering troublesome time heare true worshiper god fled exile england country gently receiued entertained among you▪ releeue ease heauie banishment also due consideration glory sonne god insomuch made gospel sounded citie euen tongue aliants straunge language like curtesie shewed late magistrate tigurine afflicted citizen lo▪ receiue • oster within walles citie home coulde worship god woulde also erected temple wherein might celebrate god holy seruice neither diswaded diuersitie tongue suffering christ speake italian euen middest tigurine let passe come againe say soone vnderstoode curtesie stretched farre suffer countrimen haue holy congregation citie perceiuing selfe bound vnto priuate benefit thought good testifie thākful hart gift present vnto condition countrie men rightly lamented dwelling natiue soyle seeme tyrannous sacriledge pope cleane banished christ kingdome contrary part little bee reioyced haue resting place graunted straunge countrie may render due honour vnto liuing god surely holy hospitalitie haue vsed much towardes men tochrist himselfe shall bee meanes trust moue god powre rare benefites vpon still continue liberalitie towarde alredie slorish prosperitie doubtlesse constrained mee signified dedicate booke vnto commentarie vpon harmonie made three euangelists making wherof haue takē paine lesse fidelitie thē industry smal purp •• e declare seriously haue traueled herein submit self men iudgmēts ye learned wise discreete reader take great delight common vtilitie ashamed like rude barbarous caytifes learne augment knowledge reading studie peruers ouerthwart wrangler little esteeme meane cowled monkes maintenance pope tyrannie fight open place v also vnnaturall drone mingled amōg v desire nothing clean extinguish al sight learning intent may cloke couer ignorance although like dogges despitefully bark yet wil vse exception alwaies neede submitte selfe censure iudgement either law god men onely kept vnder like child blamefull infamous vnskilfulnes also seuerely punished malitious obstinacie stubbern impudēcie whatsoeuer say trust better sort wil graunt lawfull acknowledge without arrogancie faithfull labour haue imploied profit god church came forth two yeeres since gospel iohn interpretation trust hath beene fruitelesse thus like apparitor haue endeuoured power set forth christe ryding princelike foure wheeled chariot gloriously reading worke gentle reader haue profited selues wil loath confesse haue studied vaine euangelicall history described sette forth foure witness appointed god himselfe without cause compare vnto chariot sweete pleasaunt consent god seemeth purposelye haue made triumphant chariot son might plainly appeare seene al faithful people swiftnes whereof might lightly passe raunge ouer whole world neither doth augustine vnfitly compare foure euangelistes trumpet noyse whereof doth sound al coastes churche christe beeing summoned foure quarter world might flock gather together east vveste south north vnto holy consent faith vvherefore absurd curiositie lesse borne withal content gospel proclamation proceeding heauen thrust toyes corrupt imaginatiōs nothing defile puritie faith cause christes name scorned derision vngodly • farre excel common sort since detest minde al corrupt leuen wherewith true sinceritie gospell infected shewe selues delight nothing maintaining allowing plaine simple doctrine set forth christ himselfe perswaded wil wel like watchful worke expoundeth treasure glad tiding also haue good hope signe token good loue ward aswel acceptable haue dedicated vnto thus bid farewel right honourable lordes wishe christ may direct holy spirit strengthen power preserue vnder protection enrich citie common weale plenteous benediction geneua first aug yeere lordes righteousnes rise also make mētion describe executing office luke doth purchase authoritie yet borne declareth wonder diuine power euen infancie sheweth bee appoynted god prophet men could know manner man purpose doth greater reuerence might heard take vpon publike office goe forth aduauncement glory christ 5 time herod sonne antipater whō father promote euen kingdō augmentation great care great diligēce labour therfore giuē vnto surname great certaine think named heire luke first forreine king • gned therefore fitte time deliueraunce beecause scepter transposed straunge nation say doe wel vnderstand prophesie iacob whereas comming messias simply promised iewes shalbe depriued empyre shoulde taken away tribe iuda neither yet holy patriarkes minde tribe iuda depriued princely gouernaunce comming christ rule people established stocke vntill christes comming whole person sure euerlasting continuaunce although time machabeyes florished tribe iuda brought narrow streight shortly duke iohn last stocke slaine yet notwithstanding rule altogether extinguished yet remayned synedrion chosen counsell stocke posteritie dauid whose auctoritie great continue herod horrible slaughter iudges reuenged punishment layde vppon condemned murder constrained goe voluntarie exile might escape losse head reigne therefore herod straunger brake scepter trybe iuda residue renoume soeuer remained stocke theeuish dealing abolyshed kingly dignitie fayled long rule litle litle fel almost downe discontinuaunce dooth repugne prophesie iacob outwarde shewe god hath promised two diuerse thinges throane dauid last euer ouerthrowne would repayre ruines power kingdome euerlasting yet notwithstanding young slyppe ryse stock lesse thing ought fulfilled god suffer rule erected trybe iuda kept downe season greater might diligence people hope kingdome christ vvhen hope faythfull cutte destruction chosen counsell sodenly lorde clearely shone forth belongeth course historie whilst time thing done noted rashlye vnder name king also noted miserable state tyme iewes might knowe turne eye vnto messyas assuredly estimation league god zacharias course abia knowne sacred hystorie familyes priestes deuided dauid certaine order thing dauid attempted nothing commaundement lawe god appoynt priesthoode aaron sonnes rest leuites appoynted lesser office thing nothing altered dauid deuice partely beware least thing doone tumultuously among people partely preuent ambition also bring passe take charge vnto selues greater parte sitte ydle home distribution abia sonne eliazar erronious assoone shall departe lawe betweene preceptes iustifyinges difference latter name properlye referred exercise godlynesse diuine worshippinges first vniuersall dooth aswell pertaine vaine ceremony bente vppon trueth▪ spirituallye obserue leawde counterfeite menne although dayly wearle selues outwarde ceremony yet beecause doe obserue commaunded lorde doe nothing lose labour chiefely two woordes luke dooth comprehende whole law zachary elizabeth vnblamable concerning keeping law neede christ ful obseruing law doth bring life transgression▪ arrained state doth cease forgiuenes whereby pardoneth offences▪ • ust vnreprouable therefore thought life doth witnesse auowed righteousnesse feare god reigne certaine example godlynes godly endeuour farre differ perfection vnto seruauntes feare yet profitable yea necessarie mooued feare dismayed selues might learne yeelde iust honour god neyther dooth luke onely shew zacharias haue beene troubled addeth feare fell vpon vvherby declareth haue bin dismayed hee subdued feare neyther dooth feare presence god much strike men instruct reuerence might humble pride fleshe hautie neuer submitte selues god vnlesse violently concorde first deuided amongst selues eyther part prophet notwithstanding meant nothing else signifie mutuall agreement oftentimes men conspire among themselues shoulde alienate god angell doth therewithall define manner conuersion shoulde bee hee doth promise yea call disobedient wisdome righteous therefore noted wee knitte selues fast wicked vnder false cloake concord name peace goodly▪ pleasaunt ofte commeth scripture greedily snatched papistes procure v enuie though endeuour call world disloyall reuolting christ aucthours discorde text foolishnes well refelled angell doth shew manner true lawfull conuersion maketh stay bande wisdome righteous accursed therefore peace vnitie wherein men agree amongst themselues god furthermore doubted fayth vnderstoode wisdome righteous men contrary vnfaythful called disobedient truelye excellent testimonie fayth whereby wee learne wise saluation wee obedient woord god worlde also hath wisdome corrupt therefore deadlye condemned vanitie knew spokē sufficient▪ although known zacharias haue beene vnbeleeuing altogether hee shoulde shrinke faith generall faith dooth take hold promise eternall saluation testimonie free adoption euen god hath receiued v fauour specially promiseth many thinges feede take v perilles defender innocencie preserue life perticular fayth answereth euery promise therefore sometime may man trusting god forgiuenes sin saluation yet point wauer either shoulde feare much daunger death much carefull daily sustenaunce ouer doubtfull counsailes incredulitie zachary hauing roote foundatiō faith onely stick one poynt whether god would giue sonne vvherefore let v know doe fall departe fayth infirmity particular affaire doe disturbe moue thē faith faile roote oft boughes doe shake diuerse inuasions supposed husbande writing enformed promised childe certainely cheerefuller minde shee sheweth god aucthour benefitte shee approoueth nexte woordes dayes wherein looked take rebuke among men shee declareth cause barrennesse fauour god turned amongst earthly blessinges god doth giue scripture accounteth chiefe vochsafeth giue v child increase bruit beastes blessing god much excellent man first appeare learne modestie submit selues god neyther let grieue v learne bore christ eternal wisdome god wombe nothing taken heede proud contempt bereaue selues knowledge incomparable misterie god wil hidde litle one seeke knowledge seemeth cause chose virgin espoused man imagination origen wrought hee might keepe secrete sathan saluation prepared giue men hath lykelyhoode veile matrimonie therefore spread beefore eye worlde commonly supposed sonne ioseph godly length fayth knowe sonne god yet christ came forth base meane sorte heauenly father shewed forth euen beginning glorye godhead angelles declared sauiour borne voice heard shepheards spread farre one wonder famous amongst rest wise men came east euery reporte starre appeared vnto testimonie birth great king yet see howe god kept soone secrete vntill time came shoulde fully shewed erected one saye theatre whence might plainly beholden participle memnesteumenen euangeliste doth vse doth signifie shee virgin promised husbande deliuered wife husbande custome amongst iewes parentes keepe daughter home time espoused vnto men else law slaundered wife deut 22 13 vaine luke saith ioseph stock dauid familyes woont accounted name men matter speake place 28 hayle thou art freely beloued message wonderfull almost incredible therefore angell beganne commendation fauour grace god seeing reason dull vnderstanding mindes driuen straight cannot cōprehend wonderful greatnes god work best remedie stir vp mindes meditate consider infinitenesse grace therefore since vnderstanding god goodnesse gate fayth angell tooke without cause best order occupying minde virgin meditating fauour god might better prepared receiue vnderstand incomprehensible misterie participle kecharitomene luke dooth vse signifieth free fauour god appeareth plainely epistle ephesian 1 6 paule intreating reconciliation god saieth god beloued sonne echaritosen receiued v grace fauour embraced v beefore enemy afterwardes angell saieth god vppon god vouchsafeth bestow loue vnto declareth selfe bee mercifull bountifull hee giueth bestoweth giftes therefore thirde parte sentence added blessed art thou amonge woman hee vseth woorde blessing effecte proofe fauour god myne opinion heere vsed praysing dooth rather signifie happynesse blessednesse paule vseth praye faythfull might haue first grace peace kind good thing signifying thereby becōe blessed rich beloued god aucthour al good thing blessednesse righteousnes lyfe mary doe come free loue god vertues excellencie meere liberalitie god deale preposterously teach v aske thing shee v recieueth grosse folly papistes magicall coniuring haue turned salutation prayer want reason haue beene farre drawne preacher might praye pulpitte assistaunce grace god spirite hayle mary besides accompted salutation onely rashlye take vnto selues office god inioyned angell twise foolish imitation salute one absent 29 vvhen shee sawe shee troubled luke doth say shee troubled sight angell saying dooth also make mention sight interprete cause marye seeing portion heauenly glory angell reuerence god conceaued sodaine feare therefore shee troubled shee perceiued mortall manne salute angell god luke dooth say shee troubled shee thereby amased rather sheweth signe attentiue verye readye minde presently addeth shee thought self manner salutation bee whereto tended meant presently shee thought angell sent nothing example wee admonished first woorkes god sleightly passed ouer likewise wee ought weighe consider reuerence feare may goe 30 feare marye willeth afrayde let v alwayes remember howe weake fleshe cannot shoulde afrayde oft least sparke god glorye doth appeare earnestly consider presence god wee cannot imagine vaine ydle presence therefore wee daunger iudgement feare riseth trembling vntill hee shewe selfe father holye virginne sawe amongst people vile heape sinnes good cause shee afrayd greater vengeaunce vvherefore angell might put feare awaye hee saieth hee witnesse tydinges bringer wonderful good luke vsed hebrewe phrase finde fauour haue god mercifull cannot sayde hee found fauour sought hee offered seeing example sufficiently knowne vaine heere alleage 31 loe thou shalt conceaue thy wombe angell frameth woordes firste prophesie esaye place prophetes might thereby better sincke virgin minde prophesies knowne common euerye among godly yet noted angell whisper onely eare virgin brought gladde tidinges saluation long spread throughout whole world vvherefore doone without counsell god hee plainely expresseth consent betweene olde prophesies present message comming christe woord conceauing sufficient confute witlesse fancie aswell marcyon manicheus thereby may easily gathered mary bring aiery body ghost frui conceaued wombe thou shalt call name iesus mat 1 21 rendreth cause name giuen saue people frō sinnes verye name saluation promised cause shewed end christ sent father worlde saieth selfe came destroy saue worlde ioh 12 47 let v also remēber name giuen man angell commaundement god faith might fastened heauen vppon earth deryued ithg hebrewes saluation thence commeth word signifieth saue furthermore doe fondlye reason endeuour deriue hebrewe nowne • ushug appeareth rabbynes deale malitiously neuer giue honourable title christ euery place write iesu rather imagine haue beene base degenerate iew therfore writing deserueth much credit aucthoritie doth barking dogge obiect farre inferior dignitie sonne god hee shoulde haue name common others may also pretended christe answere easie shadowed vnder lawe fully wholye perfourmed sonne god substaunce figured obiection greater force denie name iesu holy reuerent euery knee philip 2 9 ought bowe vnlesse onely belong sonne god paule dooth attribute vnto magicall name whose sillables maiestie included wordes purpose haue said great power giuen vnto christ father vnder al worlde bowe therefore let v bid faigned inuentions farewell let v know name iesu giuen vnto christ faythfull might learne seeke beefore shadowed vnder law 32 hee shall great angell sayde iohn baptist yet hee would make equall christ baptist great order presently declareth greatnes christ extolled farre aboue creature hath alone proper peculyar selfe called sonne god apostle proueth heb 1 5 graunt sometimes scripture angelles kinges adorned title common called sonnes god excellencie god hath giuen cleare doubted god exempteth sonne rest peculiarly saieth vnto psalme 1 7 thou art sonne therefore christ accounted neither among angel men might accounted one common sort company child god giuen vnto lawful none take selues true king child god right nature lord hath bestowed honour vpon neither doth title belong vnto angel vnder chief head excell amongst creature also child adoption obtaine faith wee haue nature christ onely onelybegotten sonne interpretation false deceitfull filthie dogge seruetus wresteth woorde future tence mighte prooue christ eternall sonne god began accompted hee tooke vpon flesh hee argueth christ sonne god clothed flesh appeare worlde angell sayd shall called except affirme wordes angell doe signifie nothing else sonne god made manifest flesh eternall called referred apparaunt knowledge great difference betweene two enterpretations whether beganne sonne god made knowne vnto men might know promised time past truely sith god age called father people may thereby gathered sonne heauen fatherhood came men men arrogate much vnto themselues durst bold bragge sonnes god member onely begotten sonne vvherefore certaine holy father assuraunce honourable calling confidence sonne mediatour profit haue perfect knowledge whereof speake paule doth teach v place nowe wee may freely onely call cry god father rom 8 15 gal 4 5 god shall giue vnto throane dauid vve haue sayde angel tooke prophetes title giueth vnto christ holy virgin might thereby know better redeemer time past promised vnto father vvhen prophetes doe speak restitution church cal whole hope faithfull kingdome dauid common rule amongst iewes sauegard church reposed prosperitie dauids kingdome neither thing aptly fitly agree office messias hee againe restore kingdome dauid therefore messias sometimes called name dauid ier 30 9 shall serue lord god dauid king also ezechel 34 24 37 24 seruaunt dauid shall prince amongst ose 3 5 shall seeke lord god shall reigne ouer house iacob seeing saluation peculiarly promised vnto iewes euen couenaunt made abraham father christ paule witnesseth rom 15 8 minister circumcision angell doth without cause appoynt kingdome nation proper seate abiding place differeth prophesies enlarge stretche kingdome christ vttermoste partes earth god newe wonderfull adoption plante gentile straungers house iacob yet iewes first borne shoulde holde principall degree set downe psal 110 2 lord shall sende rod thy power syon therefore throne christ placed amongest child israel whēce made whole world subiect vnto many gathered faith sonnes abraham accompted true israel although iewes defection separated selues church god yet lordes certaine remnant shoulde remaine euen vnto end calling beyonde power man body people shewe vtterly cut must remember mysterie whereof paule speaketh rom 11 25 length come passe god woulde gather iewes dispearsing scattering abroade meane season church scattered whole worlde spirituall house iacob fetched beginning sion e • er angel declareth sense perpetuitie oft promised prophet kingdom dauid florished time dauid salomon power rich roboam third successor skarse held tribe halfe time ceased shaken diuers misery vntil length broken downe angel declareth person christ shall established shall againe destroied proue vseth wordes daniel set downe 7 14 kingdom shalbe ende although sense word god euerlasting gouernor kingdom christ churche shall neuer pearish earth long sunne moone shall shine heauen yet true perpetuitie belongeth vnto glory come therefore faithfull doe continual course succeede others life vntill lengthe gathered together heauen shall raigne without ende luke 1 matthew marke 34 sayde marie angell howe shall seeing know man 35 angel answeared saide vnto holy ghost shall come vpon thee power moste highe shall ouershadowe thee therfore also holy thing shal borne thee shall called sonne god 36 beholde thy cousin elizabeth shee hath also conceiued sonne olde age sixte moneth called barren 37 god nothinge shall bee vnpossible 38 marie sayd behold seruaunt lorde • ee done vnto mee accordinge thy woorde angell departed 34 howe holy virgin seemeth hardly restraine power god zacharie doeth shee accompte vnpossible beyond comm • n order nature thus reasoneth knowe man beleeue shoulde come passe thou tellest needefull shoulde greatly labor cleare fault faith shee ought haue risen omnipotēt power god tied natural mean surmounteth whole world yet shee staieth common course generation yet knowen shee doeth doubt demand shee would haue power god made subiect equal sens stricken sodaine admiration shee moued aske question obediently gladly receiueth promise may gathered wheras many doubt contrary part shee yet stay one shee might easily haue obiected throne dauid become seeing al dignity empire long time ben abolished glorious beautye kingly stocke extinguished weighed matter iudgement flesh haue takē al heard angel fable vvherfore doubted shee easily gaue place throughly perswaded restitution church thing according flesh incredible probable prophesie esay 11 1 cōmonly spoken euery whereas god promiseth raise graffe grow contempned stocke isay faith therefore grace god conceiued virgin minde caused without doubt beleue message brought erecting throne dauid except say also prophesie virgin beare sonne answer knowledge mysterie darke father hoped shoulde haue king borne vnder people god blessed happy meane lay hidden veile bene put betwene therfore maruell holy virgin asketh question shee knoweth not▪ imagine word shee made vow perpetuall virginitie ouer weake altogether absurde vnfaithfully shee done shee suffred selfe bestowed husband making mocke god despised holy ordinance matrimonie although poperie crept barbarous tyrannie matter matrimony yet neuer durst go farre permit wife without consent husband vow • continencie furthermore childish inuention imagine kinde monkerie amongst iewes yet obiection answered virgine respect vnto time come therefore signifie dwel together husband cōiecture probable plaine greatnes rather maiestie matter strike virgin shee sens tied bound admiration vvhē heareth son god shalbe borne considereth matter common reason shee excludeth knowledge man thus amased shee crieth therefore doth god gentlely pardon louingly fauourablie answere hauing god workes admiration shee reuerently soberly demaunde could come passe perswaded far aboue common accustomed course nature furthermore question faith arose rather admiration distrust holy ghost shall come vpon thee angell doth set maner bene nedefull haue done woulde satisfie curiositie many calleth virgin simplie consider power holy ghost silence quietly might resigne selfe wholely ouer vnto worde come vppon doeth signifie extraordinarie worke meanes nature want next parte sentence added expounde former power highe shall ouershadowe thee spirite essentiall power god whose worke sheweth exerciseth himselfe well gouernance worlde myracles apt metaphore worde ouershadowe scripture doth oft compare power god wherewith preserueth defendeth vnto shadow seemeth peculier sense vnderstanding place namely worke spirite shoulde secrete euen cloude set shoulde stay eye men seeing woorking myracles god doth kepe secrete v counsell workes partes modestie reuerence hee woulde haue kepte hidden v therefore holy thing shall borne confirmation former sentence angell teacheth v behooueth christ borne without companie man woman might holy sonne god commō estate amongst men holinesse glory hee shoulde excell creature heretikes faine borne man made sonne god wrest causall coniunction therfore called sonne god woonderfully conceiued power holy ghost reason wickedly althoughe hee manifested sonne god flesh followeth worde begotten father worldes rather sonne god eternal deitie appeared also sonne god humaine flesh place doth teache v vnitie person christ also sheweth christ euen put humane nature also sonne god therefore name sonne god beginning proper diuine essence christe deitie humanitie ioyned agreeth nature together secrete celestiall woorking generation exempteth common order men oftē also affirmeth himselfe man calleth himselfe sonne man veritie humane nature let diuine generation mighte procure peculiar honoure aboue others namely conceiued holy ghost beyōd ordinarie maner nature groweth good cause assurance faith wee might • boldly call god father onely sonne woulde needes become oure brother hee mighte common make father also also noted christe hee conceiued spirituall power called holy seede euen behoouefull man might wash awaye sinnes flesh might ouercome death sathan might perfecte mediatour necessarie purge others sinne free vncleannesse spottes although yet christ borne seede abraham yet broughte hee infection corrupte nature holy ghost kept pure cleane euen beginning neither himselfe alone excell holinesse also sanctifie therefore maner conception doth testifie haue mediator separate sinner 36 beholde elizabeth example done home angell doth strengthen faith marie hope myracle neither barennesse olde age elizabeth could hinder god would make mother shall see spectacle god power owne kinswoman cause marie shoulde still containe selfe within accustomed bondes nature expresly noteth sixth moneth seeing woman commonly perceiueth fifth moneth childe hath life sixt month put al doubt bene part marie haue creadited simple worde god haue bene nede meanes strengthen faith least wauer lorde vseth new supportation staye promisse fauour doth daily aide hold v vp yea faith weaker fauour doth aide v therefore least shoulde doubt truthe gathereth diuers testimony may confirme vnto v demaunded howe kinred came betwene elizabeth daughter aaron marie stocke dauid also seemeth lawe num 3 6 forbiddeth woman marry owne tribe concerning lawe ende considered forbid onely mariages whereby enheritances elizabeth 37 god shall woorde vnpossible vse phrase worde proper natiue signification meaning god performe euer hath promised let equal power argument shal thus framed hath god promised therefore hee perfourme impossibilitie may obiected woorde woorde according phrase hebrew tounge oft vsed thing substāce may plainly expound thus nothing impossible god yet axiome must alwaies holden doe peuishly wander oute way dreame power god besides word founde omnipotencie considered may foundation building hope faith shall doe rashly vnprofitably also perillously dispute god doe vnlesse withall consider wil doe furthermore angell doth heere place god doth diuers place scripture vnder generall doctrine hee confirmeth one especiall promisse true righte vse generall doctrine apply promise therein set downe present matter soeuer vexed troubled long general inde • inite colde furthermore maruailed angell doeth tell marie power god distrust power doeth make v beleeue promisses men wi • h tounge confesse god omnipotent promise thing beyonde reache capacitie staie whereof commeth attribute nothing power sens discerne▪ therfore paule th • rom 4 20 commending faith abraham sayeth gaue glory god able fulfil soeuer promised place speaketh hope eternall life proposeth power god 2 tim 1 12 sayeth knowe whome haue beleeued perswaded able keepe haue committed vnto seemeth small portion faith none wicked wil derogate god title omnipotent soeuer hath power god surely deepely fixed heart shall easily ouercome let hinderance faith yet noted effectuall power god may speake apprehended true faith god mighty wil acknowledged may declare himselfe true deede 38 beholde seruant lord holy virgine argue dispute matter yet doubted many thing might hinder faith yea altogether turne minde speach angel shee taking aduauntage contrary reason enforced selfe obedience right proofe faith restraine mindes hold prisoner dare oppose god side libertie contend mother infidelitie word smal waight behold seruant lord shee offereth dedicateth self wholely vnto god may freely vse according owne wil vnbeleuers withdrawe themselues hand much canne hinder worke faith dooth present v god may ready obey holy virgin seruant lord obediently submitted selfe gouernement worse contempt fleeing denie obedience deserueth doth require short faith maketh obedient seruants god deliuereth v power infidelitie maketh v rebel runnagates done vnto clause may expounded two way either holy virgin passeth prayer request el continuing matter shee proceedeth resigning deliuering selfe vnto god simply interprete shee perswaded power god willingly following whether calleth doth also subscribe vnto promisse doeth onely wait effecte also doeth earnestly desire noted shee rested vppon woorde angell shee knewe came god babe sprang bellie elizabeth filled holy ghost 42 shee cried loude voice sayde blessed art thou among woman fruite thy wombe blessed 43 whence cōmeth mother lord shoulde come 44 loe assoone voyce thy salutation sounded mine eares babe sprang belly • ioy▪ 45 blessed • • hee beleeued thing shall performed tolde lorde 39 marie arose iourney wherof luke maketh mention testifieth mary faith vnfruteful god promisse soone forgottē angel sight remained fast minde haste witnessed earnest ardent affection hereof may gathered businesse set aside virgin meete accompt preferre fauour grace god yet may demaunded purpose toke iourny certain went thither make search enquiry nourished sonne god well heart faith conceiued wōbe neither subscribe iudgement thinke shee went thether salute seemeth probable partly encrease confirme faith partly one might set foorth glorye god cause moued cause shoulde accompt absurd thing sight myracle seke confirmation faith vaine angel propose vnto although faithful cōtent bare word lord yet meane time despise work think may whit preuail supporting faith especially behoued mary accept aid profered vnles wold haue forsaken lord willingly geuen furthermore seeing one another might stir vp wel elizabeth greater thankefulnesse text appeareth power god euident notable see grace powred vpon comparison adde small light luke doeth declare citie wherein zacharie dwelt onely maketh mention pertained tribe iuda also placed hill country whereof gathered towne nazareth hierusalem 41 shee heard salutation naturall thing childe wombe woman great child moue sodaine ioy luke would note vnto v extraordinary thing appertaineth nothing matter entangle selues subtile question whether infante knewe christe presente whether sense feeling godlinesse let one thing rather suffice v infant leapt secrete motion spirite neither doth luke attribute proper sense infant doeth rather signifie thys portion worke god mother infant sprang wombe sayeth filled holy ghoste meaning shee besides accustomed maner sodenly endued spirite prophesie shee without giftes spirite power appeared farre plentifull wonderfull 42 blessed art thou shee seemeth place marie christ like degree nothing meere conuenient willingly admit iudgement thinke cause blessednesse rendered second parte sentence oft vsed put copulatiue steade woorde causall therefore elizabeth affirmeth cousen blessed blessednesse sonne although chiefe felicitie marie beare christe wombe naye dignitie order came behinde shee spirite christe borne againe newe life yet shee woorthely called blessed whome god made woorthy singuler honour beare vnto world sonne shee spiritually regenerate day cannot make mention blessing brought vnto v christe also must remember honourably lord aduaunced marie would mother begotten sonne 43 vvhence commeth modestie noted elizabeth considering great grace god marie doeth geue vnto honor due yet lifteth higher wherby god might offended conuenient wickednesse planted world fewe fall one 2 vice pleasing selues much aboue measure doe maliciously despise giftes god brother alone might aloft others doe superstitiously extoll men make idol worship heereof came leauing christe lower rowme geue chiefest seat vnto marie contrariwise elizabeth praising doeth obscure glorye god rather referreth thing god himselfe yet shee acknowledgeth god hath geuen grace vnto others shee enuieth geue highest degree modestly sheweth shee hath receiued due calleth marie mother lord noted vnitie person two nature haue sayde begotten mortall man wombe mary also eternall god must remembred simple womā doth speake owne witte shee onely vttereth thing holy ghost doeth teach name doth properly belong sonne god manifested flesh vnto whome power geuen father ordained chiefe prince heauen earthe whose hand god gouerneth al thing yet especially lord faithfull willingly gladly submit themselues vnder gouernemēt hee heade owne body therefore paule sayeth 1 cor 8 5 although many called lordes world yet vnto v housholde faith one lord furthermore amplifieth grace god whereof shee speaketh sodaine motion infante whiche shee bare wombe doubted shee would declare shee felt something supernaturall diuine 45 blessed shee beleeued seeing appeareth whych luke hath saide elizabeth spake secreate direction spirit spirit affirmeth mary blessed beleeued praising faith mary generally teacheth v wherein chiefe felicitie men consisteth blessed mary beleeued heart promise god conceiued bare saluation self world special haue drop righteousnes life good thing lord offereth vnto v woorde one faith pulleth v extreeme pouertie miserie maketh v partaker true felicitie great waight clause thing shall performed tolde meaning faith geueth place promisses god may take effecte v certaine truthe god doeth depend vppon menne rather true rom 3 4 god remaineth alwayes true althoughe worlde whiche geuen vnbeliefe lying shoulde endeuour weaken hinder vnbeleeuers vnwoorthy enioy fruit promisses therfore scripture teacheth promisses onely faith made effectuall saluation god offereth benefites generally faith openeth bosome receiue vnbeliefe suffereth passe may come neare v mary ben vnbeleeuing yet coulde haue hindered purpose god woulde haue perfourmed woorke meanes would haue liked shee called blessed faith shee receiuing blessing offered made way ready god performance worke againe vnbeliefe shutteth gate staieth hand woorking least taste comforte saluation disappoynt glory power also relation betweene woorde faith noted hereof learne beleeue namely subscribe consent god doeth speake doe certainly assure selues hee perfourme hath promised clause lorde signifieth muche simple doe commonly say behalfe parte god promisse brought aungell came god alone whereby wee gather whether god vseth ministerie aungelles menne yet shall lesse reuerence geuen woorde selfe openly appeare heauen luke 1 matthew marke 46 marie sayde soule magnifieth lorde 47 spirite reioyceth god sauioure 48 hee hathe looked poore degree seruaunte beholde hence foorthe shall age call blessed 49 hee mightye hathe done great thing holy name 50 mercye generation generation feare nowe doeth hee sette downe shewe songe holye virgine notable woorthy reported whereby plainely appeareth howe shee excelled gifte spirite three partes songe marie solempne thankes geuing doeth first declare mercie god shee founde selfe general woordes commendeth power iudgements god length shee applieth present matter shee speaketh redemption promised time past church nowe perfourmed soule magnifieth marie declareth thankfulnes sayde euen hypocrite part doe set foorth praise god full mouthes affection heart therefore marie sayth doth praise god euen innermost affection minde truely doe nothing el prophane holy name god heart tounge onely doe declare glory furthermore wordes soule spirite diuersly taken scripture yet come together doe signifie two especiall faculty soule spirit taken vnderstanding soule seat affection wee maye better vnderstande minde holy virgine noted put heere second place order oughte first man might stirred praise god necessary reioycinge spirit go iames teacheth chap 5 13 mery lette sing sorow heauines restraine minde also hinder tounge vttering declaring goodnesse god therefore minde marie filled ioy heart brake forth praise god without cause attributeth epithyte sauiour vnto god shee speakes ioy heart vntill god knowen sauioure mindes men neuer freely truely merye doe alwayes remaine ambiguous carefull therfore fatherly fauour god saluation proceedeth filleth v ioy summe first learned faithfull may glory ioy saluation god ought folow next hauing found louing father shuld geue thanks word soteros doth signifie greeke seruator doth latine euen one doth deliuer also authour perpetuall saluation 48 hath looked sheweth cause ioy heart grounded vpon god euen fauour loue looked vpon calleth selfe poore resigneth worthinesse selfe ascribeth whole cause ioy free grace goodnesse god humilitie place vnlearned ignorant men haue foolishly thought doeth signifie submission modestie habite minde signifieth vile estate abiecto condition therefore sense vile despised hinderance god vouchsafed tourne hie eye vnto pouertie marie opposed excellencie matter selfe declareth plainely appeareth greeke word see marie casting downe selfe doeth exalt god shew fained humilitie simple plaine confession thought engraued mind accompt world whit esteme selfe hence foorth shall call blessed sayeth thys benefite god shalbe remembred age notable men euery shoulde declare lawful mary vpon bestowed bury silence obserue mary accompteth nothing owne felicitie acknowledgeth geuen aboue thankfully accepteth grace hath receiued shall sayth accompted blessed throughout age doth say obtained praise owne power industrie shee rather doth cōmend worke god wherby perceiue much papist differ good thing soeuer god made small accompt vnaduisedly set foorth wyth owne vaine inuentions aboundantly heape vp together magnifical proud title shuld quene heauen starre saluation gate life life swetenes hope health yea sathan also caried farre impudencie madnesse gaue power ouer christ song aske father commaund thy sonne seeing plainly appeareth none proceede lord holy virgin one woorde abandoneth shee esteemeth glorye god benefites shee one thing onelye bee renowmed god hath dealt mightely place lefte fained title else haue borowed furthermore nothing reprochefull haue sonne spoiled due shee selfe shoulde bee clothed sacrilegious spoiles nowe let papist go let cry iniurious christes mother reiecting lie men onely set forth benefit god graūt honorable preposterous worshipper take doe willingly receiue teacher obey doctrine preceptes vnknowne hath said papistes regarding treading vnder feete doe discredite wordes much let v remember common rule set downe vsed v praysing either angel men namely grace god may set forth also nothing praised al proceedeth thence vvhen saith god mightie hath done great thing shee declareth god holpe ayde onely power might appeare nowe must repeate sayd shee looked vpon although shee abiect contemned vvhereof followeth prayses mary preposterous adulterous power free fauour god altogether wholy extolled 49 holy name second part song wherein holy virgin general sentence commendeth power iudgments mercie god clause ought ioyntly one sentence read former aparte mary extolled grace god shee founde selfe taking occasion shee cryeth name holy mercie florisheth age furthermore name god called holy deserueth great reuerence oft mention made god appeare withall reuerend maiestie next sentence wherein perpetuity mercy god praised takē accustomed forme couenaunt gene 17 7 bee thy god god thy seede thee euer deut 7 9 god shee mercie euen thousand generation wordes doth onely shewe alwayes like selfe declareth continual fauour beareth towardes euen death hee loueth child childrens child whole ofspring continuall course loue hee shewe selfe posteritie abraham receiued abraham fauoure hee made league euer come abraham flesh deede sonnes abraham therefore mary restraineth effect promise true worshipper god dauid also doth psal 103 17 mercy lord endureth euer vpon feare righteousnes vpon childrens child vnto keepe couenaunt god therefore promiseth wil shew selfe mercifull child saint throughout al age may yet take away occasion vaine hope hipocrites degenerate child saint haue fallen godlines faith doe vaine rashly glory god father vvherefore exception vanitie pride ouerthrowne puffed vp false pretence god grace without fayth god made vniuersall couenaunt saluation stocke abraham stone watered raine doe become softe therewith hardnesse heart hinderaunce vnfaithfull promised righteousnesse saluation enter yet god promisse might certaine sure hath reserued vnto himselfe seede feare god vnderstode godlineste religion without faith heere question may demaunded cause god called merciful man finde deserueth fauour mercy god vpon feare godlinesse good conscience doe procure fauour men meanes men merit preuent grace aunswere also methusala sonne enoch sonne lared sonne malel • ell son cainan 38 sonne enos son seth sonne adam son god genealogy written matthewe luke doe agree thinges must first seene whether doe fetch genealogie christ ioseph whether matthew doth onely luke dooth fetch mary latter iudgement haue good colour difference diuers name truely first sight seeing luke doth much differ matthew seemeth nothing lesse declare one genealogie dauid vnto salathiell againe zorobabell ioseph name altogether diuerse name furthermore pretende absurde bestow much labour matter needefull accompt petegree ioseph twise yet father christ purpose say repetition whereby nothing prooued doth much appertaine edifying faith thing onely known ioseph one posteritie house dauid yet line christ romaineth doubtfull therfore iudgments superfluous euangelistes imploy themselues vppon matter matthew repeateth progenie ioseph excuse thus hee manye yet thinke father christ scorned cockering hee nourish pestilent error text doth openly confute matthewe assoone hee commoth ende genealogie teacheth christ came seede ioseph secrete power holy ghost conceiued wombe virgin wherfore iudgements stand matthew might reprooued foolishnes want consideration one vaine would recite genealogie ioseph obiection yet aunswered genealogie ioseph doth nothing appertaine christ answere old commonly known person ioseph petegree mary also comprehended law commaunded euery man shoulde take wife owne tribe take exception lawe neglected almoste age argumentes vse friuolous cite example eleuen tribe promised oath woulde giue wife men beniamin prescribed law say needed new oath answer doe yll vnwiselye drawe extraordinarie facte common rule necessary one trybe cutte bodye people shoulde haue beene maimed remedie bin help prouided great necessitie therefore common law considered againe obiect mary mother christ cosine elizabeth whō luke witnessed haue bin daughter aarō answer also easie lawful maides tribe iuda anye tribe marrie tribe priesthoode reason expressed law thereby hindered least woman carrye inheritaunce owne tribe holy historie 2 para 22 11 declareth wife ioiada high priest came kingly stocke therefore neither meruaile thing vnwonted mother elizabeth married priest denie thinges fully prooued lawful determine mary tribe ioseph shee wife verily graunt cannot simply prooued bare historie read except circumstance bee added first noted euangelistes spake thinges well knowne age genealogie ioseph drawne vnto dauid easie euery man draw genealogie mary thence also doubted euangelistes beeing occupied commonlye knowne age therefore lesse curious doubted might easily speedily haue made inquisition furthermore take thing graunted seeing ioseph good man modest hee would take wife owne tribe according appointment law although generall law sufficed proue mary kingly stocke mary might haue come tribe iuda though shee came stocke dauid therefore matter thus euangelistes care godly would contentiously striue might person ioseph knowe genealogie mary especially seeing matter said age well knowne doubtfull may seeme incredible poore despised marryed folkes posteritie dauid kinglye seede whereof redeemer come nowe aske whether genealogie set downe matthew luke doth clearely euidently shewe mary stocke dauid graunt cannot certeinely gathered seeing kindred mary ioseph vnknowne euangelistes lesse carefull matter yet purpose take away offence basenes contempt pouertie aswel ioseph mary might breed least might knowne thing apportaining kingly race furthermore imagine faine luke setreth downe genealogie mary letteth passe ioseph easily confuted thus word word writeth iesus supposed bee sonne ioseph sonne eli sonne matthat truely hee maketh mention neither father grandfather christ euidently appeareth sette downe diuerse line good learned interpreter doe thus reconcile shewe discorde matthew leauing naturall genealogie luke followeth doth rehearse legall genealogie call legall hee speaketh sense hee meaneth thing else kingdome establyshed person solomon lawefull meanes fall length vnto salathiell saye better aptly saye legall order set downe matthew naming solomon negligent slouthfulnesse whereof spake therefore ioseph zeale iustice condemned fault supposed wife yet minde bent humanitie staied executing extremitie lawe meane qualified priuely departing shoulde go toe place whereby wee gather hee softe effeminate minde vnder pretence mercye woulde nourish sinne couering onely remitted extremitie lawe would cast foorth infamous reproche doubted minde stayed secrete instincte spirite know outragious gelousie howe violently carieth man away wherfore although ioseph endured ouer daungerous inuasion yet wonderfully crossed diuers perilles hand first beganne deliberate matter iudge mary silence though graunt shame shee durst tell husband shee childe holy ghost yet shee rather stayed prouidence god owne counsell witte shee tolde matter incredible ioseph haue thought shee mocked men would haue laughed haue taken meere fable neither oracle god haue bene muche estemed followed therefore lorde suffered seruaunt iosephe caried awaye wrong opinion owne churche whome god hathe ioyned neare vnto hymselfe drowned death destruction vntill christ restore life shall wee saye straungers whome neuer anye hope life appearing vvherefore bee concluded saluation christe reiected mankinde subiecte destruction cause destruction bee noted celestiall iudge doeth pronounce cursse v rashly wythout cause therefore aungell witnesseth wee pearished holden oppressed vnder miserable yoke damnation sinnes wee estraunged life whereby corruption wickednesse nature reuealed vnto v manne perfecte able liue righteous life hee might without christ deliuerer without exception one haue neede hys grace therefore foloweth seruauntes sinne destitute true righteousnesse heere againe wee gather maner way christ vseth sauing hee deliuereth v sinnes furthermore two partes deliueraunce first sacrifice hauing made full satisfaction geueth v free pardone forgeuenesse whereby wee exempted guiltinesse death reconciled god next sanctifying v wyth spirite chalengeth v tyrannie sathan wee shoulde liue righteousnesse therefore christ acknowledged truely sauiour vntill faith wee learne embrace free forgeuenesse sinnes knowe accompted righteous god freed guiltinesse without trust either workes oure power aske spirite righteousnesse truthe aungell wythout doubte nameth iewes people christe whose heade king ordained gentile shortly grafted stocke exercised office mediator euen frō beginning world al depend later reuelation though cloathed newe person woorthely length called immanuel came foorth priest sacrifice owne body shuld wash away sin men price owne bloud shuld reconcile father short fulfil al partes man saluation first name diuine maiestie christ cōsidered v may haue reuerence v due eternall god yet neuertheles fruit neglected god would therof gather receiue v oft behold god man person one christ may certainly determine god possesseth v faith ioyned vnto christ number changed verbe shall call differeth nothing thing spake prophet speaketh one virgine therefore hee vseth second persone thou shalt call cause name firste vttered common confession godly god gaue selfe christ enioyed v 24 ioseph raised readinesse obedience heere described doeth make whit lesse testifie certaintye faith ioseph doeth praise obedience excepte euery doubte hadde beene taken away conscience well setled neuer willingly sodainly changed counsell taken wife whose companie hee lately iudged himselfe haue bene defiled therefore note power god imprinted dreame suffered minde wauer folowed effecte faith god knowen presently prepared himselfe obey 25 knew til shee vnder colour place heluidius time past moued great trouble church would gather therof mary virgin vnto first birth child husband perpetual virginitie mary sharply copiously defended hierome let one thing suffice v fondly il gathered wordes euangelist became christ borne hee called first borne anye respecte mighte know borne virgine denied ioseph vntill shee brought foorth also restrained vnto time folowed doeth declare sufficiently knowen vse scripture certainly man wil time mooue question matter except curious man wil obstinately stād except contentious brabler mathew marke luke 2 1 came passe dayes came commaundement augustus caesar world taxed 2 first taxing made cyrenius gouernour syria 3 therefore went taxed euery man owne citie 4 ioseph also went vp galile citie called nazareth iudea vnto city dauid called bethlehem hee house linage dauid 5 taxed marie geuen wife childe 6 day accomplished shee shoulde bee deliuered 7 shee excludeth humane counsel sayth ioseph mary left house came thither mighte bee taxed accordinge familie stocke throughe owne deuise counsell hadde chaunged place mary might deliuered bethlehem haue considered person themselues haue purpose might obey commandement augustus plainely see blinde folkes led hande god thither behoued christ borne semeth fal fortune prophane mē ascribe vnto fortune al remoued house might time come bethlehem without wōderful prouidēce god see somtime holy child god although wander minde knowing whether goe yet holde right way lord directeth step wonderful prouidence god doth lesse shew selfe tyrannical gouernmēt draweth marie house prophesie might fulfilled god prophet apoynted place shall see would sonne borne mary force ben compelled determined haue bene laid home augustus commanded taxe seased iuda euery man shuld geue name thence forth might pay yerely tribute woont pay god god vsed require people prophane manne doeth violently snatche vnto himselfe much hee shoulde binde iewes wholely himselfe forbid accompted people god matter come vtter despaire iewes seemed euer cut alienated gouernment god god doth speedily beyond hope men geue remedy vseth wicked tiranny redemption gouernor whosoeuer caesar deputie executed geuen commaundement secrete messenger god fetch mary place appoynted god certainly purpose tendeth whole hystorie luke faithfull might knowe christ brought forth birth hand god auaileth litle assuraunce faith marie sodenly owne minde drawen bethlehem redeemer might come frō thence promised 1 world synecdoche ought seeme hard seeing vsed diuers place romane wryters doubt taxe generall throughout prouinces mighte tollerable odious yet manner tribute might diuers first taxing interpreat iewes throughlye tamed hadde newe vnaccustomed yoake laide vppon whiche saye first cyrenius gouernour syria hath colour yearelye tribute description taxing made euery yeare therefore meaning iewes grieuously oppressed absurditie diuersitie gouernours name call cyrenius quirinus quirinius wee knowe greekes translating latine name often chaunge somewhat pronounciation riseth farre greater difficultie iosephus eighteenth booke antiquity first chapter declareth archelaus banished vienna quirinus came proconsull shoulde vnite iudea prouince syria also agreed vppon amongest wryters archelaus raigned nine yeares deathe father herode whereof gathered aboue thirteene yeare betweene birthe christe taxing almoste subscribe epiphanius affirmeth christe borne xxxiij yeare raigne herode foure yeares death also litle doubtfull iosephus thirde chapter 18 booke sayeth taxing fell 37 yeare victorie wonne actium true augustus liued almoste seuen yeares longer moste eight nine yeares shall detracted age appeareth third luke raigned fifteene yeare seeing certaine age christe better knowen ought called question vnlike iosephus forgotten himselfe matter also manye others truely chronicle declare quirinus consull aboute nineteene yeares antonius ouercome augustus enioyed empire alone hee olde manne hee sent prouince obserue iosephus numbreth foure gouernours iudea space eight yeares yet graunteth fifte gouerned eleuen yeares valerius gratus whome pontius pilate succeeded yet may geuen aunsweare coulde goe taxe presently commaunded iosephus declareth coponius sente thether hoste might keepe iewes vnder whereof easily gathered tumult people taxe time hindered woordes luke doe beare interpretation came commaundement time christes natiuitie taxing people description could made except might declare mercy god voyce doeth onely raise vppe menne fallen restoreth lost calleth backe death life heare god mercifull angell sayeth bringeth tidings great ioy hee addeth cause matter ioy sauiour borne woordes first taughte vntill menne haue peace wyth god reconciled grace christ ioy soeuer conceiue vaine deceitfull wicked one often triumph drunken madde mirth except meane pacifier betweene god necessitie must miserablye tormented blinde stinges conscience furthermore although flatteringly daintily nourish vppe themselues delightes yet pleasure many torment beginning perfecte kingdome spirituall vvherefore storie onely profitable god brought wisemen sonne first fruites gentile also hee woulde set forth kingdome sonne praise starre helpe fayth least wicked malitious dispite god turne fame lye first demaunded whether starre one number lord beeginning created garnishing heauen whether knowledge astrologie brought wise men hether thereby mind conceaued birth christ although may contentiously striue matter yet gathered word matthew naturall starre extraordinary course nature certeine time vanished away sodenly shone againe went streight course towardes bethlehem length stoode fixed ouer house wherein christ none thinges agreeth naturall star probable like comet seene ayre rather heauen absurditie matthew speaking according manner people improperly called starre hereof almost gathered answere second question seeing certaine astrologie contained within boundes nature wise men could onely direction haue come christ therefore behoued holpen secrete reuelation spirite yet deny beginning seede arte say necessary shoulde holp new extraordinary reuelation least vaine vanish away 2 vvhere hee borne king interpreter thinke king borne secretely opposed king made created seemeth subtill therefore take simplye wise men meane king lately borne remaineth yet infant might make difference betweene king growen age holding gouernment people presently say mooued neither fame actes present greatnesse openlye knowne diuination heauen thing come seeing sight starre effectuall wisemen woe sluggishnes coldely seeke christ king reuealed vnto v vve come worship vse doe foolish confidence established kingdome seeing dronken felicitie securitie contemned prophesies sodenly feared remembraunce much haue beene mooued simple speach wisemen oracle prophesies come wise men made mention king prophesies came minde beefore forgotten herod presently coniectureth king wisemen seek messias time past promised frō lord againe appeareth herod woonderfully affearde inquisitiō declareth grosse contēpt christ comming wisemen scribe high priestes doe sincerely aunsweare scripture yet afterwardes furiously endeuoured corrupt whole scripture least giue testimonie credit christe therefore done yet christ troubled gospell wicked one doe easily subscribe god generall principle trueth god dooth vrge neerer vomit forth poyson contumacie thing daye wee haue notable example papistes without controuersie confesse christ onely begotten sonne god cloathed flesh acknowledge two nature one person god man come power office christ ther presently riseth conflict wil suffer themselues bee brought order much lesse brought nothing summe far wicked thinke nothing taken themselues much reuerence graunt god scripture christ hand hand striueth ambition couetousnes pride vaine hope hypocrisie deceites forgetful modestie caried madnesse therfore let v know wicked affection chiefe cause blinding enemy trueth turne light darknesse 6 thou bethlehem doubted scribe faithfully cite wordes text tongue prophet enough matthew note place writ greeke followed allowed translation place others easily gathered gospel written hebrew tongue furthermore alwaies obserued oft prophet interrogatiuely yet better iudgment thought matthew would chaunge set forth praise grace god poore obscure towne made place birth great king although bethlehem excelled honour yet profited nothing dweller rather fell grieuouser destruction redeemer worse vnworthily receiued thither mathew also rular putteth word shephearde yet expresseth two declareth christ captaine people office feeding committed vnto matthew 2 marke luke 7 herod priuilye called wisemen diligently enquired time starre appeared 8 sent bethlehem saying goe search diligently babe ye haue found bring word againe may come also worship 9 hearde king departed loe starre seene east went till came stoode ouer place babe 10 sawe starre reioyced exceeding great ioy 11 went house founde babe mary mother fell downe worshipped opened treasure presented vnto gift euen gold incense mirrh 12 warned god dream go againe herod returned countrey another way 7 herod priuily called wisemen tirant durst shew feare carefulnes least shuld arme people audacitie whō knew hated therfore opēly dissebleth cause thogh per tained priuily enquireth may preuent present peril although euil cōscience made feareful yet doubted stroke mind vnusual feare destitute counsell distraught mind time amased easier matter vnder cloak humanitie suborne cōpanion amongst courtier espying ye whole matter might presētly return certenly herod wonderful subtil ther rare magnanimity wōdred extreame daunger remedie hand lie astonished half dead wherfore may know wonderfull sonne god escape iawes lyon lorde day doth lesse bewitch enemy least deuise thousande sleightes hurte destroy church nay often take occasion readinesse lord meanes wee shall see laughed scorne mocked subtiltie wherewith hee deceaued wisemen faigning himselfe would come worshippe heord fearing tumult people bereft minde againe madde neither doubt feare stirre vp god himselfe knew king borne ordained god hee might raise vp decayed throane dauid therefore set vpon men foolishly presumes war god therefore noted hee taken spirite giddines might strik god yet dealt childishly counsell brought naught euen blind manne gropeth darke 9 vvhen heard king departed truely vile sluggishnes iewes none kept companie strā gers might goe see king promised nation scribe shew way assigne place borne yet suffer goe alone man stirres foote peraduenture feared crueltie herod also wicked vnthankfulnesse woulde incurre daunger obtaining saluation offered set lesse grace god offending tyrant shewed litle whole people much degenerate rather oppressed yoake tyrannie chaung would feele discō moditie god confirmed spirite mindes wisemē might haue fallen offence yet zeale endeuour diminished forward goe without companion want matter confirme faith nowe heare renoumed king diuine oracle shewed vnto thē star star directeth thē wēt way euē vnto place may easily gathered vanished away cause might enquire ierusalē new king take away excuse iewes taught redeemer sent vnto yet wittingly willingly despised 11 found babe vncomly sight might haue bred new offence wisemen whē saw nothing christ appertained king vilier vsed contemned cō mon infant perswaded appointed god king thought fixed mindes causeth thē reuerence christ counsel god behold dignitie yet hid kept secret certeinly appoint shal proue otherwise yet appeared whit ashamed giue kingly honour also gift declared whence cāe douted yt brought token fruit coū trey vnderstād euery one thē offer gift 3 thing cōmō offred thē al almost al interpreter disput kingdō priestod burial christ make gold tokē kingdom incense priesthood mirrh buriall iudgment hath likelihood vve know solemne custome amongst persian haue gift hand oft saluted kinges wise men chose three fruit earth parte spiritually worship lawfull reasonable worshipping hee desireth first offer vp selues vnto wee haue mathew marke luke 2 22 dayes purification law moses accomplished brought ierusalē thou thy seruaunt departe songe appeareth simeon beheld sonne god eies eies flesh outward beholding christ could bring nothing contempt least could haue satisfied minde holy man glad enioying summe desire hee shoulde make haste die therefore spirit god lightened eies faith might discern glory sonne god vile contēned habite saith would depart peace vnderstandeth hee woulde die quiet mind hee filled obtained desire demaunded haue died simeon haue bene drawen trouble tumult vse vnwilling aunswere circumstance added noted according thy woorde seeing god hath promised sight sonne sitte shoulde stay suspence nay behooued liue carefully vntill hee made partaker hope therefore obserued many falsly naughtely doe pretend example simeon boasting would willingly die graunted enioy matter yet take libertie thēselues conceaue vowes according owne lustes forge vaine hope without word god simeon said precisely staied quiet mind die haue seene sonne god speach bewrayed weakenes faith word lawfull according rule faith flee death vntil comming christ 30 mine eies haue seene although maner speaking oftē seene scripture yet corporal beholding christ seemeth expressly noted word simeō shuld say sonne god present flesh vpon bent eies mind take saluation matter saluation▪ al partes saluation blessed life laid vp christ sight christ yet infant much preuail simeon ioyfully quietly would go death much aboundāt matter saluation giuē v day may see al point saluation fulfilled christ christ conuersant vpon earth neither beare armes diuine maiestie doth clearly openly shine gospel therin sheweth seene v face face paule saieth 2 cor 3 18 neither sheweth weaknes flesh wonderful power spirit declareth miracle sacrifice death resurrection summe absent v body yet wee may beeholde person sayd neuer called priest absurditie say hee prayed happie successe kingdome christe spirite psalme commaundeth maner blessing godlye beholde childe appoynted simeon properly directeth speache christe shoulde receiued generall fauour people rather shee might armed inulncible strengthe minde contrary blastes yet spirite god woulde deliuer generall doctrine godly beholdinge worlde wicked contuma •• resisting christe shaken broken hard dealing vve knowe howe grieuous sore hinderance vnbeliefe worlde vnto v behooueth v ouercome beleeue christe iesu estate menne neuer broughte good passe greater parte followe christ vvherefore necessarie whosoeuer shoulde geue name christ instructed principle armed defense may continue faith • greuous temptation christ knowen owne naye contumeliously reiected people boasted themselues church god especially priestes scribe gouernement churche deadly ennemies woulde thinke king shoulde see vnwoorthely reprochefully reiected therefore symeon doeth withoute cause foretell christe appoynted fall many people israel meaning ordained god hee shoulde ouerthrowe cast manye downe headlonge noted fall rose heereof vnbeleeuers stumbled whiche shortly declared simeon calleth hym signe spoken againste therefore vnbeleeuers rebelles vnto christe strike themselues againste whereof foloweth fall metaphore fetched marke butte whiche archer doe shoote simeon shoulde haue sayde heereby malice men perceiued nay wickednesse mannes witte menne made conspiracie stirre crie sonne god coulde bee suche consent worlde speake gospell excepte naturall discorde betweene sonne god menne thoughe ennemies gospell disagree amongest themselues ambition furie carieth diuers faction factiously deuided diuers fantasy varietie superstition separateth idolater manifolde yet agree maye withstande sonne god vvherefore truelye sayde euidente token wickednesse manne euer withstandeth christe thoughe bee incredible woonder worlde riseth againste creator yet scripture foretolde shoulde bee reason openly sheweth menne estranged god throughe sinne alwaies flee cause suche example shoulde disturbe v rather faith furnished suche armes shoulde buckle selfe forwardes fight resisting worlde furthermore god hadde gathered israel himselfe whole worlde nowe difference betweene iewe grecian conuenient shoulde nowe come passe whiche reade shoulde done isaias sayde time chapter 8 • 4 beholde lord shall bee stumblinge store rocke fall vppon two house israel tyme iewes neuer almost ceased strike againste god moste violente conflicte againste christe nowe whyche call themselues christian doe imitate furie naye whyche proudly arrogate themselues supremacie church often bend power haue oppresse christ lette v remember shall nothinge preuaile lengthe shall broken torne peace vnder woorde falling downe spirite dueth pronounce punishment vppon vnbeleeuers might learne goe farre least companye shoulde wrappe v destruction christ therfore anye lesse beloued rising many fall downe sauour gospell ceaseth pleasant acceptable god although • deadly wicked worlde anye manne demaunde howe christe canne occasion falling vnbeleeuers nowe destroyed withoute hym aunsweare easie pearish twice wilfully depriue themselues saluation offered god therefore fall signifieth double punishment whyche remaineth vnbeleeuers wittingly willingly haue striuen god rising • former clause comfort opposed might mitigate matter odious sense sorowfull heard nothing else added christe shoulde bee stone offence hardnesse breake rend peeces great number men therefore scripture calleth v backe office saluation men hath foundation isaias 8 13 also speaketh sanctifie lord hoastes let feare shall vnto sanctuary defensed tower peter speaketh plainly whome yee come vnto liuing stone disalowed menne chosen god precious yee liuely stone built 1 pet 2 4 contained scripture beholde putte sion chiefe corner stone prooued electe precious beleeueth therein shal ashamed vnto therfore beleeue precious whiche beleeue stone whiche builder disalowed c therefore least title wherein christ called stone offence make v afraid christ presently contrary side affirmeth hee also called corner stone whereby faith godly sustained nay woulde put v minde accidentall naturall proper furthermore woorthy noted christ called stay proppe godly rising estate men suche expedient remaine therefore behoueth first rise death begin liue 35 thy soule admonition auailed confirming minde holy virgin least shee throwne downe wyth sorow time bitter conflictes come whiche shee shoulde passe although faith shaken troubled diuers temptation yet bitter strife crosse wherby christ seemed one vtterly extinguished although shee neuer swalowed vppe sorowe yet brest stonie greuously wounded constancie saint doeth muche differre vnsensiblenesse thought many heart may opened ioyne sentence clause whiche goeth somewhat christ appoynted fall c include parenthesis last expounded sword iudgement better referre whole sentence woorde heere properlye causall onelye noteth clause folowing lighte gospell shineth persecution arise affection heart opened whiche hid suche cloakes mannes dissimulation without christ easily hidde christ throughe light wipeth awaye fained excuse laieth hypocrisie naked therefore office righte attributed vnto layeth open secrea • heart foolish emulation hathe filled worlde ape superstitious menne doe greedily wisely snatche vnto themselues whatsoeuer heare praised saintes thoughe distincte degree order also choise woorkes euery one luke seemeth establish part worship god fasting noted workes belong worshippe god required simply saye necessarye themselues others referred end might serue former praiers doe properly appertaine vntil time ioseph commanded flee egypte vnknowen neither anye great matter probable lord spared marie vntil strong childebedde shee might able take iourney woonderfull counsell god woulde preserue sonne flight doubted minde ioseph shaken daungerous temptation hope shewed onely flighte flight token helpe god vnlikely sauiour men could preserued aid mortal man lord held moderatiō preseruing sonne might shewe signes heauenly power yet shewed euidently shoulde lie hidde vnder forme infirmitie yet time come christ shoulde openly glorified euident shewe deitie aungell foretelleth matter hid vnknowen men appertaineth infirmitie flesh whereunto christe become subiecte commaundeth defend life childe flight banishment heereby taught god doth alwaies preserue child one meane nowe sheweth power gloriously nowe againe sheweth litle sparkes vnder obscure couerings shadowes nowe wonderfull maner preseruing sonne god vnder crosse doeth teach wickedly prescribe certaine way god therefore let v suffer saluation furthered diuers meanes neither let v refuse humbled thereby may better shewe foorth glorie especially must flee crosse wherewith hee exercised sonne euen first infancie furthermore flight parte foolishnesse crosse whyche excelleth wisedome worlde sauiour iudea might come forth time enforced flee egypt nourisheth whence neuer anye thynge came whiche deadlye churche god vvho amazed sodaine woorke god againe hereof gather certaintie dreame ioseph presently obeieth commaundement aungell▪ readinesse obey doth plainely shewe doubted hadde god authour flight hee take yet maye seeme rise vpon distrust hasteth speedily fleeing also night cannot without feare excuse easie sawe meanes whiche god ordained preseruation meane base therefore hee gathereth lawfull hym fearefullye flye nyghte vse extreeme daungers behooueth v alwaies moderate oure feare warninges god lord consent shall faithe till bring thee woorde wordes aungell declareth god hath care life childe yea euen time come ioseph neede confirmation mighte certainly perswaded god woulde onely guide thys iourney also woulde continual keeper banishment meanes lorde woulde stay many care whyche might trouble minde godly man might remaine quiet egypt otherwise moment time haue passed without diuers torment shoulde discerne see himselfe depriued enheritaunce promised god sainctes temple sacrifice publike profession faith shoulde remaine amōgst wicked enemy god depe whirlpoole superstition caried person infante good thing soeuer father hoped lorde promised hee yet profited muche faith knowledge christ hee neede vpholden commaundement vntill bring thee worde least troublesome languish amongst egyptian banished countrey 15 egypt haue called sonne mathew sayeth prophesie fulfilled many haue thought prophet meant nothing expressed imagined sence thē selues iewes doe foolishly resist endeuoure oppresse sonne god father call oute egypte maner doe wickedly wrest woordes prophet whose purpose make iewes guiltie vnthankefulnes first infancy beginning haue found god louing bountifull father yet foorthwith prouoke wyth newe sinnes therefore lette controuersie place oughte restrained christe neither yet wrested mathewe aptly applied present purpose thus ought woordes prophet vnderstoode israel childe broughte hym miserable captiuitie wherein drowned firste like one dead egypt stead graue brought thence one brought graue bring light life lord sayeth good cause deliueraunce certaine birth people table adoption made openly lawe proclaimed hee receyued charge god priestly kingdom holy nation separate people short lorde erected tabernacle himselfe might dwel midst woordes prophet force haue sayde people pulled egypte otherwise deepe swalowe death nowe redemption broughte christe else resurrection death beginning new life light saluation almoste extinguished god person christ begate againe church vnto himselfe head came churche egypte euen whole body broughte thence analogie causeth seemeth absurd christ shoulde passe time childehode egypt rather muche glorious grace power god wonderful counsel much shine foorth light came darknesse life helles otherwise reason flesh might amazed namely redemer come egypt mathewe therefore declareth newe straunge thinge god shoulde call hys sonne thence rather auaileth confirmation faith time past nowe againe church god shoulde come egypt diuersity time past whole people shut vp prison egypt seconde redemption heade church lay hid caried included saluation life men 16 herode seeing mathew speaketh iudgement opinion herode thoughte himselfe deceiued wisemen would minister crueltie rather taken owne subtilety vnfaithfully fained also mineded worship newe king mention made hystorie detestable example crueltie almoste time slew iudges called sanhedrim least might remaine remnant stock dauid doubt feare driuen bothe murthers yet question mooued time mathewe sayeth slaine two yere old yonger according time searched wise men whereof maye gathered christ age least farre poynt 2 yeare olde drawe affirming christ almost age time wisemen came denie one may gathered howe fearfull herode rumour spred among common people new born king haue sene litle seeing feare thē staied durst send priuie traitour search cause cause maruell time restrained odious cruell slaughter especially sith late report comming wise mē yet fresh new certainly coniecture probable deferred execution villanous offēce mind vntil saw occasion may iudges first slaine people without captaines might without cōtrolment compel beare thing wherby may gathered vse friuolous argument say christ two yere olde worshipped wise men according time wherein starre appeared herode slewe child two yeare olde somewhat vnder foolishly take graunted starre appeared vntill virgine deliuered much likely true warned tooke iourney natiuitie christ might finde see infant new borne swathling bandes mother lappe aboue rest childish deuice came vnknown countrey oute worlde hadde almoste spent two yeres iourney furthermore thing osiander bringeth rather laughed neede confutation text hystorie whiche propose inconuenience wise mē came time childbed passed ouer soughte kinge whiche borne one whiche nowe two yeare olde ioseph retourned countrey fled away night yet passage iourney hee executed ierusalem duetye religion whiche lawe lord prescribed coulde hee populous citie whereunto continuall concourse people al place safe daunger gone egypte herode carefully considered daunger lengthe boyle crueltie brake nourished within aboue yeare halfe aduerbe doeth alwaies signifie continuaunce time scripture often vsed long distance thing 18 rama voyce certaine prophet describeth destruction tribe beniamin whiche came passe tyme fortold cutting tribe iuda wherunto half tribe beniamin annexed hee ascribeth mourning rachel dead figure prosopopaia auaileth much mouing affection ieremias bringeth rethoricall coulers setting forth oration hardnes sluggishnesse liuing could otherwise corrected calling dead sort graues lament vengeāce god liue vse moste parte haue derision sith prophesie prophet
