sinnes kingdome god amongst men nothing el restoring happy life true eternall felycitie therefore iohn saith kingdome god hand meaneth men estraunged righteousnesse god banished kingdome heauen againe gathered vnto god might lyue vnder hand doth free adoption forgiuenes sinnes worke whereby hee reconcileth vnworthy himselfe summe kingdome heauen nothing else newnesse lyfe wherein god restoreth v hope eternall immortalytie taken bondage sinne death chalengeth v vnto himselfe wee wandring vpon earth might fayth possesse heauenly life ephesian 1 4 although like dead men yet know lyfe safetie hidde christe colloss 3 frō hence fountaine exhortation repentaunce gathered iohn saieth repent meanes kingdome heauen shall appeare first place proposeth grace god hee exhorteth menne shoulde repent vvhereby euident mercy god whereby restoreth lost foundation repentaunce neither doe matthew luke sense reporte preached repentaunce remission sinnes repentaunce vnwisely imagine placed first cause forgiuenesse sinnes might preuent god hee might beginne mercifull vnto v men cōmaunded repent might receiue reconcilyation offered free loue god whereby hee imbraceth miserable men imputing sinnes vnto orderly goeth noted haue forgiuenes sinnes christ god would nourish loue hee might heale v neyther man taste grace god except hate sinne displeased offēces definition repentaunce fayth may fullyer knowne vnseperably ioyned togeather therefore entreating doctrine sparer better vnderstanding present place meete obserue whole gospell consisteth two partes forgiuenesse sinnes repentaunce matthew noteth first parte kingdome heauen may thereby gathered hostile dissention betweene men god wholy banished kingdome heauen vntill god shoulde againe receiue fauour though iohn proposing grace god exhorteth menne repentaunce yet noted also • gift god aswell enheritaunce kingdom heauen hee freely forgiueth v sinnes mercy delyuereth v guiltinesse eternall death also hee repayreth v owne image might liue righteousnesse freely adopteth v sonnes hee regenerateth v spirite life might testifie doe falsly cal father christ doth lesse quicken v vnto righteousnesse crucifying old man extinguishing fault fleshe doth wash away sinnes bloud appease heauenlye father towardes v sacrifice owne death yet summe gospell god embraceth v sonne sinnes washed awaye wee denying selues owne nature might liue horryble dissipation might bee compared deserte prophet amplifieth grace god hee shoulde haue sayde although people thrown farre countrey banyshed company menne yet voyce god shall also resounde visible deserte thereby might greedilye haue receiued promise saluation offered vnto death wee see truely prophesie agreeth vnto iohn properly applyed vnto prepare ye way lord doubted prophet speaketh hinderaunces waye beeginning shadowing redemption spirituall trueth commeth light iohn sent hee might remoue lettes daylye voyce soundeth eares wee shoulde prepare way lorde vice beeing taken awaye shutte vppe kingdome christe wee shoulde giue accesse grace purpose also beelongeth followeth prophet crooked shall bee made streight hee meaneth onely rough troublesome course worlde hard passage lorde make himselfe waye woonderfull meanes hee might pearse accomplishing saluation 6 fleshe shall see meaning saluation shall bee kepte secrete tasted onely fewe menne▪ shall knowen common vvhereof followeth prophesie fulfilled returne people although god shewed token fauour woorthye bee remembred yet hee reucale saluation woorlde naye purpose prophet oppose wonderfull excellē cie saluation reuealed agaynst former benefites god faithful might know neuer dealt notably church power god neuer excellently shewed deliueraunce flesh place doth signifie men without note sinne 4 matth iohn garment euangelist dooth accompt amongst especiall vertues hee addict rude austere manner lyuing also fled meane accustomed cleannesse said manne dwelling among mountaines addeth meate apparell according dwelling place hee reheaseth onely wee might know hee tooke delycates content countrey meate apparell filthy contemptible habite much esteemed amongst men delicate renoumed furthermore superstition appoynted almoste perfect rigghteousnesse outwarde shewes commonly thought decency heap holynesse fault neere vnto woulde imagine man solitarie lyfe abhorred common maner lyuinge eremite moonkes excell one thing could differ rest length grew ouer grosse ignoraunce made garmente hayres whole skinne doubted euangeliste discrybeth heere mountaine man farre vrbanitie finenesse daintinesse onely content meate might gotten onely eating naturall meates wilde honney whereof good plentie enough place locustes whereof countrey also fruitful profitable man contemned fauoured excellency come forth world onely maiestie god might shine yet shoulde draw men wonder noted added great concourse people came vnto euery place whereby wee gather renoumed fame purpose god propose rare example frugalytie meanes hee might allure iewes reuerence doctrine leaste might conuince iewes vnthankfulnesse according sayinge christe iohn came neyther eating drinkeing c luke 7 33 6 matth 5 mar baptised confessing sinnes confession testimonie repentaunce lord sacramentes doth binde vnto v giuing v hand writing also meete aunswere againe baptism witnesseth sinnes forgiuen v calleth v repentaunce consideration church baptisme receiued body christ except first examination vvhereby manifest ridiculous papist wrest auricular confession sacrificer present whose eares priuilye shoulde whisper sinnes neither mention made sinnes neyther said iohn commaunded gaue disciple ordinary manner confessing wee maye graunte papistes require confession shall beelonge onely shall bee catechyzed baptisme therefore euery tree bringeth forth good fruite heawne cast fire 7 sayd people come bee baptised generation viper hath forewarned flee wrath come 8 bring forth therefore fruit • worthy amendment lyfe beginne say selues haue abraham father say vnto god able stone raise vp childrē abrahā 9 also axe laid vnto roote tree therefore euery tree bringeth forth good fruite shall hewen downe cast fire 10 th •• people asked saying shall doe 11 answered said vnto hath two coates let parte hath none hath meate let doe likewise 12 came publican also baptised▪ said vnto maister shall doe 13 saide vnto require appoynted vnto 14 soldiours likewise demounded saying shall doe said vnto thē • doe violence man neyther accuse falsly content wage mat 7 vvhen saw many pharises math luke doe declare iohn generaly preach repentāce also applyed speach persōs truly wil cold maner teaching except teacher doe wisely consider time requireth • itte person behalf thing vnequall perpetuall equalytie cause sayde iohn seuerely hādle pharises saduces hypocrisie prid wherein swelled seemed meet sharply punished comon sort men may well vnderstand purpose known ther people without sense feeling hypocrite outward shew holines deceiue themselues others god thundereth euery whole world false imagination frame vnto themselues sanctuarie perswaded haue nothing doe iudgement god think iohn dealt preposterously first salutatiō entertained hardly answer vnknown vnto knowledge custome experience rather secrete reuelation spirit wherfore whi • lesse spared least greater prid shuld return home againe shall obiect feared sharpe rebuking baptisme professed would become men answere also readie accustomed lie god please themselues shew deceite dissimulation truth hardly vrged true repentaunce▪ sayd • wonderfull obstinacie hypocrite therefore vntill skoured violence hold fast shew iohn reprooueth rebuketh openly al men example sense luke reporteth spak people though iohn pinched fewe menne yet regard might strike 〈◊〉 feare 〈◊〉 paule • tim 5 20 commaundeth open reproouinges profit looked therefore peculyarly speaking pharises saduces dooth person admonish reste shoulde shewe forth faigned shewe repentaunce true affection furthermore greatly profitte al people know manner menne saduces pharises whome worshippe god miserablye corrupted churche wasted whole relygion ouerthrowne shorte hadde corruption extinguished light god theyr sinnes infected thinges therefore probable iohn openly sette vppon pharises hee might prouide whole church god vaine shewe holde eye simple oppresse people wicked tirannie therein also shewed wonderful constancie though excelled others yet spared dignitie sharplye worthy brought course becommeth al godlye teacher bolde▪ shoulde feare anye power men without feare striue throwe downe euerye hygh thing lifteth vp selfe christ willinglye came baptisme might giue theyr name gospell sharpely saluted instrument holy ghost must doe day professed enemy christ onely stubbornly refuse taste sound doctrine violentlye goe sword fire blotte name christe▪ certeinlye thou shouldest compare pope filthy cleargy shalbe gently dealt cast one bundle togeather wherfore let quarell v • spirit god whose care delicate abide nothing spoken sharply agaynst pope yet let godly teacher take heede themselues caryed godly zeale tyrantes church least myxe affection fleshe vehemencie canne approoued god moderated wisedome spirite let onely restraine theyr affection let delyuer commit themselues holy ghost gouerned least thing passe without consideration hee calleth generation vypers rather thou viper hee myght lay venymous poyson sorte them▪ would condemne fewe present whole bodye say sortes engender serpent great dissentions betweene contempt god wicked desire rule hatred sound doctrine heaue many sinnes vvho hath farewarned suspected thyr repentaunce doubting enquireth admiration whether possible repent heart meanes stirreth neare examination conscience sifte themselues deeply al flattery remoued farre might exercise seuere sensure calling sinnes question vvrath taken iudgment god 〈◊〉 diuerse place vsed▪ paule saith rom 4 15 1 • 19 lawe worketh wrath giue ye place wrath calleth come hangeth ouer head least according wont nourish vp thē selues securitie yet hee therefore maketh mention tyme come hypocrices long god spareth doe carelesly despyse threates wakened except striken hard though wrath god flowe forth roddes doe stryke whole earth yet hypocrite doe alwayes hope free flee wrath god taken good parte much seeke meanes appease god might cease angry v great number men might escape wrath god withdraw themselues hand iudgement sinner profiteth nothing fleeing god dooth rather encrease wrath vppon mat lv 8▪ bring forth therefore fruit • confirmeth sayd repentaunce testified wordes value except proue deede thing precious lyght vaine opinion therefore iohn denyeth open testimonye gaue sufficient saith processe time shalbe reuealed workes whether doe earnestly repent noted good work called fruit repentaunce repentance inward placed heart minde chaung life bringeth forth fruites popery poynt doctrine filthyly corrupted difference holden repentance inward renewing man springeth forth outward life tree bringeth forth fruit mat 9 think say selues lv 8 begin say sith certain one meaning speaches easily gather iohn would hypocrits either sleepe sin licentiously proudly vaunt thēselues vntil oppressed cited tribunal seat god carefully seeke mean escape lurking corner pretend colour therfore iohn thus speaketh vnto pharises saduces sharply reproued vse doe seek remedie vaine false pretence wresteth thē wicked hope wherwith betwitched couenant god made abrahā vnto thē • steede shielde couer euil conscience setled hope persō one man god adopted whole stock abraham meane thought none accounted seede abrahā folow faith▪ couenaunt god ratified may profit saluation faith clause selues superfluous although speach boast themselues sonnes abraham yet inwardly pleased themselues title hypocrite nothing ashamed mock god men god able iewes flattered themselues almost pretence papist day insolently chaleng themselues necessary shoulde church worlde god knowne haue name called vppon worlde church cannot bee v lord hath made couenaunt priestes gouerment aucthoritie especially puffed vp arrogancie accounted common people prophane accursed wee reade iohn 7 49 thought themselues holy first fruites day horned bishop abbot canon monk sorbonists al sacrificer lift vp proud title cleargie cōparison themselues despise laitie errour doth iohn reproue refel straightly restraine promise god shewing though god none them▪ yet would without church therefore meaning word god made couenant abraham seede one thing deceiueth whē thē degenerate think selues son abraham god wil frō place raise vp new seed abrahā doth appear speaketh datiue case wil raise vp childrē vnto abraham might know promise god effecte abraham obeyed hym shoulde bee deceyued although wanted seede beeginning worlde lorde true seruauntes neither euer fayle perfourming promise shewing fauour child although hee reiected hypocrite many thinke iohn speaketh calling gentile seemeth force seemed incredible proude men church might transferred place admonisheth thē god hath meanes preserue church think make child stone mat 10 lv 9 also axe iohn taken couer vaine hope hypocrits pronounceth iudgement god nigh said cast god shuld want people addeth god might driue vnworthy church barrē tree vse cut vp summe hand god stretched forth purge church grace god doth neuer shewe self saluation godly withal iudgement commeth forth destruction worlde two cause lord seperateth reprobate vnthankfulnes world prouoketh wrath new vvherefore meruaile preaching gospell comming christ doe put axe cutte away corrupt tree dayly hasten vengeaunce god wicked lv 11▪ people asked true affection repentaunce engendreth carefulnesse sinner desirouslye enquireth god willed commaunded aunswere iohn doth brieflye define fruites worthy repentaunce worlde alwayes desireth discharged ceremony towardes god dooth nothing readily sette faigned deuised worshippinges god ofte hee calleth repentaunce fruites dooth baptist commende place▪ dueties charitie second table god neglecteth outward profession godlines worship note difference certaine dooth often lesse deceiue hypocrite doe painefullye endeuour might shewe themselues worshipper god ceremony yet lette passe care true righteousnesse eyther vnkinde neighbour giuen deceites spoyles vvherefore necessarilye called straighter examination whether lyue honestly amongst menne whether helpe poore whether spare misery whether louingly communicate thinges lorde hath giuen cause christe matthew 23 23 calleth iustice mercie trueth chiefe poyntes lawe scripture diuerse place commendeth iustice iudgement noted dueties charitie first named excell worshippe god witnesse godlynes menne dissimulation may layd open bragge mouth farre heart demaunded whether iohn laid law precisely vpon al thē christ prepared disciple haue two coates fyrst noted figuratiue speech parte whole vnder one kinde comprehended general doctrine hereof followeth meaning gathered agreeth rule charitie prescribed god namely euery man aboundaunce helpe neede poore lorde doth wrest tribute giue sorowfullye vnwillingly compulsion constrained doe would loueth cheereful willing giuers paul saith 2 cor 9 7 speake purpose auayleth much men perswaded offer goodes acceptable sacrifice sweete sauour vnto god doe onely cast feare vppon conscience drowne dyspayre whosoeuer make lawe man possesse thing owne nead long confutation bee vsed fanatical men bytingly snatch letter laweful haue two coates said dish saltsellers shirt housholdstuffe text appeareth iohn meant nothing lesse ouerthrow politike estate whereby gather commaunded nothing el rich menne according ability bestow vpon poore necessitie required haue said looke thinges neighbour doe want sustentation life haue aboundance aboundaunce may helpe neede furthermore much god nourisheth v much must euery man beware cocker selues let rather necessitie brother vrge v benefites god soeuer haue v let enforce v charitable well 12 publican came hee doth onely generally exhort publycans shuld repent requireth thing belōg calling know besids general rule law euery one must looke estate lyfe whereunto called requireth loue generally commaunded al christian folow particular dueties wherein doctour church magistrate prince people againe people magistrate husband wife againe wife last child parēts bound one furthermore vexed couetous rauenous cruel kind men common people vniust exaction baptist reproueth faultes wherewith people infected forbidding exceade measure exacting tribute yet hereby gather lesse lawfull christian gather tribute graunted magistrat lay vpon thought warfare iohn commaundeth soldiours throw away weapon forsake calling forbiddeth vnder pretence warfare spoyle poore people oppresse innocent iniuries go abroade manner theeues manye woont word priuat approbation polliticke estate friuolous cauill onely delyuered instruction rude farre vnderneath christian perfection office iohn make people perfect lord doubted wholly applyed himselfe faythfully matter truely diffame gospel sacrylegious accusatiō make contrary gouernementes men christ destroy heauenly father hath ordayned without sword lawes dead power aucthoritie iudgements neither hath magistrate onely neede executioner also officer number soldiours peace cannot otherwise bee preserued ayde hand end considered prince make iesting sporte man bloud soldiours placed bestow helpes kill caryed desire gaine crueltie drawne necessitie respect publike profit matth 3 mar 1 luke 3 11 indeede baptise water amendment lyfe hee commeth mightier whose shoe worthy beare baptise holye ghost fire 12 vvhiche hath fanne hande make cleane floore gather wheat garner wil burn vp chaf vnquenshable fire 7 preached saying stronger commeth whose shooes latchet worthye stoupe vnlose 8 trueth haue baptised water baptist one thing luke plentifull first declareth vpon occasion sermon made namely daunger least people false opinion shoulde giue honour due christe therefore might speedily take away occasion errour openly testifieth christe putteth difference betweene himselfe christe might giue right doth willingly might delyuer disciple christ hand say hand hee preuenteth speedilyer least holding peace longer hee might confirme errour people vvhen hee saieth stronger shall come hee meaneth one endued farre power dignitie respecte hee brought order vseth common phrase wherwith vnder one kinde comprehended general doctrine hereof followeth meaning gathered agreeth rule charitie prescribed god namely euery man aboundaunce helpe neede poore lorde doth wrest tribute giue sorowfullye vnwillingly compulsion wil burn vp fire neuer shalbe quenshed 18 thus exhorting many others thinges preached vnto people euangelistes reporte wordes baptist one thing luke plentifull first declareth vpon occasion sermon made namely daunger least people false opinion shoulde giue honour due christe therefore might speedily take away occasion errour openly testifieth christe putteth difference betweene himselfe christe might giue right doth willingly might delyuer disciple christ hand say hand hee preuenteth speedilyer least holding peace longer hee might confirme errour people vvhen hee saieth stronger shall come hee meaneth one endued farre power dignitie respecte hee brought order vseth common phrase wherwith extolleth glory christ comparison hee declareth nothing yet chief accounteth christ aucthour spirituall baptisme minister onely outward seemeth answere secrete obiection peraduenture obiect ende belonged baptisme tooke himselfe matter light weight bring thing church god especially professe newe kinde instruction perfecte law god therfore answereth taketh nothing hand rashly yet minister outward scale whiche diminished nothing power glory christ whereby gather purpose distinguish baptisme christ commaunded disciple whose perpetuall vse willed flourish church neither doth oppose visible signe signe comparing person lord seruaunt together teacheth proper lorde attributed seruant neither let opinion hinder v long ago spread euery baptisme iohn doth differ must learne iudge matter self rather errour men truly coparison imagine bee absurd therby foloweth holy ghost bee giuen daye minister agayne shoulde followe baptisme iohn dead signe voide power thirdlye folow baptism common christ v seeing sufficiently appeareth seale sanctifieth felowship vouchsafeth haue v owne body consecrated baptisme therefore bee holden sayde iohn simply discerneth person christ himselfe minister baptisme lorde might aboue seruauntes gathered generall doctrine dueties men baptisme proper sonne god onely administration outwarde visible signe committed men trueth selfe resteth power christ alone scripture doth somtime improperly assigne mē iohn chalengeth christ alone affirmeth belongeth men thē scripture waieth specialy man hath simply teacheth power profit signes god worketh spirit distinction made christ minister least worthily due one world wickedly giue bent thing adorne creature thinges belōg god obseruation shal helpe v many difficulty vve know great iars age vse effecacy signes may answered▪ whole institution lord comprehendeth aucthour power spirit togeather figure minister whereas minister compared lord lord may haue al minister brought nothing •• vvith holy ghost fire demaunded iohn also sayd christ washeth soules bloud namely washing also selfe wrought power spirite sufficient name spirite expresse whole effect baptisme meaning plaine christ alone doeth geue grace euer outward baptisme doth figure sprinkleth conscience bloude himselfe mortifieth olde man geueth spirit regeneration worde fire added stead epithyte applied spirite purgeth filthinesse golde tried fire iohn 3 5 metaphorically calleth water mat 12 vvhich hath fanne former sentence iohn preached grace christe iewes mighte geue themselues renewed nowe also speaketh iudgement mighte strike feare contemners sith many hypocrite proudly refuse grace christ offered also necessary pronounce vnto vengeāce remaineth cause iohn doeth describe christ seuere iudge vnbeleuers order teaching must obserued v hypocrite maye know shall go vnpunished reiect christe raised sluggishnesse maye begin feare reuenger haue despised authour saluation also douted iohn would teach christ would worke gospell therfore preaching gospel fanne lord sift v whole worlde full confusion euery man seeketh please himselfe good mixed euill last pleaseth wallowe chaffe christ commeth foorth gospel reprooueth conscience citeth tribunall seate god chaffe fanned away couered part floore thoughe gospell purgeth euery man chaffe yet iohn heere compareth reprobate chaffe faithfull wheat furthermore floore taken world imagine church noted whome iohn speaketh vvhen iewes lift vppe bare title iohn warneth thē folishly proud possesse place time church god shortly throwen chaffe oute floore maner reprehendeth corrupt state church full huskes weedes filthie thing presently purged liuely voyce gospell howe christ sayd purge chaffe wheate finde nothing men meere chaffe answeare easie elect made wheat taken chaffe maye gathered barne christ began cleansing daily goeth forwarde wyth yet shall fully performe latter day therefore iohn calleth v thither must remember faithful day hope enter garner lord length deede may haue eternall seate reprobate guiltinesse doe conceiue heat fire perfecte burning whereof last day shall feele know many haue subtilly disputed eternal fire wherein wicked shallbe tormented iudgement maye gathered many place scripture metaphoricall kind thoughte fire vvherefore lettinge passe speculation wherein vaine men weary themselues without profit let suffice v vnderstand maner speaches rudenesse oure capacitie horrible torment noted day excelleth wee must rather looke calling requireth enioyned v god father general cause christ baptized might perform obedience father special cause body might cōsecrate baptisme might cōmon v 14 nede may thing rashly reuelatiō though first vnderstād euery thing annexed office depēding vpō modesty also noted ceasing frō opinion doth presētly obey christ 16 lo heauens opened opening heauēs vppon likenesse doue signe notable pledge moste sweete comfort geuen vnto v feare come vnto christe commeth foorth vnto v fearfull power spirite endued louing pleasant grace sa • e holy spirite namely iohn presently foloweth spirite descended vppon christ nowe heere ariseth thirde question iohn could see spirite answeare seeing spirite god spreade euery place filleth heauen earthe descendinge vnproperly attributed accompted sight although selfe inuisible yet sayde seene shewed signe presence iohn seeth essence spirite falleth vnder sense eye neither see power selfe cōprehēded humane sense vnderstāding faith hee seeth likenesse doue vnder god shewed presence spirite therefore metonymicall kinde speache wherein name spirituall thing geuen visible signe doe folishly preposterously vrge letter mighte include signified thing signe noted kindes speaking noted coniunction thing signe according meaning bread holy supper called bodye christ testifieth truely geuen v foode yet withall remembred touched must imagined descention thing signified soughte signe thoughe locally included one thinge ought enough enough suffice v lorde secrete power wil performe whatsoeuer hath promised v figure many also rather curiously profitably▪ doe demaund wh • ther doue perfecte body goast though wordes luke seeme affirme substance body likenesse yet least man therby take occasion quarelling leaue finde 17 voice heauen voyce sounde diuision heauens whereof mention made thereby maiestie might certainly manifest vnto also christe came openly execute office mediatour hee sent father testimonie v wee hauing pledge oure adoption might without feare call god himselfe father title sonne doeth truely naturally belong christe alone yet sonne god shewed oure flesh one father hath owne right might also obtaine v vvherefore god bringing foorth christ mediator v title sonne declareth father v purpose appertaineth epithyte beloued wee selues hated god necessary fatherly loue flowe vnto v christ best interpreter place paule ephesian chap 1 6 hee sayeth haue obtained fauour beloued sonne might beloued god also fully expressed clause whome wel pleased doeth declare loue god doeth rest againe paule place teacheth came hee might gather thing soeuer heauen earth col▪ 1 20 mathew 4 marke 1 luke 4 1 iesus led aside spirite wildernes tempted deuill 2 fasted forty day forty nightes hee afterward hungrie 3 came hym tempter sayd thou sonne god cōmaund stone made bread 4 answearing sayd wrytten man shall liue breade euery worde procedeth mouth god 12 immediatly spirite • • eth wildernesse 13 wildernesse fourtye dayes tempted satan also wilde beastes angel ministred vnto 1 iesus ful holy ghost retourned iordan led spirit wildernesse 2 fourtye dayes tempted deuil dayes hee eate nothing ended hee hungrie 3 deuil sayd vnto thou sonne god commaunde stone 〈◊〉 made bread 4 iesus answered saying wrytten manne shall liue breade onely euery woorde god • iesus led aside christe went aside deserte two cause first fast fortie dayes newe man rather heauenly hee mighte come foorth execute office hee enter hard notable office except tried rēptations lay foundation first exercise therfore let v know christ direction spirite led companie menne great doctour churche embassadour god come abroade one rather sent heauen taken little towne common sort men god vsed moses hand would deliuer law tooke mount sinai led aside sight people kept holy sanctuarie exod 24 12 behooued christ adorned fewer lesse token diuine grace signes power moses least maiestie gospell shoulde le law lord thought doctrine minister death woorthy rare honour much honour doeth doctrine life deserue shadowed figure god hadde great light howe perfecte brightnesse meete haue countenaunce beautified whiche appeareth gospell ende fast christ abstained meat drinke hee mighte geue instruction temperance might thereby haue authoritie whyle exempt frō common sorte men doeth come foorth angel heauen man earth beseeche maner vertue abstinence eate meate whome hunger mooued desire certaine euangelistes doe plainly pronounce otherwise bare hunger hee bene clothed flesh vvherefore mere follye establish lenten fast call imitation christ greater reason daye shoulde followe example christe time past holy prophet father vnder lawe imitate fast moses knowe neuer came minde god almost cause continued eliah fasting mount minister shoulde restore lawe faine thēselues folowers christ lent daily fast stuffe belly dinner vnto supper time easily passe time without meat vvhat likenesse haue sonne god greater sparinge elder also affinitie fast christ abstinence men commeth neere hunger angel adde also neither christe moses yearely keepe solemne faste whole life woulde god onely plaide like ape folly wicked detestable scorning christ attempted theyr fained fasting frame selues moste vile superstition perswade themselues worke meritorious part godlinesse diuine worship contumely borne first god obscure notable myracle christ taking glorye decke themselues spoiles thirdly gospell small credite taken fast christ acknowledged seale god shewed singular myracle hee kept sonne necessitie eating madde boldnesse spite god affecte owne power christ noted deuine glory fasting shall spoiled glory brought order mortall menne shall make themselues felowes ende god appoynted christes fast▪ shoulde seale gospell apply vse take much dignitie gospell therefore let counterfetting cease peruerteth counsell god whole order workes fastes kinde speake wish common amongst v pure mete shew purpose christ fasted also sathan tooke occasion hys hunger tempte christ little shall bee shewed large nowe muste bee generally seene whye god woulde haue tempted woordes mathewe marke doe sounde hee broughte thys combate determinate counsell god saye hee ledde spirite thys cause deserte doubte god personne hys sonne woulde shewe moste cleare glasse howe deadlye importune ennemie mannes saluation sathan whereof commeth passe hee shoulde assaile christe sharpelye shoulde powre oute force violence hym thys time whiche euangelistes note sawe hym commaundemente father prepared redemption mankinde therefore hee resisted personne christe saluation hee deadly persecuteth daily minister redemption whereof christe authour bee noted wythall sonne god willinglye endure temptation whereof nowe entreated hee striue wyth deuill hande hande victorie might gette v triumphe therfore ofte sathan assaileth v let v remember violence canne way sustained driuen backe opposinge thys shielde againste cause sonne god suffered himselfe bee tempted hee myghte stande betweene v ofte sathan▪ stirreth anye exercise temptation againste v therefore hee l • dde priuate life home wee doe reade hee tempted hee vndertooke office redeemer hee common name hys churche came combate christe tempted publike personne faithfull lette v knowe temptation whyche befall vnto v fortune stirred pleasure sathan without permission god spirite god gouerneth conflict whereby oure faithe exercised whereby gathered certaine hope god chiefe great captaine gouernour vnmindefull v hee helpe v oure streightes wherein hee seeth vs▪ ouermatched woordes luke sounde somewhat otherwise iesus ful holye ghoste retourned iordan whyche woordes hee signifieth hee armed plentifull grace power spirite hee myghte bee stronge endure suche bruntes spirite vaine descende vppon hym visible shape sayde grace god shyne oute cause oure saluation required euangelist marke teach beginning temptation sooner sathan assaulted forty dayes also hys hunger especiall moste notable conflictes declared▪ may knowe sathan ouercome many conflictes sharply inuade laide strongly whole force might length might oppresse yet inuinsible euery man exercised spirituall battelles muche vehemently doth god suffer stricken vvherefore lette v learne neuer bee wearied vntill wee haue perfourmed whole course warfare come marke first sight seemeth absurde christ subiect temptation men may tempted must sinne infirmitie answere first christ taken infirmity without sinne derogate glory tempted tooke vppon flesh condition made manne might take vpon affectiōs together flesh al difficultie doth consist former clause christ coulde compassed infirmitie mighte tempted sathan yet pure free sinne answere shall hard remember whole nature adam yet pure image god shined yet subiect temptation howe manye corporall affection manne manye occasion tempting doth sathan take woorthely accompted infirmity humane flesh haue sences mooued thing obiecte faulty selfe except corruption bene added whereby commeth passe sathan doeth neuer assault v geueth wound least doeth hurt v prick poynt integrity nature hath separate christ v yet meane condition imagined adam whome onely geuen possibilitie sinne wee knowe christ armed power spirite hee could pearced weapon sathan came tempter spirite purpose doth geue name sathan faithfull might therby diligently take heede vvherby also gather temptation prouoke v euil come gen 22 deut 13 3 god sayd tempt belongeth ende might trie faith mighte take vengeaunce vnbeleeuers might laye hypocrisie open obey truth heart mat 3 stone heere also olde wryters played wyth weake deuices say first temptation gluttonie seconde ambition third couetousnesse ridiculous man hungrie desireth meat hee might satisfie nature refer intemperancie throte dainty doe imagine bread accompted delicate content say drie breade lose woordes vaine answeare christ doth sufficiently declare sathans purpose otherwise truely sonne god rude vnskilfull champion knewe howe auoide blowes enemie stricken right side hee shoulde rashly holde shield left therefore sathan endeuoured driue delightes gluttonie testimony scripture readye wherewith might driue away vttereth none suche taketh sentence men liue breade secreate blessing god whereby gather sathan streightway assaulted faith christ extinguished might driue christe vnlawfull wicked wayes seeke breade doeth sathan wounde death attempteth bring passe distrusting god otherwise prouide selues word lawfull therefore meaning woordes sith thou seest thy selfe forsaken god necessitie compelleth thee thou shuldest prouide thy self therfore get thee meat god prouideth thee althoughe pretende diuine power christe whereby stone tourned bread yet one thing seeketh christe departing woorde god infidelitie shoulde folowe soeuer shoulde say therefore christ aunsweareth aptly manne shall liue bread shoulde say thou commandest seeke remedy whereby mighte helpe selfe otherwise god doeth permitte poynte distrust without reason long god promiseth nourish thou sathan tiest grace bread contrarily witnesseth meat wanting onely blessing sufficeth feede v nowe vnderstande kinde temptation namely wherewith sathan doeth assault v daily sonne god woulde subiecte himselfe vnaccustomed assault fightes common wyth v defended armour shuld doubt victorie hande 4 wrytten manne shall liue bread onely first woorthy noted christe vseth scripture shielde thys right maner fighting wee desire obtaine victorie paule doeth vaine call woorde god spiritual sworde armeth v shield faith ephe faith frō place scripture though promisse wil geue angel charge ouer thee c doth appertain al faithful yet especially belongeth christ head whole church right gouerneth angel geueth charge v wherfore way clause haue force al thy wayes doeth sathan maliciously corrupt maim saying prophet generally confusedly wresting wandring erronious course god commandeth v walke way sayth angel shall keeper mat 12 vvhen iesus heard hystorie iohn seemeth agree witnesseth iohn christ began office teaching together one time noted thre euangelistes doe therefore silence passe ouer shorte time because▪ course iohn yet finished preparation receiue gospell christe certainly though christe within time executed office teacher yet properly began preaching gospell vntil succeeded iohn vvherfore absurditie three country nazareth length began preaching luke marke doe say taught openly countrey answeare easie aduerbe time mathewe ought onelye referred nexte clause whole course hystorie therfore comming galile christ entred course also summe doctrine deliuered mathew differeth nothing litle read iohn vsed consisteth two partes repentance preaching grace saluation hee exhorteth iewes conuersion kingdom god hand god take people hande gouerne ful perfecte felicitie marke speaketh little otherwise kingdome god hande r • p • nt beleeue gospell yet sence hauing spoken restoring kingdome god amongst iewes hee exhorteth repentaunce faith yet may demaunded sith repentance doeth depende gospell whye marke separateth doctrine gospell may answeared two wayes god sometime calleth v repentaunce hee onely commaundeth life chaunged better afterwardes sheweth conuersion newnesse life gifte spirite might knowe onely commaunded duetie together offered grace power obedience maner take whiche iohn preached repentance meaning shall lorde commaundeth tourne yee doe owne industrie promiseth spirite regeneration vvherfore behooueth embrace grace faith though faith requireth hadde gospell ought restrained gift renouation belongeth especially forgeuenesse sinnes iohn ioyneth repentaunce faith god doeth therefore reconcile himselfe v father may worshipped v holinesse righteousnesse furthermore absurditie saye beleeue gospell doeth signifie muche embrace fre righteousnesse speciall relation betwene faith remission sinnes often found scripture teacheth iustified faith place may expounded wayes yet let principle remaine vnshaken free saluation offered v god conuerted liue righteousnesse therefore promising v mercy doeth call v denial flesh epytheton noted wherewith marke adorneth gospell heereby learne preaching kingdome god erected established vppon earthe neyther doeth god raigne meanes amongst men vvherby also appeareth howe miserable condition menne wythout gospell lvke 15 hee honoured cause first alone endued fulnes spirite hee might witnesse messenger reconciliation god reason paul assigneth peculiarly commō minister gospel ephe 2 17 shuld preach peace many nigh farre worketh perfourmeth power spirit whatsoeuer good thing promised 18 spirit lord vpon therfore said might know christ aswel minister doth work mā priuate busines sent god restore saluation church testifieth doth nothing motion counsell man al thing gouernment spirit faith godly might grounded vpon aucthoritie power god clause next followeth hath annoynted mee added expound former many falsly boast haue spirit god whē without gift spirit christ annoynting effect proueth hee endued spirit god hee sheweth end hee endued grace spirit namely might preach poore whereby gather whosoeuer sent god preach gospell ought first endued necessary giftes maye able discharge great office vvherefore indeede laughed vnder pretence calling god doe vsurpe place pastor vnapt execute office horned bishop poperie ignorant ass yet proudlye cry vicar christe lawful gouernours church also expresly said lord doth annoynt seruauntes beecause true effectuall preaching gospell dooth consist windy eloquence celestiall power spyrite paule sayeth 1 cor 2 1 4 poore prophet declareth estate church beginning gospel al condition without christ therefore calleth poore broken captiues blind brused god promiseth restitution though body people oppressed many misery title might agree euery member yet manye pouertie blindnesse bondage bee shorte death doe flatter themselues ar senselesse therfore fit receiuing grace first taught ende preaching gospell belongeth bringeth v wholly ouerwhelmed kind euils god shineth vnto v light life leading v great depth death might restore v full felicitie truely vsuall commendation gospell gather incomparable fruit secondly see whō christ calleth maketh partaker grace committed wretch alpoyntes without hope saluation againe admonished cannot otherwise enioy benefit christ except humbled deepe feeling misery people hungarstarued doe desire seeke deliuerer whosoeuer swell pride sigh vnder captiuitie displeased theyr owne blindenesse doe deaffe eares dispyse prophesie 19 preach acceptable yeere seemeth many allusion yeere iubile whose iudgement doe refuse yet worth labour note prophet taketh paine aunswear doubt might trouble shake weake mindes seeing lord long differred promised saluation holden suspence therefore appoynteth time redemption counsell goodwill god saith chap 49 8 acceptable time haue heard thee day saluation haue helped thee paule galla 4 4 calleth fulnes time faithfull may learne curiously enquire expedient reste god one thing sufficient saluation christ giuen god saw good 20 eye synagogue doubte god touched heartes straungnes matter fulfilled christe doth onely vse three word prooueth deede tyme nowe come wherein god would restore decayed church exposition prophesie might euident plaine hearer interpreter rightly order handle scripture applye present vse saieth fulfilled rather eares eies bare sight doth litle profit except doctrine chiefe place 22 bare witnesse luke first commendeth vnto v diuine grace mouth christe hee liuely paynteth vnthankfulnes men calleth word grace gratious wordes hebrew phrase wherein power grace holy ghost seene therefore nazarites compelled acknowledge admiration god speaking christ yet willingly hinder themselues giuing right due honour heauenly doctrine obiect sonne ioseph amplyfie circumstaunce glory god became thē malitiously take offence might fairer colour refuse whatsoeuer shalbe sayde sonne ioseph day see many though enforced graunt word god heare yet get friuolous excuse wherewith may exempt themselues necessitie obedience truelye cause touched power gospell meete commeth meanes wee lette vnto selues malice choake light beholding whereof wee moued whether matth marke luke 4 23 sayd vnto surely say prouerbe physition heale thy selfe soeuer haue heard done capernaum doe likewise thine countrey 24 said verily say vnto prophet accepted countrey 25 tell troath manye widowes israel dayes elyas heauen shut three yeeres sixe monethes great famine throughout 29 rose vp thrust citie lead vnto edge hill whereon citie builte caste downe headlonge 30 passed middes went way 23 phisition heale thy selfe wordes christ easily gathered contemptuously receiued nazarites vttereth knew thought mindes layeth falt vppon stayeth working miracle amongste reproueth malice gaue reuerence prophet god obiection preuenteth maruell countrey men haue estimation seeing hee doth ennoble owne countrey miracle doth straunge place therefore iust reuenge reiected lesse esteemeth purpose belongeth common prouerbe physition shoulde beginne first himselfe owne people shew skill curing stranger summe obiection christ preposterously myracle hee renoumed city galile respect countrey seemed nazarites honest excuse againe might refuse 24 verily say vnto hee layeth charge fault sheweth power miracle amongst thē place incredulitie men stayeth god work saluation wished matth 13 58 mar 6 5 therfore could christ doe miracle amongst beleeued men tie handes god depriueth fruit workes infidelitie make themselues vnworthy therefore aunswere asmuch christe haue sayde wil partaker miracle doe giue place god naye doe proudlye reiect minister power therefore haue iust reward contempt passed rather shew miracle place messias god restoring church committed truely vnthankefulnesse might borne god would haue sonne brought vp citie despyse nourse vvherefore ryght withdrew hande thence scorned wicked contemners learne much lord esteemeth word may punish contempt hee taketh amongst grace testimony presēce vnderstanding sentence prophet esteemed owne countrey let reader looke haue said fourth chapter iohn end 25 many widowes christ layd fault vpon without miracle proueth two example seeme absurde god preferre straungers owne housholde people ought laye faulte vppon obeyed calling god elyas elisaeus time past sharply restraineth vaine confidence would haue bound brought vppe amongst time saith hee famyne continued two yeares halfe1 ki 17 9 manye widowes lande israel whose neede prophet commaunded helpe2 ki 5 14 sent straunger citie sydon likewise elisaeus cured none leper owne countrey naaman manne syria though peculyarly nyppeth nazarits yet hee also reproueth vnthankefulnesse al nation almost al wont much vnworthily despise lord much came neere came passe god preferred straung woman israelite prophet thrown forth enforced seeke entertainment prophane land wherefore would god naaman syrian healed elisaeus reproofe people israell therefore meaning falleth time past god send power farre vnto straungers driuen backe thē dwell home yet christe declareth nothing glory diminished nought set countreymen god ignominie shame honour exalt sonne tymes past hee honoured prophet middest gentile manner foolish glorying flesh beaten downe wee see lorde reigne onelye hee euen vttermoste corner regarding lande hee chosen dwelling place himselfe also heere generall doctrine gathered becommeth v prescribe god lawe bestowing benefites pleasure hee may rayse lowe contemned menne honour chiefe reiected neyther lawefull v styrre altogether ouerthrow order yt pleaseth iudgement antithesis betweene israell prophan nation must noted behooueth v alwayes consider thas chooseth none beefore worthinesse rather commeth wonderfull counsell god yet though reason hidden necessary honour worship depth 28 filled wrath vnderstoode purpose two example tended christ alleaged grace god trasferred place therefore took theyr reproach wheras conscience ought touched quick fault corrected might seeke remedie onely driuen madnesse wicked onely stubbornly resist iudgementes god cruelly rise seruants hereby appeareth force reproues haue come spirite god enflame mindes madnesse willingly scorne see mindes menne full poyson waxe madde god soone sharpely handled must aske spirite meekenesse fury cary v deadly battayle vvhen luke saieth christ went thorow middes escaped handes hee declareth delyuered god without great myracle present death example taught although aduersaries preuaile life seeme pleasure yet power god shall alwayes conquerer preserue v long keepe v world eyther binde handes strike eye blindnes amase heartes mindes matth doctrine obedience fayth hold requireth v though hee taste small taste gospell yet sheweth much attributeth christ wheras wearyed labour without profit vaine tried againe attempted therefore cannot length lead full obedience sith peter ready obey commaundement christe whome yet hee know eyther bee prophet sonne god excuse canne serue slouth taught hee lord king iudge tenne time commaunded doe blessing god happye successe shal folow labour oft commaundement direction christe wee laye handes worke plentie fish sanke shyppes astonyed myndes beehelde meete diuine glorye christe shoulde bee reuerenceth christ myracle amased maiestie would flee much could onely befall peter text doe gather al afrayd vvherefore see feeling planted men afraide presence god profitable v foolish boldnes pride onely discribed generall calling fayth speciall calling certaine office graunte office teachinge yet committed vnto yet christe calleth chuseth company might frame teaching wisely considered commaunded leaue parentes old trade lyuing maye followe christe foote lorde contente haue flocke churche others hee appoynteth proper standing therefore lette haue office publike person layde vppon knowe required anye priuate person christe chaunging nothinge common lyfe others dooth bring foure theyr worke whereby lyued hee might vse help notable office also christ chose vnto grosse idiotes lesse rude witte voyde learning hee myght frame naye hee might renew grace spirite might excell wisemen world pull downe pryde fleshe giue notable token spirituall grace might learne aske lyght fayth howe great force rather violence fauoure loue hatred ambition drawe v away furthermore though great diligence vsed election yet thing shall prosper ill except lord take vppon gouerne chosen endew hee woulde first fruites hys churche shoulde polluted vile reproache fourthlye whye christ wittingly willingly preferred iudas honest faithfull minister first obiection thus aunsweared lorde purposely meete offence fal least shoulde troubled beyonde measure oft wee see false teacher occupie place churche professours gospell become apostate also person one manne gaue example horrible defection least placed higher estate dignitie shoulde flatter themselues much yet lette v saye christ suffered repulse vvhen father woonderful councel adioyned one deuill eleuen angelles yet hee gouerned falling matter falling awaye shoulde confirme faithe churche rather shake thys aunsweare may geuen thirde question first beginning speedely shewed estate churche shoulde least weake shoulde waxe faint fall reprobate vnmeete stabilitie gospell shoulde depende vppon menne concerning last obiection christe preferre iudas holy godly disciple lifted vppe high whence fall woulde shoulde spectacle men instruction age man shoulde abuse honour geuen god pillers falling seeme common sort faithfull might remaine stedfast lvke 13 vvhich also called apostle may expounded two wayes either consecrating send preache therefore hys companion vppon whome would lay greater charge hee sayeth would send foorth preach doeth appoynt one moment time haue sayde mar 16 〈◊〉 named symon peter although behoueth al christian liuing stone spiritual tēple yet christ mesure grace wold bestow vpō simō gaue peculiar name neither doth shamefull infirmitie denying lord hinder title inuincible power constancie disciple spake thus purpose euangelistes gather together one place principall poynts doctrine christe belong rule godly holy life therfore though luke first made mention plaine place yet hee doeth continuall course prosecute hystorie myracles hee passeth doctrine neither assigning time place mathewe noting time place likely christ preach hee hadde chosen twelue woulde curious keeping order time might carie mindes highe farre earthly care study going vp mount rather soughte secreate place way farre company might refresh litle disciple wearinesse first considered cause christe spake disciple true felicitie vve knowe common people also wise men herein deceiued thinking happy led mery quiet life free griefe desired certainly iudgement almoste menne felicitie esteemed present state therefore christ might accustome bearing crosse reprooueth wicked opinion happy nowe liue wel prosperously according flesh cannot paciently submit necke beare sorowes iniuries accounte patience enemie blessed life therefore one comforte whereby bitternesse crosse mischiefes mitigated also made sweet wee perswaded midst misery happy patience blessed lord shortly shall folow ioyfull ende graunt doctrine doeth muche disagree common sense behooued disciple christ taught wisedome might accounte felicitie world beyond vnderstāding flesh though carnall reason neuer allowe christ teacheth yet hee proposeth fantasticall deuice time past stoickes sporte paradox deede declareth truly happie whose estate accounted miserable therefore let v remember chiefe poynte doctrine • christ denieth miserable wretched oppressed iniuries wicked subiect diuers danger christ doeth proue peruerse iudgement measure felicity man present state misery godly shall shortly chaunged better also hee exhorteth patience proposing hope rewarde • blessed poore spirite luke bare metaphor mathewe doeth plainly expresse minde christ pouerty many accursed vnhappy therefore many oppressed euils yet cease inwardly swell wyth pride cruelty christ pronounceth happy tamed subdued trouble submit thēselues wholely vnto god inwardly humbled commit themselues custody others interpreat thē pore spirite arrogate nothing thēselues throwing downe al trust flesh acknowledge nede necessary one sense wordes luke mathewe bee doubted called poore oppressed afflicted aduersities difference mat adding epithyte doth restraine felicity thē vnder discipline crosse haue learned humble vve see christ doth puffe vp mind disciple vain perswasion harden hard hearted obstinacy stoicks calling hope eternal life encorageth thē patience meanes shuld enter heauenly kingdō worth labor note mā pore spirit brought nothing reposeth mercy god brokē ouerwhelmed desperation fret god lofty proude spirite 4 blessed mourne sentence next goeth appendix confirmation wont iudged trouble make man vnhappy alwayes doe drawe sorow griefe nothing cōtrary felicitie sorow christ doth deny mourne miserable hee teacheth holpe euen sorowe happy life meanes framed receiue eternall ioy pricked forward spurres least seeke comforte paule sayeth romaine chapter 5 3 reioyce tribulation knowing tribulation bringeth foorth patience patience experience experience hope hope maketh ashamed 5 blessed meeke meaneth meke quiet easily prouoked iniuries geuen frowardnes euery offence ready rather suffer thing wicked seemeth absurde christ promiseth enheritance earth suche rather vsurpe gouernment earthe couragiously repell iniuries anye time hurte ready hand reuenge certainly experience teacheth wicked much boldly stoutlye go forward gently borne hereof roase deuelish prouerbe must howle wolues whosoeuer maketh himselfe shepe presently deuoured wolues christ opposing owne aid helpe father fury violence euilles doeth wythout cause declare meeke shalbe lordes enheritors earth child world doe thinke themselues otherwise safegard except sharply reuenge euill soeuer done force armes defend life sith certaine christe onely keeper life remaineth nothing else shoulde hide selues vnder shadowe hys wing also behooueth v sheepe couette accounted flocke anye obiecte heere spoken experience firste woulde hee shoulde weigh howe vnquiet cruell men euen trouble themselues troublesome life thoughe lord earth hundred time yet possessing thing possesse nothing child god aunsweare though place sette foote vppon owne grounde yet quietly enioy dwelling place vpō earth imagined posfession dwel vpon earth know graunted god also armed wyth hande god agaynste tempest rage mischiefes though set forth dartes fortune subiecte inconuenience euilles compassed aboute wyth daungers yet dwell safelye vnder defence god leaste maye taste nowe fauoure god sufficient vntill last daye enter enheritance world 6 blessed hunger hunger thirst figure synecdoche taken want without thing necessarye also defrauded owne right mathew sayth hunger righteousnesse placing part whole yet hee amplifieth vnworthines sayth carefull sighing get nothing righteous saye blessed though moderate desire desire nothing geuen right doe yet neuerthelesse languishe hungry soules though carefulnesse wherewith bee troubled scorned yet preparation felicitie shall length satisfied god length heare sighes wil heare iust desire whose office fil hungry good thing virgines song 7 blessed merciful sentence also hard cōtrary iudgemēt man world accoūteth happy carelesse misery men prouide ease christ calleth thē blessed ready bear owne harmes also take mēs vpon thēselues may help thē misery willingly ioyn thēselues thē troubled put affection thereby maye willingly employe themselues helpe hee addeth shall obtaine mercy onely god also amongest men themselues whose mindes god bowe humanitie though sometimes world vnthankful bestoweth woorst reward vpon deserue best ought suffice v fauour laide vp god mercifull kinde▪ shall haue kinde mercifull againe 8 blessed poore heart christe seemeth heere saye nothynge agreeable iudgement men al confesse cleannesse heart mother vertues yet scarce hūdred man doeth accompt subtletie notable vertue heereof commeth passe commonly thought blessed subtile craftie conueiances whiche euill meanes doe craftelye circumuent whome haue doe therefore christe agreeth iudgemēt flesh calleth blessed delited craftinesse walke sincerely amongst men word countenance pretend thing thinke heart simple laughed men nothing warye doe deceite enoughe prouide themselues christe calleth higher wise enough deceiue vpon earth shall enioy sight god heauen 9 blessed peacemaker doeth meane loue peace flee quarels muche lieth doe also diligently ende dissentions raised vppe amongest others authours peace vnto doe take awaye occasion hatred displeasure neither rashly spoken sith painefull troublesome matter pacifi • disagree amongst themselues quiet men studie maintaine peace enforced beare crueltie heare reproches complaint quarelles bothe partes thereof riseth euery man would wish haue al patron side therefore least hang vppon fauour men christe commaundeth v regarde iudgmente father god peace accounteth v child nourish peace although labor please men called signifieth much accounted 10 blessed suffer persecution disciple christ haue great neede doctrine much lother hardly flesh doth admit much dilygently must meditated neyther canne vnder condition war vnder christ greater parte world ryse vp hatred agaynst v shall persecute v euen death standes matter sathan prince world wil neuer cease arme child madnes may strik member christ monstrous nature loue righteousnes vexed enemy haue deserued therefore peter saieth auoyde euill deedes1 pet 3 13 harme vnbrydeled wickednes world falleth often good men zeale righteousnes enflame displesures wicked lotte especially christian hated greatest number men flesh cannot beare doctrine gospel none beare haue faultes reproued sayde suffer righteousnes thereby kindle displeasure wicked prouoke theyr fury agaynst care right equitie oppose themselues euill cause defende good muche lieth behalfe truthe god hathe woorthely chiefe place vvherfore note christ discerneth martyr wicked men euil doer returne sayd euen syth liue godly christ must suffer persecution2 tim 3 12 • paule witnesseth admonition doth generally belong godly time lord spareth weakenesse permitteth wicked vexe v pleasure yet meete vnder shadowe leisure meditate doctrine maye prepared oft nede require come forth field come battell except well furnished sith condition godlye moste miserable throughe whole course life christe good cause raiseth v vp hope heauenly life heerein sentence christ differeth much inuentions stoicks commaunde euery manne satisfied owne opinion hee might owne chuser felicitie christ doeth vncertainlye plant felicitie vppon vaine imagination groundeth vppon hope rewarde come 11 vvhen men reuile luke sayeth hate separate reuile put name euill whiche woordes christ would comfort faithfull one shoulde faynte mindes though see themselues detested worlde small temptation throwne churche wicked prophane sith knewe nothing deadlye hypocrite hee might foresee howe furious violence ennemies gospell enflamed little despised flocke perfectlye arme shoulde bee ouerthrowen though great heape reproches hang ouer ouer whelme heere appeareth howe popish excommunication feared nothing tyrantes seperate v theyr synagogue deuorced christ 12 reioyce • e glad wee shoulde ouerthrowen wyth vniust reproches declareth remedy hand assoone lifte vppe mindes heauen presently great occasion ioy doeth offer selfe maye swallowe vppe heauinesse sporte papistes make wyth name rewarde heere easily wiped away neither dreame mutuall relation betweene rewarde merite free promisse rewarde wee consider howe maimed corrupte good deedes come euen best menne god shall neuer finde worke woorthy rewarde againe clause noted sake sonne man also shall say maner euil falsly least suffer persecution owne faultes presently boast themselues martyr christe donatistes time past pleased themselues wyth title magistrate againste thys daye anabaptistes thoughe disturbe churche wyth theyr doating dreames slander gospell yet glory beare ensignes christe condēned righteously christ pronounceth none blessed suffer iust defence quarell f • r persecuted prophetes purposely added least apostle hoping triumph kingdome christ full richesse pleasure vvherefore christ doth without cause admonish trouble prepared prophetes sometime experience much succeede place neither doeth say prophet respecte time order therefore behooued frame themselues example common fancie nine atitudes friuolous neede long confutation lvke 24 vvee riche men luke rehearseth onely foure principall blessing nowe opposeth foure curse sentence might answere one antithesis doeth tende striking feare wicked stirring vppe faithfull least sleepe vaine captious snare world knowe howe quickely readily man may made drunke prosperitie entangled faire speaches men whereby also doeth often come passe child god doe enuie reprobate whome see thing flowe prosperously happelye cursseth riche take cōfort worlde rest fortune forgette life come therefore hee meaneth richesse farre making man blessed often become occasion destruction otherwise god doeth remooue rich men kingdome make snare themselues fixinge theyr hope earth doe shut gate heauen themselues aptly sayde augustine might shewe richesse selues hinderance child god doeth saye poore lazarus receiued bosome riche abraham sence doth curse ful haue aboundance pusfed vppe confidence present ioyes refuse heauenly ioyes thought laughter laughter vnderstandeth geuen pleasure epicure drowned pleasure flesh doe flee trouble endured defence god glory last woe tendeth correction ambition nothinge common seeke praise men least entāgled christe therefore sheweth fauour men venimous deadly might feare disciple admonitiō especially belongeth teacher haue neede feare ambition anye pestilence shoulde defile pure doctrine god seeke fauour men christ sayeth men ought referred child world speake well none deceiuers false prophet faithfull good minister salte earth proper doctrine doeth attribute person ministerie committed christe calling apostle salte earth doeth meane office season earth menne haue nothing vnsauerie vntill bee seasoned heauenly doctrine hee admonisheth called pronounceth grieuous horrible iudgement except perform office sheweth doctrine laid vppe adioyned good conscience godly vpright life corruptiō borne others detestable accounted monstrous say menne vnsauery god salte geuen wherewith may made sauery vnsauery frō whence shal haue remedy ought helpe • lorde doeth excellently prosecute metaphore hee sayeth thing doe degenerate owne nature yet corruption profitable way salte hurtfull also maketh dunghilles barren therefore sum sicknes incureable whē minister teacher word doe corrupte make themselues vnsauerye▪ oughte salte season rest worlde furthermore admonition profitable minister also whole flocke christe sith god earth shoulde seasoned word foloweth soeuer wanteth salte vnsauorie although sauour neuer well vnto menne vvherefore nothing better admit seasoning meanes vnsauerinesse amended yet let seasoner take heede nourishe worlde corruption especially infecte vile corrupt sauour therefore wickednesse papistes borne thoughe purpose christe geue vnto hys apostle vnbrideled libertie make tyrauntes ouer soules rather admonishe duetie turne oute righte waye christe declareth maner teacher hee woulde haue churche lawe doe chalenge themselues apostle doe vnder couer maintaine abhomination soeuer please bringe christe called peter suche lyke salte earth yet doe consider howe grieuous seuere threatninge added woorste become vnsauerie sentence placed luke abruptly end red neede peculiar exposition marke 49 euery manne shall seasoned fire haue ioyned woordes marke former woordes mathewe doe altogether agree sense vsed place time rather reader may better thys comparison perceiue diuers vse sentence vvhen christ hadde spoken euerlasting fire marke reporteth hee side exhorteth shoulde nowe rather offer themselues lorde seasoned fire salte may made holy sacrifice least sinnes purchase themselues fire whiche neuer quenched seasoned fire vnproper speache nature salte fire like purging trying humour therefore christe applied woorde bothe nowe vnderstande occasion thys sentence namelye faithfull shoulde refuse salted fire salte since without cannot made holy god alludeth commaundemente laweleuit 2 13 lorde expreslye forbiddeth oblation bee made without salte nowe gospell teacheth faithfull seasoned may sanctified vvhen addeth salte good generally extendeth al whō god vouchsafeth season woorde hee exhorteth alwayes keepe sauoure metaphore somewhat harder hee calleth whatsoeuer • seasoned name salte yet sense made thing doubtfuller haue carelesnesse lost sauour whiche grace god remedye vtterly lost corrupt faith wherby consecrate themselues seeing good sauour cānot obtained seasoning furthermore become corrupt forsaking grace god woorse infidel euen salte corrupteth earth dunghill marke 50 haue salte selues woorde maye taken heere diuers wayes maye signifie either seasoning good sauoure obtained faithcol 4 6 wisedome spirite paule commaundeth oure communication shoulde seasoned salte hee meaneth ought purged pure frō prophane folly corruption filled spirituall grace maye edifie sauour maye perfume shall heare exposition stande last clause must vnderstode mutual peace nourished salte yet probable latter sentence doeth depende former speache christ seemeth exhort disciple preserue force strengthe theyr faith may also helpe others shoulde haue sayde must doe diligence onely seasoned within also may season others yet salte doeth bite hys sharpnesse therefore doeth presently admonish seasoning shoulde tempered peace may yet remaine safe math 14 lighte worlde thoughe wee child light lightened faith commanded beare burning lightes oure handes least wee wander darkenesse also shewe waye life others yet preaching gospell committed apostle aboue others day commaunded pastours church therefore christ geueth thys title peculiarely shoulde haue sayd thys condition placed suche degree mighte geue lighte highe others hee addeth two similitude towne sette vppon hill cannot hidde neither vse hide candle lighted woordes woulde signifie liue sette oute looked vppon menne certainly higher manne placed greater hurte doeth hys euill example behaue himselfe peruersly therefore christe willed hys apostle bende themselues godly holy life meane men common sorte mennes eye sette vppon vppon lanternes neither meanes borne wyth except godlinesse integritie life doe answeare doctrine whereof minister applying similitude marke luke seemeth vnlike christe generally admonisheth diligently take heede least manne beinge darkenesse shoulde nourish vppe himselfe libertye sinning hidde season shall lengthe bee reuealed thys meaning excepte christ rehearsed sentence abruptly depending text math 16 let light shine menne taught
