obserue teache shall called great kingdome heauen marke luke 16 17 nowe easie heauen earth shoulde passe awaye one title lawe shoulde fall 17 thinke though christ perfection life might rightly say came fulfill law yet doth entreat life doctrine proclaime kingdome god come stirre vppe mindes menne wyth vnwoonted hope also receiue disciple baptisme probable mindes many doubted diligently sought purpose newnesse tended nowe christ declareth doctrine farre dissenting lawe agreeth well lawe prophet onely bringeth full perfection seemeth especially led two cause testifie consent law gospel assone spring newe kinde teaching common people take shoulde alteration thing preaching gospell order sayde euen nowe made hope churche shoulde bee altered estate therefore thinke olde vsuall kinde gouernment abolished vvhich opinion bene hurtfull many wayes godly woorshippers god woulde neuer haue embraced gospell beene defection lawe light troublesome spirites would assay taking suche occasion greedily ouerthrowe state religion knowe howe ouerthwartly rashnesse lift vp selfe new thing furthermore christe sawe manye iewes thoughe professed beleeued lawe yet altogether prophane degenerate estate thinges amongest people decaied thinges filled wyth suche corruption either slouthe malice priestes hadde quenched pure lighte doctrine remayned greate reuerence lawe hadde beene brought newe kinde doctrine shoulde haue discredited lawe prophetes religion hadde beene miserably shaken seemeth first cause christe denied hee came destroye lawe may easily gathered oute texte confirme presently addeth cannot one iote title lawe shuld passe vnfilled hee accurseth teacher doe labour faithfully mainteining authoritie seconde cause hee might take away vile reproche whiche rude ignoraunt woulde charge appeareth scribe charged hys doctrine wyth faulte muche presently inueigheth vvee must consider purpose christe calleth exhorteth iewes receiue gospell yet hee keepeth vnder obedience lawe hee mightily refelleth vnwoorthye reproches cauilles wherewith ennemies sought bringe preaching slaunder suspition anye minde restore thinges confused better estate hee muste alwayes vse wisedome moderation people maye knowe eternall woorde god touched thereby newe thing thrust whych derogateth thing scripture least suspition repugnancie shoulde weaken faith godly leaste rashe vnaduised menne shoulde become insolent vnder pretence holinesse lastly prophane contempte woorde god maye staied religion brought reputation amongst vnlearned defence christe wherewith hee excuseth doctrine oughte comforte v day suffer like reproach faulte also obiected pauleact 21 21 hee apostate lawe god wherefore maruell papistes mould doe coyne like againste v example christe meete auoide slaunderous reportes yet truthe may freely professed though subiecte many vniust reproches came destroy god hadde promised newe couenaunt comming christe hee sheweth also shall diuers firste thys rather ende league whiche hadde made people beginning might sanctified euer wryte sayeth hee lawes heartesier 31 3 • forgette sinnes woordes hee farre departing former couenaunt hee rather affirmeth shall established confirmed • newe shall come place meaning wordes christe hee sayde came fulfill lawe hee fulfilled truelye quickeninge deade letter spirite hee deede perfourmed whyche shewed onelye vnder figure cursse beinge abrogate subiection taken awaye libertye purchased faithfull nothynge derogated doctrine lawe onelye expoundeth minde lawe geuer appeareth galathians thirde fourthe chapiter therefore concernynge doctrine wee maye imagine anye abrogation lawe comminge christe sithe euerlasting rule godly holy life must vnchangeable iustice god one whiche therein comprehended concerning ceremony thoughe maye accounted certaine addition yet onely vse abrogate signification approoued commyng christ derogate anye thing ceremony rather truth shadowes shewen foorth doeth obtaine assured credite vnto wee beholding perfecte effecte doe acknowledge vaine vnprofitable therefore lette v learne keepe sacred knotte lawe gospel inuiolable many wickedly dissolue doeth much auaile establishing truth gospell wee heare nothing else fulfilling law mutuall consent shewe god authour 18 till heauen earth pearish luke vseth woordes sense easie heauen earth passe away one title lawe shoulde fall christ teach place nothing sure whole frame worlde certaine truth lawe euery poynte doe verye subtillye play woorde vntill passing heauen earth shall last daye iudgement shoulde putte ende lawe prophet truely tongue shall cease prophesies abolished thincke wrytten lawe wyth exposition shall cease thinke christe spake simply feede reader eares suche deuices therefore lette suffice v vnderstande heauen shoulde fall whole frame worlde shoulde come together rather certaintie lawe shoulde wauer meaninge thinges lawe shall perfourmed euen least title see farre menne perfecte fulfilling lawe euen regenerate god spirite aunsweare fulfilling referred life menne perfecte truthe doctrine hee shoulde say nothing inconstante lawe nothyng putte rashly therefore cannot bee one letter vanish away 19 vvhosoeuer therefore shall breake heere christe speaketh namelye preceptes life ten woordes according prescript order becommeth child god frame liues therefore pronounceth false peruerse teacher keepe disciple vnder obedience lawe vnwoorthy haue place churche whiche diminish authoritie lawe least parte good faithfull minister god whiche teache obseruation lawe well example life woordes also hee calleth leaste commaundements lawe according sense iudgement men thoughe like waight commaundementes compared betweene themselues lesse yet may nothing soner esteme account little wherof heauenly lawgeuer hath voutchsaued geue commaundemente sacriledge contemptuously receiue commeth mouth meanes maiestie shuld haue bene abased wherefore whereas christ calleth least preceptes kinde yeelding vnderstanding vvhen hee sayeth shall called least allusion sayde commaundementes meaning euidente bring doctrine law contēpt yea though one sillable shal reiected woorst sort men kingdome heauen taken renouation church second state church began arise preaching gospell luke 7 28 christ accounteth least kingdome god greater iohn reason speache god restoring world hand sonne framed kingdome perfectly therefore christe teacher admitted churche renewed suche faithfull interpreaters lawe wil endeuour keepe doctrine sounde demaunded whether ceremony accounted amongst commandements god required obserued answere purpose end lawgeuer considered god commaunded ceremony outwarde vse mighte temporall signification eternall hee breaketh ceremony holdeth effecte omitteth shadowe nowe sith christe banisheth kingdome accustome menne contempte lawe beastlinesse monstrous ashamed wyth sacrilegious indulgence remit god doth seuerely require vnder pretence veniall sinne beat downe righteousnesse law againe title noted geueth good holy teacher exhort men word especially example life keepe lawe matth 5 marke luke 20 saye vnto excepte ryghteousnesse exceede righteousnesse scribe pharises yee shall enter kingdome heauen 21 yee haue heard sayde old time thou shalt kill whosoeuer killeth shalbe culpable iudgment 22 saye vnto whosoeuer angrye brother vnaduisedlye shall culpable iudgement whosoeuer saith brother racha shalbe worthy punished councel whosoeuer shall say foole shalbe worthy punished hell fire 20 except righteousnes exceede reprehendeth scribe endeuoured charge doctrine gospell though ouerthrow law hee disputeth matter onely dooth shewe briefly haue nothing lesse mindes zeale lawe haue sayde pretend hate mee woulde breake lawe appeareth lyfe coldly esteeme law nay securely scorne god painted faigned righteousnesse beare vp thē selues amongst men iudgement interpreter see hee doe rather reproue corrupt kind teaching scribe pharises vsed teaching people restrayned lawe god onely outward dueties framed disciple ape hypocrisie speake lyued wickedly nay worse taught therefore willingly ioyne theyr glory false righteousnesse wicked docctrine yet dooth easily appeare wordes followe christ doth especially inueigh sentence purging lawe wicked commentes doth restore former puritie summe wickedly obiected haue sayde forcibly returneth backe vpon themselues behold said perfect apt interpreter lawe doe frame righteousnesse shall shutte gate heauen follower must remembred said otherwhere amplifying matter pharises ioyned scribe secte got reporte holynes themselues others though deceyued thinke called separation menne separate common sorte men challenged degree proper themselues called pherus • im interpreter contente simple letter professed hadde kaye gather secrete vnderstanding whereof greate heape mixed inuentions sprange drawing maistership themselues wicked pleasure like boldnes durst intrude inuentions steede scripture 21 haue heard sayde sentence others following doth agree goeth christ dooth large shew kindes ouerthwartly doe wrest law righteousnes nothing el drosse deceiued thought reformation law christe extolled disciple higher degree perfection moses euer could bring grosse carnall people vnto hardly fitte learne first elementes went opinion beginning righteousnes tymes paste delyuered lawe perfection taught gospell christe meant nothing lesse chaunge alter anye thing commaundementes god hath therein established perfecte rule lyfe whereof neuer repent beecause lawe corrupted adulterous commentes wrested prophane sense christ delyuereth corruption sheweth right vnderstanding whiche iewes fallen away doctrine law doth onely beginne also perfourmeth vpright lyfe maye gathered one chapter requireth perfect loue god neighbour endued loue wanteth nothing chiefe perfection therefore law commaundements good lyfe leadeth men marke righteousnesse therefore paule accounteth weake respect selfe respect flesh lawe onelye giue entraunce true perfect righteousnessedeu 30 19 moses protestation vaine take heauen earth recorde day haue sette thee waye lyfe deathdeu 10 12 againe israel doth lord thy god require thee thou shouldest wholly cleaue vnto promise also vaineleuit 18 5 purpose hee doth thinges shall liue euidentlye appeareth place scripture christ meant alter thing commaundementes commaundeth woulde good workes enter lyfe obserue nothing commaundements lawe neyther hee apostle doe giue anye preceptes godly holy lyfe truely doe great iniurie god aucthour law imagine hee onelye frame eye handes feete feigned shewe good workes onely gospell teacheth v loue god hearte therefore let errour passe wantes law amended christe may imagine christe new lawgiuer adde thing eternal righteousnesse father faithfull interpreter heard wee might know manner law purpose tendeth farre reacheth remaineth v see christ condemneth pharises interpretation differeth commentes summe thet translated doctrine lawe politike order sufficed doe outward dueties came passe thought himselfe free manslaughter hand killed mā defiled body adultery thought himselfe chaste pure god profanation lawe might borne certaine moses euerye require spirituall worship god god delyuered hand moses according owne nature spake well • eartes handes eye christe alleadgeth wordes law applyeth himselfe common capacitie simple say scribe haue yet deliuered vnto literall exposition law sufficient man keepe hand manslaughter violence admonish looke deeper matter charitie perfection lawe say thy neighbour iniuried oft thing vncharitably done last clause rehearseth shalbe culpable iudgment killeth man doth confirme said euen christ reproueth fault law god giuē gouerne mindes men turned polytike gouernement 22 say vnto doth oppose answere cō mandement moses cōmon fantasie scribe also pharises boast antiquity commonly long prescription time pretēded defence error christ calleth peopple backe auctoritie whereto al antiquitie ought right giue place whereby gather trueth much esteemed thē either antiquitie custome vvhosoeuer shall say vnto brother christ setteth three degree condemnation besides violence handes wherby hee declareth commandement law doth restraine hand affection contrary brotherlye charitie shoulde haue saide onely angry brother doe proudly lyfe vp themselues doe hurt opprobrious word murderer sith euident word racha placed middest betweene anger manifeste reproofe take bee interiection contempt despite though christe adiudgeth onely hell fire break open reproofes yet hee acquiteth anger punishment alluding iudgementes world declareth god become iudge priuate secrete wrath may punish hee proceedeth sheweth indignation bitter speech hee saieth hee shall found guiltie heauenly councell may haue greater punishment adiudgeth hell fire breake reproach signifying hatred whatsoeuer else charitie sufficeth purchase reward eternall death though violence offred doubted worde gehenna borowed hebrewes signifieth valley also valley hennon infamous place detestable superstition offered child idolles heereof came passe holy men vsed word hell vile vngodlynes might greater detestation people might abhor detestable horrible name appeareth manner speach vsed christ time hell called almoste name gehenna worde somewhat altered natural sound matthew 5 mark luk 12 23 thou bring thy gifte altar remembrest thy brother hath ought thee 24 leaue thine offering altar goe thy way first reconciled thy brother come offer thy gift 25 agree thine aduersary quicklye while thou art way leaste thine aduersary delyuer thee iudge iudge delyuer thee sergeaunt thou cast prison 26 verily saye vnto thee thou shalt come thence till thou hast payd vttermost farthing 58 vvhilest thou goest thine aduersarie ruler thou art way giue diligence way thou mayst liuered least hee bring thee iudge ye iudge deliuer thee iayler iayler caste thee prison 59 tell thee thou shalt departe thence till thou hast payd vtmoste mite 23 bring thy gift vvith clause confirmeth also expoundeth former doctrine summe doe satisfie commuundement lawe wherein wee forbydden kill nourish agreement brotherly loue neighbour might better perswade v christ pronounceth euen dueties religion accepted god refused dissent amongst selues commaundeth haue hurt one brother first fauour beefore offer gifte hee declareth entraunce v vnto god long faulte wee enmitie neighbour men pollute corrupt hatred whole worship offer hereof gather much esteemeth mutuall concord amongst v yet may question moued whether absurde dueties charitie accounted worshippe god wee must say eyther order law preposterous el first table preferred second easily aunswered wordes christe doe tend purpose shew doe vaine falsly professe themselues worshipper god doe contemptuously dispise brother haue vniustly iniuried vnder one kinde hee noteth outward exercise relygion figure sinecdoche outwarde exercise men doe oft counterfeit holynesse rather truely testifie noted christ maner time spake sacrifice day estate vnlike yet doctrine remaineth whatsoeuer offer vnto god corrupt except one brother much lyeth v scripture calleth almes philip 4 18 sacrifice sweete sauour yet heare paule mouth 1 cor 13 2 3 bestoweth goodes vppon poore yet nothing except hee haue charitie also god dooth take acknowledge child excepte againe shew themselues men brother though christ doth commaunde haue iniuried brother apply themselues appease yet vnder one kinde hee sheweth howe precious brotherly concord god setteth much commaundeth leaue gifte altar hee shoulde haue sayde vaine doe menne come temple offer sacrifice god longe discord neighbour 25 agree thine aduersarie though christ seemeth goe onely exhorte reconciliation haue done iniurie brother also haue bene iniuried yet thinke regard namely might cut occasion hatred discordes shew meanes maintaine good whence spring iniuries men carefull hold owne right giuen much mainteine theyr owne commoditie losse men almost men blinded peeuishe loue selues • latter themselues euen worst cause therefore christ might preuent discordes hatred strife iniuries forbiddeth selfe loue commaundeth disciple bend themselues moderation equitie parting extremitie right might equitie redeeme peace friendship wished neuer fall strife controuersie amongst v surely men neuer fall contention strife loue amongst ought hardly bee brought passe strife arise christ sheweth remedie may presently ended namelye bridle lustes readye rather passe ouer losse thē prosecute right vnappeasable rygour christ vsed exhortatiō diuerse time appeareth 12 luke sermon made mount set downe epitome gathered diuerse sentence christ vvhereby also appeareth way beefore thou commest iudge least thine aduersary delyuer thee iudge expound clause metaphoricaly heauenly iudge wil deal extremitie law forgiue nothing except wee endeuour pacifie contention haue neighbour take simply christ admonisheth v profitable v euen amongst men couetous desire often daungerous contentious yet doe deny similitude may bee aptly applyed god shall feele iudgement without mercy rygorous brother bendeth himselfe wholy contention papistes ridiculous expounding place allegorically doe build purgatory nothing euidente christ doth speake maintaining good amongst men make religion without shame peruerte wordes drawe straunge sense might deceiue vnlearned vnworthy long confutation shewe one onely word shamefull ignorance imagine aduersary deuill christe commaundeth faythfull one louing vnto therefore papistes maye finde purgatorie behooueth first brother friend deuill well knowne quarterne fourth parte pound place taken farthing smal peece money also appeareth luke would vse cauilles woulde also refell folly papistes purgatorie shall neuer goe thence vntill haue payde vttermost farthing followeth rite call suffrage luying dead vaine christ doth admit others make satisfaction release debter expresly requireth euery manne payment owne debt mass sacrifice vnprofitable howe hotely soeuer fire purgatorie doe burne yet priestes monkes kytchens shall wax cold cause haue painefully striuen matth 5 mark luke 27 yee haue hearde sayde • f old time thou shalt commit adulterie 28 say vnto whosoeuer looketh woman lust hath committed adultery already heart 29 vvherefore thy right eye cause thee offend pluck cast thee better thee one thy member perishe thy whole body cast hell 30 also thy right hande make thee offende cutte caste thee better thee one thy member perishe thy whole bodye shoulde bee caste hell 27 thou shalt commit adultery christ proceedeth disputation prouing law god gouernour life fram outward behauiour pollitike maner also requireth perfect whole affection heart must remembred gaue warning although christ reporteth word law yet grosse adulterous sense false interpreter gathered reproueth said came new lawgiuer faythfull interpreter law alreadie giuen might obiected interpretation cō tinued long christ expresly graunteth maner answereth long continuance errour ought bee preiudice truth 28 hee looketh vpon woman purpose christ generally condemn lust flesh therfore saith adulterer god defile men wiues also pollute eye vnchaste looke figuratiue kinde speeche eye doe make men guiltie adulterie also blinde burning lustes hearte therefore paule placeth chastitie body spirit 1 cor 7 34 christ thought sufficient confute grosse opiniō taken place thinke auoyd nothing outward adulterie notwithstanding eye moste parte procure mindes filthy deuises lust entreth dores christ vseth manner speach would condemne concupiscence may easily gathered word lust whereby also taught onely accounted adulterer conceaue whoredome mindes full consente also admitte prickes motion vvherefore hypocrisie papistes grosse carelesse deny concupiscēce sinne vntil whole hart yeeld consent merueiled lessen sinne doe behoueth dul slow accounting sinnes ascribe righteousnes desertes work 29 thine eye weakenesse imbecilitie fleshe christe might seeme vrge men seuerely preuenteth aunswereth complayntes summe declareth though bee hard difficult troublesom sharp god commandeth yet make excuse therby righteousnes god ought esteemed v thinges moste deare precious v haue sayde cause whye thou shouldest obiecte thou canst scarsly turne thine eye hether thither caught snare thou art aware thou must rather forsake leaue thine eye departe commaundementes god yet christes meaning body lamed might obey god men doe gladly desire sens may maymed maye haue free vse christe dooth hyperbolically teach v cut away thing hindreth v obedience vnto god hee requireth v lawe hee dooth purpose men behalfe licentiously nourish vp themselues mind pure eye handes would also obedient haue proper motion owne doe herein offende grieuouslye carefull wee ought bee auoydinge deceitfull baytes rather vnbrydeled libertie doe willingly prouoke selues euill matth 5 marke luke 16 31 hath beene sayde also whosoeuer shal put away wife let giue testimoniall diuorcement 32 say vnto whosoeuer shall put away wife except bee fornication causeth commit adultery whosoeuer shall marry diuorced committeth adulterie 1 • vvhosoeuer putteth away wife maryeth another committeth adultery whosoeuer giue byll diuorcement wiues put away certeine testimonie manumission woman might free yoake power husband husband also confesse hee put away wife fault lyke hence sprang errour thought fault bee diuorcement satisfied law tooke wrong rule godly holy lyfe ciuil lawe politike lawes sometime bent men manner god giuing spirituall law regarde menne could doe ought doe therfore perfect vpright righteousnesse therein contayned though haue power fulfill christ dooth admonishe v presently lawful god polytike law moses doth tollerate saith vnder pretence law absolueth himselfe putting away wife giueth bill diuorcement band matrimonie holyer may brokē vnknitte rather pleasure men though manne wife doe ioyne themselues togeather mutuall consent yet god doth ioyne knit togeather knot cannot dissolued lawfull depart yet hee putteth exception except fornication woman worthylye put away hath traiterously broken matrimonie band broken fault man set libertie 32 causeth commit adultery byll best agree al couenauntes promisses confirmed adding name god thereto god made witnesse party pledge faith 34 sweare clause hath deceiued many thought christ generally condemned oathes many good men else al oathes vnlawful abuse prophane sacred name god reuerence whereof ought preserue neyther heauen deceiued say christe reprooued formes swearing corrupt god alone shoulde sworne reason bringeth sweareth himselfe whosoeuer swore tymes paste moloch idoll much diminishe glory god placed roumth vnderstander thoughtes iudge • oules day doe sweare angelles dead saintes doe spoyle god honour prescribeth remedy namely menne deale truely faythfully amongst themselues playne speach shall value oath amongst knowe corrupt false dealing truely best way reproue correct vice note fountaines whence spring whence commeth rash readinesse swearing much vanitie manye deceites vnconstancy ficklenesse nothing almost beleeued therfore christe requireth trueth constancy wordes wee shoulde neede violence paule interprete v place best commaundeth ouercome euill good rather striue euill ro 12 17 antithesis noted betweene offence correction fault speaketh reuengmēt christ might take lybertie disciple forbiddeth resist euil euil also stretcheth law patience shoulde onely receiue iniuries without grudging rather prepare selues beare new iniuries summe purpose admonition faythfull learne forgette mischiefes soeuer done vnto least hurte breake hatred enuie desire hurt againe shuld frame themselues greater patience mischiefes iniuryes encrease stirre vp vvhosoeuer shall strike thee equitie one two iniuries faynte waxe wearie true augustine saieth lawe giuen outwarde workes thou vnderstand rightly graunt christe restraineth handes aswell mindes whereas manne cannot defende selfe folly man stand vpon wordes first giue vnto enemy whatsoeuer desire rather goe lawe suche facilytie fanne kindle mindes wicked theftes robbery wee know christe minde farre meaneth thou shouldest giue thy cloak vnder colour lawe woulde take away thy coate anye man oppressed wrongfull iudgement loseth yet ready leaue rest neede deserueth lesse praise patience suffereth himselfe twise spoyled hee wil spoyle yet goe doctrine christ perswadeth beare oppression pacience truly rare example man come sue court quiet patient affection may one maye defende good cause respect owne priuate commoditie common wealth lawfull simplye condemne thing selfe vntill corrupt affection doth appeare diuerse phrase matthew luke doe alter sense cloake commonly greater value coat therefore matthew saith thou must giue thy cloake taketh awaye thy coat hee meaneth haue small losse willing readye beare greater losse wordes luke agree olde prouerbe coat nearer cloake lv 30 euery one asketh giue mathew hath word shall keepe v within band brotherly loue testifieth al men neighbour common nature dooth tie v oft looke vpon man necessary beholde self glas bone flesh thogh greater parte moste commonly doth seperate according euery man minde haue none bee accounted neighbour desertes worthy beloued least woulde deale friendly againe common sense teach therefore child world neuer ashamed professe hatredes wherfore could yeelde account charitie god commendeth law regardeth euery man deserueth stretcheth self vnworthy peruerse vnthākful christ restoreth natural sense deliuereth corruptiō wherby also appeareth said christ make newe lawes reproue corrupt comment scribe wherwith puritie law god bene corrupted 44 loue enemy one poynt containeth former doctrine whosoeuer frame minde loue enemy wyll easily temper himselfe reuenge wil patient affliction much ready help miserie christ wordes sheweth way maner fulfilling commandement loue thy neighbour thy selfe shall neuer satisfie cō maundement banisheth loue himselfe rather deny selfe make much men god hath ioyned goeth loue euen lie hated wordes learne farre faithfull ought bee reuenge wherein onely forbidden aske god remitte wholy put mind shal wish wel enemy yet meane cease cōmit cause god vntill hee take vengeaunce reprobate desire muche lyeth wicked return perfect mind seeke saluation shuld perish yet comfort case al trouble doubt god wilbe reuē ger obstinate malice might declare yt care innocent hard thing altogether nature flesh recompence good euil must seeke excuse faultes infirmity must rather simplye seeke law strength yet monk ashamed chalenge themselues perfection voluntarily bind themselues obserue counselles howe faithfully performe doe onely vsurpe woordes doe nowe omit saye howe preposterous fond deuise counsel doeth heereof appeare first cannot sayd without iniurie christ counselled disciple according authority command whiche righte follie sette dueties charitie suche liberty whiche depende hys fatherlye goodnesse liberalitye onelye prophane philosopher see moste wicked contemners godlinesse coulde make confession nothing lyke god liberall summe christe witnesseth note adoption doe good euill vnwoorthy yet thou must vnderstande wee liberalitie made child god spirite whiche witnesse earnest • ale free adoption doeth reforme wicked affection flesh striue charitie christe prooueth effecte none else child god shewe gentlenesse clemencie phrase luke sayeth yee shall child moste high man getteth honour hymselfe beginneth sonne god loueth ennemies accustomed maner speaking rise rehearseth two testimony goodnesse god towardes v onely knowen vnto men common rather societie selfe shoulde prouoke v performe one another though figure synecdoche comprehendeth many like 46 doe publicanes luke vseth sense thys worde sinner naughty wicked men office self condemned publicanes gatherer tolle lawfull prince sette taske lawfull demaunde gather thys maner menne wont couetous snatching yea faithlesse cruell accounted amongest iewes minister vniust tyrannie therefore man shall gather woordes christ publicanes woorst men shal argue amisse speaketh common maner speach say almost without humanitie haue yet kinde mutuall loue seeke owne commoditie 4 • yee therefore perfecte perfection requireth equalitie referred likenesse therfore though far god accounted perfecte hee bende marke proposeth v himselfe interpreat otherwise lette made comparison betweene god v perfection god called first free meere liberalitie whiche done without accounte gaine then▪ singular goodnesse striueth malice vnthankfulnesse menne appeareth wordes luke • e mercifull year heauenly father mercy opposed bought loue tied priuate commoditie mathewe 6 1 take heede yee gaue almes bef • men seene else yee shall haue rewarde father heauen 2 therefore thou geuest thine almes thou shalt make trumpet blowne thee hypocrite doe synagogue streetes praised men verely saye vnto haue rewarde 3 thou doest thine almes lette thy left hand know thy right hand doeth 4 thine almes may secreate thy father seeth secreate hee rewarde thee openlye marke luke 1 take heede christ doeth place exhort disciple syncere studie good workes studie simplie doe wel god shoulde boast themselues men necessary admonition vertues ambition alwaies feared woorke laudable thereby often corrupted defiled figure synecdoche vnder one kind generall doctrine deliuered hee speaketh almes speaketh little prayer yet many copy woorde right eousnesse vsed almes olde interpreter also translated wayght wayes sufficiently appeareth correcteth disease ambition whilest well seeketh glory men 2 vvhen thou geuest thine almes heere hee reprooueth name faulte commonly vsed custome wherein desire vayneglory may onely seene almoste felt handes emptied basket amongst poore corner streetes publike place vsed publike meeting sought publike place might haue many witness shewed appeared manifest vainglorious boasting satisfied also vsed sound trumpettes fained called poore vnto neuer want pretence yet nothing euident sought commendation praise serue eye men make god iudge examiner life therfore christ sayeth without cause boast themselues sort haue reward already cannot haue regard god haue eye possessed vanitie reason hypocrite called couetous vaine glorye hypocrite called prophane gesters played counterfait person vpon stage playes scripture geueth thys name men double dissembling heart althoughe diuers kindes hypocrite though guiltie themselues yet impudently chalenge accounted good men worlde endeuour couer fault whereof conuict owne conscience others securely nourish vppe themselues dare also chalēge vnto themselues perfect righteousnes god others wel desire righteousnesse glory god onely may get themselues fame opinion holinesse christ noteth later kinde rightly calleth hypocrite whiche good woorkes propose themselues good end put person others vppon might seeme holy good worshipper god 3 let thy left hand know meaning speach ought content god alone witnesse doings bende selues obedience caried vanitie falleth often men doe sacrifice muche god themselues therefore christes meaning shoulde caried away contrary thought wholely bende oure selues may worship god pure conscience 4 thine almes may secreate sentence seemeth contrary many place scripture wee commaunded edifie oure brother wyth good example consider purpose oure sauioure may stretch woordes commandeth hys disciple freely wythout ambition applye themselues good woorkes may done willeth looke beholding menne maye thinke sufficient god alone approoue deedes simplicitie taketh away care diligence profiting others example little doeth precisely forbid good deedes men condemneth vaine ostentation thy father seeth secreat couertly condemneth folly raigneth euery amongst men thinke labour lost haue many witness good deedes therefore sayeth god needeth great light see knowe good deedes knoweth euen seeme buried darkenesse therefore cause shoulde thinke thing loste menne see beare witnesse god hathe seate euen darkest dennes hee ministreth aptest remedye curinge disease ambition hee calleth v beholding god maketh vanish vtterly blotteth vaine glory oute mindes seconde clause foloweth next christ warneth v seeking reward good woorkes patiently wait last day resurrection thy father sayeth shall rewarde thee openly vvhen euen morning last day shal arise thing nowe hidden darkenesse shall laid open mathewe 6 marke luke 5 thou prayest hypocrite loue stande pray synagogue corner streetes woulde seene menne verely saye vnto haue rewarde 6 thou prayest enter thy chamber thou hast shut thy doore praye vnto thy father secreate thy father seeth secreate shall rewarde thee openly 7 also yee praye vse value repetition heathen thinke hearde muche babling 8 yee like therefore father knoweth whereof ye haue neede ye aske 5 vvhen thou prayest teacheth nowe prayer whych taught almes grose shamefull prophaning name god hypocrite praye rather faine themselues pray openly may haue glory menne sith hypocrisie alwaies ambitious wonder blinde therefore commaundeth disciple praye rightlye enter chamber though seemeth first absurde doe expounde allegorically inwarde parte heart yet neede subtletie vve commaunded manye place scripture pray god praise publike assembly company men al people testifie saith thankfulnesse also might stirre others example doe lyke christ doeth forbidde v onely admonisheth v haue god eye oft prepare selues prayer therfore woordes vrged enter thy chamber thoughe hee commaunded v flee company menne affirme coulde pray rightly speaketh comparison signifying rather seeke secreate place desire company men shoulde see v praying conuenient faithfull drawe themselues companye menne may freely powre desire sigh god secreate place also profitable cause mindes maye bee rather sequestred free allurementes therefore christe himselfe often hide himselfe secreate place might pray matter entreated place reprooueth desire vaine glorye summe whether man pray alone whether pray others yet must haue affection secreat chamber witnesse onely god vvhen christ sayth shall haue reward praiers declareth sufficiētly reward soeuer scripture diuers place doeth promisse v paied dette free gifte 7 vse muche babling reprehendeth fault praier namely much babling vseth two wordes sense battologia signifieth superfluous vnsauerie repetition p • lul • gia vaine babling christ reprooueth also foolishnesse might perswade entreate god powre oute many woordes diligence praying often commended scripture contrary doctrine prayer conceiued earnest affection tounge doeth runne minde also fauour god obtained vaine heape woordes godly heart doeth rather sende oute affection arrowes shall pearce heauens yet superstition heere condēned thinke pleasure god doe seruice longe murmured praiers errour wee see poperie infected greatest force prayer supposed consist many wordes mo wordes manne hathe muttered effectually accounted haue prayed also doe daily resounde church long tedious song though would allure god eares 8 father knoweth one remedye sufficient purge take away superstition heere condemned whence commeth foolishnesse men thinke haue profited muche weary god muche babling imagine like mortal man hath nede taught admonished soeuer perswaded god hath care v knoweth also oure necessity noteth oure desire care admonished vseth many woordes thinketh sufficient make prayer expedient exercise faith acknowledgeth thinge absurde laughed deale god rethorically hee bowed copye woordes god aske doth know haue neede seemeth vaine pray owne accorde ready helpe v purpose v adde oure prayer whiche breake willing course prouidence answeare easie considering ende prayer faithfull doe praye admonished god thing knew exhorted hym doe duetie stirred vppe one negligent slowe rather might stirre vp themselues seeke exercise faith meditating promisses might ease themselues discharging care bosome lastly might testifie well themselues others alone hope aske soeuer good▪ frely vnasked determined geue v yet doeth promisse geue request vvherefore holden owne wil preuenteth prayer yet prayer obtaine aske sometime delayeth v longer time also sometime graunteth requestes shall shewed another place mathewe 6 marke luke 11 9 maner therfore pray ye father art heauen halowed thy name 10 thy kingdome come thy done earth heauen 11 geue v daye oure dailye breade 12 forgeue v oure dettes also forgeue detters 13 lead v
