vncertaine whether christ deliuered forme praier hys disciple twise latter semeth probable luke sayeth asked mathewe bringeth teachinge owne accorde yet mathew sayd gathereth together chiefe poyntes doctrine continued course reader may better perceiue summe meaning maye mathew omitteth occasion luke reporteth yet contend man matter lvke 1 iohn also taught iohn taught disciple priuate maner forme prayer iudge time required certaine thing amongst iewes corrupt whole religion decayed maruail fewe held right order prayer againe promised redemption hand necessary myndes faithful shuld prayer stirred vp hope desire iohn therefore might oute diuers place scripture gather praier might agreeable time moste according spirituall kingdom christ began reueale math 9 maner therefore pray whyche luke sayeth vvhen pray say yee yet christe commaundeth disciple pray conceiued wordes onely sheweth purpose referre request prayer therefore 6 petition comprehended whatsoeuer lawfull v aske god nothing profitable v doctrine principall exercise godlinesse yet making prayer conceiuing request sens doe faile man shall praye rightly whose mouth heart heauenly master guideth thys cause thys rule geuen according necessary frame prayer couette haue accounted lawful approued god sonne god sayde euen nowe prescribe vnto v woordes shoulde vse lawfull decline fourme set downe yet woulde praiers shoulde bee directed ordered leaste shoulde wander beyonde boundes vvhereby gather lawe prayer hee sette downe consisteth woordes matter thinges themselues sayde prayer consisteth sixe petition knowen first three hauinge regarde v haue onely respecte glorye god last three framed thinges whiche profitable saluation lawe deuided two table whereof first containeth dueties godlinesse charitie prayer christ commandeth v partly looke seeke glorye god partlye hee permitteth v prouide selues therefore lette v know well prepared prayer onely carefull selues owne commoditie doe first seeke glorye god preposterous onely haue care owne matter neglecte kingdome god preferred farre thinges father art heauen ofte prepare selues prayer must especially consider two thing partly may haue entraunce god partly wyth full perfecte trust maye repose selues vppon hym fatherly loue towardes v great power vvherefore lette v doubte god willingly embrace v ready heare prayer also willing hys owne accorde helpe v called name father therefore christe epythite doeth minister vnto v muche matter staie faith wee rest goodnesse god onely parte next clause hee commendeth v power scripture sayeth god heauen declareth thing vnder power world soeuer contained hys hand power spredde euery place thing ordained prouidence dauid sayeth psalme 2 4 dweller heauens shall laugh scorne also psal 115 3 god heauen hath done soeuer woulde god placed heauen shutte vppe therein rather considered sayde seconde booke chronicle seconde chapter sixte verse heauen heauens cannot containe hym maner speache exempting order creature warneth v ought base earthly thing enter mindes considered greater worlde nowe conceiue purpose christe namely beginning prayer woulde establish faith disciple goodnesse power god prayer shall want fruite excepte grounded vppon faith nowe sith fonde yea madde arrogancie cal god father grafted body christ acknowledged sonnes heereby gather maner prayer come god person mediatour halowed thy name heere doeth euidently appeare said first three petition care selues beinge regarded glory god sought separate saluation maiestie god deserueth preferred farre aboue al care good god doeth raigne glory geuen vnto man zealous enough god glory sorte forgetteth himselfe aduaunceth foorth himselfe seeke height also greate similitude likenesse betweene three petition halowing name god alwayes ioyned kingdome principall parte kingdome established may done soeuer doeth consider howe great coldnesse howe sluggish seeking chiefest thing whereof wee heere petition admonished graunte nothing superfluous vaine three thing heere required shoulde thus distinguished sanctifie name god nothinge else geue to▪ god honour whereof woorthy menne neuer speake thinke without great reuerence hindered prophaninge name either maiestie deminished menne doe lesse reuerence honour vse hee doeth deserue also glory whereby hee sanctified riseth dependeth men doe acknowledge wisedome mercy iustice power goodnesse god hath holinesse alwaies remaininge perfecte himselfe men partly obscure malice wickednesse partly desile pollute throughe theyr sacrilegious contempte therefore summe petition glory god maye shine worlde celebrated amongest men ought doth religion flourish best men account proceedeth god right laudable ful righteousnesse wisedome heereof commeth passe embrace woorde obedience faith satisfied rest hys desire woorkes faith yeelde woorde god iohn sayeth 3 33 subscription wherewith testifie god true euen incredulitie contempt word striketh moste grieuous contumely nowe see moste parte howe maliciously account god woorkes great libertie reprouing euery man taketh himselfe chastice anye v keepe stirre complaine murmure also doe breake oute open blasphemy except satisfie affection doe thinke hym liberall enoughe towardes v many doe ouerthwartly scornefully bable vnspeakeable prouidence secreate iudgements also holy name ofte taken grose iestinges short greatest parte worlde doeth prophane holinesse much lieth therfore maruaile require first may haue worlde reuerence deserueth thys small accounte god doeth make v hee commendeth v care seeke hys glorie 10 thy kingdome come thoughe greeke verbe bee sumple yet sence shall remayne perfecte reade compounde olde interpreter doeth translate first definition kingdome god considered sayde raigne amongest menne flesh brought vnder yoake haue bidden affection farewell doe willingly freely geue themselues bee ruled thys corruption nature affection many souldiours sathan whyche striue againste righteousnesse god hinder disturbe kingdom vvherefore thys petition desire lettes taken away wold bring al mortal menne vnder gouernment leade meditation heauenly life brought passe partly preaching woorde partly secreat power spirite gouerne men woorde naked voyce without inwarde woorking spirite added cannot pearce heartes necessary bothe bee ioyned together establishing kingdome god therefore pray god woulde exercise power well woorde spirite whole world may willingly submitte selfe vnto disorder confusion hindereth kingdome god neither thing ordained world hande gouerneth councelles affection hereby gather beginning kingdome god v destruction olde man denial selues might renewed life god also raigneth sort ouerthroweth enemy bringeth sathan head perforce vnder power vntill made footestole vvherefore summe petition god shoulde lighten world light worde breath spirit frame heart obedience righteousnesse would force bring order soeuer disordered vppon earth hee beginne kingdome pulling vnder lustes flesh nowe kingdom god encreaseth continually vnto ende world necessarie daily pray comming asmuch iniquitie remaineth world farre kingdome god full perfection requireth thy done althoughe god one simple respecte self yet proposed vnto v scripture two sortes sayde done pleased god hee perfourmeth secreate decree hys prouidence thoughe menne doe obstinately bend themselues wee commaunded praye heere hye may bee done maner creature may quietly wythout resistaunce obey hym doeth better appeare comparison hee hath aungelles ready commaundementes whereof called minister alwaies ready obey desire haue mennes mindes framed consent righteousnesse god may willingly bende whiche way soeuer hee becke godly wherein submitte selues god subscribe decree petition comprehendeth somewhat god abolishing resistance menne ceaseth stirre woulde make apt taught humble desire thing except please bee approoued yet question may mooued whether ought pray god whyche sayeth shall neuer ende worlde aunsweare nede sifte euery manne pray earth may bee framed obedience sufficeth v testifie petition soeuer see god hate sorowe wishe extinguished shoulde onely gouernour affection might offer selues wholely fulfill readinesse becommeth v 11 geue v day daily bread sayd seconde table part order prayer christ taught v mighte aptly teache first distinguish 2 table lawe first giueth charge righte worship god dueties charitie prayer first parte instructeth v seeke glory god part sheweth conuenient v aske selues yet also noted prayer conceiue owne saluation profit ought referred last ende lawfull v occupied care owne profite glory god alwayes haue first place therfore oft pray must neuer tourne eye marke line yet difference betwene two sortes partes prayer sette downe speake kingdome god halowing name behooueth v lift vp sens high hauing regarde selues attend vpon god alone descend selues ioyne care saluation former petition whiche belong god alone althoughe forgiuenesse sinnes bee preferred foode euen muche soule excelleth body yet christ beginneth breade sustentation thys earthly life beginning might lead higher therfore doe desire haue daily breade reconciliation god though esteeme corrupt foode belly eternall saluation soule mindes doe ascend earth heauen steppe god vouchsaueth imploie himselfe nourishe body bee doubted muche carefull spirituall foode therfore louing kindenesse doeth raise vppe faith higher many doe take greeke worde signifying bread substantiall supernaturall altogether absurde reason erasmus bringeth onely friuolous also contrary godlinesse semeth probable appeare sight god christe commaund v speake nourishment thoughe like bee founde oute diuers place scripture taste present goodes may ledde hope heauenly thing nay iust triall faith aske nothing god onely acknowledge onely fountaine al good thing also feele fatherly goodnesse stretched euen least thinges hee refuseth take care euen flesh christe speaketh heere corporall foode may firste bee gathered heereof otherwise shoulde bee maimed full perfecte prayer commaunded many place cast care bosome god hee promiseth liberally hee wyll faile v nothyng therefore exacte rule right prayer necessary somewhat commaunded innumerable necessity present life also thys woorde day signifieth aske heere god neede care day bee douted meaning restraine moderate couetousnesse earthly foode whereunto immoderately caried also sufficiently knowen figure synecdoche vsed thys woorde breade vnder hebrewes doe comprehend kinde nourishment vsed heere largely doe onely desire haue foode geuen v hande god also would geue v soeuer necessary passe life sence cleare first commaunded pray god would defende nourish world life hath geuen v needeth many helpes hee woulde geue v soeuer hee knoweth necessary nowe loue god floweth continually feede v breade giueth called daily continually comming may interpreated therefore woorde signifieth muche hee hadde sayd lord sith life hathe daily neede newe nourishment thou neuer wearie bestowing daily vppon v aduerbe day vsed sayde brydle greedie couetousnesse myght learne continually depende vppon goodnesse god content wyth measure whiche hee bestoweth vppon v day day say question mooued sith certayne christe gaue thys generall rule prayer godly number riche menne whych haue muche layed vppe store howe hee commaundeth aske haue home aske day whyche haue aboundaunce serue yeare aunsweare easie warned wordes heape store prouision ought worth▪ excepte god doe daily feede v thoughe wheate wine thynges doe abounde excepte bee watered wyth secreate blessinge god shall presently vanishe away vse shall taken away power whych ingrafted feede v shall fall away aboundaunce wee shall bee hunger starued vvherefore meruaile christe doeth generally call riche poore thys heauenly nourishment manne shall pray heartely hee hathe learned example hunger abound hee canne beare hys neede wante patiently become drunke deceitfull hope aboundaunce manne demaunde aske haue breade geuen v nowe doe call accounte owne aunsweare called due v righte appoynted vse fatherly goodnesse god sorte made heauenly father doeth geue v freely least wante supplied vvee must till fieldes endeuoure gather fruites earth euery manne must applie himselfe beare laboure calling hee may gette liuing yet letteth wee fedde free goodnesse god without whiche menne shoulde waste away themselues laboure vayne therfore taught acknowledge receiued thence whatsoeuer seemeth gotte industrie yet woorde also gathered desire fedde god must abstaine none child god ofte vse maner prayer testifie desire nothing may rightly call owne 11 forgeue v debtes behooueth v remember sayde euen nowe christe placing requestes regarded firste last order sith wrytten foure fourtie chapiter isai two twentie verse fiftie nine second verse lam 3 44 sinnes wal hinder v comming god cloude whereby eye hindered beholding v necessary praiers alwaies beginne forgeuenesse sinnes wee heereby firste emboldened pray god hee mercifull vnto v hee cannot bee otherwise appeased towardes v forgeuinge sinnes freely christ comprehendeth two petition thinges appertaine eternall saluation spiritual life soule two principall partes couenaunt god whole saluation consisteth hee offereth free reconciliation imputing sinnes vnto v promiseth spirite whiche engraueth righteousnesse lawe heartes therefore commaunded aske first make request obtaining forgiuenesse sinnes mathewe calleth sinnes debtes guiltinesse binde v iudgement seate god make v debters nay wholly estraunge v god hope obtaining peace fauour forgeuenesse fulfilled paule teacheth romanes 3 23 guiltie depriued glory god though righteousnesse god doeth partly shine saincts yet long cloathed flesh remaine laden sinnes none founde pure whiche needeth mercy god whereof desire partaker necessary feele owne miserie imagine haue suche perfection thys worlde free sinne faulte doe muche forsake sinne doe christe himselfe whose churche exclude themselues whereas hee commaundeth disciple flee daily forgiuenesse sinnes hee wipeth himselfe number hys disciple thinketh remeady superfluous nowe remission desire haue bestowed vppon v ouerthroweth satisfaction world endeuoureth redeme selfe withall creditour sayde forgeue whiche hauing receiued paiment doeth require hee willingly freely leauing owne right acquitteth debtour neither hathe common distinction faulte punishment place heere douted dettes doe signifie deseruing punishment forgeuen v freely recompences must needes vanish away neither luke meaning anye thoughe hee nameth sinnes god doeth otherwise pardon takinge awaye guiltinesse wee forgiue clause therefore added least man shoulde presume come god aske forgeuenesse except free voide hatred yet pardonne desire geuen v doeth depende perfourme others christe maner forgeue offence also better confirme hope oure forgeuenesse wyth seale neyther clause luke hath signifieth anye thyng contrary purpose christe note cause onely admonish v minde oughte beare towardes brother desire reconciled god certainly spirite god doeth raigne heartes euill desire reuenge must cease sith spirite witnesse oure adoption see heere simplie set downe note whereby child god maye discerned straungers heere called detters money duetie endaungered v iniuries offered v 13 leade v temptation petition hathe bene corruptly deuided two matter selfe appeareth one conioyning woordes doeth shew coniunction aduersatiue placed middest ioyneth two clause together whiche augustine doeth also wisely consider therefore sentence ought thus taken least caried temptation deliuer v euill summe acknowledging owne weakenesse doe desire defended power god may stande strongly againste attempt sathan former petition haue shewed manne accounted christian except hee acknowledge himselfe sinner thys wee gather wee haue power selues liue well god doeth geue vnto v soeuer vanquishing temptation doeth require healpe god graunteth hymselfe haue suche neede deliuerer otherwise ouerthrowen woorde temptation often taken generally euery triall whiche sence sayde abraham tempted god whē faith tried tried aduersities also wyth prosperity occasion affection whiche lay hidde doe come lighte heere noted inward temptation whiche may bee aptly called scourge deuill stirre vp concupiscence absurde aske god hee shoulde deliuer v instruction faith therefore wicked motion stirre v vppe sinne comprehended vnder thys woorde temptation though cannot shall feele prickes mindes throughe whole course life wee haue continuall warre wyth flesh yet aske lorde make v subiecte temptation suffer v ouerwhelmed christe mighte better declare howe apte wee slide daily falles ruines excepte god sustaine v wyth hande hee vsed maner speache leade v temptation others translate carie v certaine euery manne tempted hys owne concupiscence iames teacheth first chapiter fourteene verse god doeth onely deliuer v pleasure sathan hee mighte kindle sire concupiscence vseth hym minister wrathe ofte hee driue menne headlonge destruction hee also maner leadeth menne destruction sence sayde euill spirite god came vpon saule diuers place scripture tende purpose yet may call god authoure euill deliuering menne reprobate sence hee doeth exercise vniust tyrannie executeth iust iudgementes though secreate deliuer v euill euill thys place may well bee taken neuter gender masculine chrysostome referreth deuill framer euilles deadly ennemie saluation doeth daily assaulte v yet may conueniently taken sinne neede strise aboute matter sense remaineth almoste one cast foorth deuill sinne excepte lorde doeth defende deliuer v thine kingdome maruaile latines omitte thys conclusion prayer onely added stirre vppe heartes require glorie god admonish v oughte bee ende prayer also may teache v praiers heere taught v oughte bee grounded vppon god alone least shoulde stay vppon owne merites mathewe 6 marke 11 luke 14 forgeue men trespass heauenly father also forgiue 15 yee doe forgiue menne trespass father forgeue trespass 25 yee shall stande pray forgiue yee haue thing againste manne father also heauē may forgiue trespass 16 wil forgiue father heauen pardon trespass christ doeth heere onely sette downe purpose clause added forgiue v forgiue say god bee otherwise entreated v shewe selues ready forgiue shall hurt v certainly except harder yron exhortation shuld mollify v might ready forgeue offence except god doe daily forgiue v diuers offence know shall pearish many wayes promiseth v forgiuenesse condition except pardonne brother soeuer haue faulted v therefore doe willingly set purpose mindes addicte themselues destruction doe diligence prouoke god anger whiche forgette iniuries offered done vnto mathewe 6 marke luke 16 moreouer yee fast looke sowre hypocrite disfigure face might seeme vnto men fast verely say vnto haue rewarde 17 thou fastest anoynte thine heade wash thy face 18 thou seeme vnto men fast vnto thy father secreate thy father seeth secreat reward thee openly hee retourneth againe former doctrine hee hadde begonne reprehende vaine ostentation almes prayer hee sette downe lawfull rule praying nowe concerning fasting hee giueth commaundement disciple gaue prayer almes least wyth greater diligence seeke please worlde haue god witnesse woorkes also hee commaundeth annoynt heade washe face hyperbolically spoken christe doeth drawe v one kinde hypocrisie might lead v therefore hee doeth commaunde v faine daintinesse neither doeth exhorte v temperate diet hee might nourish delicacie oyntments apparelling doeth simplie exhort v kepe moderation wherein shoulde bee nothing either straunge affectate shoulde haue sayde must apply selues fasting chaunge nothing accustomed maner life hee promiseth frō god reward fasting improper maner speach sayde little prayer thoughe greate difference betweene prayer fasting prayer almes chief amongst dueties charitie fasting selfe woorke indifferente sorte whych god requireth approoueth almes pleaseth onely referred ende may exercise v abstinencie may tame wantonnesse flesh may stirre v vp inflame v prayer may testimony repentāce oft vrged iudgemēt god therfore meaning christes word god wil sōtime declare opēly good woorkes doe please seemed lost men sawe mathewe 6 marke luke 12 19 laye vppe treasure selues vppon earth moth canker corrupte theeues digge steale 20 lay vppe treasure selues heauen neither moth canker corrupteth theeues neither digge steale 21 treasure wil heart also 33 sell haue giue almes make bagges waxe olde treasure neuer faile heauen theefe cōmeth neyther moth corrupteth 34 treasure heart also 19 lay vppe deadly plague raigneth euery world menne become madde insatiable desire hauing christe reprooueth foolishnesse felicitie sette richesse gathered greate care made subiecte woormes canker layed foorth spoyle theeues contrary reason lay vppe goodes whereas eyther may pearish themselues stolen away menne couetous menne thinke thus shutte vppe richesse chestes well locked yet cannot auoide richesse shalbe subiecte theeues mothes therefore blinde lacke right sence bestowe muche labour paine gathering richesse whiche subiecte eyther rottennesse stealthes thousande suche casualty especially sith god doeth allowe v place heauen lay vp treasure doeth louingly call v possesse richesse doe neuer pearish sayde lay vp treasure heauen whiche beinge loosed oute snare worlde doe employ care study meditation heauenly life luke setteth downe antithesis noteth occasion christe commaunded prepare sackes doe waxe olde hee hadde sayde sell thing possesse may geue almes nowe harde sharpe menne spoyle themselues owne goodes ease trouble proposeth large liberall hope recompence whiche healpe neede brother vppon earth doe lay vppe treasure themselues heauen according saying salomon hee geueth poore lendeth lord commaundement hee geueth selling possession precisely bee vrged though lawfull christian keepe thing himselfe onely teache must geue poore sorte thing superfluous bestowed landes may spared reuenewes whyche haue hande suffice necessitie poore shoulde haue sayde lette liberalitie extende selfe euen diminishing patrimonie alienation landes 21 vvhere treasure sentence christe conuinceth proueth miserable menne haue treasure laid vp vppon earth felicitie corrupt vanishing couetous menne say nothing lesse hindered may haue heart heauen christ opposeth generall rule whersoeuer men doe faigne chiefe felicitie thyther bound tied followeth hereeof renounce heauen desire happy world vve know diligently phylosophers disputed chiefe felicitie yea traueiled point without cause sith thereuppon dependeth whole course framing man lyfe sens haue regarde honour bee adiudged chiefe felicitie necessarye ambition shoulde whollye possesse mindes menne money couetousnesse shall presently obtaine kingdome pleasure cannot men degenerate beastlye wantonnesse naturally enclined desire chiefe good commeth passe false imagination doe cary v hither thither rightlye certeinelye perswaded felicitie heauen easie ascend clime heauen treading world vnder feete despysing earthly goodes whose deceitfull bayghtes doe bewitch moste parte men maner paule hee would lift faithfull vp high exhort study heauenly life proposeth christ vnto onely perfecte felicitie sought shoulde haue sayde absurd vnworthy thing mindes shoulde bee setled vppon earth whose treasure heauen matth 6 mark luke 11 22 light bodye eye thine eie single thy whole bodye shall light 23 thine eye bee wicked thy body shall darke vvherefore light thee darkenesse great darknes 24 manne serue two master either shal hate one loue • ther else shal lean one despise yee cannot serue god rich 34 lyght bodye eye therefore thine eye single thy whole body light thin eye euill thy body darke 35 take heede therefore light thee bee darkenesse 36 therefore thy whole bodye shall light hauing parte darke shall light euen candle doth light thee brightnesse luke 16 13 seruaunte serue two maisters eyther hee shall hate one loue el hee shall leane one despise yee cannot serue god rich 22 light body eye remembred whiche first giue warning short sentēces gathered togeather continuall sermon also summe meaning sentence menne slouth go astray bend themselues becommeth right purpose whereof cō meth passe men filthily doe wander slide fall corrupt iudgement rather satisfie owne pleasure iustice god onely choake light reason ought gouerne life wholy turne darkenesse christ vseth similitude calling eie light whole body haue said menne walke neither handes feete belly direct gouerne way onely eye sufficeth guide member therefore handes feete rashly caried whither meete fault imputed eye duetie similitude bee applyed mind al affection certeine member haue neede direction beecause blinde themselues god vseth reason may bring order excel candle shewing way vse doe part namely vprightnesse mind giuen doe willingly corrupt peruerte remaineth one spark light calleth simple eye couered webbe blemished blearednes troubled faulte hee taketh poneron faultie light bodye lightened deed rightlye ordered called darke confusedly caryed diuers errours therfore wee see haue sayde slouth men reproued wordes neglect opening eye mindes gouernment affection friuolous papistes doe hereof gather men excell reason wisdome haue free election good euill christ doth declare place power haue becometh v walke may directed certeine purpose hee teacheth course man life therefore darke beecause manne proposeth himselfe right end menne doe nourishe themselues follow euil greedily graunt nature reason grafted men whereby might discerne betweene vice vertues say corrupted sinne fayleth euery steppe yet followeth menne doe willingly thruste themselues darkenesse cloased eye fledde profered light witting willing folow lustes 23 light thee hee calleth reason light litle soeuer left remaining menne fall adam hee calleth darkenesse grosse beastly affection meaning therefore meruaile menne doe filthyly beastly wallow selues myre sinnes seeing reason whiche might gouerne blinde darke pleasure fleshe saieth light turned darkenesse onely menne doe suffer iudgement minde ouerwhelmed wicked lustes fleshe yeelding witte peruerse thoughtes degenerate beastes wee see malitiouslye menne doc turne wisdome giuen craft subtiltie myght seeke deepe thoughtes saith prophet esai 29 15 throughe subtill shiftes might proudlye ryse vppe god bee shorte diuerse wayes attempt wise destruction vvherefore christ doth without cause pronounce cannot horrible thicke darkenesse shall reigne lyfe menne set purpose doe make themselues blinde meaning wordes luke christe doth ioine sentence expounded fifte chapter matthew man lighteth candle setteth secret place c also steede clause light thee darkenesse c setteth downe exhortation take heede lighte thee darkenesse haue saide take heede least thy minde shine light direction thy action doe darken peruert thy whole lyfe hee addeth body lightened eye member shalbe better gouerned euen light lighted shineth pearseth al part chamber 24 man serue christ returneth former doctrine may withdraw disciple couetousnesse said heart man bound tyed treasure hee telleth heart alienated lord addict themselues rich greater part men sport themselues vnder false pretence doe imagine canne deuide themselues betweene god couetous desire christe denieth possible man one time obey god fleshe without doubt prouerbe commonly vsed man serue two maisters therfore receiued opinion taketh graunted doth apply present cause rich reigne gouernment takē god impossible rich men serue god whosoeuer deliuereth himselfe serue rich necessary hee set himselfe free seruice god couetousnesse doth alwayes make v bondslaues deuill haue ioyned texte luke set downe place euangelistes doe occasion serueth set downe doctrin christe sentence diuerse place neede think much apply together especiallye sayd rich may well extended kinde vice vvhen god doth euery commend much sinceritie doth abhorre double heart deceaued thinke hee content one halfe heart confesse worde god cannot truely worshipped entyre whole affection indeede deny endeuor recōcile thing contrary themselues ambitious man saith wil cease serue god though apply good part witte hunte honor couetous voluptuous gluttenous leacherous cruell euery one doe boast themselues though possible serue god parte openly seene purpose fight true faythfull selues neuer wholly addicted obey god ofte withdrawne sinfull lustes flesh sigh vnder miserable slauerie displeased themselues doe otherwise serue flesh vnwillingly resistance accounted serue two maisters study endeuours approued lorde yeelded perfecte obedience vnto hypocrisie reprooued flatter themselues theyr sinnes coulde ioyne light darkenesse togeather matth 6 mark luke 12 25 therefore saye vnto carefull lyfe yee shall eate yee shall drinke yet body shall put lyfe worthy meat body rayment 26 behold sowles heauen sowe neither reape cary barnes yet heauenly father feedeth yee much better 27 vvhich taking care able adde one cubit stature 28 whye care yee rayment learne lylyes fielde grow labour neither spinne 29 yet say vnto euen salomon glory arayed lik one 30 vvherefore god cloath grasse fielde day morow cast ouen shall hee doe much vnto ye litle faith 22 spake vnto disciple therefore say vnto take thought life yee shal eate neither body shal put 23 life meat body raiment 24 consider rauens neither sow repe neither haue store house barne yet god feedeth muche yee better fowles 25 whiche taking thought canne adde one cubit statute 26 yee able least thing take ye thought remnant 27 consider lylyes howe grow labour neyther spinn • yet say vnto solomon himselfe royaltie cloathed like one 28 god cloath grasse day fielde morow cast ouen much wil hee cloath yee litle fath sermon christe doth reprehend excessiue care meat cloathing wherewith menne doe vexe torment themselues hee giueth also remedie heale disease hee forbiddeth carefull ought taken precisely hee would haue carelesse know men borne condition sustaine care yea laste portion misery lorde hath enioyned v punishment hee might humble v condemneth immoderate care two cause menne doe waste torment themselues therewith vaine taking meete calling wil beare take vppon themselues meete vsing industrie neglect call vppon god promisse beholden psal 127 2 vvhen vnfaithfull doe lye downe late shall ryse early shall eate bread sorowe faythfull shall grace god enioy rest sleepe therefore sonnes god though free labour care yet cannot properly sayde carefull lyfe reposing themselues prouidence god doe quietly take rest hereby may easily gathered much euery man ought care theyr lyuing namely euery one v labour asmuch callinge doth beare lorde dooth appoynte necessitie shoulde prouoke euery man call vppon god suche care meane betweene slouthfull securitie excessiue tormentes wherewith vnfaithfull doe waste themselues wee doe weigh wordes christ wel doth forbid v euery care groweth distrust carefull saith yee eate drinke propertie tremble feare pouertie want want prouision euery moment 25 life worth hee reasoneth lesse forbidden care much lyfe may maynetained addeth reason lord gaue lyfe selfe suffer thinges wanting apperteine sustaining certeinely doe god smal iniurie oft distrust god giue v foode cloathing though cast v vppon earth fortune whosoeuer certeinely perswaded knoweth estate condition life let man doubt hee verye well prouide necessity therefore oft feare carefulnes prouision shall assaulte v let v remember god hath care life hath giuen v 26 beholde fowles remedie whiche spake might learne rest vppon prouidence god infidelitie mother excessiue care therefore onely meanes amend couetousnesse wee embrace promisses god wherein witnesseth himselfe hath care v maner apostle minding draw faithfull couetousnesse confirmeth doctrine heb 13 5 written fail thee neither forsake thee therfore summe exhorteth v trust god neglecteth none creature though bee meanest diligently noted hee saith heauenly father nourysheth fowles although wondred sustaine life yet many v doe thinke life doth depende god doth vouchsafe extende prouidence euen throughly fixed mindes god doth hand minister nourishment fowles hope maye easier created image accounted amongste child vvhen saieth fowles doe sow mowe hee doth wordes perswade v slouth idlenesse onelye meaneth though helpes cease yet prouidence god shall sufficient aboundantly bestoweth vppon beast soeuer needefull luke fowles nameth rauens alludinge peraduenture place psal 147 9 giueth foode young rauens cal vppon him▪ thinke dauid especially speake rauens first olde one haue forsaken necessitie fed god hereby appeareth christes wil none might teache caste theyr care vpon god 27 vvhich taking thought christe heere condemneth faulte almost alwayes ioyned immoderate care prouision mortall man taking vpon lawefull doubteth sacrilegious boldnesse passe bound know saith ieremy 10 23 way manne himselfe neither man walk direct step scarse hundred man found dareth promise himselfe thinge owne industrie power heereby commeth passe god regarded doe doubt attempte anye thing whiche chalenge themselues prosperous successe thinges christe hee might brydle madde boldnesse dooth say whatsoeuer pertaineth sustentation lyfe dependeth onely blessing god asmuch haue sayde menne fondly weary themselues labour superfluous vaine care doe come effect god blesseth plainely expressed luke christ addeth cannot doe least ye carefull remnant wordes sufficiently appeareth hee reprooueth onelye dystruste pride men doe challenge witte meete salomon glory sense goodnesse god whiche shineth hearbes flower doth excell whatsoeuer menne doe rich power meanes faithfull may account shall want nothing perfect lentie although outwarde meanes wanting blessing god may flourish yee litle faith christ dooth without cause beehalfe blame want weakenesse faith care haue according grosnesse witte much doth infidelitie bewray selfe except thinges fall desire therfore many great matter seeme endued least indifferent faith yet doe faint daunger pouertie matth 6 mark luke 12 31 therefore take thought saying shall wee eate shall drinke wherewith shall wee clothed 32 thinges seeke gentile heauenly father knoweth ye haue need al thing 33 seeke yee first kingdome god righteousnes thinges shal ministred vnto 34 care morow morow shal care self day hath ynough griefe 29 therefore aske yee shall eate ye shall drinke neither stand doubt 30 al suche thinges people world seeke father knoweth yee haue neede thing 31 rather seeke yee kingdome god thinges shalbe ministred vnto 32 feare litle stocke father pleasure giue kingdome hath purpose former doctrine faithful trusting fatherly care god hoping haue thing soeuer think necessary shoulde torment themselues extreame carefulnes forbiddeth carefull seeke luke reporteth manner whiche seeke without respect god onely ought bend themselues neither doe rest time see aboundance encrease attribute god gouernment world sweat vexe themselues cōtinual disquietnes vvhen saith gentile seeke thing vpbraideth grosse folly whence al care spring whereof commeth passe vnbeleeuers doe neuer rest quiet state imagine god ydle sleepeth heauen least looketh vppon thinges appertaine vnto men vpon hath taken charge feedeth houshold comparison hee declareth haue profited ill doe yet vnderstand firse rudiment godlines doe looke eies fayth hand god secretely filled aboundaunce good thinges might patiently quiet mindes thence looke sustentation heauēly father saith knoweth need thing hee shuld haue said al careful foode doe giue honour fatherly goodnes god secrete prouidence vnfaithful doe lv 29 stand doubt clause answereth last sentēce set downe matthew bee carefull morowe christ reproueth fault men bending prouide themselues would gladly imbrace fiue world worde luke vseth doth properly signifie looke aloft wee doe commonlye say make long discourse intemperature fleshe hath neuer enough would turne ouer heauen earth hundred time hereof cōmeth passe yt giue place god prouidēce therfore vnder title reprehended much curiositie carefulnes procure selues trouble without profit doe become willingly wretch time matthewe saieth daye hath enough owne griefe appertayneth purpose faythfull shoulde temper theyr care least desire prouide beyond boundes vocation sayde euerye care condemned whiche wandereth throughe ouerthwarte vnmeasurable compass beeyonde boundes mat 33 first seeke kingdome god brydeleth great care foode argument reprooueth grosse slouthfull neglecte soule hath heauenly life therefore christ teacheth v preposterous menne borne better life doe wholly occupy themselues earthly thinges whosoeuer shall esteeme kingdom god best wil exercise himselfe prouiding lyuing moderatelye neyther thing sitter bridle wantonnesse flesh triumph course present life meditation heauenlye life word righteousnesse may well referred god kingdome know yt kingdom god consisteth righteousnes spirituall newnesse lyfe vvhen saieth thinges shalbe ministred hee meaneth thinges belonge present life placed second place ought set vnder kingdome god lv 32 feare litle flocke vvith sentence christ confirmeth hope whereunto hee exhorteth disciple god deny vile corruptible meate hath adopted heires kingdome purposely calleth name litle flock least therefore think themselues lesse account god fewnesse nothing accounted world word vseth signifieth eternall lyfe doth flow vnto v fountaine free mercy purpose also appertaineth word giuing christe witnesseth openly god hath giuen v kingdome cause pleaseth heereby manifest obtained desertes workes therfore oft lord raiseth v vp hope eternall lyfe must remember wee maye feare want dayly foode matth 7 marke 4 luke 6 1 iudge yee iudged 2 iudgment yee iudge yee shall iudged measure yee meate shalbe measured againe 3 seest thou meate thy brother eie perceiuest beam thine eye 4 sayst thou thy brother suffer cast • thine eye behold beame thine eye 5 hypocrite firste caste beame thine owne eye shalt thou see clerelye cast meate thy brother eye 24 vvith measure ye meate shal measured vnto 37 iudge yee shal iudged condemne ye shal condemned forgiue yee shall forgiuen 38 giue shal giuen vnto good measure pressed downe shaken togeather running ouer shal men giue bosom measure yee meate shal men meate againe 41 seest thou moa • thy brother eye considerest beame thine owne eye 42 eyther howe canste thou say thy brother brother let pull moat thine eye thou seest beame thine eie hypocrite cast beame thine owne eie first 〈◊〉 shalt thou see perfectly pull moat thy brother eye 1 iudge christe dooth word preciselye restraine iudgeing heale disease whiche settled almost see al menne doe flatter spare themselues euery man seuere censor others certaine sweetenesse sinne almost man ytcheth desire enquire men faultes menne doe confesse mischief intolerable spare themselues owne sinnes malitious brother time • past prophane men also condemne many prouerbes yet continued age also remaineth day nay added plague worse parte condemning others seeke get themselues libertie sinning wicked delyght biting carping slaundering doth christ refraine hee saith iudge neither ought faithful blind shoulde discerne nothing bridle themselues desirous iudge meete cannot bee otherwise whosoeuer desireth iudge brother shuld extreame rygorous like sentence iames bee manye maisters yet doth restraine withdraw faithfull executing office teaching forbiddeth desire honour ambitiously therefore iudge doth signifie much enquire curiously men deedes first disease doth alwayes drawe sinne condemn euery light offence though grieuous faulte breaketh peruerse boldnes doe proudly iudge ill euery matter although may taken good parte see purpose christes counsel tendeth desirous ouerthwart malitious el curious iudging neghbours iudgeth word law lorde directeth iudgement according rule charitie dooth alwayes begin iudgement himselfe doth obserue right manner order iudging whereby appeareth howe wickedlye abuse testimonie moderation christe setteth downe vnder pretence desire take away difference good euil onely lawfull v condemne reproue sinnes also necessary except wil wrangle god himselfe abrogate lawes cut iudgements ouerthrow throane iudgment wil declare iudgment pronounceth deedes menne wee must onely retaine modesty mey remaine onely lawgiuer iudge least iudged denounceth punishment againste rygorous censor much desire sift faultes others shall come passe shall bee nothinge gentler entreated others shall finde extremitie exercised againste themselues haue executed againste others nothing deare precious v name nothing sharpe bitter condemned subiect reproach infamie menne owne faulte wee procure selues owne nature doe much abhorre hee amongst many doth search narrowly mennes deedes conuenient whiche dealeth hardlyer light offence dooth ouerthwartly improue selfe indifferent el doe dilygence prouoke god reuenger v hee againe maye repay like v though done iuste vengeaunce god punished haue iudged others yet lord doth execute punishment menne iudgement chrisostome others referre life come wrested iesaias 33 1 threatneth shall spoyled whiche haue spoyled others christ meaneth shall wante reuengers whiche shall punishe wicked slaunderous menne lyke poison rigor menne cease escape punishmente world haue bene desirously bent condemne brethrē yet shall escape iudgment god luke sette downe promisse forgiue yee shall bee forgiuen giue shall bee giuen vnto meaning whereof lorde bring passe hee sheweth himselfe louing gentle right towardes brother shall feele gentlenesse others towardes himselfe hee shall bee handled gentlye friendlye others often falleth child god recompensed moste vniuste rewarde oppressed many vniust slaunders haue hurte mannes name haue spared faultes brother dooth disagree sentence christe wee knowe promisses apperteine present lyfe perpetuall without exception also though lorde suffereth innocency child bee oppressed almoste ouerwhelmed yet withall hee fulfilleth hee speaketh place vprightnesse shall shine morning blessinge alwayes exceedeth vniuste slaunders hee maketh faythfull subiecte vniuste reproach length hee maye shewe forth goodnesse theyr cause furthermore faythfull one howesoeuer desire execute whiche ryght towardes theyr brother yet beecause sometyme caryed extreame rigour againste brother whiche either innocent much bee blamed prouoke owne faulte lyke iudgement themselues though may imputed vnthankefulnesse worlde doe receiue measure pressed downe running ouer yet certeinelye muste parte impute vnto themselues beecause manne hath lyberally nourished brother hee ought 3 vvhy seest thou moate hee dooth expresly reproue faulte hypocrite doe commonlye commit quicke sighted discerning mennes faultes doe onlye amplifie seuerely almost tragically cast offence behynde el wise making seeme lesse euen moste grosse offence desire seeme excusable therefore christ reproueth offence curious searching groweth want charitie wee scrupulouslye searche sinnes brother sparing flatterie wherewith couer nourish sinnes mat 7 6 giue yee holye dogges neither caste yee pearles swine least tread vnder feete turning againe ren • e cause often rehearse matthew setteth downe manye shorte sentenses read one text depending vppon doctrine doth depend vppon went altogeather matter christ admonisheth apostle person preacher gospell shoulde preserue keepe treasure heauenly wisdome onely sonnes god throw forth vnworthy prophane contēners god aryseth question afterwarde hee commaundeth preach gospell euery creature paule saieth 2 corinthian 2 16 preaching reprobate sauour death nothing certeine god commaundeth daylye bee proposed testimonie vnfaythfull might therby made inexcusable answere minister gospel called office teaching cannot discerne betweene child god swine partes offer doctrine saluation generally al although first shall see many stubborne vnapte bee taught yet charitie dooth suffer v presentlye accounte castawayes loste considered christe calleth dogges hoges menne wicked voyde feare god without true godlynes certein token doe shew stubborne contempt god disease may appeare incurable place christe opposeth dogges electe people god housholde faith saith good take childrens bread giue vnto dog vnderstandeth dogges swine corrupted wicked cō tempt god wil admit abide medicine heereby appeareth wickedly wrest word christ think restraineth doctrin gospel whiche apte taught wel prepared shuld done godly teacher shoulde call manne nowe obedience preuenteth grace god nature wee rather wicked bente stubbornesse vvherfore remedie saluation denied none doe filthily refuse offered vnto may appeare reprobate damned selues paule speaketh heretikes tit 3 11 two cause christe forbadde gospell proposed desperate contemners manifest profanation misteries god wee submitte reproachfull skornes wicked christe also minded comfort disciple cease beestowe labour teaching gospell electe god though see ouerthwartly refused wicked prophane menne haue sayde least incomparable treasure shuld waxe vile account swine dogges dryuen title noted wherewith adorneth doctrine saluation christ calleth holye thing compareth pearles heereby gather much wee ought esteeme least tread vnder feete christe seemeth make difference betweene swine dogges attributing beastly dulnesse swine madnesse dogges certeinely experience teacheth two sortes contemners god example sake whatsoeuer spoken scripture corruption man nature free iustification eternall election many turne either carelesnesse wantonnesse flesh aptly worthily accounted swine others rend doctrine minister sacriligious raylinges though shoulde ouerthrow desire wel feare god care saluation therefore though christ doth name signifie vncurable enemy ye word god yet two similitude brieflye sheweth doe differ others matth 7 marke luke 11 7 aske shal bee giuen seeke yee shall finde knock shall bee opened vnto 8 whosoeuer asketh receiueth seeketh findeth knocketh shal opened▪ 9 man among sonne aske breade would giue stone 10 hee aske fish hee giue serpent 11 yee euill canne giue child good giftes howe much shal father heauē giue good thinges aske 5 sayde vnto whiche shall haue friend shall goe midnight say friend lend three leaues 6 friend mine come way haue nothing set 7 hee within aunsweare say trouble dore nowe sh •• te child mee bedde cannot rise giue thee 8 say vnto though hee would arise giue friend yet doubtlesse importunitie would rise giue many hee needed 9 say vnto aske shalbe giuen seeke yee shall finde knocke shall bee opened 10 euerye one asketh receyueth hee seeketh findeth knocketh shalbe opened 11 sonne shall aske breade anye father hee giue stone hee aske fish wil giue serpent 12 hee aske egge hee giue scorpion 13 yee euil canne giue good giftes vnto child howe muche shall heauenlye father giue holye ghoste desire 7 aske exhortation prayer exercise godlines haue especiall care flowe slouthfull christ vrgeth matter speaking three maner wayes speach vaine saith aske seeke knock applyeth himselfe stirre vp slouthfulnesse least doctrin waxe colde purpose also beelonge promisses added yee shall finde shall bee giuen shalbe opened nothing shall better encourage v pray certeine assuraunce obtaining cannot shuld pray diligently doubt yea prayer without fayth vaine sporting ceremonie christe therefore might effectually stirre v vp parte duetie doth onely commaund v ought promiseth prayer vaine diligentlye noted first might know lawe prayer appoynted prescribed vnto v might certeinely perswaded god mercifull v wil heare desire oft prepare selues prayer oft feele wee earnest enogh desire pray remember louing bidding wherein christe testifieth vnto v god fatherly affection shall come passe euery v enioying grace christ may boldlye pray freely call vpon god paule teacheth ephes 3 12 beecause ready distrust meete christe repeateth promise diuerse wordes might also reproue faulte hee vseth metaphor seeking wee thinke thinges wee haue neede farre v knocking fancy flesh imagine thinges shutte vp v haue ready hand 8 whosoeuer asketh receiueth thinke prouerbe gathered common trade lyfe yet doe willingly encline contrary parte christ offereth fauour father pray af hee haue saide god willing ready heare v pray great rich layd vp v yt aske word declareth suffer iust punishment slouthfulnesse wanting thinges necessary doe seeke remedie want certeine often faithfull doe sleepe god waketh saluation may preuent requestes nothing wretched great weakenes rather slouthfulnesse waite prayer hee shoulde looke vppon v much carelesnesse v nay perswaded ot • er himselfe giue v fayth preuent praiers order time christe speaketh heere disciple hee dooth onely teach heauenly father would make v partaker giftes therefore although doth giue v thinges freely yet might exercise faith hee commaundeth v pray might graunt requestes thinges come owne goodnes 9 vvhat man among comparison lesse greater first christ opposeth malice men great goodnesse god selfe loue maketh v malitious euery man much addicted himselfe hee despiseth neglecteth others fatherly loue ouercommeth faulte menne forgettinge themselues doe lyberally bestow vppon child whence proceedeth god fatherlynesse descendeth eph 3 15 powreth portion goodnesse heartes fewe droppes loue manne doe much preuaile doe well hoped sea selfe whiche canne neuer drawne drye god himselfe bee strait doth open heartes menne yet heere must bee considered sayinge iesaias 49 15 although mother forgette child yet lorde lyke himselfe alwayes shew himselfe father 1 • good giftes christe purpose vse wordes leaste faythfull prayer shoulde lose raines much fond euill desire vve know intemperate presumptuous fleshe behalfe nothing aske god excepte hee yeeld folly frette fume christ therefore maketh requestes subiect god shuld giue vnto v thing hee knoweth profitable v vvherefore let v thinke hee hath care v ofte graunteth requestes iudge conuenient v affection blinde rule prayer must taken word god neither meete iudge weigh • ie matter therefore whosoeuer desireth come god faithfull prayer let learne bridle heart hee aske thing according iames teacheth 4 3 epistle luke laste clause good gift placeth holy ghost excluding benefites shewing especially desired ought alwayes minde seeke first kingdom god thinges shal thē ministred vnto vvherfore behoueth child god ende might prepare themselues rightlye prayer put earthly affection ascend meditation spiritual life shal come passe shal make lesse account meat cloath seale pledge adoption god shall giue precious treasure deny others lesse lv 5 vvhich shall haue friend luke addeth similitude whereof matt maketh mention meaninge cause faithful shuld faint heartes presentlye obtaine desire seeme harde obtayned doe desire importunitie demaunding doth wreste men woulde willingly doe cause shoulde doubt god wilbe entreated v wee constantly continue prayer mindes either delay difficultie waxe weary matth 7 mark luke 6 12 therefore whatsoeuer yee would men shoulde doe euen doe yee law prophetes 13 enter streight gate wide gate broad waye leadeth destruction many go thereat 14 gate streight way narrow leadeth vnto life finde 31 yee would men doe doe ye vaine shew dependeth former sith often shorte sentenses clause doe abounde sayde beefore matthew doth reporte one onelye sermon christes diuerse sermon hee gathereth summe doctrine therefore sentence read selfe wherein christ instructeth disciple equitie setteth downe shorte easie definition wee might know many contention doe reigne world men hurt one many way cause wittingly willingly tread equitie vnder feete yet euery one would haue streightly obserued towards vvhere standeth vpon profit none v cannot distinctly subtilly declare right therfore sith al mē shew thēselues ready teacher righteousnes cōmoditie commeth passe knowledg ready whē either profit losse men cōmeth questiō onely wise selues man prouideth neighbour onely malitiously set purpose close eye rule equitie shineth heartes therefore christ teacheth euery man may rule vnto himselfe iust vpright dealing towardes neighbour would perfourme others requireth done vnto himselfe confuteth vaine pretense menne imagine couer counterfeit owne vnrighteousnesse without doubte perfecte equitie reigne amongst v faithfull working may speak disciple charitie ready teacher haue others doe v law prophetes christ doth meane one poynt doctrine onely deliuered law prophetes whatsoeuer commaunded concerning charitie lawes exhortation set downe maintenaunce righteousnesse referred purpose meaning therefore hee satisfieth second table hee shew himselfe sort others desireth others shew themselues haue saide neede long tedious disputation simplicitie maintained menne preposterous loue themselues blot equitie engrauen heartes 13 enter strait gate nothing flesh doctrine christ man shall time well profitte learneth gather owne sens affection narrow straite may keepe themselues within straites heauenlye maister brideleth wantonnesse menne doe willingly • latter themselues leape runne order therefore christe dooth admonish disciple shoulde prepare themselues strait thorny iourney hard restraine lustes vnbrideled wandring folly mittigateth bitternesse comfortable reward hee saieth narrow gate way enter life againe least caught baightes lycentious dissolute life wee shoulde wander whither pleasure flesh doth draw v saieth doe runne headlong death hadde rather goe wide way broad gate goe straites lead life saith expresly many runne wide way men doe ouer throw one peruerse euil example whereof commeth passe menne doe wittingly willinglye without care caste themselues headlong doe thinke shall perishe perishe great companye side small number faithfull dooth make many carelesse hardlye brought renounce worlde frame selues liues maners fewe wee thinke absurd thing pull v multitude wee parte mannekinde though doctrine christe dooth holde v bondmenne bringeth lyfe streight way seperateth v multitude ioineth v companion yet straightnes ought hinderaunce vnto v wee shoulde anye whitte lesse striue life doeth sufficiently appeare luke christe sayde time hee vttered paradox blessed life haue sene deliuered order praier haue touched oft thing set downe euangelistes according order hystorie gathered together mathewe one summe myght better appeare howe christ instructed disciple therefore thought meete adde place luke agreeth matter shall diligently admonish reader course time luke obserueth hope graunt pardonne gathering doctrine curious mathewe mathewe marke luke 13 23 sayd one vnto lord 〈◊〉 shalbe saued sayd vnto 24 striue enter straighte gate many say vnto seeke enter shall able 23 sayde although mathew rehearseth answeare christ one texte sentence spoken people yet thinke occasion geuen speake present question furthermore occasion mooued question shoulde bee asked semeth christ professed author life could scarce gather disciple might seme condēne whole church smal company men excepted outwardly whole people regarded doctrine christ refused altogither seemed bee adopted god heires life oftentimes doe doute ofte beholde ouerthwart estate world vvhat meaneth thys greater parte foloweth way contrary disagreeing gospel therfore christ speaking exhorteth striue enter straighte gate woordes christ meant drawe disciple foolish curiositie hindereth staieth many looke aboute whether doe ioyne themselues though woulde bee saued great companie commaundeth striue endeuour hee meaneth cannot come euerlasting life wythout great many difficulty therefore lette faithfull rather bestowe studie vppon curious multitude go astray 24 many seeke enter thys therefore added least deceiued wyth vaine hope many companion shoulde helpe v flesh gladde • latter selfe many doe promisse themselues easie way life meane season doe please themselues wyth euery thing others againe deceiue others sleepe wicked securitie christ might shake delightes disciple affirmeth shalbe excluded promisse vnto themselues certaine possession life mathewe marke luke 13 25 vvhen good man • ouse risen vp hath shutte doore ye begin stande without knocke doore saying lorde lorde open v shall answeare say vnto know whence 26 shall yee beginne say wee haue eaten drunke thy presence thou hast taught streetes 27 shall say tell knowe whence depart yee woorkers iniquitie 28 shall weepinge gnashinge teethe ye shall see abraham isaac iacob prophet kingdom god selues thrust doores 29 shall come many east vvest north south shall sit table kingdome god 30 beholde laste whiche shall first first shalbe last 25 vvhen goodman house risen although thing spoken another time sayd euen nowe yet rather haue respecte doctrine time small helpe vnderstanding may red together one text agree together one sence christ affirmed gate opened many desired enter heauen nowe sayeth shal profit nothing although occupy place church god shall length rise iudgement maye exclude kingdome vsurpe place amongest housholde vseth similitude housholder vnderstoode wicked wanton seruauntes steale night leaue house open theeues himselfe ariseth locketh gate lette wandering nighte straying men season wander high wayes wordes admonisheth v take occasion offred long lord calleth v vnto haue gate sette open v heauen greater part doth vouchsafe stirre foote therefore christ pronounceth gate shall length bee shut shalbe danger shut waite companie 26 thou hast taught streetes christ expresly excepteth shall pro • itte iewes nothing came neare vnto familiarly offereth himselfe shoulde enioy except aunsweare day called doeth prosecute similitude speaking housholder hee doeth plainly without figure declare himselfe bee iudge doeth agree vnto himselfe thou hast taught streetes iewes shoulde negligence lose saluation might obtaine •• vvhen yee shall see abraham vvhen iewes nothing like vnto holy father yet woulde vainly bragge stocke neyther thing vsuall amongest abuse title churche christe testifieth degenerate people departed faith godlinesse father estranged kingdome god heerein contained secreate reproofe desire haue companion seeking saluation rather endeuour adioyne themselues abraham prophettes holy father seeke equal example fallen farre innumerable corruption shoulde haue sayde doe nowe neglecte enter straighte gate multitude goe astray doeth come behinde doe see howe seperated company faithfull doe linke selues company vnfaithfull sight worlde doeth nowe blinde eye slouthfulnesse shalbe taken last day late shall knowe like straungers kingdom god haue thing common abraham 29 shall come east amplification gathered heereof iewes reiected thought themselues lawfull heires god gentile shoulde bee sette place may receiue life promised abraham stocke hee opposeth gentile might pricke forward godly iealousie faith euen paule romanes 11 14 wryreth shoulde ornament ministerie hee mighte prouoke owne countrey flesh suche emulation necessary iewes shoulde pricked pleasing themselues muche proudly contemne god giftes mathewe hath sentence againe little doe nowe touche sparingly 30 beholde last christ vseth woordes oftentimes wee shall see diuers sence place hee meaneth nothing else ouerthrowe vaine confidence iewes worlde forsaken chosen god placed dignitie imagined god bounde thys cause christ telleth thē lot shalbe shortly altered gentile bringeth foorth good euill manne euill treasure heart bringeth foorth euill abundance heart mouth speaketh 15 beware christ teacheth woordes church subiect diuers deceit therefore woulde daungerous least many fall faith except bent thēselues take hede vve know ready men vanitie doe onely nature desire deceiued al men seeme wise deceiue selues sathan also woonderfull craftes man deceiuing ceaseth lay snare wherein may entangle simple vnwarie • ewe hope shoulde haue pleasant estate vnder kingdome christ free al trouble vexation therfore admonisheth disciple desire stand fast shoulde prepare themselues auoide subtile sleight sathan wil lord haue already sayd exercise church continuall warfare worlde vvherefore may continue disciple vnto ende sufficeth onely taught submit selues gouerned worde shall daily assaulted sathan necessary faith armed resist chiefest thing suffer selues gouerned good faithfull minister christ contrary side doe arise false teacher except doe watche diligently armed constancie shall easily led flocke purpose also pertaineth saying christ iohn 10 3 sheepe doe heare voice shepheard heare stranger flee vvhereby also gather cause faithfull shuld discouraged mindes troubled wolues doe breake folde christ false prophet endeuour false doctrine ouerthrowe pure faith christ ought rather stirred vp sette diligent watch christ doeth vaine bidde v beware wherefore owne slouthfulnes doth circumuēt v shal easily escape al deceit certainly without hope bolde couragious take hede vvhen know lord wold haue deceiued v inuasions sathan lette v goe forwarde without feare asking spirite discretion sealeth beleefe truth heart would reueale deceit suttleties sathan least deceiued vvhen christ sayeth come shepes clothing inwardly rauening wolues hee meaneth wante faire pretence doe wisedome • ift throughly 16 fruites note difference bene added authoritie teacher might without exception haue come question deadly daunger feared teacher meanes auoide necessitie suspected better remeady men shutte eares see prophane menne pretend daunger might without punishment reiecte kinde doctrine weake also rude doe stande doubt christ therefore least gospell syncere faithfull minister loose reuerence due commandeth iudge false prophet fruites vvherefore papist foolish corrupt might stirre vppe enuie v doe precisely cast foorth sentence christe beware false prophet outcry make simple knowing cause rashly abhorre v necessary soeuer desireth obey councell christe iudge wisely discretely doe onely willingly confesse false prophet taken heede also diligētly earnestly exhort simple shoulde beware onely admonish according rule christ doe first certainly knowe least simple doe beare punishment rashnesse refusing pure woorde god great difference betweene carefull heede taking preposterous loathing papist doe wickedly abrogate commaundement christe casting foorth false feare driue miserable soules searching therefore let first considered feare doe refuse flee doctrine whiche knowe doe therein wickedly make small accounte commaundement christe remaineth seene fruit christ noteth iudgement deceiued restraine life triall vncertaine moste wicked deceiuers doe imitate moste fained holinesse also pretende knowe showes moste straight life graunt hypocrisie shall length reuealed nothing hard coūterfeit vertue christ woulde submit doctrine vnrighteous base iudgement measured life men therfore vnder fruites comprehendeth maner teaching chief therby christ prooueth sent god seeketh hys owne glory father sent iohn 7 18 obiect fewe haue capacitie geuen iudge good fruit euil aunsweare sayde euen nowe faithfull neede shall neuer wante spirite discretion distrust themselues bidde owne vnderstanding farewel giue themselues wholy gouerned meane let v remember doctrine brought tried worde god therefore ruled analogie faith iudging false prophet must considered god enioyneth prophetes minister woorde thereby may faithfulnesse easily discerned example sake propose vnto v thing paule requireth bishop onely description shal suffice condemne whole dunghill poperie popish sacrificer seeme diligence sette vppe follow calling men gather prouerbes commonly vsed receiued consent men doth christ prooue man deceiued false prophet wil willingly blinde fruit openly make triall faithful seruaunts god false labourer presently addeth euill tree bring f • orth causall worde seemeth ioyne two sentence together certaine luke sixt chapter rehearseth diuers sermon christ may also doeth briefly touch mathew setteth downe fully neither doe rest vppon causall aduerbe whiche oftentimes place superfluous may also appear clause luke cōcludeth speach good manne good treasure heart neither doe doubt christ doeth plainly sette downe maner iudgement thys commaundeth fruit faithfull shoulde diligently examine fruite bring foorth worlde whiche professe themselues seruaunts god hee shoulde haue sayde title doe smally auaile vntill hee speaketh shall prooue deede sent god yet deny place may bee applied generall doctrine certainely last clause namely aboundance heart mouth speaketh doeth reache false prophetes seeing common aprouerbe doe obiecte mennes tongue doe often lie speake best woorst affectionate answeare christ doeth teache simply moste commonly vsed althoughe hypocrite doe pretende one deceitfully thruste themselues yet haue affection godlinesse although doctrine comprehendeth hypocrite degree place soeuer yet doeth properly touche false teacher whiche seeme excell aboue others neither doeth direct speache alone hee mighte waken securitie wherin lie drunken menne also admonisheth faithfull geue suche disguised people meete summe hee foretelleth assoone doctrine gospell shall beginne bring foorth fruite shall haue many disciple shall many onely common sorte shall falsly hypocritically geue name gospell also amongst pastours shall falshoode shal denie deedes life professe mouth therfore soeuer desireth accounted amongest disciple must doe diligence hee may sincerely heart addicte himselfe meditate newnesse life luke generall reproofe cal ye maister maister corruption doth moste parte spring dissembling teacher doeth easily spreade whole body therfore mathew christ doth namely inueighe doe father doeth onely signifie philosophically frame life maners rule vertues hauing authoritie • scribe 47 vvho soeuer cōmeth heareth word doth wil shew hee like 48 hee like man built house digged deepe laide foūdatiō rock water arose floud beat vpon house coulde shake grounded vpon rocke 49 heareth doeth like man built house vpon earth without foundation againste flud beat fel fall house great 24 vvho soeuer moste parte harde discerne true professours gospell counterfeit christ apt similitude sheweth wherein differ proposeth two house whereof one built without foundation good foundation shew outward appearance bothe first beaten winde stormes shaken flouds doeth presently fall latter shall stande fast vpon sure foundation violence christ therfore compareth vaine windie profession gospell beautifull sound building thoughe sette vppe shewe yet ready fall euery moment lacked foundation therefore paul cōmandeth v wel throughly groūded christ haue deepe rootes least wee bee caried away euery blaste summe purpose true godlinesse cannot bee discerned counterfaite holinesse vntil examination trial come temptation wherwith tried like floudes stormes doe easily beate downe vnstable mindes whose lightnesse perceiued calme quiet time heareth wordes relatiue doth note one kinde doctrine whole summe doctrine gospell except deepely fixed mindes hee sayeth like vnto wall whych builte highe strengthened foundation therefore muche shoulde haue sayd deede true faith taketh deepe rootes heart resteth vppon earnest constant zeale vppon foundation yeeldeth temptation vanitie man vnderstanding dig pearse inwardly euen denial themselues doe build vpon sande 25 vvhen iesus ended wordes vnderstande well sermone descended mountaine rest hys doctrine nowe vttered people therefore meaning hee diuers place geuen taste doctrine people ama • ed certain new • wildernesse prai • 1 vvhen hee come downe mountaine nowe mathewe retourneth hystorie sayd christ ascended mountaine gathered one heape many poyntes doctrine christe addeth preached mounte hee healed certaine leper marke luke doe reporte hystorie thoughe doe sette downe time also godheade christe shewed muche onely woorde touching hande presently cured man leprosie though leprosie hadde beene kinde disease called elephantiasi • yet appeareth plainly harde cured continued long time rare exāple haue man healed wee graunt phisitions coulde knowledge arte haue holpe yet appeared thys myracle helpe man 2 hee came woorshipped vvhat verbe doeth signifie translate worship may easily gathered place two euangelistes doe helpe v well interpretation whiche marke sayeth kneeled downe luke sayeth hee fell vpon face therefore gesture kneeling leper shewed signe reuerence knowe iewes commonly vse worshipping people east much bent ceremony vvherfore many thinke leper thought worship christe diuine worshippe onely salute honourably excellent prophet lorde doe dispute affection hee worshipped christ attributed see hee coulde make cleane woulde woordes hee witnesseth acknowledged diuine power christe christ answeareth sheweth hee hathe attributed manne proper manne necessary shoulde greate power shoulde restore menne health whether leaper beleeued christe sonne god hee hadde power giuen moses prophet yet hee doubteth hath hand power gift healing speaketh vnder condition thou wilt thou canst contrary assurance faith god requireth prayer neither ought men hope god promiseth leper assured either oracle promise god christe woulde doe therefore hee shoulde haue done rashly hee hadde passed beyonde boundes whereas reade sometimes pray simplie bee vnderstoode singular motion holden rule yet knowe whether one speaking properly may say leper conceiued praier sayth perswaded power christ hee doubteth coulde heale leprosie offreth himselfe healed yet vncertaine successe christ yet knowen vnto 3 putting foorth hande hee touched touching leper time lawe contagious puritie christe whiche swaloweth vppe vncleannesse pollution doth neither desile himselfe touching leper neither doth transgresse lawe hee taking vppon flesh doeth onely vouchsafe v touchinge hande tooke vppon one body wyth v might flesh flesh neither doeth onely reach arme v descendeth heauen euen helles yet notwithstanding hee thing blotted thereby remaining perfecte hee tooke away filthinesse hath washed v hys holinesse wyth woorde alone hee able heale leper also touched wyth hande witnesse mercifull affection marueile seeinge hee woulde take vppon fleshe hee might purge v sinnes wherefore reaching hande signe token great fauour goodnesse certainly whiche wee doe carelesly passe colde reading bee well considered wythout great woonder sonne god farre abhorringe speake leper hee reached hand also touche vncleannesse 4 iesus sayde vnto might excuse leper thinke hee earnestly forbidden christe hee shoulde publishe myracle rather vsed pricke forwarde yet others better iudgement whiche thinke cause forbidding time appoynted yet come graunt myracle ought haue bene suppressed certaine reason lorde would haue fame spred soone least vttered leper therefore iudge leper preposterous zeale farre deseruing praise rather condemned obey commaundement hee woulde haue bene thankefull healed hym hee coulde otherwise haue done better obedience wyth god preferred al sacrifice 1 sam 15 22 beginning chiefe lawfull worshippe therfore example taught wickedly maintaine vnaduised zeale applie themselues seruice god encrease number rebelles hys commaundement shewe thy selfe priest ceremony lawe yet abrogated christe woulde shoulde contemned pretermitted nowe god lawe hadde commaunded reported fourteenth chapiter leuiticus seconde verse manne cleansed leprosie hee offer himselfe priest sacrifice thankes giuinge ende priest iudgement approoue benefite god also hee healed shoulde shewe testimonie thankefulnesse christe therefore sending leper priest doeth declare hee hadde purpose hee might sette foorth glorie god shewing referred triall gifte token thankes giuing priestes shoulde iudge grace god might bee euident vndoubted leper shoulde acknowledge hee healed god yet sayde euen nowe hee commaundeth keepe rite prescribed lawe vnto time abrogation papistes without reason place gather lawe confession allegorically call sinne leprosie sacrificer pope consecrateth iudges spiritual leprosie graunt power geuen priestes lawe people might know cleannesse iudgement depende vppon priesthoode yet popish sacrificer wickedly take vnto themselues honour euer geuen priestes law doth christe nowe chalenge himselfe alone therefore onely knoweth iudgeth spirituall leprosie hee onely worthy cleansed offer gift purgation therfore vnder lawe cleansing sealed offering sacrifice menne otherwise cleansed shedding bloud therefore geue right god hathe assigned owne sonne moste hainous sacriledge christe commaunded minister gospell declare vnto sinner made cleane whiche papistes doe imagine appertaine fained iurisdiction wreasted might descerne leprosie marke 44 witnesse vnto take testimonie lawe statute sayd hundreth two twentie psalme fourth verse god gaue testimonie israel yet semeth mee colde doubt pronowne them▪ hath relation priestes therefore iudgement christe hadde respecte circumstaunce present matter thys myracle shoulde moste euident proofe conuince vnthankefulnesse neither lette christ commaunded leper holde peace remembraunce myracle buried euer therfore commaundement christ leper came priest sight witnesse vnto inexcusable woulde embrace christe minister god also occasion speaking euill taken away christe omitte poynte lawe summe ben incurable might haue ben brought christe solempne witnesse god effectual enough condemning vnbeleeuers 45 iesus coulde heereby gather christe would myracle shoulde soone haue bene vttered might meanes haue hadde libertie teache ennemies rose vppe againste whiche sought stoppe mouthe importunitie people great desiring myracles hee hadde time doctrine haue menne bent woorde signes therefore luke sayeth hee dwelt desartes auoided resort menne sawe hee coulde satisfie desire people except ouerwhelme doctrine aboundance signes mathewe 8 marke luke 7 5 vvhen iesus entred capernaum came vnto centurion beseeching 6 saide maister seruaunt lieth sicke home palsie grieuously pained 7 iesus sayde vnto come heale 8 centurion aunsweared saying maister worthy thou shouldest come vnder rouse speake woorde onely seruaunt shalbe healed 9 manne also vnder authoritie another haue souldiours vnder mee say • ne goe goeth another come commeth seruaunt doeth 10 vvhen iesus heard hee marueiled sayde folowed
