certaine centurion seruaunt sicke ready die deare vnto 3 heard iesus hee sent vnto elder iewes beseeching hee woulde come heale seruaunt 4 came iesus besought instantly saying hee woorthy shoulde doe thus 5 loueth sayde nation hath built v synagogue 6 iesus went nowe farre house centurion sent friendes saying lorde trouble thy selfe woorthy thou shouldest enter vnder roufe 7 vvherefore thought self worthy come vnto thee say woorde seruaunt shalbe hole 8 likewise manne sette vnder authoritie haue vnder souldiours say vnto one goe goeth come commeth seruant doeth 9 vvhen iesus heard thinges marueiled turned sayde people folowed say vnto haue sounde great faith israel 10 sent turned backe house founde seruaunt sicke hole 5 vvhen iesus entered thinke mathewe luke doe set downe two diuers hystories striue matter nothing onely diuersitie wordes mathew sayeth centurion came christ luke sayeth sent certaine iewes speake vnto name mathew doth without cause attribute vnto done request name two euangelistes agree circumstance follie imagine two myracles one also doubt companie souldiours centurion guided standing citie capernaum woont distribute legion defence city vvhen hee perceiued maners people wicked corrupt knowe capernaum citie neare sea side filled moe superstition others yet hindered countrey superstition condemned might haue taste true sincere godlinesse could builde synagogue iewes without enuie daunger neyther could loue nation embraced worship god alone therefore christe healed seruant himselfe healed lord wonderfull warriour passed sea band souldiours might accustome iewes beare yoke romaine tyrannie willingly submitte himselfe yelde obedience god israel luke sayeth seruant deare vnto meanes preuenteth dout might come reader mind know master seruants estimation except suche singular industrie faith vertue obtained fauour luke therefore declareth hee common vile bondman faithful seruaunt endued rare giftes great fauour maister cause hee great care life diligently commend appeareth euangelists sodaine palsie first put despaire life slow palsy without torment mathewe sayeth young man grieuously vexed luke sayeth hee neare vnto death saying preuaile set foorth glory myracle either sorowe paine great daunger dare say lesse certaintie maner disease lvke 5 hee loueth nation doubted iewes commende godlinesse coulde cause loue detested nation loue lawe woorshippe god building synagogue euidently declare hee fauoured doctrine lawe vvherefore say without cause hee woorthy haue christe shewe himselfe bountifull godly woorshipper god yet wondered entreatie shoulde obtaine fauour god gentile whiche themselues contemptuously refused christe bee minister dispenser gift god doe enioy grace themselues gette straungers suche securitie doeth alwaies raigne amongest hypocrite thinke make god sorte obedient vnto power make grace god subiect power wil beinge filled therewith rather doe vouchsafe taste thereof resigne vnto others thynge superfluous math 8 woorthy hee shoulde come vnder rouse mathewe shorter hee bringeth manne speaking thus himselfe luke expressing fully sayeth hee gaue commaundement friend meaning one two cipall poyntes sentence centurion sparing christe honour sake requireth christe shoulde wearie himselfe hee accounteth himselfe vnwoorthie comming hee attributeth great power hee beleeueth onely woorde canne restore seruaunt life woonderfull humilitie hee shoulde extol manne seruile captiue nation much aboue himselfe may accustomed pride iewes owne modestie hee take ill parte accounted prophane manne afraide iniurie prophete god hee shoulde bee compelled come manne gentile vncleane vvhat soeuer matter certaine hee speaketh heart hee esteemeth reuerently christe hee dareth call naye foloweth texte luke hee accounted himselfe vnwoorthie speache yet may bee demaunded reason perswaded highly extol christ whiche presently foloweth encreaseth doubt onely speake word childe shalbe healed knowen christ bee sonne god hadde beene superstition haue geuen glory god man scarce credible hee coulde bee rightly instructed godhead christe whiche yet vnknowen almoste also christe imputeth chargeth woordes ignoraunce declareth proceede faith reason enforced many interpreaters thinke centurion celebrateth christe true onely god thinke godly manne fully assured diuine woorkes christe simplie apprehended power god without doubte hee hadde also hearde somewhat promised redemer therefore thoughe hee vnderstode christe bee god manifested fleshe yet hee perswaded power god shewed suche gift giuen myracles hee shewed presence god hee doeth superstitiously ascribe vnto manne whiche proper god considering committed god christe beleeued woorde alone hee coulde heale seruaunt auy obiect nothing proper god word pleaseth mighty power wythout sacriledge bee giuen mortall manne againe easilye aunsweared althoughe centurion subtilly distinguish yet hee attribute thys power woorde mortal manne god whose minister hee certainely perswaded christe douted therefore christe hadde power healing hee acknowledging bee heauenly power doeth tie bodily presence satisfied woorde whence hee beleueth suche power proceedeth similitude whyche centurion vseth taken like say compareth lesse wyth greater hee accounteth diuine power whyche hee declareth bee christe power whyche hee himselfe hadde ouer seruaunts souldiours 10 iesus maruelled although cannot befal god maruaile ariseth thinges newe vnlooked yet maye befall christe hadde flesh taken vpon mannes affection nowe christ sayeth founde great faith euen israel spoken certaine respecte simplie consider poyntes faith faith marie heerein leaste excell beleeued childe holy ghost beare onely begotten sonne god acknowledged sonne borne wombe bee creatour maker onely redeemer worlde christ commended faith heathen manne faith al iewes two especiall cause namely little small taste doctrine hee brought forth great fruit sodeinly common highly extoll power god beganne shine certaine sparkes christ whereas iewes bent outwarde signes meete heathen man requireth visible signe sayeth onely worde satisfie christ comming hee needed hee mighte prooue faith vvherefore cause especially cōmendeth faith rested vppon worde onely vvhat would euen one apostle haue done come lorde see touche manne desireth neither corporal comming touching beleeueth great power included worde thereby hee doeth certainly looke healthe seruaunt hee geueth honour worde manne worde god sheweth christ priuate manne prophet sent god hereby may general rule gathered although god would saluation shoulde wrought flesh christe doeth daily seale sacramentes yet certaintie bee fetched worde except authoritie giuen worde beleeue soone god speaketh minister sinnes forgiuen v wee restored life hope saluation falleth away 11 many shall come east person seruaunt christ gaue taste first fruites grace gentile hee teacheth maister token calling gentile come spreading faith throughout al world hee teacheth shoulde come onely next border furthest coastes worlde though witnessed many prophesies prophetes yet first seemed absurde incredible iewes imagined god bounde stocke abraham vvherefore cannot bee hearde without admiration straungers shoulde bee housholde heires kingdome god onely couenaunt saluation shoulde presently bee published worlde might gathered one body churche gentile shoulde come faith shoulde sayeth made partaker saluation abraham isaac iacob heereby doe assuredly gather saluation whiche geuen vnto v thoroughe christe time past promised also father otherwise inheritaunce could common except faith one meanes obtaine worde sitting downe allusion table yet wee knowe heauenly lyfe needeth meate drinke speach signifieth much bene sayde shal enioy lyfe 12 child kingdome vvhy calleth hee child kingdome nothing lesse child abraham certeinely meete accounted flocke god straungers fayth answer although rightly church god yet occupy place church graunteth title noted couenaunt god force longe contiuued stocke abraham enheritaunce heauenlye kingdom properly belong least respect god himselfe yet holy braunches holye roote forsaking followed sheweth sufficientlye retained houshold god secondly bee noted christe speaketh perticuler men whole nation much harder calling gentile somewhat tollerable gentile shoulde grafted free adoption body abraham posteritie iewes thēselues shuld thrust gentile might succeed emptie roumth accounted wonderfull yet christ saith thinges come passe god would admit straungers bosome abraham would driue child outwarde darkenesse secrete antithesis god declareth kingdome kingdome light reigneth nothing darknes scripture doth metaphorically darknes signifie horryble griefe cannot expressed wordes life canne comprehended sense 13 goe thou belieuest heereby appeareth louingly christ powreth forth grace hee obtaineth vessell fayth opened although speaketh centurion wordes yet doubted calleth v hope well heereby also taught god part dealeth streightlye towardes v vnbeliefe restraineth lyberalitie therefore fayth wee open passage hee heare requestes spiritually faith namely addeth secrete power word pearceth euē dead soules euē saith ioh 5 25 houre commeth dead shall heare voice sonne god heare shal liue 16 came feare necessarye feeling presence god bring feare difference betweene feare vnbeleeuers godlye vnbeleeuers eyther astonyed feare afraid fome god godly religious touched reuerence willingly humble themselues therefore feare taken good parte yeelding honour power god beholde doe onely reuerence god also giue thanks say god visiteth people vnderstand euery visitation shuld wholy restore iewes onely fallen lay miserable vile slauerie god looked vpon onely hope remained god promised himselfe redeemer afflicted extreame misery therefore thinke myracle warned hope restitution hand deceiued maner visitation though al ready giue theyr name christ yet seuerall vice hindered righte course accordingly receiued diuerse aunsweares yet first might seeme absurde christ turne awaye receyue company offred presently without delay followe retaineth slowe ready asked time respite hee good reason vvhereof proceedeth readines scribe hee shoulde readily prepare himselfe waite vppon christe hee account hard streight condition folowers noted scribe accustomed quiet profitable life bene honour could haue borne reproches pouertie persecution crosse manne would followe christ dreameth soft pleasaunt waye lodginges filled good thinges christes disciple shoulde walke thornes continuall sorowes goe forward crosse therefore haste maketh vnreadier hee doth euen would goe warre vnder shadow dallyaunce without sweating duste without reach dartes meruaile haue refused christe doe rashly thrust themselues discouraged first brunt tried first skirmish take theyr feete doe filthily forsake place consider also scribe might seeke christ might fedde table freely daintily ydlenesse vvherefore let v vnderstand admonished rashlye careleslye intrude selues disciple christ accounting nothing crosse trouble let v rather consider hand condition remaineth v instruction enterteineth v schoole denying selues take vp crosse 20 fox haue hole sonne god declareth condition lyfe whilest hee conuersaunt vpon earth prescribeth disciple maner lyfe ought frame themselues yet merueile christ saith hath foote ground might lay head many kinde godly men would haue receiued house noted saide admonition sake leaste scrybe shoulde looke large fatte rewarde rich maister lord himselfe lyued entreatie mennes house 21 may bury father vvee haue sayde scribe refused companion christe rashly thrust selfe imagining haue profitable kinde life christ retaineth contrary faulte imperfection heard forsake father hindred hee woulde presently haue followed calling christ supposed old man saieth suffer may bury speach declareth much time left luke declareth commaunded christ folow matthew saith one disciple also refuseth calling craueth hee may haue libertie time go dutie father excuse signifieth much say free vntill father dead aunsweare christe vnderstand child must dutie parentes oft god calleth regarding giue chiefe place commaundements dueties men ought giue place ofte god commandeth diligence imployed vpon nowe euery man must see god requireth calling asketh tyed least earthly parentes hinder yeelding right due chief onely father men 22 let dead bury dead christ dooth wordes condemne duetie buriall filthy beastly cast body dead without buryall know right buriall delyuered god men vsed amongst saintes confirme hope last resurrection onelye teach whatsoeuer calleth v back hindereth v frō right course doth sauor nothing death haue saide alone doe liue apply endeuours part life obey god sitte world passe dutie god might yeelde themselues obedient men lyke dead men vaine vnprofitably imploy themselues caring dead lv 60 goe preach matthew saieth follow luke doth plainely declare end called namely hee minister preacher gospell shoulde haue bene left priuate lyfe bene necessitie leauing father fauour father fainte gospell preaching gospell suffered sitte home christe good cause draweth father wōderfull goodnesse christ appeareth would bestow honorable office vpon man yet weake worth labour note flattery dooth nourishe correcteth faulte yet stoocke fast vnto lv 61 saieth matthewe maketh mention third man appeareth tied world lybertie ready follow christ hee offereth himselfe followe christe exception hee hath bid housholde farewell hath set businesse order home vse prepare themselues goe forth depart cause christe doth sharpely reproue word hee professeth himselfe folower christe yet hee turneth backe towardes vntill done earthly businesse christ saieth fit kingdome god looke backe wee must diligently seeke meaneth hereby saide looke backe entangled care worlde doe seemeth hard think christ god knew faith lay hid within christ graunted faith benefit bestow vpon man sicke palsie acustomed bee demaunded place much men may holpen fayth men first certeine fayth haue faith owne whether straungers borne god child respect eternall saluation soule cannot holpe faith others meanes whereas praiers without fruit wherin aske god would cō uert vnbeleeuers repentance appeareth faith doth profit yet cannot saued vntill haue faith themselues well known whereas mutual consente faith saluation againe holpe others also without controuersie vnbeleeuers haue earthly benefites bestowed vpon thē godlies sake cōcerning present place though said chrst moued faith fo others yet sicke man could haue sinnes forgiuen except faith christ doth often giue health body vnworthy god doth dayly make sunne rise vpon good euill hee reconcileth v vnto meanes faith wherefore figure sinecdothe word christ behold faith thē bore sick man beheld also faith thy sinnes forgiuen thee christ wordes seemeth promisse man sick palsie sought whē would cure body beginneth take away cause disease also teacheth man sicke palsie came sicknes ought make prayer commonly men • 2 4 man warreth entangleth affaire life would please hath chosen soldiour dooth meane chosen soldiours doe diuorce wiues frō thē forsake child renounce house euer time abstaine house care nothing much referred multitude guestes plentie daintines meates know christ vsed austeritie hee suffered himselfe sometime daintily enterteined rich men yet gluttony secluded doubted hee singuler example temperaunce would exhort hostes moderat meane diet woulde neuer suffer prodigall excessiue daintyes matthew saieth sinner came menne wicked lyfe noted infamy came passe publican eschewe company suche beecause themselues commonlye hated infamous lytle correction doth make sinne ashamed much seuerity doth dryue despayre casting shame doe throwe themselues filthines offence gather tribute custome publycans saw themselues reiected prophane detestable menne common reproach despise reioysed company infamous sometime thrust thēselues amongst adulterer drunkard lyke whose wickednes would haue condemned woulde haue bene nothing like beene driuen necessitie open hatred reproach mat 11 vvhy eateth maister publycans scribe doe assault disciple christ may procure fal away lay forth first sight euill shamefull purpose became peculyer maister shuld withdraw themselues common people might lead holy life seemeth leadeth honest tollerable estate lyfe prophane lycentiousnesse might defile themselues filthy guestes reproach might haue dryuen disciple yet rude flexible forsake theyr maister doe well make complainte theyr maister themselues sufficientlye armed againste cauill christ aunswering confirmeth time come 12 hole nead christes aunsweare appeareth scribe offended two wayes made account office christ sparing owne faultes doe proudly despise vvhich thing must therfore noted disease hath alwayes beene common hypocrite full drounken windy hope owne righteousnesse doe accounte wherefore christ sent earth know great labyrinth mischiefes mankinde drowned horryble wrath curse god doth lye vpon men confused heap sinnes pressed downe commeth passe moued misery men doe neuer thinke vppon anye remedie pleasing thēselues wil abyde brought order think themselues vnworthy accounted amōgst sinner christe reproueth second errour aunswering whole nead physition figure hee teacheth therefore offended beholding sinner chaleng thē selues righteous saieth hee hole despise sicke loath sight troublesome vnto behoueth phisition farre otherwise sheweth must take vpon parte phisition sent father call sinner though christe beeginneth reprouing thē yet desire profit doctrine must especially holden hee setteth downe second place▪ namely comming might giue life dead might iustifie guiltie condemned hee might cleanse polluted defiled filthynesse hee might pull lost euen helles might cloth thē glory couered filthinesse hee might renew thē corrupte filthynesse sinnes prepare blessed immortalitie wee consider duetie ende comminge wee remember cause hee put vppon flesh shedde bloud became sacrifice death descended euen hell shall neuer seeme straunge vnto v vilest amongst menne euen couered dunghill sinnes gathered saluation hee seemeth thee vnworthy grace christe thou doost abhorre became christ sacrifice sinne accursed hee might reach hand accursed sinner wee beginne loath baptisme also holye supper dooth ioyne v company wicked menne companye shall seeme defile v blotte let v presently enter selues search owne sinnes without flattery examination shall bringe v passe wee gladly suffer selues washed fountaine moste vncleane wyll refuse righteousnesse whiche hee commonlye offreth wicked lyfe giuen dead saluation lost 13 goe yee learne hee sendeth away commaundeth departe seemed stubborn would learne sheweth contend god prophet pride become cruell grudge wretched holpen phisicke ministred sicke testimonie taken prophet osea 6 6 prophette preaching vengeaunce god iewes least take exception obserued outward worship god accustomed securitie bragge ceremony affirmeth god pleased sacrifice mindes voyde godlynesse manner estraunged integritie righteousnes god saieth hee haue sacrifice appeareth second clause bee spoken comparison knowledge god desired sacrifice word doth precisely reiecte sacrifice hee maketh lesse accounte godlynesse fayth yet wee must account fayth spirituall worshippe doe themselues please god charitie dueties men towardes neighbour required themselues sacrifice accidentes say estimation account wheras trueth self wanting thing haue entreated large vppon tenth chapter hebrewes word mercy figure synecdoche noted vnder one parte prophet comprehendeth duetie soeuer owe vnto brother came although spoken ouerthrow pride hypocrisie scribe yet generally containeth profitable doctrine wee admonished grace christe shall otherwise profit v grieued sinnes sighing vnder burthen doe humbly come vnto againe dryue despayre casting shame doe throwe themselues filthines offence gather tribute custome publycans saw themselues reiected prophane detestable menne common reproach despise reioysed company infamous sometime thrust thēselues amongst adulterer drunkard lyke whose wickednes would haue condemned woulde haue bene nothing like beene driuen necessitie open hatred reproach mat 11 vvhy eateth maister publycans scribe doe assault disciple christ may procure fal away lay forth first sight euill shamefull purpose became peculyer maister shuld withdraw themselues common people might lead holy life seemeth leadeth honest tollerable estate lyfe prophane lycentiousnesse might defile themselues filthy guestes reproach might haue dryuen disciple yet rude flexible forsake theyr maister doe well make complainte theyr maister themselues sufficientlye armed againste cauill christ aunswering confirmeth time come 12 hole nead christes aunsweare appeareth scribe offended two wayes made account office christ sparing owne faultes doe proudly despise vvhich thing must therfore noted disease hath alwayes beene common hypocrite full drounken windy hope owne righteousnesse doe accounte wherefore christ sent earth know great labyrinth mischiefes mankinde drowned horryble wrath curse god doth lye vpon men confused heap sinnes pressed downe commeth passe moued misery men doe neuer thinke vppon anye remedie pleasing thēselues wil abyde brought order think themselues vnworthy accounted amōgst sinner christe reproueth second errour aunswering whole nead physition figure hee teacheth therefore offended beholding sinner chaleng thē selues righteous saieth hee hole despise sicke loath sight troublesome vnto behoueth phisition farre otherwise sheweth must take vpon parte phisition sent father call sinner though christe beeginneth reprouing thē yet desire profit doctrine must especially holden hee setteth downe second place▪ namely comming might giue life dead might iustifie guiltie condemned hee might cleanse polluted defiled filthynesse hee might pull lost euen helles might cloth glory couered filthinesse hee might renew thē corrupte filthynesse sinnes prepare blessed immortalitie wee consider duetie ende comminge wee remember cause hee put vppon flesh shedde bloud became sacrifice death descended euen hell shall neuer seeme straunge vnto v vilest amongst menne euen couered dunghill sinnes gathered saluation hee seemeth thee vnworthy grace christe thou doost abhorre became christ sacrifice sinne accursed hee might reach hand accursed sinner wee beginne loath baptisme also holye supper dooth ioyne v company wicked menne companye shall seeme defile v blotte let v presently enter selues search owne sinnes without flattery examination shall bringe v passe wee gladly suffer selues washed fountaine moste vncleane wyll refuse righteousnesse whiche hee commonlye offreth wicked lyfe giuen dead saluation lost 13 goe yee learne hee sendeth away commaundeth departe seemed stubborn would learne sheweth contend god prophet pride become cruell grudge wretched holpen phisicke ministred sicke testimonie taken prophet osea 6 6 prophette preaching vengeauance god iewes least take exception obserued outward worship god accustomed securitie bragge ceremony affirmeth god pleased sacrifice mindes voyde godlynesse manner estraunged integritie righteousnes god saieth hee haue sacrifice appeareth second clause bee spoken comparison knowledge god desired sacrifices▪ word doth precisely reiecte sacrifice hee maketh lesse accounte godlynesse fayth yet wee must account fayth spirituall worshippe doe themselues please god charitie dueties men towardes neighbour required themselues sacrifice accidentes say estimation account wheras trueth self wanting thing haue entreated large vppon tenth chapter hebrewes word mercy figure synecdoche noted vnder one parte galla 4 3 9 doubt preferre first rudimentes farre beyonde chiefe perfection followeth frowardnesse pride mischiefe menne would gladly driue whole worlde followe theyr example thing please v wee doe presently desire passe law others liue according pleasure vvhē read heere disciple iohn taken snare sathan let v first learne holynesse consisteth thing outwarde indifferent also brydle v brydle moderation equitie least desire binde others follow pleasure let euery manne remaine owne lybertie thinke iohn exercised disciple certeine rule fasting prayer end ceteine appoynted dayes fasting worthily accounted amongste ceremony thinges indifferent obseruation whereof ought seuerely vrged nowe iohns discipline streight christes haue said shall haue conueniente place speake againe 15 child handle v hardly streightly anye tyme god giue v release sorow trouble must take heede become drunken delyghtes let v rather remember maryages shall last alwayes child bridegroome bride chamber vsed christe direction faith shee stacke garment rather shee woulde praiers offer self vnto healed peraduenture vnaduised zeale somewhat goe way especially sith sheweth shee attempted doubtfull wauering generally diligent office namely hee mighte publish doctrine saluation confirm myracles vve haue sayd place called gospel kingdome effecte meanes god doeth gather vnto himselfe people miserably dispearsed hee might raigne midst cause truely hath raised vp throne might endue full felicitie yet let v remember behooueth v become subiecte god wee may caried celestiall glory 36 compassion vpon hereby gather first sluggish priest placed whole lande might shewe foorth light heauenly doctrine become idle belly proudly boasted themselues chief bishoppes people small multitude gloried title yet christe acknowledgeth none pastours want found day poperie yet replenished pastorall title greate sinke heape leude companie vnder name cleargie doe deuoure vppe people though dumbe dogges yet ashamed arrogantly bragge hierarchie woorde christ heard sayeth pastours whereas labourer sheepe wandring dispearced gathered togither folde god doctrine gospell touched compassion prooueth himselfe faithfull minister father caring saluation people whose sake takē vpon flesh though receiued heauen hath affection whereunto hee subiecte mortall life yet casteth away care church hathe regard vnto wandering sheepe owne stocke cruelly putte flight scattered wolues 37 haruest great metaphore declareth many common sorte ready receiue gospell though greater number vnworthily vnthankefully refuse saluation offred yet compareth small number elect mixed amongst vnbeleeuers vnto plentifull haruest god esteemeth small company world beside though many intrude themselues yet doeth account amongst labourer behaue themselues faithfully taketh name labourer good part vvhen paule complaineth euill woorkers hath respecte vnto vaineglory boasting bestoweth title vpon apply labour onely destroying wasting vnder false pretence chalenge vnto selues pray lord haruest syncere fitte minister gospell thrust himselfe neither doe others rightly discharge office teaching raised lord spirite furnished giftes yee haue faith 41 feared exceedingly said one another wind sea obey 2 • came passe certaine day hee went ship disciple sayde vnto let v goe ouer vnto side lake lanched foorth 23 sailed fell sleepe came downe storme lake filled water ieoperdie 24 went aw • ke saying maister maister pearish hee aroase rebuked winde waues water ceased calme 25 hee sayde vnto faith feared wondered among themselues sayinge commaundeth bothe windes water obey shortly mention made lake wherinto sayde swine caried headlong al doe agree whether one lake doe confesse water genesara pleasant taste wholesome vsed strabo sayeth lake gadara noysome pestilent beast whiche dranke lost hooues haires therfore doubted two diuers lake space farre distant one without question place ought vnderstoode genesara christ passed ouer went gadarens called gergesens mathew diuersitie name gather two diuers hystories recorded woulde seeme subtile slippe grosse ignoraunce countrey gergesens also called gadarena famous citie called gadaris name chaunged hierome • time therefore hee calleth gerasens according custome receiued yet doe denie swine caried headlong deuilles lake gadara christe sayeth let v goe shoare cannot interpreate genesara nowe remaineth shoulde consider time whiche cannot gathered neither mathew luke onely marke noteth euening day christ spake preaching gospell vnder parable seede vvhereby appeareth obserue order time whiche luke doeth also euidently declare sayeth came passe vpon certaine day woordes sheweth muche busie himselfe first last 23 vvhen hee entred shippe marke sayeth shippes passe also christe disciple went vppe owne shippe luke doeth also rehearse woordes mathewe brieffer yet summe agree namely christe laide himselfe rest slept sodenly arose tempest first certaine tempest trouble lake came chance god would suffer owne sonne tost blind force windes meanes reueale apostle little weake faith yet thoughe christes sleepe naturall yet auailed vse disciple shoulde better knowe owne infirmitie say many doe christe fained himselfe sleepe hee might trie doe rather iudge hee slepte condition necessitie humane nature require yet godheade watch apostle ought haue feared haue presently bene conforted helpe prepared heauen therefore lette v knowe done secreat prouidence god christe slept storme arose waues couered shippe shippe hardly escaped drowning lette v learne heereby oft aduersitie doth arise faith tried lorde trouble doe encrease doe almoste ouerwhelme v purpose god exercise patience meanes hidden infirmitie might come light wee see waues couered apostle infirmitie reuealed hidde 25 maister saue v godly prayer seemeth could haue done better poynt lost seeke preseruation christe sith christ condemneth infidelitie wee must seeke wherein offended doubt stucke muche carnall presence maister appeareth marke doe simplie entreat expostulate matter maister carest thou pearish luke also noteth amased trembling maister maister wee pearish ought account godheade christe oppressed sleepe flesh haue fledde rest vntill extreeme daunger enforceth excessiue fear amaseth thinke cannot safe except waken christ cause hee accuseth infidelitie required hee woulde helpe rather testimonie faith trusted diuine power patiently without feare hadde hoped helpe required thus question aunsweared maye demaunded reproouing whether feare naught repugnant faith first doth simplie reprooue feare feareful marke also vseth suche phrase noteth feare beyond measure opposing faith feare sheweth speaketh excessiue feare whiche doeth much exercise faith shake rootes faith mindes thereby appeareth euery feare contrary saith feare nothing retchlesse securitie fleshe doeth oppresse v faith fainteth desire pray waxeth dull remembraunce god length extinguished touched feeling euilles rather blockish constant see feare stirreth vp faith selfe condemned vntill exceede measure herein excesse tranquillitie faith therby either troubled waxe faint ought rest vpon word god neuer falleth faithfull gouerne themselues faith kept vnshakē almost alwaies offend fearing requisite determine condemne shaking faith euery feare feare disturbeth peace conscience rest promisses god 26 rebuked windes mathew rehearseth also word christ wherwith speaketh sea commaundeth silent calme lake sens might shew power voyce doth pearce euen dumme element onely sea windes creature without sence doe obey commaundement god wicked also themselues theyr stubbornnesse god appease warlike tumult doeth alwaies mollifie cruell mindes men frame obey yet causeth weapon fall handes neuer madde fulfilled wrytten psal 46 9 maketh warres cease vnto end world breaketh bow cutteth speare sunder burneth chariotes fire 27 men meruailed marke luke seeme attribute apostle sayd christe reprooued adde cried feare yet rather applied others yet know christe lette v folowe bothe heerein doeth nowe appeare fruite myracle glory christe shewed foorth thinke apostle spake shalbe meaning woordes diuine power sufficiently prooued windes sea doe obey yet probable spake euangelistes doe teache wordes mind striken myracle reuerence christ certaine preparation faith math 8 marke 5 luke 8 howe hath compassion thee 20 departed beganne publishe decapolis greate thing iesus done vnto men maruell 26 sailed vnto region gadarens ouer galile 27 hee went land met certaine man city deuil long time ware cloathes neither aboade house graues 28 sawe iesus cried fel downe loud voice sayde haue doe wyth thee iesus sonne god high beseeche thee torment 29 hee commaunded foule spirite come man oft time hee hadde caught therefore hee bound chaines kept fetter brake band caried deuil wilderness 30 iesus asked hym saying thy name saide legion many deuils entred 31 besought him▪ wold command • go deepe 32 thereby herd swine feding hill deuils besought wold suffer enter suffered 33 went deuils manne entred swine heerd caried violence frō stepe downe place lake choked 34 vvhen herdmen sawe done slodde departed tolde citie countrey 35 came see done came iesus founde man deuilles departed sittinge feete iesus clothed right mind wer afraid 36 also saw told thē mean possessed deuill healed 37 whole multitude country gadarenes besought hym wold depart frō takē great feare went ship returned 38 man whome deuilles departed besought hee mighte iesus sent away saying 39 return thine house shewe greate thing god hath vnto thee hee went way preached throughoute citie great thinges iesus hadde done vnto haue confuted error thinke mark luke report myracle three euangelists doe note region galile luke also declareth circumstance doe agree beleeue thinges fell diuers time 28 met two possessed deuils difference caused interpreter erre separate mathewe two nameth two one augustine coniecture probable thinketh ther two yet made mētion one famous myracle notable reason greatnesse disease certainely see marke luke bestowe moe wordes amplifying cruelty deuil might appeare miserable man whō speake wonderfully tormented therefore reporte notable example diuine power christ thogh say nothing man yet dissent hystorie math addeth hystorie wel known luke sayth certaine man met citie vncertaine whether meaneth citizen gadara whether came thence meete commaunded go home preache grace god amongest owne friendes marke sayeth hee decapolis whiche countrey next ouer againste galile wherby cōiectured gadaranite borne mathew marke expresly say came citie graues luke whole course hystorie declareth liued desart therefore wordes certaine man met citie thus interpreate christ came citie certaine man possessed deuil mette way coast opinion thinke hee dwelte graues either deuils delited fauour dead carcase pleased sighte sacrifice woulde catche soules desired neare vnto body friuolous foolish vncleane spirite rather holde man amongst graues might consumed continual terrour sorowfull beholding deade one banished company menne would dwell amongst dead wee learne hereby deuil doth vexe men present life persecute euen vnto death kingdom might flourish euen death mar 3 man could binde chaines▪ coulde naturally breake chain wherby gather sathan permitted haue sometime extraordinarie motion whose force excedeth vnderstanding vsual reason often seene frantike men haue much strength perfect health denied deuil doth also play partes oft god doeth suffer violent force euangelists speake far greater truly sorowful horrible spectacle ther admonished miserable fearful thing subiecte tyranny sathan muste muche feare vexation soule torment body sharp cruell euer 6 worshipped order hystorie possessed deuils mette christ commaunded vncleane spirit come humbly beseech woulde torment time therefore worshippe christ christ spake neither cōplaine christ troubled vntil commaunded go foorth noted came willingly christes sighte drawne secreat power wont furious fiercenesse drawe men graues greater power bringeth thē wil tribunal seat iudge wherby gather kingdom sathan subiect power christ deuils haue nowe owne desire christe citeth miserable men tyrannie caried hither thither short secreate power christe brought casting might declare hymselfe deliuerer men also compulsion woorship reprochefull complaintes doe testifie confession voluntarie wreasted violence say vvhat hast thou doe v woordes desired driue away sawe themselues holden fast bound vaine flee power complaine tormented time ioyne entreatie wee see deuilles doe nothinge breathe crueltie god yet pride wherein swell fall downe confounded creature present bicause malice peruersenesse neuer tamed ceaseth wreastle power god yet meane season enforced giue place seemeth cause christ doeth openly reiecte confession deuill place bicause euident could doe harme place note christ consideration menne cause malicious wicked men might readilier stop false reportes slander sharply put deuils silence concerning place inough inough deuilles humbly entreating outragiously fret math 29 art thou come hither torment v time interpreat bee kinde torment enforced leaue manne possessed free libertie referre last day iudgement vnderstande amased presence iudge thinke punishment euill conscience notable instruction feele hand god doe profit ought might thereby submit themselues vnder true holynesse gadarenes beholding miracle afraid namely maiestie god shine christ thus farre well sende hereby appeareth much difference betweene knowledge goodnes power god power striking feare maketh men flye sight god driueth farre away goodnes doth sweetely allure account nothing desired vnited god vncerteine christe refused haue man follow except hoped greater profit aryse telling excellent notable benefit amongst owne countrey men mar lu testifie christ purposely cōmandeth shew forth work god showes coates might lyghter iourney hee commaundeth leaue burden thereunto also belongeth saying marke shodde sandalles seeme differ rodde staffe marke staffe allowed matthew luke denied seeing interpretation hebrew word thet doubtfull amongst hebrewes though euangelistes write greeke haue diuersly taken worde rabden therefore matthew luke doe meane staues burden beare marke meaneth staffe whereon trauellers doe ease rest themselues appeareth manner trauailed cary staf according vse said gen 32 10 vvith staffe passed ouer iordan word iacob confesseth came syria emptie laden rich 10 workemanne worthy meate christ aunswereth doubt condition might seeme hard goe iudea furnished prouision iourney therefore christ willeth afrayde fainting want whither soeuer come least worthy theyr message saluation wordes commaundeth enquire whether anye godlye honeste men haue feare god relygion whose aptnes taught may hope might especially offer labour lawefull longe tary euery place meete beginne preparation 11 tary vntill declareth also haste make shoulde place haue made longer taryinge shoulde haue chaunged theyr hoste leaste shoulde charge anye one manne much therefore christe commaundeth tarye theyr first hoste vntill goe cittie hee declareth must make haste shoulde presently runne cittie haue preached gospell one 12 salute coulde discerne true worshipper god contemners hee commaundeth entraunce euery family friendly insinuate themselues saluation certeine entraunce speach nowe willed goe menne knowne reported seeke godlynes falleth oftē haue greatest fame doe bewray vngodlynesse shall thorowly tryed meete commaundement added therefore meaning try first entraunce whether hostes gladly heare whosoeuer gladly imbrace doctrine tary saluation may confirmed refuse depart presently much pull backe againe salutation phrase signifieth much shuld haue sayde vnthankfulnes vnworthy enioy blessing god praid breake communication name peace hath relation manner saluting iewes commonly vsed sith peace doth signifie prosperous estate pray peace desire well prosperously whose good wish safe graunt apostls brought kind peace men sight swift draw place free reconciliation god men 14 vvhosoeuer receiueth seuere denouncing vengaunce contemners gospell wherby christ would encourage disciple least vnthankfulnes world hinder office commaundeth apostle hee would haue doe fall amongst contemners yet especiall purpose comfort sorow wearines doctrine refused least faint middest course see paule 2 cor 2 15 vsing comfort doth boldly despise contempt men doth constantly go forward let doth glory sweete sauour god though deadlye perish place teacheth much lord esteemeth gospell certeinly sith incomparable treasure much vilely vnthankful refuse offered vnto scepter kingdom cannot reiected manifest reproach shake dust lord doth commend doctrine gospell men might receiue reuerence striketh feare vnto rebellyous grieuous decree vengeaunce commaundeth whiche refuse heare gospell menne shall deny aucthoritie creator maker neither vouchsafe heare voyce doe reiect calling louingly beleeue promising thinges lyberally wickednesse greatest heape sinnes heretofore set downe doe belong former progresse iourny day ended christe proceedeth hee armeth time come might know chosen declare message short time remained matter greater weight much trauaile though presently brought forth broyles wherof christ speaketh yet profitable warned hande abide trouble might know certeine preparation harder warfar wherunto prepared also true first ambassage apostle lyke sheepe amongst woolues lorde sparing infirmitie held backe seueritie woolues hurte peculierlye referring time lord appoynted handle straitlye vsed maryage guestes brydegroome beefore resurrection brydegroome departed tendernesse ease ceased • estate harde vnderstand vayne furnished hand defence also may wordes spoken diuerse tymes mathew gathered one place luke shal see reporteth woordes spoken seuentie disciple whiche putte place apostle question wordes foretolde successe haue iourney nowe entred forwarned whole course theyr apostleship 16 beeholde sende exhortation presently followeth dooth shewe euidently whereto admonition tendeth therfore text ought thus resolued haue neede wisdome simplicitie shall sheepe amongst woolues reason gathered necessitie excepte doe wisely looke themselues presently deuoured woolues affrayde maddenesse woolues carefull shoulde wauer length fall theyr office vvee first declare meaneth sent sheepe amongst woolues although menne cruell bloudy lorde could mittigate theyr crueltie tameth maketh gentle wylde sauage beastes ofte hee pleaseth lorde doth bring great company menne obedience gospel leaueth fearcenesse witte dooth purpose hee might exercise minister though woolues nature god dooth regenerate spirite meekenesse yet christe dooth especially note raging enemy gospell hearing shepheardes voyce tamed enflamed greater crueltie therefore lorde sendeth forth minister word condition lyue amongst woolues shoulde haue manye deadlye enemy shoulde bee compassed many daungers euery side shoulde hardly execute theyr office amongst manye lettes theyr tryall might bee sharper hee giueth weapon wherewith shoulde violently defende themselues casteth vnarmed naked teeth woolues compareth sheepe referred gentle quiet manner lenitie minde onely declareth nothinge stronger able resist violence enemy sheepe againste madnesse woolues christe also requireth disciple shoulde haue mindes sheepe might striue patience malice wicked shoulde receiue iniuries quietlye simple meaninge place apostle manye enemy mighty cruell prepared agaynst themselues without defence anye manne except antithesis cannot sorte stand betweene sheepe woolues aunswere ready though lord calling enemy gospel wolues dooth rather note power delight hurte yet manne knowne woolfe except waxe mad gospell therefore ioyneth two togeather caried cruell desire suck bloud also haue power performe bee yee therefore wise meaning wisdome takinge heede tempered fearful becommeth become neglygent theyr office see would accounted circumspect prouidente become tymerous slothfull meete dysciples christ cyrcumspect take heede seeing daungers doe hang ouer euery greatest daunger least shoulde slouth waxe neglygent hee commaundeth sincerelye goe forwarde whyther soeuer theyr calling shall carry hee declareth two similitude serpentes perceyue hated doe dilygently auoyde flye whatsoeuer noysome faythfull commaunded haue care theyr lyfe least rashly leape daunger throw themselues perilles doues contrary parte though bee fearefull nature subiect innumerable daungers doe waite carelesse creature stricken commonlye caste themselues snare taker simplicitie doth christ exhorte disciple least much fearefulnesse shoulde hynder perfourming theyr course phylosophers subtilly argue heere nature serpent doue similitude reacheth farther therefore see carnall wisdome rather craftinesse condemned christ wherein great multitude menne flatter themselues meete whyle looke hether thether aboute farre go wil cast themselues daunger renounce christe calleth 17 beware menne erasmus addeth thought article force pronounce demonstratiue iudgment better take indefinitelye christ haue sayde must walke wisely amongst menne al thinges full deceites daungers seemeth fight himselfe best way heede doe owne busines home sende forth abroade aunswere hee noteth kynde heedefulnesse shoulde leaue theyr office feare troubled beeyonde measure sodaine mischiefes knowe assaulted vnawares doe become people halfe dead therefore christ commaundeth looke beefore shall folowe might tyme prepare theyr mindes beare conflict short soundeth alarme might spedilyer prepare themselues battell far litle forecast much doubtfulnes doth weaken many▪ carelesse securitie doth make many drunken running vnaduisedly doe faint neede▪ delyuer vp councilles vvee may easily gather wordes contention christ speaketh apostle ought tryed first iourney wherein founde thing purpose forewarning time dismaide▪ poynt singular vertue poore menne bolde courage come prince bee amased glistering shew world admonisheth also shal haue contention iudea onely place distant onelye might prepare themselues long meditation warfare confirmed maisters wordes doubt gouerned heauenly prouidence added witnesse gentile hath meaning god declared also straunge prince nation farre might inexcusable whereby followeth apostle shall loose theyr labour euen menne shallbee conuicted contumacy iudgement god shall shewed 19 bee▪ carefull added comfort▪ christ haue exhorted disciple hundred tymes vaine also promised god would present power certeinly conquerers hereby gather purpose christ vttering daungers diminish theyr zeale whereby necessary enflamed would execute theyr office rightly great thing come prince onely feare euen shamefastnes also dooth amase mindes good menne prince shoulde breake almoste thunder deadlye anger yet christ forbiddeth carefull spirite shall teach say manne knowing weaknesse distrusteth himselfe much hee feareth except hee haue helpe place see many doe therefore faynt measure succcesse thinges take hand doe theyr owne force small none therefore christ forbiddeth disciple look doe commaundeth depend trust heauē ly grace question saith hee abilitie power holy ghost frameth directeth tongue faythfull pure confession fayth least shoulde feare present wante declareth shall haue helpe sent euen moment lord dooth make faythfull voyde gyfte vtteraunce long hee requyreth wittenesse necessitie shall require hee maketh verye eloquente whiche seemed tonguetyed tyme wee haue seene certeine martyres whiche beeing almoste bruitish called make confession faith excelled wonderfully gift speaking aptly learnedly christ would apostle shoulde without feare profitable bee carefull sue prayer holy ghost might giuen would cast awaye carefull meditation wherewith men much hinder themselues whyle enquire themselues shall com passe shoulde fall vexed miserable disquietnesse doe reste vppon prouidence god whosoeuer giue honour prouidence god able due time supply want certeinly worthy tormented matth 10 21 brother shall betraye brother death father sonne child shal rise parentes shall cause die 22 ye shal hated men name sak endureth end hee shalbe saued 23 persecute citie flye another verely say vnto yee shall finish city israel till sonne man bee come 24 disciple aboue maister seruaunt aboue lord 25 enough disciple master seruaunt lord haue called master house beelzebub much houshold mark luke 6 40 disciple aboue master whosoeuer perfecte disciple shall bee maister 21 brother shall betray first admonisheth grieuous trouble doe remaine mitigateth sharpnesse adding notable consolation first declareth thing wont defence bring ease bring encrease greater misery disciple brother ought helpe oppressed reach hand calamitie prouide safegard shuld become deadly enemy yet deceaued think doth befall onely faythful delyuered death brother may father may persecute sonne godly zeale hee see apostate sincere worship god behalfe lord cōmādeth v forgetful flesh bloud apply al endeuor maintenaunce glory name neither doth euery manne spare kinsfolkes feare relygion god doth florishe rather al perish neede required haue kingdome christ shaken doctrine saluation extinguished worship god abolished affection ordered right onely cause right hatred christe would establysh kingdome god restore godlynesse perfecte strength would also call menne backe destruction saluation nothing vnworthy cause hate minister comfortable doctrine monstrous thing nature might haue much troubled simple mind yet christ foretelleth shal come passe 22 hee endureth one promise sufficient enough staye mindes godly although world ryse thē promiseth happy blessed end assurance purpose doth cary death whiche fight vnder earthlye captaynes vncerteine end warre shall menne doubt imploy themselues follow christ end certeine victory 23 persecute citie preuenteth whiche might haue excepted hatredes whole world borne end length though therefore coulde safetie place yet christ admonisheth despayre throwne one place shuld rather attempt whether may profit thing labour place interpreter deceiued think bee naked permission christ rather commaundeth disciple hee woulde haue doe hath abyden one persecution would gladly take ease soldiour hath done duetie christ alloweth vacation willeth run whole course vnwearied minde summe apostle cō maunded offer themselues new skirmish least thinke done dutie passed ouer one two neither doth suffer flye corner might lye ydely though labour tooke good successe one place lord doth exhort go forward vnder commaundement also contayned permission flying persecution thus vnderstoode flye generally condemned neither yet euery flyght lawfull heate old writer great matter condemned flight kind deniall true part ignominie shoulde redound christ apostle againe lawfull generally flye shoulde time persecution difference betweene good pastor hyreling therefore moderation bee noted augustine prescribeth honoratus least man fearefully forsaking standing either traiterously forsake flocke giue example slouthfulnes yet man vnaduisedly thrust himselfe headlong either whole church assayled part folowed death pastor shall doe yll withdraw himselfe whose duetie oppose life euery particuler man flocke may sometime absence shall beneficiall church appeasing fury enemy therefore let case simplicitie • e preuaile least nice mē make cloake fearefulnesse flesh alwayes wise auoydinge trouble verely say vnto lykely vnderstand first sending forth rather comprehendeth whole apostleshippe herein consisteth difficultie comming sonne manne signifie menne expounde gospell shoulde haue passage menne know christe reigne truely restitution kyngdome dauid shoulde hoped doe referre destruction ierusalem wherein christ appeareth • reuenger vnthankefulnesse first exposition tollerable latter wrested yet doe iudge comfort giuen peculyarly apostle christe sayde come hee bringeth remedie thinges despayre ambassage vndertake woonderfull spread doctrine gospel throughout whole world therefore christ promiseth himselfe come shall passe iudea namely hee beautifie kingdome power spirite glorye maiestie shoulde verelye shine apostle whiche yet hydde 24 disciple aboue maister hee exhorteth patience owne example certeinly comfort swaloweth vppe sorowe consider lotte common v sonne god yet might make v ashamed thereby taketh two similitude • custom menne disciple accounteth honored made equal maister dare desire greater honor condition lord doe beare patiently seruauntes doe refuse beare sith sonne god wayes aboue v chief aucthoritie giuen father hath office maister committed vnto let v ashamed flye himselfe disdayned take vppon cause thinges rather neede meditation exposition euident enough themselues luke reporeteth sentence sixt chapter depending vppon text vttered abruptlye amongst wordes matthewe dooth place declare verye well purpose apperteineth thought could place better anye translation followed neither erasmus olde interpreter cause greeke participle doth signifie aswel thing made perfect apt lyke meete sith christ speaketh lykenesse perfection latter sense seemeth better haue sayde nothing meete conuenient disciple frame himselfe example maister 25 haue called maister house much shuld haue called himselfe lord church apostle hebrewes 3 2 comparing moses prophetes saith seruauntes sonne heyre though hee vouchsafeth v honour brother yet firste borne head body short hath chief gouernment power hand vvherefore nothing absurd desire counted amongst number faythfull yet grudg god frameth v image owne sonne hee hath sette ouer whole housholde nice fancy would possesse place house excell aboue lord himselfe ought despise fraile transitorie life summe tendeth purpose faithfull would consider wherfore borne condition cause shoulde gredely desire earthly life though sence woordes full plentifull christe teacheth feare god vtterly dead feare tyrantes doe fall confession faith raigneth beastly blockishnesse heart feare death doubt forsake confession faith antithesis betweene two contrary feares noted feare god choaked feare men doeth appeare yelde god himselfe nowe heereof foloweth heauenly eternall life reiected cause onely remaineth v wee become like beastes power eternall life death hande god alone neglect feare men doth carie v away doth euidently appeare shadowish life body estemed v eternal state soul nay celestiall kingdom god nothing set v respect fleeing vanishing shadow present life therfore word christ ought thus resolued know haue giuen immortal soul subiect wil god alone come power men faith ought yeld terror threatnings men cō meth passe vexation fear men preuail body preferred soule immortalitie lesse estemed transitory life therfore luke emphatical repetition certainly say vnto feare christ shuld haue said haue respecte god oft giue place feare men contrariwise reuerence god victory easily hand force men shuld draw v duety also experiēce al time teacheth v necessary exhortation christ minister generally al godly ther neuer time wherin men haue violently lift vp themselues god haue endeuoured ouerwhelme gospell al armed like power cause strike fear death greater nūber monstrous cruelty doeth raigne occasion serueth sheweth selfe also sathan doth oft suborne giant whose sight seruaunts christ fal dead except armed doctrine constāt without shaking two clause ioyne together one sentence vnlearned naughtily take part men feared christ said opposeth godly holy feare god remedy peruers feare men draweth v right way otherwise consequence doth folow feare god lorde body soule men feared whose power reacheth beyonde body christ attributeth menne power killing spoken kinde graūting god slacketh bridle wicked puft vp trust owne power dare thing also amase mind simple could euery thing therfore wicked triumph vaine life godly subiect pleasure god holdeth bound restraineth cruelty violent force oft pleaseth yet permission occounted able kil often suffereth furie weakely creepe lastly sermon christ consisteth two partes might learne wil haue witnesse howe oft howe howe farre faith professed hard sette downe certaine lawe occasion considered none v doe fail duetie time must aske also lord spirite wisedome boldnesse whose direction againe v steade recompence compare men mortall estimation god angelles heauenly glory howe much excellent whiche promiseth requireth although men vnfaithful peruerse yet christ esteemeth much giue offe • ed christe declareth himselfe witnesse shall falsly thruste themselues sayd christe shall come glory father angel thus muche sence diuine glory shall shewed openly angel doe nowe compasse throane god shall attend vppon adorne maiestie place 12 luke answeareth text mathew set 9 chapter marke semeth spoken time difference doctrine thought good ioyne tog • ther lvke 51 thinke yee come christ required euen nowe disciple euery one v might performe himselfe without businesse worlde one consent woulde subscribe doctrine gospel greater part doeth also sharply resist cannot confesse christe without variance hatred many therefore christe admonisheth disciple shoulde prepare themselues battell necessitie must fight testimonie truthe hee preuenteth double offence otherwise might haue troubled weake mind little sith prophet promised peace quiet state vnder kingdome christ disciple else hope haue thing quiet whether soeuer come christe called peace gospell reconcileth v god followeth shoulde also brotherly concorde amongst v therefore haue strife contention kindled worlde gospell preached seemeth agree prophesies prophet much lesse office christ nature gospell peace prophet commend ioyned faith flourisheth amongst true worshipper god godly conscience belongeth vnbeleuers thoughe offered nothinge abide rather come fauour wyth god whereby commeth passe message peace doeth stirre vppe greater tumult muche sathan possesseth kingdome amongest reprobate madde name christe assoone doctrine gospell vttered wickednesse whetted lay sleepe christ properly author peace malice men occasion trouble heereby learne howe muche wickednesse corrupt nature whiche doeth onely defile incomparable gift doeth tourne worste meane season tumultes doe arise kingdom christe beginneth shewe selfe let v troubled newe vnwonted matter himselfe compareth gospell sworde sayeth separation makebate thinke heere described punishment laide vpon contemners gospell rise enemy others rewarde 25 went great multitude turned sayd vnto 26 man come hate father mother wife child brother sister yea owne life also cannot disciple 27 soeuer beareth crosse commeth cānot disciple 28 whiche minding builde towre sitteth downe counteth cost whether hee haue sufficient performe 29 least hath laid foūdation able perfourme • th • beholde begin mocke 30 saying man began builde able make end 31 king going warre ether king sitteth downe first taketh counsell whether hee able tonne thousand mete commeth twentie thousand 32 else yet great way sendeth ambassage desireth condition peace 33 likewise soeuer th • forsaketh hath cannot disciple 37 loueth sharpe repugnant sense nature make ennemies friendes therefore christ sayth cannot condition disciple doeth commaunde v lay v humane affection doeth forbid euery man may performe due beneuolence friendes willeth mutuall loue soeuer amongst men brought order godlinesse may haue chiefe preheminence therefore lette husbande loue wife father sonne sonne father loue towards men doe ouerwhelme duetie due christe amongest men themselues tied vnto straiter bande loued others vnwoorthy acte christ alone shoulde preferred certainly doe sufficiently account thankefull minde disciple christe excepte excellencie dignitie doe preuaile bringe vnder affection flesh luke hathe harder speache vvho soeuer hateth father sense loue friendes doeth hinder v following christe muste mightely withstoode paule sayeth philip 3 8 accounted thinges losse christes sake estemed aduantage lost thing willingly 38 taketh vp crosse proceedeth perticular general might know cannot otherwise accounted disciple except prepared beare many danger torment v vexe v haue discord cause gospell father wife child lette condition come memorie christ dedicateth disciple crosse yet lette v remember comfort bearing crosse become felowes christe▪ shall come passe bitternesse shall easily become pleasant reprobate lesse tied crosse cannot shake striue neuer muche crosse without christe accursed remaineth vnhappy end vvherefore lette v learne knit two togither faithful must take vp crosse may folow master may conforme themselues example faithful companion walke steppe 39 saue life least former doctrine hard troublesome flesh selfe worke smal effecte christ sentence confirmeth two way sayeth wary prouident shal themselues thinke haue preserued life best deceiued haue loste againe neglect life shal lose nothing shall saue vve know al thing omitted life sake suche loue planted v wherefore necessary christ might encourage contemne death promisse threaten finde life signifieth place possesse vnder safe custodie couetous earthly life keepe themselues oute pearils please themselues vaine truste well prouided themselues life fenced suche defence shall fleete away lengthe must die death shall destruction▪ contrary part faithful offer themselues death soule seemeth presente vanishe away restored better life furthermore founde somtime doe lose life either ambition sake furie christ expresly declareth cause suffer death doubtfull whether sermon made time luke declareth lord doeth also exhort disciple beare crosse long sermon also confirminge sentence addeth presently two similitude whereof mention made mathewe consent summe matter made doubt bring thing found luke hither lvke 28 vvhich minding least troublesome man folow christ condition shoulde renounce desire profitable admonition proposed men meditate hand profession gospell doeth require hereof commeth passe many fall away light temptation fansied themselues mere wāton delites though shoulde alwaies shade idlenesse therefore shall neuer sitte seruaunt christ except prepare warre long time nowe purpose doe similitude well agree matter ful trouble wearinesse builde also smally welcome reason charge also manne taketh warre vpon againste bringeth many discommodities threatneth almoste ruine mankinde yet profitte dwelling allureth men doubt lay substance necessitie also compelleth refuse expēces making warres remaineth farre excellent rewarde builder temple god whiche giue name warres christ christian doe neither labour transitorie buildinge sight vaine triumph saying christe▪ kinge vnable beare brunt battell least ouercome shame let seeke peace enemie cannot applied present purpose might make reconciliation spirituall enemie richesse force doe faile v fonde thing wrest al particular clause parable matter handled lorde simply meaneth shuld furnished least taken without iust defence doe shamefully turne backes neither euery one v king doeth make warre owne force rashnesse reproued doctrine foolishly leape beyond measure make themselues pleasure thinking bearing crosse must beware least meditation whereto christ exhorteth v feare v flack forwardnesse many haue presently taught themselues law patience euē prison thorough nicenesse retourne backe course race wil abide christian condition may free crosse others haue proposed vnto condition hard vnsauerie flesh dare come christe cause knowledge want discourage v whome lord doeth helpe time certainly graunt accounte charge poore weake cannot lay one stone drawe sworde enemie sith lord heauen giue v matter costes weapon force sluggishnesse slouthfulnesse shall haue pretence hardnesse therefore purpose christ admonishe bearing crosse might girde themselues strength 33 likewise soeuer hee forsaketh clause doeth shewe accounting charge doeth meane whereat christe commaundeth beginne namely must meditate account forsake thing vaine doe thrust themselues professe christianitie whiche delighted sweete idle estate voide crosse also vnderstand must renounce thinges doe preferre christe life also desire flesh nothing shall hinder right course man shall precisely vrge letter shal deale preposterously though man disciple christ shuld throw soeuer possesseth sea shoulde deuorced wife bidde child farewell suche fansies folish men haue bene allured monkery beinge willinge come christ haue fallen humanity man doth truely renounce al thing possesseth thē redy leaue al thing euery momēt doth imploy wholely fre bound vnto lord passing lettes doeth folow calling true denial lorde requireth settled much action say affection euery man liuing day sette heart vppon gouerneth hand mat 40 receiueth comfort though great part world offended disciple christ prouoke hatred men yet lorde might allure many shewe kindnesse disdaineth account receiued owne table soeuer giuen thereby appeareth howe much loueth hee suffereth thing soeuer done imputed also doeth speake somuch receiuing doctrine men graunt latter doeth depende former purpose christ considered mind speake saw apt fitte helping infirmitie man shoulde receiue louingly shoulde gently helpe woulde accepte kindnesse himselfe ben liberally entreated person onely offered sacrifice good sauour vnto god father 41 receiueth prophet beginneth prophet descē ding length lowest degree comprehēdeth al disciple therefore hee commendeth without exception true worshipper god louers gospell receiue name prophet righteous manne signifieth much good honour gospel respect godlinesse thoughe god commaundeth v doe dueties charitie mankinde yet good cause preferreth aboue rest may especial care regarde reward prophet interpreaters expoūd clause diuersly thinke noted mutual recompence prophet god giue spiritual thing earthly giftes exposition receiued shalbe reward iust others vnderstād shalbe partaker reward laide vppe prophet righteous haue ben liberal towards many referre communion sainctes liberalitie declare one body seruaunts christ meanes made partaker good thing whiche christe communicateth amongst member body simply take rewarde fit worthinesse person vpon liberalitie shall bestowed christe meaneth shall notable declaration much estemeth prophet euery disciple large rewarde shall appeare none lost bestowed vpon amplifieth matter promiseth rewarde euen meanest deedes giue cup colde water appeare office whiche christe laide vppon time fowe day say went city townes doubted shortly returned master shall shewed place needeth interpreated marke reporteth annoynted many sicke oyle demaunded purpose vsed oyle sith christe hadde giuen power healing learned men thinke kinde medicine graunt oyle muche vsed countreis nothinge vnlikely apostle vse ordinarie natural remedy darken cloudes myracles christ instructed lorde arte skill surgerie rather commaunded worke myracles stirre vp al iudea therfore thinke visible signe spiritual grace whereby declared healing proceeded secrete power pufte vp richesse doe leaue void place grace god nay refused part men cause shoulde maruell scarce hundreth man swelleth vain confidence christ defendeth gospel contempt againe declareth fit receiue meane let pouertie cause despaire lette comfort rather seeke christ let v remember none else accoū ted poore thinke themselues whiche lye oppressed feeling owne pouertie 6 blessed clause wil christ teach remaine constant firme faith gospel must resist striue offence shal arise hinderance course faith preuention wherewith hee shieldeth v offence shall neuer want occasion mooue v refuse vntil lift mindes aboue offence therefore first noted must warre offence may stande fast faith christ neither christ wrongfully called rocke offence stumbling stone whereat many fal certaine cō meth passe fault cureth disease also pronounceth blessed offended vvhereby also gather vnbeleeuers haue excuse though innumerable offence fall hinder shoulde come christ offend fall christ namely crosse appeareth one sinne rom 6 7 beecause cursse sinne power ouer vsing greater libertie interprete hardly wisdome estraunged child howsoeuer greek preposition interpreted iudgement sense apt wisdom though child vtterly despise dooth ye • lose nothing excellencie dignitie remaineth sound iewes especially scribe vaunted themselues child wisdome god yet trod theyr mother vnder foot onely flatter themselues great sacriledge theyr iudgement would christ also haue fallen side christ saieth though wisdome hath wicked degenerate chyldren yet remayneth safe credit authoritie cannot bee ought cmpared malice doe wickedly malitiously slā der haue yet set downe sense iudgment doth best agree place naturall first wordes christ secret antithesis betweene naturall child bastardes vaunt vaine title without cause christ say let goe pride gloriously boast themselues wisdomes child vaine shal yet haue praise autoritie amongst naturall child therefore luke addeth vniuersall note child whereby declareth easier day sodom citie 1 thinges may gathered many circumstance apostle returned backe againe christ seuentie substituted theyr roomes twelue sente stirre vp iewes hope saluation hand theyr returne neede dilygent attentiuenes moe sent second messenger shoulde euerye place spread abrod fame comming christ speciall ambassage committed christ onely sent forerunner might prepare mindes people receiue doctrine number seuentie seemeth folow order wherto people heretofore bene accustomed must remēbred spake twelue apostle look many trybes florishing estat people many apostls chosē patriarch shold gather member torne body togeather thence might come perfect restitution church reason vnlike seuentie vve know moses able beare burden chose vnto seuentie iudges shuld gouerne people togeather numb 11 iewes returned captiuitie babylon councell called synedrion corruption called sanedrin consisted seuentie two iudges common speach number spake synedrion onelye called seuentie iudges chosen posteritie dauid philo witnesseth might yet remaine authoritie kingly stocke vvherefore many miserable murthers last part theyr destruction herod ouerthrowne councell hee spoyled people lawfull gouernment furthermore returne babylon figure true perfect redemption lord seemeth chuse seuentie preacher comming therby promise sort restitution decayed estate yet made thē iudges power beecause people called backe againe one head hee commaunded onely goe alone might rule gouerne sent two togeather seemeth consideration theyr weakenes feared least seuered alone shuld haue lesse courage thē necessarye perfourmaunce theyr office therefore mutually encourage others sent two togeather 2 haruest great expounded sentence 9 chap matthew yet conuenient set downe againe vttered vppon occasion christ might therby better stirre vp disciple diligently apply theyr labour telleth haruest great whereof followeth labour vaine finde aboundaunce matter wherein might exercise themselues admonisheth daungers contention trouble commaundeth girde vp themselues might speedely goe iudea rehearseth commaundements giuen apostle therefore superfluous load reader moe wordes sith full exposition thinges may hadde onely admonished speach meaneth salute man way token great haste man meere v way goe forward speake might hinder v though litle 2 4 29 elizeus sent boye sunamite forbad salute way vvould christ therefore haue disciple vnkind would allowe salute way commaundeth make speede passe ouer lettes luke also hath onely disciple eate drinke thinges whiche shoulde set word christ doth command cōtent cōmon meane diet also aloweth thē eate men charge simple natural sense shall free lyue mennes charge long shall iourney meete whose cause labour giue foode thinke scruple taken away disciple
