city wherein moste great workes done repented 21 vvoe thee chorazin wee thee bethsaida great workes whiche doone beene done tyrus sidon repented long agoe sack • loath ash 22 say shal easier tyrus sidon day iudgement 23 thou capernaum art lyfted vp vnto heauen shalt bee brought hell great workes haue bene thee bene doone among sodome remained day 24 say vnto shall easier lande sodome day iudgmente 13 vvoe chorazin thee bethsayda miracle bene done tyrus sidon haue bene done great ago repented sittinge sackcloath ash 14 therefore shall bee easier tirus sidon iudgement 15 thou capernaum whiche arte exalted heauen shalt thrust downe hel 16 hee heareth heareth mee despiseth despiseth mee hee despiseth despiseth sent 20 beganne vpbrayde luke sheweth wherefore christ inueighed city namely hee sente disciple diuerse partes iudea preach wente kingdom god hand cōsidering vnthankfulnes amōgst laboured prophet long time wrought manye miracle profiting thereby brake word haue said time come would goe city sith found inhabitant coaste began preach gospel work miracle stubborn malitious people speaking doctrine hee vpbraideth drawn repentaunce miracle euidēt lord shewed power miracle end hee might thereby call men vnto sith nature al men set necessary beginne repentance well known chorazin bethsaida city situated vpō shore side lake genezareth 21 great workes done bene done tyrus sydon christ purpose brought comparison tyrus sydon infamous wickednes pride luxuriousnes sinnes euen neighbour hard hee might pricke countreymen iewes rather none accounted tyrians sydonians moste wicked contemners god therefore christ amplifieth curse hee saieth hope amendment place relygion appeared iuda selfe least anye moue curious question god secrete iudgementes considered lord applyed woordes common capacitie man vnderstanding comparing citizen bethsaida theyr neyghbours tirians sidonians hee disputeth god forsawe secret counsel shuld become eyther others would haue done might outwarde appearaunce gathered city corrupt maners dissolute behauiour might imputed theyr ignoraunce word god neuer heard neither miracle calling repentaunce city galyle reproued sauiour hardened obstinacie appeareth contemning miracle seene wrought aboundantly amongst without profit summe wordes christe tende purpose chorazin bethsaida excell tyre sidon malice outragious contempt god yet cause contend god passing hope shewed power amongst wickedest past hope vvhōsoeuer employed mercy vppon iustly appoynteth destruction withdraw word suffer perish others may inexcusable hee solycite exhort repentaunce meanes canne therefore charg yll dealing therefore acknowledginge infirmitie let v learne humbly reuerence high misterie proud arrogant frowardnes borne cannot abyde god accounted righteous theyr sens reach vnto proudly refuse misteries god duetie reuerence agreth theyr reason great workes bene done vve said woordes taught right vse myracles yet great work also comprehended doctrine thought christe helde peace whyle shewed power father nay myracles annexed gospel make attentiue word christ sackcloath ash repentaunce described outwarde signes solemnlye vsed church god christ esteemed outward rite applyed capacitie common people vve know repentance faythfull tyed dayes must daylye exercyse themselues meditating thereof vnto death necessary put sackcloath sprinkled ash euery day therefore outward shew repentaunce alwayes vsed grieuous falling away menne turne againe god sackcloath ash shewes guiltinesse vsed appease wrath iudge properly belong beginning conuersion sith menne doe testifie sorow griefe outward ceremonie necessary hatred sinne feare god mortification flesh goe accordinge saying ioel 2 13 rent heartes garment see christe spake tyre sydon ioyned sackcloath ash repentaunce whose inhabitant could haue gospell preached vnto condemneth former life leauing refuge flye sorowfull shewe guiltinesse humblye seeke forgiuenesse purpose also maye woorde sitting bee applyed▪ signifieth lyinge prostrate vppon grounde whiche menne forlorne doe vse testifie shewe mourninge appeareth manye place prophetes 33 thou capernaum hee nameth capernaum especially hee much conuersant menne thought hadde beene borne inestimable dignitie sonne god beginne kingdome priesthood citie hee chosen steede palace sanctuarie drowned owne filthinesse droppe god grace hadde euer bene amongst therefore christ pronounceth greater blessinges god hadde much horrible punishment remained place dilygently bee noted prophaning god giftes ioyned sacriledge shall neuer escape vnpunished therfore hygher manne dignitie seuerelye bee punished hee prophane gyttes god beestowed vppon especiallye horryble vengeaunce hande wee beeinge enriched spyrituall gyftes christe haue gospell derysion hadde beene one sodome sayde christe spake manner menne hee shew heauenly oracle foresawe shoulde haue become sodomit • prophet hadde bene sent vnto aunswere doe satisfie contentious yet one thing shall take awaye occasion quarrelling though god remedie hande whereby could haue saued sodomite yet iust reuenger destroying lv 16 hee heareth deceaued thinke repeated matthew 10 40 hee receiueth recosueth christ spak person doctrine receiuing pertained dueties charitie cōmendeth faith receiueth god word sum godlines men tried obedience faith refuse gospel though glory great worshipper god yet openly shew wicked contempt furthermore purpose christ considered whereas great part world preposterously esteemeth gospel dignitie men therefore despise brought men meane base estate christ meeteth peruerse iudgment also sith pride almost al men wil hardly submit thēselues equal contemne respect thēselues god appointeth gouerne churche ministerie men chuseth minister worde oft time dregges offscouring cōmon people therfore necessary set forth maiestie gospel least become vile vttered mouth man therefore notable commendation outward ministerie christe saieth honour reuerence soeuer giuen preaching menne bee faithful god accepteth imployed vve may profitte commendation two wayes first nothing better encourage v embrace doctrine gospel heare excellent seruice god sacrifice sweete smelling sauour heare speaking v mouth men submit selues reuerence vnto word brought men shuld discend heauen reueale counsel angel established assurednes taketh doubt v wee heare testimonie saluatiō witnessed v men sent frō god receiued credited owne voice shoulde sounde heauen contrariwise driue v contempt gospel addeth seuere sentence affirming disdaine men god father whiche disdaine heare minister though bee meane men dignitie pastor sincerly faithfully execute office highly extold pope maketh selfe ridiculous shauelings vnder pretence would mainteine tyranny certeine christe speaketh would resigne men right receiued father onelye purpose delyuer gospell contempt vvhereof followeth transferreth honour due person menne onely seeke separated word therefore pope bee receiued lette bring word warrant whereby hee maye knowne bee minister christe long hee goeth owne lykenesse chiefe enemie christes hauing nothinge like apostle lette leaue deckinge selfe others feather math marke luke 10 17 seuentie turned againe ioy saying lord euen deuils subdued v throgh thy name 18 said vnto saw sathan lyke lightning fall downe heauen 19 behold giue vnto power treade serpentes scorpion ouer power enemie nothing shall hurt 20 neuerthelesse reioice spirit subdued vnto rather reioyce name written heauen 17 seuentie turned againe appeareth seuentie disciple first fully perfectly beleeue christes wordes returned reioycing strang matter thing hoped cast deuilles power christe aucthoritie committed also commaundement yet thinke went forth perswaded maister said nothing vaine yet straungnes matter exceeded opinion amased wonderfull sightes commonly falleth faithful onelye conceaue certeine taste power god word experience caryeth admiration maner ioy shall plainely appeare christes aunswere 18 saw sathan christ leadeth disciple one special sort whole generalitie namely commanded gospel preached end might ouerthrow kingdome sathan disciple tooke exāple experience seene without application christ telleth force efficacie doctrine reach tyranny sathan exercised al minkinde ouerthrowne wee conceaue meaning word christ commaunded gospel preached attempte matter end whereof doubtfull saw sathan therby ouerthrown sith sonne god cannot deceaued foreknowledge belongeth continuall course gospel bee doubted oft raiseth vp faithfull teacher wil giue like happy successe labour vvherby gather cannot otherwise deliuered seruice sathan gospel profit rightly gospel power sathan falleth downe dying vnto sinne begin liue righteousnesse god similitude also noted hee vseth sathan fell downe lightning thunder gospell diuine incredible power doctrine expressed sodenlye casteth downe headlonge violence prince worlde furnished great power also expressed miserable condition men ouer sathan triumphed reigned aire held world subiect vnder foot vntil christ delyuerer came 19 behold giue vnto power spoken waye graunte christ denieth excellent gift wherin reioice specially warneth looke somwhat deeper matter stay outward miracle therefore ioy cō ceaued nothing doth altogether condemne sheweth ought pleased themselues much outward shewes lift vp mind heauē almost al godly sick disease though consider goodnes god benefit thāks giueing yet go far thē ought ladder holpe thē clime heauen therefore haue neede raysed vp lord outstretched arme holden fall downe vpon ground aspyre heauenly newnesse lyfe calleth al daungers power enemie deuill throweth vpon v whatsoeuer knoweth may make v hee hath power thinges hurte men armed curse god endeuoreth turne al scourge destruction taketh weapon wound v 20 name written christ purposing withdraw disciple vaine ioy glory ioy eternal lyfe leadeth head spring fountaine namely chosen god adopted sonnes might haue commaunded reioyce regenerate spirit god new creature christ lightened hope saluation haue seale giuen vnto set vnto head whence good thinges doe come free election god least ascribe anye thing themselues benefites god feele selues giue v occasion praise god eternall election without v doth shew plainely meere goodnesse god foundation saluation saith metaphorically name written heauen meaning accounted beefore god sonnes heires written catalogue math 11 marke luke 10 25 time iesus aunswered sayd giue thee thankes father lord heauen earthe thou hast hidde thinges wise men vnderstā ding haste opened vnto babe 26 father thy good pleasure 27 thing giuen vnto father man knoweth sonne father neither knoweth man father sonne sonne reueale 28 come vnto mee yee wearye laden wil ease 29 take yoake learne meeke lowly heart yee shall find rest vnto soules 30 yoake easie burden light 21 houre reioyced iesus spirit said confesse thee father lorde heauen earth thou haste hidde thinges wise learned haste reuealed babe euen father pleased thee 22 hee turned disciple sayd▪ thing giuen father man knoweth whoe sonne father neither father saue sonne hee sonne reueale 25 iesus answered though hebrewes doe commonly vse word answering euen beginning matter speach yet think place greater emphasis christ took occasion present matter speake thus luke wordes doe plainely confirme saieth christ houre reioyced spirit whereof reioycing proceede christ esteemed church gathered meane contemptible men deare pretious al nobilitie excellencie world bene gathered glorious shewes same▪ wordes speaketh father haue vehemēcy thē speaketh disciple though certeine respecte cause hee gaue thankes father least offended meane base estate church doe alwayes seeke glorious shewes nothing seemeth vnlikely v heauenlye kingdome sonne god whose bewtie gloriouslye described prophet consist dregges offscouring people surelye woonderfull counsell lorde hee hauinge whole worlde hande hadde rather chuse peculier people himselfe meane despised common people amongst mightie men world might haue better bewtified adorned name christe nobilitie christe withdraweth disciple proud disdainfull iudgement least shoulde bolde despise meane base estate church wherin himselfe delyghteth reioyceth may force ouerthrow ouer whelme curiositie hereof aryseth mindes men lifteth vp himselfe aboue world reuerenceth secrete iudgementes god hee might drawe others haue admiration truely though order god farre differeth iudgement yet madde arrogant blind murmurre christe head doth reuerently accept account conuenient weigh wordes giue thee thankes father wordes hee declareth setleth himselfe decree father differeth much iudgement world also contayned vnder wordes secrete opposition betweene praise giueth father malitious slaunders froward barkings world considered wherefore thanketh father namely hee lord whole world preferred babe simple one menne vnderstanding respecte circumstaunce argument small force hee calleth father lorde heauen earth woordes sheweth difference onely dependeth god wise blind rude vnlearned vnderstand misteries gospell manye like place wherein lord sheweth freely chosen attaine saluation maker creator world nation learne sentence two thing first want power god doe obey gospell hee able subdue creature power secondlye onely woorke free election become faythfull others remayne ignoraunt obstinate drawing passinge dooth onely make difference betweene men whose estate nature one equall yet chose simple rather wise consideration owne glory fleshe alwayes proud wise learned men goe opinion would presently take place menne obtayned faith dexteritie wisdome learning vvherefore mercy god could otherwise manifest deserueth making choyce might plainely declare whatsoeuer men bring themselues nothing worth therfore meete wisdome man ouerthrowne least obscure praise god grace yet demaunded christ calleth men vnderstanding calleth litle one experience teacheth v rude simple haue faith wise learned left blindnes therfore accounted wise men vnderstanding lyft vp diuelish pride cannot abyde heare christ speaking heauen generall rule forsaken god pryde delyght thēselues ought taught example paul whose pride christ tamed yea descende rude common people greater part appeare full deadly malice see lefte togeather great mightie menne theyr owne destruction graunt al vnbeleeuers puft vp vaine trust themselues whether apply themselues accounted wise honest honourable rich yet doe thinke christ dooth simply comprehend doe excell wisdome learning without noting faulte againe hee accounteth respect vertues litle one though christe mayster lowlye firste rudiment fayth manne shoulde wise owne conceate yet hee speaketh wilfull wickednesse christ reason amplifieth louing mercy father disdayned descend lowest vylest place might rayse poore myre aryseth question sith wisdome gift god commeth passe hinder v seeing light god shineth gospell must bee remembred saide euen nowe vnfaithfull doe defile whatsoeuer vnderstanding giuen therefore excellent wittes often hindered cannot submitte themselues taught concerning present place aunswere though wisdome light wise yet may bee depriued light gospell sith al menne one lyke condition shoulde god pleasure take hee chose wise mightie paule teacheth v 1 corin 1 27 namely hee chose weake foolish thinges world might confound glorious pride flesh note againe christes speach generall hee sayd misteries gospell hidde wise fiue menne vnderstanding foure refuse gospell one receiue many simple menne two three become disciple christe sentence fulfilled also confirmed place paule euen rehearsed hee banisheth wise noble mighty kingdome god onely sheweth many shal saued question aunswered wisdome condemned gyfte god christe onely saieth value obtaining fayth againe commendeth foolishnesse though menne thereby reconciled god hee denyeth hinderaunce mercie notwithstanding might lighten rude simple menne heauenly wisdom remayneth declare reueale keepe secrete meaneth christe speaketh outwarde preaching may gathered hee offereth himselfe generallye teacher menne gaue commaundement apostle vvherfore meaninge manne attaine fayth owne wisdome onelye secrete lightning spirit god 26 father sentence taketh v occasion vaine wanton inquiringe ofte prouoketh stirreth v god requireth harder matter v wee shoulde account perfect reason righteousnesse doth ofte rehearse iudgementes great bottomlesse deapth yet wil runne headlonge violence depth wee finde oughte please v wee grudge murmurre many breake open blasphemy lorde hath prescribed rule vnto v wee account right pleaseth god wise wee ought bee esteeme one good pleasure god thousande reason christe coulde haue alleaged cause dyfference hadde bene beeing satisfied good pleasure god hee enquireth hee called little one saluation rather others framed kyngdome obscure common people vvhereby appeareth rage agaynst christe grudge heare chosen freelye good wyll god oother forsaken greeueth gyue place vnto god 27 thynges giuen mee father interpreter doe yll applye sentence former thinke onely purpose christe shoulde encourage disciple greater boldnesse preaching gospell think christ spake cause ende sayde church came secrete fountaine god free election nowe hee sheweth grace saluation commeth vnto men manye heare none heires eternall lyfe god chose world made doe curiously enquire may bee certeine god secrete counsell caste themselues labyrinth whiche canne finde passage christe commaundeth come presently certeintie saluation maye bee fetched thence meaning therefore life reuealed v christ himselfe therefore man partaker entreth gate faith wee see ioyneth faith eternall predestination god foolish men doe peeuishly compare togeather contrary though saluation alwayes hidde god yet christ conduit pipe whereby commeth v faith receiued v may confirmed ratified heart wherfore lawfull shrinke christe except refuse saluation prepared v manne knoweth sonne hee speaketh cause least maiestie vainely esteemed iudgment menne meaning therefore wee know christ must credit testimonie father whoe onelye canne tell v truely rightly hath giuen vnto v certeinely imagining one minde imagination thereof conceaueth spoyle great parte power therefore knowne rightlye father voyce though onely voyce sufficeth without direction spirite power christ deepe secrete menne cannot reach vnto vntill lightened father note therefore father knoweth himselfe v might reueale vnto v yet sentence seemeth ful two partes agree together sayd sonne man knoweth father reueale father onely sayde onely knoweth sonne mention made hee reueale aunsweare haue beene vaine haue rehearsed spoke dooth former thankes giuing containe father hath reuealed sonne hath thought good therefore foloweth nowe man knew sonne father reason rendred hee hadde spoke imagination might haue rysen neede father reueale sonne hath shewed himselfe seene openly vnderstand wherefore sayde sonne knowne father alone remaineth shuld consider latter parte sentence manne knew father sonne also knowledge differeth former sayde sonne knewe father hee reueale spirite hee lyuelye image father hee sheweth visiblye sorte owne person yet exclude spirite referre reuealing whereof christe nowe speaketh manner knowledge text agreeth well togeather christe confirmeth whiche hee sayde beefore thinges giuen vnto father might knowe fulnesse godhead dwelte summe gift father sonne knowne hee openeth eye mindes spyrite wherein wee see glorye christe otherwise hidden v father dwelleth light whereto man reache incomprehensible himselfe reuealed vnto v sonne liuely image sought else vaine 28 come vnto yee doeth louingly cal vnto acknowledgeth fitte disciple though ready reueal father yet part neglecteth come touched feeling want hypocrite care christ drunke righteousnesse neither hunger thirst grace giuen worlde make account heauenly life therefore christe shoulde call two sortes people vaine turneth therefore himselfe miserable afflicted also calleth labour mourne vnder burden neither doeth generally meane oppressed sorowe griefes whiche confounded owne sinnes striken feare god wrath ready fal downe vnder great burden god humbleth elect diuers way part men oppressed misery doe yet remain stubborne vntamed christ meaneth men wery loaden haue conscience afflicted guiltinesse eternal death prickt inwardly owne misery fainte feblenesse maketh v apt receiue grace shoulde haue sayde grace therefore contemned moste parte fewe doe feele owne wante yet cause pride obstinacie hinder afflicted conscience sigh remedy vvherefore lette v leaue bewitched sleight sathan either perswade themselues haue righteousnesse without christe else imagine themselues blessed world misery driue v seeke christ christe admitteth none enioying rest fainte vnder burden let v learn deadly poyson sluggishnesse whiche planteth v false deceitfull opinion either earthly felicitie righteousnesse vertue therefore lette euery one v daily stirre vp selues first let v busie selues shake delightes world let v emptie selues vaine trust selues though preparation receiue grace christe doeth discourage men yet noted gifte holy ghost beginning repentance whereto man attaine himselfe neither purpose christ teache man doe himselfe ought affected come vnto whiche restraine burden labour ceremony lawe doe tie sentence christ short graunt burden lawe intollerable woulde ouerwhelme soules must remembered sayd christe reacheth hand afflicted mighte make difference betweene disciple contemners gospell general speache christe noted christe doeth therefore without exception comprehende labour laden least man faithlesse doubting shut vp way himselfe yet fewe number innumerable companie perish feele themselues going destruction refreshing christ promiseth consisteth fre forgiuenesse sinnes easeth v 29 take yoake see many doe abuse grace christ turne serue wantonnesse flesh therefore christe hath promised ioyfull rest miserable afflicted conscience hee also warneth deliuerer vpon condition take yoake haue sayd therefore free sinnes hauing god mercifull shuld therby take libertie sinne comforted grace shoulde take yoake freed conscience might keepe bondage wantonnesse flesh heereof gathered definition rest whereof spake freeth disciple christ warfare crosse liue pleasantly exerciseth vnder burden discipline containeth vnder yoake learne iudgement deceiued think christ spake mekenesse least disciple comming mighty menne woont fearefull diuine glory shoulde flie rather frameth v folowe reason stubbornnesse flesh flie yoake sharpe hard thing little sayeth yoake sweete howe man shoulde submitte necke willingly ioyfully except cloathed • eekenesse becommeth like christe appeareth meaning christ exhorting disciple beare yoake least difficultie terrifie addeth presently learne ye signifying yoake shoulde grieuous vnto v owne example taught framed meekenesse humilitie also pertaineth purpose hee addeth yee shall finde rest long flesh liberty wee murmur whiche refuse yoake christ endeuor please god way weary tire themselues vaine see papist vexe themselues miserably beare cruell tyrannie vnder tormented yet silence passe ouer say laste daye solemnization whiche much estemed first yet like iudgement better take second feast yere name agreeth wel called second sabboth first order time second high yerely feast first passeouer therfore probable feast first fruites mar 24 vthy saboth day pharisies reproue disciple christe pulling eares corne mannes fielde breake sabboth thoughe sabboth bene ordained ende hungry men pearish rather relieue hunger onely cause sabboth people sanctifying themselues god shoulde exercise themselues true spirituall worship freed worldly businesse might better frequent holy assembly vvherfore lawfull obseruation must referred purpose interpretation lawe must fetched minde lawgiuer heereby appeareth howe malitious obstinate superstition especially may see disdainfully cruelly hypocrite doe lifte vppe themselues ambition hatred person meete togither affecting fained holinesse sayde made pharisies sharpe cruell sith purpose desired carpe wordes deedes christe cannot drawe thing yl parte wherein fault malitious interpreaters doe contrarietie mathew mark say fault laid vpon lord luke vpon disciple probable disciple troubled accusation broughte againste maister himselfe also may quarell seconde argument whereby christe prooueth breache sabboth whereof pharisies complained voide offence lawfull sabboth dayes kill sacrifice circumcise infant doe thinges pertaine worship god vvherof godlinesse also disciple applied themselues offer vppe soules consecrated god gospell mathewe onely toucheth argument nowe sayeth sabboth broken priestes vnproper maner speach christ vseth may frame himselfe hearer lawe commaundeth men abstaine workes doth forbid men religious exercise christ graunteth true whiche mighte seeme common people hauing enoughe workes temple offend god 7 yee knewe mathew onely maketh mention third argument christ reprooueth pharisies considered purpose ceremony commaunded ende belong truely hath bene common fault almost age therefore prophet oseah 6 7 reprooueth menne age beinge addicte ceremony made accounte woorkes charitie god telleth otherwise hee accounteth mercy sacrifice worde mercie noted figure workes charitie euen vnder sacrifice al outward worship law comprehended christ applieth sentence time accuseth pharisies wickedly wrest law god contrary sence neglecting second table apply themselues wholely ceremony yet ariseth question god sayeth regardeth sacrifice sith commaunded law straightly obserued may readily answeared outward rite respecte themselues estemed required god respecte ende whereto directed againe god doeth simplie refuse comparinge woorkes charitie sheweth hee doeth lesse esteeme yet notwithstandinge perfection righteousnesse worship god hath chiefest place secondly come dueties belong men though godlinesse right much accounted charity god excelleth aboue men yet faithfull maintaining mutuall charitie amongest themselues doe geue testimonie worship god effectually god doeth without cause call hypocrite faine godlinesse outward signes doe wonderfully peruert resting carnall outward worship furthermore christ gathereth effectually testimonie prophet disciple guiltlesse god exercising people rudiment law minded nothing lesse kil men famine • sonne man lorde ioyne sentence former one greater temple thinke diuers christ first alluding temple affirmed breach law annexed holy seruice sayeth heere hath power giuen set disciple free necessitie obseruing sabboth sonne man sayeth owne power moderate obseruing sabboth doeth ceremony law certainly without christ bondage lawe miserable onely freeth whome enricheth free spirite adoption mar 27 sabboth made man fift argument reported marke onely summe doe wickedly whiche conuert sabboth man destruction whiche god instituted hy • sake pharisies sawe disciple christ occupied holy worke saw weary labour iourney also oppressed hunger yet grudge hungry men shoulde comfort wearied body fewe cornes wheate purpose god wickedly peruerted restored hole 6 came passe also sabboth entred synagogue taught man whose righthād dried vp 7 scribe pharisies watched whether would heale sabboth day might find accusation 8 knew thought sayd manne forth thine hande hee hand restored againe 9 departed thence hystorie former tende one end scribe maliciously bent carpe cauill euery thing christe therefore maruell whose mindes poysoned frowardnesse continued obstinate enemy yet see common matter hypocrite onely folow shadowe righteousnesse lawe say commonly rather shew substance first therfore lette v learne bringe v wee giue iudgement thing pure mind free al malitious affection hatred pride like thing raigne v shal iniurious men contempt god himselfe turne light darkenesse man voide malice woulde haue denied haue bene godly worke good doctours dout condemne whence cōmeth madnesse sens fraught vile hatred christ would see bright sun shine vve also warned take heede least giuing ceremony meete omit thinges greater account god christ matth 23 23 calleth weightier matter law bent outward ceremony wee neuer keepe meane behalfe except remember whatsoeuer commanded worship god ought first spiritual measured guided rule prescribed christ 10 asked saying marke luke say watched lord wold mat setteth plainly tēpted also word likely healed others sabboths hauing therefore taken occasion demand whether think lawful done shuld haue considered selues whether ben worke god mā heale dried hand touching word god instituted sabboth laid law vpon selfe neither bring himselfe bondage might labour sabboths shoulde thinke meete vppon dayes therfore poynt great madnesse mouing question driue god himselfe order abridge free course workes 11 vvhat man shall among shal haue shepe christ sheweth true right obseruation sabboth also reproueth malitious dealing cauild vsual maner amōgst man shepe fel pit man forbid pulling out▪ much man worth beast much lawful help therefore appeareth help necessity brother breaketh rest commanded lord marke luke haue similitude say christ demanded whether lawful good dede sabboth day euil loseth life man guilty offence yea litle di • sereth mā flaier hath regard help hath nede therfore christ reproueth vnder pretence holy rest wold enforce doe euill doth sin said doth thing lawe also neglecteth duety heereby also perceiue christ alwaies vse reasōs ouerthrow cauil disputeth godhead doeth iohn neither nedeful one defence sufficient cōuince pharisies two cannot agree accounted breaker sabboth follow god lvke 8 knew thought mathew say true openly bewray speache minde therefore christ answeareth secrete thought opē wordes may stande spake openly christe iudged secrete thoughtes neither vtter meant mathewe declareth demaunde captious therefore luke meaneth nothing else christ knewe deceites thoughe pretended matter wordes marke addeth christ looked vppon angerly mighte well angry wicked obstinacie might know anger iust holy layeth sprang mourned hardnes hart first therefore christe sorowfull menne exercised lawe god suche grosse ignorance malice blinded also conceiueth anger sorowe right moderation zeale mourne destruction wicked men angry vngodlinesse place declareth christe free humane affection doe heereof gather passion themselues sinfull temperate meane kepte vve cannot holde meane reason corrupt nature neuer angry iust cause without sinne thinges founde christe onely integritie nature beare rule also shoane perfecte example righteousnesse therefore wee muste pray spirite god may giuen v heauen correct bridle imperfection math 1 • marke 3 luke 6 14 pharisies went oute consulted might destroy 15 iesus knew departed thence great multitude folowed healed al 16 charged make knowen 17 might fulfilled spoken esaias prophet saying 18 beholde seruaunt whome haue chosen beloued whome soule delighteth putte spirite hee • shall showe iudgement gentile 19 shal striue crie neither shall man heare voyce stretes • 0 brused reede shall hee breake sinckinge flaxe shall hee quen • till hee bringe foorthe iudgement victorie 21 name shal gē tile trust 6 pharisies departed straight way gathered acoūcel herodians might destroy 7 iesus auoided disciple sea great multitude folowed galile iudea 8 ierusalem idumea beyond iordan dwelt tyrus sydon hearde greate thinges hee came vnto great number 9 commannded disciple ship shuld wait multitude least throng 10 hee healed many muche preased vpon touch many plages▪ 11 vncleane spirit saw fel downe cried saying thou art sonne god 12 sharply rebuked ende shoulde vtter 11 wer filled full madnesse communed one another might doe iesus 14 pharisies see whether obstinate fury carieth reprobate resisting striuing god vanquished answeres yet powre poyson certainly detestable monster chiefe doctor lawe gouernment church theues seeke murthers necessary shoulde come passe oft desire haue ouerthrowne soeuer pleasure though god himselfe imputed feare christe escapeth away flight thing couragious nowe ledde strength spirite fledde wherewith endued hee willingly offered himselfe death portion humbling paule commendeth phil 2 7 could myracle haue readily defended life hadde rather flying take vppon infirmity also deferre die cause time conuenient appoynted father yet come yet euident preserued rather heauenly power flight bene hard matter enemy haue broken place whether went drawing company making place famous myracles hid himselfe darke onely withdrew himselfe sight least shoulde make madde marke addeth tooke counsell herodians yet hated deadly would seme kepers defender publike liberty necessary professe thēselues haue deadly hatred tyrantes officer yet madde hatred christ farre preuailed onely conspired straungers familiarly insinuated themselues fauour whose company otherwise abhord vngodlinesse carying men hether thether driueth diuers debate controuersies yet knitteth togither one consent striue lord hatred enemities doe let extremest enemy doe ioyne hand togither ouerthrow truth god 16 charged marke setteth downe speciall matter put vncleane spirites silence cried sonne god vvee haue place shewed cause woulde admitte suche witness neither douted confession wrested deuilles power god christe shewed subiecte power also without cause refused testimony extendeth farther mathewe sayeth christe commaunded fame myracles wrought spred abroade would haue vtterly suppressed roote setled might bring foorth fruite aboundantly due season knowe christe plaied myracles proposed ende might proue himselfe sonne god redeemer giuen vnto world shewed himselfe litle litle euen certaine degree neither otherwaies reuealed time ordained father allowed yet matter worthy noted wicked doe endeuour ouerwhelm glory god farre obtaining hope god applieth wicked endeuours rather contrary though christe gone famous place yet glory ceaseth shine euen secrete corner yea breaketh notably excellent brightnesse 17 might fulfilled spoken mathew meaneth prophesie altogither fulfilled christ charged rumor power much vttered herein also shewed token humilitie isaias describeth person messiah myracles christ wrought amongst would shoulde muche boasted able shake heauen earth therfore doeth plainly shew howe farre vaine glory pompe world yet conuenient sift purpose mathew narrowly would declare circumstance glory godhead christ ought lesse estemed appeared glorious shewe certainly holy ghost directed eye prophet purpose flesh doth alwaies desire outward glorious shew least faithful shoulde seeke messiah spirite god doeth declare shall farre vnlike earthly kinges make great stirres noyses fill city townes tumult may admiration soeuer come see howe aptly mathew applieth saying prophet present cause god hath laid humble abiecte person vpon sonne least simple take offence contemptible obscure estate wel prophet mathew meete one say without cōsideratiō celestiall decree come estate vvhereof foloweth doe wickedly despise christ outward condition aunsweareth fleshly affection neither lawfull v deuise christ shall like imagination simply necessary v embrace offered vnto v father therefore vnworthy saluation whose eye humilitie christ seemeth vile lord declareth delited wil enter wordes prophet isaiah 42 1 18 behold seruaunt whome haue chosen god may tie v waite vpon wil sheweth wer singer whō would send cause note demonstration behold vsed like reason also epithites folow nameth seruant chosen wherein minde deliteth come passe men bolde measure christ owne imagination except weigh saluatiō doth depend vpō mere fauor god wicked liberty whē god offereth v incomparable treasure men shoulde esteeme according fleshly desire called seruant one common people respecte dignitie god hath laide vpon office redemption church man taketh honour himselfe called worthely estemed god sayeth chose owne counsell shoulde come order whereof followeth lawfull men refuse cōtumelious god certainly absurde holy inuioleable calling god made none effecte pleasure pride yet whiche god addeth prophet soule deliteth christ hath meaning though calling euery one v commeth free grace god fountaine yet especiall delite christ person god father comprehendeth embraceth whole church loue nature enemy god loue coulde neuer haue come v except first begon head sayd shalbe seene againe 17 chapter shall shewe iudgement gentile prophet doeth heere describe briefly office christ foretelleth shal come passe shal shew iudgement gentile iewes comprehend vnder word iudgement state rightly orderly established wherin equitie vpright dealing flourisheth therfore much prophet shoulde haue sayd one shoulde come shoulde restore righteousnesse decaied gouernour onely people bring gentile also vnder gouernment god amongst raigned heretofore nothing confusion signification word shew bring forth prophet vseth office christ spread kingdome god world shut vp corner iudea said psalme 1 20 2 lorde shall sende scepter thy power sion also expressed maner bringing forth iudgement namely god powre spirite vppon christ true ther neuer thing done rightly world proceeded frō spirit god set forward heauenly power also neuer king could erecte defend lawfull order instructed spirit christ bringing forth iudgement doth far excell others receiued spirit father imparteth disciple doeth declare word wryting right power spirite doth inwardly frame heart men obseruing rule righteousnesse 19 shal striue crie summe said euen cō ming christ shuld troublesom shall want kingly furniture pompe yet presently said man saluation humility may brought fauour euery despised world certainly folishnes mē wōderful esteme christ worse doth louingly hūbly submit capacity christ shuld appear glory thing come passe shoulde ouerwhelmed vvhat froward wickednesse vnwilling receiue cause descended height glory therfore gentlenesse christ might get reuerence amōgst faithfull prophet isaiah doeth admonish v howe profitable necessary euery one v knoweth owne frailty thereby behooueth v consider conuenient menne louingly gentlely receiued chearished christ speake vnbeleuers yet without sparke god grace called lord vntil light fully kindled strength become perfect like reede halfe broken smoking matche therfore lette v learne embrace great goodnesse christ frameth infirmity yet meane lette man flatter himselfe sinnes let euery man endeuour profit better selues least wander life long bend turne euery blast like vnto reedes lette v growe perfect men may stand fast sundry assault sathan let faith like smal sparkes hidden darke smoke let shewe foorth bright shining beames nowe example christ minister haue prescribed vnto ought behaue themselues vnder pretence place falsly folishly pretend mildnesse generally vsed towards men difference noted prophet expresly maketh betwene weake obstinate strong whose hardnesse meete broken violence beetle either endeuour bring darknesse ouer al place else firebrand kindle consuming fire euery necessary smoke shuld scattered heat shoulde quenched therefore faithfull minister word must diligently apply themselues sparing weake may encrease nourish grace god yet small must wisedom take good hede nourish malitious obstinate whiche nothing like smoking flaxe brused reede 20 til bring forth iudgement victory wordes prophet somwhat otherwise namely shal bring forth lead forth iudgement truth yet speach mat vseth full great importāce may knowe righteousnesse cannot placed worlde without great strife labour deuill casteth lettes hinderance may righteousnesse shoulde shewe foorth great wrestling confirmed woorde victory obtained fighting presently foloweth prophet hath yles shall waite lawe thoughe mathewe hath changed wordes yet agreeth sense grace christ shall common gentile whatsoeuer worst part yet euident math luke doe meane christe knew hart semeth spake openly christ might heare cauils christ diuine spirit knew mind cauild commeth oft passe men iudge proposterously fal ignorance impugne truth purpose nourish secret hidden poyson thē caried hedlong rashnesse therefore meaning text christe much vehemently enuey witnes iudge malice conceiued inwardly euery kingdom first confuteth cauil obiected common prouerb yet confutation seemeth ful know sleight sathan sometimes deludeth men making shewe variance may therby snare mind men superstition exorcismes poperie nothing else deuised fained conflictes sathan suspition christ casteth deuils maketh hole sound god oft deuill hath conflict himselfe suffreth bound iest himselfe yet hath victorie triumpheth christ assaulteth deuill open defiance casteth cleane leaueth place rest hee ouerthroweth one side may strōger vtterly ouerthroweth deuices therefore christ reasoneth aptly hath felowship father deceit hath purpose vpholde maintaine kingdom obiecte deuils oft caried wilde giddinesse blind madnesse ouerthrow themselues answer ready meaning christes word nothing absurd deuil willingly ouerthrowe power hath ouer men endeuoreth applieth meanes haue bondage furthermore christ vseth cōmon prouerbs probable coniectures sound perfect proof lastly speaking matter known wel proued vrgeth le enemy cōsciences mā ignorāt christ came thrust sathan possession nothing manifest myracles tēded end vvherby easie iudge power contrary sathan god 27 whō child cast thē accuseth thē wicked malicious iudgmēt woulde altogether depriue power would adorne priesthode seruice temple generall testimonie necessary distinguished euident note superstition gentile first interpretation seemeth iudgement moste naturall 28 cast deuils spirite god luke metaphorically calleth finger spirite god woorketh sheweth power spirite name finger aptly giuen speach cōmon amongst iewes moses reporteth pharaoh enchāters sayd ex 8 19 finger god christ gathereth former wordes scribe vnthankfull god would shoulde raigne ouer hetherto hath answeared friuolous obiection giueth charge vnto menne conuicte oppose themselues wickedly kingdome god holdeth himselfe within compasse one myracle occasion thereof speaketh cause comming declaring onely consider one peculiare facte thing farre excellent namely god reuealinge messias woulde repaire decayed estate restore kingdome amongest therefore see christ complaineth vnthankefulnesse furiously reiected cast amongest incomparable grace god woorde come forcible witte god appeared willingly redeemer bu much coulde driue amongest would giue place come ready prepared saluation 29 man enter strong man house though euangelists differ somwhat wordes yet agree notably summe matter christ prosecuteth touched litle kingdome god saieth necessary sathan shuld thrown forth violence god may haue kingdom amongst men sentence confirmation wente may certeinly vnderstād meaning christ behoueth v remember analogy matthew reheased betweene visible spirituall grace christ whatsoeuer body shoulde applyed soules deliuered corporall sens men tyranny deuill declared sent god champion shuld ouerthrow spirituall tyrannie ouer soules nowe returne wordes affirmeth strong mighty tyrant cannot dryuen kingdom vntill spoyled weapon except mightier power set neuer willingly giue place purpose spoken first wee know deuill called diuerse place prince world tyrannous gouernment holdeth fortified euery side strōg defence many snare entrappe men hee holdeth subiect vnto bandes rather nourish seruitude wherein bound rather anye meanes aspyre lybertie also innumerable sortes daungers holdeth miserably ouerwhelmed vnder feete short nothing contrary may without resistaunce rule tyrant world canne doe anye thing without maker adam estranging himselfe power god brought himselfe posteritie vnder straunge miserable seruitude though deuill reigneth againste nature iust iudgement god menne subiect tyranny sinne yet holdeth kingdome quiet possession hee triumpheth ouer v without resistaunce vntill stronger shall aryse stronger bee found earth power men helpe themselues therfore redeemer promysed heauen christ sheweth manner redemption necessary strong hande wrest deuill hee wil neuer let goe except enforced wordes declareth menne hope vaine deliueraunce vntill sathan bee brought vnder violent assaultes though purposely reproueth ignoraunt folly scribe vnderstoode beginninges kingdom god yet reproofe toucheth almoste men sith ouerwhelmed almost folly manne make bragge wordes desire kingdome god yet wil necessitie requireth suffer christ fight valiantly may delyuer v hand tyrant sicke manne shoulde craue helpe phisition abhorre abstaine remedy vnderstand purpose christe brought parable namely hee might shew scribe enemy kingdome god whose beginninges malitiously withstoode yet al subiect bondage sathan let v learn god doth begin kingdom v otherwise strong mighty hand christ setteth v libertie miserable hard bondage 30 hee mee place expounded two wayes gather shuld argument repugnancies christ haue sayde cannot reigne except deuill ouerthrowne al endeuours bent vppon scatter whatsoeuer gather certeinely see enemie doth boldly apply himselfe ouerthrow kingdome christ yet rather yeelde opinion interprete scribe double enemy kingdom god sette purpose hinder proceedinges meaning therefore part helpe set hand buylding kingdome god whosoeuer doth helpe setteth himselfe sorte leaste worthy accounted amongst enemy carryed madde fury openly striue also appeareth plainely former dealinges truely christ nowe speaketh whosoeuer gather scatter abroade readines nature euill suche place righteousness god doe earnestly apply doctrine also reacheth witte vnworthy accounted flock christ applye theyr endeuours furtherance commeth passe slouth kingdome god decayeth falleth ruine buylding wherof called 31 vvherefore say vnto conclusion may restrained last sentence dependeth whole text christ hath taught scribe could reproue casting deuils set thēselues kingdom god length concludeth light saying tollerated hainous offence wittingly willingly blasphemed spirit god saide christ spake bare word vngodly wicked thoughtes euery sinne blasphemy lord pronounceth blasphemy spirit hainous sinnes worth labor enquire meaneth saying interprete vnrepentaunce may easily confuted vainely fondly christ haue denied could forgiuen world also word blaspemy cannot generally applyed kindes sinnes comparison christe bringeth meaning shall easily appeare vnto v vvhy saide sinne hainously speaketh blasphemy spirit christ beecause maiestie spirit excellent sharply reuenged certeinly cause fulnesse godhead christe whosoeuer reproachfull againste christe ouerthrew abolyshed whole glory god muche lay shall christ separated spirite contum • lious spirit leaue vntouched vnhurte heere wee beginne gather meaning blasphemy spirit exceedeth sinnes spirite aboue christ beecause whosoeuer doe kicke power god reuealed excused vnder pretence ignoraunce noted spoken blasphemy simply referred essence spirit grace wherwith endued haue light spirite though speake euill glory spirit yet guiltie sinne perceiue blasphem spirit god determinate malice oppose themselues grace power sacriledge committed spirit dwelling v doe wittinglye endeuor selues extinguish reason spirit sayde blasphemed rather either sonne father himselfe blaspheming grace power god wee strike streight spirite proceedeth grace god appeare v beleeue blaspheme god hee blinde man strike wall man blasphemeth spirit first lightned doth knowledge wittingly giue himselfe wicked rebellion also distinction vaine al blasphemy shal forgiuē except one holy ghost man simply blasphemeth god hope forgiuenes sayd god neuer mercifull speake blasphemy spirite whye blaspheme spirite doe knowledge soule oppunge slaunder gift power spirit also apperteineth purpose marke saieth christ threatned pharises hardly saide vnclean spirit saying purposely wittingly malitiously turned light darknesse manner gyantes prouerb saieth bidde battell god yet ariseth question whether menne wyll breake madnesse doubt wittingly willingly strike god seemeth straung monster beleeued aunswere boldnesse proceedeth frantike blindenesse wherein malice poysonfull fury getteth victorie without cause paul saith 1 tim 1 13 though blasphemer yet receiued mercy ignorantly thorow vnbeliefe wordes distinguiseth sinne wilfull blasphemy also place confuted theyr errour whiche ymagine euerye wilfull sinne whiche committed conscience withstanding vnpardonable paule dooth expresly tie sinne firste table lawe lorde dooth name blasphemy poynt one kinde sinne hee also sheweth directly fighteth glory god gather sinne blaspheme againste holye ghoste whiche turne grace gyftes god reuealed vnto spirite whiche shoulde sette forth glorye hynderaunce slaunder sathan captaine professed enemy glory god vvherefore meruaile christe cutte away hope forgiuenesse frō sacriledge paste hope turne onely medicine sauing health deadly poyson seemeth hard therfore flye childish cauill saying sayde vnpardonable forgiuenes rare hard obtained christ speketh expresly wordes cannot childishly shifted also reason fondly god cruell neuer forgiue sinne crueltie would make v amased doe consider howe haynous offence onely prophane holy name god set purpose also spitte face hee shineth vppon gratious fauourable countenaunce exception whiche take fond namely meaning bee man obtayne forgiuenes without repentaunce certeine blasphemy holy ghost signe reprobation whereof followeth fall giuen ouer reprobate sense hold vnpossible truely regenerate spirit throw himselfe headlong horryble sinne againe holden fall neuer rise againe god sorte reuengeth contempte grace hardeneth heartes reprobate neuer attaine repentaunce 32 neither life marke dooth briefly set downe meaning wordes saying speake holy ghost shall subiect eternall damnation vve aske god forgiuenes sinnes dayly reconcileth v vnto himselfe length al sinnes abolished death sheweth himselfe merciful vnto v fruit mercy shall shew selfe latter day therfore sense hope blaspheme holy ghost obtaine forgiuenes life latter iudgement cauil papistes gather hereof sinnes may forgiuen men theyr death easily confuted first foolish wresting worde world come middle time euident men signifieth last day herein also wickednes laid open cauill pretende contrary owne doctrine destinction knowen sinnes freely forgiuen respect offence required satisfaction punishmentes graunt hope saluation except sinnes forgiuen death therefore remaineth dead onely forgiuenes punishment dare denie sentence spoken sinne let go cold substance let kindle purgatory fire flame gotten cold ice matth 12 mark luke 33 either make tree good fruit good el make tree euill fruit euill tree knowne fruit 34 generation viper yee speake good thinges yee euil abundance heart mouth speaketh 35 good man good treasure heart bringeth forth good thinges euill man euill treasure bringeth forth euill thinges 36 say vnto euery idle worde men shal speake shal giue account therof day iudgement 37 thy wordes thou shalt iustified thy wordes thou shalt condemned 33 eyther make tree good may seeme absurd choice giuen men either good euill consider kind men christ speaketh shall easily answered know opinion estimation pharises mindes common people daseled feigned shewe holynesse man durst call lewde dealinges question christe meaning take away viserd commaundeth either good euill haue sayde nothinge contrarye honestie hypocrisie doe challenge themselues tytle righteousnesse vaine sincere vpright putteth nothing choise neither doth giue bridle libertie onely admonisheth shall profit nothing theyr vaine disguisinges long continue duble necessary men either good euill saieth make tree gather fondly thereof euery man owne hande frame owne lyfe maners vpbrayding kind speach wherwith christ scattereth hypocrisie scribe smoake calling perfect pure vprightnesse setteth downe manner way whereby may shewe themselues bee good euill tree witte bring forth good euil fruit▪ ambiguitie sense life scribe infamous amongste men grosse sinnes bewrayed poyson pride ambition enuie thorow owne ouerthwart cauillinges simple people saw christ brought great mischief corner light obiect cannot bee corruption nature man shoulde found perfect euery respect pure sinne aunswere ready christ requyreth exact perfection wherein want onely simple affection without dissimulation pharises whome christ spake far wide scripture calleth euill wicked wholly giuen sathan sincere worshipper god though infirmitie flewe compassed many sinnes grone vnder burden yet called good free mercy god vouchsafeth honourable title aspire goodnes 34 generation viper place christ applyeth similitude tree fruit present speach might thereby discouer inward secrete malice scribe cause standeth much one kind sinne therefore christ inueighed bitterly bewraied false slander euident rest life saith merueile vomit euil word seeing heart ful malice let think reproofe hard truely could haue dealt mildly sinnes deserue sharp reprehension vnconstant men depraue right seeke colour thinges naught wickednesse againste lorde right shoulde thunder vehementlye againste sinnes purpose christe occasion serued condemne wicked sophistrie whiche turned light darkenesse place therefore teacheth howe precious trueth lorde whereof hee sharpe defender reuenger would diligētly considered thē haue wit ready prompt defend al cause set tong sale vtter al forged subtil shift christ especially inueigheth either ambition enuy wicked desire enforceth speak euil nothing consciēce misliketh christ also maner sharper pharises bewitched false perswasion righteousnes milde admonition haue profited litle certeinelye except hypocrite sharply pricked disdainfully despise whatsoeuer said ye speake good thing haue said prouerbial sentenses may alwaies drawn general rule shew commeth passe part sometimes commeth passe cruel sweete alluring word shal deceiue simple subtil shal circumuent vnder cloake simplicitie imagineth wickedlye shal tongue pretend angellike puritie yet cōmon vse proueth true christ saith abundance heart mouth speaketh also old prouerb tongue called character mind certeinly though heart man hath secrete hidden corner euery man dissembleth faultes wonderfull shift yet lorde wresteth al mē cōfessiō bewray tong desire inward affection also noted ende christe vseth parable hee vpbraideth pharises vtter wordes malice cōceiued inwardly knowing sworne obstinate enemy took occasion one cauill laye open al life discredite people credit authoritie great deceaue hurt also though good speaches doe alwaies proceede inward affection heart grow men say outside lip yet alwaies true euil word witness euil heart 36 euery idle word shal giue account argument lesse greater euery idle word called accounte shall god spare open blasphemy sacrilegious reproches vtter glory god idle word takē vnprofitable bringeth neither edifying fruit seemeth hard many consider vse tongue made wil graunt worthy condemned rashly addicte apply friuolous triflles neither smal offence abuse time wastinge vaine matter paul cōmaundeth v col 4 5 carefully redeeme sith man spare speaking wisely moderate himselfe shall break idle speaches god deale v al according extremitie law remained nothing v despaire hope saluation grounded vpon god enter iudgment v free mercy wil forget sinnes deserue innumerable deathes doubt blotting guiltines life also pardon offence vanne speach scripture speaking iudgement god doth ouerthrow forgiunes sinnes yet let man flatter hereby let euery man diligētly endeuor bridle tongue first may speake holy misteries god reuerently soberly may abstain scurrilitie vaine iestings especially enuious euill speaking lastly must giue dilygence speach may seasoned salt col 4 6 37 thy wordes thou shalt iustified applyeth common prouerb present cause doubt saying common mouthes people euery man shoulde either condemned absolued confession christ applieth sēse somwhat differing namely wicked speach shew hidden malice suffiseth condemne man obiection papistes gather wresting ouerthrow righteousnesse fayth childish fancie man iustified owne word speach cause righteousnes faith obtaine fauour god account v righteous pure speach purgeth v frō found wicked tongue foolishly inferred men deserue part righteousnes god place rather strengthneth doctrine though christ entreateth cause righteousnes yet contrarietie betweene two word declareth word iustifie signifieth seemeth absurd papistes say man iustified faith expound made righteous deede vnderstand accounted righteous cleared iudgmente god plainly appeareth many testimony scripture doth christ confirme hee opposeth iustifie condemne one matth 12 mark luk 11 43 vncleane spirit gone man walketh throghout dry place seeking rest findeth none 44 saith returne wine house whence came come hee findeth emptie swept garnished 45 thē goeth taketh vnto seauen spirit worse enter dwel end man worse beginning euē shal wicked generation 24 vvhen vncleane spirit gone man walketh dry place seking rest findeth none saith wil returne vnto mine house whence came 25 commeth findeth swept garnished 26 goeth taketh seuen spirit worse enter dwell last state man worse thē first 43 vvhen vncleane spirit hee pronounceth scribe hypocrite despise grace god conspire deuill iudgement vnthankfulnesse deserueth yet fruit doctrine may largely appeare hee generally declareth iudgement procure themselues despisinge grace offered againe open dore deuil greate waight almoste euery seuerall clause thinges must bee noted order handle summe parable vvhen christ speaketh going deuill commendeth vnto v force effecte grace god ofte commeth vnto v especially god draweth neere vnto v person sonne end delyuered tyrannie deuill hee might take v himselfe christ plainly declare former myracle therefore sith peculier office driue away euyll spirites reigne men well said deuill goeth men christ offereth himselfe redeemer though presence christ effectuall al vnbeleeuers make none effect yet would haue v note end visiteth v comming auayleth selfe lastly euyll spirites doe feele neuer woorketh men deuilles brought conflicte doe giue place vnto power therefore bee noted deuill cast v ofte christ shineth vppon v sheweth testimonie fauour towardes v also miserable condition mankind described vnto v followeth deuill hath dwelling place men driuen thence son god speaketh one perticular man ofspring adam therefore glory nature deuill hath seate v hee dwelleth aswell body soule vvhereby also see spectacle excellent mercye god filthy stable deuill hee maketh v temple himselfe consecrateth v dwelling place spirit thirdly painteth vnto v practise sathan wit neuer ceaseth endaungering v applyeth dayly turneth himselfe euery way short bendeth endeuors work destruction especially vanquished putte flight christe hee enrageth desireth hurt christ maketh v partaker power enemie reigneth v play sport driuen hee soroweth losse pray gathereth new force stirreth al power hath may ouerthrow v againe therefore sayd metaphoricallye walketh drye place banishment grieuous dwelling men like filthy desert sense also saieth seeketh rest long menne fretteth tormenteth himselfe ceaseth try euery way vntill recouer hath lost vvherefore let v learne assoone christ calleth v hotte sharpe comabt prepared v though attempteth destroy menne saying peter apperteineth al without exception goeth aboute like roaring lyon seeking may deuoure 1 pet 5 18 yet plainely taught word christ burneth greater hatred caryed enuious force thē taken snare admonition ought make v afrayde stirre v vp make v diligent keeping watch beeing armed spirituall armor wee may bee strong resist 44 hee findeth emptie christ without doubt meaneth voyde spirit god ready receiue deuill faythful spirit god doth dwel perfectlye fenced euery side hole ginne left open sathan calleth house swept garnished similitude borowed vse men delighted cleannesse neatnesse lodginges deformitie onely bewtiful sathan nothing • auoreth well stinch filthinesse meaning sathan neuer haue conuenient place v byd christ farewel admit guest therefore greatest delightes emptinesse foloweth neglecte grace god 45 hee taketh seuen number seuen taken indefinitely oft place also christ teacheth word fall grace duble endaungered sathan vseth greater libertie ouer v iuste punishment slouthfulnes vvherefore let v thinke deuill ouercome one battell throwne v let v rather remember sith hee hath dwelt v old euer since wee borne hath found experience known al way may enter v common passage open wā teth subtiltie creepe secretely priuy mine secrete ginnes therefore must labour diligently christ ruling reigning v may shut vp passage enemie although assaultes sathan sharpe daungerous cause weaken child god inuincible power holy ghost keepeth safetie know plague onely pronoū ced despisers grace god menne become profane choaking vp light faith suppressinge studie godlinesse matth 12 marke 3 luke 11 46 vvhile hee yet spake multitude behold mother brother stoode without calling miracle 39 euill generation doth onely accuse malice age hee accuseth iewes wicked nation scribe like signifiing disease obstinate stubbornnes came vnto enheritaunce word vsed sometime taken one age somtime countrey nation calleth adulterous corrupt people begotten adultry bastardes beecause degenerate theyr holye father prophetes doe also reproue vnbeleeuers theyr age ofspringe abraham prophane seede chanaan demaunded whether christ sharply reproue thē desired haue signe giuen booke iud 6 17 god sheweth much displeased thing gedeon demandeth signe god angry graunteth request though proceedeth importunately yet god yeeldeth infirmitie god offered willingly signe ezechiah demanded isa 38 22 achas sharply reproued beecause refused demaund signe commaunded prophet isa 7 11 therfore christ doth simply reproue scribe demaund signe vnthankfull god hauing malitiously refused many grace power take shift least obey word doe onely say slouth malice kept eye shut many miracle therefore troubled vaine deuise purpose might freely reiect christe paule condemneth fault posteritie 1 cor 1 22 vvhen saith iewes seeke signes signes shalbe giuen vnto conuicte sundry miracle christ ceased shewe power amongst hee might thereby take al excuse onely meaneth one signe vnto steade vnworthy haue wicked desire satisfied let content saieth signe ionas brought bottome sea preached niniuites shoulde heare voice prophete raysed life againe knowe manye haue interpreted place subtilly sith similitude betweene christe ionas holde perticular poyntes bee seene farre christ compareth himselfe ionah omitting speculation men think one thing meete noted touched euen beecome prophet vnto resurrection haue said contemne sonne god whiche descended heauen therfore remaineth dead rise graue restored life againe wil speake vnto ionas came bottom sea therefore lord cut away al occasion wicked desire saith resurrection would become prophet seeinge would receiue cloathed mortal flesh luke saith would signe vnto ionas vnto niniuites word signe vnproperly vsed shoulde foreshewe thing remoued far common order nature sending ionah wonderful brought belly fish graue might call niniuites againe fell good ground brought forth fruit one corne hundred fold soe sixtie fold thirty fold 9 hee hath care heare let heare 10 disciple came said vnto speakest thou parabls 11 answered said vnto giuen vnto know secretes kingdom heauen giuen 12 whosoeuer hath shalbe giuen shal haue aboundance whosoeuer hath shall bee taken away euē hath 13 therfore speake thē parable seeing doe see hearing eies haue winked leaste shuld see eies heare eares vnderstand heartes shoulde returne might heale 16 blessed eies see eares heare 17 verely say vnto many prophet righteous men haue desired see thing ye see haue seene thing whiche yee heare haue heard thē 1 began againe teach sea side gathered vnto great multitude entred ship sate sea al people sea side land 2 hee taught many thing parable saide vnto doctrine 3 hearken behold went sower sowe 4 came passe sowed fell waye side fowles heauen came deuoured 5 fell stony ground much earth sprang vp hadde deapth earth 6 soone sun vp caught heat root withered away 7 fell among thornes thornes grew vp choaked gaue fruit 8 againe fell good ground yeeld fruite sprang vp grewe brought forth thirtie fold sixtie fold hundred fold 9 said vnto hath eares heare let heare 10 alone aboute twelue asked parable 11 said vnto giuen know misterie kingdome god vnto without al thing done parable 12 seeing may see discerne hearing maye heare vnderstand least time turn sin forgiuen 24 said vnto take heede yee heare vvith measure ye meat shal measured vnto vnto shal giuen 25 vnto hath shal giuen hath shalbe taken away euen hath 1 came passe afterward hee himselfe wente euery citie towne preaching publyshing kingdōe god twelue 2 certein woman healed euil spirit infirmity marye whiche called magdalen went seuen deuils 3 iohanna wife chusa herodes
