heare let heare 9 disciple asked demaunding parable 10 said vnto giuen know secretes kingdome god parable whē see see heare vnderstand somwhat 1 • take heede therefore ye heare whosoeuer hath shalbe giuen whosoeuer hath frō shalbe taken euē seemeth hath luke 10 23 returned disciple said secretly blessed eye whiche see yee see 24 tel many prophet king haue desired see thinges yee see haue seene heare thing ye hear haue heard thing haue wrytten downe luke peraduenture belong time reason seemeth compell separate thinges hath ioyned together one texte first sayth 12 apostle preached kingdome god christ vvhereof gather though ordinarie office teaching yet laide vpon yet continuall helper make people attentiue hearer master though estate farre inferiour yet accoūted helper christ also addeth christ certaine woman company healed deliuered euill spirites infirmity marie magdalene bene tormented seuen deuils hauing company might seeme small honour vndecent sonne god leade woman noted infamie better perceiue sinnes wherwith loden beleeued farre hindering glory christ doe rather amplifie set forth sayd found church chose without spotte wrinckle washed cleansed bloud might make pure beautiful vvherfore miserable shameful estate woman deliuered made greatly glory christe ensignes token power grace luke also commendeth thankfulnesse despising shame world followed deliuerer doubted poynted finger euery company presence christe vnto theatre set foorth shew refuse set shamefastnesse openly broache rather grace christe suppressed hid beholding christe might notable doe willingly suffer themselues thus humbled also singular wonderfull shewe great goodnesse christe towardes marie woman possessed seuen diuils moste vile bondslaue sathan onely vouchsafe honour disciple tooke also company luke addeth surname magdalene may make difference betweene marthaes sister mary whome mention place lvke 3 iohanna wife chusa knowen whether luke would spake marie vnderstode woman also opinion seemeth probable first placed order whome christ shewed great power chusas wife susanna honest matron good name fame added onely healed common disease godly endeuor deserueth much praise riche noble matrones ministred vnto christe owne substance content labour leauing affaire owne house rather folowe enuie many discommodities straunge vncertaine lodging place enioy delicate quietnesse owne house may chusa herodes stewarde like maister much contrary wife minde godly woman throughe feruencie zeale stancie ouercame lette math 2 great multitude resorted vnto vaine euangelists doe speake great concourse people christ beholding tooke occasion compare doctrine sede multitude come togither many place stode doubtfull doe hadde like greedy desire heare like affection profite occasion parable teache seede doctrine fruteful euery though bee sowed farre wide alwayes findeth fruitfull well appoynted earth christe therefore professeth himselfe like husbandmanne goeth foorth sowe many hearer like harde drie earth others like thornie grounde labour seede lost leaue entreatinge meaninge parable vntill come exposition lorde himselfe maketh little onely present reader admonished founde like vnprofitable barren earth farre place come menne starued christ maruell gospell day bring forth frute many whereof slacke slowe others heare negligently others scarce drawne heare 9 hath eares christe doeth wordes declare partly endued true vnderstandinge conceiue hee speaketh partly stirreth vppe disciple shoulde diligently consider doctrine neither easie meete euery man distinguisheth betweene hearer coulde heare others deafe nowe demaunded whereof commeth former haue eares heare scripture testifieth psal 40 6 man make frame himselfe eares owne industrie prepared lord 10 disciple came sayde vnto appeareth mathewes woordes disciple onely respecte themselues also care regarde others vvhen perceiued meaning parable knewe much harder people therefore complaine christe spoken wordes hearer reaped profite also though similitude doe commonly make matter plaine hand yet containe continuall metaphore obscure harde therefore christ propounding similitude couered vnder allegorie could haue spoken plainly fully without figure expoundeth figuratiue speache plaine pithy whiche simply spoken without figure onely effectuall mooue mindes also plainer good therefore consider howe order euery thing spoken 11 giuen knowe mystery answeare christ doe gather god proposeth doctrine saluation mon diuers endes christ declareth spake darkely purpose woordes might seeme harde vnto many shoulde onely beat eares confused doubtfull sounde man shall obiecte contrary saying isai 45 19 haue spoken secrete neyther darke corner sayde vaine seede iacob seke commendation whiche dauid doeth giue lawe psalme 119 19 lanterne • feete giueth wisedome simple aunsweare ready easie woorde owne nature alwayes light light dimmed darkenesse men though lawe couered vaile yet trueth god euident seene eye many bene blinde paule witnesseth truely gospell 2 cor 4 4 hid reprobate ordained destruction whose mindes sathan hath blinded also knowen force lightning whereof dauid maketh mention familiar kinde teaching isai speaketh properly referred chosē people yet alwaies remaineth certaine sure worde god obscure worlde owne blindnesse darkeneth yet lord reserueth mystery reprobate cānot come vnderstanding depriueth light doctrine two wayes sometime speaketh parable whiche might haue bene spoken plainly sometime opening minde plainly without darke speaches figure dulleth sens amaseth cannot see midde day purpose pertaine horrible threat isai 28 11 threatneth woulde straunger people hee woulde speake wyth straunge vnknowen language vision prophetes learned booke shutte sealed wherin could read isa 29 11 booke opened shoulde idyotes stay menne amased cannot reade nowe sith christ dispensed doctrine purpose profit onely fewe whose mindes throughly setteled holde suspence doubt foloweth doctrine saluation deliuered god menne one ende purpose ordered wonderfull counsell shoulde bee reprobate sauour deathe deathe electe liuely sauour life least manne shoulde bolde murmur paule answeareth wordes soeuer effecte gospell yet sauour thoughe deadly doeth alwayes smell swetely god meaning present place may better vnderstode behoueth v sift narowly purpose christ cause end spake first comparison vndoubtedly tendeth ende christ might amplifie set forth grace fauour shewed disciple specially giuen generally allowed man shoulde demaunde whence apostle dignitie priuiledge certainly cause shall founde christe saying giuen excludeth merite desart christe affirmeth appoynted chosen menne whome god hathe especially vouchsafed honour woulde reueale secretes vnto others voide without grace cause difference found god calleth vnto hath freely chosen 12 soeuer hath christ prosecuteth spake euen nowe admonisheth disciple howe liberally god dealeth might make much accounte grace acknowledge themselues bounde hadde receiued greater benefite rehearseth wordes place sense hee speaketh lawfull vse giftes simply teacheth bestowed vpon apostle vpon common sorte men heauenly father would sort aboundantly heape vp bountifull kindnesse towardes neuer forsaketh woorkes owne hand sayde psalme 138 8 beginneth make beautifieth daily vntill length bringeth great perfection cause doeth flowe manifolde grace v hereeof come ioyfull proceeding beholding god deliuerance prouoketh continuall course bountifulnesse richesse innumerable neuer weary enriching child therefore oft lifteth v vp higher ought remember benefit soeuer receiue daily come fountaine would performe worke saluation begon v contrary part christe affirmeth reprobate doe alwaies become worse vntill beinge altogither come naught doe faint owne weakenesse seemeth harde speach taken wicked haue luke mitigateth hardnesse taketh away ambiguitie altering wordes somewhat saying thing shall taken away seemed haue certainly falleth commonly reprobate doe excell many excellent gift shew like child god soundnesse minde voide godlinesse appeareth onely vaine shewe vvherefore mathew doeth rightly say haue nothing accounted nothing god conscience vaine vnfrutefull luke doeth aptly declare giftes wherwith endued prophaned onely made shew eye men else nothing pompe vaineglorious brag heereby also learne seeke profite euery day life god hath condition giuen v taste heauenly doctrine might daily aboundantly fed vntil come perfecte fulnesse marke setteth downe sentence somewhat confusely take heede sayeth lorde sayde vnto haue profited well putteth hope greater grace sayeth heare shall giuen followeth clause agreeth mathewes woordes midst sentence expounded seuenth chapter mathew likely placed owne order euangelists sayd curious setting downe christes sermon heaped oft diuers sentenses togither luke setteth downe sentence diuers place wordes whiche christe spake also noteth diuers cause christe spake namely make attentiue doctrine least woorde life passe foorth vaine oughte receiued take rootes mindes shoulde haue sayde take heede least taken giuen fructifie 13 therefore speake parable sayeth spake obscurely multitude coulde partaker true lighte yet sayeth vaile drawne ouer blind might remaine blindnesse ascribeth faulte thereby commendeth grace giuen apostle sorte giuen commonly cause assigneth none secreat coūsell god reason wherof though hid v yet apparant shall heereafter plainly perceiue though parable haue ende containe darke speaches god would shoulde plainly made knowen yet sayd haue hand proposed christe continuance allegorie doutfull riddle 14 fulfilled prophesie confirmeth prooueth prophesie isai newe thing many profite nothing word god time past olde people founde great blindnesse place prophet diuersly cited newe testament paule actes 28 26 vpbraiding iewes obstinate malice sayeth therefore blinded could see light gospell bitter rebellious god set nearest cause sene openly men epistle rom 11 7 setteth downe cause higher secreat fountain teacheth remnant saued according grace election rest blinded according said isaias c opposition vsed noted onely free election god saueth remnant people foloweth doe pearish secreat iudgemēt god yet righteous paule opposeth remnantes whiche chosen whome god woulde shoulde saued like reason also iohn 12 38 sayeth many beleeued man beleeueth arme lord reuealed presently addeth could beleeue wrytten againe isa 6 9 hath blinded eye hardned heart christ also regard vnto referreth secrete counsell god truthe gospell generally reuealed set foorth farre vnder darke speaches nothing powred people mind grosser blindnesse doe alwaies graunt soeuer god doeth blinde found woorthy plague next cause doeth appeare persones men let principle remaine alwayes certaine sure lightened god saluation singular gift god hath freely chosen reprobate depriued light life whether god withdraweth woorde else holdeth eye eares fast closed heare see see howe christe applieth prophesie prophet present cause hearinge yee shall heare woordes prophet recited neither needefull sufficient christ shewe new strange example many astonished word god saying prophet go blind mindes harden heart mathewe referreth hearer faulte blindnesse hardnesse might saide vppon themselues one cannot separated many cast reprobate sense willingly conceiued malice blinde harden themselues neither otherwise spirit god raigneth wherby electe onely ruled vvherefore let added noted minde whiche god lighteneth spirite adoption therfore rather blinded word god yet fault remaineth willingly blinded minister woorde may comfort themselues haue alwaies successe labour desire yea many far profiting doctrine rather become worse thereby namely thing befalleth vnto prophet doe excell experience wished brought obey god becommeth apply labour bring passe yet lette wonder iudgement exercised time past ministerie prophet also fulfilled day must diligently take hede lest frute gospel pearish throgh defalt mar 12 seeing may discerne sufficeth note briefly largely entreated doctrine properly selfe owne nature cause blindnesse accidental meanes purblinde come foorth sunne eye blinded fault imputed sunne eye woorde god blindeth hardeneth reprobate cōmeth owne wickednes proper naturall thēselues accidental word least time shoulde tourne clause sheweth profite haue hearing vnderstanding namely men turned god may receiued againe grace enioyinge mercy may liue well happely therefore lorde woulde worde preached especially ende renewing mindes heart menne might reconcile contrary side isai heere sayeth reprobate stonie hardnesse remaineth least shoulde obtaine mercy effecte woorde taken away least heartes shoulde tourne repentaunce vnder woorde healinge mathewe comprehendeth deliuerance al euilles prophet also doth doe metaphorically compare people afflicted hande god sicke man lorde releaseth punishment say healeth health dependeth vppon forgiuenesse sinnes marke doeth aptly wel set downe cause fountaine whence proceedeth mitigation punishment lorde well pleased v bestoweth blessing vppon v though sometime hath forgiuen sinne yet ceaseth punish v either may humbled may wary heereafter yet sheweth token fauour hee quickeneth restoreth v moste parte punishmentes taken awaye sinne healinge rightly ioyned forgiuenesse cannot gathered repentaunce cause forgiuenesse thoughe god shoulde receiue repentante fauour deserued euen conuersion selfe token free mercye fauour god onely noteth order thinges followinge fauour god god forgiueth sinnes onely menne whiche displeased themselues mat 16 blessed eye luke seemeth referre saying time yet easily answered heapeth many sentence togither obseruing course time vve wil therefore folow course mathew holdeth setteth downe plainly occasion spake singular grace bestowed vpon admonished lorde exempting common sorte familiarly admit mystery kingdome nowe grace extolled comparison witte preferd olde prophet holy king much excellent preferred vnbeleeuing multitude also christ meaneth euery hearing simple seing flesh saith eies blessed see glory due begotten sonne god acknowledge redeemer liuely image god appeared wherby receiue saluation perfect blessednesse said prophet fulfilled thē learne euery man neighbor shuld fully perfectly taught god obiection also answeared whiche might gathered saying christ iohn 20 29 wher called blessed sawe yet beleeued noted maner seeing namely suche seeing thomas desired serue grosse affection speach wherof christ speaketh common apostle faithfull age seeing hearing hear see christ gospel paul sayeth 2 cor 3 18 appeareth vnto v face face might chaunged image perfection wisedome righteousnesse life giuen shineth therein daily lv 24 king haue desired see present estate church may wel accoūted better estate holy father liued vnder law whō shewed vnder shadow cloud appeareth plainly open face christ vaile tē ple rente wee doe enter faithe heauenly sanctuarie therby haue fre accesse god though father content lot nourished blessed peace mindes yet hindered caried desire abraham sawe iohn 8 56 day christ farre reioyced yet desired haue nearer sight hee obtained desire simeon spake according desire sayd luk 2 29 let thy seruāt depart peace could otherwise vnder burden curse wherby mankind oppressed al enflamed desire promised deliuerāce therfore know famished people hungred christe yet stayed faith grudged god patiently suspended desire vntill full time reuealing math 13 marke 4 luke 8 18 heare ye therfore parable sower 19 vvhen euer man heareth word kingdome vnderstandeth euill one commeth catcheth away sowen heart hee hath receiued sede way side 20 receiued seede stonie grounde heareth worde incontinently wyth ioye receiueth 21 yet hath hee roote himselfe dureth season assoone tribulation persecution cōmeth worde offended 22 receiueth seede amonge thornes hee heareth woorde care worlde deceitfulnesse richesse choake worde made vnfrutefull 23 receiueth seede good ground heareth worde vnderstandeth whiche also beareth fruite bringeth forth hundreth folde sixtie folde thirtie folde 13 againe sayd vnto thē perceiue yee parable shoulde ye vnderstād parable 14 sower soweth word 15 receiue seede way side whome woorde sowen haue heard sathan commeth immediately taketh away word sowen heart 16 likewise receiue seede stony groūd whē haue heard woorde straightway receiue gladnesse 17 yet haue roote themselues endure time trouble persecution ariseth woord immediately offended 18 also receiue seede amonge thornes heare woorde 19 care world deceitfulnesse richesse lustes thing enter choake worde vnfrutefull 20 haue receiued seede good grounde heare woord receiue bring forth frute one corne thirty another sixty hundreth 11 parable seede woorde god 12 beside way heare afterwarde commeth diuell taketh away word heart least beleeu saued 13 stone whiche haue hearde receiue woorde ioye haue rote beleue time temptation goe away 14 fell among thornes haue hearde departure choaked care richesse voluptuous liuing bring foorth fruite 15 whiche fell good grounde honest good hart heare woorde keepe bring forth frute patience mathevve • luke doe sette downe exposition parable christe hadde simply expounded disciple without reproouing marke doeth sharply reprooue slacknesse become teacher others profite others summe doctrine gospell scattered abroade seede doeth bring foorth fruite euery doeth alwayes fall vppon frutefull good grounde rehearseth foure sortes hearer whiche first receiue seede seconde sort seeme receiue seede taketh roote liue third sort corne choaked remaineth fourth part bringeth foorth fruit foure hearer one tenne fortie embrace doctrine bring foorth fruite purpose christ appoynt certain definite number deuide spake equall portion alwaies one encrease faith word sowed sometime aboundance sometime lesse onely teacheth diuers faultes seede life pearisheth many whome either presently corrupteth wythereth little little degenerateth may profite better admonition noted maketh mention despisers doe openly withstand word noted seemeth aptnesse taught greater part doeth vanishe away shall become rest worlde whome doctrine saluation openly debarred nowe wil come perticular poyntes 19 vvhen soeuer manne heareth woorde kingdome vnderstandeth • first maketh mention barren hard groundes receiue sede inwardly heart prepared cō pareth hard dry earth common hi • way continuall treading vppon becommeth hard pauement woulde many sort day haue thoughe offer themselues heare yet stande menne amased feele taste speake fewe woordes differ little blockes stone wherefore maruell vanishe altogether away christe sayeth woorde sowen heart whiche though improper speache yet without reason sinne wickednesse menne taketh away nature woorde retaineth still force seede diligently noted least thinke grace god lost force though effectuall v respecte god woorde sowed heart heart doe receiue meekenesse graffed iames exhorteth 1 21 gospell therefore alwayes power frutefull seede deede luke added deuill taketh away sede heart least beleeuing shoulde saued vvhereby gather hungry birdes behaue themselues seedes time assoone doctrine deliuered enemie saluation present laboureth violence take away canne take moysture bringe foorth fruite also small praise faith called cause saluation 20 hee receiued seede stonie grounde sorte differeth former temporall faith faith season conceiuing seede promiseth fruite beginning heart well throughly brought order may suffice giue continuall nourishment sorte menne also see many day whiche doe greedely embrace gospel shortly doe waxe faint liuely affection strengthen continue constancie vvherefore let euery man examine himselfe throughly least hastinesse giueth great shew speedily vanish men say flame stubble except woorde doe throughly pearce whole heart take deepe rootes faith cannot haue continuall moysture maintaine continue readinesse worthy praised receiue woorde god assoone vttered without delay ioy yet must know purpose vntil faith shall gather perfect strength least wither first springing example christ sayeth offended trouble persecution certainly barrennesse grounde tried heat sunne persecution affliction discouereth vanitie lightly touched know affection well endued earnest desire godlinesse called mathew marke temporiser onely professing thēselues christes disciple time fall away temptation seeme also themselues haue true faith therefore luke christ sayth beleeue time honour giue gospell like faith yet notwithstandinge noted truely regenerate incorruptible seede whiche neuer fadeth peter teacheth 1 pet 1 4 saying isaias 40 8 word god shall stande euer fulfilled heart faithfull trueth god setled neuer fadeth away flourisheth euen ende yet doe louingly reuerence receiue woord god beleue sort differ vnbeleeuers either giue credite god speaketh despise worde onely let v knowe none partaker true faith sealed spirit adoption doe call god father heart also spirite neuer extinguished impossible faith hath engraued heart godly vanish away pearish 22 receiueth seede among thornes thirde place rehearseth inwardly apt nourish seede sowen suffered otherwise▪ bee corrupted spoyled christe compareth pleasure wolrde euill desire couetousnesse affection flesh thornes though mathew onely mentioneth care worlde couetousnesse meaning one vnder word comprehended baites pleasure wherof luke maketh mention kinde euill desire thornes noysome weedes doe choake vppe corne woulde otherwise prosper growe vppe wicked affection fleshe preuaile heart menne ouergrowe faith ouerwhelme force heauenly doctrine yet ripe though euill desire doe possesse heart man woorde lorde make shewe yet seeme beare rule first corne groweth promiseth yeelde fruite growe vppe aloft therefore menne must diligently applie themselues roote vppe thornes heart least worde god choaked man filled wyth great aboundance thornes thicke woode certainly see fewe come ripenesse scarce tenth man applieth himselfe roote vppe loppe cutte great aboundance whiche shoulde mooue menne diligent causeth many carelesse christe vseth phrase deceitfulnesse richesse couetousnesse purposely calleth richesse beguilfull deceitfull men might thereby learne rather take heede beware snare let v remember many affectiōs flesh abundance varietie whereof innumerable many lettes hinderance corrupt seede life 23 hee receiueth seede good grounde christe compareth onely good frutefull grounde whome woorde god onely taketh rootes deepe sound doe also ouercome lettes least hinder frute man obiecte cannot found voide free thornes answeare easie christe speaketh heere perfection faith onely sheweth whome worde doth fructifie therefore though frute small yet soeuer degenerateth frō sincere worship god counted good frutefull grounde behooueth v diligent rooting vppe thornes shall neuer bring passe daily labour remnantes alwaies remaine yet lette euery one v endeuour mortifie kill least hinder frute woorde foloweth next christ teacheth al bring forth frute like measure confirmeth sentence though frutefulnes ground bringeth foorth frute thirtie folde small comparison hundred folde yet see christ ioyneth groundes together doe altogither deceiue labour hope husband man heereby taught despise growe great excellencie householder himselfe thoughe preferre one aboue rest respecte high estate yet vouchsafeth common shewe fauourable goodnesse also towardes inferiours hierome wresteth fondly three degree virgines widowes wiues though frute lorde requireth v onely tied virginitie godlinesse maried oft plentifull bringing foorth frute righteousnesse also noted way christ speaketh hyperbolically encrease hundred folde diuers region time frutefull appeareth many hystoriographers eye witness mathewe 13 marke luke 24 parable put forth vnto saying kingdome heauen like vnto man sowed good seede fielde 25 men slept came enemie sowed tare among vvheat went way 26 blade sprong vp brought foorth frute appeared tare also 27 came seruauntes housholder sayd vnto master sowedst thou good seede thy fielde whence hath tare 28 sayde vnto enuious man hath done seruants sayd vnto wilt thou goe gather vp 29 sayd nay least yee goe gather tare ye pluck vp also wheat 30 let growe together vntil haruest time haruest say reaper gather ye first tare binde sheaues burne gather wheat barne somewhat 36 sent iesus multitude away went house disciple came vnto saying declare v parable tare field 37 answeared sayde soweth good seede sonne man 38 fielde worlde good seede child kingdome tare child wicked 39 enemie soweth deuil haruest ende world reaper angel 40 tare gathered burned fire shall ende world 41 sonne man shall send forth angel shall gather kingdome thing offend doe iniquitie 42 shall cast furnace fire shalbe wailing gnashing teeth 43 shall iust menne shine sunne kingdome father hath eares heare let heare may profite parable worth labour consider purpose christ applieth thinke least confused multitude flatter themselues outward profession gospel sayd field oftē mixed bad seede good day come wherein tare separated wheat therefore ioyne parable last one cause one ende seemeth otherwise doth therfore make mentiō separation least mind godly waxe faint wearinesse beholding confused mixture good euill though christ hath cleansed church bloude shoulde without wrinkle spotte yet suffereth many faultes remaine speake remnantes infirmity fleshe faithfull subiect regenerate spirit god assoone christe hath gathered little flocke vnto himselfe many hypocrite insinuate themselues peruerse men creepe many wicked men thrust themselues commeth passe holy company christ separated vnto himselfe polluted many filthy pollution also seemeth absurde vnto many either vngodly prophane wicked menne nourished bosome church furthermore many vnder pretence zeale frowarde neede thing ordered according desire doeth appeare absolute puritie doe either tumultuously depart churche else ouerthrowe destroy throughe outragious rigour vvherefore iudgement simple meaning parable long churche wandereth worlde shall hypocrite wicked men mixt good syncere child god might arme themselues patience holde theyr faith strong sure amongest offence might troubled moste apte comparison lorde calleth churche fielde faithfull seede though christe doeth say afterwarde field worlde yet without doubt properly applied name church whereof began speache drawe ploughe coastes world till field himselfe whole worlde sowe seede life applied figure world rather agreed part nowe noted meant wheat tare cannot vnderstoode doctrine haue sayd soeuer gospel preached presently corrupted defiled wicked inuentions christ would neuer haue forbid labour strongly purging corruption neither lawfull deale maners men tollerate vice coulde punish shoulde lawfull beare wicked errours whiche ouerthrowe purity faith christ taketh away doubt doeth name call tare child wicked yet againe noted cannot simply vnderstode person men god creation sowed good men deuill euill men vvhich thing therfore giue warning maniches haue abused place might cast colour vppon fained deuice two beginning knowe soeuer corruption deuill men nothing else corruption sound pure nature therefore god maketh electe infected originall sinne good sede creation regenerateth grace spirite deuil createth euil men depraueth created god thrusteth fielde lorde defile pure seede 36 soweth good seede sayde kingdome heauen like sower vnproperly yet sense euident doeth oft befall preaching gospel sowing fieldes tare ouer groweth vvheate hee setteth downe one speciall thinge saying fielde sowed wyth tare deceit ennemie might know came chaunce naturally many wicked menne mixe themselues amongest faithfull one corne lette v learne impute faulte mischiefe deuill condemning shoulde deliuer menne guiltinesse firste lay fault vppon god thys offence befalling church wonder tare doe grow vp lordes fielde sith sathan doeth alwayes watche annoy also without reason christe sayeth minister woorde doe sowe himselfe onely though conuenient restrained person yet hee vseth helpe applieth v instrument tillinge fielde hee alone woorketh v v hee doeth rightly chalenge himselfe whiche sorte common vnto minister therefore lette v remember gospell onely preached commaundement christe direction guiding handes onely author woorke 39 haruest ende worlde troublesome estate churche loaden reprobate ende worlde yet christe doeth therefore prescribe v time prepare v patience least wee shoulde feede selues wyth vaine hope behooueth pastours diligently applie themselues purging churche behalfe good menne helpe farre calling suffer menne haue generally putte helping handes yet shall profite much vtterly purge away filth churche therefore must note purpose christe nothinge lesse sufferance nourishe sinnes onely purpose exhorte faithfull shoulde fainte compelled haue wicked amongest doeth also serue bridle moderate zeale whiche thinke lawfull keepe companie pure angelles anabaptistes also suche like haue wickedly abused texte mighte driue away vse sworde churche answeare easily made themselues admit excommunication rooteth wicked reprobate time godly magistrate exercise sword wicked oft neede shall require take exception saying one space giuen repentaunce whiche punishment death thoughe theefe founde comfort saluation vppon crosse lette answeare suffice christe speaketh heere neither office pastours magistrate applieth hymselfe take away offence wherewith weake troubled see churche gathered onely electe filthy dregges wicked reaper angelles thys woorde may applied thys present purpose reaper fourth chapiter iohn eighte thirtie verse sayde apostle respecte prophet entered labour commaundement enioyned giuen minister woorde shoulde bring foorth frute lorde whiche shoulde alwayes remaine iohn 15 16 whiche also appertaineth corne waxeth white iohn 4 35 requireth reaper also haruest great labourer fewe mathewe 9 37 heere cause comparison sayde planted fielde lorde whiche occupie roumth churche neither obiection christe thirde chapiter mathewe twelfth verse sayd assone commeth foorth gospell haue fanne hand wherwith wold purge floure described beginning purging sayeth cannot broughte passe last day shalbe throughly performed poynts though last putte hande purge church angelles yet beginneth nowe doe godly teacher furthermore attributeth thinges angelles shall stande idle tribunall seat shall offer themselues execute commaundements therefore doe hasten preposterously ouertourne soeuer doeth displease doe preuent iudgement christe muche lieth takinge away office aungelles doe rashly vsurpe themselues 41 shall gather kingdome followeth al doe iniquitie thinge diuers exposition former woordes hee shoulde haue sayde time ripe ready wherein thinges shall restored lawful order wicked shall taken away offence called onely liue wickedly themselues weaken faith many others hinder right course doe vtterly ouerthrowe others cast downe headlonge may take profitable admonition least compassed many offence shoulde goe forwarde slouthfully carelesly wee shoulde earnestly diligently bende selues take heede nicenesse heere also reprooued whiche daintie tourne backe course euery small offence harde graunt whiche conuersant amongest many offence stumble yea sometime fall mindes must strengthened comforted hope doubted sonne god commaundeth goe throughe middest offence also giue strength ouercome also pronoūceth horrible iudgement hypocrite reprobate seeme chiefe citizen church least shoulde lay downe rest vainglorious boastinge phrase fiery fornace metaphoricall speache excellencie glory whiche laide vppe child god doeth exceede beyonde sens canne bee expressed wyth woordes iudgement punishment whiche remaineth reprobate incomprehensible sette foorth shadowe according measure capacitie ignorance whereof made sophisters turmoile themselues vaine disputation weight haue already touched otherwhere know haue prosecuted subtilly euery perticular clause feared least suche subtlety whiche sounde foundation leade v folly rather deale sparingly suche thinges content simple plaine meaning much delighted suche curiositie demaunded howe deuill shoulde sowe tare amongst good seede christe slepte knewe haue thing answeare yet haue endeuoured selfe sparing matter woulde omitte thing woorthy profitable knowen 43 shall iust men shine notable comfort child god nowe lie either ouerwhelmed filthe hid people reputation assaulted reproofes slaunders shall cleare skie cloudes scattered away shine clearly freshly beholden aduerbe time forcible containeth secreate opposition present state last day hope whereof christe comforteth hys faithful one meaning therefore though many wicked one doe nowe flourish alofte churche yet must certainly hope happie daye wherein sonne god extoll child wipe away filthe wherewith beautie nowe ouerwhelmed true glory come promised none whome image god nowe shineth whiche continuall degree glory transformed life godly nowe hid saluation inuisible consisteth hope christe doeth woorthely call backe heauen faithfull may enioy glory promised doubted respecte place daniell hee might thereby rather touche hearer quicke hee shoulde haue sayde whereas prophet preacheth excellent brightnesse come hee noteth withall temporall darkenesse therefore prophesie may haue place mixture wrappeth encloseth elect god reprobate time must borne patience hee maketh equalitie comparing glorie sunne light christe doeth nowe distribute giftes diuersly amongest faithfull also crowne last day must remembred sayde restoring renewing whiche deferde latter comming christe onely campared mistie cloudie estate worlde kingdome father enheritance godly opposed earth might remember pilgrimes might aspire heauen though kingdome god sayde otherwhere v yet shall fully enioy vntill god mathewe 13 marke 4 luke 13 31 parable put forth vnto saying kingdō heauen like vnto graine mustard seede man taketh soweth field 32 vvhiche indeede least seedes growne greatest among hearbes tree birdes heauen come buyld braunches thereof 33 parable spak kingdome heauen like leauen woman taketh hideth three peck meale tyll leuened 34 thinges spak iesus vnto multitude parable without parable spake 35 might fulfilled spoken prophet saying wil open mouth parable wyll vtter thinges haue beene kepte secrete foundation world 26 also sayde kingdom god man shuld cast seede groūd 27 sleepe rise vp night day seede spring grow vppe knoweth 28 earth bringeth forth fruit selfe first blade eares full corne eares 29 soone fruit sheweth selfe anon putteth sickle haruest come 30 said moreouer whereunto shal liken kingdome god comparison shal compare 31 like graine musterd seede sown earth least seed earth 32 sowne groweth vp greatest hearbes beareth greate braunches fowles heauen may build vnder shadow 33 many parable hee preached word vnto able heare 34 without parable spake nothing vnto expounded thinges disciple apart 18 sayde kingdome god like wherto shall compare 19 like grain • musterd seede man tooke sowed garden grewe waxed great tree fowl heauen made neastes braunches therof 20 againe hee said wherunto shal lyken kingdom god 21 like leauen woman tooke hidde three peckes floure till leauened 22 hee wente city townes teaching iournying towardes ierusalem parable christ encourageth disciple least beeinge offended small base beginninges gospel giue backe vve see proudly prophane men doe despise scorne gospel brought meane simple minister receiued lyking whole worlde hath disciple part men estimation reputatiō euen common people vvhereby commeth passe weake doe despayre successe measure beginninges lord beginneth kingdome purposely meane contēptible beginning proceeding hoped doe better set forth power therefore kingdome god compared grain musterd seede least amongst seedes yet encreaseth height becōmeth tree wherin birdes doe buyld neastes also compared leauen whiche though smal doth yet spread force greet heape meale leauened therewith therefore shew kingdome christe bee contemptible eies fleshe bloud let v learne lift vp mindes great inestimable power god created thing nothing dooth daylye rayse vp thinges aboue measure man vnderstanding let v let alone proud mē doggish scornings vntill lord amase looke meane season let v faint harted let v arise faith pride world vntil lord shew forth woonderfull testimonie power wherof speaketh word leauen somtime taken worst parte christ warneth take heede leauen scribe like manner paul teacheth 1 cor 5 6 litle leauen sowreth whole lumpe simply noted applying present cause kingdome god kingdom heauen haue spoken otherwhere mar 26 kingdome god though similitude tendeth purpose two former yet christ seemeth earnestly apply speach minister word least wax cold theyr office fruite theyr labour doth presently appeare therefore setteth husband menne follow hope time reape doe cast seede earth vexed greedines neuer quiet goe rest arise againe ordinarily apply theyr daily labour refresh themselues nightly rest vntill corne waxe ripe length due time therefore though seede word lye hidde tyme choaked drowned yet christ commandeth godly teacher good comfort least distrust shuld abate diligence mat 34 thinges spake vnto although mark saieth expresly christ spake vnto able heare yet seemeth probable vsed continuall parable much instruction sake make hearer attentiue apt time hee expound familiarly disciple aparte people vvas ignoraunt common people nay verely familyarly deliuer meaning mind vnto lest others suspence vntil shuld become apt ripe certeine entraunces gospel fuller plainer shew declaration differd vnto time fit shew repugnācie seemeth betweene saiing math prophesie isaiah alleaged litle easily answered though kept back light doctrin reprobate yet notwithstanding applied himselfe capacitie thereby made inexcusable therefore folowed kinde teaching hee knew apt agreeable hearer hee know bee yet sufficiently prepared learne 35 might fulfilled matthew meaneth psalme citeth peculyar prophesie christ maiestie spirit shone wordes prophet euen force set forth word christ prophet beginninge speake couenaunt god whereby adopted seede abraham daily benefit towards people whol gouernment church beginneth great maiestie psalme 78 2 wil open mouth parable wil speake lught tryfles speake wisely earnest matter hee meaneth also hard sentenses repetition commonly vsed psalme word heere first vsed hebrewes signifieth comparison resemblance refer woord graue sentenses similytudes moste part doe adorne sette foorth wordes second word vsed doe call sometimes ryddles hard speaches sometimes apothegmes though matthewe seemeth allude word parable yet doubted hee meaneth christ spake figuratiuelye phrase speach beeing notable common speache common sorte might giue dignitie weight saieth fulfilled written psalme hee saieth entreated secrete misteries god allegory figure least doctrine waxe vile vvee doe also gather hereby absurditie christ spake darkely people diuerse endes though conceale spake reprobate yet applyed speach woordes full heauenly diuine maiestie men astonished myght perceiue lv 22 iourneying towards hierusalem doubtefull whether luke spake one onely iourney whether meaneth christ hadde walked iudea gone coastes thereof teaching wont feastes goe vp hierusalem former part sentence seemeth note continual trade christe life entred office inioyned father vvherefore latter part may agree therwith meaning must oft feast dayes came hee frequented holy assembly others matth 13 mark luke 44 againe kingdome heauen like vnto treasure hidde field man hath found hideth ioy therof departeth selleth al hath buyeth field 45 againe kingdome heauen like merchaunt man seeketh good pearles 46 vvho hauing founde pearle great price went sold al bought 47 againe kingdome heauen like vnto draw nette cast sea gathereth kindes thinges 48 vvhich ful men draw land sit gather good vessel cast bad away 49 shall ende worlde aungelles shall goe forth seuer bad amongst iust 50 shall caste furnace fire shalbe wasling gnashing teeth 51 iesus said vnto vnderstand yee thing said vnto yea lord 52 sayde hee vnto therefore euerye scrybe taught vnto kingdome heauen lyke vnto housholder whiche bryngeth foorth treasure thinges newe olde two former similitude tend end teach faithfull preferre kingdome heauen whole world therefore renounce themselues desire flesh least shoulde way hindered obtaining great good also admonition necessary v enchaunted deceiteful allurementes world heauenly life remembred carnall spiritual grace god lesse esteemed v therfore doth christ rightly extol much excellencie eternal lyfe grieue v leaue whatsoeuer otherwise esteemed deare vnto v firste hee saieth kingdome heauen lyke hidden treasure moste parte sette much thinges apparant new spiritual lyfe proposed gospel regarded lyeth hidde shut vp vnder hope therefore apt comparison treasure whose value decayeth though lye vnder earth hydde whelmed eies menne woordes wee taught rich spirituall grace god accounted viewe flesh outward shew treasure though hidde yet bee preferred aboue gorgeous rich similitude dooth likewise expresse one pearle though small yet much esteemed skilfull merchaunte doubteth sell landes house buye therefore though wisdome flesh apprehendeth excellencie heauenly life yet wee doe consider dignitie thereof requireth except wee readie denie thinges shew gloriouslye eye vnderstand summe parable namely apt receiue grace gospell regarding delightes wholy addict themselues study obtaining noted christe saieth hidden treasure pearle much esteemed menne would sel al haue price set treasure founde knowne skilfull marchaunte hath estimation pearle wordes knowledge fayth noted christ haue said common sort make account kingdom heauen men without vnderstandinge cannot see sufficiently incomparable treasure lord offereth gospel yet demaunded whether necessary renounce good thinges enioying eternall life answere briefly simple meaning wordes gospel hath honour due except preferre aboue rich delightes honour aud commodity world farre satisfied spiritual grace promiseth neglect thing soeuer withdraw v behoueth losed frō al hinde • ances aspire heauen therfore christ doth exhort faithful one denial thing let pietie yet graunteth vse enioy temporal benefit god vsed 46 bought christ meaneth word buying men bring recompence whereby might purchase thē selues heauenly life know vppon condition lorde calleth faithful people isa 55 1 come buy without siluer c though heauenly life whatsoeuer pertaine bee free gift god yet said buye wee doe wyllingly bridle desire flesh thereby hindered obtaining paul saith philip 3 8 al thinges losse dongue might winne christe 47 like vnto draw nette christ teacheth new thing confirmeth similitude wee church god mixed good euil long conuersant vpon earth yet may end parable purpose witte christe onely remedyeth offence troubleth many weakelinges beecause puritie founde world wished also might keepe disciple feare modestie least shuld contente themselues vaine title faith naked profession doe willingly allowe endes christ teacheth mixture good euill must patiently borne vntill end world true perfect restitution church shall time admonisheth sufficeth nay purpose v gathered sheepfold except peculyar chosen sheepe purpose belongeth saying paule 2 tim 2 19 lord knoweth therefore let euery one calleth name lord departe iniquitie also compareth preaching gospel aptly nette drawne vnder water wee might know present state church thing cōfused though god god order confusion commendeth discipline vnto v yet time graunteth hypocrite place amongst faythfull vntill last day doe bring kingdome perfect order therefore much v lyeth let v endeuour correct vice let filthines seuerely purged yet shal church free wrinckles spot christ shal separate lambes goates 51 vnderstand yee thing must remembred wee saw parable expounded priuately disciple lorde hath familyarly louinglye instructed also admonisheth hath employed labour teaching might wise themselues impart vnto others committed thē meanes sharpneth prouoketh endeuour learne therfore saieth teacher like housholders careful shal liue themselues haue also prouision laid vp manner woman toucheth sinner 40 iesus answered said vnto simon haue somwhat say vnto thee sayde maister say 41 certeine lender hadde two debtor one ought fiue hundred penny fiftie 42 vvhen nothing pay hee forgaue vvhich therefore tel wil loue 43 simon answered said suppose forgaue said vnto thou hast truely iudged 44 hee turned woman said vnto simon seest thou woman entred thyne house thou gauest water feete hath washed feete teares wiped hayres head 45 thou gauest mee kisse thee since time came hath ceased ki • se feete 46 myne head oyle thou didst annoint hath annoynted feete oyntment 47 vvherefore say vnto thee many sinnes forgiuen shee loued much litle forgiuen doth loue litle 48 hee sayde vnto thy sinnes forgigiuen thee 49 sate table beeganne say within themselues euen forgiueth sinnes 50 said woman thy faith hath saued thee goe thy way 36 one pharises desired history declareth ouertwhart know office christe conceiuing yea seeking taking offence pharisee inuiteth christ wherby gather one neither enuious violent enemy doctrine neither proud contemners though hee meeke presently offended sawe woman gentlye admitted christ opinion haue beene driuen company speach therefore denieth prophet knew mediatour whose peculiar office bee reduce miserable sinner fauour god truely somwhat vouchsafe christ honour prophet ought also haue enquired end sent bring short enioyned father hee neglected grace reconciliation speciallye bee taken holde christe hee thought prophet certeinely woman ought haue bene reiected grace christe sinnes abolyshed obteined new righteousnesse simon deceiued onely considering christ came saue lost coniectureth rashly hee could discerne worthye vnworthy least disdainefulnes ouerwhelme v let v know first christ giuen delyuerer miserable lost men restore death life let euery man examine himselfe life shall come passe shall wonder others receiued v man shall bold preferre himselfe aboue others hypocrisie onely puffeth men vp securitie despise al others 37 woman citie sinner word word haue trāslated erasmus thought best vse preterplufect tence verb least think yet haue bene sinner leaueth meaning word luke woulde note behauiour woman men thought though sodeine chaunge hadde made womanne god shee yet infamy former life yet extinguished amongst men therfore common iudgemente shee sinner wicked shamefull life vvhereuppon simon dooth euill inferre christ spirite discretion knewe infamy commonly knowne 40 iesus answered christ declareth aunswere muche simon deceaued reuealing setting forth silente secrete thought prooueth hee hath greater excellencie prophet answereth word refuteth kept secrete within simon sake onely may thereby learne feared hee shoulde reiect sinner ready lesse lyberallye outstretched armes receiue gentlye louinglye call 41 two debters summe parable simon erred condemning woman heauenly iudge hath cleared proueth righteous hath satisfied god sinnes forgiuen otherwise similitude agree christ saieth debtes freely forgiuen debters able pay therefore maruaile many interpreter grosly deceaued though woman shoulde obtaine forgiunesse teares annoynting kissing feere argument christ vseth taken cause effect order first receiue benefit giue thanks free forgiunesse heere noted cause mutuall loue summe argument wherby christ proueth woman reconciled god gathered fruites latter effectes 44 hee turned woman lord seemeth compare simon woman maketh bound onelye small offence manner graunting haue said simon imagine thy guiltinesse small lorde hath deliuered thee woman ouerwhelmed many grieuous sinnes yet thou seest forgiuen doth testifie deede meane teares thus abundantly shedde continual washing feete precious ointment confesseth selfe haue bene ouerwhelmed wonderfull weight damnation embraceth mercie god much carnestly much shee acknowledgeth selfe haue greater neede therfore christes word gathered whether simon debt small whether hee deliuered guiltines rather beleeued blind hypocrite yet drowned filthines sinnes christ rested vpon one thing though bene wicked woman yet manifest signes righteousnes testifie thankfulnes omitted kinde duetie declared al meanes could much bound god yet christ admonisheth simon cause hee shoulde flatter himselfe though free al fault also neede mercie himselfe please god without forgiunes hee ought signes repentaunce thankfulnes consider whatsoeuer woman sinned forgiuen wordes noted wherein woman preferred aboue simon namely shee washed christes feete teares wiped hayres commaunded giue much common water shee ceased kisse feete vouchsated receiue christ kisse salutation guest powred pretious ointment vpon feete annoynted head oyle also cause lorde singular example sparing moderate life suffered cost oyntment beestowed vppon beecause miserable sinner shoulde meanes testifie shee ought desired delightes allured pleasaunt sauour allowed glorious decking looked onely earnest testimonie wordes see great desire pietie womanne peruerse iudges except iudge thereby god hath already bene mercifull vnto free forgiunesse hath order gone christ doth dispute price men obtaine grace god proueth god hath forgiuen miscrable sinner mortall man hard 48 thy sinnes forgiuen thee may bee demaunded ende christ promiseth againe forgiuenesse obtayned whereof shee assured say spoken much sake others iudgement especiall regarde shall euidently appeare thinges follow meruaile shee shoulde againe bee absolued christes wordes hadde tasted grace perswaded hee onely sanctuary saluation necessary fayth alwayes goe aske lorde hee would forgiue sinnes neyther make prayer vaine thing needlesse heauenly iudge would seale mercy heart meanes quiet conscience therefore though woman conceaued faith faith obtained yet promise superfluous much auailed confirmation faith 49 sate table beganne say heere perceiue againe menne knowing office christe doe thereof gather themselues new offence roote euil manne searcheth owne misery without doubt would prouoke menne seeke remedy meruaile hypocrite sleepe sinnes murmur straunge wonderfull matter christ forgiue sinnes 50 thy fayth hath saued thee christ appease murmurer withal comfort womanne prayseth fayth haue sayde howsoeuer grudge establishe thou thy selfe constantly fayth hath brought thee assured saluation yet christe reserueth vnto himselfe right giuen father power healing sayth rightly directed declareth woman lead rashnes ignoraunce come vnto direction spirit shee held right waye fayth vvhereof followeth cannot beleeue sonne god make iudge life death ought beleeue christ heauenly father hath giuen power forgiue sinnes assoone faith applyed honour necessitie taken saying also errour confuted thinke sinnes redeemed charitie christ setteth downe farre meanes embrace mercy offered fayth last clause noted incomparable fruite fayth scripture oft commendeth witte bringeth peace ioy conscience least disquietnesse trouble tossed hyther thither matth mark luke 10 38 came passe went entred certeine towne certeine womanne named martha receiued house 39 shee sister called mary whiche also sate iesus feete heard preaching 40 martha cumbred aboute much seruing came saide maister doest thou care sister hath left mee serue alone bid therefore helpe 41 iesus aunswered sayde vnto martha martha thou carest art troubled many much disdained withdraw v heauen know men created end labour sacrifice doe please god better euery man labour calling apply himselfe lyue profitably common wealth ignorantly haue abused wordes christ proue deuice shall easily appeare plaine sense luke saieth mary iesus feete doth meane nothing else al lyfe time lord rather commandeth time deuided studieth profit god schoole ydle negligent hearer put practise learned time hearing tyme labouring therefore monkes doe fondly wrest place though christ compare contemplatiue life labouring life christ doth simply shew end would receiued though hospitalitie martha worthye cōmendation praised yet christ noteth two fault first martha exceeded measure busiyng self christ rather enterteined sparingly small charg thē holy matrō shuld take much paine second fault martha withdrawing self occupied superfluous labor made cōming christ vnprofitable l noteth excesse mētioneth much seruing christ content litle asmuch man receiuing prophet shuld haue regard hear shuld rather bury al doctrine great supefluous preparatiō lawful receiuing prophet whē profit god appoynteth offreth v wee see diligence martha worthy cōmendation yet without faultes also fault martha pleasing herselfe troublesome labour despised godly desire sister hadde learne example warned take heede alwayes least weldoing preferre themselues aboue others 42 one needefull expound coldly one kind meat sufficient others dispute subtilly besides purpose vnitie christ bent himselfe way namely whatsoeuer faythful take hand doe whereto soeuer apply themselues yet one end meete yt al thing shuld referred summe therefore wander vaine direct al action certeine end therefore hospitalitie martha faultie principal matter neglected wholly caryed away taking care busines yet meaning christ al thinges nothing onely excepted order must wisely holden least accessary cal esteemed principal may hath chosen good parte comparison foolish absurd interpreter doe dream christ onely saieth mary occupyed holy profitable exercise frō ought drawn haue said thou mightest wel haue reproued thy sister following idlenesse occupied vaine care desiring thing meete calling haue layde whole burden prouidinge house vpon thee applyeth selfe well profitably hearing well draw opportunitie alwayes though others doe take latter part otherwise christ sayd mary therfore chosen better part fruit heauenly doctrine neuer falleth away iudgement though reiect yet haue followed think aptly agree meaning christ matth mark luke 12 13 one company sayd vnto maister bid brother deuyde enheritance 14 said vnto man made mee judge deuider ouer 15 vvherefore said vnto take heede beware couetousnes though man haue abundaunce yet lyfe standeth huriches 16 put forth parable vnto saying ground certeine rich manne brought foorth fruites plenteously 17 therefore hee thought himselfe sayinge shal doe haue roume may lay vp fruit 18 hee said wil pull downe barnes buyld greater therein gather al fruit goodes 19 say soule soule thou haste much good laid vp many yeeres liue ease eat drinke take thy pastime 20 god said vnto foole night fetch thy soule thee whose shal thing thou hast prouided 21 hee gathereth rich rich god 13 bid brother deuide lord required giue iudgment deuision enheritaunce refused doe sith made nourishment brotherly concorde office christe onely reconcile men god bring mutuall consent demaunded cause would end strife betweene two brother appeareth two cause especially abstained office iudge first sith iews imagined kingdom messiah earthly take heede least example nourish errour seene deuide enheritaunces rumour deede shoulde presently haue bene spread abroad many hoped carnall redemption gaped greedily wicked gloried hee bring new matter passe hee ouerthrowe state romane empyre vvherefore could better aunsweare haue bene giuen whereby menne might vnderstand kingdome christ spirituall therefore let v learne gouern selues soberly attēpt thing may drawne worst part secondly also lordes wil make difference betweene polytike empyres worlde gouernment church created doctor father shuld sword word cut downe thoughtes affection shuld pearce soules men magistrate deuide enheritaunces theft pope priest condemned pretending thēselues pastor church yet bolde inuade earthly prophane iurisdiction nothing pertaineth office somewhat selfe lawfull yet belongeth euery man also iudgment third perticular reason christe saw man leauing doctrine prouiding houshold commodity disease cōmō many professing gospel doubt abuse pretence encreasing wealth pretend authoritie christ owne gaines may readily gathered circumstaunce exhortation except man abused title gospell owne gaine bene occasion giuen christ condemne couetousnesse therefore text doth sufficiently declare manne faigned disciple whose mind drowned fieldes money bagges furthermore anabaptistes doe foolishlye inferre aunswere lawfull christian man deuide enheritaunces thrust deale worldlye affayres execute ciuill office christe argueth matter selfe owne calling hee ordayned father ende hee saith hee iudge hee hath commaundement therfore let rule force amongste v euery man keepe himselfe within band calling wherein lorde hath set 15 take heede beware first calleth disciple backe couetousnes might purge mindes throughly disease affirmeth lyfe consisteth aboundance wordes noted fountaine inward beginning whence mad desire hauing ariseth people doe commonly iudge man possesseth happier life imagine rich cause blessed lyfe hence commeth intemperatate desire hauing burning furnace sendeth heate yet ceaseth burne within perswaded ryches aboundaunce goodes help present life lord giueth vnto v hand blesteth vse thereof one thought would easily appease wicked desire faythfull finde true theyr owne experience whereof commeth passe stayed mindes depend god alone binde life make subiecte aboundaunce rich rest prouidence god onely sustayneth v power giueth v much meete 16 hee put forth similytude similytude proposeth vnto v glasse lyuely shew sentence menne lyue abundaunce rich sith richest doe also lose lyfe moment helpeth gather vppe great heapes rich al men graunt true christe speaketh nothing vsuall common al men tongue meane season doth euery man apply giue minde doe men rather frame theyr lyues mixe counselles theyr reason may depart furthest god placeing lyfe present aboundaunce theyr rich therefore menne haue neede waken themselues least imagining themselues blessed reason rich entangle themselues snare couetousnesse also parable sette forth vnto v vncerteine shortnes life rich profit nothing lengthening life third thing bee added expressed may easilye gathered former notable helpe faythful seeking daily bread lord whether rich poore rest prouidence 17 vvhat shall doe wicked therefore doubtfull theyr counselles knowe lawefull vse rich dronken theyr peruerse hope doe forgette themselues rich manne setting hope lyfe great aboundaunce shaketh remembraunce death farre away yet dystrust annexed pride couetousnes neuer filled doth yet neuerthelesse vexe rich menne rich manne enlargeth barnes though belly stuffed former barnes yet enough yet christ doth expresly condemne hee dooth parte diligent carefull housholder laying vp prouision bottomlesse deepe would swallowe vp deuoure many barnes greedy couetousnes whereof foloweth hee knewe true vse plentifull prouision nowe exhorteth himselfe eating drinking remembreth longer manne becommeth proud aboundaunce wee doe dayly see euident example insolencie prophane men set heap rich brasen fortress death vvhen saith soule eate mery speach great force phrase hebrewes speaketh vnto yet would declare hath aboundance fil desire minde sens nothing else life power rich manne accounted owne hande doe therefore giue warning doe without cause imagine spoken aungelles rich manne reproued follye hee knew lyfe depended 21 hee gathereth rich present season shewed galilean whose bloud pilate mingled owne sacrifice 2 iesus answered saide vnto suppose yee galilean greater sinner al galileās haue suffered thing 3 tell nay except yee amend liues yee shall al likewise perish 4 think eighteene vpon whome tower sileam fell slew thē sinner aboue al men dwell hierusalem 5 tell nay except amend liues yee al shal likewise perish 6 spake also parable certeine manne figtree planted vineyarde hee came sought fruit thereon found none 7 said dresser vineyard behold three yeares haue come sought fruite figtree finde none cut downe keepeth also ground barren 8 answered saide vnto lorde let alone yeare also till digge rounde doung 9 beare fruit wel shalt thou cut downe 2 suppose yee place verye profitable euen cause disease engrafted almost v beeing sharpe seuere iudges others flatter selues sinnes falleth doe onely exaggerate sinnes brother sharply meete also aduersitie come vnto condemne wicked men reprobate meane whosoeuer touched hand god sleepeth carelesly owne sinnes god fauourable mercifull wherein double fault oft god chastiseth man sight admonisheth v iudgementes euery one shoulde learne examine themselues consider haue deserued spareth v time benignitie mercy wherby calleth v repentaunce ought farre v taking occasion thereby sluggishnes christ therefore might correct wicked iudgement wherein become enemy misery affliction hee might withall shake away pleasure wherein euery man flattereth himselfe first teacheth worst hardest handled al others beecause god executeth iudgementes order maner hee shal think good presently punished others rest long idlenes pleasure saith many calamity befall world ar many testimony wrath god vvherby gather destruction remaineth v except amend thē aryseth occasion exhortation brought worde pylate mingled mannes bloud sacrifice witte sacrifises haynous deede might come detestation likelye reproach done samaritanes fallen pure worshippe lawe easie readye matter iewes condemning samaritan iustifie selues lord turneth way wickednesse whole nation odious infamous vnto demādeth whether thinke wretch slaine pilate worse others haue sayd vnknown vnto land ful wicked men remaine many yet aliue worthy punishment blinde therefore wicked iudge measureth sinnes men present punishment worste man first punished many lord chuseth fewe punished whose person teacheth rest auenger might feare spoken samaritanes came nearer iewes themselues dayes eightene menne slaine fall tower hierusalem affirmeth wickedst destruction sayth example terrour sette foorth vnto menne god hath shewed token iudgement vppon others shall nothing rather escape hand though borne time christ forbiddeth faithfull shoulde diligent considering iudgements god appoynteth order holden begin owne sinnes hereof shal great profit come shall voluntarie repentance preuent iudgements god purpose exhortation paule doeth also pertaine ephes 5 6 let man deceiue vaine word thing commeth wrath god vpon child disobedience 4 hee spake also parable summe tendeth purpose many worthy destruction tollerated time yet shall gaine nothing delay goe forwarde obstinacy hence commeth wicked flatterie wherein hypocrite doe harden themselues become obstinate consider owne misery except enforced therefore long lord winketh suspendeth correction imagine themselues well agreed nourish vppe themselues securitie made couenaunt death graue isaias sayeth 28 15 therefore doeth paule enuey vehemently romanes 2 5 heape vp selues wrath god latter day knowe tree somtimes preserued alwaies profitable frutefull owner carefull wise husbandman attempteth trieth euery way stocke vppe field vineyarde heereby taught lorde hath great reason forbearing doeth presently reuenge himselfe vppon wicked deferreth punishment vvhereby mannes rashnesse put silence least shuld bold murmure chief iudge menne doe alwayes execute iudgements like sorte comparison heere made betweene lorde stewarde minister god doe exceede mercy meekenesse lord doeth onely prolong life sinner hee also husbandeth diuers wayes hee might gather better frute mathewe marke luke 13 10 hee taught one synagoguei sabboth day 11 behold woman spirit infirmity 18 yeres bo • ed • gither could lift vp selfe wise 12 vvhen iesus sawe called said woman thou art losed thy disease 13 laid handes immediately made straight againe glorified god 14 ruler synagogue answeared indignation iesus healed sabboth day sayd vnto people sixe dayes whiche men ought woorke therefore come healed sabboth day 15 answeared lord sayde hypocrite doeth eache one sabboth day lose oxe asse stall leade away water 16 ought daughter abraham sathan bounde loe 18 yeares losed bond sabboth day 17 sayde thing aduersaries ashamed people reioyced excellent thing done haue determined gather togither one place thinges red diuers place set luke alone without expresse nothing time haue sayde euangelistes nothing curious behalfe returne shall better common harmonie heere report made myracle healing woman iewes maliciously conceiued offence lord healed sabboth day luke sayeth woman holden spirite infirmitie body shrunke vp shrinking vp synewes doth otherwise describe kinde disease seemeth common disease physitions knew therfore calleth spirite infirmitie knowe deuil applieth himselfe plague men strange vnwonted disease vvherin diuine power christ shewed self euidently triumphing ouer sathan sathan ruleth ouer men owne pleasure hath power giuen lorde hurt lorde onely authour good thing yet doeth chiefly shew glory especiall extraordinarie benefites also would haue power tyrannie sathan especially knowen extraordinarie scourge though also vseth hand light chastisement doeth daily chastise v 12 vvoman thou art losed christ myracle others giueth testimony power grace saith came cause might helpe misery power expressed word womā thou art losed authority saith deliuerance hand yet addeth outward signe vse wherof haue entreated people glorifieth god testifieth v heauenly benefite euident obscure woorke whiche might disputation applied either way gaue great certaine occasion praising god vvhereby wickednesse master synagogue reuealed 14 sixe dayes controller dareth condemne christe openly turneth poyson frowardnesse way condemning christ ouerthwartly person common people growen malice madnes without reason warneth sixe day appoynted labour wickedly folishly defineth labor permitted 6 day vvhy doth also forbid thē entring synagogue least shoulde breake sabboth vvhy doeth commaund abstaine exercise godlinesse men restrained frō owne work sabboth day wicked tie restraine spirit god commandeth come healed day though power god lie slepe sabboth shoulde rather day exercise saluation people purpose holy assembly faithful seeke craue aid helpe god therfore wicked hypocrite speaketh lawfull obseruation sabboth hinder course god benefites shoulde exclude men calling vpon depriue grace 15 eache one sabboth day vvhen easie matter refel grosse malice diuers argument christ content one lawfull shewe kindnesse sabboth day beastes faine preposterous worshippe day child god holpen double comparison woordes christe beast daughter abraham haltar wherwith asse oxe tied manger bandes sathan wherin holdeth men bound destruction sayth scrupulous obseruers sabboth dare lose ox ass may led water shall lawful performe like duety electe people god especially greater necessity requireth namely manne deliuered snare sathan though wicked reprehender held peace shame yet see christ wrought myracle notable wicked cauil neither maruell sathan applied study endeuour purpose hee mighte peruert glory christe ceaseth daily scatter cloudes might obscure holy woorkes faithfull noted christe calleth daughter abraham whose body bene▪ 18 yeres enthralled sathan called onely respecte stocke iewes generally proude title one true naturall member church vvherein also behold paule teacheth 1 cor 5 5 deliuered sathan destruction flesh spirit might saued day lord continuance time teacheth v despaire though lorde doeth presently heale misery mathewe marke luke 13 31 day came certaine pharisies sayde vnto depart goe hence herode seeketh kill thee 32 sayde vnto goe yee • tell foxe beholde cast deuils heale still day morowe thirde day shall perfited 33 neuerthelesse must walke day morowe day followinge cannot prophet pearish ierusalem also cannot certainly coniectured befell euident christ galile course trauaile would seeme friendes perswade herodes iurisdiction hee would safe vnknowen affected gaue counsell rather coniecture sawe moste parte people giuen christ doctrine gospell euery receiued assaied driue place noted warner luke sayeth pharisies know secte mercifull christe probable carefull life vvhat certainly purpose casting feare driue away corner hoped shoulde come passe shorte time authority shoulde decay whole doctrine vanish away yet must consider purpose sathan chief master framer deuise fearing sonne god sought hinder course gospell nowe inuenteth frameth newe terrours wherwith might discourage minister christ enforce leaue course 32 tell foxe beholde cast deuils certaine hee speaketh herode antipas though maners foxe disposition lesse seruile crafty yet thinke comprehendeth subtelty whole life vnder name foxe secreat deceit attempted vndermine doctrine gospell open warre durst sette vppon christe declareth though crafty yet shoulde preuaile nothing hys deuices sayeth guile soeuer deuiseth day morowe doe office laide vpon god come ende race shall offered vppe sacrifice yet meaning woordes may plainly sette downe vnto v first part sentence christe graunteth third day shortly die thus declareth fear death driuen duetie whiche setteled purpose minde goeth without feare addeth vaine shew feare obiected false fained warner daunger death ierusalem seconde parte reprooueth pharises sharply doe see shall butcher warne take heede herode though vpbraidinge goeth sayeth ready die ierusalem also denne theeues almost prophet slaine true many slaine otherwhere especially time cruell rage iesabel hotte continually prophet place cruelly dealt christ layeth woorthely reproofe vppon wicked inhabitant holy citie part befell prophet slaine sith wickednesse came thence wherewyth iudea filled also fielde wherein god exercised prophet knowe doctrine gospell shineth nearer commeth wicked madder become yet horrible example place chosen sanctuary worship god house lawe heauenly wisedome defiled one two murder ordinarie slaughter prophet heereby appeareth howe obstinate vnthankfulnessse world refusing sound doctrine thoughe exclamation followeth presently luke seemeth ioyned christ heereof taking occasion enuey ierusalem yet rather thinke luke sayd ierusalem embrued prophet bloude yea continuall course many age cruell sacrilegious slaughter house occupied murthering prophet presently according maner addeth sentence whiche agreed speache see diuers place vnwōted thing gather one place saying christ vttered sondry time mathewe marke luke 11 37 spake certain pharisie besought dine hee went sate downe table 38 pharisie sawe hee
