apostle returned tolde great thing done tooke went aside solitarie place neare citie called bethsaida 11 people know folowed receiued spake vnto thē kingdome god healed neede healed 12 whē day began wear away 12 came sayd vnto send people away may go townes village round lodge gette meat heere desart place 13 sayd vnto them▪ giue yee eat sayde haue moe fiue loaues two fishes▪ except shoulde goe buy meat al people 14 fiue thousand men saide disciple cause sitte downe fifty companie 15 caused sitte downe 16 tooke fiue loaues two fish looked vppe heauen blessed brake gaue disciple set people 17 eate satisfied taken vppe remained thē 12 basketes full broken meat 13 vvhen iesus heard iohn reporting hystory mentioneth cause iesus went ouer shoar marke also luke doe somwhat differ mathew teach cause iourney might giue rest disciple wer returned frō ambassage discord may bee hee would haue disciple aparte desert place might better frame greater matter time new occasion befell death iohn death iohn might terrifie weake mindes sorowfull euente great prophet giue warninge condition remayned certeinely declared iohn taken christe went herodes iurisdiction might turne awaye present fury may gathered christe nowe withdrewe disciple yet fearefull fire went deserte place also vncerteine howe much time apostle spente theyr firste ambassage course tymes either neglected euangelistes strictly obserued haue said otherwhere rather probable sent foorth onely declare message kingdome christe but▪ occasion serued either iterate place time went forth diuers place therefore take gathered togither heereafter might daily folowers ben sayde goe maister euery one continuall ordinarie office teaching preach time return schoole againe might profite better multitude followed though vnknowne christe knew thinges come passe yet man prouide disciple might indeede declare care thē great concourse appeareth famous name euery iewes might inexcusable owne slouthfulnes depriued benefit saluation offered thē yet great multitude enflamed sodaine heate follow christe small number gaue themselues doctrine truely constantly appeareth iohn 14 hee moued compassion two doe expresse plainely especaly marke christe tooke compassion witte saw hungry soules caried hot zealous desire owne dwelling place desert wante doctrine token miserable dissipation therefore marke saieth christ compassion sheepe wanting shepheards acknowledged sheepe spirite godhead hee man hee gaue iudgement present sight smal token piety leaue owne house come flockes prophet god though hee set purpose auoyded sight good note christ mindefull person sustayned office doctour layd vppon therefore ought time account iewes stocke church god vntill estraunge themselues mercifull affectiō preuayled christ wearied disciple almoste ouerwhelmed continuall trouble would yet spare himselfe hee sought time refreshing much himselfe disciple yet necessitie office called new labour willingly leaueth priuate respect employeth himselfe teaching multitude though hee hath put affection doe fall mortall man yet doubt looketh downe heauen vppon miserable sheepe wante shepheard seeke remedy want marke saieth hee taught many thinges preached long might cary away sound profit luke saieth spake kingdōe god effect mathew maketh mention miracle weight get christ name easily gathered omitted doctrine chiefe 15 vvhen euen come disciple frustrate theyr hope see christ busied teaching also people desirous taught thought returning therefore admonish christ regard body send thē away next townes purposely deferde miracle thought worke vnto time first disciple stirred somwhat vp consideration might better profitte thereby circumstaunce time selfe shoulde teache though preuent necessity neither helpeth first yet doth neuer cast away care hath alwayes help ready hand bestow moment 16 giue yee eate miracle fullyer expounded sixt chapter iohn least repetition troublesome reader rather shuld sought yet least nothing shuld spoken briefly set downe summe christ yet hadde employed labour feed soules also extendeth pastorly office euen care also bodyes vvherein also confirmeth saying seeke kingdome god righteousnes thereof thinges shall bee giuen math 6 33 hoped christ alway manner giue foode want hungry yet certeine neuer suffer want thinges maintaine life hee would reach hand heauen hee shal see meete helpe necessity desire christ nourish must also learne desire exquisite deinties content barly bread christe commaundeth people sitte downe company first purpose disposed company myracle myght euident men might easilyer numbred looke vpon others might themselues witness heauenly grace thirdly saw disciple carefull hee would trye obedience commaunding seemed shew iest wonder end christe hauing cates woulde make shew banket purpose also belong thing followe loaues giuen disciple wonderfull plenty grow betweene handes shoulde minister diuine power christ small matter eye witness christ would feele handle power two hundreth peeces money spoken budeus account amounteth value thirty foure frenche poundes esteeme litle bread euery man french souse made account much bread suffice feede people meanely obedience deserueth small praise simply obeying commaundement christe doe commit successe pleasure 19 blessed blessing taken place ofttymes otherwhere giuing thankes christ teacheth v example cannot otherwise eate meates holyly purely except shewe thankfulnes god whose hand come vnto v therefore paule saieth 1 tim 4 5 vvhatsoeuer meates god dooth giue v sanctified word god prayer vvherein declareth beastly men neyther account blessing god faythfully doe praise giuing thankes doe defile pollute filthye pollution theyr owne infidelytie whatsoeuer owne nature pure againe meat doe deuoure polluted defiled christ therefore prescrybed manner eating least wicked sacriledge prophane themselues benefites god lyfting vp eies heauen doe declare earnest vehement affection praiers gesture alwayes necessary pray sonne god would neglect ceremony profitable man infirmity also lifting vp eies fit spur stirre vp sluggishnes mindes much bent downward earth 20 tooke vp fragment remained vvhen fragment left great number men filled twelue time set downe first gaue small lyght myracle men vnderstoode thereby christe power onelye create meates nothing whiche shuld suffice present vse neede could also prouide necessitie come lastlye myracle wrought christ would gathered againe bee notable testimony filled meate shoulde leasure behold though christ doth dayly multiplye loaues neyther feedeth men without handye labour tyllage field yet fruit history extēdeth euen v slothfulnes vnthankfulnes onely hinderaunce doe see aboundaunce corne wherby liue encreased blessing god dayly vppon v also besides refreshing nourishing v also remayneth seede grounde one yeares encrease euery one v thinke without heauenly encrease wickednes hindred whiche blyndeth aswell eies minde fleshe least shoulde behold manifest worke god also christe declareth thing giuen father hand meates fed doe slow come v grace math 14 mark 6 luke 22 straightway iesus compelled disciple enter shippe goe euer sent multitude awaye 23 assoone sent multitude away went vp mountaine alone pray euening come alone 24 ship mids sea tossed waues contrary winde 25 fourth watche night iesus wente vnto them▪ walking sea 26 disciple sawe walking sea troubled saying spirite cried feare 27 straightwaye iesus spake vnto saying good comfort afraid 28 peter aunswered said maister thou bid come vnto thee water 29 saide come peter come downe ship walked water go iesus 30 saw mighty wind afraid hee beganne sinke cryed saying master saue mee 31 immediately iesus stretched forth hu • band caught sayd thou litle fayth wherefore didst thou doubt 32 assoone come ship wind ceased 33 ship came worshipped saying trueth thou art sonne god 45 straightway caused disciple go ship go side vnto bethsaida sent away people 46 assoone hadde sent away departed mountaine pray 47 euen come ship mids sea alone land 48 saw troubled rowing wind cōtrary fourth watch night hee came vpon walking vpon sea would haue passed 49 saw walking vpon sea supposed bene spirite cryed 50 saw sore afraide anon talked sayd vnto bee good comfort afrayd 51 went vp vnto shippe wind ceased sors amased themselues beyond measure meruailed 52 considered matter loaues beecause heartes hardned 21 iesus compeld disciple behoued compell leaue would haue passed ouer place willes also doe herein declare howe much obeye owne minde giue place obey commandement certeinly shew seemed absurd would remaine alone desert place night approched therefore aptnesse taught deserued much prayse authoritie heauenlye maister regarded esteemed might seeme probable contrary part rightly perfectly obey god except simply follow whatsoeuer commaundeth much soeuer sense repugne certeinly god alwaies hath best reason ground counsel commaundement often hideth v might learne selfewise wholly depend vppon thus christ compeld disciple passe ouer hee might frame rule obedience spake neyther doubt would make himselfe way miracle next followeth 23 hee went vp mountaine alone likely sonne god tempest come could hidde neglect prayer preseruation disciple yet meruaile doth rather preuent perill apply himselfe prayer might fulfill partes mediatour hee sheweth himselfe god man gaue testimony nature farre matter required vvhen thinges owne shewed himselfe man praying neither feignedlye shewed sincere affection humane loue towards v matter diuine maiestie withdrew selfe sort yet shewed self length order going vp mountaine hee sought oportunitie might freelyer pray farre noyse vve know easily ardent zeale prayer least disturbance either falleth away else waxeth colde though christ imperfection yet teache v example diligently vse helpes may deliuer mindes snare world free may wholely bent heauen solitarinesse much auaileth prepare themselues praier shoulde diligent hauing god alone witnesse powring heart bosome diligently examine themselues lastly cōsidering themselues haue doe god let lift vp themselues aboue themselues yet noted setteth downe lawe lawfull pray secrete paule also commaundeth v lifte vp pure handes euery 1 tim 2 8 christ himselfe sometime prayed men also taught disciple gathered togither conceiue praiers openly amōgst themselues libertie praying place hindereth shoulde also vse priuate prayer time conuenient 24 shippe nowe middes sea reader shall finde hystorie expounded vpon sixt chapter iohn therefore shorter heere christe suffered disciple tossed troublesome tempest daunger time ende might readier mindes receiue helpe brought contrary winde roase midnight litle thē fourth watche christ appeared three houres ful day faith hardly shakē terrours armes toyled rowing necessitie selfe vrged desire maisters presence grosse blockish afraid sight hadde bene spirite cause marke sayeth heart blinded vnderstoode matter loaues myracle sufficiently taught christe wanted diuine power helpe hee doeth carefully prouide necessity requireth therefore sluggishnes nowe worthily condemned doe presently call minde heauenly power notable token whereof shewed late ought yet present eye fault theyr sluggishnes afrayd beecause profited former miracle rightly became blindnes especiallye reproued forgotten saw late rather applyed mindes consider godheade whereof multiplying loaues testimony euident enough yet mark setteth downe two thinges wordes considered thoroughly glory christ shewed multiplying loaues declareth cause heartes hardened seemeth added onely aggrauating greatnes fault▪ also admonish v infirmity minde aske new eye lord certinely sayde euen beastly ignoraunce vnderstande palpable power god yet mankind sicke disease mardoth purpose make mention blindnes wee might knowe new matter men cannot see manifest workes god vntill lightned aboue moses also said deut 29 4 yet lord hath giuen hearte vnderstand though word heart doth often signifie wil seate affection yet place also place moses cited take mind 27 straightway iesus spake vnto christ known delyuerer offreth himselfe deede hee calleth disciple word knowlede also comfort exhorteth vnto presence haue saide vnderstand present haue assured cause good comfort feare possessed mindes reproueth least hinder delay theyr comforte could ioyfull comforted without al feare necessary feare preuailed shoulde bee appeased least ouerwhelme comforte though voyce sonne god reprobate deadly presence terrible yet described v farre contrary effectes faithful witte inward peace comfortable boldnes obtaineth victory heartes least giue place fleshly feares▪ blinde inconsiderate tumultes trouble v wee vnthankful malitious hold innumerable benefit god buckler rightly cōsidered shuld sufficient stay v vp though high time haue helpe christe appeared yet tempest doth presently cease vntill disciple better stirred vppe desire also hope grace bee noted might knowe lorde dooth without cause ofte tymes defer delyueraunce whiche hee hath hande 28 peter aunswered exception maketh declareth fayth yet ripe thou saith hee commaund mee come heard christ speake therefore doth doubtingly vncerteinly thus wauer yet himselfe small weake fayth breaketh heate inconsiderat zeale ought haue mette himselfe owne measure rather pray christ encrease fayth guiding direction hee might length passe ouer sea mountaines hee nowe desireth rashly flye without winges fayth whereas worde christe firmely rightly setled hearte desireth water firme vnder feete yet doubted affection sprang good beginning degenerateth corrupt extremitie looseth praise goodnes commeth passe peter presently tasteth punishment rashnes vvherefore let faithfull bee taught example take heede rash hastines vvhether soeuer lorde calleth wee must runne diligently passeth shall feele length vnhappy successe passe beyonde owne boundes yet may demaunded christe graunt peter requeste seemeth allow aunswere ready god parte prouideth best v denying thing desire somtymes graunteth requestes hee may better conuince v experience owne foolishnesse dayly graunteth faythfull one meete hee instructeth sobrietie modesty time come furthermore profitable peter rest also profitable v day power christ shewed selfe euidently person peter tooke companion hee walked alone vppon water yet peter knoweth others doe plainely behold beganne sinke rested perfect faith reposed himselfe word god trusting secrete power god make water strong yet christ dealeth louingly suffered altogether swallowed vppe thing befall v peter assoone afrayd beganne sinke fraill vaine cogitation flesh work v sinke midst course affayres yet lord pardoneth infirmitie reacheth hand least water drowne v altogether also noted peter seeing rashnes euil badde successe committeth mercy christ vvherefore though worthily punished behoueth v yet flye hauing mercy vppon v may giue v helpe whereof vnworthy 31 thou litle faith christ doth louingly preserue peter yet doth nourish flatter fault end purpose reproofe▪ wherein weaknesse faith condemned yet demaunded whether euery feare doth argue want fayth word christ seeme note ought doubting faith doth reigne aunswere christe dooth reproue doubtinge directly contrary faith may man may doubt autoritie tradition ye haue ordained ye many like thing 1 came iesus place worthy noted reproued offence lesse daungerous common vve see frowardnes menne way meanes worshipping god dayly deuise new kindes worshipping wiser man would seeme bendeth shew witte way speake straungers houshold church god hath peculiarlye enriched honour holde rule pietie hee hath spoken mouth gad hath prescribed maner worship law hath comprehended perfect holynes part light vaine matter ro obey god obserue hath commaunded themselues gather sundry place many addition whiche authoritie wrest owne deuises end somwhat heades perfecter worde god crepte tyranny men take themselues lyberty commaund seuerely exact obseruation lawes abide least title omitted either cō tempt el negligence also though world cānot abide lawfull gouernment rebellious bearing lord yoake yet doth easily willingly yeelde snare vaine tradition yea many seeme desire seruitude worshippe god defiled ought chiefly principally obeyd authoritie men preferred imperial dignitie commō people hardly tyrannously enforced apply whole endeuour vpon triffles place teacheth v al fained worshippings displease god alone would heard hee might order frame v true pietie pleasure lose labour people satisfied law god weary themselues obseruing tradition men thirdly god iniuried deuises men extold hygh maiestie law shuld fall away reuerence least shuld waxe colde scribe pharises ierusalem declared purpose scribe came iesus yet seemeth probable moued fame come desire learne asmuch seemed fit master though may sent spy howsoeuer matter beecause brought theyr owne selfe lyking leaste offence might easilye exasperate byte gnaw christe vvhereby see hard drawne sound doctrine possessed ambition desire reigne especially addicted ceremony haue bene long accustomed admit new thing obstinately condemne whatsoeuer accustomed short cannot people lordly froward men euangelistes doe make mention scribs pharises yet matthew speaketh entraunce hystory marke placeth meaning one meane sectes scribe came pharises chiefe honoured gouernmente handes meruaile soonest offended contempt lawes themselues made said boasted themselues bee interpreter lawe thereof name giuen corrupted puritie word owne deuises tradition soeuer iewaes came shoppe wherefore became hotter shewed themselues sharper defender 2 vvhy doe thy disciple vvhen controuersie man tradition question politike lawes vse end whereof doe tende purpose prescribe god worshipped diuersitie man tradition must bee distinction vsed manifest wicked doe institute wicked manner worshippinges ful contrary word god others myxing worship god prophane trifle doe defile puritie others whiche haue colour infected notable fault yet cause condemned imagined necessary worship god god meerely obeyed conscience caught snare euident treatie heere latter sort washing hand pharises vrged coulde self condemned wicked superstition el christ would haue suffred water pottes haue beene placed maryage except ceremonie beene lawfull faulte thought god coulde bee otherwise rightly worshipped ceremonie washing broughte firste without goodly pretence know seuerely law god required outward cleannesse lord would haue seruauntes bee stayde carefully take heede spirituall vncleannes law helde meane washinges came doctor vppon whiche thought themselues wise enough except added somewhat worde god hereof came washinges whereof mention lawe lawgiuers themselues would bragge giuen new law onely added certeine caution meanes helpes obseruing lawe god presently corruption followed ceremony brought man beganne accounted part worship god also necessitie layd vppon free voluntary action god said would alwayes worshipped prescripte rule owne word therefore addition lawe tollerable permitteth faythful haue certeine outward rite wherein myght exercise themselues godlynesse hee suffered bee mixed word religion wath handes cause offence set forth large marke summe many customes amongste scrybes took vpon obserue wil secundary lawes inuented curious heades commandemēt god sufficient pertained cup vessel garment thing pertaining houshold touch vncleane defiled thing deuise new washing vaine idle deuice without colourable cloake paule saith col 2 23 inuentions men haue shew wisdome hadde stayde themselues onely law god theyr modestye haue bene approued scrupulous doubtfulnes prouide vncleane person shoulde rashlye without consideration eate meat sufficient lorde purge apparant spottes also deuises neither ende measure could scarse moue finger new blot would arise corruption much worse caste religion vpon conscience guilty vncleannesse oftē wash body water may wold haue borne contempt ceremonie meane men conceiued greater excellent estimation christe disciple seemeth heinous offēce rite appointed elder religiously vsed scribe obserued disciple master professed better matter present estate deliuered also much deceiued compare sprinckling comured water papistes call holy water iewish washinges papistes blot asmuch lyeth one baptisme iteratinge oft applyed exorcismes oyishe sprincklinge supposed force wash away sinnes thing lawfull selfe free corruption yet necessitye vrge alwaies condemned 3 vvhy yee also transgresse commaundements god christ maketh double answere first person say conteineth definition matter cause order otherwise sette downe mark first bringeth whiche christe spake whole matter addeth reproofe wherin heinueigheth hypocrite follow course obserued matth againe lord demaundeth scribe defile law god tradition doth yet plainely delyuer disciple fault obiected hee onely sheweth wicked preposterous froward take grieuously preceptes menne exactly obserued much grieuous matter law god neglected imploy whole endeuor obseruing tradition therfore appeareth moued rather ambition true right zeale prefer men god also doth easily appeare text sense saith commaundements god transgressed openly professedly abolish law god affirme lawful law forbidden indirectly transgresse exercise enioined lorde suffred carelesly omitted exāple christ bringeth plaine familiar god hath commanded child shuld honor parent yet offrings made gaine priest gathering narowly looked imagined sinned grieuously offred nothing robd parent honor due thē also according law god left thing voluntary importance iudgment scribe thē one chief cō mādements god therfore oft bent kepe law men yt imploy lesse diligence care keeping law god accoūted trāsgresse litle saith cōmandemēt god made autority ye traditiōs mē scribe hold people bound deuises could time leasure left word god also thoght done duety well waited ynch hereof arose liberty sin thought law god may freely broken sith holines rather put obseruation thing let euery man consider whether fault abosideth day amōgst papist thē time past amongst iews pope whol dunghil cleargy denieth god ought bee obeied come purpose detest tasting litle flesh deadly sinne theft whordome veniall sinne ouerthrow law god tradition way bee suffered obseruation man deuises diminish obedience due god alone honour god commaundeth yeelde parent extended dueties godlines last clause christ addeth worthy death curseth father mother tendeth wee shoulde know commaundement honoring parentes small light importance sith breach sharply punished doth litle amplifie sinne scribe seuere threatning terrifieth lettinge bridle loose contemners parent 5 ye say sentence wanteth fully sette downe mark added suffer thing father mother meaning scribe wickedly absoluing withdraw themselues dooing dueties parent supply want voluntarye sacrifice might haue bene omitted without offence god neyther may word christ takē scribe haue restrayned men al right obedience earnestly apply themselues get pray child meane space duty parent 7 isaias prophesied wel lord proceedeth hee speaketh cause selfe deuideth two partes first bent outward rite esteemed nothinge true holines consisteth sincere integrity heart peruerslye worshipped god owne 〈◊〉 seemeth reproue men speaketh counterfeit feigned holines yet comprehendeth sum doctrine fully defined thus worship god spiritual consisteth sprinckling water ceremony also reasonable seruice god whiche framed hys word though iesaias prophesied time come respect mē age yet christ saith prophesie belō geth scribe pharises like old hypocrite whō prophet christ rehearseth word set yet prophet doth expresly mentiō two fault wherewith iewes prouoked vengance god thēselues faigned holines onely lyppes outward professiō declined faigned worshippings first therfore wicked hypocrisie men honour god outward shew euil self draw nere god mouth lyps heart went therefore summe worship god spirituall nothing pleaseth except inward sincerity heart ioyned hypocrite put holines outward pompes 9 worship vaine prophet speaketh word word thus feare taught precept men christ doth faithfully aptly yeelde sense thus god vnto canne blind lead blind shall fall ditch 10 called multidude vnto christ turning willing bee taught doth large expound whiche touched kingdom god consisteth meate drink paul also teacheth ro 14 17 whē outward thing nature cleane vse also free cleane neither cometh vncleannes good creature god therefore general iudgment vncleannes commeth man without fountaine hid synecdochen hee saieth mouth man commeth euils euery man bringeth forth hee alludeth present matter haue said draw mouth vncleannes togeather meat drinke al kind filthines floweth v 12 perceiuest thou pharises scribe froward vnframeable christ bestowed much labour appeasing enough reproue hipocrisie pride offence first conceiued doubled see washing carelesly professedly despised christ triffles christ doubted set malitious poysoned mindes fire pricking thē sharply let v learne example greatly regard whether doings saying please al men yet disciple maner rude vnlearned men gather hard successe christ answered dangerously ill purpose tended admonition christ correcting ouersharpe speach shuld endeuor pacifie offended mind almoste thing common weake iudge euil doctrin soe receiued vnrighteous enuious eares certeinly wished might quietly without offence haue alowance al men sith sathan blindeth many men mindes enflameth heart euen madnes holdeth many soules ouerwhelmed beastly blockishnes cannot true doctrine saluation sauor men especiallye meruaile see exasperated nourish within poyson malice vntowardnes vve must endeuor selues far lawfully may yt offēce may arise maner teaching poynt extreame madnes v moderate greater wisdome doctrine taught heauēly master see speach wicked leaud men took occasiō offence yea see ye shew offēce malitiously takē handled either side 13 euery plant weake mind wounded doctrine better successe christ would remedy mischiefe applieth remedy cause good menne shoulde troubled shoulde lesse honourably esteeme doctrine though light vppon many destruction place ignorātly expounded inuentions men soeuer procedeth mouth god must rooted vppe pearishe • christe hathe respecte rather vnto menne meaning meruaile doctrine saluation beecome deadlye reprobate alwayes caried headlong destructiō appoynted vnderstand therfore planted hand god free adoption grafted tree lyfe iesaias also 60 21 calleth church renued grace christ graft planted lorde saluation commeth god election necessary reprobate perish meanes soeuer done god destroy innocent without fault owne malice turne owne destruction whatsoeuer offred though wholsom commeth passe gospell willinglye perishe sauour death death paul witnesseth 2 cor 2 16 though proposed vnto men saluation yet bringeth foorth fruit elect also part faithfull good teacher temper whatsoeuer hee bringeth forth may profit men ofte soeuer falleth otherwise let v comfort selues aunswere christe similitude doth notably expresse cause destructiō doctrne reprobate haue roote god hauing doctrine set doe vomitte hidden poyson might bring haste death vppon themselues appoynted note christ specially meaneth hypocrits time seeme planted good tree epicure notorious grosse infamous contēpt god properly said like tree vaine shew godlines shineth scribe alofte church god otherwise ceders libanon falling away might seeme absurd christ might haue saide doe worthily perish vnworthily refuse saluation goeth deeper denyeth man canne alwaies stand excepte saluation bee established god election word plainly sheweth first beginning saluatiō commeth grace wherein god chose v vnto child created 14 let alone saith vnworthy account therfore cause offence much moue v hence gathered old distinctiō auoyding offence must regarded least offence giuen weak stubborn malitious wicked person shoulde take offēce regarded would satisfie frowardnes al mē wer necessary christ rock offence shuld buried therfore conuenient know difference beetweene weak offēded ignorance presently apply thēselues cured proud froward take offence least weake troubled fault wheras wicked wil frowardly troubled let v without regard go midst offence spareth weak brother treadeth vnder feete cōmanded reach hand cō uenient regard others whose offence necessary fall wee desire hold right course vnder pretence offence commeth passe menne alienated fall away christ must let alone least draw v away blinde leader blinde christ declareth shall miserably pearish soeuer wil bend themselues hither thither pleasure stumble plaine way doeth heereby appeare willingly blinde nowe purpose manne suffer himselfe gouerned except would fall pitte christe sunne righteousnesse shineth v light gospell onely sheweth v way wil haue preferred v without cause calleth disciple backe slouthfulnesse least fauour blind menne wander darkenesse hereof doe also gather inexcusable vnder pretence simplicitie modestie doe deliuer themselues deceiued snared errours luke rehearsing sentence noteth circumstance generally sayeth christ vsed similitude mētioning many saying christ sheweth purpose spoken might also haue bene christe spake thing oftner yet thought good set place wher apter place luke declareth time spoken 15 peter answeareth disciple doe bewray ouermuch rudenesse christ doeth correcte reprooue worthily yet without vnderstandinge yet hee ceaseth theyr teacher mathew name doeth attribute peter marke reporteth sence demaunded euident answear christ ignorance peter togither reproued summe men defiled meates haue filthinesse sinnes shutte vppe within doe openly breake foorth dedes work manne doe obiecte intemperancie feeding vnclennesse easily answeared christ speaketh natiue lawfull vse thing god hath made subiect vnto v eat drinke selfe thing free indifferent corruption falleth springeth man himselfe ought therefore accounted inward thing outward 19 heart come euil thoughtes heereby gather gaue warning woorde mouthe first vsed heere christ reason circumstance present place nowe mention mouth onely sayde heart man proceedeth soeuer vncleane doeth defile filthinesse marke differeth mathewe hee reckeneth vp many sinnes euill thoughtes wicked desire translate couetousnesse rather take generally like maner deceit intemperancie doe thereafter follow though maner speache improper sufficient hold meaning christ vice doe proceede euill corrupt affection heart vnproperly sayd euill eye proceedeth heart yet matter selfe nothing either absurd doubtfull vncleane heart defileth eye become seruaunts instrument euil lustes neither yet doth christ restraine euery thing euill man manifest sinnes might euidently shewe heart man seat euilles sayeth testimony fruites apparant sinnes selues woorde de • iling making vncleane greeke sayd make common little marke sayd common hand crieth v 24 answeared sayd sent vnto lost shepe house israel 25 yet • hee came worshipped saying lord helpe 26 answered sayd good take childrēs bread cast whelpes 27 shee said trueth lord yet deede whelp eat crums fall master table 28 iesus answeared sayd vnto womā great thy saith thee thou desirest daughter made whole houre 24 thence arose went border tyrus sidon entred house woulde man shoulde haue knowen could hid 25 certain womā whose little daughter hadde vncleane spirit heard came fell feete 26 woman greeke syrophenissian nation shee sought would cast deuil daughter 27 iesus said vnto let child first sed good take childrēs bred cast vnto whelp 28 answered said vnto trueth lorde yet dede whelp eate vnder table childrens crums 29 said vnto saying go thy way deuil gon thy daughter 33 shee come home house shee founde deuill departed daughter lying bed myracle taught grace christ begā spread amongst gentile though full time yet come wherin christ make himselfe knowen whole worlde yet pleased giue taste commō mercy length bestowed generally iewes gentile resurrection also woman canaan described notable image faith making comparison might knowe promised redemption worthily taken iewes whose vngodlines blockish woman mathewe calleth canaanite marke sayde haue bene grecian nation syrophenissian wherein difference knowe common maner speache amongst iewes call forraine nation grecian therfore antithesis betwene grecian iewes often sounde paule also shee borne coastes tyre sidon meruaile shee called syrophenissean region hadde name syria parte phoenicia iewes odiously called inhabitant land cananites supposed part came people canaan banished country toke next place refuge banishment doe agree woman came prophane nation brought vp doctrine lawe shee came owne accord christ humility seeke aid circumstance also noted set downe marke christ came thither banner displaid priuate man might hide corner time marke speaketh common sense flesh though christ foresaw diuine spirit come passe yet much seruant ambassadour father kept himselfe maner man within bound calling laid vpon therfore said could man would haue done meane circumstance hath great waight condemnation iewes whē christ opē place set promised redemption loud voice myracles annexed remained blinde deafe yet boasted themselues heires couenant lord peculiar people priestly kingdome woman none priuiledges child abraham vnto whome couenant shewe appertained called either woorde signe commeth running owne free 22 haue mercy lorde though woman stranger lordes flocke yet gotten tast godlinesse without knowledge promise shee coulde haue called christ sonne dauid although iewes almost falne away frō pure sincere doctrine law least turned far aside yet renoumed fame promised redemption flourished whē restitution church rested vpon kingdom dauid whē speach messias name son dauid cōmon among confession mouth men true faith worne amongest wonderful incredible goodnes god came passe sauor promisses came natiōs dwelt therfore though womā ben familiarly taught master neither yet framed faith christ vnaduisedly self cōceiued law prophet vvherfore dog seruetus lesse folishly thē wickedly abused exāple might strip faith bare naked promisses sense deny somtimes may faith cōceiued alwais hath expres distinct knowledge sound doctrine hold faith doth alwaies spring woorde god hath beginning true principle may alwayes annexed light true knowledge 23 hee answeared euangelistes doe diuers wayes commend faith woman nowe inuincible constancie silence christe kinde repulse meruaile shee ouerthrowne temptation diligence praying witnesse perseuerance yet seemeth contrary nature faith inuocation paule doth describe romanes chap 10 14 namely man pray rightly except haue heard woorde god vvho therefore say woman endewed faith christ held peace motion breatheth forth hope whē christ speaketh holdeth peace two wayes noted thoughe hee suppressed woordes mouth yet hee spake inwardly minde woman inward instinct vnto stead outward preaching note also whē prayer arose hearing faith though christ doeth presently answear yet doctrine learned doeth alwaies resound christ redemer come lorde often speaketh faithfull one withall holdeth peace trusting testimony scripture heare speaking doubt hee mercifull vnto yet doeth presently answear request petition rather dissembleth hearing therefore see purpose christ holding peace wold quench faith woman rather hee might sharpen endeuour kindle feruencie little seede doctrine brought forth great fruit woman canaan nothing vnseemely shoulde fall away time holde v suspence doeth yelde v presently kinde answeare sende away disciple aske nothing fauour importunitye troublesome vnto desire shee may sent away meanes childish deuice papist vnder pretence endeuoured bring saincts dead patron graunt woman entreated disciple either speake fauour whiche yet cannot gathered text yet reason state dead aliue note disciple heare disdainfully minde helpe patronage yet obtaine nothing 24 sent rendreth reason vnto apostle heareth cananite would employ himselfe wholely vpon iewes whome onely sent minister grace god therefore calling commaundement father argueth helpe yelded vnto stranger power christ alwaies enclosed narow boundes circumstance time require beginning iewes shoulde especially apply sayd mat 10 5 partition wal broken resurrection christ might preach peace gentile stranger frō kingdō god ephes 2 14 therefore forbade apostle goe sowe first seede gospell iudea therfore true sayth place sent sauiour 25 shee came worshipped woman seemeth striue wyth stout obstinacie shee would wrest somewhat hys doubted faith shee conceiued goodnesse messias encouraged precise deniall christ part office repugnancie terrified withdrewe purpose came wholely setled former feeling faith spake admitted nothing contrary hope true triall faith meanes suffer generall principle saluation grounded vpon worde god shaken v 26 good take childrens bread christ sharper answer former seemeth take away hope doeth onely teache grace soeuer receiued father belongeth iewes must imploied vpon except defrauded peculiar right reprochefully compareth woman selfe dog signifying shee vnworthy made pertaker grace meaning may made plaine vnto v must knowen calleth heere childrens bread gift god peculiarly belonged abraham posteritye beginning world god goodnesse spred abroad euery place filled heauen earth mortall men fealt father vouchsafed bestow greater honour vpon child abraham vpon rest mankinde called childrens breade soeuer properly pertaineth adoption whereby iewes chosen child gentile doe enioy common light sunne breath life nourishment earth togither iewes blessing hoped christ rested onely house abraham vvherfore cast foorth cōmon without difference god singular priuiledge appoynted one nation nothing else abolishing couenant god meanes gentile made equall iewes excell meete therefore christ vseth woorde casting signifying well placed whiche taken church god made common prophane men ought restrained time god called vppon iudea since gentile taken felowship saluation done christ shineth euery gospel difference taken away dogges nowe accounted amongst child pride flesh must necessity ouerthrowne heare beginning dogges excellencie mannes nature greater beginning image god shine reprochful name shoulde light vpon gentile yea euen vpon king whome god adorned owne title sinne falling away adam brought passe lord shuld worthely cast donghill dogges degenerated offence first father especially comparison made betwene iewes exempted common sorte gentile banished kingdom god purpose christ euidently declared marke sayde let child first sed admonisheth cananite shee doeth preposterously shee • ieth table middest supper though specially regarded examining woman faith yet also teacheth howe horrible vengeance remaineth iewes refused incomparable good thing freely offered vnto denied others earnestly feruently desiring 27 truth lord answer woman declareth caried blinde blunt violence shee would directly stūble saying christ whereas god preferreth iewes others also leaueth honour adoption vnto sayth shee wil hinder christe according order prescribed god satisfie onely shee desireth crummes falling vnawares may come dog certainly god neuer shut vppe grace amongst iewes scattered little taste least amongst gentile therefore nothinge could aptly better spoken expresse grace god sprang amongst 28 great thy faith first praiseth faith woman sayeth graunted praiers faith sake greatnesse faith especially shewed self guided litle sparke doctrine shee knew proper office christ attributed vnto celestiall power cōstantly went forward hard lettes suffered selfe set naught shee might holde shee hoped without aide christ short shee seasoned confidence humility shee woulde arrogate thing rashly vnto selfe neither yet feeling owne vnworthinesse would shutte fountaine grace christ commendation prophane woman vnthankefulnesse people condemned boasted dedicated god woman might sayd beleeue rightly destitute promise christ beaten away worde cleane contrary haue shewed though sharply shew refuseth prayer yet perswaded saluation promised god throughe messias shee ceaseth hope wel therefore shee thinketh gate shutte shee altogither driuen away hand may gathered former place laying hand solemne signe blessing wherby gift holy ghost also giuen without doubt christe often vsed rite men demaunded nothing knew vsed heretofore christe vseth signes toucheth tongue dumbe man spittle putteth finger eares onely laying hand bene effectual enough yea though moued finger could haue done becke appeareth hee vsed signes frankly moste profit men putting spittle toung would declare gifte speaking commeth alone thrusting finger eares taught gift proper boare open deafe eares needelesse runne allegory see haue subtilly dalied course farre bringing foorth thing sounde rather make scripture become iesting stocke therefore let one thing satisfie discreate reader obtaine christ speach hearing prayer inso muche infuseth force tongue pearceth eares finger remoueth deafe man multitude doeth partly purpose would shewe glory godheade rude yet fitte witness shoulde beholde farre partly might freely powre foorth seruent prayer looked vp heauen sighed signe vehement affection whereby perceiued great loue towardes men whose misery bewailed neither doubted taking spittle owne mouth putte mouthe putting finger testifie shew kinde louing affection yet declareth hath great power curing disease giuing health hee simply cōmaundeth tongue eares opened neither without consideration marke setteth downe chalde woorde might testifie diuine power christe amongst trifle wherewith foolish men defiled baptisme heere also one apis • iesting toye example admonished ende licentiousnesse men begin dally mystery god owne pleasure 36 commaunded tell man though many interpreaters wrest commandements sence christ purposely prouoked spread fame myracle yet seemeth simple meaning alleaged purpose onely deferre time conuenient sitte whereof may gathered ouercome reason last refuge obstinate menne oft driuen extremity yet least shoulde enforced subscribe truthe commonly vse pretende somwhat besides cause though maner disputation expressed yet seemeth likely mee brabled callinge christe durst innouate thing lifted vppe bare selfe high comming kingdome god shoulde bee restored estate vvhen remained nothing might obiect doctrine desired haue signe giuen heauen certaine woulde haue yeelded hundred signes testimony scripture note also power christ manifested sight already many myracles might hādled hand despise signes whereby vnto newe myracles also noted pharisies great contention sadduces neither onely bitter hatred daily hotte strife betweene yet nowe doe mutually ioyne togither christ wicked debate yet deadly discordes hinder conspire god making league doe ioyne handes togither ou • throwe truthe worde tempting▪ euangelists doe sign ••• e came sincere mindes desire learne take deceit thought denied least christ coulde doe imagined accounted better vilely basely purpose shewing base estate ouerthrow estimation heeretofore gotten amongst people vnbeleuers said tempt god oft obtaining soeuer pleasure desireth doe fall murmuring doe charge god want power 2 vvhen euening woordes christe declareth power sufficiently declared might know time visitation flee open light shutting eye owne accorde vseth notable similitude fitte purpose though course aire changeable sodaine tempest riseth vnlooked waxeth cleare yet nature directing menne signes doe prognosticate whether day shall faire foule therfore christ demaundeth know kingdome god reuealed euident signes hereby certainly appeared muche giuen earthly transitorie commodity contemninge soeuer pertained heauēly spirituall life thus blind much ignorance wilfull malice therefore hee calleth also hypocrite fained seeke shewed woulde see reproofe doeth almost appertaine whole worlde menne doe bende witte applie theyr sens present vse almost manne wise enoughe behalfe least hauing obtained meane knowledge followeth expedient whereof commeth vnderstande signes whereby god calleth v vnto euery manne giueth himselfe wilfull sluggishnesse callinge christe present offering eternall saluation manifested scribe wel law prophet doctrine confirmed myracles many suche thys day pretende doubtfull matter haue iust cause suspēd iudgmēt yt resolute determination must waighted nay think point great wisdom purpose auoid inquirie truthe thoughe poynte great slouthfulnesse neglecte eternall saluation soules diligently prouide thinges flesh earth meane season pretende vaine excuse grosse deepe ignoraunce certaine vnlearned menne doe gather muche absurdly place lawfull looking skie iudge either temperature stormes christe rather right course nature argueth shoulde iustlye pearish vnthankfulnesse quicke wicked thing pertaining present life doe wittingly willingly ouerwhelme heauenly light owne blockishnesse mark addeth christe sighed spirite wordes declare took grieuously bitterly hee saw vnthankfull menne stubburnely resiste god certainly becommeth studious glory god carefull mannes saluation nothinge wounde deepelier sorowe see vnbeleeuers sette purpose stoppe vppe themselues meanes whereby beleeue apply al witte haue purpose might darken lighte woorde woorkes god mistes thinke worde spirite putte heere emphatically might knowe sigh • came deepe affection heart least sophister shoulde say christe made outwarde shewe sorowe fealt inwardly coulde otherwise holy soule gouerned spirite zeale shoulde altogither grieued heereof commeth hypocrite proude quarelling cast foorth arrogant speaches aire without regarde gather sences togither neither doe sette themselues iudgement seate god truthe knowen mighte haue heede selues leauen pharisies whiche hypocrisie 5 vvhen disciple come heere christ former matter taketh occasion exhort disciple keepe themselues corruption might hinder sincere godlinesse pharisies bene litle giuen testimonie poysoned frowardnesse saduces kept companie side herode moste vile aduersary corrupter sound doctrine disciple amongst daungers necessary shoulde warned looke themselues wisedome man doeth incline selfe vanitie errours leude deuices false doctrine suche mischiefes doe compasse v nothing easie v fall away true naturall puritie woord god come passe ensnared neuer true religion haue full possession v matter may euidently appeare let v consider christes woordes 6 take heede leauen pharisies mat ioyneth sadduces pharisies marke putteth herode secondes roume luke maketh mētion pharisies though vncertaine whether luke rehearseth speach christ defineth leauen hypocrisie also doth briefly set sentēce doutfulnesse woordes though metaphore leauen applied false doctrine might transferred hypocrisie life behauiour else spoken twise yet absurdity say saying two according course hystorie doe set forth largely luke touched somwhat otherwise place order yet difference matter lawfull folow cō iecture hypocrisie shall signify somewhat else counterfait fained shew wisedome namely fountaine selfe matter vaine pompe boasting great thing men estimation god eye lorde ieremie witnesseth 5 3 behold truth word directeth faithful perfect holinesse perfecte sincere heart may cleaue vnto righteousnesse according saying deut 10 12 israel doeth lorde require thee thou shouldest cleaue vnto thy heart thy soule contrary side spirituall worship neglected doe bring tradition men fading colour god could caught baites although outwarde ceremony serue make shew yet god childish tri •• e exercised true holinesse nowe vnderstande luke put hypocrisie steade fained doctrine vnder name hee comprehendeth leauens menne doe onely puffe vppe vaine shewe god haue soundnesse nay drawe mindes menne right studie godlinesse vaine rite esteemed mathew exposition plainer shall best rest vpon vvhen lorde reprooued disciple length vnderstoode commaunded take heede doctrine certaine meaning christe arme present corruption cōpassed euery side therfore speaketh expresly pharisies sadduces two sectes tyrannously raigned time churche wyth corrupt doctrine ouerwhelmed doctrine lawe prophet remained almost nothing sounde perfect demaunded wherfore marke putteth herode amongst number false teacher professed suche thing aunsweare halfe iewe degenerate vnfaithfull endeuoured subtelties coulde drawe people maner apostate adde mixture newe religion may spring may abolish former therefore endeuoured craftily ouerthrowe principle true auncient religion religion might length flourish shoulde agreeable tyrannie endeuoured bringe newe kinde iudaisme lord doeth without cause commaunde also beware leauen scribe scattered errours temple god herodes court shoppe sathan forginge errours see like poperie day antichrist doeth vomite subtlety church dennes sophisters monkes also proppeth vp kingdom helpe courtly diuinitie wil omitte craft christe mette present euilles gaue warninge beware noysome warned example let v learne wisely weigh corruption may annoy v man may sooner mixe fire water togither make inuentions pope agree gospel therfore soeuer desireth good faith become christes disciple lette studie keepe hys soule pure leauens nowe already infected lette labour muche cleansing himselfe vntill dregges filthinesse sticke part troublesome men attempt diuers wayes corrupt sounde doctrine faithfull must watch diligently auoiding suche subtlety may celebrate continual passeouer sweete bread truth vile wickednesse noysome leauen deadly poyson ouerwhelmeth nowe euery place let men imploy sens warning necessary 1 vvhy thinke thus selues disciple againe declare euil haue profited master doctrine also wōderfull work said taking hede leauen tooke christ wold draw outward felowship custome receiued amongst iewes eate meate togither prophane menne disciple thought pharisies sort number ignorāce tolerated sorte forgate late benefite thinke remeady christes hande compelled defile themselues meate drinke rebuketh sharply well woorthy certainly vnthankfulnesse grosse hadde lately seene bread created nothing satisfying many thousandes menne twise done nowe take care breade power remaining master still woordes doe gather condemned infidelitie whiche hauing twice tried power god doe afterward distrust faith nourisheth remembrance gift god heart except faith ouerwhelmed neuer forgotten •• vnderstoode spoken doctrine hard bee vnderstoode christ opposeth word leauen simple pure word god christe taketh beefore good parte saide gospel like leauen scripture parte doth hereby signifie thing added whereby naturall purity thing hindered place two contrary doe without doubt aunswere one simple trueth god inuentions men deuise owne brayne neyther cause sophyster shoulde seeke slyppe away denying vnderstoode euery doctrine doctrine found beareth name pure sweete doctrine proceeded god vvhereof followeth mixture soeuer commeth called heauen paul 2 cor 11 3 also teacheth faith corrupted assoone drawne simplicitie christ nowe seene whose doctrine lorde woulde haue beware certainly ordinarie power church handes scribe priest amongst pharisies chief vvhen christe name warneth doctrine followeth must refused mixe inuentions word god thrust straunge thinge degree honour soeuer placed proude title soeuer beare vvherfore accursed corrupt subiection submit themselues tradition lawes pope mathewe marke 8 luke 2 • came bethsaida brought blinde man vnto desired touch 23 tooke blinde hande ledde towne spit eye putte hand vppon asked saw 〈◊〉 24 looked vp sayde see men see walking like tree 25 put handes againe vppon eye made looke againe restored sighte sawe euery manne farre clearely 26 sent home house saying ••• ther goe towne tell anye towne myracle declaration whereof omitted others seemeth reported marke especially circumstance christ often wont doe little little restore blinde man sight likely end might man set example free disposation bounde certaine rule may shewe power either way therfore doth open eies blinde presently may see clearly instilleth darke confuse sight putting hand vpon againe giueth perfect sight grace christ sodē ly powred vpon others commeth drop drop man 24 see men blind man asked question disciple might know somwhat giuen yet litle beginning fully healed therefore aunswereth seeth men hee seeth walkinge whiche straight like vnto tree wordes hee confesseth sight cleare discerne men tree yet canne see litle motion gesseth men whō seeth straight stature sense also saith like vnto tree vvherefore see onely coniecture hee saith seeth men 26 sent home house christe suffered returne bethsaida many might haue beene witness myracle thinke done christe would punishe inhabitant place depriuing vse sauour vvhatsoeuer cause certeine wrought miracle end alwayes buried would haue manye others kept secrete vntill sinnes vvorld washed away death ascend
