hystory may christ iourney made stay prayd demaunded disciple also two caesareaes aunciente famous whiche firste tower straton scituated foote mount libanus farre iordan epithite added difference sake though thinke built place town dan stoode time past yet lately built phillip tetrach called philippy vvhom doe men say may seeme bee meaning common fame redeemer becom sonne man yet question otherwise namely opinion men iesus sonne mary maner calleth himselfe sonne man haue saide whilest cloathed flesh conuersant vpon earth one sonnes men iudgment purpose christ throughly strengthen disciple assured faith amongste sundry opinion wauer shall presently see 14 say iohn nothing spoken heere either professed enemy christ neither prophane contemners sound sincere part people chosen flowre church disciple doe make mention spake honorably christ yet truth proposed vnto thē man tēded scope al mē vanished away delight vvherby perceiue weake wit man onelye conceiueth nothing self right true euen gathereth errours true principle adde also christe onelye signe concorde peace whereby god woulde gather whole world vnto greater parte doe heereby take occasion dissention euen amongest iewes vnitie faith setteled christe yet whiche seemed haue agreement amongest themselues nowe seuered sundry opinion also see howe one errour engendereth opinion setled mindes common people soules went diuers body heereof came rather bent false imagination thoughe comming christe iewes maner deuided yet varietie opinion shoulde haue hindered godly shoulde haue desired right knowledge manne vnder pretence geuinge himselfe sluggishnes hadde neglected seeke christ euen iudgement hee shoulde bee inexcuseable muche lesse shall hee escape iudgement god manne reason diuisions shall abhorre christe false opinion menne shall take occasion loathynge hee wyll vouchsafe applye selfe vnto christ 15 whome saye yee heere christe seuereth disciple reste people whereby might better appeare absurde thing v drawne vnitye fayth though others doe disagree whosoeuer doe simplye addict themselues christe doe striue adde anye thinge owne head gospell true lyghte shall neuer fayle heere great dilygence required whyle whole worlde slydeth theyr owne inuentions shoulde take faste sure holde christe sathan coulde take awaye iewes perswasion lawe prophetes christe come hee diuersly transfiguring hee deuided partes hee thruste amongst many false christes true redeemer bee esteemed hee lefte subtilties afterwarde eyther roote christe vtterlye thruste person roume vvherefore amongst confused contrary speaches worlde let voyce christe sound alwaies eares whereby separateth v wandring vnconstant men follow multitude neither faith wauer amongst contrary floudes opinion 16 thou arte christe short confession whiche containeth whole summe saluation vnder title christ comprehended eternall kingdome priesthood would reconcile god vnto v sinnes washed away owne sacrifice would obtaine perfect righteousnesse would preserue v receiued sayth custodye would adorne enrich v kinde blessinges marke onely hath thou art christ luke hath christe god sense tymes paste called king annoynted god christes god luke vsed phrase sayde simeon answere giuen heauen dye shoulde see christ lord surely diuine redemption god gaue hand sonne therefore necessary redeemer shoulde come noted person heauen annoyntment god matthew expresseth plainlye sonne liuing god though may bee peter yet expresly vnderstande howe christe beegotten god yet beleeued hee excellent person beginning god men liuely true godhead dwelt flesh vvhen epithite liuing giuen god note make difference betweene dead idol nothing 17 blessed art thou simon vvhen life eternall know one god sent iesus christ without cause christ pronounceth blessed whoe confessed heart spake perticularlye peter alone shewe onely felicitie whole worlde placed men may aspyre greater desire first must holden mē miserable cursed nature vntil find remedy christ thē must added whosoeuer obtaineth christ wāteth nothing al perblessednes seeing wee desire nothing better eternall glory god possession whereof christ doth bring v flesh bloud vnder person one man christ admonisheth menne faith must asked father praise must attributed grace peculyar lightening god opposed flesh bloud vvhereby gather mennes mindes voyde vnderstanding perceiue misteries heauenlye wisdome hidden christe nay humane sens behalfe fayle vntill god open eies see glory christ therfore let man trusting owne witte lift vppe himselfe pride humbly let v suffer selues taught inwardlye father lightes onelye spirite may lighten darknesse nowe whiche endewed faith acknowledging blindnes let thē learne yeelde god due 18 say vnto thee christe wordes declareth muche peter confession pleaseth hee bestoweth great rewarde vppon though giuen simon disciple name peter freely appointed apostle yet free giftes ascribeth steede reward faith thing straunge scripture peter adorned double honour first dooth belong owne priuate saluation last apostolicall function vvhen saith thou art peter confirmeth gaue name vain stedfast liuing stone temple god though extendeth faithfull ephes 2 21 euerye one temple god faith beeing compact amongste themselues together make one temple yet excellencye peter noted amongst rest euen euery man receiueth lesse order according measure gift christ vpon rock hereby appeareth name peter agreeth name simon also rest faythfull grounded vppon fayth christ holy consent buylte vp togeather spirituall building god may dwell midest christ declared commō foundation al church would gather vnto peter company faythful soeuer world shuld haue saide smal number men therefore confession small estimation present time shall shortlye come shall shew selfe magnifically shall spreade selfe large litle preuaile encouraging disciple bee constant though faith yet obscure base yet chosē lorde first fruites length contemptible beginning new church shuld arise stand conqueror al affaults infernal power though ye pronoune may referred either faith church yet latter sense doth better agree strength church shall stand vnuā quished al power sathan namely truth god shal alwaies continue vnshaken wherupon faith staid saing io 1 ep 5 4 answereth setēce ye victory ouercōmeth world euē faith promise worthy whosoeuer vnited christ acknowledging christ mediatour shall continue end safe annoyaunce spoken body church appertaineth perticular member farre forth one christ yet hereby admonished long church shall pilgrim vpon earth shall quiet subiect many trouble therefore sathan denied superiority hee dayly therefore may vse saying christ let v without feare glory sathan faith let v triumph ouer bandes agayne let v knowe haue allarme sounded vnto v might alwayes ready prepared battayle euident name gate noted euery kind power strong holde 19 thee giue keyes christe nowe beginneth speake publike office apostleshippe whose dignitie adorned double title christe saieth minister gospell porter kingdom heauen beare keyes secondly addeth haue power bind lose effectuall heauens similitude keyes aptly applyed office teaching christ saith luke 11 52 scribe pharises interpreter law likewise key kingdome heauen know gate lyfe otherwise opened vnto v word god vvherof followeth deliuered vnto minister key hand think keyes plural number therfore sayd apostle onelye commaundement gyuen open also shutte doe speake without probable lykelyhoode yet man take otherwise let vse owne sense demaunded lord promise giue peter seemed haue giuen creating apostle question aunswered tenth chapter sayd twelue first sent forth preacher time returning christ ended course calling christ rose againe dead beganne bee appoynted ordinary teacher church honour giuen respect time come vvhatsoeuer thou shalt bind second metaphor similitude properly belongeth note forgiunesse sinnes christe gospell delyuering v guiltines eternal death loseth snare curse wherein holden bound therefore hee testifieth doctrine gospell ordained losing bandes losed voice testimony men vpon earth shuld also indeede losed heauen many onely wickedly refuse deliueraunce offred also frowardnes doe procure heauier iudgement themselues therefore power yea commaundement binde also giuen minister gospell yet noted accidentall gospel nature paul 2 cor 10 6 teacheth speaking vengeaunce hee saith hath ready vnbeleeuers disobedient presently addeth obedience fulfilled reprobate owne faulte turne lyfe death gospell power god saluation men yet hearde vngodlynes many openly breaking doth prouoke wrath god necessary sauour thereof deadly summe christ would assure saluation profered vnto gospell might surelye looke discend heauen witnesse againe strike feare contemners least think might freely scorne minister word necessary incomparable treasure lyfe proposed vnto v earthly vesselles 2 cor 4 7 aucthoritie outward doctrine thus sanctified vnto v credite would decay almoste euery moment againe vngodly boldlye set thinke haue doe men therefore christe declareth preaching gospell reuealed vppō earth iudgement god shalbe heauen assuraunce lyfe death cannot otherwhere great honour god interpreter witnesse world saluation great maiestie gospell called ambassage mutuall reconciliation betweene god men shorte wonderfull comfort godly mindes knowe message saluation brought man reputation mortal ratified god meane season let vngodlye raue please doctrine preached cōmaundement god shal fele length truly earnestly god hath threatned thē mouth men godly teacher furnished hope maye without feare testifie vnto themselues others grace god giueth life lesse courage may thunder obstinate contemners doctrine thus farre haue plainly expounded natural sense word nothing remaineth added except romane antichriste desiringe colour tirannye dare bolde lesse wickedly vnfaithfully peruert whole place though light true interpretatiō haue shewed seemeth sufficiēt chase away darknes yet least shuld thing hinder godly reader wil brieflye answere corrupt quarrel first hee imagineth peter called foundation church seeth transferreth person man spoken peter faith graunt peter rock grecian signifie one thing first spoken phrase athenian common language diuersity rashly set math gender rather chāged purpose might expres diuerse thing doubt christ noted difference speache therfore augustine doth wisely admonish called rock peter called peter rock al christian christ tedious whē saying paul 1 cor 3 11 must holden amongst v certein sure church haue foundation christ alone pope cānot deuise foundation without sacrilegious blasphemy certeinly muche ought detest tiranny pope euen one thing cā sufficiently expressed word sake foundatiō church shoulde taken away open gulfe hell swallow vp miserable soules adde clause touched doth yet belong publike office peter onelye amongst holy stone temple one place giuen amongst chiefe title follow belong apostolical function vvherof followeth nothing spoken peter dooth belong also rest fellowes dignity apostleship cōmon amongst whatsoeuer annexed vnto must also common christ speaketh vnto peter name one name al confessed christ soone god speach directed one yet alike belōgeth neither reason despised alleaged cyprian others christe personne one spake vnto hee myght commend vnitie church except hee peculiarly giuen preferred aboue al reste much contend haue apostle rather thē fellowes power binding losing cannot taken away office teaching apostleship rather heat light sun yeeld sōwhat graunted vnto peter rest shuld excel amongst apostle yet papist foolishly inferre primacy giuen vniuersal head al church difference betweene dignity power also difference higher degree honour amongst gather whol world vnder elbowes truly christ laid greater burden vpon hee able beare commanded porter kingdome heauen cōmaunded binding losing dispence grace god execute iudgment vpon earth namely farre power mortal man doth reach therefore whatsoeuer giuen must restrained measure grace wherewith hee indued edifying church huge empire papist arrorogate vnto falleth downe controuersie strife peter yet maketh nothing tiranny pope principle papist hold man right mind graunt giuen peter shuld passe ouer right inheritance shuld come vvherfore papist make liberal man shuld continual succession yet pope getteth nothing therby vntil proued lawful successor peter proueth peter died rome though rome horrible murther apostle gat self supremacy pretende also bishop vaine haue sufficiently shewed institution whence rather haue whole tractation argument fetched trouble wearines reader vnfold yet let short clause added although byshop rome law successour peter yet owne falshoode shall depriue himselfe great honour whatsoeuer christ gaue successours peter shall profit nothing well knowne pope court rome shew mark church asmuch abhorreth office pastor couetously striueth autoritie christe omitted nothing extolling peter heyres yet hee prodigall bestow honour vpon apostate matth 16 mark 8 luk 9 20 hee charged disciple shoulde tell mā iesus christ 21 time forth iesus began shew vnto disciple must go vnto ierusalem suffer manye thinges elder high priestes scribs slaine rise againe third day 22 peter tooke aside began rebuke saying master pitie thy self shall vnto thee 23 hee turned backe said vnto peter get thee behind sathan thou art offence vnto thou vnderstā dest thinges god thinges men 24 iesus said disciple man wil folow let forsake take vp crosse follow 25 whosoeuer saue life shall lose whosoeuer shal lose life sake shal finde 26 shal profit mā though win whole world lose soule shall man giue recō penny soule 27 sonne man shall come glorye father angel shall giue euery man according deedes 28 verily saye vnto stand shal taste death til haue seene son man come kingdome 30 sharpely hee charged concerning shuld tell man 31 beganne teache sonne manne must suffer many thinges shoulde bee reproued elder high priest scribe slaine within three dayes rise againe 32 hee spake thing plainly peter tooke aside began rebuke 33 turned back looked disciple rebuked peter saying gette thee behinde sathan thou vnderstandest thinges god thinges men 34 hee called people vnto disciple said vnto whosoeuer follow let forsake himselfe take vp crosse follow 35 whosoeuer wil saue lyfe shall lose whosoeuer shal lose life sake gospel shal saue 36 shal profitte man though winne whole world lose soule 37 shall man giue recompence soule 38 whosoeuer shalbe ashamed word amōg adulterous sinfull generation shall sonne man ashamed also hee commeth glory father holye aungelles marke 9 1 sayd vnto verily say vnto stand shal tast death till haue seene kingdome god come power 21 warned commanded tel man 22 saying sonne man must suffer manye thing reproued elder ye high priest scribs slaine third daye rise 23 said thē al man wil com let deny take vp crosse daily followe 24 whosoeuer saue life shall lose whosoeuer shall lose life sak shal saue 25 auantageth man win whol world destroye himselfe lose 26 whosoeuer shal ashamed wordes shal sonne man bee ashamed hee shal come glory glory father holye angel 27 tell surety stāding shal taste death tyll haue sene kingdome god christ made shewe glory come admonisheth disciple suffer also might prepare themselues beare crosse time tryall hande knew farre vnmeet except furnished new force christ bent chiefly shew kyngdome begin royal pomp great rich pleasaunt allowaunce world reproachfull death nothing difficult ouercome offence especially consider throughly perswaded master imagined procure earthly felicity therefore caryed away vaine hope earnestlye gaping time christe sodenly reueale glorye kingdome litle mind ignominy crosse thought lykely thing befal vnto contrary cyrcumstaunce also hard shoulde reiected elder scribe gouernmente church hand vvhereof easie gather necessary admonition could yt mention crosse would grieuously trouble weak mind presently healeth wound saith thyrd day hee shall ryse againe death certeinlye crosse onely appeared infirmitie fleshe fayth shal finde nothing wherein shall reste comfort selfe vntil shall come resurrection wherein power spirite shineth forth therefore course muste bee wisely holden minister word desire teache profit alwaies ioyne glory resurrection ignominy death meruaile christ wold haue apostle testifie hee appoynted office beefore end sente bee preacher redemption depended vpon comming christe answer easie remēber thing thē set nāely created doctours declare certeine full testimonie christ might prepare schollers master make ouerwhelmed drowsinesse apt taught attentiue commaundement laste time preaching christ put end time death drewe neere yet ready witnesse faith yea confession shoulde haue bin dirision weaknes faith therefore lorde commaundeth silence vntyll others know conqueror death endue constancy 22 peter beganne rebuke signe immoderate heat peter vseth maister thus yet hee seemeth beare reuerence towardes tooke aside durst reproue witness yet intemperancy great warneth hee well wittes spare himselfe rash zeale driueth men yea casteth downe headlong farre doubt make god subiect pleasure peter iudgeth absurd thing elder crucifie sonne god redeemer people shuld put death aucthour lyfe therefore hee endeuoureth drawe christ backe hee delyuer himselfe ouer death fayre colour necessarye credit bee giuen iudgement christ peter zeale pretence soeuer excusable taught intentes whiche supposed good auaileable god great prid men thinke haue iniury complaine whiche thinke right also accepted god see frowardnesse papistes doe maintaine deuotions boldly allow themselues god doth onely reiect thinke worthy great prayse also doth sharply condemne vngodly madnesse truely sense iudgment man shuld preuayle peter intent godly least allowable christe could sharply contumeliously reiecte vvhat meaneth beseech sharpe aunswere euery behaued himselfe meckely hee would breake brused reede e 42 3 thūdreth vehemently chosen disciple reason apparaunt person one man would restraine men flattering owne affected zeale though harde keepe vnder pleasure fleshe lyke wylde beastes yet beast furious wisdome fleshe therefore christe dooth sharpelye inueigh againste beateth downe yron mallet wee myghte onelye learne bee wyse woorde god 23 get thee behinde sathan reason verye fondlye word behind peter commaunded followe goe luke beefore fourth chapter declareth deuill repulsed lorde wordes word eypage signifieth leaue whence latine word apage auoyde deryued christe therefore reiecteth disciple farre beecause preposterous zeale hee playd sathans pranckes neither dooth hee simply call aduersary hee calleth deuill token great detestation reason noted presentlye added thou art offence vnto beecause thou vnderstandest thinges menne thinges god peter offence christ opposed againste calling vvhereof also appeareth menne madde theyr peruerse zeale peter endeuoured stoppe maisters course aduised himselfe would haue defrauded himselfe mankind eternall saluation therefore one worde wee taught diligence must auoyded whatsoeuer draweth v obedience god christ openeth fountaine mischiefe saith peter sauoreth thinges menne therefore least heauenly iudge cast v endeuours deuil let v learne tied owne iudgement obediently imbrace lord alloweth let papistes goe extol owne deuises vp sky shall feele length shal come celestiall tribunall seate boastinge shall preuaile christ pronounceth deuillish v let v desire otherwise wise mouth god except wee would willingly shut way saluation selues deadly barres 24 iesus sayd disciple christe saw peter abhorre crosse knew al others affection doth generally entreate bearing crosse neither teacheth twelue alone layeth lawe vppon godly vve almost lyke sentence math 10 28 apostle onely admonished persecution remained assoone beginne discharge function teacheth common exercise al younglinges entreth firste principle professe gospell saith expresly man followe mee might refell peter ymagination hee proposing himselfe example denyall himselfe patience euerye manne hee declareth hee must suffer peter thought vnmeete person furthermore hee inuiteth member body follow ought wordes vnderstoode anye manne disciple let forsake himselfe take vppe crosse followe mee let frame himselfe example meaning none accounted christes disciple true follower readye runne race prescribeth short rule imitation wee might know thing especially requireth lyke consisteth two poyntes denyall selues willinge bearing crosse denial reacheth farre namely denying owne wisdome forsaking al affection flesh might bee readye bee brought nothing god might lyue reigne v vvee knowe howe naturallye menne ouerwhelmed blinde loue themselues much giuē themselues much account themselues desire enter christes schole behoueth beginne foolishnes whereunto paule exhorteth v 1 corinthyans 3 18 goe forward tame bringe vnder affection therefore preacheth taking vp crosse though generally life men subiect cō mon misery • yet god doth peculyarly exercise seruāts might make lyke vnto image sonne meruaile law said giuen also though god loadeth crosse aswell wicked good yet none saide bear crosse willingly lay shoulder vnder thogh fearce vntamed horse beareth rider yet taketh vp therefore patience faythfull willing minde beare crosse luke addeth word dayly whiche hath great force christ declareth ende warfare vntyll wee shall departe world therefore let daily meditation godly haue born many trouble prepare themselues beare new 25 whosoeuer saue lyfe apt consolation truly shall finde life doe willingly suffer death christ mark doth expresly prescribe vnto faythfull cause death therefore bee vnderstoode matthew wordes oft tymes commeth passe ambition desperation driueth prophane men contemne life couragiously hasten death yet profit therby also opposed threatning auaileth much shaking drowsie sluggishnes flesh forewarneth desirous present life onelye preuaile thus farre shal lose contrarietie betweene temporal life eternall taught vpon tenth chapter whence reader may seeke rest 26 shall profit man c hee lose owne soule word soule heere taken properly christe admonishth soule man therefore created enioy world onely fewe dayes length may attaine immortality heauen shuld haue said great sluggishnes beastly blockishnes world holdeth men bound vnto ouerwhelmesh thē consider end born haue immortal soule giuen vnto race earthly life finished liue euer heauen men truly doe confesse soule worth rich pleasure worlde meane season sense flesh doth blinde wittingly willingly cast soules destruction therefore least world enchaunt v baytes let v consider minde excellency soule bee earnestlye considered dooth easilye dispearse vaine imagination earthlye felicity 27 sonne man shall come former doctrine may better sinke mind christe setteth eye iudgement come transitory lyfe may become vile vnto v necessary v touched earnest feeling thee heauenly slownesse sluggishnesse minde hath nead bee holpe stirred vp looke vp heauen therfore christ citeth faithfull trybunall might continuallye thinke liue cause aspyre blessed lyfe shall bee reuealed day warning tendeth purpose wee might know striue vain confession faith deare precious life christ haue fayde cast lyues hande keeping without feare wyll shewe selfe length auenger length restore agayne perfectlye though seemed tyme perishe hee mentioneth glorye father aungels leaste hys disciple shoulde iudge kingdome present face shewe yet hee base despised beeing hidde vnder habite shape seruaunt therefore promiseth farre otherwise shall come iudge worlde word marke luke haue reader shall finde expounded tenth chapter matthew also haue spoken sufficiently otherwhere reward workes summe ofte rewarde promised good workes doth oppose merite thē free righteousnes faith neyther dooth shewe cause saluation onely encourage faithful study weldoing certeine labour vaine vvherefore two wel agree iustified freelye accepted god besides desert yet owne free pleasure bestoweth reward due vnto work 28 verely say vnto disciple might yet doubte amongst themselues day lorde styrreth vp neerer hopei namely hee shortly giue shewe token glory come vve know true common prouerbe desired haste selfe seemeth make delay found true especiallye amongst v saluation differd comming christe lorde therefore hee might meane season refresh disciple hee proposeth vnto confirmation time meane season hee shuld haue saide seeme long waite comming wil sooner preuent shal dye kingdome god shalbe euidente beefore eye hope whereof commaund depend naturall sense wordes doe imagine iohn fancy comming kingdome god meant manifestation heauenlye glorye christe beganne hys resurrection shewed fullye sendinge holye ghost working merueilous workes beginninges hee gaue disciple taste newnes heauenly lyfe true certeine tryalles might knowe sate right hand father matth 17 mark 9 luk 9 1 sixe dayes iesus took peter iames iohn brother brought thē vp high mountaine parte 2 transfigured face shine sunne clothes white light 3 beehold appeared vnto moses elia talkinge 4 answered peter said iesus master good v thou wilt let v make three tabernacle one thee one moses one elia 5 vvhile yet spak behold bright cloud shadowed thē behold came voice cloud saying beloued sonne well pleased heare 6 discyples heard fell theyr face sore afraid 7 iesus came touched sayd arise afrayd 8 lifed vp eies saw manne saue iesus onely 2 sixe dayes iesus took peter iames iohn brought vp high mountaine waye alone transfigured 3 raymente shine verye white snow white fuller canne make vppon earth 4 appeared vnto elyas moses talkinge iesus 5 peter aunswered said iesus master good v heere let v make also three tabernacle one thee one moses one elia 6 yet hee knew hee said afraid 7 cloude shadowed voice cāe cloud sayinge beloued sonne heare 8 sodenly looked round aboute sawe man saue iesus onely 28 came passe abou • eight day word tooke peter iohn iames wente vp mountaine pray 29 prayd fashion countenaunce chaunged garment white glistered 30 beholde two men talked moses elyas 31 vvhiche appeared glory told departing accomp •• sh hierusalem 32 peter heuy sleepe awoke sawe glorye two men standing 33 came passe departed peter said iesus maister good v let v therefore make three tabernacle one thee one moses one elia wiste hee said 34 vvhile thus spak came cloud ouershadowed feared whē wer entring cloud 35 came voyce cloud saying beloued sonne beare 36 whē voice past iesus found alone first considered purpose christ tooke vppon heauenly glory short time onely three disciple witness straung sight opinion done end might strengthened tēptation hand reason death probable hee haue depriued others remedy naye doth expresly forbid shuld declare seene resurrectiō profit visiō shuld appeare death therfore doubt christ would declare drawn death wil went willingly hee might offer vp sacrifice obedience hys father knowledge came disciple mindes vntil christ rose againe neither necessary time conceaue diuine power christ shuld know conquering vpon crosse taught another time aswel sake least infirmity christ offend man though necessity constraint suffer euident easie christ exempt body death adorne heauenly glory therefore taught hee subiect death wil crucified offred flesh offred vpon crosse lay graue could haue bene free death graue whē bene partaker celestiall glory also taught long christ conuersant world shape seruaunt maiesty hid vnder infirmity flesh nothing withdrawn humbled hys freewil resurrectiō taketh away vaile wherwith power hidden time sufficient lord chuse three witness law number prescribed proouing matter deut 17 6 difference tyme ought offend v math mar number six whol day passed betweene luke saying done almost eight day comprehendeth aswel day wherin christ spake day wherin trāsfigured therfore wee see agree wel one sense vttered diuerse word 2 transfigured luke sayth came passe hee praid circumstaunce place tyme may gathered praied obtayned visible shewe demonstratiō godhead might reuealed brightnesse new shape nead aske prayer wyl father doubted whole course humilitie hee thinge god referred father purpose stirre v vppe prayer transfiguration disciple see christe altogeather excellency heauen gaue taste great glory able abyde face shone sunne farre exceedeth brightnes sunne vnwoonted brightnes shone apparell nowe without apparell maiesty godhead shyneth hys whole body god time paste appeared vnto father himselfe able abyde beames hys great bryghtnesse iohn saieth 1 io 3 2 faythfull shal see hee made lyke vnto nowe cause manne dispute subtilly whitnesse garmentes brightnesse face full reuealing celestiall glorye hee partelye gaue taste figure whiche yet able whollye conceaue 3 moses elyas appeared vnto demaunded whether moses elia verily present disciple sawe onely lykenesse prophetes oftentimes see vision thinges absent though matter disputable side menne say yet profitable iudgement brought indeede place neyther absurditie seeing god hath body soules hande pleasure restore dead life time moses elyas rose themselues might present christe manne demaunde agayne apostle knew moses elia neuer seene answere easie sith god brought appeare gaue thē also signes markes whereby might bee knowne amongst extraordinary manner reuelation certeinly knew moses elyas two appeared rather companye holy father reason ought satisfie v lawe prophet purpose ende christ made greatlye faith christ came without testimonye beefore commended god neyther doth reason displease woont brought elyas especially taken represēt al prophetes though hee lefte nothing writing yet hee chiefe next vnto moses restored religion god corrupted yea without comparison especiall auenger law true holynesse nowe almoste extinguished appeare christ talke togeather signe consent theyr talke luke onely reporteth namely talked manner departure remayned ierusalem must restrained theyr priuate person rather office enioyned wil god though bene long dead perfourmed course theyr calling shuld yet againe confirme theyr voyce taught theyr lyfe wee might know saluation promised holye father sacrifice christe common v nowe olde prophet prophesied death christ hee whiche eternall wisdome god sate secrete throne glory vvhereof followeth hee cloathed flesh subiect vnto death hee freely submitted himselfe thereunto 4 maister good v luke reporteth peter sayd moses elyas gone wherby gather afraid least departure shuld lose sweet blessed sight though meruaile peter delighted plesaunt sight thinges despised onely enioying satisfied sayd p 16 11 fulnesse ioy countenaunce god yet preposterous desire vnderstoode ende vision hee foolishlye made seruauntes equall master thirdly hee erred hee wold make transitory tabernacle menne dwel already receaued celestiall angelycall glory say hee vnderstoode ende vision heard moses elia say time death christ hand man amased sight momentary hee dreamed eternall vvhat meaneth kingdome christ bee meanes included narow roumth twentie thirty foote redemption whole church vvhere fellowship eternall saluation also peruerse iudgement imagine elyas moses fellowes sonne god necessarye menne shoulde brought vnder hee alone may extolde peter contente lotte whye dooth hee thinke haue neede earthlye supplyes sight whome hee thinketh himselfe happye therefore two euangelistes doe verye well note hee knewe hee sayde marke addeth cause afraid neither wil god apostle time profit beholde godheade sonne moment liuely glasse afterwarde successe time shewed frute corrected want iudgement therefore marke declareth peter astonished spake man altogither amased 5 beholde bright cloude cloude put eye might knowe yet fitte beholde brightnesse heauenly glory lord gaue token presence added withall vailes suppresse boldnesse mannes wisdome nowe hee may instructe disciple humility withdraweth eye beholding celestiall glory also admonition doeth appertaine v shoulde desire breake secreates passe sens rather euery manne doe soberly containe himselfe within measure faith cloud stead bridle v least curiositie become wanton meete disciple also admonished must retourne accustomed warfare must promise themselues triumph time came voyce cloude also woorthy noted voyce god sounded cloude neither body face seene therefore let v remember warning moses gaue deut 4 15 god appeared visible shape least deceiued thinke like vnto man true holy father time past saw sundry shape whereby might know god yet alwaies abstained shewes might yelde occasion prouocation make idolles truely sith mindes men bent meete shoulde grosse fantasy hurtfull put oyle lampe notable manifestation glory calleth v vnto cloud owne voyce howe absurde v goe make bee present eye stocke woode stone therefore lette v learn faith alone fleshly eye pierce light cannot come neare wherein god doth dwel voyce came cloude disciple knowing came god might receiue reuerence meete sonne willingly subscribe iudgement thinke heere secreat opposition betweene moses elia christe christ commaund disciple content onely sonne name sonne emphaticall forcible whereby hee extolled aboue seruaunts also christ adorned two title lesse honourable profitable faith namely welbeloued sonne also maister father calleth beloued whome well pleased declareth mediator reconcileth world himselfe vvhen commaundeth heare hee maketh chiefe onely doctour churche purpose note al others word doe truely properly gather nature sonne like maner obserued alone beloued father hee made onely doctour authoritie might rest power man except asking whether god loueth aungelles men aunsweare easily made fatherly loue god hee beareth aungelles menne commeth fountaine neither sonne therfore beloued father creature shoulde hated hee might impart proper himselfe though estate v aungelles diuers neuer estraunged god neede reconciler sinne ennemies vntill christe reconciled vnto v yet alwayes certaine god merciful bothe embraceth v christe aungelles coulde ioyned god without head nowe father speaketh heere distinguisheth himselfe sonne followeth distincte personnes thoughe essence maiestie one heare shewed church called backe word onely doctoure christ might depend onely mouthe though christe came confirme lawe prophet yet holdeth chiefe roume brightnesse gospell hee swalloweth vppe sparkes shone olde testament sonne righteousnesse whose comming appeared ful day reason apostle sayeth first chapiter hebrewes god sundry time diuers maners olde time spake prophet spake last day beloued sonne furthermore day christ lesse heard law prophet gospell authoritie maister might wholely rest vppon euen chalengeth himselfe alone mathewe 23 8 keepeth prerogatiue safe except al men tounges keepe silence vvherfore necessary soeuer menne haue deuised shoulde ouerthrowne cast downe hee mighte keepe v vnder doctrine doeth daily send foorth doctours suche doe purely faithfully deliuer whiche shoulde learne suche doe mixe gospell theyr owne addition summe manne faithfull teacher church except christes disciple also bring others taught 6 disciple heard god strike disciple feare might better impri • te remembraunce vision heart meane • ason see howe great infirmitie flesh whiche af •• de hearing voyce god cause wicked doe either scorne contemptuously despise god doeth effectually touche necessary maiestie god shoulde cast v downe assoone feele christe afterwarde doeth office raising vppe throwne downe therefore came downe v direction faithfull might without feare appeare presence god maiestie otherwise consumeth fleshe shall terrible vnto furthermore hee doeth onely comfort woorde also confirmeth touching afterwarde sayde saw onely christe tendeth shewe glory tied lawe prophet time onely christe might continue glorious vse helpe moses rightly hee must rested vppon must applie diligence may ledde hande vnto christe whose minister hee togither rest place also may bee applied ouerthrowinge superstition doe onely sette christ equall prophet apostle doe ioyne common halfe sainctes one number grace god doe shine sainctes farre ende shoulde forceably take vnto themselues parte honour due vnto christe fountaine errour might haue benne noted disciple themselues long feared maiestie god mindes wandered seeking menne christ hadde comfortably raised vppe onely seene wee haue comfort v wherewith christe taketh away feares foolishe affection doe drawe v hether thether shall vanishe away mathew 17 marke 9 luke 9 9 came mountaine iesus charged saying shewe vision manne vntill sonne manne rise againe deade 10 disciple asked sayinge vvhy saye scribe elia must first come 11 iesus aunsweared said vnto certainly elia must first come restore thing 12 say vnto elia come already knewe haue done vnto soeuer woulde likewise shall also sonne manne suffer 13 disciple perceiued hee spake vnto iohn baptist 9 came downe mountaine charged shoulde tell man hadde seene saue sonne manne risen dead againe 10 kept matter themselues demanded fully come publishing vision truely shoulde haue bene credite giuen disciple except christ giuen resurrection euident token glory diuine power shewed self openly momentanie beholding glory began haue erred person elia may also meant maliciously subtilly vnder pretence elia derogate christe elia promised forerunner messias shoulde prepare way easie lay preiudice vppon christ came without elia euen messias 11 certainly elia must come vve haue shewed whereof errour sprang among iewes restoring decaied estate churche iohn baptist like elia malachi gaue name also vnto rashly taken scribe elia downe seuerall poyntes plainly folowe course woordes sette downe first doeth euidently declare wherefore christe became nowe sharper woont wheras exclameth iewes people vnworthy longer borne withall frowarde malice vve know gently wont vse yea though dealt importunately father heere sueth sonne great necessity vrgeth modestly humbly sueth christe mercy vvhy sodaine earnest accustomed sayeth borne reason greate seueritie sette downe mathewe luke interpreaters deceiued whiche thought christe rebuked heere either disciple childes father well consider whole course hystorie sette downe marke shall easie iudge christe rather offended malice scribe roughly reproue ignorant weake vvhen absence christ lunatike childe bene brought foorth middest amongest seemed plausible occasion scribe quarrell willingly tooke therefore earnest disciple haue power shoulde shewe healing childe likely disciple tried coulde bring purpose passe scribe boast conquerours doe onely scorne disciple quarrell christe power decayed person moste abhominable vngodlines ioyned like ingratitude maliciously suppresse many myracles whereby learned howe greate power christe hadde sette purpose endeuoured quenche light sette eye vvherefore christe exclaimeth without cause hee beare longer calleth faithlesse croked nation shoulde many former instruction haue least prosited thus farre seeke occasion quarelling mar 14 hee sawe great multitude doubt disciple accounted iesting stockes ennemies truth woont bragges make muche euen nothing scribe therefore troublesome dealing laide disciple open scorned many yet seemeth euill • fected assoone see iesus salute yea presence pulleth downe insolencie scribe much demaunded whereof disputed helde peace 17 maister haue brought sonne mathew noteth another kinde disease marke doeth sayeth man lunatike yet doe agree two poynts dumme certaine time driuen rage called lunatike whiche eyther wane moone haue falling sicknes troubled giddinesse neither hold chrysostome imagineth name inuented sub • letie sathan hee might blotte infamie good creature god certain experience teacheth disease doe encrease decrease according course moone yet letteth sathan may adde force naturall meanes therefore thinke man deafe dumme nature tounge eares possessed sathan furthermore weakenesse braine synewes made subiecte falling sicknesse greater mischiefe added sathan himselfe heereof came passe euery sought owne destruction lay torne falleth downe one without life like vnto deade man heereby learne many meanes sathan hath hurt v except driuen away hand god many infirmity flesh soule think innumerable many dartes yeelde sathan annoy v therefore blockishe miserable condition doe prouoke v prayer heerein doeth incomparable goodnesse god shewe selfe besette diuers daungers yet hee preserueth v vnder defence especially consider howe great desire oure ennemie enflamed destroy v comfort shoulde also come minde christe came bridle madnesse wee doe therefore remaine safe amongest many daungers oure heauenly medicine force daungers circumstance time maketh also purpose father aunsweareth sonne hath bene thus miserably tormented euen youth sathan haue great libertie giuen vppon tender age shoulde feare whiche owne sinnes doe make oure selues meete suche deadly blowes doe minister weapon enemie vpon coulde enter owne right desire restrained ouerthrowne wonderfull power mat 17 generation faithlesse though christ seemeth directe speach father lunatike yet douted hath respect scribe taught little certaine simple weake rebuked enclosed owne malice doe stubbornly resist god therefore christ denieth woorthy borne withall threatneth shortly diuorce himselfe them▪ nothing woorse fall forsake v small reproofe proudly refuse grace visitation also noted men handled diuersly euery man according inclination whē allureth apt taught gentlenesse beareth wyth weake doeth also moderately stirre vppe slowe hee spareth croked serpent whome seeth cured remedy mar 20 assoone spirite 〈◊〉 deuill rageth vehemently vpon man woont maruell nearer grace christe sheweth selfe effectually worketh outragiously sathan fareth stirred vppe presence christ sounde trumpet mooueth tumult stirreth much able behooueth v meditate time least faith troubled oft appearance grace christe enemie ariseth v violence wont yea thing moreouer noted true beginning healing throughly afflicted shalbe little death also lord kindleth torche light furious rage sathan shewe foorth grace men astonished horrible sight thereby power christ presently folowed might better discerned 21▪ childe heereby gather inflicted punishment sinnes manne secreate iudgement god certaine infantes come firste oute wombe mother innocent god guiltlesse god scourge haue sometime secreat cause triall obedience▪ neither doe otherwise yeelde honour due god reuerently modestly adore iustice euen hidden v man desire knowe matter may search place ninthe chapter iohn neither manne hath sinned parent 22 thou canst doe thing helpe v vve see howe little honour yeeldeth vnto christ thinking prophet whose power finite within measure commeth vnto doubting first foundation faith embrace immeasurable power god also first entrance prayer extoll aboue lette • may certainly perswaded pray vaine man thought christe otherwise man false opinion corrected behoueth shoulde beleeue might capable fit receiue grace desired christ doth plainly reproue man answer turning back vpon way spoken euill sheweth faulte teacheth seeke remeady exception thou canst beleue much haue sayde thou desirest helpe thee doe thing thou shalt finde fountaine power cannot drawne drie thou bringest measure faith large enough heereof may gathered profitable doctrine whiche generally belongeth vnto v lorde lette great bountifulnesse goodnesse sloweth vnto v must imputed narow straites faith stilleth downe v drop drop nay ofttimes cānot feele drop vnbeliefe stoppeth vp heart vaine would subtel men shew themselues heere christ would teach manne coulde beleeue purpose cast vpon men fault owne weakenesse oft doe weaken power god owne vnbeliefe 23 thing possible beleueth douted christ taught fulnesse al good thing giuen vnto father kinde helpe cannot hoped alone otherwise hand god shoulde haue sayd onely beleeue thou shalt obtaine howe faith shall obtaine thing shall see little 24 beleeue lord sayeth beleeueth yet confesseth himselfe vnbeleuer though two seeme contrary yet man hath triall himselfe perfect faith followeth part vnbeleeuers yet god mercy pardoneth v accounteth v faithful litle portiō faith yet behoueth v diligently shake dreg infidelitie doe sticke v striue craue lorde woulde correcte oft conflicte flie helpe v well consider giuen euery man shall easily appeare fewe haue excellent faith fewe haue meane faith haue small measure mathewe 17 mar 9 luke 17 19 came disciple iesus apart sayde vvhy coulde cast 20 iesus sayd vnto vnbeliefe verily say vnto yee haue faith much graine mustard seede yee shall say vnto mountaine remooue hence yonder place shall remooue nothing shall vnpossible vnto 21 howe best kinde goeth praier fasting 28 come house disciple asked secreatly could cast 29 sayd vnto kinde meanes come foorth prayer fasting 5 apostle sayde vnto lorde increase oure faith 6 lord sayde ye faith much graine mustarde seede shoulde say vnto mulber • e tree plucke thy selfe vppe rootes plant thy selfe sea euen obey 19 came disciple disciple maruell power hadde taken depriued themselues therof owne fault therefore christ assigneth want vnbeliefe sentence touched rehearseth againe prosecuteth large nothing impossible faith certaine hyperbolicall kinde speache sayth faith tree mountain shuld remoued yet sum tendeth purpose god neuer leaue v would open doore grace neither meaning god giue soeuer commeth rashly minde thought nay nothing contrary faith rash vnaduised vowes flesh followeth faith raigneth euery thing confusedly desired lorde alloweth therefore sobrietie must holden desire hath promised v praiers restrained rule set downe man obiecte disciple knew whether pleased lord lunatike healed answer ready thing befell owne fault christ nowe speaketh speciall faith secreat force presēt matter required faith whereof paule maketh mention 1 cor 12 9 came passe disciple spoiled power spirite working myracles choaked owne slouthfulnesse christe spake perticular faith according circumstance place appertaineth common faith whole church 21 kinde goeth saying christ doth reproue sluggishnesse might know neede common faith otherwise might haue excepted altogither without faith therefore meaning euery faith sufficeth battoll fought hotly sathan requireth strong force prescribeth prayer remeady weakenesse faith whereunto adioyneth fasting helpe sayeth tender exorcistes come foorth fight shadow battell sport haue deale stout champion ouercome great sharpe fight therefore faith must stirred vp prayer slow colde prayer helpe fasting must also added hereby doeth euidently appeare howe ridicoulously papist doe fasting make medicine driue away deuils lorde applieth purpose stirre vppe desire prayer vvhen sayeth kinde deuil cast foorth meanes praier fasting meaning sathan hath taken deepe rootes hath hadde long possession walketh vnbrideled libertye harde muche doe gette victorie therefore wee must striue force math 17 marke 9 luke 9 22 abode kingdome heauen 5 soeuer shal •• lue suche little childe name receiueth 30 departed thence went galile woulde haue knowen 31 taught disciple sayd vnto sonne man shalbe deliuered hand men shal kil killed shall rise againe third day 32 vnderstoode saying afraide aske 33 came capernaum hee house hee asked yee disputed among way 34 held peace way reasoned among themselues shoulde chiefe 35 sate called twelue said anye manne desire bee first shalbe last al seruaunt vnto 36 toke litle childe sette middes tooke armes said vnto 37 vvho soeuer shal receiue one little childrenne name receiueth mee whosoeuer receiueth mee receiueth mee sent 43 while wondered thing iesus sayd vnto disciple 44 marke wordes diligently shall come passe sonne manne shall deliuered handes men 45 vnderstoode woord hidde could perceiue feared aske worde 46 arose disputation among shoulde greatest 47 vvhen iesus sawe thoughtes heartes hee tooke little childe sette hym 48 said vnto vvho soeuer receiueth little childe name receiueth soeuer shall receiue receiueth sent least among shalbe great 22 abode galile nearer time death approched oftner christe warneth disciple least fearfull sight shoulde weaken faith speache vsed little myracle wrought marke sayth went place galile might liue quietly meane time determined come ierusalem solemne day sacrifice next passeouer offred vp though bene often admonished matter yet lesse troubled neuer hadde heard thing opinion taken doth much preuaile darkeneth mind cleare light apostle imagined amōgst themselues kingdom christ quiet pleasant thought assoone shewed foorth receiued allowance men nothing incredible priest scribe others chief church shuld therefore errour doe admit thing sayde contrary parte marke sayeth knewe lorde meant whereof commeth ignorance worde manifest plaine vaine illusion hadde couered mindes vaile durst aske thoughe maye bee partly attributed certayne reuerence yet thinke helde peace men oppressed sorowe stricken absurdity imagined thēselues vvherfore shame altogither praised nourished perplexed dout corrupt sorow meane secreatseede godlines rather manifest knowledge truth tied christ shuld depart frō schole beginning rote faith true vnderstāding planted hart zeale following christ far implicite faith papist yet proceded far knowledge nature kingdome god promised renewing christ doe say desire godlinesse rather appeare certaine knowledge heereby gather worthy either praise reprehension though blockishnesse excused yet cause shoulde maruel expresse euident declaration crosse ignominie master vnto riddle onely contrary glory sonne god refused condemned nothinge vnlikely grace promised peculiarly iewes shoulde reiected gouernours nation great horrour crosse wherewith sodenly taken excluded comfort hope resurrection added let v learne oft mention made death christe comprehende whole 3 day togither death burial may lead v vnto happy triumph newe life 1 time disciple came appeareth two disciple came christ owne freewil priuily reasoned matter way drawen denne light absurditie mathewe hasting christes answer doth set downe whole course hystorie passing beginninge doeth summarily declare christ reprooued foolish desire soueraigntie amongst disciple christ inquireth secreat speach vrgeth disciple cōfes desired haue suppressed taught beware emulation neuer secreat circūstance time noted foretelling death made sadde doubtful yet heard fond fable poeticall cup fained drinke begun doe presently striue supremacie commeth passe great carefulnesse shuld spedily vanish away mindes men giuen much ambition forgetting present warfare deceiued false imagination doe straight step triumph remembrance lately spoken soone forgotten apostle shall become v bid meditation death farewell long time giue selues slouthfulnesse carelesnesse idle speculation demaunded occasion trouble disciple aunswear flesh doeth willingly shake trouble letting passe cause heauinesse doeth take holde whiche spoken resurrection whereof contention arose amongst thus carelesse doe eschewe former part doctrine vnpleasant flesh god suffereth erre resurrection might dreame whiche shoulde come passe christ preaching onely get himselfe kingdom earthly shoulde presently growe great wealth prosperitie question double fault apostle dealt preposterously reiecting care warfare whereunto called souldiers well deserued desire rest seke haue rewardes giuen honor time secondly dealt yll ought haue bent thēselues togither one consent mutually help one desire price lesse brother thēselues malitious ambition endeuored preuent rest vvherfore course may allowed vnto lord let v learne paciently bear burden crosse laid vpon v vntil full time come v crowned paul exhorteth rom 12 10 giuing honor go one another vaine curiosity men day like former fault leauing lawfull course calling doe leape time aboue heauens calling v gospel kingdome sheweth way leadeth thither winged men thinking faith patience calling vpon god exercise doe dispute done heauen muche man take iourney diligently inquiring situation inne lodging mooueth one foote forwarde lord commaundeth v walke vppon earth soeuer doeth curiously dispute howe deade doe sitte heauen doeth hinder himselfe comming heauen 2 iesus called little childe sum soeuer desire greatnesse whereby may aboue brother shalbe far obtaining cannot sticke vtmost corner reasoneth contrary humility doeth extoll v outward thing set eye moue setteth figure humilitie yong child commaundeth become like childe stretched generally thinges vve know child many thing corrupt wherfore paul wold haue v child vnderstanding malice whome otherwise vnderstanding commaundeth ripe age infant doe yet knowe preferred aboue others striue superioritie example christ would blot mind thing prophane men child world alwaies discourse pleasure honour least ambition shoulde stirre vp man except infant euen wombe haue pride grafted would haue themselues accounted cared aunswer easie similitude must exactly narowly sifted haue agree poyntes doth yet raigne great simplicitie infant knowe degree honour swellinges pride therfore christ doth fitly aptly propose example purpose appertaineth conuersion whereof hee maketh mention namely disciple framed thēselues much common maners men therfore might come right marke course must turned backward euery man desireth first second place christ alloweth man lowest place except forget superiority humble contrary sayth shalbe greatest hū ble themselues least thinke loose thing willingly leaue al greatnes heereof may gathered short definitiō humility namely truely humble neither chalengeth thing vnto himselfe god contemptuously disdaineth brother desireth sene ligher satisfieth accounted one member christe desiring thing head may onely exalted 3 soeuer shal receiue christ doth metaphorically cal thē child laying aside al loftinesse doe frame thēselues modesty subiection added stead comfort least submission shuld hard troublesome vnto v wherby christ doth receiue v owne protection commendeth v also men meanes faithful taught howe shoulde eche esteme others euery man submitteth himselfe howe mutuall frendship commonly nourished amongst child world doth bear anothers couetousnes therfore couetouser man glory boldly taketh authority vnto may extolled lowly shuld scorned disdained christ cōmādeth mā doth hūble shuld honored meaning saying added luke neither yet doth cōmand worthily despised shuld estemed void pride make account abased mathew 18 marke 9 lu 17 6 soeuer shall offend one litle one fire 10 see yee despise one little one say vnto heauen angel alwayes behold ye face father heauē 42 soeuer shall offend one little • ne beleeue better rather milstone hanged necke cast sea 43 thee offende cut better thee go halt life hauing two feete cast hel fire neuer shall quenched 46 vvhere worme dieth fire nouer goeth 47 thine eye cause thee offend plucke better thee go kingdome god one 6 soeuer shal offend semeth added comfort godly least estate seme troublesom vnto world doth despise doth much hinder thē frō humbling thēselues voluntary modesty thinke meanes shal become contēptible yet hard loathed also troden vnder fote proud men therfore christ encourageth disciple cōfort world despise basenes yet god doth neglect yet also semeth tēd end strife begā superiority honor vvherof might easily gathered apostle infected wicked desire aloft also cā shuld reprochful brethrē soeuer pleaseth much desireth preferred al mē heale desease christ denoūceth horrible punishmēt mā pride shal cast pore mē already hūbled accord cōprehē deth vnder word offence forbiddē contempt though cānot otherwise mā shuld carelesly offend weake yeldeth regard honor vnto thē shuld whē sundry kind offence yet kinde thing offence briefly considered defaut mā either stūbleth brought right course hindred said offend therefore soeuer desireth escape punishmēt christ headlong whether soeuer pleasure shall cary full dishonestie make haste vile pouertie afterwarde describeth punishment iust iudgement god remaineth part suche prodigall waster namely goodes wickedly wasted shoulde throughly pinched hunger knewe vse thriftily aboundance best breade shalbe driuen feede vpon acornes huskes short becomming swine fellowes thinke themselues vnwoorthy mannes meat dainty neither gaue kind meate swine could want saying cyrus notable flight bene long fasting sōwhat refreshed meate browne bread sayd hee neuer tasted sauorye bread necessity compelled yong man
