fatherly remitteth must brotherly forgiue thinke people iewes described vnder figure elder sonne though without reason yet seeme sufficiently marke whole course texte murmuring scribe ther arose speach troubled kindnes christ towardes miserable men bene lose lyuers therefore compareth scribe swelled arrogancye thriftye modeste men alwayes wel regarded houshold estate liuing honestly sparingly yea hee compareth thē obediente sonnes al lifetime patiently beare autority father though altogether vnworthy prayse yet christ speaking sense concession imputeth vnto thē fained holines vertue shuld haue said although shuld graunt vnto falsly brag haue alwaies bene obedient sonnes vnto god yet brother muste proudly cruelly cast repent wicked life 28 therefore came father word reproueth intollerable pride hypocrite must bee entreated father enuy mercy shewed vnto brother though god doth entreate yet example exhorteth v beare fault brother may cut excuse theyr wicked rigor doth bring hypocrite speaking whose false boastinge might refuted also man shall whollye discharge al dueties godlynes towards father yet hee denyeth haue iust cause complaynt brother forgiuen certeine sincere worshipper god alwayes free void malitious affection purpose christ shew hee vnrighteous enuyeth brother receiued fauour although would giue place angel holynes 31 sonne thou art euer two chiefe pointes aunswere first cause elder angry seeth endamaged receiuing brother fauour hauing regard saluation brother grieued sory ioy conceiued returne mine saieth thine though thou haste yet taken away nothing house thou hast lost nothing thinges remaine safe thee doth ioy offend thee whereof thou shuldest haue bene companion meete reioyce thy brother wee thought bene loste safety returned home againe vve must note two reason neyther doe wee lose anye thing god doe kindelye receiue fauour whiche theyr sinnes hadde bene estraunged hardnes without godlines gladde see brother restored death life matth 18 mark luk 17 15 moreouer thy brother trespasse thee goe tell fault betweene thee alone hee heare thee thou haste wonne thy brother 16 hee heare thee take yet thee one two mouth two three witness euery word may confirmed 17 hee vouchsafe heare tell vnto church refuse heare church also let vnto thee heathen man publican 18 verely say vnto whatsoeuer yee bind earth shal bound heauen whatsoeuer ye lose earth shalbe losed heauen 19 againe verely say vnto two shal agree earth vppon thing whatsoeuer shall desire shalbe giuen father heauen 20 two three gathered together name mids 3 take heede selues thy brother trespasse againste thee rebuke repent forgiue 15 thy brother trespasse thee hee spoken bearing infirmity brethrē sheweth plainly ende farre borne otherwise bene ready obiection offence cannot otherwise auoyded euery manne shoulde winke faultes men sinne nourished bearinge therefore christ prescribeth meane betweene neither shall offende weake much yet shall apte healing disease seuerity compounded nature medicine profitable prayse worthy summe christe commaundeth disciple forgiue one another yet endeuor correct fault must wisely obserued nothing difficult spare fauour men freely reprehend faultes men almost leane one side eyther deceiue one another deadly flatteringes el strike hardly heale christ commendeth disciple mutual loue bee farre flattery hee onely commaundeth season admonition moderation least austere hard ouerthrow weake expresly setteth downe three degree brotherly correction first hee hath sinned admonyshed priuately second hee shew token stubbornesse hee againe admonished beefore witness third preuaile nothing way delyuered publike iudgment church purpose spake least charity broken vnder pretence feruent zeale ambition doth cary away part men desirous spread offence brother christ doth time meete faulte commaunding v couer faultes brother much delighted shame infamy brother certeine caryed away hatred malice charity would haue regard shame brother yet demāded whether rule doth generally extend sinner many whiche wil allow publike reproues vntyl offender first pryuately admonished manifest restraint christes wordes doth simply without exception commaund whosoeuer sinneth admonished reproued priuately without witnesse would haue v try way priuately offended matter owne beecause meete wee shoulde wounded sorowe ofte god offended neither yet dooth christe speake heere suffring iniuryes hee dooth generally teach v imbrace vse louing kindnes amongst v least handling weake one sharply wee lose kept therefore clause thee doth note iniury done one man distinguisheth betweene secrete manifest sinnes man sinneth whole churche paule commaundeth publikly reproued hee woulde haue elder spared name doth paule giue timothy charge publike reprouing beefore men might made publike example others 1 tim 5 20 certenly ridiculous thing hee offended offence openly knowne publike offence brother bee admonished euery one thousand knew shuld admonished thousand tymes vvherefore distinction whiche christ expresly maketh kept man making secrete offence common rashly without necessity defame brother shall heare thee thou hast wonne christ confirmeth doctrine profit fruite shall come thereof small matter get soule god bondage sathan whereof cō meth passe falne doe seldome repent beecause handled odiously enemy hardē themselues obstinacy therefore nothing better gentlenesse reconcileth god falne dooth intemperately runne fond fauouring offender doth willingly lose saluation brother hand luke christ commaundeth v expresly satisfied priuate admonition brother thereby brought repentaunce hereby also gathered necessary amongste faythfull free mutuall lyberty reprouing one another euery one v doth offend often euery daye extreame crueltie silence dissimulation betray saluation whō friendly reprofe might delyuer destruction though successe doth alwayes followe yet dooth lye great guiltinesse vpon neglecteth remedy prescribed lord preseruation saluation brother also noted diligenter perfourme duety lord doth yeeld ouer honour v one man cannot conuerte another belongeth vnto yet doth adorne v vndeserued title doe gaine winne lost brother 16 heare thee take yet thee second degree hee behaued himselfe stubbornely towardes one manne woulde abide taught shoulde againe admonished witness doe heere obiecte vaine call witness wee haue deale manne disobedient rebellyous hee wyll farre bente acknowledge fault theyr presence hee wickedly deny knotte shall easily losed thou wilt distinguishe betweene kinde manner denyinge slypping backe hee precisely denyeth deede saieth hee falselye slaunderouslye charged lette alone shall vayne vrge callynge beefore wytnesses beecause moste parte menne doe eyther frowardlye scorne impudentlye excuse doone wickedly vngodly vntyll brought greater aucthoritie shall bee profitable obserue course towardes also saying sauiour must vnderstod appeareth word vseth signifieth reproue reproue conuince euident demonstration shoulde reproue stoutlye denyeth whole matter hath hard browe deny offence committed shutteth vp way second admonition wee vnderstand christe woulde haue v vse witness admonition may haue weight greater effect absurditie doth bend moses word somewhat sense moses forbiddeth giue iudgemente matter vnknowne setteth downe lawful meanes triall testimony two three euery word may stand confirmed christe alluding lawe saieth cause euident two three witness doe arise condemne man especially iudgment church may riper neither cause complaine iniury brought forth lyghte refused heare two three 17 tell vnto church demaunded hee meaneth vnderstandeth name churche paule 1 corinthian 5 5 commaundeth incestuous corinthe bee excommunicate anye chosen number whole companye godly therefore maye seeme probable iudgement heere referred people beecause yet church hadde giuen theyr name christe anye order appoynted lorde himselfe speaketh manner vsed receyued bee doubted hee alludeth order olde churche also place applyeth speach accordinge manner knowne amongste vvhen hee commaundeth matthew 5 23 gyfte wee woulde offer left altar vntyll wee may reconcyled offended brother doubted hee woulde presente forme manner worshypping god vnder lawe teache v wee cannot praye ryghtlye offer anye thing god longe dyscorde brother therefore nowe dooth looke fourme disciplyne receyued amongste iewes absurde hym appoint iudgemente church yet none also aucthoritie excommunication amongste iewes handes elder whoe represented person estate whole church christe dooth verye aptly appoynt whiche haue sinned length openly brought church doe eyther proudlye despyse scoffinglye scorne pryuate admonition vvee knowe iewes returned captiuitie babylon hadde chosen councell called sinhedrim greeke synedri • n whereunto censure manner doctrine committed gouernmente brydle keepe frowarde vntractable menne order lawfull approued god anye manne except thinges corrupt order comminge christe tyranny bee accounted nothing lesse iudgement church aunswere easie though manner theyr dealinge defiled corrupted yet order worthylye praysed christe tymes paste delyuered father shortlye hee erected church corruption taken awaye hee restored pure vse excommunicating yet doubted order disciplyne flouryshed vnder kingdome christ succeeded place elder certeinely prophane nation hadde shadowe rite excommunicating appeareth god put mind men beginning vncleane defiled driuen holy exercise therefore vile shamefull thing people god altogeather without disciplyne whereof remayninge shewe amongst gentile whiche obserued lawe christe translate v wee aunciente father haue one cause purpose christ send disciple synagogue willingly nouryshed filthy corruption bosome excommunicated true sincere worshipper god declareth order bee holden church bene holily appoynted vnder law presently added heathen publycans confirmeth interpretation brought heathen publycans much hated abhorred amongste iewes vnto compareth men vncleane incureable wyll obey yeelde admonition certeine would haue giuen precept heathen whome church shoulde gathered shoulde flye themselues neyther cause day faythfull abhorre publycans christ might better vnderstoode borowed manner speach presently vsed owne countrey meaning haue nothing doe contemners church vntil repent 18 vvhatsoeuer ye shall bynde hee rehearseth wordes nowe hee vsed beefore sixteene chapter diuerse sense purpose confirme aucthoritye doctrine heere hee appoynteth disciplyne adioyned doctrine christe sayde preaching gospell vaine sauour eyther lyfe death hee sayeth though wicked doe scorne iudgement church yet shall vaine distinction must holden speaketh word preached publike censure discipline let reader seeke reason bynding losinge thence summe whosoeuer hauing committed sinne dooth humbly acknowledge fault entreateth obtaine forgiuenes church absolued onely men also god agayne whosoeuer scorneth reproues threatning church condemned iudgment shall bee confirmed heauen giuen men manne obiect god meanes shoulde vnder iudge without voyce owne must subscribe iudgment mortall menne aunsweare ready christ doth defende right church would thereby diminishe owne right father hee would thereby rather sanctifie maiestie word sixteene chapter establish generallye euery doctrine came mouth neyther place dooth say euery iudgment shall establyshed ratified wherein president chiefe onelye spirite also worde vvhereof followeth men god preiudice whyle pronounced nothing mouth doe faithfullye endeuour themselues onely execute commanded though christe onely iudge world yet would meane season haue minister word denounce proclaym would haue church delyuer iudgment hee derogateth nothing himselfe vsing ministerie menne alone loseth byndeth yet hereof aryseth question whē church tollerateth many hypocrite also absolueth many pretende faygned repentaunce whether apparaunt bee absolued heauen aunswere speach directed none rightlye sincerely reconcile themselues churche would giue comfort take away feare fearefull trembling conscience sayth whosoeuer shall sinne receiued fauour church freed guyltinesse beefore god hee appoynted pledge heauenly grace whiche nothing apperteineth hypocrite doe peruert right vse reconciliation ariseth hence small hope vnto godlye heare sinnes blotted god angel assoone obtaine forgiuenesse church parte ambyguitie meaning christe stubborne proud men ready vnder pretence despyse iudgmēt church vngodly knaues doe often boldlye appeale tribunall seate heauen christe hee may terrour breake pryde saieth condemnation ratified heauen meane encourageth iust righteous seueritie leaste shoulde giue place wicked frowardnesse whiche refuse shake discipline heere also seene ignorauntly papistes doe wrest place colour kynde tyranny certeine ryght aucthority excommunicating giuen vnto church menne right minde doe confesse whether euery manne one called churche created horned disguysed beaste may according pleasure send forth theyr vaine empty crake excommunication accordinge theyr pleasure manifeste lawefull gonernmente church committed elder onelye minister worde also people ioyned cēsors word yet cōtented former impudencye endeuoured proue place whatsoeuer burden layd vppon people borne speake moste wicked enemyes church doe vnworthily vsurpe violence take vnto themselues aucthority graūted vnto church onely say christe spake onelye correcting sinnes lawes ensnare soules doe lesse foolyshlye wickedlye abuse testimony sorte braune vnder pretence defend auricular confession though christ appoynted reconcyled church theyr faulte brought publyke iudgement yet lay lawe vpon men shuld vnburden thē sinnes eare sacrificer fancy friuolou • necessary stand longer confute 19 againe say vnto confirmeth former sentence god onely giue spirite counsell wisdome thē shall aske also cause whatsoeuer shall doe worde want power effect ioyning consent prayer declareth soberly reuerently faythful behaue themselues holy action sinner must admonished except giue place reproofe must excommunicated behoueth onely aske counsell holy mouth god nothing done according word also meete beeginne prayer vvhereby taught appeareth euidently licence giuen men doe whatsoeuer lust god placed reuenger gouernment church might defend sanctifie iudgementes whereof aucthour meane season faithfull doe meet • taught ioyne petition generally pray together onely testifie vnitie faith god would heare desire therefore god doth often promise otherwhere wil heare priuate prayer euery man christ adorneth publike praiers singular promise might thereby stir v vp earnestly exercise 20 vvhere two three gathered name promise stretcheth former lord declareth presente oft two three shal gathered name hee may directe counsell bringe prosperous successe whatsoeuer shall take hande cause therefore doubt delyuer ouer themselues ruled hym shall feele presence profit fruit shall desire sith inestimable good thing haue christ chiefe presidente affayres againe nothing miserable without grace promise small spurre v might godlyly holyly ioyne togeather amongste selues whosoeuer eyther neglecteth holy assembly negligently separateth himselfe brother behaue himselfe catelesly preseruinge vnitie dooth hereby declare maketh accounte presence christe first must prouided desire haue christe present gathered name definition clause must also noted wicked lesse falsely impudētly wickedly make hys holye name cloake conspiracy therefore excepte wyll caste christe forth theyr scornes togeather ouerthrowe •• promysed first must known saying meaneth namely gathered lettes cast away hynder v comming christe come sincerely christ yeelde obey worde suffer themselues gouerned spirite vvhere simplicitie taketh place feared christe blessinges wyll openly declare company gathered together vaine vvherin grosse follye papistes doth bewray selfe cry theyr councels cannot erre therefore al theyr decree must holden ofte two three gathered name christe hee midst first demaunded whether came together name christe whose faith doctrine affection doubted vvhile papist doe omitte hyde seeth differēce holy prophane assemblyes subtilly confounded power thing may transferred church sworne enemy christ therefore let v know none godly worshipper god sincerely seeke christ comforted hope shuld doubte hys presence bastarde vnfruitefull councelles whiche weaue webbes theyr owne braynes beeinge lefte christe wyll alwayes remain chiefe doctrine gospel amongst v math 18 mark luk 17 21 came peter sayde maister oft shal brother sinne shal forgiue vnto seuen time 22 iesus sayde vnto saye thee vnto seuen time vnto seuenty time seuen time 23 therefore kingdome heauen likened vnto certeine king would take accounte seruants 24 hee begunne reckon one brought vnto ought tenne thousande talleats 25 beecause nothing paye master commaunded sold wife child al debt bee payde 26 seruaunts therefore fell downe beesought saying maister appease thine anger toward pay thee 27 seruaunts maister compassion losed forgaue debt 28 seruaunt departed found one fellowes whiche oughte hundred penny layde handes tooke throat saying pay thou owest 29 fellowe fell downe feete besought saying appease thine anger towards wil pay thee al 30 yet would went caste prison till pay debt 31 fellowes sawe sory came declared theyr master done 32 master called said vnto euil seruant forgaue thee al debt thou praidst 33 oughtest thou also haue pittye thy fellow euen pittie thee 34 master wroth deliuered iaylers tyll hee shoulde paye due 35 likewise shall heauenly father doe vnto except ye forgiue heart • ch one brother trespasse 4 though hee sinne agaynste thee seuen tymes day seuen time daye turne againe thee saying repenteth thou shalt forgiue 21 maister oft peter maketh obiection according cō mon sense wisdome flesh naturally grafted men would haue themselues pardoned man doe presently obtaine forgiuenes complaineth streightlye vnkindly dealt much doe finde shewe themselues easie bee entreated others desire bee gentlye dealte themselues therefore lorde exhorted discyples louing kindnesse doubt came peter minde shall come wee ready forgiue gentlenesse shall bayght prouoke sinne therefore demaundeth whether conuenient forgiue sinne often number seuen signifieth much aduerbe seuen time taken great number hee haue saide master howe ofte wouldest thou haue v receiue offend fauour absurde vnprofitable finde v ready appeased christ farre moued obiection expresly saith shuld end forgiueing neither yet would appoint certeine number rather commandeth neuer weary luke doth somwhat differ mathew simplye reporteth commandement christe wee shoulde bee readye forgiue seuen time yet sense meaninge agreeth wee shuld ready willing forgiue twise oft sinner repenteth onely difference according mathew lord reprouing peter streight behalfe encreaseth number hyperbolically selfe sufficeth sette forth summe matter neither peter aske questiō whether forgiue seuen time content goe far obiecting making shew ā great absurditie hee might drawe christe iudgment touched euen hee ready forgiue seuen time wil also appeased seuenty offence luke wordes aryseth question beecause christ doeth commaund forgiue sinner doth turne v shall testifie repentance meanes hee seemeth graunt liberty deny mercy forgiuenesse wicked aunsweare offence forgiuen two wayes man doe iniurie laying aside desire reuenge doe cease loue stead iniurie bestowe benefite vpon though thinke hardly deserueth yet said accounted forgiue god commandeth v well ennemies doeth therefore presently require shoulde allowe thing condemneth would onely haue mindes free hatred kind forgiuenesse looked hath offended come owne accorde appease v behoueth v loue set purpose exasperate v refuse fauour heape olde offence newe togither second manner forgiuing whē receiue brother fauour thinke wel perswaded remembraunce sinne blotted god gaue warning christe doeth heere speake onely iniuries done v kinde offence woulde haue fallen holpen compassion doctrine therefore necessary nature almost froward beyonde measure sathan vnder pretence seuerity driueth v extreme rigor miserable mē forgiuen swallowed vp sorrowe despaire heere againe demaunded whether man creadited assoone woorde shall professe repentance graunted shall necessitie followe wittingly willingly offend discretion without correction manne might freely scorne v euen hundred offence answear first speaketh heere daily offence euen best manne hath neede forgiuenesse therefore great infirmitie fleshe haue dangerous way many sleight assault shoulde become v second third offence hope forgiuenesse takē away secondly added christ spoyleth faithful iudgement fondly credulous one word would onely haue righteous kinde may reach hande repentant appeareth heart displeased thēselues sinnes repentance holy thing hath nede diligent examination oft sinner shall giue signe conuersion christ would admitted reconciliation least ouerthrowne repulse shuld faint thirdly noted manne hath giuen suspition himselfe lightnesse inconstancie may release asketh forgiuenes hereafter may marke maners least despise pacience kindenesse whiche proceedeth spirite christ counsell lorde must holden fallen must bee holpen kindnesse may raised vppe againe certainly must imitate goodnesse heauenly father meeteth sinner farre hee maye call repentaunce repentance maruellous woorke spirite creation newe man despise doe iniurie god himselfe 23 kingdome heauen likened vnto certaine king hard draw v mercy especially many fault brethrē borne doeth presently loathsomnesse creepe vppon v lord doth confirme doctrine apt fitte parable summe whereof brought forgiue offence brother doe euill prouide themselues make hard straight law themselues shal finde god straight hard entreated towardes similitude consisteth especially 3 poyntes maister set seruant great sum small meane thing singular clemency extreme cruelty 3 thing obserued meaning christe may easily gathered compared god summe euery one v endebted towards lastly light offence wherwith brother endangered v obligation god considered vnworthy therefore mer • god miserable wretch loaden intollerable burden hard entreated fellowes forgiue least offence concerning word spiritual estate churche heere called kingdom heauen christ haue sayde case betweene god manne respecte soule estate spirituall life poynt betweene ciuil earthly master seruauntes respecte money business present life 25 maister commanded friuolous thing subtlely search sift euery perticular poynt god doth alwaies shew rigour vnto v first vntill wee driuen entreate sue forgiuenesse nay preuenteth v free goodnesse onely teacheth shoulde become v god vse v iustice might also shuld exacte v due meete v flee prayer onely remaining refuge sinner great difference betweene summes also noted one talent hundred penny hundred penny ten thousand talent 31 vvhen fellow seruants though mysterie sought woordes yet containe nothing nature teacheth doe daily learne experience knowen shall haue many aduersaries witness v god men liue cannot otherwise cruelty shuld displeasant odious especially euery man afraid least light vpon head seeth befall vnto another question demaunded sentence folowing vaine god punish sin hath forgiuen simple meaning though offer mercy mē yet vnworthy enioy cruel dealer pardon may obtained papist scorned would draw purgatorie fire aduerb vntil euidēt christ speaketh eternal death temporal punishment wherby shuld satisfie iudgement god mathew 17 marke luke 24 come capernaum receiued polle money came peter sayd doeth maister pay tribute 25 sayd yes come house iesus preuented sayinge vvhat thinkest thou simon whome doe king earth take tribute polle money child stranger 26 peter sayd vnto stranger sayde iesus vnto child free 27 neuerthelesse least offend goe sea caste angle take firste fishe commeth vppe thou hast opened mouth thou shalt finde piece 20 penny take giue vnto thee 24 come capernaum purpose hystorie must especially noted christ willingly declared subiection euen taken vpon shape seruaunt yet withall sheweth word myracle debased either law necessity owne free voluntary submission world esteme one cōmon people custome woont gathered passage yearely tribute whiche imposed vppon iewes euery head pay tyrant wont pay god alone know tribute set vppon law yerely paimēt half siccle shuld professe god redemed chiefe king vvhen king asia trāslated vnto themselues pleased romanes wel follow example iewes estranged gouernment god paied prophane tyrant holy tribute commaunded law yet might seeme absurd christ cōming redeme people coulde set himselfe free tribute might take away offence taught word bound therto owne free wil proued myracle coulde haue exempted himselfe earthly empire ruled sea fish maister thinke toll gatherer vpbraided christ withdraw himselfe common course scornefull reprochefull kinde men thinke reprochefully spoken whereas euery man wont seased owne citie knowe christ quiet abiding one place therefore men doe demaunde whether free lawes wanderer hee goeth hither thither peter answeare made modest excuse appease yes sayeth pay vvherby gather christ wont pay peter promised thing doubted call vppon rather vppon thinke christ dwelt vsed one lodging exaction haue common therefore papistes laughed vnder friuolous pretence make peter companion christ dignitie chose vicare say made honour like himselfe paying tribute hee made equall himselfe meanes may make swineheards christes vicares euen paid much peter supremacie appeared paying tribute whence immunitie chalenge themselues behooueth foolishly fonde doe depraue scripture owne pleasure vvhat thinkest thou simon christ heerein made shewe diuinitie declaring nothing hidden whereto tendeth speach exempt subiection lawes doe expounde christian free right doe freely submit themselues common order otherwise humane societie coulde mainteined yet thinke rather meaning daungerous least disciple shoulde thinke christ came vaine yt paying tribute might take away hope deliuerance simply sayeth doeth therefore pay tribute doth owne accorde abstaine owne right power whereof gathered nothinge diminished hys kingdome doeth chalenge himselfe whiche owne namely maiestie vnknowen tribute gatherer though kingdome spirituall yet must esteemed sith onely sonne god also heir whole world thing ought subiecte brought order meaning therefore king therefore appoynted god rule ouer mankinde neither hathe established common wealthes sonne shuld without respect brought seruitude men yet vntill glory kingdome manifested doth willingly abase himselfe seruaunt togither others pope doeth lesse foolishly happily abuse might free cleargie lawes though shauē crown could make sonnes god shuld free tribute tax christ suche purpose chalenge himselfe honour kinges sonne hee mighte thereby least obtaine haue house free priuiledge common order vvherfore anabaptist ignorantly wrest word weakening pollitike estate nothing certaine christ pleade common right faithfull tooke onely similitude king togither housholdes free 27 cast angle though doe graunt christes bagges alwayes full yet doe thinke enforced want giue commaundement peter might prooue myracle dominion reacheth king earth hath fish tributary reade onely one instruction whole life sufficient state • much value siccle namely four drachmes two didrachmes math 19 marke 9 luke 9 1 came passe iesus finished saying departed galile came coastes iudea beyonde iordan 2 great multitude followed hee healed 38 iohn answeared saying maister sawe one castinge deuilles thy name followeth v wee forbade followeth v 39 iesus sayd forbid manne doe myracle name lightly speake euill 40 soeuer v part marke 10 1 arose thence went coastes iudea farre side iordan people resorted vnto againe hee woont hee taught againe 49 iohn answe • red said maister sawe casting diuels thy name wee forbade hee followed thee wyth v 50 iesus sayde vnto hym forbid yee hee v v 51 came passe day accomplished receiued vppe setteled himselfe fully goe ierusalem 52 sent messenger went entered towne samaritanes prepare lodging 53 woulde receiue behauiour though would goe ierusalem 54 disciple iames iohn sawe sayde lorde wilt thou wee commaunde fire come downe heauen consume elia mar 38 maister hereby appeareth name christe renowmed vsed acquainted disciple may abused dare affirme certaintye may partie heere mentioned embraced doctrine christ gaue himselfe woorke myracles euill minde christe gaue power certaine choyce preacher gospell thinke tooke vppon vnaduisedly rather intruded himselfe office though preposterously attempted durst imitate disciple without commaundement yet boldnesse wythout successe pleased lorde meanes also make name knowen worketh sometime whose ministerie doth allow lawfull furthermore cause contrary man hath perticular faith may followe blinde zeale cast himselfe headlong woorking myracles nowe come iohn companion say forbad man woorking myracles vvhy first aske whether lawful beinge nowe vncertaine doubt doe aske master iudgement vvhereof followeth without consideration toke vppon authoritie forbidding vvherfore condemned rashnesse soeuer shall attempt knoweth allowed woorde god furthermore christes disciple suspected ambition doe defence priuiledge owne honour howe commeth passe shoulde sodainly restraine manne whome acquainted woorking myracles alone woulde enioy libertie doe alledge cause followed christ haue sayde follower thine therefore haue honour 39 forbid christ wold haue forbidden set worke allowed dede else wold haue allowed disciple bee borne reioyced god glorified occasion paule phill 1 18 though displeased euill dealinge ambition wanderer boasted themselues name gospel yet reioyceth glory christ sette foorth occasion reason noted followeth cannot shoulde speake euill christe wrought myracles name therefore haue beene accounted gaine thereof followeth except disciple beene giuen owne glory studious desirous sette foorth glory maister would haue take matter grieuously saw set forth encreased otherwise neither yet whereas christe sayeth accounted friendes open ennemies doeth hee commaunde lette bridle slacke rash menne lust holde peace according pleasure stirre hether thether trouble whole order churche suche licentiousnesse must brideled farre calling suffer onely denieth doe well doe earnestly withstand stoppe least kingdome god encrease meanes neither doeth acknowledge accounteth flocke indifferent betweene ennemies friendes meaning much hurt doe pro • ite helpe prouerbiall sayinge whereby warned mooue warre vntill prouoked lvke 51 vvhen dayes accomplished onely luke reporteth hystorie yet little profitable many wayes first diuine fortitude constancie christ despising death heere described great hatred enimities dissentions religion breede thirdly howe nature menne caried impatience rashe zeale howe ready apt followe falles faultes sainctes lastly taught meekenesse example christe death christ called taking away taken amongst men departing base prison flesh ascended vp high hee settled himselfe heereby luke declareth death christe eye feare cast away went forwardes meete yet withal declareth striue conquerour terrour hee might boldly offer himselfe death feare beene throwne vppon difficultie strife care shoulde settle countenaunce hee neither blockishe yet caried away rashe headie boldnesse behooued mooued cruell bitter death naye fearefull horrible torment whiche knewe neare ready fall vppon seuere iudgement god euen farre darkening diminishing glory notable shewe declaration loue towardes v regardinge himselfe hee might apply himselfe saluation thorough middest terrours hastened vnto death day time whereof knewe neare 52 sent messenger supposed hee hadde great company follower messenger sent neither prepare pleasant dainty chuse beautifull palace onely declare greate companye straungers comminge beinge shutte repulsed doe tarie waytinge maister doe heereby learne whiche noted seconde place men doe disagree betweene themselues matter doctrine religion doe easily fall mutuall hatred signe moste bitter hatred defraude hungrie meate deny harbour weary iewishe religion euill thought esteemed amongest samaritanes thought woorthy kindnesse whiche followed may bee griefe reproache vexed knewe iewes accounted temple prophane detested esteemed degenerate corrupt worshipper god superstition receiued frowardly stacke wyth wicked emulation contended defend lengthe contention grewe hotte one fire destroyed bothe theyr countreys iosephus declareth firebrande warres iewes thoughe christe coulde readily haue auoyded enuie yet hee hadde rather hymselfe bee iewe gette hym lodginge ouerthwarte deniall 54 disciple sawe may region putte minde desire lightning fal vpō wicked time past elia place ouerthrowne wyth fire heauen king souldiours whiche sent take 2 reg 1 10 therefore came minde thinke samaritanes vnwoorthily reiected sonne god ordained like destruction heere doe see whether folish imitation holy father doth cary v iames iohn pretende example elia consider howe much differre elia doe examine extremitie zeale looke callinge god samaritanes like goodlye pretence idolatrie sette downe iohn 4 20 amisse wythout regarde rather ape follower holy father thoughe doubted whether thought power owne handes desired christ giue yet doe thinke probable lift vppe foolish hope thinking themselues sufficiently armed execute reuenge christ would allow 55 yee knowe spirite yee aunsweare christ restrained vnbrideled heat two disciple also prescribeth rule v nourish heat v behoueth soeuer attempteth thing wel assured himselfe haue spirite god authour guide led right pure instincte feruencie zeale doeth cary many men wisdome spirit wanting become blubber frothe also often falleth troublesome affection flesh mixed zeale seeme moste zealous glorye god blinded priuate affection flesh vvherfore except spirit god doe guide zeale serue excuse wee attempted nothing good zeale spirite selfe shall gouerne v counsell wisedome doe nothing beside duetye beyonde callinge also attempt anything wisely conueniently indue mindes euery dreg flesh wiped away right affection desire thinge god commaundeth christ also blameth disciple farre spirite elia doe wickedly taking thēselues elia executed iudgement god cōmaunded spirite god men commaundement god prouocation flesh caried seeke reuenge vvherefore example saincts defence v except spirite doe dwell v directed mathew 19 marke 10 luke 3 came vnto pharisies tempting sayinge lawfull man put away wife euery fault 4 answeared sayde vnto haue ye red made beginning made male female 5 sayd cause shall man leaue father mother cleaue vnto wife twai • e shalbe one flesh 6 vvherefore twaine flesh let manne therefore putteas god hath coupled togither 7 sayde vnto vvhy moses commaunde giue bill diuercement putte away 8 sayd vnto moses hardnesse heart suffered put away wiues frō beginning 9 say therefore vnto soeuer shall putte awaye hys wife • xcepte whoredome marrie another committeth adulterie soeuer marrieth diuorced doeth commit adulterte 2 pharisies came asked lawfull manne put away wife tempted 3 answeared said vnto vvhat mo • s commaunde 4 sayde moses suffred wryte bil diuorcement put away 5 iesus answeared sayde vnto hardnesse heart wrote precept vnto 6 beginninge creation god made male female 7 cause shall man leaue father mother cleaue wife 8 twaine shall one fleshe twaine one fleshe 9 therefore god hath coupled togither let man separate 10 house disciple asked againe matter 11 said vnto soeuer shal put away wife marry another committeth adulterie 12 woman put awaye husband married shee committeth adulterie though pharisies lay snare • christ craftily set vpon might intrappe yet malice wrought profite lord doeth wonderfully know howe turne good soeuer thing wicked doe deuise subuersion true doctrine occasion question answeared liberty diuorcement bring foorth certaine law deliuered holy inseparable knotte matrimonie thereof taken occasion quarelling answeare could odious side respecte demaunde whether lawfull man put away wife euery cause christ deny cry doeth wickedly abrogate law affirme wil bragge rather baud prophet god wil fauour lust men conceiued mindes sonne god knew howe take wise owne subtletye deceiued hope seuerely resisted vnlawfull diuorcements yet shewing withall bringeth forth nothing agreeable lawe concludeth matter two poyntes sayeth order creation shoulde lawe manne keepe marriage promise lawe whole life diuorcements permitted lawfull doe people stubborne would taught 4 haue yee read christ doth answeare directly demaunded doth plainly satisfie question proposed man demanded masse faithfully declare mysterie holy supper length inferre sacrilegious falsifier dare bolde adde diminish thing pure institution lorde openly ouerthrowe fained sacrifice masse christe taketh rule god beginning ioyned manne woman togither two might make one perfecte manne therefore hee putteth away wife teareth away himselfe one halfe himselfe nature suffereth manne rende sunder owne body hee addeth another argument drawne lesse greater bonde matrimonie holier straiter wherein child bounde parent godlinesse tieth child parentes bande cannot bee loosed muche lesse therefore maye husbande renounce wife heereof followeth band made god broken manne diuorced wife nowe meaning woordes god maker mankinde made man woman euery man contēted one wife shoulde desire others resteth vppon number two also prophet malachie chap 2 10 inueighed polygamie bringeth reason god whome aboundance spirite pleasure create mo yet made one man namely described christ therefore inseparable societie one husbande one wife prooued order creation man shall obiecte reason shall lawfull first wife dead take answear easie band broken death second wife placed god roumth former shee one 5 cause shall man leaue father doubted whether moses bringeth adam god speakinge place whether two thou takest maketh little present place sufficient bring oracle god though spoken adam hee doeth simply commaunde marrieth wife leaue father god shuld contrary himselfe matrimonie shuld abolishe honour hee commaundeth child vse towardes parent comparison made betweene dueties wife preferred father mother man shoulde sende backe message father shoulde shake yoake whereto bounde man woulde allowe suche monster much lesse shall liberty graunted dissolue matrimonie shall two one flesh saying polygamie lesse condemned libertie putting away wiues knitting togither two sanctified lorde ioyning either three foure adoulterous christ sayd little doeth apply otherwise purpose euen thus soeuer shoulde put away wife rende himselfe piece power holy matrimonie suche husband wife become one flesh neither purpose christe bringe foule filthy deuice plato speaketh reuerently order appoynted god therefore lette husband wife liue togither one may nourish euen one halfe parte himselfe lette commaund head wife tyrant like maner let woman modestly submit selfe obedience 6 god hath ioyned togither christe sentence brideleth lust men shuld forsaking wiues breake holy knot denieth power man breake matrimonie giueth lawe others confirme vnlawfull diuorces authority magistrate abuseth authority sheweth fauour man put away wife yet christ properly bent himselfe purpose euery man shuld religiously maintaine faith hee hath giuen himselfe whiche prouoked lust wicked affection diuorcement let thus thinke themselues arte thou wouldest take liberty thy selfe breake god hath ioyned doctrine maye also applied papistes imagininge v church separated christ head leaue v vnperfecte maimed body holy supper whereas christe ioyned breade wine bolde depriue people vse cuppe diuelishe corruption may oppose whiche god hath ioyned togither let man put sunder 7 vvhy moses thought vppon quarrell christe likely sho • 〈◊〉 •• quire lawfull vse diuorcements soeuer god permitteth lawe seemeth lawfull whose onely maketh difference betweene good euill christ meeteth false enuie fitte answeare moses graunted frowardnesse allow lawfull confirmeth saying notable reason beginning taketh graunted god beginning instituted matrimonie established perpetuall law force euen ende institution matrimony accounted lawe inuioleable followeth soeuer declineth proceedeth frō pure nature corruption men yet demaunded whether lawfull moses permitte selfe euill corrupte answeare seuerely forbidde vnproperly sayde permitted hee gaue lawe diuorcements woulde approue allowance wickednesse men could otherwise restrained gaue remeady tollerable man least giue testimonie chastity wife lawe giuen fauour woman least vniustly reiected incurre slander vvhereby gather rather punishment laide vppon men libertye permission graunted prouocation lust note also spirituall gouernmēt doth differ much politike outward order vvhat lawfull meete done lord comprehendeth ten wordes may many thing called iudgement seat men wherof euery mannes conscience reprooueth conuinceth meruaile politike lawes agree vnto let v take familiar exāple haue greater liberty contende lawes rule charity beare vvhy right cannot giuen euery man except way opened demaunde meane season inwarde lawe god sheweth must followed charity commandeth yet heere cause magistrate shoulde bee excused negligence doe owne accorde cease correctinge sinnes shall omitte thinges whiche estate callinge doeth require lette priuate menne take heede leaste coueringe offence vnder pretence lawes double faulte lorde doeth heere waye blame iewes sufficient haue frowardnesse born passed without punishment except make god author sinne rule liuing godly holily cannot alway euery gathered lawes polliticke muche lesse custome 9 say vnto marke reporteth spoken disciple aparte come house mathewe omitting circumstance setteth downe speache euangelistes doe often leaue circumstance way count sufficient gather summes thinges difference one setteth downe matter plainly summe though lawe doeth punish diuorcements differre first institution god yet hee adulterer whiche putteth away wife taketh pleasure manne dissolue faith matrimonie whiche lorde woulde haue remaine firme sure therefore shee harlot supplieth roumthe lawfull wife putteth exception woman committing whoredome cutting selfe rotten member husbande setteth libertye doe deuise cause woorthily reiected wiser heauenly maister haue leprosie lawfull cause diuorcement infection thereof doeth onely infecte husbande also child would counsell godly man shoulde touche wife hath leaprosie allowe liberty put away man obiect cannot liue alone haue neede remedy least shoulde burne saye remedye without warrant worde god adde also shall neuer want gift continencie would deliuer themselues gouerned lord follow prescribeth man shal begin loath wife cannot abide lie shall euill remedied taking two wiues mannes wife shall fall palsie apoplexie shall diseased incurable disease shall husband reiecte vnder pretence incontinencie wee knowe shall neuer want helpe spirite doe walke wayes auoiding fornication sayeth paule 1 cor 7 2 let euery man marry wife hath done though fall according desire hath done part therefore thing want shall amended helpe god goe nothing else tempte god whereas paule noteth cause 1 cor 7 15 namely whereas hatred godlinesse married person reiected vnbeleuers godly brother sister subiect bondage repugnant minde christ doth speake lawfull cause diuorcement onely whither woman continueth bounde vnbeleeuing manne shee hatred god wickedly putte away cannot otherwise receiued fauor shee denie god vvherefore meruaile paule chuseth rather separated manne alienated god yet exception christe putteth seemeth vaine adulteresse deserueth death purpose shold speake diuorcement duety husbande followe adultery iudgements hee might cleare house offence whatsoeuer successe christe setteth husbande conuinceth wife vnchastitie free bonde may amongest corrupt wicked people sinne might raigne freedome punishment ouerthwart pitie magistrate day driueth menne necessitie putte awaye defiled wiues adultery punished noted law common free partes bond faith mutual like whereas husbande chiefe thing respecte bed hee equall wife maister owne body therefore adulterer shall fall awaye knotte matrimonie wife sette libertie hee maiyeth putte away sentence hath moste corruptly expounded many interpreaters thought generally confusedly commaunded liue soale diuorcement husbande put away adulteresse necessitie bothe shoulde liue vnmaried libertie diuorcement onely lie away wife also christe euidently cause permitte done iewes woont generally vsurpe vnto themselues according owne pleasure therfore errour grosse christe condemneth adulterie marrieth putte away certaine vnderstoode vnlawfull friuolous diuorcements therfore paule commaundeth remaine vnmaried putte away reconciled husbandes matrimonie ouerthrowne brawlinges dissentions first epistle corinthian seuenth chapiter eleuenth verse gathered marke whereas wife name spoken shoulde depart husbande lawfull wiues giue bill diuorcement husbandes iewes fallen straunge corruption marke noted corruption lord reprooued raigned euery voluntary diuorcements went forward newe mariage therefore maketh mention adulterie mathew 19 marke luke 10 sayde disciple matter betweene manne wife good marrie 11 sayd vnto men cannot receiue thing saue whome giuen 12 chast whiche borne mother bellye bee chaste made chaste menne chaste whiche haue made themselues chaste kingdome heauen able receiue let receiue though estate husbandes harde longe shall remaine chaste compelled rather beare thing depart disciple mooued answear christ doe except better without wiues caught suche snare doe againe consider howe straite bondage wiues affection fleshe doeth tie themselues owne commodity despising others onely desire prouided themselues yet doeth vile vnthankefulnesse appeare woulde refuse singular gifte god either feare wearinesse one discommoditie better according opinion auoide mariage tie himselfe bande perpetuall fellowshippe god hath instituted matrimonie common good mankinde though bringeth thinges acceptable must therefore despised therefore lette v learne among blessing god thing pleaseth v lette v daintie frowarde lette v vse reuerence especially must take heede wickednesse holy matrimonie enwrapped wyth many trouble sathan endeuoureth vexe hatred infamie might withdrawe menne hierome heerein shewed euident token malitious peruerse witte doeth onely quarell holye godlye order life tauntes reproches soeuer canne gather oute prophane wryters hee casteth vppon hee might slaunder deforme beauty lette v thinke soeuer trouble doe befall matrimonye accidentall arise corruption menne also lette v remember sith nature corrupted became medicine salue meruaile sower taste bee mixed sweete bee seene howe lorde reprooueth foolishnesse hee denying menne receiue • sayinge declareth choyse hande wee hadde authoritie consulte matter manne thinke profitable hym without wife without triall made doeth lay lawe single life vppon himselfe farre deceiued god sayde good woman helpe manne punishe contempte hys order mortall menne doe arrogate much vnto themselues striue exempte themselues heauenly calling free menne chuse luste christe prooueth continencie speciall gift hee sayeth cannot receiue giuen plainly declareth giuen menne vvhereby pride conuinced whiche doubte arrogate themselues whiche christe plainly taketh 12 chaste christe nameth three kindes menne chaste whiche chaste nature whiche made chaste men driuen matrimonie want lacke partes manne others sayeth chaste whiche haue made themselues chaste might better serue god setteth free necessity marriage vvhereof followeth al doe abhorre matrimonie doe sacrilegious boldnesse maner giantes fight god papist vrging word making chaste men owne pleasure could make lawes continencie colde christ first sheweth god giueth whome thinketh good little doth againe affirme sole life rashly chosen man endued special gifte vvherefore making chaste subiecte free plaine meaning nature apte marriage thought doe abstaine yet tempt god god graunteth libertie kingdome heauen many doe foolishly expounde deseruing eternall life sole life contained selfe meritorious woorshippe papist doe faine angelical estate christe meant nothing el married ought haue ende sette free care might diligentlier apply themselues exercise godlinesse therefore foolish imagination accoūt sole life vertue god pleased fasting neither doeth deserue accounted amongst dueties god requireth v must looke ende christ would expresly set downe though man free whoredome yet sole life approoued god prouide owne ease delites onely heereby excused apply free quiet meditation heauenly life sum christe teacheth sufficient vnmarried doe liue chastly except purposely abstain might apply themselues better exercise able receiue let receiue clause christ warneth vse matrimonie must despised except blinde rashnesse woulde cast selues headlonge destruction behoued lay hand vpon disciple saw runne headlong without iudgement admonition profitable men choyse kinde life leade doe consider giuen god leape without choyse whether soeuer vnaduised heat doth carie would ben better heard heeretofore knowe enchantment sathan eares stopt nature despite god would lay vppon themselues snare perpetuall single life whome god hadde called marriage miserable soules caught deadly snare vowe would neuer pitte mathew 19 marke 10 luke 18 13 age feele howe greatly neede grace yet vnderstanding little child desire blessed yet hee receiueth louingly kindly solemne manner blessing consecrateth father purpose also brought child christe shoulde obserued except stedfast perswasion mindes power spirit hand powre vpon people god ben absurd haue brought child vvherefore doubted desired grace might bestowed vpon therfore amplifying matter luke addeth worde also haue sayd tried howe many wayes holpe growen yeares hoped also child shuld go away altogither void al gift spirit shuld lay hāds vpon thē also laying hand sayd otherwhere rular asked sayinge good master ought inherite eternal life 19 iesus said vnto callest thou good • 〈◊〉 good saue one euen god 20 thou knowest commandementes thou shalt commit adultery thou shalt kill thou shalt steale thou shalt bear false witnesse honour thy father thy mother 21 hee saide haue kept youth 22 iesus heard said vnto yet lackest thou one thing sell euer thou hast distribute vnto poore thou shalte haue treasure heauen come followe 23▪ heard thing • ea • ye merueilous rich 16 behold one came luke saieth rular man great authority one common people though ryches get honour yet seemeth esteemed graue good manne cyrcumstaunces considered though called younge man yet thinke one sorte sober chaste life reuerenced auncient integrity came deceitefullye scrybes woont minde learne aswell wordes kneeling downe declared reuerenced christ faythfull teacher againe blynde confidence workes hyndereth profiting vnder christ vnto otherwise desired yeelde himselfe taught day see euill affected yet wil hardly tast doctrin gospel caried away know shadowish holines yt may iudge better estate ye answer maner questiō must bee noted dooth simply ask meanes way shuld come eternal life good shuld get dreameth merit wherby wold make fulrecōpēce eternal life wherfore christ aptly sendeth obseruation lawe certeine way life presently fully declare 17 vvhy callest thou mee good take reproofe subtilly great part interpreter though christ would secretely instruct godhead think word signifie thus much haue said thou knowest higher thing humane nature thou dost wrong giue title good belongeth god alone verely graunt speak properly men worthy honorable title angel haue drop goodnes themselues borowe god christ purpose bring doctrine credit shuld haue said thou doest euil call good maister except thou dost acknowledg come god therfore yong man instructed essence godhead led beleeue doctrine already affection obediēce christ would haue go heare god speaking maner mē deuils part make angel generally cal thē good teacher whō see nothing good prophanings gift god therfore meruaile christ get doctrin autority doth cal yong man back god keepe commaundements old writer haue corruptly interpreted place whō papist folowed though christe shuld teach obseruatiō law could deserue eternall life christ considered men could answereth question proposed righteousnes work wich law defineth certeinly must holden god law cōprehendeth way liue holily righteously wherin perfect righteousnes contained neither moses vtter sētence vaine yt doth shal liue therin likewise call heauen earth witnesse haue day shewed life therfore cannot denied obseruation law righteousnes wherby life may obtained anye man perfect obseruer law al voyde glory god nothing shalbe found law cursing neither refuge v flie free gift righteousnes therfore paul setteth two sortes righteousnes one law faith first placeth work second meere grace christ vvherby gather answere christe righteousnes according law mete yong man inquiring righteousnes work shuld first taught man accoūted righteous satisfieth ye law impossible yt seing infirmity might flie refuge faith therefore graūt sith god hath promised reward eternal life obseruers law way kept infirmity sleshe hindered v scripture teacheth fault necessary v haue gift cannot obtain merites man obiect righteousnes lawe proposed v vain wherto man time attain answer vain instruction whereby lead vnto righteousnes whiche suite therefore paule saith dooers lawe iustified righteousnesse lawe excludeth men place abolysheth faigned deuices whiche papistes inuēted obtaining saluation onely deceaued would binde god vnto theyr good work shuld saue dutie debt prepare themselues good work doctrine lawe regarded bend themselues faigned deuotions call doe openly refuse law god doe prefer tradition men farre saith christ namely worship approued god prescribeth obedience acceptable al sacrifice therfore soeuer endeuoreth frame life please christe papistes occupied friuolous traditiōs let imploy al endeuor keeping commandementes law 18 thou shalt kil meruaile christ would haue v bound whole law onely toucheth second table therfore doth dueties charity euery man minde best discerned godlynes toward god chiefe hypocrite doe often counterfeit obseruation firste table best tryed second table therefore must knowe christe chose commaundementes wherein appeareth testimonie true righteousnesse yet figure synecdoche noteth whole parte matter setteth commaundement honouring parentes last place hee regarded keepe exact order yet thys worthy noted hee putteth second table least man bee deceaued errour iosephus thought appertayned first table added end thou shalt loue thy neyghbour nothing diuerse former commaundements general exposition al 19 young man sayd vnto law might haue bene dead dreamed ryghteous except flattered himselfe hypocrisie beene good admonition towardes learning humilytie see hys owne blottes faultes glasse law drunken foolysh boldenes carelesly boasted hee well discharged duety euen hys childhoode paule confesseth case hee perswaded lyued long knew force law felt power law deadly wounded thereby therefore christes aunswere followeth directed affection man yet christ required nothing commaundementes law simple rehearsall moued nothing discouereth word secrete disease couetousnes graunt commaunded place law sell end lawe drawe men denyall themselues expresly condemneth lust see christ purpose correct false perswasion young man throughly known himselfe hearing law rehearsed would haue confessed himselfe daunger god iudgment▪ simple word law sufficiently cōuince guiltines declareth inward sense wordes christ requyre thing besides commaundements law contrary himselfe taught euen perfect righteousnes comprehended commaundementes law therfore shuld agree reproue law default protestation moses cited hadde beene false therfore christes meaning yongman wā • ted one thing besides obseruation law one thing obseruation law though law doth place compell v sell yet bringeth corrupt lustes nothing teacheth v beare crosse would haue v ready abyde hunger penury yong man far ful obseruation lōg caried away loue rich saith one thing wanted neede speak whoredome murther noteteth speciall disease hee shoulde touch byle finger noted hee dooth commaund sell giue poore reiect rich self vertue vaine ambition crate • cō mended prophane hystoriographers hee caste money precious thing soeuer sea thought could safe except destroyed rich though hadde beene better haue bestowed vppon others whiche thought superfluous himselfe certeinelye charitye bond perfection defraudeth himselfe others vse money deserueth prayse therefore christ doth simply cōmend felling lyberalitie helping poore christe also vrgeth mortification flesh hee saieth follow hee doth onely commaund giue name putte hys shoulder bearinge crosse marke dooth expreslye expound meete hee bee thus launced home wont lyue pleasantly vnder shadow ydlenes neuer conceiued tasted little meane crucifie old man tame lust flesh monkes ridiculous vnder pretence place chalenge themselues state perfection fyrst easie vnderstand commaunded men without difference sell husbandman accustomed lyue labour thereby nourish child sinne shuld sel small portion land compelled thereto necessity therfore better keepe god hath put handes modestly thriftily maintaine selues houshold giue part poore wastefully spoyle al goodly selling monk much brag whē great number cannot finde foode home thruste thēselues monastery swine sty full stuffed men carefullye spare themselues idle bellyes might fatted men bread notable chaunge surely commaunded giue poore rightlye possesse content theyr take away men mar 21 iesus beheld loued papistes doe hereof gather good morall workes wrought instinct spirit go regeneratiō right deserue childish deuise gather desert loue god may say frog flyes deserue god loueth creature without exception therefore needful distinguish degree loue respect present place shal sufficiēt know god loueth none fatherly loue sonnes hath regenerate spirit adoption loue cōmeth passe shal approued tribunall seate according sense beloued god iustified one signification god said sometime loue hee neither alloweth loueth preseruation mankind acceptable vnto consisteth iustice equity moderation wisdome faith temperaunce hee said loue polytike vertues doe merit saluation grace beecause tende ende alloweth sense according diuers respect loued hated aristides fabritius asmuch adorned outward righteousnes common good hee loued hys work yet beecause heart corrupt outwarde shew righteousnesse auailed nothing obtaining righteousnes know heart purged onely faith spirit vprightnes giuen onely member christ question answered could christ loue man proud hypocrite whē nothing odious god thē two vice neyther anye absurditie god loue good seede put nature yet reiecteth person work corruption mat 22 hee went away sorowfull departure sheweth length farre young man perfection whereto christe called commeth passe hee withdraweth himselfe christes schoole griefe forsake hys rich ready beare pouertie euidente luste doth yet reigne v sayde christe commaunded sell addition lawe tryall sinne lay hidde euery manne giuen sinne reprehending hee layde open example teacheth v continue constantly christes schoole conuenient renounce flesh yong man departed christ brought desire learne modesty hard leaue vice wherewith acquainted shal befal v except sweetnes grace christ make al intisements said vnto child howe hard truste ryches enter kingdome god 25 easier camel goe eye needle riche manne enter kingdome god 26 much astonied saying themselues saued 27 iesus looked vppon sayde men impossyble god god thing possible 24 iesus sawe sorowfull sayd diffycultie shall haue rich enter kingdom god 25 surely easier camell goe needle eye rich manne enter kingdome god 26 saide heard saued 27 sayde thing vnpossible men possible god 23 rich man shall hardly enter christ doth declare noysome deadly plague couetousnes also great hinderaunce rich doe bring marke asswageth sharpnesse saying applyeth onely put trust rich think former sentence rather confirmed word corrected saye shoulde seeme merueilous rich men haue hard entraunce kingdome heauen common disease almost men trust rich doctrine also profitable al men namely rich men admonished daunger take heede poore men shuld content estate couetously desire wilbe harm gain certeine rich selfe doe hinder v following corruption man haue aboundance scarsly escape drowning themselues therein flow rich holden bound sathan chaines shuld look vp heauen nay entrench bind enthrall thēselues wholly earth similitude camel addeth litle amplifieth difficultie declareth rich men swell puft vp prid vain boldnes cannot suffer thēselues brought straites god doth keepe childrē thinke word camel rather noted great rope shyp beast 25 disciple heard disciple doe meruale make v litle carefull considering rich doe stoppe vp entraunce kingdome way soeuer shall turne eye thousand stop set themselues v let v note amased yet fledde doctrine christe mention made euen dealt otherwise streightnesse commaundement feared diuorced himselfe christ though men amased doe ask saued yet bend theyr course way desire vanquishe doubtful hope shall profit v feare threatninges god ofte hee denounceth anye harde fearefull thinge myndes faynte rather bee styrred vppe 26 vvith men vnpossible christ doth altogether sette theyr mindes free care profitable vnderstand hard ascend heauen first might imploy al endeuours purpose distrusting themselues might seeke helpe heauen vve see sluggish carelesse vvhat shoulde befall faythfull shoulde thinke walke pleasauntlye softe pleasaunt playne recreation therefore cause christe dooth extenuate daunger might thereby put disciple feare rather encreaseth hee onely sayde heard saith impossible vvherby appeareth preposterous teacher afrayd speake hardly giue lybertie sluggyshe fleshe better follow rule christe tempereth speach might teach men throwne thē selues onely repose themselues grace god withall hee myght stirre vppe prayer hee dooth wisely helpe infirmity menne attributing thing vnto stirring vp mindes hope grace god aunswere christ generall rule refelled papist gathered hierom vvhosoeuer shal say law hard kept let accursed christ doth plainly declare possible men keepe way saluation far grace god doth helpe direct math 19 mark 10 luke 18 27 answered peter said beehold haue forsakē al followed thee shall haue 28 iesus said vnto verely say son man shall sitte throane maiestie yee followed regeneration shall sitte also vpon twelue throanes iudg twelue tribe israel 29 whosoeuer shall forsake house brethrē sister father mother wife child landes name sake shall receiue hundreth folde shal enherit euerlasting life 30 many first shal last last shalbe first 28 peter beganne say vnto loe wee haue forsaken al haue folowed thee 29 iesus aunswered said verelye saye vnto man hath forsaken house brother sister father mother wife child landes sake gospel 30 shall receiue hundred folde nowe presente house brother sister mother child landes persecution world come life euerlasting many first shall last last first 28 peter said lo wee haue left al haue folowed thee 29 said vnto them▪ verely saye vnto yo • • man hath left house parent brother wyfe • child kingdome god sake 30 vvhiche shall receiue muche worlde world come lyfe euerlasting luke 22 28 ye haue continued temptation 29 therefore apppoynt vnto kingdom father hath appoynted vnto 30 yee may eate drink table kingdome site seates iudge twelue tribe israel peter dooth secretelye compare himselfe disciple rich man world alienated christ ledde poore wandring lyfe without reproofe trouble neither appeare anye shewe better estate tyme come hee demaundeth without cause whether haue lefte followed christ vaine absurd thing spoiled better recōpenced lord al thinges base poore men scarse house leaue therefore bragging might seeme ridiculous certeinly experience sheweth howe greatly menne doe commonly esteeme theyr dueties towardes god day almost ready begge popery proudly cast forth haue lost much cause gospell yet disciple may excused though estate neuer gorgious yet lyued home handy occupation • richest wee knowe poore menne accustomed quiet honeste life hardlyer drawn wiues child men caryed ambition drawne hether thether blaste prosperitie except beene reward layde vp fondly chang manner life behalfe excused yet herein offended desire see triumph yet gone throgh warfare time wee doe loath bee vnpacient time tryumph delayd let v learne first consider solace wherewith lorde asswageth bitternesse crosse world stirre vp selues hope eternal life two poynts answere christ contained mat 28 verely say vnto least disciple think lost labour repent course begunne christ teacheth glory kingdom hidde reuealed saye cause whye faint base estate doe scarsly lye amongste meanest length ascend throane maiestie therefore beare litle vntill time manifesting glory shall come doth promise namely shalbe fellowes glory giuing throanes wherin shuld iudge twelue tribe israel compareth ambassadours chiefe counsellers presidentes whiche haue chiefe seates kingly assembly vvee know apostle chosen twelue number might declared god sending christe would gather togeather dispersed remnauntes people chiefe dignitie yet hidden therfore christ deferreth desire vnto last manifestation kingdome might receiue fruit election yet doubted christ spak place latter day regeneration doe referre poynt followeth text regeneration nothing else newnesse followe restoring mortall shall swallowed vp life weake body shall made like heauenly glory christ doe rather referre regeneration first comming christ world beganne renewed church sprang vp darknesse death light life manner speaking found euery prophetes dooth well agree cyrcumstaunce place renewinge churche often promised made hope greate happines messias appeare christ therefore might take away errour distinguisheth betweene beeginning end kingdome lvk 28 though luke seemeth report speach christ diuersly spoken time yet thinke otherwise appertaineth time neither set downe continuall sermon speach christe diuerse sentenses sette togeather without regard order tyme shal againe sayde little vseth moe wordes mat sith apostle followed temptation continued constant hee saieth shall also partaker glorye demaunded hee meaneth temptation thinke hee meante trouble wherewith god generallye exercised hys apostle hee dooth verye aptlye vse worde temptation euen accordinge sense humane nature faith patience proued 29 appointed vnto kingdom hee doth onlye make ruler king imparteth kingdome receiued father great vehemēcy word appoint shuld rash hotte desire make much haste possesse kingdom wherof lawful autoritie ordaining exhorteth thē patience example though father made king yet presently placed glory nay humbled shame crosse obtained kingly honour eate drink vpon table metaphorically put fellowes al glory mat 29 vvhosoeuer shal forsake stirred vp mindes hope life come also encourageth present comfortes confirmeth strengthneth beare crosse though god suffreth much afflicted yet doth neuer forsake recōpence sorowes helpes neither doth onely speake apostle taking occasion generally directeth speach godly summe shal willingly lose al thing christes sake shall yet euen life bee blessed kept al chiefe reward laid vp heauen yet promise recompensing hundred fold seemeth agree see experience part spoiled parentes child kinsman depriued wiues robbed goodes testimonye christ farre recouering owne goodes people without company forsaken painefully hardly trauell banishment great want pouertie answere man doth rightly esteeme present grace god wherwith comforteth lifteth vp misery wil graunt rightly preferred al rich world though vnfaithfull doe flourish yet knowe shall become morow necessary shoulde alwayes doubtfull afrayde neither otherwise enioy pleasure sort amased themselues meane season god maketh mery litle good enioy worth vnto farre pleasaunt without christ great abundance goodes shuld flowe vppon sense take word added mark persecution christe shoulde haue saide though godly world doe alwaies suffer persecution crosse doth alwayes cleaue backe yet sauce god grace sweete maketh mery estate desired pleasure dainty kinges 30 many first sentence added teach v shake sluggishnes flesh apostle hasted reward scarse come forth race wee disposition almost haue passed one month seruice desire rewarded set libertie bene verye seruiceable soldiours well deserued christe exhorteth beganne well goe forwarde couragiouslye withall hee warneth runne beganne verye freshly shall auayle nothinge faynte middest race paule also declareth runne obtayne pryce 1 connthyans 9 24 place owne example shoulde forgette thinges whiche beehinde endeuour part course philippian 3 13 therefore oft thinke heauenly crowne becommeth v pricked forward new spur become duller hereafter math godly shall hee onely saieth cause whye whiche firste time shoulde glory bragge ouer others lord oft please call hee seemed neglect tyme eyther make equall preferre thē first foolish curiositie man woulde exactly discusse al perticular poyntes parable therefore must bee sought christes purpose deliuer also haue shewed already applyed end prouoke continual spurres go forward vve know sluggishnes doth part arise much confidence commeth passe many got end race fainte midst course therefore paule commaundeth v forget thing behind v cōsidering yet remaining v shoulde prepare selues runne lustilye yet shal hurtful run word doctrine may therby euidently appeare 1 kingdom heauen like meaning account made calling god man hire labourer morning certeine wage dresse vineyard shoulde afterwards send without couenant yet giueth like reward hire doth therfore make mention kingdō heauen compareth spiritual life earthly reward eternal life money wherwith mē paid wage labour haue couenant made especially work saluation giuen thē freely christ al subtilties purpose difference couenant god made time went vinyard euening receiued reward came first though god time past promised law reward work iewes yet know took effect man could time obtaine saluation merit vvhy shal man say doth christe expreslye make mention couenaunte speakinge firste saieth nothinge hee speaketh namely might teach man iniuried thys latter haue much honour hadde beene called first proper speach hee oweth nothing anye manne right challengeth v hath tyed vnto whatsoeuer obedience able yeeld vnto dooth freely offer v reward hee sayde hyre labour otherwise due heereof commeth passe also calleth crown giueth v freely name reward furthermore might declare haue cause quarrel god hee ioyne others v came long v fellowes honour hee boroweth similytude custome menne firste agree wage send labourer worke anye manne hereby gather menne created labour euery manne hath charge enioyned god men slouthfull ydle shall wrest christes wordes also may gathered whole lyfe vnprofitable maye rightly condemned slouthfulnesse vntill wee frame lyues according commaundement calling lorde vvhereof followeth auayle nothing toyling doe rashly take vpon kinde life waight allowaunce theyr calling god lastly gathered wordes christe doe please god labour profit brother seemeth peny somewhat value foure french caroleys ordinary hyre dayes worke houres three sixe nine therefore mentioned day wont time past deuided sunne rising sunne setting twelue houres diuision day three houres againe deuide night foure watch threefore eleuenth houre signifieth end day 8 euen come misterie bee sought master commaundeth beginne last though god would crowne first course time last deuise agree doctrine paule saith remaine comming christ shall preuent slept christ shall follow christ place setteth diuerse order could otherwise declare hee added firste murmured giuen note also doth say murmuring latter day onely denieth shalbe cause murmuring faygned person bringeth similitude giueth small lighte doctrine liberalitie god subiect complaintes men though adorne large rewardes vnworthy haue deserued nothing vaine reach cast dart willingly offer handes deadly enemy though feare manye way corrupted yet smal token obedience godlines followed christ bene much better folowed gladly cheerefully whethersoeuer sonne therfore speak opē ly least rumor thereof spread far abroad time hope good wrought presentlye admonition thought sufficient commit fewe afterwardes witness seede cast earth dooth presentlye bring besides promise neither sufficient apply minde simply christ first except alwaies continuance puritie corrupt affectiōs doe often creepe vpon v midste race draw v back crooked path credibly supposed zebedeus two sonnes professed christe sincerely first saw themselues small credit heare mention made toward kingdome mindes presently caried wicked desire loath remaine simply office befalleth two chief disciple behooueth v walk carefully wil fall right course especially anye apte occasion offreth selfe heede must taken least couetousnes honour infect poyson desire godlines though mat mark somwhat differ word yet agree substance matter math saith zebedeus wife came made requeste sonnes might placed first kingdom christ mark bringeth making request themselues probable beeing ashamed themselues craftily sette mother forwardes might boldly demaund motion came thē gathered christ answeraeth mother also mother humbly shewed somwhat aske would vtter minde also marke generally condition would haue graunted whatsoeuer shoulde desire fearefull insinuation testifieth thought euil themselues 21 thy kingdome praise worthy zebedeus sonnes hoped kingdome christ whereof appeared muche least shewe see despised vnder base estate seruaunt yea see despised loathed world subiecte many reproofes yet perswaded themselues shortly shall glorious kinge taught sure singular example open force worse foole amongst many deathes doth carelesly delite fantasied triumph lord commandeth sure victory triumphe midst death otherwise encouraged fight manfully one thing man hope reward promised god bend himselfe fight chearefully apply himselfe withal force purpose another thing mē vnmindful warres forsaking ennemy neglecting daungers runne vnto triumph shoulde haue beene waited vnto time appoynted note also preposterous speede doeth part drawe menne calling euen moste cowarde battaile doeth greedily desire pray kingdome christe none doe desire supremacie doe moste flee trouble labour therefore christe doeth rightly tie standinge puffed vppe vaine glorye summe crowne prepared none whiche striue lawfully especially man shall liue raigne christe except pertaker suffering death woorde baptisme maner metaphore doeth plainely appeare wee knowe faithfull instructed baptisme deny themselues crucifie olde man also beare crosse▪ doubted whether lorde woorde cuppe alluded mysterie holy supper yet vse doe rather take measure affliction god assigneth euery man lorde according pleasure layeth burden vpon euery man euen housholder deuideth parteth portion amongst housholde therefore sayde hee giueth cuppe drinke small comfort wordes alay bitternesse crosse christ doth ioyne v desired haue thing cōmon sonne god meanes commeth passe thing first shew seeme deadly doe woorke saluation life whosoeuer desireth altogither without crosse shall accounted amongst disciple christ refuseth baptised baptisme nothing else withdraw himselfe first rudiment nowe oft baptisme mentioned let v remember baptised condition ende shoulde beare crosse vppon shoulder iohn iames doe bragge lustily ready drinke cuppe bolde confidence flesh appeareth without reache dartes seeme able doe thing befell shortly discouered rashnesse yet good men ready estate offer themselues beare crosse 23 yee shall drinke deede cuppe disciple necessary made like maister christ telleth shoulde come passe afterwardes might arme themselues patience vnder person two men speaketh al disciple though many faithful haue lotte die peaceably violent bloudy death yet common paule rom 8 teacheth bee made like image christ therefore life sheepe led slaughter mine giue christ answeare derogateth nothing himselfe declareth office enioyned father assigne euery manne distincte proper seat heauen came might gather al eternal life ought suffice v inheritance v purchased bloude degree shalbe placed aboue others neither part enquire neither would god christ reueale v deferred vnto last reuelation nowe vnderstande purpose christe hee disputeth heere owne power onely would haue ende considered wherefore sent father belongeth calling therefore maketh difference betweene secreat counsell god office teachinge committed vnto profitable admonition teaching v soberly wise endeuour selues breake hidden mystery god especially curious aboue measure searching estate life come doeth
