gracious lordes 26 shall let greatest among least chiefest serueth 27 greater hee sitteth table serueth sitteth table among serueth 24 vvhen tenne heard luke seemeth referre contention time soeuer shall wisely consider 22 chapter shall easily perceiue speaches spoken diuers time wrytten vppe togither without regard order therefore contention superiority wherof luke maketh mētion sprang fountaine sonnes zebedeus ambitiously sought chiefe place kingdome christ yet hadde iust cause disdaine two sharply reprooued folish ambition went away christe shame hurt tooke tenne foolish desire obtained though iust cause giuen thē emulation yet repulse others shuld haue appeased lord wold occasiō discouer disease lay hid thē one woulde willingly giue place others euery man nourished secreatly hope superioritie cōmeth passe enuie contend amongst themselues yea wicked desire raigneth men vice grafted base obscure men brake vppon light almoste occasion howe much behoueth v take hede wode hidden fire burne matter woorke therefore see ambition waxeth hotte amongest mighty honourable sheweth flame farre wide except spirite modesty doe quenche heauen pride sticketh nature men 25 ye know lordes gentile haue domination ouer first said christ called vnto hym might reprooue apart also gather hereof ashamed desire openly complain began secreat whispering grudging euery one secreatly preferre himselfe aboue others doeth generally declare deadly plague ambition simply teacheth folish thing striue nothing declareth shall suche superioritie kingdome striue therefore deceiued stretch saying godly generall christe onely teacheth matter hande apostle fonde make question degree power honoure estate calling office teaching whereto appoynted hadde likelihoode empire worlde graunt doctrine well appertaineth priuate menne king magistrate manne deserueth bee accounted flocke christe hath profited vnder schoolemaister humilitie hee arrogate nothinge himselfe humbly applieth himselfe maintaine brotherly loue true purpose christ sayde putte difference betweene spirituall regiment church earthly empire least apostle shoulde apply themselues courtly grace fashion euery one among noble beloued kinges hee climeth vppe wealth office christe sette pastours ouer churche beare lordly rule ouer minister errour anabaptistes banish king magistrate churche god christe sayde like disciple ouerthrowne comparison made heere betweene christian prophane menne betweene office note also christe regarded muche personnes menne estate churche might come passe shoulde lorde towne citie might also necessitie execute withall office teaching sufficient christ declare office apostolicall woulde beare yet demaunded christ appoynted distinct order church refuseth degree place seemeth ouerthrow least make equall none shoulde lift vppe aboue others course nature teacheth v farre order paul describing gouernement churche rehearseth diuers office ministerie preferreth office apostle office pastours commanded timothie titus without doubte commaundement god aboue others authoritie aunsweare searche thing throughly kinges themselues doe rule rightly lawfully except serue yet heerein office apostleship differeth earthly gouernement kinges magistrate hindered seruice may rule ouer subiectes royall glorye pompe dauid ezechias suche like willingly became seruaunts menne yet adorned scepter diademe throane suche ensignes gouernment churche admitteth suche thinge christe gaue allowance pastours shoulde minister shoulde altogither abstaine lordly gouernement •• heere also noted spoken rather thing self affection christ separateth apostle degree king lawfull life vppe themselues aboue kinges greate difference betweene estate kinges office apostleshippe therefore behooueth bothe humble lowly apostle muste alwayes looke fourme gouernement lord hath appoynted vnto churche concerning woordes mathew sayeth kinges exercise authority ouer luke sayeth called gratious lordes bountifull bothe meaning one thing hee shoulde haue sayde king flowe wealth haue aboundaunce richesse might bountifull liberall thoughe king reioyce power rather feared loued yet desire praised accoū ted bountifull vvhereof haue hebrewe tounge name bountifull called giuing bestowing customes tribute payed ende may haue sufficient necessary charge honour glory 26 shall among doubted christe reprooueth foolish imagination wherewith sawe apostle deceiued foolishly fondly done imagine shall haue kingdome abhorre therefore desire serue mee faithfully must think vpō another course euery one earnestly apply themselues serue others hee speaketh vnproperly commaundinge greatest become seruaunt ambition suffer serue submitte brother graunt doe aspire honour doe vse seruile flatterie purpose nothing le serue meaning christ plaine sithe euery manne caried away loue himselfe sayeth affection must otherwise altered hee shoulde haue sayde lette onely greatnesse excellency dignity submitte selues brother lette also superiority seruaunts 28 sonne manne christe confirmeth former doctrine owne example willingly humbled himselfe taken vppon estate seruaunt paule also teacheth phillip 2 7 might euidently declare howe farre hee suche ambitious pomp calleth backe death haue sayde haue chosen honour nexte vnto self corrupt ambition prouoketh desire raigne whose example frame life came lifte vppe selfe take vppon mee kingly dignitie doe rather take vppon shame crosse togither base contemptible estate fleshe man obiecte christe therefore exalted father euery knee shoulde bowe easily answeared nowe sayeth referred time humiliation therefore added luke hee conuersant amongest hee seruaunt inferiour either shew title deede would acknowledged master lord humbled himselfe great lowlinesse submitted himselfe beare infirmity furthermore remembred compareth heere greater lesse doeth iohn 13 14 maister lord haue washed feete much ought doe one giue life raunsome many christ doeth therefore make mention death sayd might withdraw disciple peeuish fantasie earthly kingdome meane force frute aptly well expressed sayeth life shoulde price redemption vvhereof followeth reconciliation god free gift raunsome whereof else found death christ therefore one woorde ouerthrowne soeuer papist doe prattle filthy satisfaction furthermore christ raunsome v himselfe death submission whereof hee speaketh farre derogating great glory greatly adorneth hee speaketh manye definitely certaine number diuers opposeth others sense taken epistle ro 5 15 paule speaketh one sort men comprehendeth mankinde mat 20 marke 10 luke 18 29 departed iericho great multitude followed 30 beholde two blinde men sittinge way side whē heard iesus passed cried saying lord sonne dauid haue mercy v 31 multitude rebuked shoulde holde peace cried saying lorde sonne dauid haue mercy v 32 iesus stoode still called vvhat yee shoulde doe 33 sayde lorde eye may opened 34 iesus moued compassion touched eye immediatelye theyr eye receiued sight followed 46 came iericho hee went cute iericho disciple great multitude bartimeus sonne timeus blinde man sate way side begging 47 heard iesus nayareth began cry say iesus sonne dauid haue mercy 48 many rebuked holde peace cried much sonne dauid haue mercy 49 iesus stoode still commanded called called blinde saying good comfort arise calleth thee 50 threw away cloke rose came iesus 51 iesus answeared sayde vnto vvhat wilt thou doe vnto thee blinde sayd vnto lord may receiue sight 52 iesus sayd vnto goe thy way thy faith hath saued thee hee receiued sight followed iesus way 35 came passe hee come neare vnto iericho certaine blinde man sate way side begging 36 heard people passe hee asked meant 37 sayd vnto iesus nayaret passed 38 cried saying iesus sonne dauid haue mercye 39 went rebuked hold peace cried much sonne dauid haue mercy 40 iesus stoode still commaunded broughte vnto hee come neare asked 41 sayinge wilte thou doe vnto thee hee sayde lorde may receiue sight 42 iesus sayd vnto receiue thy sight thy faith hath saued thee 43 immediately receiued sighte followed praising god people sawe gaue praise god 29 departed thence o • ander seemeth subtilly make one blinde man foure deuice friuolous saw euangelistes differ many woordes imagined gaue one blinde man sight entrance city second two others sight giuen christ departed thence circumstance agree wise man wil beleue entreat diuers hystories may omitte rest followed christ endeuoured first make hold peace sawe healed beyond expectation would soone haue attempted like three needefull followe euery poynte euery manne may gather easily doe set downe one hystorie difference offendeth mathewe marke doe say myracle wroughte vppon one two blinde menne christ went citie luke maketh mention done came citie marke luke doe speake one blinde man mathewe addeth two sith wee knowe doeth often fall among euangelistes settinge downe one hystorie one letteth passe reported others againe plainly expounded one passed silence must seeme newe straunge thinge present place doe suppose blinde manne cried christ came toward citie sith hearde noyse hee gate way comming citie lengthe christ called luke beginninge beginninge doeth prosecute whole hystorie passeth ouer time christes tariaunce citie two doe onely touche time whiche nearest myracle may coniectured christ oft time triall faith menne doeth sometimes deferre hee tried blinde manne seconde knotte easily loosed haue seene place marke luke reported one man possessed deuil healed mat nameth two euē place yet disagree may rather coniectured one blinde manne first soughte helpe christe mooued example occasion two receiued sighte marke luke doe speake one onely either hee knowen power christe notably shewed one two surely marke seemeth speake well knowen therefore setteth downe wel owne name father doeth commende either birth welth meanest sort people begger vvherby appeareth myracle wrought vppon notable calamity commonly knowne thys seemeth reason marke luke onely name saye nothinge inferiour addition mathew eye witnesse woulde omit though • well knowen 30 lorde sonne dauid haue mercy v sayd euen nowe one beganne cry like necessity doeth easily driue ioyne also also giue small honor christ desire haue mercy vpon help perswaded hadde helpe remeady hand needed faith marueiled confesse messias whome knowe iewes noted title therefore flee christ onely prophet onely authour saluation promised god cry doeth shew vehemencie affection knew woordes odious manye regarded honour christ earnest desire ouercame feare notwythstāding freely lifted vppe voyce 31 multitude rebuked marueile christes disciple followed duety reuerence would driue poore wretch grace christe muche lay stopte passage power commeth oft time passe greatest number whiche professe name christe doe rather hinder staye v comminge call v sathan wroughte godlye simple menne whiche followed christe religion hinderance two blinde menne howe muche bringe purpose passe hypocrite faithlesse menne take diligent heede selues therefore haue neede constancy whereby may passe stoppes hinderance yea moe stoppes sathan layeth way behooueth v bend selues earnestly prayer see blinde men doubled cry 32 vvhat yee shal doeth louingly gently aske desire hee determined graunt request thought prayed special motiō spirit lorde deliuer men bodily disease doeth hee allowe simply pray pleasure rule prescribed v aske howe respect lawfull decline except lorde secreat motion spirite teache anye peculiar speciall petition christe asketh question muche respecte priuate cause respecte people wee knowe worlde deuoureth blessing god without sense except moued stirred vppe therefore christe sayinge stirreth vppe multitude present obserue marke myracle doeth also moue visible signe openeth eye touching vvhen mathewe sayeth iesus hadde compassion participle verbe vsed euen person blinde menne besought christe mercye woulde helpe miserable creature euangelist nowe declareth christe onely mooued free goodnesse heale hee mooued sorrowe griefe togither euill metaphore borowed bowelles wherein humanitye mutuall compassion resteth stirreth v vp helpe neighbor marke 52 thy faith hath saued thee woorde faith doeth onely meane hope recouering sight deper perswasion blind man acknowledged iesus messias promised god neither thoughte confuse knowledge haue seene confession taken lawe prophet blinde manne rashly call christe name sonne dauid receiued suche one taught promisses god come christ • ascribeth faith blinde manne receiueth sight though power grace god doeth sometime extende euen vnbeleeuers yet man vseth benefites rightly profitably enioyeth faith naye vse giftes god farre profiting vnfaithfull rather hurtfull vvherefore saluation whereof christ maketh mention restrained outward health also comprehendeth curing sauing soule christ haue sayd blind man obtained faith god mercy haue request graunted lord respect faith bestoweth grace vppon blinde man followeth iustified faith math 34 followed signe thankefulnesse blinde menne applied themselues follow christ though vncertaine whether tary longe office calling yet token thankefull minde shew foorth grace christ iourney many luke addeth people gaue glorye god maketh assured proofe myracle mathewe marke luke 19 1 nowe iesus entered passed throughe ieriche 2 behold man named zacheus chiefe receiuer tribute hee riche 3 hee sought see iesus shoulde coulde prease hee lowe stature 4 vvherefore ranne clinted vp wilde figge tree might see hee shoulde come way 5 iesus came place hee looked vppe sawe saide vnto zacheus come downe day must abide thine house 6 hee came downe hastily receiued ioyfully 7 sawe murmured sayinge gone lodge sinful man 8 zacheus stoode foorth sayde vnto lorde beholde lorde halfe goodes giue poore haue taken manne forged cauillation restore foure folde 9 iesus saide day saluation come house muche also become sonne abraham 10 sonne man come seeke saue lost hereby appeareth luke curious obseruing order course time hath declared myracle rehearseth befell citie iericho saith christe offered himselfe menne walkinge wayes one zacheus desirous see signe great desire climed vppe vppon tree riche men moste parte proud chalenge shew grauity themselues maye bee also desired luke especially maketh mention manne rather partly respect estate partly respecte woonderfull conuersion manne sodainly wrought though zacheus hadde yet faith planted yet certaine preparation hee coulde earnestly desire see christe without heauenly instincte especially ende presently appeareth certaine vaine curiositie came see christe place farre distant appeareth successe zacheus hadde seede godlinesse minde lord manifesteth himselfe vnto men doeth often inspire blinde affection whereby caried whome haue yet knowen seene though haue certaine apparante reason doe yet hee deceiueth reuealeth himselfe time vnto 5 zacheus come downe day must example grace worthy remembered lorde preuenteth zacheus taryeth biddinge himselfe seeketh entertainment hys house vve knowe odious detestable name publicane doeth luke shortly declare therefore great kindnesse sonne god come whose companye common people abhorred hee bidden maruaile hee doeth honour whome hee drawen vnto secreate motion spirite excellent gifte dwell heart enter house speache hee declareth men doe sincerely desire knowe shall neuer seeke vaine zacheus obtaineth muche hoped force direction holy ghoste doeth plainly appeare zacheus obeyed readily came speedily tree receiued christ ioy though yet perfect faith yet readniesse learne obedience beginning faith 7 vvhen sawe inhabitant towne doe murmure may followed christ went man diffamed euill name yea manne bad world neglecteth grace god offered vnto murmureth grudgeth bestowed vpon others let v see farre grudging equitie thinke absurd thing christ shoulde make account wicked manne sinner taken heere common sense diuers place signifieth man filthy notorious euill life lette v graunt zacheus manne yet must first considered purpose christe chose lodge house murmured without doores god mightely shewing glory name within confuted wicked cauill conuersion zacheus wonderfull worke god yet iust cause speake infamously zacheus hee receiuer custome selfe wicked gather customes iewes odious enuious sort people thought mete tributary maner man soeuer zacheus christe yet praised blamed kindnesse helping miserable man brought destruction saluation offence feared went forwarde doe father commaunded behooueth minister gospel haue courage make account saluation one soule murmuring woordes wicked therefore thoughe see deedes saying subiect sclanders yet cease office 8 zacheus stoode foorth christes woorke may iudged comming foorth men make preposterous haste leaue place god also zacheus conuersion described frutes outward signes probable encreased wealth hinderāce many men ready hath defrauded man restore foure fold furthermore bequeatheth halfe good poore man might deede haue bestowed goodes vpon poore whose liberalitye yet might nothinge accounted god though heere mention made inward repentance yet luke meaneth godly purpose commēdeth zacheus sprang liuely roote paule speaking repentaunce exhorteth v behaue selues men may thereby vnderstande become better let stoale steale lette rather labour worke hand may haue helpe poore needy ephes 4 28 therefore must beginne heart repentance must shewed workes let v note zacheus woulde offer god portion thing whiche gotten spoyle many rich men giue part theftes god might haue libertye spoile afterwarde may goe free wrong haue done zacheus doeth sacrifice one halfe goodes god hee also recompenceth iniuries soeuer hath done vvhereby gather gotten goodes vnlawful gaine zacheus ready satisfie thing gotten fraud imparteth lawfull patrimonie poore whereby declareth hee turned wolfe shepe also shepheard amending faultes committed renounceth euill practises hereafter god requireth first abstaine offence zacheus doeth necessity binde others follow example spoyle themselues one halfe goodes rule must kept lord prescribeth yeelde selues haue holy lawfull v 9 day saluation come house testimonie whiche christe giueth zacheus declareth dissemble neither yet doeth ascribe cause saluation good woorkes conuersion sure pledge adoption god hee doeth thereby gather well house shoulde enherite saluation doe woordes also signifie zacheus one child abraham hee argueth house saued necessary woulde accounted amongest child abraham shoulde followe faith yea scripture giueth commendation properly faith putteth difference betweene natural child abraham straungers therefore must know principally cōmended cause wherefore good woorkes also become acceptable god neither doubted christes doctrine went conuersion zacheus therfore beginning saluation hearing christe teaching free mercy god reconciliation men redemption church faith receiue doctrine house masculine gender greeke place may expounded two wayes olde interpreater referreth zacheus iudgement doe also like best erasmus rather translate house selfe childe abraham though refell yet doe thinke aptly applied zacheus god adopteth housholder hee also promiseth hee god whole house right saluation reacheth heade whole body worde also importance christe declareth zacheus lesse childe abrahā iewes pride despised least former life seme haue shutte gate saluation againste hee reasoneth office prooueth nothing chaunge shoulde offende man sent father saue lost mathew 25 marke luke 19 14 kingdom heauen man going straunge countrey called seruaunts deliuered goodes 15 vnto one gaue fiue talent two one euery manne owne abilitie straight way went home 16 receiued fiue talent went occupied gained fiue talent 17 likewise also receiued two also gamed two 18 receiued one went digged earth hid master money 19 longe season master seruaunts came reckened 20 came receiued fiue talent broughte fiue talent saying maister thou deliueredst vnto fiue talentes behold haue gained fiue talent 21 master said vnto well done good seruaunt faithful thou hast faithful little make thee ruler euer much enter thy master ioy 22 also receiued two talent came sayd master thou deliueredst vnto mee two talent behold haue gained two talent 23 master said vnto wel done good seruant faithful thou hast faithfull little make thee ruler ouer muche enter thy master ioy 24 receiued one talent came said master knew thou wast hard man reapest thou sowedst gatherest thou strawedst 25 therfore afraid went hidde thy talent earth beholde thou •• st thine owne •• master answeared sayd vnto thou euill seruaunt slouthfull thou knewest reape sowed gather strawed 27 thou oughtest therfore haue put mony exchanger comming haue receiued mine owne vantage 28 take therfore talent giue vnto whiche hath ten talent 29 vnto euery man hath shalbe giuen hee shall haue aboundance hath euen hath shalbe taken away 30 cast therefore vnprofitable seruaunt vtter darkenesse shalbe weeping gnashing teeth 11 while heard thing continued spake parable neare ierusalem also thought kingdome god shortly appeare 12 sayd therefore certaine noble man went farre countrey receiue kingdom come againe 13 called ten seruants deliuered ten piece mony said vnto occupy till come 14 citizen hated sent embassage saying wee wil haue manne raigne ouer v 15 came passe come againe hadde receiued kingdome hee commaunded seruauntes called whome hee gaue mony might know euery man gained 16 came first sayinge lord thy piece hath encreased ten piece 17 said vnto wel good seruant thou hast ben faithful little thing take thou authoritye ouer x city 18 second came saying lord thy piece hath encreased fiue piece 19 said thou also ruler ouer fiue city 20 came saide lorde beholde thy piece whiche haue laide vp napkin 21 feared thee thou art straite man thou takest vppe thou laidest downe reapest thou didd • st sowe 22 sayde vnto thy mouth wil iudge thee euil seruaunt thou knowest straite manne takinge vppe laide downe reaping sowe 23 vvherefore gauest thou • ny banke comminge might haue receiued vantage 24 hee sayde stode take piece giue hathe tenne piece 25 sayde vnto lord hath ten piece 26 say vnto vnto haue shall giuen hath euen hee hath shall taken 27 moreouer mine ennemies would shuld raigne ouer bring hither slay 28 thus spoken went foorth ascending vp ierusalem lv 11 while heard thing wonderfull thing disciple oft admonished death christ passe ouer kingdom double error first dreamed blessed rest without affliction valued kingdom god owne fleshly vnderstanding vvherby appeareth small darke faith though tasted hope resurrection yet tast little helde thinge certainly firmly christ beleeue redemer promised time past whō hope ye church shall renued knowledge doth presently vanish fantasy either peruert darken force kingdom nothing absurd many admonition giuen shuld forgotten without profite truely beastly blockishnesse onely remaine secure carelesse haste triumph christe lately expresly tolde bitter shamefull death hand 12 acertaine noble man mathewe regarding order time placeth parable amongst others purpose frō beginning 22 chapt gather togither last speaches christ cause reader shoulde much seeke spoken first second thirde day within short time nowe worth labour note math luke differ amongst selues whē toucheth one part latter toucheth two thys sette downe christ like noble man going farre country get kingdom deliuered mony seruāts occupy forward part touched luke subiects abused absence prince mooued tumult might shake yoake christ bothe poyntes bent disciple farre deceiued thoughte haue kingdom established went hierusalem presentlye erecte gloryous estate hope present kingdome taken awaye exhorteth hope patience hee telleth must abide manye trouble long time carefully beefore shall enioy glorye earnestly gape farre countrey vvhereas disciple thought christe went euen take possession kingdome hee reproueth errour first must take longe iourney get kingdome hunt curious pointes subtilly dispute farre countrey shuld meane suppose christ meant thing long absence time death vntill last cōminge though sitting right hande father hath obtained rule ouer heauen earth since hee ascended heauen power giuen euery knee shuld bow yet hath throughly brought enemy vnder yet appeared iudge world manifested glorye vnaptly said hee absent vntill returne againe furnished new kingdō true reigneth regenerateth heauē ly life reneweth image god accompanieth angelles gouerneth church worde preserueth might enricheth gift spirit cherisheth grace sustaineth power shorte beestoweth vppon whatsoeuer necessary saluation stayeth rage sathan wicked bringeth al deuises nothing manner gouernment hid eye body manifestation properly deferd vnto latter day therfore apostle fondly take hold shadow kingdome lorde saieth must seeke kingdom farre might learne abide delay 13 called ten seruaunts number seruants much rested vpon summes mony math speaking diuers summes containeth plentiful doctrine christ doth lay like burden trauell vpon men committing small sum one maketh ruler ouer agree christ sort goeth iourney far country vntil last day resurrection meane meete sit idle nothing euery perticular man hath certaine calling laid vpon wherin exercise himselfe therefore ought apply businesse might diligently lordes worke luke sayeth simply euery man hath piece mony giuen whether lorde committeth vnto v lesse euery man shall giue like account mathew sayde dealeth fully plainly speaketh distincte seuerall portion know lord doth giue al men without differēce like measure gift diuideth diuersly thinketh best shuld excel others 1 cor 12 7 eph 4 7 also must know gift soeuer lord bestoweth vpon v committed vnto v mony gaine shuld arise thereof viler thing grace god force wherof consisteth frute lie buried applied vse mat 15 euery man ability christ doth word distinguish nature gift spirit power abilitie acknowledged receiued frō god therfore whosoeuer would parte god shal leaue nothing self meaning maister gaue euery mā lesse ability god hath disposed euery man adorned naturall gift also dooth lay vpon exerciseth thing hee carieth forwardes diuerse callinges furnisheth notably woorke giueth occasion bee occupied papistes bee laughed doe hereof gather gyftes god bestowed vpon euery man according measure deseruing though old interpreter vsed worde vertue yet meant god would bestow vpon men according behaue themselues get praise vertue onely maister esteeme sitte wee know god findeth man sitte vntill hath made ambiguitie greek word dunamis christ vseth 20 fiue talent sayde gain profitably employ whatsoeuer god hath left life godly aptly compared gayning occupying ought deale fro maintenaunce societie amongst themselues industry euery man applyeth occupying gyft committed calling self faculty wel gift accounted marchandise belong vse end may mutuall fellowshippe amongst men gayne whereof christ maketh mention common profitte setteth forth glory god though god doth enrich encrease work yet euery man doth profit brother doth profitably apply saluatiō gift hath receiued god sayd profit gaine god heauēly father doth much accoūt saluation men whatsoeuer imploied way hee woulde haue reckoned amongst accountes least waxe weary well christ saith labour shall vaine doe exercise themselues faythfully calling luke saith made ruler ouer fiue city gayned fiue piece wordes hee declareth glory kingdome shalbe farre otherwise last comming appeareth labour trauayle businesse one absent hee shall haue great aboundaunce store honour hand wherewith royally sette v vp manner speache set downe matthew simple playne enter thy maisters ioy wherby declareth faythful seruants whose labour shall allow shall made partner blessed aboundaunce good thinges demaunded meaneth added take talent giue hath ten maner occupying shal cease aunswere must remembred spak doe amisse doe curiouslye search euery perticular poynt naturall meaning though slouthful vnprofitable seruants furnished gift spirit length shal spoyled theyr want shameful pouertie may turne glory good christe saieth slouthfull seruauntes doe hyde eyther talent piece earth wil take paynes prouide pleasure ease see manye giue themselues thēselues owne commodity flye al dueties charitye haue respect common profit vvhere sayde master returne called seruauntes accounte good may hereby receiue comfort knowe labour vaine againe striketh small terrour slacke slouthfull therefore let v learne lord commeth reckoneth v reckon selues euery day accorde 24 knew thou wast hard man hardnesse appertaineth nothing summe parable doe gather fond fancye dispute austerely straightlye god dealeth farre christes purpose note rigour prayse vsuries hee bringeth maister speakinge thus thou oughtest haue put money exchaungers least might haue encreased vsury christ onely declareth excuse shall serue theyr slouth suppresse gyftes god consume age ydlenes vvhereby wee doe also gather kinde lyfe commendable god whereof profit doth arise societie men sentence euery one hath shalbe giuen expounded beefore thirteene chapter also eight chapter haue taught vtter darknes opposed home light olde time supper kept night many torch lamp light christ saith cast kingdōe god cast darknes lvk 27 moreouer mine enemy second parte hee seemeth specially reproue iewes yet hee toucheth absence master bend themselues fall away christ purposed onely terrifie denouncing horryble vengance also keepe faythful obedience light temptation see kingdome god shaken faythlesnesse rebellion many therefore wee myght remayne quyet amongst manye tumultuous styrres christe saieth hee come agayne wyll reuenged hys comming vngodlye fallyng away math 21 mark 11 luk 19 1 drewe neere ierusalem come sonne dauid blessed hee commeth name lord hosanna art highest heauen 1 came neere ierusalem bethphage bethania vnto mounte oliues hee sente forth two disciple 2 said vnto goe wayes towne euer sonne yee shal enter ye shal finde colte beunde whereon neuer man sate lose bring 3 man say vnto ye say lord hath neede straightway hee send hither 4 wente theyr way sound colt tied dore without place two wayes mette losed 5 certeine stoode sayde vnto doe yee loosing colte 6 saide vnto iesus hadde commaunded lette goe 7 brought colte iesus cast garment hee sate vpon 8 manye spread garmentes way▪ cut came passe hee come neere bethphage bethania besides mounte called mount olyues sent two disciple 30 sayinge got towne wherein assoone yee come yee shall finde colte tyed whereon neuer manne 〈◊〉 lose bring hither 31 anye man aske yee lose shall yee saye vnto lorde hath neede 32 sent went waye found saide vnto 33 losinge colte owner thereof saide vnto lose yee colte 34 sayde lorde hath neede 35 brought iesus caste garraentes colte set iesus thereon 36 went spred clothes ye way 37 hee nowe come neere going downe mounte olyues whole multitude disciple began reioyce praise god loud voice al great workes seene 38 saying blessed king cōmeth name lord peace heauen glory highest place christe sent asse disciple beecause wearye iourney ende sith time death hand minde shew shoulde bee nature kingdome beganne doe baptisme remained shewed towardes end calling hee thus long abstaine called king length professeth himselfe king farre ende hys race therefore time neere departure heauen openly beganne kingdome vppon earth pomp beene ridiculous aunswered prophesie zachary christ challenging kingly honour himselfe entreth ierusalem riding vppon asse royall shew warrant note also borowed asse another wanted saddle furnyture disciple compelled lay theyr cloathes vpon token vile shamefull pouertie graunt great company following manner men vnaduisedly runne next village many ioyful shoutes heard whome namely poore men basest sort people purpose set himselfe scorned men doe two thinges togeather giue shewe kingdome teach like earthly empire stā deth transitory rich world meete hee holde course yet also might seeme fonde thing prophane men god declared prophet yt shuld come king restore sauing health people therefore least contemptible estate christ hinder v beholding spirituall kingdome shew let v alwayes haue heauenlye oracle eye wherewith god adorned sonne vnder contemptible shew begger haue shone withal ensignes kinges earth vvithout sauce hystory neuer bee sauory v therefore matthewes wordes great weight hee saith saying prophet fulfilled saw men much giuen glorious pompous shewes hardlye brought theyr owne wisdome fleshe profitte thing hystorye leadeth simple beeholding thing consideration prophesie 2 goe towne hee borowed asse ease hys iourney come farre bethani • hee might easily haue gone rest iourney foote kinges goe vp charets may seene farre lorde woulde meanes moue people look vpon token ratifie cry follower least man thinke gaue honour kinge againste vncerteine whence lorde commaunded bringe asse supposed countreye village verye ridiculous doe allegorically expound ierusalem vnapt also allegory doe coyne asse colte woulde haue asse figure iewish people beene brought vnder accustomed yoke law colt wheron neuer man rydden represented gentile christe therefore first ride vpon asse first begin iewes shifted ouer colt also second place set ouer gentile mat seemeth note riding vpon considering figure synecdoche often vsed scripture meruaile hee name two one plainely appeareth euangelistes ridde onely vpon colte zachary taketh away doubt familiar vse hebrew tongue rehearseth one thing twise anon yee shall finde least hinder disciple yeelding readye obedience lord speedily aunswereth question first telleth sendeth aduenture saith first entraunce towne finde young asse damme man hinder shuld bring answered neede meanes proued godhead belongeth god alone knowe absent bend heartes men yeeld consente though might haue beene owner asse hauing euill opinion would willingly graunt yet say whether home whether would lend whether would giue credit men vnknowne mortal man te say christ strengtheneth disciple might readier obey see diligent ready shewe themselues obeying successe declareth whole matter gouerned god 5 tell yee daughter sion zachary word word yet euangelist doth aptly fitly apply al godlye teacher god gaue commandement one prophet declare onely hope whereupon child god staye strēgthen themselues redeemer come length therefore prophet teacheth comming christ bring full perfect matter reioyceing faythfull god otherwise merciful putting mediatour betweene mediatour delyuered euilles therebe without comfort men lost sinnes oppressed misery christ absent necessity altogeather ouerwhelmed sorowe againe prophet telleth faythfull haue iust cause reioyce redeemer present though commendeth christ title iust furnished saluation yet matthew tooke one poynt serued hys purpose namelye shoulde come poore meeke vnlike earthly kinges excell royall pompous estate added token pouerty ride vpon asse colt asse doubted hee opposeth thys meane manner riding princely pompe 6 disciple went already spoken disciple commended diligence readines obey authority christ great bare name shoulde suffice moue straungers also feared least shoulde bee charged theft therefore doth hereby appeare howe much credited maister answere againe trusting promise hasted execute commaunded let v also learne example go let hinderance maye obey lorde thing requireth v al let set aside shal finde passage wil suffer endeuours vaine 8 great multitude euangelistes doe declare people acknowledged christ king might seeme bee iest simple people cutting downe boughes spreading garmentes way giue christ vaine title king yet earnest testified obedience heart christ accounted fitte harauldes proclaymers kingdome gesse according auncient solemne custome day see probability likelihood rather appeareth moued soden instinct spirit giue honour christ disciple example matter reste multitude thought thing also may gathered luke word 9 osanna sonne dauid prayer taken psalm 118 25 matthew also doth purposely set hebrew word wee might knowe greetinges rashlye giuen christe disciple spake randon without regarde wordes soeuer came vppon tongue ende reuerently folowed forme prayer holy ghost mouth prophet taught whole church though speaketh kingdome yet doubt speciall regard would haue others haue regard eternall succession lorde promised hee prescribed vnto church perpetuall order prayer also vsed wealth kyngdome decayed came passe custome euerye vsed wordes theyr prayer redemption promysed mathewes purpose wee touched euen set hebrew verse notably commonly vsed declare people acknowledged christ redeemer pronunciation wordes somewhat altered rather haue beene sayde hosch • na saue beseech wee know wordes scarsly translated tongue somwhat sounde must chaunged spirit onely teach old people praye kingdome christe also prescribeth rule vnto v god raigne hande sonne noted wordes wee saye thy kingdom come plainely declared psalme furthermore praying god hee would preserue sonne king graunt kingdome erected manne vpholden power menne standeth inuincible defence heauen sayd come name god doth intrude taketh kingdom cōmandemēt appointment god certeinely gathered marke another cry sette downe blessed kingdome commeth name lord father dauid say respect promise lord said would length lesse excused gate saluation alwayes open somtime silent smal common benefit calleth v vnto loud voice familiarlye therefore remaineth sharper reuenge contempt hidde spoken lessening fault ierusalem wonderfull blockishnesse noted shamefull cause shee could see god present graunt beelongeth vnto god open eye minde blinde man able see misteries heauenly kingdome hee whome god lyghteneth inwardlye spirite therefore worthye forgiuenesse perishe owne beastlye blindnesse christe also purposed take awaye offence otherwise might hinderaunce rude weake eye al men cast vpon citie example citie great saye vnto yee haue faith doubt yee shall onely doe haue doone figtree also saye mountaine take thy selfe awaye cast thy selfe sea shalbe done 22 whatsoeuer yee shal aske prayer ye beleeue yee shal receiue 11 iesus entred ierusalem temple looked thinges nowe euening hee wente forth vnto bethania twelue 12 〈◊〉 morow • bethania hungry 13 seeing figtree farre leaues hee went see hee might finde agree christ accursed tree came citie next day solemne entraunce onely marke reporteth matthew omitted disciple marked day following therefore though mark noted order time distinctlye yet diuersitie beetweene seemeth differ aswell matthew luke hystory reforming buying selling saye christ draue buyer seller assoone entred citie temple marke simply saith looked vpon thinges referreth casting forth day thus reconcile hadde spoken cleansing temple set place hee saith came first day temple looked aboute vpon thinges end looke diligently might reforme amisse wont visit temple often newnesse sight moued marke haue added presently casting temple bought solde hee saith christ went citie hee omitted worthy rehearsall reporteth except man rather say marke hystory also obserued circumstaunce time omitted two though seeme keepe continuall course text yet set downe certeine day absurditie deuide read ioyntlye togeather yet doe rather allowe opinion sette downe beefore verye lykely christe great perill bee brought citie kingly pompe beene amased therefore summe christ entred secretely neyther enemy content therewith despised him▪ rather restrained secrete feare god striken durst attempt thing meane season slouthfull security city reproued religion straungers commended citisens hearing noyse doe demaund bee appeareth company followed christ 11 iesus entred temple vvhen gone often vp temple seene corruption put hand twyse reforme beginning ambassage nowe agayne hee comenye ende sith reigned filthy prophane confusion temple sacrificer appoynted destroyed sufficient christe twyse reproue openly prophaning vvhen hee shewed prophet teacher sent god might waken iewes make attentiue tooke vpon cleanse temple onely iohn toucheth former historye seconde chapter towardes end course againe challenging authority himselfe admonisheth iewes pollution temple sheweth withall newe reformation hand meane season bee doubted hee shewed himselfe king high priest president temple worshippe god must therefore bee noted least anye priuate manne thinke lawfull doe lyke meete godlye menne shoulde haue zeale wherewith christ moued doe least manne vnder pretence immitation shoulde runne headlong rashly must seene calling wyll beare farre behoueth v goe commandement god corruption shall creepe church god let child god grieued god hath armed euery man hand let priuate men sigh sorowe vntyll god shall giue remedy graunt blockish displeased pollution temple god neither sufficient inwardly grieued except abstaine corruption testifie theyr tongue ofte occasion shall suffer desire thinges reformed haue publike authoritie faultes cannot remedy hand let speak tong haue liberty yet demanded christe sawe temple stuffed grosse superstition whye shuld reforme smal corruption leaste tollerable amongst aunswere christes purpose restore al holy ceremony auncient vse neither make choyce corruption greater lesser▪ onelye bent shew one visible signe god hadde committed charge reforming temple would also declare worshippe god corrupted filthy palpable abuse wanted pretence merchandise eased people much trouble sacrifice shuld farre seeke also might money ready hand euery man would offer neither table money chaungers set sacrifice offred solde sanctuarye onelye courte porch whiche sometime called name temple nothinge inconuenient maiestie temple haue market set vp thinges sold haue money chaungers sit make gaine exchaunge prophanation borne christ inueighed sharplye appeared couetousnes priestes filthye gaine sake brought custō entreth shop richly furnished diuers kind ware though purposeth buy nothing yet caught baightes altereth purpose priest cast forth net catch offrings might milk gaine euery one 13 written christe bringeth two testimony taken two prophetes one fiftie sixe chapter isaiah seuenth ieremy isaiah writte agreed circumstaunce time calling gentile foretolde therefore isaiah promiseth god onely bringe passe temple shalbe restored former bewtie also gentyles shall come euery place thither certeine speaketh metaphoricallye prophetes doe vnder shadowes law set forth spirituall worshippe god shuld vnder kingdome christ neuer fulfilled people come ierusalem worshippe therfore saith temple shall place prayer gentile asmuch haue sayde gentile shall gathered church god togeather child abrahā might one mouth call vpon true god hee maketh mention temple somuch visible seate place religion christ dooth worthily reproue iewes vilelye applyed v whereto ordained meaning therefore god would temple remaine vnto time signe marke whereto true worshipper bent vnworthily wickedly doe turning prophane market christes time temple house prayer long lawe shadowes force beganne house prayer nation doctrine gospel sounded thence whereby whole worlde grewe consent fayth though shortly destroyed yet vnto day appeareth effect prophesie sith law came sion necessary whosoeuer pray rightly shoulde looke beginning graunt difference place lorde bee called vppon euerye faythfull professe themselues worshippe god israell sayde speake language canaan also come temple true religion sprang thence fountaine water short space wonderfully encreased flowed forth great aboundance drink shall liue ezechiell maketh mention chap 47 9 water going temple doe spread themselues east west though vse church day meeting ye holy assēblies yet cause since christ came proposed v outwarde shadowish image hee tymes past father vnder lawe furthermore noted prophet woord prayer meaneth whole worshippe god though time great aboundaunce ceremony yet god word taught iewes end al ceremony referred namely might spiritually worship plainely set downe fiftie psalme dooth god also call backe exercise godlynesse prayer haue made christe declareth complainte ieremiah belongeth also time wherein temple lesse defiled prophet rebuketh hypocrite strengthning themselues temple tooke themselues libertie sinne purpose god instructe iewes outward signes instruction true godlynes common matter hypocrite turne trueth lye sufficient apply themselues outward ceremony content vaine pretence temple prophet cryeth god tied temple bounde ceremony therefore boasted vaine name temple made denne theeues theeues doe boldly sinne dennes beecause hope shall escape without punishment hypocrite grow bolde vnder faigned pretence godlinesse almost hope deceiue god metaphor denne reacheth corruption christ doth aptly apply place prophet present cause marke addeth christ forbadde man cary vessell temple hee would suffer anye prophane thing seene word vessell hebrewes doe signifie kinde furniture house summe christ tooke away whatsoeuer hindered reuerence maiestie temple 14 blinde halte came vnto least authoritie christe hadde taken vppon hee woont shoulde bee suspected rashnesse hee confirmed miracle therefore healed blinde halte temple might manifestly knowne right honour messias belonged prophetes doe describe sette forth christe againe seeme nippe scornefully caste teeth seeketh praise child noted whereof toke offence malitious wicked deadly contēners god appeareth much vexed myracles happy ioyfull cryes seeke would haue decree holden oracle shuld lawfull allow reiect thing according theyr pleasure therefore thinke absurd peruerse course people giue title messias man whō shal think worthy degree certeinly meete would haue done theyr duety haue gone whole people leader guydes priestes created end al menne might aske knowledge law god lippes also might aungelles interpreter god hostes mal 1 7 wickedly extinguished light trueth christ aunswereth aptly shal preuaile nothing seeking suppresse doctrine saluation stone shall rather vtter wordes contained secrete graunt▪ christ doth deny preposterous order vnlearned common people child shoulde first celebrate speach comming messias yt malitiouslye choake trueth shoulde approued witness meruaile god raise vppe others shame chuse child doe heereby reape litle comfort though wicked labour wayes deuise darken hide kingdome christ heare labour vaine hope company promote kingdome christe shal kil restraine others feare shal obtaine theyr purpose lord wil deceiue wil rather giue mouthes tongue stone rather kingdom sonne shall want witness 16 read yee neuer scribe priest tooke occasion quarrell christ suffered child call king wicked one doe truely hungred wee knowe owne accorde became subiecte infirmity though nature free void difficulty standeth howe hee shoulde deceiued seeke frute vppon tree without especiallye time frute yet come anger hot harmlesse tree absurdity follow say man knewe kinde tree yet may ignorant ende came vnto purpose hee caried heate anger curse onely vnrighteous also childish ridiculous reuengement hunger grieuous vnto respecte flesh sought ouercome contrary affection namely might set foorth glory father sayeth place meate may doe father iohn 4 34 also doeth striue wearinesse thirste doe rather incline opinion hunger meanes prouoking woorke myracle teache disciple therefore hungred meat ready fedde himselfe otherwise namely setting foorth glorye god tree giue token ende remaineth hypocrite also declare howe vaine boastinge purpose 19 neuer frute grow thee hence forwarde heereby learne woord accursing meaneth namely tree condemned barren againe god blesseth woord maketh frutefull doth euidently appeare marke figge tree presently wyther least disciple marke vntill next day sawe leaues fallen marke also doeth attribute peter alone mathewe doeth commonly referre disciple christ answeareth plurall number easie gathered one asked question name rest 21 iesus answeared christ extendeth vse myracle hee mighte encourage disciple faith confidence marke first sette downe generall exhortation haue faith god followeth promisse shall obtaine faith soeuer shall aske god haue faith god signifieth muche promisse himselfe certainly looke god soeuer needeful faith v doeth presently breake prayer pearceth treasure grace god shewed woorde might enioy therefore christe addeth prayer faith hee hadde onely sayd haue soeuer shall desire faith might seeme imperious secure vvherefore christe declareth beleeue right trusting goodnesse promisses doe humbly flee vnto notable place expresse force nature faith namely certaine assurance resting goodnesse god without doubtfulnesse christ doeth acknowledge others beleeue doe vndoubtedly account god mercifull doubt giue doe aske vvhereby see diuelishe imagination papist bewitched doe mixe faith doubting togither nay charge v foolish presumption perswaded fatherly fauour god towardes v dare bolde present selues paule doth especially commend benefite christe faith haue boldnesse entrance god confidence ephe 3 12 furthermore place doth teache true examination faith contained prayer manne doe obiecte prayer neuer heard mountaines cast themselues sea answeare easie christe doeth slacke raynes mennes prayer shoulde desire lust maketh prayer subiecte rule faith necessary spirite bridle affection bryng obedience woorde god christe requireth certaine assured confidence prayer without doubting whence shall minde manne conceiue tēple preached gospell highe priestes scribe came vpon elder 2 spake vnto hym saying tell v aucthoririty thou doest thing hath giuen thee authority 3 answeared said vnto also wil aske one thing tell therefore 4 baptisme iohn heauen men 5 reasoned within themselues saying wee shall saye heauen say beleeued ye 6 wee shall saye men people stone v perswaded iohn prophet 7 therefore answeared could tel whence 8 iesus said vnto neither tell authority doe thing 23 authority doest thou thing purpose open attempt proceede priest scribe doe ouerthwartly trie may meanes driue maner teaching quarrell doctrine selfe whether true often tried vaine mooue question calling commaundement goodly colour sith manne might thrust himselfe either honour priesthoode office prophet muste waite calling god muche lesse lawfull manne take vppon name messias except may euidently appeare chosen thereunto god must appoynted onely woorde god also othe wrytten psalme 110 4 deale peruersly wickedly diuine maiestie christ beene declared many myracles though ignorant thing inquire frō whence came absurde sawe hande god stretched foorth healing halte blinde doubte whether priuate man hath rashly taken authority vppon sufficiently proued christ sent heauen could lesse allowe dedes heart acknowledged god bee authour therefore rest vppon lawful minister god shall chuse voyces whole power theyr handes though lawfull gouernours churche yet monstrous thing lifte themselues againste god nowe vnderstand christ doeth directly answeare wickedly shamelesly asked question matter euidently knowne 25 baptisme iohn christe asketh question baptisme iohn onely might shew vnworthy authority despised holy prophet god also might reprooue owne aunsweare impudently pretendinge ignoraunce matter euidently knowen must remembered wherefore iohn sent message matter specially bent himselfe vnto sent crier proclaime christ slacked thing set chalenged nothing himselfe might prepare way lorde poynted christ singer testified hee onely sonne god nowe whence would scribe haue newe authority christe approoued vnto baptisme iohn hadde made lawfull assured triall nowe see christe vsed crafty subtelty auoide answeared question proposed wholely fully iohn coulde acknowledged seruant god christ must acknowledged lord armed frowarde men whiche without commaundement owne presumption dare take publike office vppon neither doeth hee example teache sophisticall arte concealing truth many subtile men doe falsly alleage authour graunt man must alwayes answeare one maner especially ennemies lay snare catch v malice must wisely auoided truth lest vndefended baptisme taken place onely outwarde signe washing whole ministerie iohn christe would haue answeared whether iohn true lawfull prophet god deceiuer yet sentence containeth profitable doctrine whether baptisme iohn god men thereby gather godly may admit amongest doctrine sacrament except may appeare proceeded god neither power men coyne pleasure hee speaketh iohn whome lord doeth highly commende aboue prophetes yet christ sayeth baptisme may receiued except commaunded god vvhat shall said fained sacrament fondly brought menne value without commaundement god christe doeth openly declare woordes whole gouernment church doth depende vpon direction god wickednesse menne bring thing themselues thought amongst themselues wickednesse priestes heereby shewed consider true neither doe aske owne conscience nay rather vilely tourne backwarde confesse whiche knowe true least poynt tyrannie lost godlesse though seeme desirous learne yet shut gate truthe thinke gaine therefore christ doeth sende away without answeare sendeth away ashamed confounded alleageth much testimony iohn sufficeth shewe doeth power god mathew 21 marke luke 28 thinke yee certaine man two sonnes came elder sayde sonne goe woorke day vineyard 29 answeared sayde yet afterward repented himselfe went 30 came second sayd likewise answeared sayde sir yet hee went 31 vvhether twaine father sayd vnto first iesus sayd vnto verely say vnto publicanes harlottes shall goe kingdome god 32 iohn came vnto way righteousnesse ye beleeued publicanes harlot beleeued yee though ye saw mo • ued repentance afterward yee might beleeue clause sheweth end parable tendeth christ preferreth notorious infamous abhominable people scribe priest discouereth hypocrite boast themselues minister god pretend vaine shew godlinesse though ambition pride cruelty couetousnesse knowen men yet would accounted otherwise lately assaulted christ fained themselues carefull order church beene faithful carefull preseruers sith grosely mocke god men christ reproueth impudencie shewing nothing lesse suche boasted themselues farre dignity wherwith flattered themselues sit beneath publicanes harlot professed themselues chiefe maintainer worship god zealous law christ sayeth euen like sonne shuld woord promisse obedience vnto yet deceiue concerning publicanes harlot excuseth sinnes compareth dissolute life disobedience vntoward disobedient sonne togither first reiecteth father commā dement sheweth muche better doe continue sinnes end rather become meete apt beare yoake disdainfully refused nowe vnderstand purpose christ doth reproue priest scribe doe stubbornly resist god doe repent many admonition spoyleth honour wherof vnwoorthy vngodlinesse worse wantonnesse harlot 30 sir phrase borowed hebrew tongue hebrewes woulde offer seruices woulde say ready obey vse wordes beholde ready sir vertue selfe praise worthy willing ready obey assoone god shal speake word neither doeth christ place cōmend slacknes fault mā hath lingred long length goe labour wordes professe thou wilt perfourme christ teacheth hypocrisie intollerable stubbornnesse processe time tamed 32 iohn came vnto iohn faithfull minister god christ referreth soeuer taught god speach beene full plaine god came preaching righteousnesse mouth iohn iohn spake name god priuate man aptly sette place god place giueth small authority preaching woorde accounted stubborne disobedient soeuer shall despise godly holy admonition teacher sent doe subtelly expound word righteousnesse whome doe permit vse • sense iudgement signifieth nothing else doctrine iohn sound right shoulde haue sayde cause shoulde reiecte sayeth publicanes beleeued meaning allow word earnest affection embrace heard vvherby gather self faith man subscribe sounde doctrine comprehendeth greater deeper matter hearer renouncing himselfe giue life wholely god vvhen sayeth mooued example amplifieth obstinate malice token extreeme desperation least follow harlot publicanes math 21 marke 12 luke 20 33 heare parable certaine housholder whiche planted vineyearde hedged rounde made wine presse therin built tower let husbandman went strange country 34 time fruit drewe neare sent seruaunts husbandmenne receiue fruites thereof 35 husbandmenne tooke seruaunts beate one killed another stoned another 36 sent seruaunts first like vnto 37 last al sent vnto owne sonne sayinge reuerence sonne 38 husbandman saw sonne saide among themselues heire come lette v kill lette v take inheritaunce 39 tooke cast vineyard slew 40 vvhen therefore lorde vineyarde shall come hee doe husbandman 41 said vnto wil cruelly destroy wicked men let vineyard vnto husbandman shall deliuer frutes season 42 iesus sayd vnto read yee neuer sciptures stone builder refused made heade corner lordes doinge merueillous eye 43 therefore sayd vnto kingdome god shall taken shall giuen nation shal bring foorth fruites thereof 44 soeuer shall fall stone shall broken whome soeuer shal fal grinde powder 45 chief priest pharisies heard parable perceiued hee spake 46 seeking lay handes feared people tooke prophet 1 beganne speake vnto parable certaine manne planted vineyard compassed hedge digged pit winepresse builte towre lette husbandman went straunge countrey 2 time sent husbandman seruaunt might receiue husbandman fruite vineyard 3 tooke beat sent away emptie 4 againe sent vnto seruaunt cast stone brake head sent away shamefully handled 5 againe sent another slewe many beating killing 6 yet one sonne deare beloued also hee sent last vnto sayinge reuerence sonne 7 husbandman sayd among themselues heir come let v kil inheritance shalbe 8 tooke killed cast vineyeard 9 vvhat shal lord vineyeard wil come destroy husbandman giue vineyeard others 10 haue yee redde muche scripture stone builder refuse made heade corner 11 done lorde meruailous eye 12 went take feared people perceiued hee spake parable therfore left went way 9 began speake people parable certain man planted vineyeard lette foorth husbandman went straunge countrey great season 10 time sent seruaunt husbandman shoulde giue frute vineyard husbandmenne beate sent away emptie 11 againe sent yet seruaunt beate foule intreated sent away emptie 12 moreouer hee sent third wounded cast 13 sayd lord vineyearde shall doe sende beloued sonne may wil doe reuerence see 14 husbandmenne sawe reasoned themselues sayinge heire come lette v kill inheritance may 15 caste oute • e vineyearde killed shall lorde vineyearde therefore •• vnto 16 wil come destroy husbādmen wil giue cut vineyarde others heard sayd god forbid 17 behelde sayd meaneth wryttē stone builder refused made head corner 18 vvho euer shall fall vppon stone shalbe broken whome soeuer shall fall grinde powder 19 hie priest scribe houre went lay handes feared people perceiued spoken parable 33 heare another parable woordes luke doe somewhat differ frō sayeth christ spake multitude speach heere directed priest scribe easily answeared though christ bent speach yet discouered theyr shame people vvhen marke sayeth christe began speake parable omitteth first order also place whole onely toucheth parte summe parable new thing priest gouernours church doe endeuour wickedly defraude god right haue vsed like theeuery prophet ready slay sonne shall escape vnpunished god wil arise reuenge right spoken two principall cause first might reprooue priest vnthankefulnesse full infidelitie wickednesse might take away offence might taken death neare hande preuailed much false title amongst false simple people religion amongst iewes depended wil pleasure therefore christ prepareth weake teacheth sith priest time past haue slaine many prophet one vppon cause man shoulde troubled like example also wrought owne person nowe let v consider euery parte hee planted vineyarde similitude often founde scripture cōcerning present place christes meaning god placeth pastours ouer church giueth ouer right vnto dealeth like maner housholder shoulde set vineyeard field husbandman bestowing labour dressing shoulde pay yearely frute complained isai 5 4 iere 2 21 vineyeard dressing whereof bestowed much labour cost brought foorth frute place accuseth keeper vineyeard strong theeues tooke al profit themselues saying christ husbandman receiued vineyeard well dressed laboured hand householder doeth little encrease faulte better dealt worthy abhorred vnthankfulnesse paule vseth argument 1 tim 3 15 would exhort pastours diligently doe duety stewardes chosen gouerne house god pillar grounde truth well excellenter honourable estate muche bound god followe woorke slouthfully diligently muche vnfaithfulnesse detested sayd euen nowe scornefully abuse great liberalitye honour god hath voutchsafed bestowe vppon god planted vineyeard mindfull free adoption separated againe people deliuered egypt peculier vnto himselfe testified woulde god father called hope eternall saluation planting whereof mention made isa 60 21 place winepresse tower vnderstoode meanes helpes ioyned doctrine law nourishmēt faith people sacrifice ceremony god prouident carefull housholder vsed diligence fensing church helpes might 30 set husbandman god might himselfe haue preserued estate church good order without helpe men taketh men minister vseth hand helpe time past appoynted priest dresser vineyeard marueile christ compare prophet seruants sent ende vintage aske frute know also vine dresser one charge common priest committed vnto answeare necessary christe shewe agreement difference betweene two order priestes created first cause might throughly furnish church sound doctrine either slouthfulnesse ignorance neglected worke committed vnto prophetes sent extraordinarye supplie purge vine hurtfull weedes shoulde cutte superfluous loppe supply thinges wanting throughe negligence priestes yet shoulde sharpely reprooue people restore religion decaied stirre vppe slouthfull mindes bring backe againe woorshippe god newnesse life else aske frute due vnto lorde vineyeard christ doeth aptly truely apply purpose neither yet continual regiment churche established prophet priestes alwayes kept handes euen slouthfull husbandman forsaking husbandry shoulde yet vnder pretence possession keepe place whereunto appoynted 35 beate one marke luke doe somewhat differ place mathewe maketh mention many seruauntes euill cruelly handled greater number sent againe onely sette euery manne seuerall order two three sent togither one another though one generall purpose namely iewes woulde attempt like sonne often done prophet yet mathewe doeth declare matter selfe plainely god sending many prophet stroue malice priest vvhereby appeareth howe outragious madnesse could refourmed meanes 37 reuerence sonne thought doeth properly belong god knewe shoulde come passe neither hee deceiued hope better successe common thing especially parable attribute humane affection neither yet added without cause christe would shew glasse desperate wickednesse whereof euident testimonye diuelishe madnesse arise sonne god came bring againe right minde hadde done lay driue god possession cruell slaughter prophet greatest sinne slaye sonne mighte raigne house without heire cause priest rage christe least shoulde lose tyrannie pray whome god father would haue raigne whome hath giuen authoritie euangelistes doe also somewhat vary ende mathewe sayeth began make confession themselues wherein condemned themselues marke simply sayeth christe declared punishment shoulde light vppon wicked vngodly seruantes luke seemeth plainly differ saying wythstoode iudgement christ pronounced marke meaning better diuersity amongst doubted would agree vnto christe suche seruaunts hadde deserued plague sawe bothe sinne iudgement laid vppon themselues woulde shifte 42 reade neuer scripture must remembred spake little priestes scribe people bound vnto principle common amongest onely lawfull arbiter iudges redemption come man might receiued messias liking consent shoulde allowe therefore affirme christ spoken thing impossible slay sonne heyre lord vineyeard christ confirmeth testimonie scripture asketh question vehemently sayd account great absurdity shoulde come passe husbandman whome vineyeard lette shoulde wickedly conspire sonne god vvhat hathe scripture foretolde shoulde chearefully ioyfully receiued ruler themselues rather place also citeth taken psalme 118 22 whence happy ioyfull cry fetched lorde saue nowe blessed hee commeth name lorde prophesied kingdom messias doeth appeare god created dauid king wyth condition throane stand euer euen long sunne moone shine heauen decaied shuld grace god restored former estate therefore whereas psalme containeth description kingdome dauid promiseth wythall shall perpetuall restored againe beene spoken temporall kingdome christ shoulde haue improperly drawen vnto himselfe muste alwayes noted kingdome god erected person dauid established true messias vnto ende worlde annoynting time past shadowe vvhereby gathered begunne dauid paterne figure christe nowe let v returne woordes psalme scribe priestes thoughte incredible christe shoulde reiected ruler church proueth psalme wonderful power god shoulde bee placed throane menne figured long dauid whome god tooke reiected mighty power world might declare shew would woorke length christ prophet boroweth metaphore building churche holy house god christ vpon builded called corner stone stone beareth whole weight building thys similitude holdeth square euery side man sifte euery particuler poynt belongeth christe agreeth well saluation church lieth vppon vpholdeth estate prophet also followed phrase maner speakinge especially isaias 28 16 daniel isaias alludeth neare vnto place bringeth god speaking thus beholde lay syon foundation stone stone tried pretious whereat bothe house israel shall stumble newe testament maner speache often founde therefore summe kingdome god shoulde builded vppon stone chiefe builder themselues shoulde caste away rubbishe nothing woorth meaning messias foundation saluation church shoulde chosen common voyces menne chiefe ruler whome care buildinge committed shoulde god woulde woonderfully exalte secreate vnhoped power heere two thinges v beholde god least endeuours wicked whyche ryse vppe hinder buildinge churche shoulde trouble v hee admonysheth v shoulde come passe hee declareth withall erection kingdome christe soeuer menne shall labour contrary power shall preuaile must diligently obserue bothe wonderfull authour saluation shoulde reiected straungers houshold foolish people gouernours themselues hadde gouernance church hand suche outragious fury menne faith must nourished supported least shoulde faint fall away straungenesse matter nowe vnderstande howe profitable forewarning whiche putteth mindes godly feare mighte otherwise conceiue sorowfull sighte nothinge straunge member shoulde rise heade husbandmenne lorde counsellours kinge chiefe builder cast away foundation building also efficacie clause god declareth wicked shall preuaile nothing reiecting christe shall haue dignity whole perfect namely faithfull trusting promisse might safely fort laugh ouerthwart pride men reiecting christ haue done al may yet christ spite holde place father hath giuen hym thoughe seeme haue honour power shall forceably sette themselues yet notwithstanding stand estate yeelde nothing vnto wicked contempt shorte power god shall preuaile shalbe stone tried precious shall vpholde church kingdome temple god called heade stone corner hee onely parte foundation appeareth place churche firmelye builded vppon alone simple meaninge prophet chiefe stay building doe curiously discourse woorde corner christe placed corner might ioyne togither two diuers walles namely gentile iewes yet iudgement dauid hadde farther respecte corner stone vpholdeth chief weight building nowe demaunded spirite call chiefe builder doe onely seeke ruine destruction church god paul doeth therefore glory good maister builder 1 cor 3 11 builded church vppon christ alone answeare easie thoughe vnfaithfully discharge charge committed vnto yet graunted title respect callinge deceiuers haue often name prophet called shepherd wolues deuoure flocke neither doe gette much honour shame title roote vppe foundation churche god appoynted chiefe buildinge heereof profitable lesson gathered notwithstanding lawfull calling may wicked vngodly ennemies christ minister euident priesthoode lawe ordained god lorde committed authority gouerning churche leuites doe therefore faithfully discharge office become godly deny christ obey nowe let pope goe horned bishop let boast shoulde beleeued thing supply place shepheardes wee shoulde graunte rightly called gouernment church yet vaine chalenge vnto themselues title prelate church haue much title callinge whole order church ouerthrowne might lift vppe themselues tyranny graunt doe rightly chalenge ordinarie iurisdiction yet ouerthrowe holy house god accounted maister builder name doeth alwayes fall whome gouernment church committed reiecte christe vnder lawe many godly priest also kingdome christ pastours laboured diligently faithfully building church yet must needes fulfilled behooueth v wisely discerne betweene holy ghost hath purposely forewarned v least man shoulde hee deceiued vaine title dignity calling lordes common capacitie man could conceiue pastours church themselues shoulde reiect sonne god prince prophet calleth backe secreat councell god thoughe cannot conceiue vnderstanding yet may beholde wonder therefore must knowe cutte occasion questioning expresly forbidden man esteeme measure nature kingdome christ reason flesh simplicity wonderful prophet exhorteth v reuerence wil abase capacity vnderstanding thou wilt allowe kingdome christ seemeth probable thee holy ghost sayth mystery worthy great admiration hidde eye menne therefore ofte mention beginning restitution state whole preseruation churche let v remember consult sens giue honor power god haue secreat woorke admiration also set downe secreat opposition betweene god men onely commaunded imbrace wonderful maner gouerninge church worke god also called back fonde estimation men often darkeneth glory god prophet haue sayd though men excell glorious title yet doth ouerthwartly shall oppose thē god wherby diuelish wickednesse papistes confuted whiche doubteth preferre determination church woord god whereof doeth aucthority woorde god depende according opinion pleasure men authority left vnto god receiueth allowance churche spirite teacheth v farre otherwyse place namely assoone maiestie god shal appeare world keepe silence 43 therefore say vnto christ directed speache thus farre guids gouernors people speaketh likewise people themselues good cause assisted holpe priestes scribe hinder grace god priestes beginner mischiefe sinnes people hadde already deserued haue corrupt degenerate pastours shorte whole bodye bent like malice resiste god cause christ pronounced horrible vengeance god generally priestes puft vppe authoritye rest people proude theyr pretensed title adoption nowe christe declareth god bounde vnto shall therefore come passe honour haue made themselues vnwoorthy shall bestowed otherwhere spoken wrytten sake god shall chuse v people wee become wanton vaine wicked confidence slesh lette v againe endeuour shewe selues suche child towardes requireth spared naturall braunches shal become grafted rom 11 21 iewes thought kingdom god belonged vnto right inheritance therefore without care became hardened sinnes vve nature presently succede place therfore much lesse tied vnto v except r • ted true godlines ought afraid christ sayth shall depriued kingdome god shall prophane perpetuitie noted may comfort godly christe doeth declare woordes thoughe wicked doe beate downe worshippe god amongst yet shall bring passe name christe shoulde abolished true religion shoulde pearish▪ god whose hande endes earth wil finde seat dwelling plate kingdome thy • moreouer learned place gospel therefore preached shuld lie barren idle might fructifie 44 vvhosoeuer shall fall stone christe doeth fully confirme former sentence loseth wāteth thing wicked doe reiecte though obstinacy hard stone yron yet breake owne hardnesse glory shall appeare destruction sawe wonderful vntowardnesse iewes therefore necessary vengeance shoulde order seuerely pronounced least pearish security doctrine doeth partly teache v tender flexible heart quietly deliuer selues tamed christe partly also confirmeth ouerthwart furious violence wicked whome hee lengthe moste fearefully destroy sayde fall vppon christ thrust ouerthrowe clinie vppe higher theyr madnesse doeth cary farre foorth endeuour pull christ downe high declareth onely preuaile conflicte themselues shall broken piece whereas shal lift vp thēselues proudly telleth shall bring thing passe namely shalbe ground piece vnder stone haue boldly thrust 45 perceiued spake euangelistes declare little christ profited among least shoulde marueile doctrine gospell doeth winne menne day obey let v also learne cannot otherwise threates make wicked madde god sealeth woorde heart hee also woundeth wicked conscience hotte yron vvhereby commeth passe vngodlinesse doeth burne shew self therfore must pray vnto bring v willing feare least naked feare vengeance shuld exasperate v feare people restraineth lay hand vppon christ let v know god hadde brideled vvhereby smal comfort doeth also come faithfull heare shielded hande god escape iawes death math 22 marke 12 luke 20 15 went pharisies tooke counsell howe might tangle talke 16 sent vnto
