answeare held peace vvhē pharisies tried al way christ last thought best way destroy could deliuer gouernour seditious person one sought innouations ther time great question amongst iewes cōcerning tribute haue sene wher romanes trā slated themselues tribute god law moses cōmanded paid iewes place offēded thought hainous offence borne prophane men shoulde pull maner thēselues right appertained god paying tribute appoynted law witnes adoption thought themselues spoiled honour due porer man bolder hope pouerty raise stirres tumult therefore pharisies deuise subtelty catch christ ensnare himselfe way soeuer shuld answer shuld deny pay shuld guilty sedition shuld graunt shuld paid right shuld accounted enemye owne nation betraier liberty countrey speciall purpose alienate people catching euangelistes doe note thinke haue laid snare euerye side christe could escape professed enemy knewe therefore suspected suborned theyr disciple mat reporteth luke calleth spy deceitful person shuld fain thēselues righteous shuld pretend simple honest desire learne faining righteous generally takē restrained present cause shuld haue ben admitted vnder pretence sincere affection desire learne ioyne herodians greater fauour romane empire wherby apter lay accusation charge woorth labour note sharpe dissention amongst thēselues could yet agree togither destroy christ great hatred vvee haue shewed maner sect herode half iew degenerate adoulterous professour law whosoeuer woulde kepe lawe exactly euery poynt condemned prophane kinde worshipping flatterer would cast colour vppon corrupt doctrine besides sectes also sprung vp time courtly religion 16 master wee knowe righteousnesse dissemble flatteringly crouch vnto christ desirous learne pretend godly seme also wel perswaded doctrine spoken heart ben sincere dealing wordes may definition gathered true faithful teacher fain christ say true teacheth way god faithful interpreater god truthe without corruption way god opposed inuentions men forraine straunge doctrine truthe sette ambition couetousnesse wicked affection doe vsually corrupte pure manner teachinge therefore wee muste accounte lawful teacher whyche bryngeth deuices menne departeth pure woorde god deliuereth hande hath learned mouth sincere mind doe good applyeth doctrine benefit saluation people corrupteth corruption concerninge last clause paule 2 cor 2 17 saying hath made merchā dise word god declareth verye expert openlye ouerthrow true doctrine neither notorious wicked doctrine yet wil defile corrupt purity doctrine eyther ambitious couetous chaungeable hether thether desire fleshe therefore compareth vinteners mixer corrupt sincere vse word god also worthy noted whiche hypocrite adde withall christ taught truelye hee regarded person menne nothing withdraweth teacher faythful pure dispensing hauing respect vnto men impossible manne shoulde serue god truely desireth please menne gala 1 10 menne must regarded shuld curry fauour flattering short may sincere necessary auoyde acception person darkeneth light peruerteth iust iudgment god dooth often commaunde lawe deuteronomy 1 16 17 16 19 experience dooth also declare therefore christ iohn 7 24 compareth togeather iudgement according appearance righteous iudgment thing contrary one 18 iesus perceiued wickednes vsed wordes differed nothing sincerest disciple therfore could christ know spirit searcher heartes man coniecture could smell subtilty hee god pearced heartes flattery faigned holynesse vaine couer therefore gaue aunswere shewed deitie reuealing secret malice sith wicked doe dayly lay like snare v inwarde malice lyeth hidde v must pray christ would giue v spirit discretion would bestow free gift vpon v nature right necessary haue wisdome appeareth take heede snare wicked wee shall make doctrine god subiect slaunders also commaundement christe shew money though seemeth first bee moment yet sufficient break snare ouerthrow deuises therein gaue plaine graunt obedience christ needed commaund new thing image caesar vpon money therefore authority gouernment romaine commonly allowed vvhereby appeared iewes hadde nowe theyr owne accorde layde lawe payinge trybute vppon themselues hadde graunted power sworde vnto romaine coulde dispute tribute alone question dependeth whole gouernment common wealth 21 giue vnto caesar thing caesar christ declareth question made matter money declared subiection nation haue sayde thinke absurd pay tribute subiect romane empyre money pledge mutuall fellowshippe dealing betweene menne declareth caesar raigneth ouer owne secrete allowaunce declareth lyberty pretend lost taken away christes aunswere indifferent deliuereth whole doctrine question proposed plaine difference put betweene spirituall politike gouernment teacheth v outward obedience hindereth v wee may free conscience serue god purpose christe confute errour thought could people god except set free yoake humane authoritie paule also doth diligently apply himselfe matter leaste thinke could serue god alone shoulde obey lawes menne pay tribute submit neckes beare burden summe hee declareth lawe god broken worshippe hindered obedience iewes outwarde polytike gouernement romanes seemeth also reproue theyr hypocrisie carelesly suffred worshippe god defiled manye wayes nay defrauded god wickedly power pretended onely great zeale matter nothing hee shoulde haue sayde carefull least god lose honour shoulde paye tribute romanes rather applye selues yeelde worshippe god requireth also giue vnto men belongeth seemeth fitte diuision speake properly doe duety menne thereby yeelde obedience god christ framing speach capacitie menne thought sufficient distinguish spirituall kingdom god politike order state present life vvherefore difference must alwaies remembred lorde wil onely lawgiuer gouernment soules rule order worshipping must fetched word wee must onelye rest sincere worshippe described power sworde lawes iudgementes hynderaunce worshippe god may remayne perfect amongst v doctrine reacheth farther euery manne according calling may discharge duetie menne child parentes seruauntes may submitte themselues willinglye maisters may duetifull obedient others according lawe charitie god may alwayes haue chiefe gouernment respect let whatsoeuer due vnto men brought vnder holden second degree menne saye meaning therefore sith whosoeuer doe weaken politike estate rebelles god obedience towardes prince magistrate must alwayes ioyned worshippe feare god againe prince chalenge thing themselues belongeth god bee obeyed may good conscience 22 • ruailed also appeareth god turneth wicked endeuours enemy contrary end dooth onely delude hope make frustrate also driueth awaye shame somtime shall fall though wicked ouercome yet cease murmurre though frowardnesse wyll tamed many battailes soeuer doe make againste word god many victory hand hee may tryumph ouer head satan answere speciall purpose christ set forth owne glory compelleth depart shame math 22 mark 12 luk 20 23 daye saduces came hym say resurrection asked 24 saying maister moses said man dye hauinge child let brother mary wife raise vppe seede vnto brother 25 v seauen brother first married wife deceased hauing issue left wife vnto brother 26 likewise also seconde thirde vnto seauenth 27 last woman died also 28 therfore resurrection whose wife shal seauen al 29 iesus answered said vnto ye deceiued knowing scripture power god 30 resurrection neither marye wiues wiues beestowed marriage angel god heauen 31 cōcerning rerection dead haue ye read spoken vnto god saying 32 god abraham god isaac god iacob god god dead liuing 33 people heard astenyed doctrine 18 came saduces vnto saye resurrection asked saying 19 maister moses wrote vnto v anye man brother die leaue wife leaue child brother shoulde take wife rayse vp seed vnto brother 20 seauen brother first tooke wife hee dyed left issue 21 second took died neither yet leaue issue third likewise 22 seauen hadde left issue last wife died also 23 resurrection shall ryse againe whose wife shall seauen wife 24 iesus aunswered saide vnto yee therefore deceiued ye know scripture neither power god 25 shal rise againe dead neyther men mary wiues maried aungels heauen 26 touchinge dead shal rise haue ye read booke moses howe bushe god spake vnto saying god abraham god isaac god iacob 27 hee god dead lyuing yee therefore greatly deceiued 27 came certeine saduces deny resurrection asked 28 sayinge mayster moses wrote vnto v anye man brother dye hauing wife hee die without child brother shoulde take wife raise vppe seede vnto brother 29 seauen brother first tooke wife died without child 30 seconde tooke wife▪ died chidlesse 31 third tooke likewise seauen died left child 32 last woman died also 33 therefore resurrection whose wife shall shee bee seauen hadde wife 34 iesus aunswered said vnto child world marrie wiues married 35 shall bee counted worthye enioye worlde resurrection dead neither marrye wyues neither married▪ 36 dye asmuch equall vnto aungels sonnes god since child resurrection 37 dead shal rise againe euen moses shewed besides bushe hee sayd lord god abraham god isaac god iacob 38 hee god dead liue lyue vnto 39 certeine pharises aunswered sayde mayster thou haste well sayde 40 durste aske thing heere see sathan gathereth wicked together ouerthrow trueth god men thinges coulde agree amongst themselues though great dissention betweene two • ectes yet conspire together christe pharises displeased theyr doctrine oppugned person christ day see al bandes satan though otherwise others yet ryse al place christ papistes beare great hatred gospell doe gladly nourish epicure libertine suche monster may haue helpe ouerthrowe gospell summe see came diuers fortes assault christ came passe menne generally hated lyght sounde doctrine saduces moue question christ vnder colour absurditie might eyther drawe hym errour hee shoulde dissente myght dyffame bringe contempte amongste rude vnlearned multitude maye bee woonte trouble pharises obiection lay snare christ 23 vvhich say resurrection haue shewed beginning saduces onely deny last resurrection slesh also immortalitye soule luke declareth act 29 8 truely doctrine scripture wel considered without hopeof resurrection life soule shall seeme bee dreame god doth say soules liue death enioy present glory blessednes suspendeth theyr hope vnto latter day graunt phylosophers ignoraunt resurrection flesh spak many thing immortall essence soule speake fondlye estate life come theyr writinges purpose sith scripture saieth spirituall lyfe dependeth hope resurrection soules separated bodyes haue respect whosoeuer denyeth resurrection doth also deny immortalyty soules seene horryble confusion iewish church chiefe maisters theyr relygion tooke awaye hope lyfe come death difference betweene men beastes deny holy righteous lyfe neither prophane account worship god needelesse matter rather acknowledged god iudge world al thing appertaining man gouerned prouidence sith tyed aswell reward godlye paynes due wicked present life though sayd truely euery manne handled equally according desart yet preposterous shutte vp promise god narow corner experyence doth euidently declare folly grosse sith euident rewarde layde vp good deferd lyfe punishmentes powred vppon wicked world short cannot imagined thing absurde fantasie menne created image god perish like beastes howe vile monstrous matter opinion least life come remained euery amongst prophane blynde idolater gentile seede godlynes shoulde abolished amongst iewes peculyar people god vvhat say saw holy father made haste heauenlye life couenaunte god made spirituall eternall muste blinde blockes coulde see cleare light first iust rewarde rente church god sectes god maner reuenged wicked contempt doctrine 24 mayster moses sayde sith might haue sufficed haue proposed matter simply end made preface namelye doe craftily pretend moses name proue mariages lawefull whiche made pleasure menne commaundement ordinaunce god himselfe also necessarye god himselfe agree himselfe therefore snare god time come gather faithfull kingdome restore vnto giuen worlde therefore shall become womanne god giuen seauen men godlesse heretikes doe frame cauils wherwith could deforme true doctrine godlynesse make seruauntes christ ashamed yea papistes endeuoring entrappe v past shame doe openly scorne god word therefore without cause paule tit 1 9 would haue doctor furnished weapon wherewith may driue backe enemy truth concerning law wherein god commaundeth next kinsman bloud succeede dead marriage first die without child reason woman married family receiue seede therof must vnderstoode naturall brother cosine like incest marry within degree forbidden law 29 yee deceiued knowing scripture though christ speaketh saduces yet reproofe doth generally belong deuisers false doctrine sith god doth plainely shew himselfe vnto v scripture ignaraunce fountaine cause errours small comfort godly shalbe safe daunger errour long humble modest desire learne shall seeke scripture right true christes ioyning power god word referred circumstaunce present matter resurrection far exceedeth capacitie mannes vnderstanding wil incredible vnto v vntyll mindes behold great power god able subdue thinges himselfe paule teacheth phylippians 3 11 necessary sadduces deceiued falslye measure glorye heauenly lyfe presente estate yet meane season doe wee teache doe iudge speake ryghtlye wyselye misteries kyngdome heauen whiche doe ioyne power god togeather scripture 30 aungelles god hee meaneth chyldren god shalbe rysen thinges lyke vnto angelles farre shall free infirmitie presente lyfe shoulde saye subiecte thinges transitory corrupt life hath neede luke dooth plainely set forth reason similitude could die againe therefore bring forth fruite vpon earth speaketh faythful onely question reprobate demaunded hee saith shall bee son god shalbe child resurrection sith lord doth vouchsafe honour faithfull one though shutte vp pryson frayle body bee heires eternall lyfe god shoulde acknowledge v nowe child aunswere grafted bodye christe fayth god adopteth v child spirit witnesse seale marke pledge adoption hope hereof wee may freely cry abba father rom 8 15 gal 4 6 though wee knowe wee sonnes god yet doth yet appeare shall vntill trasfigured see glory wee effect accounted sonnes though regenerate spirite god yet lyfe hidde yet manifestation shall make true perfect difference betweene v straungers sense adoption deferd paule rom 8 13 last daye lv 37 dead shall rise againe christe confuted absurdity obiected confirmeth doctrine last resurrection testimonie scripture wee muste keepe order enemy trueth hauing quarels answered may vnderstand striue word god vntill ouercome testimony scripture may alwaies murmurre grudge christ citeth place moses beecause doe sadduces gaue small credit prophetes accounted better booke ecclesiasticus hystory machabes also seeing alleadged moses rather turne backe againe vpon obiect one prophetes hee purpose gather al place scripture serued purpose see apostle lyke manner alwayes vse testimony serued matter yet christ vnaduisedlye make choise place rest chose great iudgement though first sight seemeth hard iewes especially account remember sith declareth lord therefore redeeme child abraham god saieth came thither helpe afflicted people hee addeth withall acknowledged people respecte adoption couenaunt made braham howe commeth passe god haue regard rather dead liue gaue greatest honour father whome made couenaunt excellent honourable dead relation doth euidently set forth matter also father without childrē king without people lord cannot properly called god lyuing christ doth reasō much commō maner phrase speach promise included wordes lord dooth offer himselfe condition bee god might haue v againe people one thinge sufficient strengthen hope ful perfect blessednes hence came saying church set downe prophet haba 1 12 thou art god old shall dye therefore promiseth saue whose god saieth beeing spoken abraham isaac iacob death followeth remaineth hope life euen dead man obiect soules maye lyue though bodyes rise againe▪ aunswered litle beefore two ioyned togeather beecause soules beeinge yet estate doe aspyre enheritaunce layde vppe 38 liue vnto manner speach diuerslye vsed scripture christ meaneth faythfull doe lyue heauen god passe world paule ro 6 10 saieth christ receiued heauenly glory liueth god exempted infirmity trouble transitory lyfe christ doth purposely declare heere wee must iudge life godly sense flesh bloude beecause hydden secrete custodye god almost like vnto dead wāder world much lesse doth appeare anye token life death body god faithful beyond capacity men hee keepe aliue 39 certeine pharises aunswered euident malitiously bent power god confession wrested pharises though wished christe myght haue beene ouercome haue beene put silence shame yet saw themselues armed aunswere contrarye faction ambition causeth triumph victory gotten may also enuy would haue christ ouercome saduces god wonderfull prouidence commeth passe euen greatest enemy subscribe doctrine boldnes also brydeled onely saw christ prepared withstand assaultes beecause feared shoulde haue foyle shame oft receiued ashamed silence graunted victory credit encreased much amongst people matthewes wordes wondred doctrine noted doctrine godlynes time corrupted many corrupt colde commentary might well bee accounted wonder doctrine resurrection readily aptly proued law mat 22 mark 12 luk 10 34 pharises hadde heard putte saduces silence assembled togeather 35 seconde like vnto thou shalte loue thy neighbour thy selfe 40 two commandements hangeth whole lawe prophet 28 came one scribe heard thē disputing together perceiuing answered well asked first 31 second like shalt loue thy neighbour thy selfe none commaundement greater 32 scribe saide vnto well maister thou hast saide trueth one god none 33 loue hearte vnderstanding soule al strength loue neighbour burnt offrings sacrifice 34 iesus sawe answered discretely hee said vnto thou art far kingdom god man durst ask question 25 beholde certeine expounder lawe stoode vp tempted sayinge maister shall doe enherite eternall lyfe 26 sayde vnto written lawe readest thou 27 aunswered sayd thou shalt loue thy lord god al thine heart thy soule thy strength thy thought thy neighbour thy selfe 28 hee said vnto thou hast answered right thou shalt liue 29 willing iustifie self said vnto iesus neighbour 30 iesus aunswered said certeine man went downe ierusalem iericho fell amonge theeues robbed raiment wounded departed leauing half dead 31 chaunce came certein priest way hee saw hee passed side 32▪ likewise also leuit hee come neere place went looked passed side 33 certeine samaritan iourneied came neere vnto him▪ saw compassion 34 went bound vp woundes powred oyle wine putte beast brought inne made prouision 35 morowe departed hee tooke two penny gaue host said vnto take care whatsoeuer thou spendest come againe wil recompence thee 36 vvhich three thinkest thou neighbour vnto yt fel amōg theeues 37 said shewed mercy thē said iesus goe doe thou likewise though thinges matthew 22 chapter marke 12 doe reporte haue onely something like hystory one yet haue chosen set place matthew marke doe say last question wherewith lord tempted luke maketh mention matter seemeth omit purpose hadde reported yet doe saye one hystory luke hath thinges diuerse two agree scribe moued question tempt christe hee matthew mark make report length departeth well affected yeeldeth christes aunswere sheweth token mild spirit apt taught note also christ likewise saith far kingdome heauen luke bringeth obstinate man swelled pride whome appeareth token repentaunce may sayde without absurditie question true righteousnesse obseruation lawe rule good lyfe ofte moued christ whether luke reporteth place whether pretermitted question former history sufficiēt respect doctrine likenesse doctrine seemeth require confer three euangelists together must bee considered occasion moued scribe aske question christ interpreter law offended doctrine gospel thought authoritie moses thereby diminished hee much zeale law hee tooke disdainefully hys maister lose honour therefore hee demaundeth christe whether would professe thing perfecte lawe though hee vttereth wordes yet captious question tendeth bring christ hated people mathew marke doe attribute subtiltie one man onely teach matter done agreement one chosen whole company seemed excell reste witte learning luke also doth somewhat differ matthewe marke manner mouing question scribe demaundeth men doe attaine eternall life two greatest commaundement law ye • one end hee assaulteth christ subtilly hee could draw thing hys mouth differed law might shake vp apostata aucthour wicked backsliding lv 26 vvhat written law heareth another maner aunswere christ looked christe shewed rule holy righteous life thē deliuered law moses chiefe perfection righteousnesse contayned vnder perfect loue god neighbour yet muste noted christ spake meanes obtaine saluation according question moued doth plainely teach doth otherwhere men shoulde come eternall lyfe shoulde liue might accounted righteous god euident law teacheth men howe shoulde frame theyr lyfe purchase owne saluation god law nothing condemn therfore called doctrine death saide encrease transgression rom 7 13 fault doctrine v impossible v performe commaundeth therefore though manne iustified law yet law selfe containeth chiefe righteousnesse doth deceitfully promise saluation follow man doth fullye obserue whatsoeuer commaundeth neyther manner teaching seeme absurd v god first require righteousnes workes shoulde offer freelye without good workes necessarye men▪ acknowledge theyr owne iust damnation might driuen flye mercy god therfore paule dooth compare righteousness togeather rom 10 5 might know god iustifieth v freelye beecause haue righteousnesse owne christ applyed himselfe aunswere lawyer respect manner question mooued demaunded whence seeke saluation work attained mat 38 thou shalt loue lorde marke setteth downe preface saieth god israel lord word god would sette forth authority law two wayes sharpe spurre stirre v vp worship god wee certeinly perswaded worshippe true maker heauen earth doubting dooth naturallye make v slouthfull dooth sweetely allure v loue hee adopteth v hys free grace people therefore least iewes afrayde commonly vseth thinges doubtfull heare true onely god prescribeth rule liue least distrust draw backe god commeth familiarly commendeth free couenaunt vnto yet notwithstanding doubted god would make himselfe known idolles least iewes drawne away shuld keepe themselues true worshyppe alone nowe vncerteinety canne hynder miserable idolater following loue madde heate excuse shall hearer law haue become slouthfull god hath reuealed himselfe vnto followeth briefe summe lawe moses also setteth downe lawe deuided table first commaundeth worship god seconde charitie moses gathered summe well wisely iewes might knowe god required euerye commaundementes though meete god shoulde bee beloued farre otherwise menne yet without cause worshyppe honour god shoulde require v loue meanes declareth worshyppe pleaseth done free wil yeelde himselfe ryght true obedience god loueth furthermore wicked corrupt affection fleshe withdraw v frō right course moses declareth lyfe shal thē well brought order loue god shall possesse sens let v therefore learne loue god beginning godlynes god refuseth al obedience mē cōmeth constraynte worshipped wyllingly freely yet let v learne vnder loue god noted reuerence due vnto moses addeth minde onelye maketh mention hearte soule strength though partition foure partes fuller yet altereth sense moses would summarilye declare god beloued perfectlye power soeuer men imployed waye sufficient adde strength soule hart leaue part v voyd without loue god also know brewes somtime note mind word heart especially ioyned word soule labour much shew minde doth differ hearte aswell place matthew except signifieth higher seate reason whence counselles thoughtes proceede short summe appeareth god giuing lawe commaundementes respecteth men doe doe cannot perfect loue god reigne rule infirmitie flesh know sens minde bent vanitie lastly gather hereby god doth stay vpon outwarde shew work doth especiallye require inwarde affection good fruit may grow good roote 39 second like placeth loue charity amongst men second place beecause worshippe god firste order saieth commaundement louing neighbour like first dependeth sith euerye manne giuen selfe loue true charitie towardes neighbour cannot founde anye loue god reigneth loue wherewith child world doe loue one another bee bought solde euery manne careth owne profite againe impossible loue god shoulde reigne brotherlye loue amongste menne spring also moses commaundeth v loue neighbour selues hee woulde set loue selues first euerye manne might loue himselfe firste neighbour sorbonicall sophisters doe cauill ruled inferiour rule sith wee giuen much selues moses reproouing faulte sette neighbour equall degree v hee forbid euerye man neglecting others haue care himselfe charitie ioyneth one body correcting selfe loue deuideth men asunder hee bringeth backe common societie mutuall embraceing one another vvhereby gather paule doth without cause call band perfection coloss 3 14 fulfilling law roman 13 10 commaundementes second table referred lv 28 doe thou obseruation therefore hee saieth wee cannot lyue beecause weake fleshe two doe • gree well togeather lawe teacheth howe menne shall bee iustified workes manne shal iustified workes beecause want doctrine lawe men yet christes purpose take awaye obiection knew rude vnlearned people murmured shuld goe ouerthrowe lawe perpetuall rule righteousnesse 29 willing iustifie himselfe question might seeme serue nothing iustifying man remember said men hipocrisie found secōd table faigne themselues great seruers god doe openly deale vncharitably towardes neighbour thereby may easily gathered pharise vsed shift couered vnder false cloake colour holines hee might brought foorth light therefore hee perceiueth examination charitie would make least shuld foūd transgressour law hee seeketh starting hoales name neighbour first see scribe herein corrupted law accounted none others neighbour worthy thereof generall rule receiued amongst lawfull hate enemy one meanes hipocrits vsed cleare themselues guiltines draw back much could least life shuld brought iudged law 30 iesus aunswered christe might haue taught simply name neighbour doth generally belong euerye manne beecause mankinde ioyned knitte togeather certeine holy bande fellowshippe surely lord set downe name lawe cause might gently allure v loue one another commaundement beene playner thus loue euery man thy selfe men blinded owne pride euery man lyketh wel himselfe scarse thinketh others worthy lyke estate withdraweth dueties lorde therefore purpose calleth neighbour affinity self might ioyne together one another therefore man may beecome neighbour sufficeth hee man power blotte nature common purpose christ drawe aunswere pharisee hee myght thereby condemne himselfe sith maisterly determination taken place amongst man neighbour hee friend christe precisely asked question one word would neuer haue graunted menne comprehended vnder name neighbour vrgeth confesse similitude bringeth forth summe greatest straunger neighbour beecause god hath tyed men togeather euery shoulde helpe others yet firste hee doth properly rebuke iewes priestes beecause boasted themselues bee sonnes one father separate nation priueledge adoption might god holye inheritaunce yet despysed eache barbarous beastly contempt neighbourhood betweene doubted christe describeth cruell neglect charitie whereof guiltie sayde chiefe confuted opinion condition adam fall described vnder figure wounded manne vvhereof inferre power doe well altogeather quenched beecause sayde onely hee halfe dead though christes purpose speake place corruption mannes nature shewe howe deadly curable wound sathan gaue adam though hee sayde plainelye without figure iohn 5 25 menne dead hee maketh aliue voice allegory hath colour yet much accepted restore health presently committeth v churche inne keeper bee healed litle litle graunte euerye plausible scripture must bee reuerenced take libertie thus alter sense manifest euery man imagination deuised curious men againste christes minde mat 40 two commaundementes nowe returne matthew christe saieth lawe prophetes dependeth vppon two commaundementes would restraine whole doctrine scripture whatsoeuer commaunded anye rule holye righteous lyfe • houlde referred two heades christe dooth generallye declare lawe prophetes doe containe speach hee saieth nothinge else requyred lawe prophetes euery manne loue god neighbour hee shoulde haue sayde summe godlye vpright lyfe contayned included worshippe god loue men paule saieth roman 13 10 loue fulfillinge lawe vvherefore certeine ignoraunt people doe wickedly snatch saying christe wee shoulde search law prophetes difference betweene promise commaundementes christ doth generallye declare place must learned word god according circumstaunce matter sheweth end commaundementes directed yet free remission sinnes whereby wee reconciled god hope calling vppon god marke enheritaunce come partes fayth though haue highest place law doe depende vppon two commaundementes one thing demaunde due another thing offer wee want mark noteth thing wordes none commaundement greater mar 32 vvell mayster thou hast sayde trueth onelye mark maketh mention scribe humbled worthy bee noted malitiously deceitfully assaulted christe onely silence giue place trueth hee subscribeth christe openly freely see hee one sorte enemy whose obstinacie incurable though shoulde ouercome hundred tymes yet doe cease sette themselues trueth euery waye bee gathered aunswere christ precisely comprehend rule lyfe two word onely occasion giuen enueighed feigned counterfeit holynesse scribe giuing themselues outward ceremony made account almost spirituall worship god▪ great reckoning charity amongst thogh scribe corruption yet commeth sometymes passe hee conceiued seede true knowledge lawe laye hydde smothered heart reason heereof hee yeeldeth suffereth himselfe reclaymed corrupt course yet seemeth fall well sacrifice parte worshippe god apperteine firste table law lesse esteemed charity towardes menne aunswer though worshippe god farre excellent pretious dueties ryghteous lyfe yet outwarde exercise themselues value ouerthrowe charitie wee knowe charitie pleaseth god simplye selfe hee doth regarde allowe sacrifice ende note hee speaketh heere naked vaine sacrifice christ dooth oppose faygned kynde holynesse againste true sincere honestye doctrine found also diuerse place prophet hypocrite might know sacrifice value offred spirite trueth god pleased sacrifice beastes charitie neglected 34 iesus sawe vncerteine whether scrybe profitte anye afterwardes beecause hee sheweth himselfe apt taught christ reached hande forth vnto teacheth v example helpe whome appeareth beeginning eyther readinesse taught right vnderstanding seemeth christ said scribe farre kyngdome heauen two cause namely would yeeld duety wisely discerne outward profession worship god necessary dueties neighbourhood christe tolde hee farre kingdome god much praise exhort goe forwarde person encourageth v al entred right way shuld goe cheerefullier forward wordes also taught many yet errour doe yet closed eye come waye meanes prepared runne race lord tyme shall serue euangelistes doe saye mouthes aduersaries stopt durste tempte christ must taken ceased left obstinate frowardnes fretted inwardly wilde beastes vse doe shutte vp caues fierce horse doe byte vppon brydle shewed themselues hard harted rebellion vanquished notable triumph christ get vpon victory must little encourage v neuer bee amased defending trueth sure successe perswasion deepely setled heart menne amongst iewes would neuer drawen perswasion beleue shoulde haue nature man therefore sathan suffered acknowledge christe man sonne dauid haue tempted vaine ouerthrow article faith worse spoyled godheade shoulde bee one sonnes adam meanes hope eternall life come spirituall righteousnesse abolished since christe came worlde heritikes haue endeuoured many engine snare ouerthrowe sometime manhoode sometime godheade least hee shoulde haue full power saue v least shoulde haue familiar accesse vnto hym sith hower death hand lorde himselfe would make godheade knowen godly might without feare put confidence man neither lawfull glory hope saued vnderstand purpose shewed himselfe sonne god much owne sake might establish faith heauenly power infirmity fleshe wherein came neare v maketh v bolde approche neare vnto onely shoulde eye would rather fill v feare desperation make v good hope yet noted scribe reprehended taught christ shoulde sonne dauid imagined christ meere manne shoulde come heauen take vpon nature person man neither doeth lord speake woordes expresly himselfe simply sheweth scribe wicked errour loked redemer earth progenie man thoughe olde opinion amongst yet gather mathew asked people thought 43 howe doeth dauid spirite saying christe dauid spake spirit forceable vehement speache opposeth prophesie thing come testimony thing present saying preuenteth cauill wherewith iewes doe flee away day say kingdom dauid commended commendation god appoynted raigne would rise furious endeuours ennemies hee sayeth shall preuaile nothinge againste god least scribe obiecte thing christ sayeth psalme made spoken person dauid spoken spirite prophesie describing kingdom christ come also easie prooued text word read place neither agree vnto dauid earthly king dauid place doth bring king adorned new priesthoode whereby necessary olde shadowes law shoulde abrogated nowe seene proueth christ greater excellency could begotten seede dauid onely namely dauid king heade people calleth lord vvhereof followeth somwhat man yet reason seemeth weake cold may excepted hee gaue p • alme people song hauing respect persō gaue christ authority ouer others doe take exception contrary hee one mēbers church nothing vnlikely would depriue himselfe common doctrine commandeth child god reioyce one voice shuld safe vnder defence heauenly victorious king separate body church coulde pertaker saluation promised christ speach kingdom christ extend farre dauid nowe neither exempt himselfe subiection withall must fal away hope eternall saluation therfore sith better thing could befall vnto dauid comprehended within compasse churche made psalme aswel rest people sum title christ appoynted chiefe king raigne ouer faithful neither may exception admitted redemer made gouernour churche men brought one order vvherefore douted dauid would submit gouernment might accounted amongst people god heere ariseth question coulde god haue raised vp man might haue made redeemer might haue ben dauids lord though sonne substantiall name god set downe adenai oftentimes giuen also men answer christe taketh graunted exempted number men exalted degre honor shuld chief head church mee • e man also endued maiesty god eternall god chalengeth oth alone euery knee shuld bow isa 45 23 42 8 also sweareth wil giue glory another ro 14 11 paul except also god manifested flesh graunt doeth heere expresly woorde expresse diuine power maye easily bee gathered hee god placed aboue creature 44 lorde said lorde holy ghost beginneth triumphant inuiolable decree god endeuours contrary therfore meaning though men become mad yet soeuer dare attempt ouerthrow kingdom christ shalbe vaine standeth vpon pleasure men erected god stād euer therfore markettes highest seates synagogue chiefe roumes feastes 1 iesus spake multitude profitable admonition amongst many dissentions grudging contention amongest troubled confused estate thing desolation right lawfull gouernment yet authority woord god shoulde remaine safe ende bent purpose christe least people offended sinnes scribe shoulde cast regarde reuerence law know readily mennes mindes bent loath despise especially life pastours dissolute men commonly fall wantonnesse theyr example graunt doe freely also nay somewhat woorse falleth dissentions greater part shaking yoake powre foorth lustes breake forth extreme contempt furthermore time scribe euen enflamed wyth couetousnesse swelled ambition extortiōs knowne fearful cruelty corruption liues great seemed haue conspired ouerthrowe lawe moreouer peruerted right naturall sense lawe corrupt commentary christe compelled sharply contende wyth caried wonderfull madnesse quenche light truthe therefore feared least many shoulde growe contempt godlinesse partly reason corruption partly tumultuous contention christ meeteth good time sayth wickedly done corruption men true religion beaten downe law thing lesse regarded sith scribe moste obstinate ennemies againste truthe oppressed church tyranny christ compelled discouer corruption except good simple men bene drawen bondage gate beene shutte vppe gospel also another reason people thoughte lawfull sawe theyr ruler made law vnto themselues corrupt liues least man wrest thing shuld speake diuers sense vseth speach maner men soeuer doctours yet meete woorde god receiue blotte blemishe filthy liues take liberty sinne wicked example wisedome must diligently noted many take holde one thing might bring vngodly wicked hatred infamie doe vnaduised zeale mixe confounde thing togither discipline despised shame troden downe shorte remaineth regard honestie yea many become impudent doe purpose spread abroade sinnes priestes might haue better cloake sinne christ doeth inu • scribe first deliuereth law god contempt therefore wee must learne vse wisedome desire reprehension good yet againe good note christ afraid offending man whereby shoulde kept discouering vngodly doctours deserued onely helde moderation least woord god shoulde grow contempt wickednesse men let v vnderstand spake sinnes procure hatred personnes men least infection spread marke sayeth expresly spake doctrine word declareth wold haue hearer profit admonitiōs might take hede themselues though luke semeth restrain disciple yet probable directeth speach generally whole multitude doeth also euidently appeare mathewe matter selfe required christ shoulde haue respecte men generall 2 sitte moses seat without consideration haue set heere whiche luke rehearseth another place besides doctrine doubt luke hadde said lorde seuerely hardly reproued scribe added also reprehension mathewe deferde proper place nowe haue seene euangelists haue placed diuers saying christ togither occasion required mathewe wryteth large rather interpreat wryteth lorde sum exhorteth faithfull sith scribe liued moste wickedly leade life corrupt maners rather frame accordinge rule lawe heare mouthes scribe necessary touched euen nowe reprehende many corruption least shoulde infecte whole people therefore least wickednesse robbe away force doctrine whereof minister preacher hee commaundeth faithfull attend wordes deedes haue sayd cause euill example pastours hinder child god liuinge well vnder name scribe doctours interpreaters law noted agreeth well hebrewe phrase certaine luke calleth men lawyer lorde doeth especially reproue pharisies wer number scribe time secte chiefe place gouernment church interpretation scripture shewed sadduces essene would accoūted learned according learned pharisies followed maner teaching deliuered vnto elder hande hand would searche subtilly mysticall sense scripture thereof name giuen called pherusim interpreaters though defiled whole scripture inuentions yet gloried popular kinde authority setting forth worship god discipline holy life therefore sentence must resolued thus pharisies rest scribe scribe amongst pharisies haue greatest honor word good maisters vpright life vngodly dedes teach yl wherfore marke rather mouthes hand demanded whether must obey soeuer doctor cōmand without putting differēce sufficiently appeareth scribe age wickedly vngodly corrupted law vngodly fantasy laden miserable soules vnrighteous lawes defiled worship god many superstition christ woulde haue doctrine kept lawful resist tyranny answer easie doeth simply compare euery doctrine li • e christes purpose put difference betweene holy law god prophane work fit moses chaire nothing el shew law god liue though certainly know whēce maner speach borowed yet cōiecture probable refer pulpit esdras set vp whēce law red neh 8 4 rabbines wold speake scripture cōpany speake arose order may custome read law self higher place therfore sitteth chaire moses commandeth owne iudgement authority woord god yet herewithal noted lawful calling christ doeth therfore command scribe shuld heard publike teacher church papist giue lawes think inough haue title place ende doe wrest christes word necessary men receiue obediently soeuer ordinary prelate church cōmand cauil confuted againe againe another cōmandement christes willeth take heede leauen pharisies authority christ lawful also behouefull reiect soeuer scribe adde owne pure doctrine lawe euident soeuer please cōmande may receiued without choise iudgement furthermore christ wold haue tied conscience precept men spokē falsly saying god worshipped vain precept men heereby appeareth christ exhorted people shuld far obey scribe continued simple pure interpretation law aug doth wel aptly according mind christ expoūd sitting scribe moses chair taught lawe god therfore shepe ought hear voice shepherd men appoynted office word presently addeth therfore god teacheth teache owne heare treatise vpō ihon 46 sentence man saith 4 boke de doctrina christiana answeareth good faithful men hear men hear god obediētly therfore heard profitably also profitably abstain thing therfore chair scribe moses cōpelled teach good thing yea though thing good life works▪ chair none suffred thē teach owne doctrine 4 binde burden accuseth scribe tyranically oppresse soules hard vnrighteous lawes though brought many superfluous rite appeareth place yet christ doth touch fault compareth true doctrine corrupt dissolute life also maruel law god called heauy burden hard bee borne especially respect infirmity thogh scribe required nothing god cōmanded yet christ doth reproue strait austere kind teaching cōmon proud hypocrite imperiously require others soeuer due god entreated frō vrging others dueties flatteringly spare thēselues euen thing doe seuerely enioyne others carelesly giue themselues thing sense ezechiel reproueth ruled austerity power doe earnestly feare god though endeuour frame disciple obey sincerely perfectly yet seuere rather towards thēselues towards others precise exactors know infirmity louingly forgiue weak none cā imagined bold cruel cōmāding blockish contēners god care difficulty exempt themselues vvherfore man orderly rule others first hath ruled 5 al work said euen scribe liued far otherwise taught addeth shew good thing euen fained toyishe purpose please men glorye thēselues doeth secreately oppose disguised viser workes serue ostentation study godlinesse holy life sincere worshipper god wil neuer giue vainglorious boasting wherwith hypocrits puffed vp doth reprooue ambition scribe pharisies sith lord condemned transgression contempt law god whole life least obiect fained holinesse defence answereth obiected thing wherof glory friuolous trifle accounted ther raigned nothing mere boasting afterward bringeth foorth one kind wherby ambition easily knowen euen • em garmēts wold shew eies mē thei wer good obseruers law end wer border garment broder philacteries exceding common custome people make vaine shew lord commanded iewes weare certaine choyse sentence forhead vppon garment man woulde easily forget lawe therefore lord would people thus • e put minde therof therefore also commaunded wryte sentence vpon postes house whether soeuer turned eye might presently haue godly admonition scribe wore commaundements god gorgeously wroughte vppon garment might differ rest people glorious boasting filthy ambition bewrayed hereby also learne wise men adde vain fantasy ende might couer owne sinnes vnder colour cloake vertues wrest serue hypocrisie exercise godlinesse god commaunded nothing profitable exercise sens meditating lawe neither commaunded lord vaine farre profiting instruction put perfect righteousnes decking garment despised law al life lawe lord coulde reprochefully derided stagelike habite woulde faine keepe woulde call keeper person prepared playe comedy marke luke speake robe doth tend ende know people east vsed long garment euery wher fashion also kepe day appeareth zach 13 4 prophet certain kind cloke wherby wer distinguished frō rest people without cause teacher shuld apparelled might grauity modesty apparell common sort scribe wickedly turned serue pleasure pomp example popish sacrificer wrested serue whose robe appeare nothing else badge token proud tyrannie 6 loue chiefe roumes proueth manifest signes scribe desire godlinesse altogither giuen ambition none desire chiefe roumes chiefe seates rather proudly extold amongst men approued god christ doeth condemne especially desired called master though name rabbi signified self excellency yet growen time vse amongst iewes called master teacher lawe name christ sayeth honour belongeth manne himselfe alone whereof followeth giuen men without iniury seemeth harde absurde sith christ doeth teache v himselfe ordaineth setteth master ouer v follye take away name giueth office yea hee conuersant vpon earth ordained apostle go teach name question title paul certainly would haue gloryed hee vsurped iniurie sacriledge christ hee called himselfe maister doctour gentile 1 tim 2 7 christes purpose bring al least greatest order euery one might haue owne right cause manne striue woorde therfore christ regardeth called discharge office teaching tieth within bondes least shuld raigne ouer faith brother distinction must alwayes holden christ onely must obeyed voyce father spake heauen onely heare doctours must minister may heard may master vnder supply roume summe may haue authority wholely himselfe mortall man take least part away onely pastour yet hee admitteth many pastours vnder may aboue may gouerne churche cōtrary must noted brother man must striue vse mastershippe ouer others followeth mastership doth violate brotherly felowship amōgst godly condemned short heere nothing el commaunded men depend christes mouth paul reasoneth almost maner hee sayeth forbidden iudge rashly one brother shall appeare iudgement seat christ rom 14 10 9 call man father chalengeth honour father god alone almost sense sayd euen nowe onely maister men tooke name themselues graunted god vvherefore lawfull call father vppon earth wicked thing depriue honour neither distinction whiche doe make purpose menne doe begette child father accordinge flesh god onely father spirites graunte god distinguished sometime men hebrewes 12 5 sith paule doeth often call himselfe spirituall father 1 corrinthians 4 15 philippian 2 22 must seene howe agreeth woordes christe therefore true meaninge honour father giuen wrongfully men glory god thereby darkened doeth come passe oft mortal man accounted father himselfe without god degree kinred doe depende god alone christ doe agree amongest themselues god properly onely father menne former sentence maistershippe christe againe rehearsed seconde time might know lawful order god alone doe rule enioy fatherly right authority ouer menne christ woulde haue menne subiecte become disciple doctrine sayde christe onely head churche ephes 1 22 meete whole body subiect obedient 11 greatest amongest sentence declareth doeth sophistically quarrell woordes hath rather respecte matter least manne forgetfull estate take vppon meete therefore sayeth greatest dignity churche rule minister vvho soeuer keepeth himselfe measure robbeth neither god christe thing title soeuer haue againe authority whiche derogateth maistershippe christe doeth pretende title seruaunt vaine profiteth pope hee hath oppressed poore soules tyrannous lawes call himselfe seruaunt seruants god might openly rise vppe god opprobriously laugh menne scorne christe doeth stande vppon woordes hee gaue precise commaundement disciple aspire desire clime higher may equally maintaine brotherly fellowship vnder heauenly father excell honour shoulde become seruaunts others hee addeth notable sentence whych expounded place exalteth hymselfe shall muche cause might call backe common simple people secte though see vengeance god reprobate proposed ofttimes scripture might inexcusable yet vnder personne child god doe receiue profitable admonition least shoulde intangle themselues snare wickednesse shoulde beware like destruction scribe hauing ouerthrowne woorshippe god corrupted doctrine godlinesse woulde beare correction desperate madnesse opposed themselues destruction themselues whole people againste redemption profered meete shoulde made odious detestable menne thoughe christe muche respecte hadde deserued profitable rude vnlearned false teacher thought false teacher bee lawfull pastours churche chiefe maisters woorshippe god pillers godlinesse adde also bewitched coulde scarce drawen thence violent feare therfore christe denounceth horrible iudgement god againste hee might heale scribe hee might driue rest feare deceitfull practises day wee enforced thunder sharplyer againste popishe cleargie cause apte bee taught altogither cast awaye shoulde giue eare saluation smitten wyth iudgement god shoulde breake deadly superstitious snare wherein holden prisonners vvhereof may gathered tender daintinesse crueltie whiche troubled earnest vehemencie displeaseth wolues shoulde bee sharpely hardly handled whiche doe daily seeke kill deuoure sheepe yet see miserable sheepe deceiued vain pomp cast themselues willingly wolues • awe except pastour desireth shoulde safe endeuoureth deliuer destruction shoulde driue away wyth loude cry voice therefore purpose christe must bee remembered hys example might seuerely threaten wicked deceiuers cry aloud soeuer curable might flee fear destruction thoughe ennemies truthe doe profitte thereby yet must cited tribunall seat god others must warned cursse ready fall vppon depart speedily wicked company 13 shutte vppe kingdome heauen christ pronounceth cursse peruerte office generall destruction people sith gouernment churche theyr handes shoulde haue beene past office committed priest scribe vnder lawe woorde knowledge doe gather howe foolishly papistes doe make theyr fantasticall keyes certaine magicall power without woorde god christ sayeth none canne commeth passe euery manne hath giuen owne manne defraud hurt others mercy extendeth euery man shoulde endeuour helpe brother hee hathe helpe poore counsell goodes defend vniustly oppressed good wil employ power hath common good faith nothing else sincere simplicitie attempteth nothing subtilly malitiously deceit seeketh plaine dealing mutually vsed amongest menne euery thing wherein haue doe one charitie accounted summe lawe knowe doe otherwise interpreate woorde faith figure synecdoche comprehend whole woorshippe god christe heere maner doeth diligently trie holinesse loue brother therefore toucheth first table thoughe luke putteth loue god faith yet doeth make sense purpose christe shewe lorde doeth especially require v lawe well knowen lawe deuided two table might shew first due lorde due menne luke setteth downe partes christ say law principally tende wee shoulde loue god vprighte mercifull towardes neighbour mathewe content one table onely absurdity call dueties charity chiefe poyntes lawe sith paule romanes 13 18 calleth charitie selfe perfection lawe sayeth another place lawe fulfilled loue neighbour christ demanded commaundements lawe onely rehearseth seconde table man wold obiect meanes mē shuld preferred god charitie done thē accounted relygion easily aunswered second table lawe opposed first rather proueth obseruation second whether worship god true heart godlynes lyeth hidde within god conuersāt amongst v try loue towards needeth seruice easie matter hypocrite lye falsly pretend loue god worke brotherly charity may seene iudged men impudency better reproued christ therfore would subtilly dispute place seueral partes righteousnes order common capacity menne could conceaue taught simply law god truely obserued behaue themselues vprightly louingly truely towardes others doe witnesse doe loue reuerence god shew forth lawfull fit testimony sincere godlynes shall auaile doe duety towardes menne except god haue due dooth necessarily follow true worshipper god frameth hys lyfe hys appoyntment yet question throughly aunswered tythes christe preferreth equitye mercye part worshippe god part wont bestowed amongst poore double sacrifice thē aunswere doth simply compare tithe almes faith iudgment fained holynes scribe sincere perfecte charitie ready willing paye tythes would please god small charge trouble bent throughly therfore might numbred amōgst work charity smal matter dissembled god men 23 thinges haue done aunswere wherwith christ preuenteth quarrel might haue ouerthwartlye quarrelled speach make accounte commaunded law god therefore graunteth thing soeuer god hath commaunded must obserued thinge omitted loue whole law impediment hinder obeying chiefe poyntes vvhereof hee gathereth deale preposterously busie themselues small matter rather beginne chiefest tithe addition law therefore christ saieth mind derogate authoritie least commaundementes though commendeth requireth order obseruation lawe whole law therefore remaineth sound cannot broken poynt without contempt authour hath forbidden commit whoredome kill steale hath also condemned concupiscence vvherby gather al commaundements knit togither lawfull disceuer one vvherfore also wrytten curssed doeth thing wrytten wordes whole righteousnes law sanctified without exception regard saide taketh away difference betweene commaundementes purpose law whereto true obseruers doe direct minde least onely play outward shew 24 yee blinde guide prouerbe doth well set forth vile scrupulositie hypocrite small matter smal sinnes tremble rather die hundred deathes fall one transgression grieuous sinnes doe fauourablye flatter themselues others therefore doe asmuch man shoulde straine crumme bread swallow downe whole loafe vvee know gnat small creature camell great beast nothing therefore ridiculous straine wine water leaste thou shouldest hurt iawes swallowing vp gnat carelesly suppe vp camell manifest hypocrite doe dally toyes passe iudgment mercy faith neglect whole law austere sharpe matter great weight meanes would seeme kisse god feete disdainfully spit face 25 yee make cleane outward side lord prosecuteth sentence manner figure reproueth scribe beecause regard accounted men outward side platter doth metaphorically note outward shew say haue regard cleannes outward appearaunce euen like man diligently wipe away filth outward side cup leaue inside filthy borrowed manner speach appeareth seconde parte sentence inwarde filthines condemned inwardly full intemperaunce rapine therefore reproueth hypocrisie beecause sought frame liues eye men might get themselues reporte vaine fame holynes therefore calleth backe pure sincere desire liue wel make cleane saith first within ridiculous thing feede eye outward cleannes drink cuppe foule dregges filthy mean 27 like whited tombes similitude tendeth ende hee compareth tombes menne worlde doe ambitiouslye make fayre gorgeous themselues therefore painting pargeting tombes draweth mennes eye looke vppon full dead carkases within christe saieth hypocrite doe deceiue outwarde shewe full fraud wickednesse luke vseth wordes deceiue mennes eies graues often perceyue walke ouer yet desolate verely tell yee shall see vntill time come yee shall saye blessed hee commeth name lord luke 11 53▪ hee said thinges vnto scribe pharises began vrge sore prouoke speake manye thing 54 laying waite seekinge catch thinge mouth whereby might accuse 29 buylde tombes doe wrongfully thinke reproued scribe superstition preposterouslye honoured prophet dead sumptuous sepulchre papistes nowe doe giue honour due god dead saintes wickedly worshippe image time blinde madde wherefore christ another purpose scribe also dissimulation gatte themselues credit amōgst vnlearned people amongste iewes beecause reuerentlye esteemed memory prophetes manner feigned maintain doctrin euery man would haue thought beene faithful follower earnest zealous keeper worshippe god therfore thing verye plausible build monumentes prophetes meanes religion puld darkenesse honoured meant nothing lesse restore doctrine might seeme haue ben ouerthrown death prophet thogh straungers cruel enemy doctrine prophetes yet dead honoured sepulchre maintained one cause manner hypocrite honour holy minister god pure teacher theyr death could abide life commeth onely common corruption horace noteth wordes enuie hate vertue present seeke taken away dead ash doe trouble sharpe seuere rebuke doe willingly make vaine shew religion worshipping whose wordes speach hadde beene almost mad dissimulation desire worshippe dumbe much regarded prophetes tyme contumeliously reiected much troubled iewes yea oft time cruelly slaine posteritie came nothing better father rather reuerenced memory shadow imbraced doctrine hated much teacher world dareth despise god altogeather least arise altogether inuenteth subtill deuise worshippe shadow god god vseth like mockery prophetes vvhereof plaine experience popery beeing contente lawfull reuerence apostle martyres doe worshippe god honour soeuer doe heape vppe togeather thinke doe exceede measure yet raging faithfull doe declare would worshippe apostle martires aliue day shoulde doe office time past outragious v desire doctrine apostle martyres sealed bloud might receiued flourish sith holye seruauntes god esteemed pretious owne life would spare theyr life doe outragiously persecute doctrine therefore let adorne image saintes incense candelles flower kinde pompes theyr pleasure peter aliue would teare peeces would ouerthrow paule stone christ liued yet world would roast small fire lord saw scribe sacrificer time seeke praysed people holy worshipper prophetes reproueth deceitfull dealing doe onely refuse prophet presently sent vnto doe cruelly trouble therein doth vile dissimulation grosse impudency bewraye selfe desire seeme religious worshipping dead labour ouerthrow aliue 30 beene dayes father christ spake vaine though doe accuse person father doth impute faulte murtherers chyldren yet doth way reproue vaine boasting vsed glory kinred yet offspring bloudy enemy god sentence therefore must bee expounded thus worship prophetes dead think sacrifice father sinnes therefore doe nowe conclude doe glory vaine holy kinred come vngodly wicked parentes goe couer wickednes godlynes whose hand confesse defiled innocent bloud commit farre greater offence sacrilegious madnes father doe condemne sepulchre dead doe follow murthering liue vvherefore concludeth length matter degenerate theyr father haue sayde nation doth begin nowe rage prophetes god olde order custome vsed father short manner dealing planted hee doth commaund doe doe kill holy teacher dooth figuratiuely declare right enheritaunce doe arise seruauntes god haue lybertie giuen oppresse trueth meanes fulfill wickednesse whiche wanting father weaue vp webbe beganne wordes hee doth onely say past hope cannot bee brought againe right minde hee admonisheth simple meruaile prophetes god euill handled murtherers child 33 generation viper christ hath shewed scrib • onely wicked enemy godlye doctrine faithlesse corruptours worshippe god also deadly plague church making end speach inueigheth sharpely necessary hypocrits violētly shaken driuen dainty drawne tribunall seate god might terrified yet christ onelye respect vnto thē purpose make people afraide might beeware like destruction hard intollerable sharpe wordes reuerend maisters may bee gathered gouernment bene peaceably setled longe custome man durst murmur without doubt many offended freedome christ word bitter accounted froward immodeste hee durst speake reproachfully order scribe daye many dainty men cannot abide heare thing spoken sharply popish cleargy christ doe vile hipocrites onelye puft vp disdainefull contempte god drunken vaine confidence themselues bewitched common people vaine shewes therefore necessary deale vehementlyer therfore calleth serpentes aswell nature manner hee pronounceth vengance shal escape except repent speedily 34 therefore behold send luke setteth downe somewhat plainelier vvherefore wisdome god also sayd interpreter doe expound thus eternall wisdome god doe pronounce yet doe rather allow god shoulde speake vnder person wisdome vsuall manner scripture sense god hath spoken beefore spirite prophesie come passe graunt wordes sentence read place god dooth euery reproue vntamed frowardnesse people christe maketh briefe collection sheweth plainely mouing lord speake againe iudgment god incurable wickednesse nation might seeme wonder teacher hadde done nothing worthy noting lorde would tyre spidily men doe reason god loseth labour hee sendeth word reprobate knoweth bee obstinate hypocrite doe hope god mercifull fauourable dayly preacher heauenly doctrine amongst though onely sufficient outward worde preached amongst though would neuer learne thing therby iewes made great boast themselues farre excelled nation hauing prophetes doctours deserued great honor bene euident signe dignitie christ might beate downe foolish arrogancye doth onely say better nation beecause god hath vouchsafed send prophetes notable interpreter hys wisdome vnto proueth grace abused shalbe greater rebuke theyr destruction purpose god farre otherwyse imagined namelye hee might make inexcusable heape wicked malice might brought full height haue said doe verye fondlye foolishlye pretende honour god hath sent prophetes god hath determined another thing secrete iudgment continuall course calling louingly might openly discouer wicked obstinacy might hath brought passe destroy child father togeather concerning wordes sentence matthew wanteth somewhat sense wherof must supplied luke wordes numbreth scribe wise men prophetes might amplifie set forth grace god vvhereby vnthankfulnesse dooth appeare god omitted meanes might serue destruction yet preuailed nothing luke scribe wise menne placeth apostle sense one place doth also teach god dooth alwayes saue menne oft sendeth word vnto shall preached reprobate knoweth obstinate might vnto • auour death vnto death word god selfe owne nature holsome calleth menne generallye hope eternall life menne moued inwardlye neyther dooth god open eares menne short menne renewed repentaunce brought obedience whosoeuer doe refuse worde god doe vnbeliefe turne destruction make deadly vvhen god knoweth shall come passe doth purposely send prophet vnto may cast reprobate headlong greater destruction hee declareth large isay 6 10 graunt agreeth reason manne see wicked contemners god doe take iolly occasion barke god cruell tyrant delight himselfe greater destruction menne without hope profiting doth wittinglye willingly blinde harden god doth instruction teach faythfull modestie therefore let v learne sobrietie fearefully reuerence passeth vnderstanding doe say foreknowledge god hinderaunce vnbeleeuers may bee saued doe fondly excuse god vaine defence graunt reprobate doe seeke owne death beecause god foresawe therefore destruction cannot ascribed foreknowledge say righteousnesse god thus rightly defended may presently obiected power god doe repent beecause gyfte fayth repentaunce hand maye also obiected meaning god sette deliberate purpose appoynteth light word blinde men contented simply destruction appointed eternall death would haue perish twise thrise aunswere made giue glory iudgementes god may cry paule profounde vnsearchable depth romanes 15 33 demaunded howe god say prophesies giuen iewes destruction adoption alwaies flourish effectually nation answere onely smal remnaunt embraced worde faith saluation speaketh greater nūber whole bodye iesaias 8 61 foretelleth generall destruction nation hee commaunded seale vppe lawe god amongst disciple therefore must knowe ofte scripture iudgeth iewes eternall death remnauntes alwayes excepted lorde preserueth seede beecause owne free election 35 vppon may come righteous bloud hee dooth onelye take wrongfully toke themselues hee teacheth prophetes giuen altogeather end age might free sinne rebelling god pronowne doth generallye comprehende whole nation beginning man would obiect agreeth iudgement god child punished offence father answere ready sith ioined togeather vngodly conspiracy must seeme absurd god generally punishing men cast punishment due father bosome child therefore account perpetual contempte iustlye exacted required whole nation punishment laid vppon though liued one age others another god long continuance patience stroue continually malice whole people whole people woorthily founde guilty stubbornnesse would amended continued euen last age slewe prophet agreed vpon meete called generall iudgement slaughter done one consent reuenged vppon bloude abel thoughe abel slaine iewes yet christ imputeth death vnto certaine kinred vngodlinesse betweene caine otherwise saieth coulde agree righteous bloude euen beginning worlde shed generation caine therefore accounted heade prince author iewish people since began kill prophet succeeded roume whose step followed hee nameth zachariah last martyr iewes made ende murthering prophet boldnesse rage rather encreased therby posterity followed made themselues drūken blud father tasted neither yet death famous knowne though holye scripture reporteth reason worthye noted interpreter saw vvhereby came passe onelye staggared themselues also entangled reader troublesome question christ might seeme haue bene forgetfull making mention one slaughter beene done olde passeth innumerable sort murthers committed afterwarde vnder manasse neyther iewes cease persecute good men time load captiuity yea afflicted know cruelly raged ieremiah 32 2 lorde set purpose vpbraide late murthers rather chose beene done long beginning fountaine wicked libertie afterwarde brake vnbrideled crueltie apt purpose chiefe end purpose shewed euen proue nation sith ceased wickednes guiltie murthers bene committed long therfore doth onelye pronounce vengeaunce againste present crueltie hee saieth shall yeelde reckoninge bloud zachariah handes yet wette bloud neyther opinion probable doe referre zacharyah exhorted people brought backe captiuitie babylon buyld temple whose prophesies doe yet remaine though tytle booke declareth hee sonne barachias yet read place slaine exposition wrested slaine meane time betweene building altar temple scripture maketh mention zachariah son • iada agreeth best place death father true relygion decayed vngodly falling away king people hee moued spirite god reproued sharpely publike idolatrie therefore slayne court temple absurditie saye father ioiada hadde name barachiah giuen honour sake sith lyfe defender true worship hee might worthily accounted blessed god whether ioiada two name whether faulte word hierome imagineth matter doubted christ noteth sacrilegious stoning zachariah whiche recorded second booke chronicle 24 cha verse 22 circumstance place augmenteth hay nonsnesse faulte regarded holynesse place temple taken court porch place altar burnt offringes neere place prieste might offer sacrifice sighte people therefore appeareth theyr madnesse outragious sight altar temple coulde appease iewes woulde defile holye place horrible murther 37 ierusalem ierusalem christ declareth euidently iuste cause angry ierusalem god chosen sāctuary heauenly dwelling place onely shewed selfe vnworthy great honor den theeues acustomed nowe long time shedde bloud prophetes christe therefore great affection cryeth great wonder beecause holye citie god falne madnesse shoulde lately endeuour blotte wholsome doctrine god bloud prophetes therefore rehearsed name beecause wonderfull incredible wickednesse worthy samll detestation christ dooth reproue one murther two hee saieth citie growne custome ceased slaye prophetes many soeuer sent vnto participle putte place epithite christe shoulde haue sayde thou oughtest haue beene faythful keeper word god mistresse heauenly wisdome light world fountaine true doctrine seate worshippe god example fayth obedience art become murtherer prophet nowe thou haste gotten certeine habyt sucking theyr bloud therefore dooth heereby appeare hadde filthilye prophaned sanctuarie god worthye kinde reproach christes purpose also meete offence hande least faythfull shoulde see slayne ierusalem without cause shoulde troubled straungenesse suche sight nowe admonished wordes meruaile citie beene accustomed slaye stone prophetes shoulde cruellye slaye redeemer heereby appeareth howe much conuenient attribute place god giuen notable ornamentes citie world honourablye exalted anye yet wee see vnthankfull became let pope compare seate hys euerye holye citie shall hee finde worthye like honour hyred flatterer doe boast v fayth flourished time past shoulde graunt true appeare daye alienated falne away christ infidelytie full innumerable sacrilegies howe fondly doe glorye honour supremacye tyed vnto lette v rather learne example worthye bee remembred higher anye place sette great benefittes god thereby exempted place aboutes degenerate shall onelye bee spoyled ornamentes shall bee much odious execrable beecause hath filthily polluted glory god defiling bewtie grace howe ofte woulde rather woorde disdaine compassion hee pittyeth yet citie selfe ouer hee wepte litle beefore hee dealte hardlye sharpelye towardes scribe aucthours saluation deserued neither dooth spare rest faulty allowers companion sinne hee prouing alike guiltie inueigheth specyallye theyr leader guydes cause euilles vehemencye speach muste bee noted grace god hadde beene simplye denied ierusalem theyr vnthankfulnesse might much lesse haue bin excused sith god tried louingnesse gentlenesse allure iewes vnto preuayled nothing great gentlenesse offence proud contempt much greater heere also bee added theyr vntamed frowardnesse god went gather twise continually tyme tyme hee sent vnto diuerse prophetes almost refused parte nowe wee vnderstande christe person god compareth himselfe henne namelye hee might lay much shame vppon wicked nation refused sweete motherlye allurementes certeinly wonderfull incomparable token loue hee disdayned humble himselfe euen entreate hee might meanes bringe rebelles obeye like reproofe almoste sette downe moses deuteronomye 32 11 god eagle embraseth people stretched winges though god dooth stretch winges one sort manner nourish people yet christe dooth peculyarlye applye manner speach one thing namely god sent prophetes gather wandred wente astray bosom god vvhereby hee declareth worde god neuer opened vnto v hee motherlye kindnesse openeth lappe vnto satisfied therewith hee woulde humble himselfe simple affection henne nourishing chicken vvhereof followeth crueltie monstrous wee suffer selues gathered togeather certeinelye one parte wee could remember fearefull maiestie god owne vile base estate shuld compeld shame stand amased great wonderfull goodnesse meaneth god humble himselfe farre sake hee taketh vppon person mother hee humbleth himselfe farre beneath glory much hee becommeth like vnto henne vouchsafeth account v chicken worthily obiected olde people lyued vnder lawe dooth much pertaine v though alwayes true cited euen nowe moses also complaintes true read isaiah 65 2 god hath dailye spread armes vaine embrace stiffe rebellious people rysing early taking daily care hee could preuaile nothing amongst yet day hee calleth v familyarly louinglye vnto hym sonne vvherefore remayneth horrible vengeaunce v ofte proposeth doctrine gospel wee doe willinglye hide selues vnder winges hee ready take couer v yet christ teacheth al shall rest safetie obedience faith doe gather themselues god vnder wing haue sort cannot ouerthrowne part also reproofe must noted god presently moued peruerse frowardnes olde people shoulde cause cast awaye fatherly loue motherlye care ceased continuallye sende prophetes prophetes day though hee hath much experience wickednesse worlde yet continueth course fauor yet thing noted word namely iewes fell assoone lorde hadde gathered heereby note falling away ofte rested quietlye scarse space moment vnder winges god wildenes seene daye worlde hath beene also age therefore necessarye god shoulde call vnto wander goe astray desperate conclusion wickednesse menne doe stubbornelye refuse goodnesse god refuse come vnder winges also sayde beefore christ spake personne god interprete speach dooth properly belonge eternall godhead hee dooth declare heere hee beganne doe sith hee manifested fleshe hee sheweth howe carefull hee hath beene saluation people euen beginning wee knowe church gouerned god christe gouerned hee eternall wisdome god sense paule saieth god father christe hymselfe tempted desarte 1 corin 10 9 place wrested cauillers proofe free wyll ouerthrowe secrete predestination god easily answered saye lorde woulde gather menne therefore free menne come dooth depend god election aunswere god whereof mention made heere considered effecte woorde hee calleth menne generallye bee saued ende preaching repose themselues keepinge fayth rightlye sayde hee woulde gather menne vnto therefore hee describeth heere secrete counsell god wyll learned nature word dooth call outwarde voyce manne whome hee would gather effectually draweth inwardly spirit anye man obiecte absurd imagine god haue two willes aunswere doe beleeue otherwise god one simple mindes cannot reache profounde depth secrete election according simplicitie capacitie god proposed v two wayes maruaile frowarde heades nothing offended humane affection founde oft scripture admytte place onelye beecause haue handled thys argument large another place least shoulde longer needlesse matter onelye saye woorde assoone doctrine whiche ensigne vnitie broughte amongste people god woulde gather menne whosoeuer doe come inexcusable 37 would may referred aswell whole nation scribe yet rather expound gathering togeather moste hindred christ enueighed whole course speach nowe hee spake ierusalem singuler number presentlye appeareth hee altered number without cause vehement opposition betweene god vnwyllingnesse expresseth deuillishe fury men set themselues striue god 38 beholde habitation shall left hee foretelleth destruction temple ouerthrow whole common wealth though defiled vngodlines wickednesse manner infamy yet blinded corrupte hope outwarde worshippe temple thought god bounde vnto buckler alwayes readye god departe place onely chose vnto himselfe alone al earth dwelleth amongst vntill yee shall say tye last daye iudgement thinke prophesie whiche fulfilled shortlye vvhen iewes humility worshippe christe like neither interpretation certeinely meruaile learned men make doubt light matter doubtfully demaund vnfaythfull say christ blessed commeth c dooth declare become hee himselfe would doe abuerbe vntyll extendeth time goeth ioseph laye wife vntill brought forth christ offered saieth come vntill sight maiestye horryble bee seene shall cry menne afrayde late truelye sonne god threatning doth belong contemners gospell especially doe wrongfully pretende name yet refuse 21 41 iesus sate ouer treasury beheld howe people caste money treasurie manye riche menne caste much 42 came certeine poore widow shee threwe two mite made quadrin 43 hee called vnto disciple sayde vnto verely say vnto poore widow hath cast al haue cast treasury 44 caste theyr superfluitie shee pouertie cast al euen al liuing 1 beheld hee sawe rich men cast theyr gift treasury 2 sawe also certeine poore widow cast thither two mite 3 said trueth say vnto poore widow hath cast 4 haue theyr superfluitie cast offrings god shee pennurye hath cast lyuing 43 verely say vnto aunswere christe containeth verye profitable doctrine whatsoeuer men offer god valued outward price according affection heart yea hys godlynesse worth according ability offereth litle hath god offereth hundred fold hys aboundaunce doctrine profitable two wayes lord encourageth poore want ability doe well shoulde afrayde cheerefully testifie good litle haue consecrate themselues offring though shew vile vaine shalbe asmuch esteemed offred croesus treasure agayne haue aboundaunce doe giue many giftes admonished sufficient excell common poore people giueing lesse accounted god rich man giue meane summe poore man bestowe litle hath widow godlye rather without meate selfe shee woulde appeare empty lord lord commendeth simplicity forgetting selfe declared belonged god also chief sacrifice required v deny selues though supposed holye offringes rightly bestowed tyme lawfull v yet manner worshippe appoynted lawe yet force christe doth reiect certeinely corruption menne could bring passe holy worshipper shall lefte stone vpon stone shall bee caste downe 3 hee sate vppon mounte olyues disciple came vnto aparte sayinge tell v thinges shall bee signe shalbe thy comming end world 4 iesus aunswered saide vnto▪ take heede man deceiue 5 manye shall come name sayinge christe shall deceiue many 6 yee shall heare warres rumour war see yee troubled thing must come passe ende yet 7 nation shall rise nation shall rise nation kingdome kingdome 11 great earthquake shall bee diuerse place hunger pestilence fearful thing great signes shall heauen 1 iesus went departed disciple perceiued christ gaue last gorgeous giue place christ must noted diligently sith outward bewtie temple wondred eye set vppon present glory could scarsly hope kingdome christ might spring vp doe expreslye confesse theyr doubt doe shewe secretely doe obiecte christ great heape hugenes stone ouerthrowne yea brought nothing would reigne also admiration estate popery withholdeth many simple men day see furnished great abundance wealth mightie power presentlye amased base simple shew church seemeth vile contemptible vnto many also think deceiued whē go ouerthrow kingdome euen harde matter pull sunne heauen meauaile christes disciple amased notable sight much building cost herod may gathered tenne thousand workman labouring continually space eight yeares doe wonder stone without cause verye goodly fayre losephus writeth fifteene cubytes longe twelue hygh eight broade nowe much reuerenced forraine countreies manne durst scarsely suspect could time ouerthrowne 2 verelye saye vnto one stone shall bee left vppon greatnesse wealth temple sette vaile beefore eye hyndred beleeuing kingdome christe hand therefore affirmeth othe soeuer thinges doe hinder shortly pearish foretelling destruction temple made way
