woulde bee reuenged vpon nation refusing sonne contempt grace offered vvherefore meete disciple shoulde forewarninge bee drawen away societie rebellious people day soeuer scripture foretelleth punishment wicked shoulde driue v sinnes whiche prouoke wrath god also soeuer teacheth transitory vaine fashion world shoulde correcte vanitie oure minde followeth greedily pompe pleasure delites especially foretelleth fearful destruction antichrist secte remooue away let doe hinder v right course faith 3 sate vpon mount marke nameth foure peter iames iohn andrew luke doe set downe much mathew say enquired time destructiō temple thing harde beleeued signe god would giue heauen shoulde come passe mathewe reporteth aske question time comming christ ende worlde may noted howe thought euen childehoode temple stand euer mindes wholely bent vpon thought temple could fall world stoode therefore assoone christ sayd temple destroyed presently thought themselues ende world errour begetteth errour perswaded presently beginning kingdome christe shoulde bee happy euery way presently speede triumph battell therefore ioyne comming christ ende worlde togither destruction temple thing coulde seperate ende worlde vnderstande restoring thinges nothing wanting perfecte felicitye godlye therefore see howe leape diuers question entangled fantasy temple coulde fall shake whole worlde shadowes law world ende togither glory kingdome christe shoulde presently appeare make child god perfectly happie apparant renewing worlde hand shuld presently bring thing confused order especially hope fondly conceiued present kingdome christ doth driue preposterously hast happy rest act 1 6 see christ risen dead runne headlong felicitie laide vppe v heauen must aspire hope patience thoughe estate like trained vppe shadowes lawe superstitious opinion kingdom christ shuld earthly hath besotted v yet ther shall scarce found one amōgst hundred troubled like disease al men nature loath trouble contention maner affliction wearinesse thing vrgeth without moderation wythout hope haste time frute faith commeth passe man willing sowe menne would mow time returne disciple good seede faith hart would tary time appoynted hauing corrupt fantasy seeke thrust perfection kingdome christ togither beginning seeke heauen sought enioy vppon earth 4 iesus answeared answeare liked gaped triumph warre ended christ exhorted long sufferance haue sayd would receiue ye price first beginning race necessity must first runne foorth race would haue kingdom god vppon earth man attaine vnto except ascend heauen sith chapiter containeth notable admonition instruction gouernment course life see howe wonderful counsell god brought passe apostle errour tourned profite summe preaching gospell like sowinge time therefore must patience wait haruest time dainty effeminate whiche discouraged theyr mindes frost snowes cloudes sharpe tempest winter christe doeth especially giue disciple commaundement two thing shoulde beware false doctrine shoulde troubled offence whiche woordes hee declareth hys churche shall subiecte suche trouble wandereth worlde might seeme vnlikely prophet hadde foretolde kingdome christ another sorte isaias 54 13 promiseth shall taught god ioel reported 2 28 poure spirite vppon fleshe sonnes daughter shall prophesie yong menne shall see vision olde menne shall dreame dreames ieremiah also promiseth brighter light vnderstanding 31 34 shall teach euery man neighbour euery man brother saying knowe lord shall knowe least greatest therefore rising sunne righteousnesse spokē prophet malachie 4 2 maruel iewes hoped sette free cleare cloudes errours heereof woman samaria sayd iohn 4 25 messias shall come teache v thing nowe wee knowe howe great promisses doe euery appeare peace righteousnesse ioye aboundance good thing vvherefore marueiled thought christes comming shuld exempted trouble warres spoyles maner iniury also famine pestilence christe declareth shall haue lesse trouble heereafter false teacher olde people hadde wyth false prophet shall lesse trouble vnder gospel time past vnder lawe prophesies touched euen nowe fulfilled fully perfourmed presently first day sufficient faithfull haue onely taste giuen nowe good thinges might nourish hope haue full enioying hereafter therfore much deceiued would haue thing perfectly perfourmed beginning gospell see fulfilled euery day furthermore though wickednesse menne cannot altogither make none effecte felicitye whiche prophet sayde kingdome christe yet hindereth troubleth lorde causeth striuing malice menne hys blessing finde way lettes certainly absurde thing established vppon free goodnesse god dependeth vppon pleasure abolished theyr fault yet might receiue rewarde vnthankfulnesse doeth onely distill grace little whiche otherwise shoulde bee powred downe great aboundance hence commeth labyrinth many mischiefes faithfull doe wander theyr life though christ captaine bearing light gospell holde ready way saluation hence arise heape manye contention shall passe sharpe warres yet without daunger hence spring many sodaine trouble troubled miserable disquietnesse yet helpe christe continue stedfast ende also christ commandeth disciple take heede deceit vnderstand shal want meanes auoyd carefull themselues vvherefore let v sure v doe diligently apply himselfe watche place calling subtelties soeuer sathan shall deuise shalbe free 5 many shall come hee doeth yet speake generally corrupt fals doctrine toucheth one kinde beginning al error wyth whych sathan endeuoured sundry wayes ouerthrow pure doctrine gospell shortlye resurrection christe arose deceiuers euery one professed hymselfe christe true redeemer onely taken among put shamefull death crosse mindes men mooued kindled hope desire theyr redemption hadde meanes ready hand deceiue doubted god gaue iewes ouer deceyued suche guile wickedly reiected sonne though madde toyes quickely brought nothing yet god iewes shuld haue tumult amongst first might make themselues famous odious hope saluation might taken altogither lastly often deceiued might brutish blockishnesse runne headlong theyr owne destruction worlde slipt sonne god whose office gather v holy vnitie meete caried hither thither tempestuous waues vengeance god came passe moe caryed away fonde opinion true faith brought obey god christ sette downe circumstance purpose least faithfull beholding multitude madde people growe fainte weary know easie matter follow multitude especially number 6 ye shall heare warres place maketh mention stirres fell amongst iewes shortly hee shew creepe first commaunded take heede least man deceiue commaundeth good courage heare rumour warres warres themselues daungerous least ouerwhelmed euilles fall away especially promised perswaded themselues peaceable ioyfull quiet estate addeth thing must come passe assigning cause declaring none thing shall fall fortune prouidence god least kick vaine pricke nothing effectuall bring v obedience wee knowe god accordinge pleasure gouerneth euen thing seeme confused god hath iust cause great reason suffreth world troubled mete faithfull shuld rest vpon pleasure sufficient christ exhort disciple beare thinges patient mindes abide constant▪ pleased lord ende yet plainly declareth sayd euen greeuous themselues yet beginninges greater trouble flame warres consumed iudea wast doctrine gospel spred like vnthankfulnesse kindled also wrath god amongst nation hereof cōmeth passe broken couenant band peace god shoulde mutuall dissentions rent themselues piece refused obey authoritye god driuen yeelde force ennemies whyche woulde reconciled god fall tumult trouble amongst themselues short whiche hadde exempted themselues heauenly saluation shoulde raging one againste another fill earth wyth slaughter knewe great malice world woulde addeth againe beginning sorrowes faithfull shoulde ouerwhelme themselues sorrowe haue comfort hande alwayes middest trouble mighte prepare themselues patience abide longer time luke also addeth earthquake signes heauen whiche thinges though remaine certaine hystory yet sufficient christe spake may read rest iosephus math 24 marke 13 luke 21 9 shall deliuer vppe afflicted shal kil yee shall hated nation name sake 10 shall manye offended shall betraye one another shall hate one another 11 many false prophet shall arise shall deceiue many 12 iniquitie shall encreased loue manye shalbe colde 13 endureth ende shal saued 14 gospel kingdome shall preached throughe whole worlde witnesse vnto nation shall ende come 9 take ye heede selues shal deliuer vppe councels synagogue yee shall beaten broughte ruler king sake▪ testimoniall vnto 10 gospell must first published among nation 11 lead deliuer vppe take yee thought neither premeditate shall say soeuer giuen time speake yee speake holy ghost 12 yea brother shall deliuer brother death father sonne • child shal rise parent shall cause die 13 yee shalbe hated men name sake soeuer shall endure ende shalbe saued 12 shall lay hand persecute deliuering vp synagogue prison bring kinges ruler name sake 13 shall turne testimoniall 14 lay vp therfore heart premeditate yee shall answeare 15 giue mouth wisedome aduersaries shall able speake resist 16 yea yee shalbe betraied also parent brother kinsman frends shall putte death 17 yee shall hated men name sake 18 yet shal one haire head pearish 19 youre patience possesse soules 9 shall deliuer vppe afflicted chirst foretelleth disciple kinde temptation wherewith besides common affliction faith tried shoulde hated detested world harde sharpe selfe child god afflicted togither reprobate contemners god subiect punishmēt endure sinnes seemeth intollerable sharpely oppressed grieuous misery wicked free wheate togither chaffe threshed flailes afterward broken ground mill god doth onely afflicte child togither wicked layeth crosse vppon vppon others might seeme moste miserable men christe doeth properly speake heere affliction disciple suffer gospell thoughe saying paule true rom 8 29 whome god hath chosen hath also ordained beare crosse might made like image sonne yet doeth marke child wyth speciall marke persecuted ennemies gospell christe speaketh nowe kinde affliction time faithfull necessitye beare testimonie gospel hatred reprochefull wordes fury wicked let disciple vnderstande doctrine gospell whereof shoulde messenger witness shoulde accepted allowed world euen tolde telleth shal haue contention fewe ennemies shall hated nation whether euer shall come wonder hardly beleeued might make couragious mindes feare quake name sonne god infamous odious shuld procure hated euery therefore marke sayeth take heede selues word noteth ende vse admonition namely ready beare least temptation shuld ouerthrow aware marke addeth place testimoniall king ruler disciple christ shoulde brought iudgement seat luke reporteth somewhat otherwyse shall testimoniall meaning one former christ declareth gospell shall set foorth shall defended daunger death apostle haue imployed trauaile preaching gospel shoulde stand constantly furious dealing ennemies defence haue ben notably confirmed doubted lay heades daunger terrours death coulde driue theyr purpose appeared courage constancie howe certainly perswaded goodnesse cause sure seale gospell apostle stoode without feare iudgement seates king frely professed name christ therfore peter calleth witnesse passion christe signes token whereof bare vppon paule phil 1 17 glorieth sette defence gospell especially woorthy noted least vile cowardlinesse fal away faith vppon whome god hath thought good bestow great honour woulde make patrones truthe mar 11 take yee thought vve haue expounded sentence next tenth chapter mathewe lordes ease disciple sorowfull doubtfulnesse hindereth v continewing calling wee distrust selues vnable beare burden would haue v altogither carelesse nothing profitable v taught humilitye knowing owne infirmitye prouoked prayer christ teacheth v cast care bosome father trusting promised helpe may goe foreward chearefully oure course luke setteth downe promisse otherwise christ wold deliuer death alwayes bee hoped giue mouth wisedome wherewith make ennemies ashamed thoughe christe giueth tyme minde power speake yet thinke meant another thing ioyning two word togither christ shuld promise woulde gouerne tongue shoulde answeare wisely purpose addeth wisedome shoulde haue victory theyr ennemies coulde resist speake agaynste impudencie giue place truthe truth sette themselues vaine triumph ouer frantike boldnesse would men required make confession faith woulde repose themselues thys hope power maiestie spirite would shewe selfe farre otherwise ouerthrowe sathans minister caryed partly owne sense puffed vppe pride runne headlong rashly goe forwarde mere partly withholden restrained peeuish fearfulnesse wofull experience sheweth destitute grace god help spirite mathew marke christ calleth spirite father speaketh v sayeth heere hee himselfe giue v mouth gather proper peculiar directe v spirite lvke 19 patience possesse soules christe doth teache disciple farre way preserue life reason manne would teache euery manne doeth naturally desire keepe life safety doe seeke meanes preseruation wee thinke best flee daunger short seeme liue except well garded christ giueth v fortresse life walke fire water swordes alwayes daunger death truely manne committeth spirite rightly hand god alwayes ready die learneth euery day liue summe christ commaundeth v possesse life vnder crosse amongst continuall terrours death math 10 shall many offended nowe rehearseth temptation shall come euill example grieuous harde ouercome christ himselfe stone offence many whereat shoulde stumble others sighte thereof goe backwarde others doe fall away 1 peter 2 7 8 seemeth christ woorde comprehendeth diuers kindes trouble doe onely fall away entred right course many become enemy christ others forgetting modesty equity become raginge madde others become prophane men cast sense feeling godlinesse others take themselues liberty trouble commit sinne 11 many false prophet shall arise admonition differeth frō former christ sayeth many shuld come name spake onely deceiuers shortly entrance gospel shuld fain thēselues christes saith shuld false teacher arise shuld corrupt foūd doctrine errours peter teacheth church shuld lesse dāger mischiefe vnder gospel vnder law 2 pet 2 1 wherfore cause error subtil practises sathan corruption godlines shuld ouerthrow mind godly man rightly established christ hath learned stād assault right trial faith standeth without remoouing false doctrine shal arise doeth say false prophet shall come also shalbe subtile deceiue shal draw sectes heere haue neede take great heede multitude follow errours violent storm enforce v turne course throughly setled god whereof somewhat spoken 12 iniquitie shall abounde man ignorant howe farre wide mischiefe shoulde spreade selfe fewe doe marke sith light gospell doth plainly discouer malice men desire doe well waxeth colde almost quenched euen good well minded men euery man thinketh himselfe thing loste done man experience daily vse declareth menne almost vnthankefull faithlesse wicked truely great dangerous temptation bee absurde allowe doctrine seemeth ouerthrowe loue godlinesse force charitie gospel taketh place charitie heat wherof heart men enflamed rather waxeth colde fountaine mischiefe must noted christe vttereth thus many doe waxe faint weakenesse cannot stand floud iniquitie floweth euery christ requireth disciple thus strong may stande fast wrastlings paule commaundeth 2 thes 3 13 weary behauing selues louingly kindely therfore though loue many ouerwhelmed abundance sinnes shoulde waxe colde christ sayeth let must also ouercome least faithfull euil exāples shuld giue ouer men tired therfore rehearseth sentence man saued hee shall striue lawfully shall continue ende 14 gospell kingdome shall preached vvhen lorde preached suche sermon giuen small occasion sorowe thys consolation added good time either raising vp mindes ouerthrowen strengthening staying falling soeuer sathan shall deuise many stirres euer shall make yet gospell shall goe forward vntill spredde whole world though incredible yet behooued apostle hauing warrant maister hope well beyond hope courage goe forwarde discharge calling doe obiecte antipode people dwel farre away yet haue heard nothing christ easily answeared christ doeth neither note perticular partes world neither doeth appoynt certaine time▪ sayeth gospell men thought shoulde bee speedily banished iudea proper dwelling place shoulde spred farthest partes round world last day cōming declareth also end preaching may testimoniall nation thoughe god neuer left himselfe without witnesse act 14 17 gaue speciall testimony iewes himselfe yet gaue testimonye thys notable rest hee reuealed himselfe christe therefore paule sayeth 1 tim 2 6 reuealed due time time appoynted call world god therefore must learne ofte gospell preached god appeareth openly directeth v solemne lawfull course wander darknesse know whether refuse obey without excuse shall ende come doe vnaptly apply destruction temple ouerthrow maner worship appoynted lawe vnderstode ende renewing world disciple ioyned two togither temple could ouerthrowne without destruction whole worlde christ answeareth question proposed telleth long sorrowfull time trouble hande hast price gone many conflictes trouble therefore last clause must vnderstode thus end world shall come exercise church sharpe painfull temptation opposeth himselfe vaine imagination apostle hadde conceiued amongst themselues vvhereof must againe considered certaine day appoynted last day shoulde presently follow performance thing foretolde euen nowe thing whereof haue red faithfull haue tasted long agoe christ yet appeared purpose teache apostle long sufferance hastily speeded heauenly glory haue sayd redemption neare hande imagined shoulde many croked turning mathew 24 marke 13 luke 21 25 vvhen yee therefore shall see electes sake dayes shall shortned 23 man shall say vnto loe heere christ beleeue 24 shall arise false christes false prophet shall shew great signes wonder possible deceiue ele • te 25 behold haue told vvherfore shal say vnto behold desart goe forth beholde secreat place beleeue 26 lightning commeth east shineth vvest shal also comminge son man 27 soeuer deade carkasse thither wil egles resort fetche thinge house 16 let field turne backe againe vnto thinges lefte behinde take cloathes 17 wo shalbe childe giue dayes 18 pray therfore flight winter 19 shall bee dayes tribulation beginning creation whiche god created vnto time neither shall 20 except lord hadde shortened dayes flesh saued electes sake hee hathe chosen hee hath shortened dayes 21 manne say vnto loe heere christ lo • beleeue 22 false christes shal rise false prophet shall shewe signes wonder deceiue possible electe 23 take ye heede beholde haue shewed thing 20 see ierusalem besieged soldiours vnderstande desolation thereof neare 21 let iudea flee mountaines let whiche middes therof depart le • countrey enter therein 22 day vengeance fulfill thing wrytten 23 wo thē childe giue sucke th • se day shall great distresse thys lād wrath ouer people 24 shal fal edge sword shalbe ledde captiue al nation ierusalem shalbe trod • u vnder sote gentile vntil time gentile bee fulfilled luke 17 22 hee sayde vnto disciple dayes come yee shall desire see one dayes sonne mā yee shall see 23 shall say beholde heere beholde goe thither neyther followe 24 lightening lighteneth oute one part vnder heauen shall sonne man day 25 first muste hee suffer many thinges bee reprooued generation 15 vvhen yee therefore shall see abhomination thing incredible sayd euen nowe temple citye ierusalem ouerthrowne whole cōmon wealth iewes destroyed also might seme absurd disciple coulde otherwise saued separating themselues people whome adoption couenant eternall life laid vp pledge christ cōfirmeth one testimony daniel haue sayde settle selues neither vpon temple ceremony law god hath brought end hath declared redemer come sacrifice cease neither let trouble separated nation god hath also time foretold child casting away nation also forewarning auaileth onely take away occasion offence also comforte mindes godly knowing god beholdeth extreeme misery regardeth saluation might flee holye anker wherby amongst cruel stormes may haue sure safe roade goe place christe citeth must examined first certaine angel 8 chapt doeth directly speake latter destruction wherof christ maketh mention place temporall spoyle tyrante antiochus made little well 9 12 angell foretelleth ende call abrogation ceremony law perfourmed comming christ exhorted faithfull cōtinue constant without yelding tolde comming christ put ende ceremony giuen outwarde prophaning temple signe length appoynteth 12 chapter certaine time well destruction restoringe time sayeth daily sacrifice shall taken awaye abhomination desolation set vp shall thousand two hundreth ninety dayes blessed wayteth commeth thousand three hundreth fiue thirty dayes know place diuersly wrested hardnesse thinke thys simple meaning angel declared temple purged pollution idolles whiche antiochus hadde brought sayeth shall time come againe shalbe prophaned newe shall loose euer holinesse reuerence wythout hope restitution grieuous sorrowfull message calleth prophet backe againe one yeare two yeres sixe moneths whiche woordes noted well long continuance ende euilles compasse yere seemeth long time continual sorrowes time doubled sorrowe encreaseth muche therefore spirite exhorteth faithfull prepare themselues beare patiently onely space whole yeare long time account beare affliction continually many age yet small comfort halfe time though affliction shoulde long yet spirit declareth shall euer first spake thus calamitie church shall endure time time halfe time reckeneth thre yeares sixe moneths dayes faithfull might bee strengthened long continuance euilles ordinarye matter men affliction accounte time yeares moneths seuerall dayes one day yeare length sayth shalbe blessed shal endure ende time inuincible patience come goale marke christ chuseth whiche serueth purpose namely ende sacrifice hand abhomination placed temple signe last destruction iewes setteled themselues much present estate would attend prophesies whiche spake abolishing christ taking eare commandeth read place diligently might learne prophet gaue euident testimony harde beleued except man rather take spokē euāgelist probable christ cōtinued speach wherin exhorted hys disciple attentiuenes abhomination signifieth asmuch prophanation worde signified filthinesse defileth ouerthroweth pure worshippe god applied desolation draweth destruction temple common wealth hadde sayd 9 chap pollutiō brought antiochus signe destroyed time doe interpreat worde wing spreading abroade deceiued thinke besieging ierusalem noted woordes neither doe luke word make thing errour whose purpose speake citie hadde bene heretofore deliuered middest ruine least faithful shoulde hope like heereafter christ sayeth shall destroyed assoone ennemies shall compasse shall vtterly depriued helpe god therefore meaning successe warre shall doubtfull citie shall destroyed hadde wholely giuen selfe breake lawe god therefore added somewhat shall troden downe gentile saying signifieth last destruction myghte seeme absurde gentile haue pleasure holy citie added peculiar cōfort respect faithful daniel omitteth speaketh whole body people namely gentile liberty time vntill theyr iniquitie waxe ripe vengeance laide vppe come light 16 lette iudea christe hath taught testimony prophet legall maner worshippe extinguished immediately prophanation temple hee addeth hang ouer iudea suche fearfull horrible plague nothing shoulde desired caried far away countrey sayeth withall come sodain scarce haue time flee away speedily purpose doe speaches belong let house toppe enter house let field returne backe least seeke saue goodes loose themselues also vvee childe giue sucke cannot apt ready flight like maner pray flighte winter sabboth daye least either religion hardnesse iourney shortnesse dayes shoulde hinder lette fleeing speedily therefore christes purpose first stirre vppe hys disciple waken shoulde haue imagination blessed estate delite earthly kingdome hee encourageth least fall away generall plague sharpe warning yet necessary respect blockishnesse huge greatnesse euils 21 shall greate affliction luke also sayeth shall day reuengement wrath people soeuer thinges wrytten might fulfilled couenāt god broken obstinate malice people mete wonderfull chaunge earth selfe aire shoulde bee shaken deadly plague coulde haue lighted vppon iewes light heauenly doctrine beinge extinguished amongst cast away god necessity required great hardnesse hear enforced feele plague casting hard sharpe whip cause horrible vengeance desperate wickednesse nation come ful measure medicine laid disease proudly disdained also reiected reprochefully yea madde men people distraught raged cruelly phisition himselfe sith lord reuenged seuerely vpon obstinate contempt gospell togither wyth raging madnesse let plague alwayes eye let v learne thereby nothing intollerable god disdainful contempt grace though reward remaineth like contemners gospel yet god woulde haue notable example remain iewes others glory comming christ might renoumed amongst posterity hainousnesse offence cannot expressed wordes put death sonne god authour life giuen vnto heauen committed abhominable sacriledge ceased diuers sundry crime pull vppon themselues cause vtter destruction therefore christ sayeth lyke affliction shall world one reiection christe accompanyed many circumstance wicked rebellion vnthankefulnesse detested sinnes age also meete shoulde sharpely reuenged rest 22 except dayes shoulde shortned amplifieth greatnesse calamity yet hee addeth comfort wyth namely name iewes might extinguished lorde regarde electe holpe somewhat sake thys place agreeth isaiah 1 9 except lorde reserued v small remnant haue bene sodome like vnto gomorrha vengeance god befell captiuity babylon shoulde fulfilled againe comming christe paule witnesseth ninthe chapter romanes nine twenty verse yea iniquitie hadde spread selfe greater reuenge shoulde light vppon therefore christe sayeth except god putte ende euilles iewes shall vtterly pearish one shall remaine god maketh account gratious couenaunt hee spare electe according saying isaiah 10 22 people israel bee sande sea remnant shall saued notable testimony iudgement god hee afflicteth visible churche may seeme vtterly destroyed yet might reserue seede doeth wonderfully deliuer electe thoughe sewe number destruction might beyonde hope escape gulfe death hypocrite terrified shoulde vnder title fourme church nourish vaine hope imagine goe vnpunished lorde hee deliuereth destruction finde meanes preserue deliuer churche bringeth great comfort godly god neuer lette louse bridle hys wrath prouide saluation punishing iewes hys wrath burnt horrible maner yet beyonde hope menne gouerned himselfe least hys electe pearish deede woonderfull myracle saluation shoulde come iewes god fewe droppes fountaine dried vppe made floudes water whole worlde hadde procured hatred gentile wanted little one day haue beene signe giuen slaye euerye doubted many desired haue murthered titus restrained god arming allowance souldiours others greedie enough execute purpose therefore romane emperour stayed last destruction whole nation shortning preseruation seede must yet bee noted restrained violence wrath electe sake would haue fewe remaine great multitude cause hadde preferre aboue rest namely grace rested vppon people hadde adopted least couenant made none effecte chosen appoynted eternall counsell saluation therefore paule romanes 11 5 assigneth election grace cause greate people onely remnant saued lette merites menne giue place called meere good pleasure god difference betweene shoulde bee anye poynte meete saued chosen marke might sette forth matter plainly expresly addeth one woorde speaking thus electe sake hee hathe chosen hee shorten dayes participle myghte haue sufficed hee woulde expresly declare god mooued cause hee shoulde rather fauour pleased chuse establish whome hee would saue secreate purpose grace yet demaunded howe god hys electe sake moderated calamity altogither destroy iewes many reprobate desperate leud people preserued answeare easie part nation deliuered might bring forth electe mixed amongest seede separate chaffe though reprobate elect partaker tēporall preseruation yet profited aptly ascribed wonderful prouidence god directed preseruation 23 shall say vnto rehearseth againe whych hee spoken deceiuers without cause daunger lyke come thys temptation least miserable men afflicted troubled deceiued false title shoulde steade christe seeke spirites helpe god take holde sleightes deuil iewes hardly oppressed contemning theyr redemption wythdrawne theyr infidelitie suche violent remedy sathan subtilly proposed newe thynges trust whiche might draw god certainly nothing daungerous want counsell aduersities vnder pretence name god deceiued lie doe shutte vppe gate repentaunce v encrease darkenesse infidelitie length doe carye v headlong menne amased wythout hope recouerie madnesse respecte great danger conuenient shoulde rehearsed especially sith christe declareth false prophet shall throughly furnished deceiue signes wonder whych shal amase mindes simple sith god doeth testifie presence hys power myracles therefore seales true doctrine meruaile deceiuers doe gette credite thereby suche maner scorning doeth god reuenge vnthankefulnesse menne might beleeue lye whiche refused truthe shoulde blinded shut theyr eye light offered yet trieth constancye wythall whych appeareth muche better subtelties ouerwhelme sith lord sayeth antichristes lying prophet shall furnished wyth myracles cause papistes shoulde vnder thys pretence bee proude shoulde afraide glorious boasting confirme theyr superstition myracles sonne god foretolde suche meanes faith many shoulde ouerthrowne vvherefore wise menne ought esteeme account sufficient themselues prooue thys kinde doctrine excepte thys meanes myracles ouerthrowen brought nothing whereby authoritie well lawe gospell established aunsweare certaine marke spirite grauen whych shoulde putte faithfull doubte feare erring ofte god doeth shewe foorth hys power confirming hys child woorketh confusedly shoulde appeare manifest distinction shew free deceite note myracles confirme doctrine doctrine also doeth shyne foorth scattereth cloudes wherewyth sathan darkeneth mindes simple bee short desire auoide subtelties let v holde signes doctrine ioyned togither may separate 24 possible shoulde deceiue electe thys added make menne afraide faithfull mighte carefully apply bende themselues beware false prophet shoulde passe wyth suche vnbrideled libertie shoulde haue great power giuen deceiue easie matter entrappe guile secure heedelesse people therefore christ exhorteth stirreth vppe disciple watche hee telleth also cause shoulde bee troubled newnesse matter shoulde see manye euery place caried errour hee commaundeth hys bee carefull least sathan circumuent ere aware againe giueth great occasion hope well wherein myght quietly repose themselues hee promiseth vnder defence keeping god safe guile sathan therefore thoughe estate godly fraile brittle yet haue sure pillar shewed heere whereupon may rest possible shoulde fall away saluation whyche haue sonne god faithfull keeper haue strong defence themselues may resist assaultes sathan christes sheepe whome manne take hys hande iohn 10 28 must noted strength assurednesse saluation resteth v secreat election god though saluation kept faith 1 pet 1 5 sayde yet behoueth v goe wee therefore safe father hath giuen v sonne sonne sayeth nothing shall pearish committed 25 beholde haue tolde marke setteth downe meaning lorde fully take yee heede beholde haue shewed thing woordes taught without excuse ouerthrowne offence whereof christ hath spoken sith god shoulde rule v sufficient v warned time pleased hym calleth himselfe faithfull sayeth suffer v tempted farther shall able beare 1 cor 10 13 shall neuer without power resist slouthfulnesse nouryshe infirmitie 26 beholde desart luke mixeth speache answeare christ pharisies asked comminge kingdome god sayd come obseruation followeth text set downe luke tourned disciple sayd dayes come shoulde see one day sonne man word forewarne v walke light least darkenesse nyghte ouertake v sharp spurre prouoke profite long enioyed presence christ sith heard grieuous trouble hand known whether christ gaue disciple twise warning one thing thinke probable mention made cōming kingdom god luke added sentence haue set downe though spoken time rare matter haue sene otherwher place ignorance diuersly wrested reader may haue natural vnderstā ding must note opposition betwene secreat place open spreading kingdom christ farre neare sodain vnloked comming lightning east vvest know false christes agreeable grosse foolish ignorance nation could haue gathered power corner desart dennes secreat place might forceable strong hande haue shaken power romane empire sense therefore whosoeuer gathereth rich secret place might armes recouer lybertie nation dooth falsely challenge himselfe christ hee sent bee redeemer sodeinly vnlooked spread grace quarter worlde two contrarye one shutte vp redemption corner spread whole world meanes disciple taught seeke redeemer secrete place iudea would sodenlye stretch coastes hys kingdome euen vttermost endes earth wonderfull speede spreadinge gospel short time partes worlde notable testimony power god coulde brought passe witte manne light gospell lightning assoone shineth presentlye spread self one end world therefore christ dooth without consideration commend heauenly glory circumstance describing largenes kingdome shew destruction iudea could hindraunce would reigne 28 vvheresoeuer dead carkasse meaning shiftes soeuer sathan shall endeuour drawe child god backe hether thether yet holy band vnitie resteth christ wherewith meete shuld holden bound whence commeth diuision confusion manye fall awaye christ onely staye strength therefore prescribed meane nourishe holy vnitie least fallinge errours shoule teare body church asunder continue fast setled christ must bee noted dilygentlye christ doth tye v eyther supremacy seate rome trifle knotte onelye would hee tie church togeather place would looke head whereof followeth whosoeuer doe cleaue pure fayth daunger schisme let romanists goe cry schismatikes doe suffer themselues alienated christe faith might bee enthralled theefe interpretation papist sottish take company professe one faith eagle allegorically expounded sharpe quicke sighted menne euident christ hadde purpose call child god keepe wheresoeuer dispearsed doth heere call simplye bodye carkasse christe attributeth nothing eagle agreeth rauens vulture v nature countrey inhabite neither firmenes fancy others saye death christ odoriferous allured electe god iudgment purpose christ reason lesse greater great wisdome byrdes many canne come together place farre distant one carkasse shame faithfull come togeather authour lyfe onely true foode matth 24 mark 13 luke 21 29 immediatelye tribulation dayes shall sunne bee darkened moone shall giue light starres shall fall heauen power heauen shalbe shaken 30 shall appeare signe sonne man heauen shall kinreds earth morne shal see sonne manne come cloudes heauen power greate glorye 31 hee shall sende aungelles greate seunde trumpet shall gather togeather elect foure windes one ende heauen 24 moreouer day tribulation sunne shal wax darke moone shal giue light 25 starres heauen shal fall power heauen shal shake 26 shal see sonne manne comming cloudes great power glorye 27 shall send angel shal gather together elect foure windes vtmoste parte heauen 25 shalbe signes sun moone star vpon earth trouble among nation perplexitie sea water shal roare 26 men hart shal fayle feare looking thing shal come worlde power heauen shall shaken 27 shall see sonne manne come cloude power great glory 28 thinges beginne come passe look vp lift vp head redemption •• aweth neere christ manifesteth kingdome fully whereof hee demaunded firste promiseth haue beene vexed many trouble redemption shall come time appointed aunswere specially bent strengthen make disciple good comfort least faint mind troublesome stirres therefore hee doth simply speake comming vseth propheticall kinde speaking euery man specially bent contrarily necessary abide sharper kinde temptation could seeme absurde beholde kingdome christ whereof prophet royally spoken onely despised oppressed crosse couered many reproach ouerwhelmed kinde affliction could maiestie haue beene sette vppon mighte haue darkened sunne moone starres shaken whole estate world haue altered vsuall course nature lord aunswereth temptation saying though prophesies presently perfourmed yet length shall fulfilled meaning therefore thinges spoken beefore wonderfull shaking earth heauen must restrained beginning kingdom prophet spake whole course euen comming goale conceaue purpose christe wordes easie vnderstoode namely heauen shal presently darkened church shall haue abyden many affliction glory maiestie kingdome shoulde appeare laste comming christ deferred time fulfilling thinges beganne appeare resurrection whereof god giuen onely taste hee might leade way hope patience manner christe helde mindes faithfull suspence laste daye least thinke prophetes hadde spoken vaine restoring come laye long time ouerwhelmed vnder thicke cloud affliction interpreter doe corruptly take affliction dayes destruction ierusalem rather signifieth vniuersall floud euilles whereof christe spake hee perswadeth argument patience affliction shal haue length happy ioyful end haue sayd long church shall worlde itshall cloudy darke time assoone misery shall come ende daye shall come wherein glorye maiestie shall appeare wee cannot imagine sunne shall darkened successe shall shew hee meaneth starres shal fall indeede according imagination menne therefore luke onelye saieth shall signes sunne moone starres meaning therefore frame heauen shall bee shaken starres themselues shall thought fall luke also maketh reporte fearefull shaking sea men shall feare doubt become astonied summe creature heauen aboue earth belowe shalbe cryers preacher cite menne appeare fearfull iudgment seate contempt whereof shall wickedly liue wantonnes euen last day 30 shall appeare signe sonne manne christe worde dooth put manifest difference betweene present estate hys kingdome glory thereof come hee seemeth manner graunt maiesty christe cannot bee scene plainelye clowde affliction neyther menne feele redemption hee offereth confused estate thing doe nowe beholde partely darkeneth mindes partelye ouerwhelmeth grace christ causeth vāquish eye least sense flesh take hold saluation hath obtained therefore saieth hee shew himselfe plainely last cō minge fullye furnished power heauen wherewith banner sette vppe high hee wyll turne eye woorlde vnto beecause hee saw greater parte menne contemne doctrine sette againste kingdome hee saieth withall people shall sorrowe lamente beecause meete breake rebel peeces destroy despised power absent speaketh partely might terrifying proude disobediente drawe repentaunce partely also might strengthen mindes childrē crooked dealinges world securitie wicked small occasion offence seeme haue god derision yet escape vnpunished nothing daungerous bee caught bayghtes prosperity enioy dryue v reuerence god therefore least faythfull enuie drunken mirth wicked christ saieth ioy shall bee turned length weeping gnashing teeth iudgement alludeth 12 chap prophet zachariah 11 verse god declaring notable example iudgement hand saieth family shall lament man mourneth buriall onelye sonne vvherefore cause man shuld looke conuersion world shall feele length haue pearsed shall late without profit followeth declaration signe shall see sonne manne comminge clowdes liued vppon earth estate despised seruaunt meanes hee declareth glorye kyngdome heauenlye earthlye disciple falsely imagined 31 hee shall send aungels hee describeth maner power send aungels shall gather electe vtmost coastes world highest heauen doth signifie farthest region christ speaketh hyperbolycally teache elect though taken earth cast headlōg aire yet shal gathered together may liue vnder head life euerlasting enioy enheritance haue hoped purpose christe comfort disciple least great affliction church dismaye vvherefore oft see church eyther molested subtilty sathan torne asunder crueltie wicked troubled false doctrine tossed stormes let v learne looke gathering together seeme incredible v let power aungels helpe v christ dooth therefore propose lift v vp aboue meanes man yeelde though church malice men nowe vexed diuerse time driuen flighte banished tossed waues bruised miserably torne asunder hath nothing certeine world yet must bee good courage lord gather togeather helpe man heauenly power cannot meanes bee hindered lv 28 thinges shall beginne come passe luke dooth euidently set downe consolation wherewith christe maketh gladde heart disciple though sentence hath nothing contrary word matthew expounded euē yet sheweth plainely end said aungels shal come gather elect together necessary ioy godly opposed againste sorrow trouble common world difference bee noted betweene reprobate least bee afraide comming christe vve know scripture doth onely speake diuersly laste iudgement thing lord doth put dayly practise accordingly directeth speach either faithfull vnbeleeuers vvhat haue doe day lord saieth prophet amos 5 18 cloudy day darkenes light sorrow ioy destruction saluation contrariwise prophet zachary 9 9 commaundeth daughter syon reioyce comming king good cause isaias 35 4 saieth day bringeth wrath vengaunce reprobate daye mercy redemption faithfull christe therefore declareth light ioy shal arise comming wicked shalbe confoūded feare shal reioice saluation neere therefore paule 1 cor 1 7 giueth note shuld watch day comming lord crowne full felycitie ioy deferred 2 tim 4 8 therefore heere called redemption rom 8 22 shall truely fully enioy deliuerance tree al trees▪ 30▪ vvhen nowe shoote forth ye seeing knowe selues sommer neere 31 likwise yee ye see thinges come passe know ye kingdom god neere 32 verely say vnto age shall passe till thinges bee done 33 heauen earth shall passe away wordes shall passe away doe knowe whether signe mentioned euidente token comming christe hande troublesome estate doe certeinely know sommar hand tree beginne wax greene christ iudgement meaneth thing whē tree nipt together winter force cold hardnes dissolued springe seeme brittle doe also open young boughes may haue passage force strength church nothinge hindred weakened affliction manne woulde iudge inwarde sappe spread bodye tree waxeth tender gathereth strēgth causeth spring almoste dead lorde restoreth child fullye corruption outward manne summe menne thinke church destroyed reason weake frayle estate rather hope immortall glorye whereunto lorde crosse affliction prepareth paule speaketh seuerall member muste bee fulfilled whole bodye outwarde manne perishe yet inwarde manne renewed daylye 2 corinthian 4 16 whiche obscurelye reported matthewe marke knowe neere euen doores plainelye expounded luke kingdome god hande kingdome god taken beginning ofte otherwhere full perfection according sense christ taught apprehend kingdome god gospell peace ioye fayth spirituall ryghteousnesse soughte blessed reste glory whiche layde vppe vnder hope vntyll last daye 34 generation shall passe though christe speaketh thus vniuersally yet hee doth generally meane al misery church simplye saieth one age shal passe whatsoeuer hath spoken shall approued successe within fiftie yeares citie destroyed temple ouerthrowne whole kingdome miserably wasted world pride lifted vp selfe god also extreamely bent ouerthrow doctrine saluation false teacher arose whiche peruerted sincere gospell theyr falsehoodes relygion wonderfullye shaken whole companye godly miserably vexed though euilles continued manye age yet christe spake truelye faythfull shoulde ende one age feele deede true experience howe true prophesie apostle suffered thinges see daye purpose christe promise disciple calamity shortly haue end hee haue beene contrary himselfe▪ hee sayde ende yet hee might encourage bear patience hee expreslye saide beelonged age therefore meaning prophesie euilles farre posteritie see manye age doe nowe hange ouer great aboundaunce myserye present age shoulde taste yet lorde heaping kinde misery vppon one age doth free posterity thē commandeth disciple prepare themselues constantly beare al thing 35 heauen earth shall passe woordes myght bee creditte hee proueth certeintie comparison namelye certeine sure frame whole world interpreter doe diuerselye expounde manner speach doe referre passinge heauen earth laste daye transitory estate shalbe abolyshed others doe expounde thus whole frame woorlde shall perishe rather prophesie shoulde passe awaye whiche wee hearde euen beecause bee doubted christe purposed moue mindes disciple looke vppe aboue worlde thinke hee noteth continuall alteration seene woorlde hee shoulde haue sayde woordes muste bee valued vncerteine vnconstante estate woorlde knowe chaunge alteration worlde howe readye mindes bee carryed awaye therefore christe forrbiddeth disciple bee carried awaye fashion worlde looke alofte glass god prouidence hath foretolde thinges shall come passe yet verye profitable doctrine bee gathered place saluation beecause establyshed vppon promise christe dooth ebbe flowe vnconstaunt worlde slandeth sure also fayth must ascende vp aboue heauen earth christ himselfe 36 daye houre manne knoweth aungels christe meant sentence holde mindes faythfull suspēce least vayne imagination shoulde appoynte certeine tyme last redemption vvee knowe howe witte dooth wander vaine desire wee haue knowe beecommeth v christe also sawe disciple hasted tryumph time therefore woulde daye comming hoped desired yet manne shoulde bold aske come also hee woulde disciple shoulde walke light fayth vncerteine tyme shoulde patientlye waite appearaunce therefore must take heede wee bee curyous momentes poyntes time lorde alloweth v chiefe parte wisdome consisteth soberly keepe selues within limit word god menne troubled knowe day christ accompanieth angel point much pride wicked curiosity v creepe vppon earth desire reuealed v angel heauen marke addeth sonne manne also yea hee thrise foure time madde could content ignoraunce whiche sonne god himselfe refused sake beecause many thought vnmeete christ endeuoured mollifie hardnesse speach comment may bee driuen seeke shift lewdnesse arrians whoe place went proue christ true god therfore opiniō christ knew last day hee reuealed vnto others sith plaine christ aungelles ignoraunt alike wee muste seeke apte exposition sette briefly take away obiections thinke reproach sonne god sayd ignoraunce doe obiect first easily aunswered wee knowe two nature christe ioyned one person yet either hadde propertie remaininge selfe especiallye godheade gaue place shewed selfe ofte humane nature wrought seuerally appertained thereunto perfourmaunce office mediatour vvherfore absurditie christ knew thinges yet ignoraunt something according iudgement man otherwise could haue beene subiect sorrow griefe like vnto v obiect absurd christ could ignoraunt punishment sinne first trifle fondly say ignoraunce aungelles came sinne foolish point know christ therefore take flesh vppon might beare vpon punishmēts due sinnes christ knew man latter day derogate diuine nature mortall doubt regard office whiche inioyned father hee saide office place right hand left expounded simply say nothing meaning sent father commaundement long conuersant amongste mortall menne also doe vnderstand nowe respecte hee came downe v mediatour vntill discharged office hadde power giuen whiche hee tooke hee rysen agayn saith power ouer al thing giuen vnto math 24 mark 13 luke 17 37 dayes noe likewise shall euery moment might shake slouth moue watch better saieth ende shall come sodenly world shall drowned beastly slouthfulnesse euen day noe nation swallowed vppe looked gorged themselues pleasure delightes shortly sodomite wallowed lustes feared nothing consumed fire heauen sith world shal giuen securitie last day cause faythfull frame themselues example common people nowe vnderstand purpose christe absurditie two euangelists hold themselues satisfied one example thogh christe proposed two especiallye sith accorded poyntes mankinde sodenly swallowed vp wallowed idlenes pleasure fewe onely excepted saieth men eate dranke made marriage applyed themselues worldly matter god destroyed whole world floud sodō lightninges declareth wordes occupied commodity pleasure present life chaunge feared though hee doth presently commaund disciple take heede surfeiting care world yet hee doth place directly condemn intemperancie time rather stubbornnesse whereby came passe carelesly despysing threatninges god tasted horrible destruction therfore promise themselues durable estate stay goe carelesly forwardes accustomed way corrupt condemned selfe prouide necessity except would oppose grosse blockishnes iudgemente god might runne blindly manner sinne none heauen reuenge christ doth declare last age world shalbe altogeather blockishe shall thinke vppon nothinge present life deferring care longe time continuing wonted course life earth shuld continue one estate similitude apt set eye befell beholding course worlde alwaies one estate shal deceiue v make v beleeue world shall stand euer within three dayes euery man possessed thinges hadde great quietnes earth drowned water fiue city consumed fire 39 knewe nothing til floud came fountaine cause ignoraunce incredulitie blinded mindes apostle dooth againe declare hebrewes 11 7 noe eies faith sawe secrete vengeaunce god yet farre speedily reuerenced christ doth cōpare noe rest world lot sodomite faithfull might learne good comfort framed perseueraunce may bydde pleasaunt baightes transitory lyfe farewell may willingly gladly haste forwardes heauē also third sentence luke addeth shoulde loose soules▪ would saue perswadeth faithful desire earthly life shuld hinder shuld courage hasten euē midst many deathes saluation laid vp heauē christ doth aptly describ frailty present life whē saith soules zoogoneisthai begotten engendred life whē lost much shuld deny men life vpon earth beecause renouncing world beginning true perfect life afterwards lu addeth mat also hath men woman shal separated least felowshippes wherin men mutually bound ech world shuld hinderāce stay vnto godly falleth oft time whil look vpon others none thē steppeth one foote forward therfore yt euery man might freed liberty frō al let might shift speed christ declareth yt 2 ye one cōpanion shalbe taken refused necessary whosoeuer ioyned togeather separated holy fellowshippe holinesse causeth honest woman ioyne honest man child shuld follow father purpose christ onelye cut away al let exhort al make speede least prest forward vaine waite fellowes luke addeth sentence vvheresoeuer body c may restrained last day disciple asked question vvhere lorde shal stand fast many fall away remaine safe great stormes place defence shall ioyned together hide selues christ reported matthew saieth banner standard al assured vnitie vnder al child god must gathered 42 vvatch therefore exhortation sette downe luke playne speciall take heede least heartes oppressed surfeiting drunkennesse care world certeinly lyuing intemperately hath sens ouercome meate wine neuer lifte vp minde meditate vppon heauenly life pleasure flesh dooth make man drunken al woulde hasten kingdome christe muste take dilygent heede surfeit worlde one word woulde vouchsafe drawe v deepe troublesome labyrinth hee would place v safe sure presence sonne cannot placed except escape infinite number deathes beecause enough escapinge manye daungers passe ouer purpose woulde shoulde bee kept secrete v wee might neuer bee carelesse watch continuallye tryall faith patience faithful al life wandring idlely pleasure shoulde space three dayes beefore prepare 48 hee knewe yet committe thinges worthye stripe shalbe beaten stripe vnto soeuer muche giuen much shalbe required men much commit aske 49 come put fire earth desire bee already kindled 50 notwithstanding must baptised baptisme howe grieued vntill ended 4 • good man house knew luke doth rehearse saying christ place mathew doth meruaile 12 chapter hee gathering togeather summe doctrine many sermon haue shewed hee setteth downe parable also general preface disciple loynes girded lightes burning hand shuld waite maister sentence aunswered parable followeth litle mathew wise virginnes foolish christ dooth aptly note woordes faythfull passe straungers world first hee opposeth girding loynes slouthfulnes burning light darkenes ignoraunce first therefore christ commandeth disciple ready prepared take iourney shoulde speede passe earth seeking resting place heauen warning profitable though prophane men speake short speedy course life man yet see rest tye themselues vnto earth god vouchsafeth honor child acknowledge themselues straungers vpon earth ready al time go forward also continually go forward way heauen compassed darkenes euery side long liue world furnisheth thē lightes take iourney night first commended diligent speedines perfourme course certeine direction least faithful wandring way weary themselues vaine otherwise better go faintly way rashely runne blinde vnknown way speaketh girding vp loynes phrase speach taken common maner easterne people lv 36 yee selues like vnto men hee vseth similytude mathew speaketh shorter matter compareth himselfe housholder feasteth merely marriage seeketh mery otherwhere frō home yet haue seruauntes liue modestly soberly home applying lawful labour cotinually waiting returne therefore though sonne god take vp blessed rest heauen bee absent v yet hath appoynted euery manne office absurde v sleepe idlenes furthermore promiseth returne behoueth v stand readines receiue al time least find v sleeping mortall man thinketh due vnto houre soeuer hee shall returne home seruauntes ready meete much lawfullye doth lord require shoulde sober watch alwayes waiting comming hee might make willinger saieth earthly maisters delighted readinesse seruauntes also serue maisters doe vse doe thus dooth sometimes fall maister milde gentle nature dooth admitte seruauntes owne table fellowes yet demaunded sith scripture dooth euery call v child light ephesian 5 8 1 thessalonian 5 5 lorde dooth also giue light vnto v woorde wee might walke mydst daye shoulde lord compare lyfe night watch answere obiection easily made wordes peter whoe teacheth worde god shineth burning light wee may see way euen darke place 2 pet 1 19 therfore must noted must take iourney obscure darkenesse world yet light heauenlye doctrine going beefore v sure wandring way especially sith christ selfe doth duety sunne vnto v mat 43 bee sure christ similitude doth exhort disciple keepe diligēt watch mā heareth theeues wandring abroad night feare suspition suffer sleepe therefore sith admonished expresly tolde christ shall come theefe must alwayes watche least finding v sleeping shoulde ouerwhelme v wicked sluggishnes cannot excused especially sith feared breaking downe wall losse rich deadly wound destruction soule take heede wordes therefore bend purpose christes warninge shoulde waken v although last iudgement long deferred yet hangeth ouer v continually therefore time knowne neerenes daunger absurd become slouthfull 45 vvho faithfull seruaunt luke reporteth place expresly peter question set downe occasion new parable christ declared tyme slouthfull daungerous comming theefe peter demaunded whether doctrine generall belonged onelye twelue haue seene place disciple wōt alwayes thinke themselues euill dealt except exempted common sorte menne preferred farre aboue others nowe taught estate finally desired hath little pleasure men amased looke hither thither answeare christ tendeth meete euery one common sort watche may suffered apostle sleepie vvherefore christ first generally exhorted whole housholde watche comming nowe hee requireth chiefe seruaunts haue singular care whyche therefore sette aboue others example might shewe others waye sober attendance sober temperaunce woordes declareth idle dignity bestowed vppon might haue libertye follow pleasure greater degree honour greater burden layed vppon therefore hee teacheth especially shewe theyr faithfulnesse wisedome vvhosoeuer called honour maye hereby learne bounde onely labour fashion apply theyr diligence witte performance office sufficient priuate seruaunts apply themselues priuate woorke behooueth stewardes proceede theyr office haue care whole housholde side christe vpbraideth vnthankfulnesse beinge preferred aboue others answeared theyr honor wherfore doth lord preferre others faithfulnesse wisedome shoulde excell men men generally appoynted soberly diligently watche pastours shuld become slouthfull vile least excused afterwarde also prouoketh diligent hope rewarde 48 euill seruaunt shall say christ wordes doeth briefly declare whereof euill seruaunts became carelesse namely trusting delaying comming theu doe willingly bryng darkenesse vppon themselues imagine day reckening account shall neuer come vnder pretence absence christ perswade themselues shall escape vnpunished cannot looking howe oft euer befal v shake sluggishnesse shoulde much bridle wantonnesse keepe v caryed wantonnesse cannot vehement effectuall exhortation mooue setting foorth seuere iudgement seat manne escape vvherefore euery one v may diligently apply himselfe watch performance callinge may diligently modestly keepe himselfe within bandes lette v thinke vppon sodaine comminge highe lorde contempte whereof reprobate reioyce christ doeth also note way easie matter impudencie growe man hauing shaken bridle hath cast headlong sinne christ doth say dissolute wicked seruāt one frowardly behaueth himselfe troubling whole house wickedly abuseth authority committed exercising cruelty vpō fellow seruants want wasting master good without reproche terrour addeth also punishment common one namely suche vnbrideled wickednesse deserueth greater punishment lv 47 seruaunt great weight circumstaunce onely added luke man shall wittinglye willingly contemne lorde hee worthy greater punishment comparison greater lesse made ende seruaunt sinneth ignoraunce escapeth punishment shall become peruerse disobedient seruaunt sette purpose treadeth maisters power vnder feete must remembred sette vp rule gouerne church sinne ignoraunce doe peruerselye wickedly defraud lord yet hereof may generall doctrine gathered vaine shift men vnder pretence ignorance free themselues guiltines mortall man doth callenge right vnto himselfe examine seruauntes according owne wil least thing disorderly confusedly done much authority hath son god whosoeuer serue carefully desire instructed commaundementes may vncerteinely pleasure doe wil must wholly appoyntment especially hee commaundeth v must bee done dooth alwayes aunswere louinglye seeke vnto certeine ignoraunce alwaies companion carelesse grosse negligence vve see vaine defence hee bee blamed sinned ignoraunce heauenly iudge saieth contrary though fault shall haue lesse punishment yet shall go altogether vnpunished ignoraunce dooth excuse horrible vengeance shal fal vpon sinne set purpose furiously run headlōg owne conscience prouoke god vvherefore knowledge man hath much greater sinne excepte obedience dooth follow knowledge vvhereby appeareth vile vaine excuse make refusing day cleare light gospel doe maintaine frowardnes ignoraunce father ye shielde ignorance strong enough beare iudgement god graunt faultes offender spared equitie pardon shuld graunted sinne willingly purposed malice rage god 48 whome soeuer much giuen christ teacheth circumstaunce chosen disciple shall bee grieuouslye punyshed neglectinge callinge shall wantonlye giue themselues lycentiousnesse greater manne much hee must thinke committed vnto condition time come must yeelde account vvherfore greater giftes v hath fielde tyld great charge hee yeelde aboundaunce encrease vnto lorde shall cost much eyther vnprofitable suppressing grace abusing prophanely 49 come put fire earth may easilye gathered clause one christes last sermon set luke right time meaning christe broughte greate trouble woorlde heauen earth shoulde meete together gospel metaphorically compared fire doeth violently alter shew thing therefore wheras apostle falsly imagined kingdome heauen come take sleeping quietly christe setteth terrible fire wherewith worlde must first burnt beginning appeare christ doth therby encourage disciple feele present power gospell vvhen sayeth great stirres begin waxe hotte must afraid rather good cōfort therfore reioyce see fruite labour behooueth minister gospel apply vnto themselues worlde troubled diligentlier apply calling noted fire doctrine generally burneth euery thing chaffe stubble shall consumed gold siluer purged 50 must baptised baptisme christ woordes declareth last woorke remaineth doe shoulde death consecrate renewing world shaking whereof hee maketh mention fearefull burninge mankinde full terrour hee presently declareth firste fruites offered vppe owne person least shuld afterwardes seeme grieuous disciple beare part compareth death wher baptism child god death flesh swallowed vp time doe shortly rise againe life death nothinge else passage midst water sayeth grieued vntill hee thus baptised therby may mooue euery one v example ready well beare crosse suffer death man nature desire death alteration present estate see celestiall glory blessed immortall rest side shoare desire thing onely die patiently caried also greedinesse thither faith hope doe drawe v mathewe 25 marke luke 1 kingdome heauen shall bee lykened vnto tenne virgines whiche tooke lampes went meete bridegrome 2 fiue wise fiue foolish 3 foolish tooke lampes tooke none oyle 4 wise tooke oyle vesselles wyth lampes 5 nowe bridegrome taried longe slumbred slept 6 midnight crie made beholde bridegrome commeth goe meete 7 virgin arose trimmed lampes 8 foolish sayde wise giue v oyle lampes 9 wise answeared saying vve feare least enough v goe yee rather sell buy selues 10 went buy bridegrome came ready went wedding gate shut 11 afterwardes came also virgin saying lord lord open v 12 answeared sayd verely say vnto know 13 vvatch therefore yee knowe neither day houre sonne man wil come though exhortation tendeth almost ende former shall appeare conclusion yet especially added confirme faithfull perseuerance lord knewe weake mannes nature cōmeth oft time passe long tracte time waxe faint sodaine loathsomnesse fall away might cure disease declareth disciple well furnished except able beare long vvhen end parable vnderstode cause trauaile much smal matter doe nothinge appertaine christes meaning much trouble themselues lampes vessel oyle simple naturall summe sufficient vse earnest diligence short time except continuance constancie without wearinesse christe declareth apt similitude hee exhorted disciple little furnished light might passe obscure darke place oyle supplied matche lampe doeth little little waxe dry loseth light christ sayth faithfull haue nede continuall supply vertue may nourish light kindled heart otherwise wil come passe theyr frowardnesse fall awaye middest course 1 kingdome heauen shall likened title meaneth estate church come gathered fauorable mercy messias vseth notable testimony set purpose least faithfull shoulde deceiue themselues wrong deuice blessed perfection boroweth similitude common vse life childish fantasie hierome suche others doe wrest praise virginitie christe purpose ease griefe wearinesse might conceiued delay comming therefore hee sayeth requireth nothing v woont bee performed friend solemne mariages vsuall custome younge delicate maiden shoulde honour sake brynge bridegrome bride chamber summe parable tendeth sufficient v bent ready calling except endure ende 2 fiue wise ende former chap lord especially willed steward wise mete greater burden man beareth harder matter dealeth wiselier shuld behaue requireth child god wise least running forwarde without aduice shuld cast themselues forth pray sathan appoynteth kind wisdom take care furnish thēselues necessary help performāce iourney life though time short yet heat impatience seemeth longe also oure wante suche hathe neede helpes euetye moment 5 bridegrome taried long wrest sleping worst part faithfull togither others shuld giue themselues slouthfulnesse apply themselues vanity worlde farre meaning christ course parable probable vnderstand death ceaseth vpon faithfull comming christe must onely wayte saluation nowe wee dead rest christe yet doe simply vnderstand earthly affaire wherein faithfull occupied necessity long dwell flesh thoughe neuer forgette kingdome god yet wythdrawing affaire world vaine cōpared vnto slepe cannot throughly bent meete christ diuers care doe either withdrawe make slowe entangle whereby commeth passe wakinge somewhat sleepe concerninge crye take bee spoken metaphorically sodaine comming knowe oft new vnwonted thing commeth passe menne vse commonly troubled lorde crieth vnto v euery day come vnto v shortly whole frame world shall sound foorth hys fearefull maiestie shall fill heauen earth shall onely waken sleepe shall bring foorth deade theyr graues • foolish sayd wise late repentance heere reproued feele want gate shutte remedy therfore condemned folly prouide themselues long time carelesly please thē selues owne want doe passe time wherein make gaine contemne helpes offred therefore thinke getting oyle time christ scorning ouer late knowledge declareth punishment shall receiue theyr slouthfulnesse namely shall finde themselues empty dry without fruite 9 vvee feare least enough v vvee knowe lorde doth therfore bestowe gift diuersly euery man according proper measure might mutually help ech others bestow cōmon laid vp either meanes nourished churche holy societie member christe noteth heere time burden taken away call iudgement seat euery manne may receiue according hath behaued himselfe body therefore doeth rightly compare portion grace receiued layde vppe euery man vnto prouision made one manne iourney serue sufficiently moe furthermore whyche presently added goe yee buy selues admonition vpbraiding sense time buy neglected best prouide oyle want therof cannot recouered papistes doe fondly 38 people came morning heare temple christ prosecuteth doctrine first described parable expoūdeth plainly without figure sum faithful stir vp themselues desire liuing holily righteously eye faith looke vp heauēly life lieth hid shalbe length reuealed last cōming christ whē saith shal sit throne glory shal come angel opposeth last appearance confused disordered trouble earthly warfare haue said therefore appeare shuld haue set kingdom presently order therefore disciple haue nede hope patience least long delay shuld tire vvherby gather added disciple remoued frō error present soden felicity shuld suspēd mind vntil second cōming christ meane season fal away waxe faint therfore sayeth shal length renouned name king although beginneth kingdō vpon earth sitteth nowe right hād father might great authority gouerne heauen earth yet throne yet erected sight mē diuine maiesty shal far fully appear shine last day thē shal ful effect glory appear tast faith therfore christ sitteth throne heauē far forth necessary raign brideling enemy defence church shal openly ascende tribunall seat may establish perfect order heauē earth may tread enemy vnder fete may gather faithfull one fellowship eternal blessed life short wil shew forth dede end father hath giuen kingdō sayth wil come glory hee uersant vppon earth mortall man lay hidde vnder contemptible habite seruaunt calleth glory place attributeth father euen sense simply meaneth glory god shone onely father hid 3 • shalbe gathered nation shall separate extolleth kingdome great royall title disciple might learne hope felicity cōceiued theyr mindes one thing sufficed nation deliuered misery wherwith oppressed myght appeare god made couenant vaine abraham posterity christ extendeth frute redēption bringeth shalbe iudge whole world might exhort faithful liue godly saith shal common bothe good badde bring wyth hym reward laid vp summe sayeth estate kingdome shall rightly ordred ryghteous shall obtaine crowne glorye wicked shall haue reward paied haue deserued nowe separation goates lambes deferred vnto daye declareth wicked mingled holy godly men lyue together one flock god comparison semeth taken ezechiel 34 21 lorde complaineth vntowardnesse goates pushe leane sheepe wyth theyr horne spoyle pasture trouble water saith reuenge christe wordes doe tend faithfull shoulde thinke estate sharpe nowe compelled liue goates yea abide many push trouble shoulde take heede least corruption sinnes infecte also thirdly might know loose labour liuing godly righteously difference describing saluation godly beginneth free loue god whereby direction god spirite aspire righteousnesse life predestinated life heereunto also appertaineth sayeth little kingdome prepared beginning world possession whereof shall sent last day though may easily obiected rewarde layde vppe merites shoulde come yet man way woordes without contention graunt secreat commendation grace god christ also doeth simply call faithfull possesse kingdome haue gotten merites expresly sayeth shoulde giuen heires yet end noted whereunto lord regarde though life godly nothinge else miserable grieuous banishmēt earth scarcely bear though trauaile vnder harde want vnder reproach trouble may stronge valiant minde ouercome lettes lord declareth kingdome prepared place notable exhortation patience menne certainly perswaded beare vaine therefore least pride wicked wherin doe glory make mind fainte least owne misery shoulde weaken hope lette v alwayes remember enheritance remaineth v heauen dependeth doubtfull case prepared v god borne yea say euery one electe christ doeth heere call blessed father absurdity onely sayd heere kingdome prepared beginning world place creation heauen earth kingdome heauen respecte good woorkes deserue righteousnesse workes shoulde authours getting themselues god doeth iustifie whome hath first chosen furthermore though direction spirit shuld aspire loue righteousnesse yet doe neuer satisfie lawe god reward due called rewarde whiche giuen freely christe doeth recken vppe partes godly holy life doeth note example sake poyntes charitye whereby declare doe worship god though woorshippe god excelleth loue menne therefore faith inuocation desired almes yet christe doeth without cause sette downe testimony true right • ousnesse apparant seene man despising god deale wel men mercy shuld nothing auaile appeasing god meane season defrauded owne right christe therefore doeth say summe righteousnesse consisteth almes signes may moste easily seene declareth liue godly rightuously truely faithfull doe professe mouth diligent exercise doe shewe doe worship god vvherfore fantasticall men preposterously vnder pretence place withdrawe themselues cruell sacriledge wordes also declareth acknowledgeth benefites done done freely without regarde rewarde truely commandeth good hungry naked stranger prisoner hope recōpence necessary loke owne accord bindeth himselfe vnto v otherwise might seeme lost suffereth reckened amongst account doth name commend faithful onely would others shuld altogither despised nearer manne approcheth vnto god much dearer must v though common band society yet child god haue strong sacred knot frendship amongst thēselues therefore sith mete prefer houshold faith stranger christ doth especially name though world also shee hath done shal spoken remembraunce 1 feast vnleauened bread drew neare called passeouer 2 hie priest scribe sought howe might kil feared people christ doth cōfirm forewarned disciple oft last forewarning doth euidently declare howe willingly offered himselfe death necessary god could appeased sacrifice obedience minde also thereby meete offence least disciple supposing brought death necessity constrainte fall away sentence profitable two wayes first might manifest sonne god willingly submit death hee might reconcile worlde vnto father meanes whereby either guiltinesse sinnes coulde washed away righteousnesse obtained v dyed one oppressed violēce could escape offred himselfe willingly death therfore sayth cōmeth purposely hierusalem die liberty go backe againe passe away time safe secreat place wittingly willingly goeth forth amongst euen appoynted time thoughe disciple profited nothing time warning giuen obedience yelded father yet afterwards faith muche strengthened doctrine also day receiue smal profit therby setteth v liuely glasse freewil offering sacrifice whereby transgression worlde blotted beholde sonne god gladly boldly going forwarde death conquerour death 3 assembled together mat meaneth assembled space 2 dayes hee setteth downe hystory declare christ told mā day appoynted death coniectures could haue beene gathered ennemies
