simon leper contrariety iohn saith feete annoynted say head vve doe certainly know oyntments cast fete ther aboundance shed wont iohn amplify sayth feete wet marke also reporteth alablaster boxe broken oyntment powred vppon head doeth well appeare ran downe feete therefore certaine doe report one hystory 8 disciple saw also common thing amongst euangelists attribute moe begunne one consented iohn sayth iudas betrayer christ began murmuring mathew marke doe bring disciple none euer durst haue grudged vngodly grudging iudas firebrand set fire began vnder good colour condemne wastfull expence taken easily infection example taught danger commeth malitious poisonfull tongue good simple modest nature except wisely take hede themselues yet deceiued wyth false report doe easily fall wrong iudgements christes disciple keeping company iudas caried light fond opiniō shal become v easily admit talebearer commonly malitiously quarrell thing well done heere may also gathered le • rashly geue sentence matter throughly knowen disciple take holde whyche iudas spake hadde pretence doe rashly geue wrong iudgement meete haue made better inquirie whether deede beene worthy reprehension especially sith maister present whose iudgement shuld haue abidden know except word god doth goe sentence preposterously giuen none v paul teacheth rom 14 10 liueth dieth vnto himselfe wee must appeare iudgement seat christ shall yeelde account 2 cor 5 10 though great difference betweene iudas others hee sought wickedly cunningly cloake hys theft caryed away meere simplicitie yet see howe vnaduisednesse drawne christe ioyned iudas 10 vvhy trouble yee woman maruell christ whose whole life rule example temperance frugality shoulde nowe allowe immoderate charge whiche seemeth neare superfluous needelesse delites maner defence vseth must noted doth say woman done well woulde haue done daily done hee sayeth acceptable god iust cause shuld done therfore though christ desired vse oyntment yet respect circumstance annoynting pleased vvhereby gather particular dedes sometime accepted god yet may made example followed bee doubted mary mooued secreat motion spirite annoynte christe certaine oft sainctes called extraordinary woorke driuen vnwonted motion least shoulde attempt thing direction gouernement god commandement enioyned mary annoynting neither needeful haue beene law set downe one worke heauenlye calling rule wel god refuseth soeuer men take hand themselues mary gouerned motion spirite certaine perswasion faith performe duty christ one action woman defended answeare christ godly ioy men hereby defended may satisfied workes approued god commeth oft passe godly men reproued also vniustly condē ned openly yet haue conscience bearinge witnesse haue done nothing commandement god respecte accounted proud despising peruerse iudgements world doe satisfie themselues onely allowance god hard temptation canne hardly corrupt consent many must grieue v doctrine must noted none time throughly encouraged doe well excepte depende onely allowance god therefore christe doeth heere make difference good euill pleasure whē sayeth womannes woorke good whiche disciple hadde already condemned doeth speache reprooue rashnesse menne iudge list vvee therefore armed defence must learne neglecte rumour euer spredde abroade v worlde know men condemne approued god isaias 50 7 oppressed slaunders wicked calleth god witnesse paule appealeth iudgement 1 corrinthians 4 4 therefore lette v learne regarde iudgementes menne oure example may taught obey god worlde shall wyth greate clamour rise vppe againste v lette comforte satisfie v accounted euill vppon earth pronounced good heauen 11 haue poore alwayes christ doth simply defend anoynting shuld follow declareth cause wherfore acceptable god cōueniēt yt shuld wise obserued least togither papist preposterously deuise sumptuous rite worshipping god whē heard christ would mary anoynt imagined delited incense waxe candle magnificall ornament like pomp cause al glorious ceremony thought could worship god aright la •• great charge christ doth plainly except thing pleased done shoulde accepted done afterwards sayth pore shuld alwais world distinguisheth betwene daily worship vsed amongst faithfull extraordinary ceased hys ascension heauen vvould bestow mony wel vpon true sacrifice let v bestow vpō pore christ sayth shal alwaies v worshipped outward pomp vve know assuredly experience faith fele present v spiritual power grace visibly conuersant amongst v receiue earthly honor hāds outragious obstinat doe thrust vpon fantastical charge refusing also saith pore shalbe alwaies hereby gather fortune many want determinate coūsel god left amongst v v exercise charity vpō sum place though lord cōmandeth haue dedicated yet requireth worshippe bestowed vppon spirituall requireth outward expēces rather wold thing bestowed vppon poore superstition hadde beene fondly bestowed vpon worship 12 shee bury mee christ wordes confirmeth said pretious oyntment accepted sauour respect burial namely signe wold declare graue shoulde yelde forth pleasant sauour shoulde breath life saluation worlde therefore iohn praiseth mary reserued oyntment day burial perfecte truth figure appeared christ come graue perfume one house worlde comfortable quickening sauour death childishe thing reiterate neither reason profit 13 vvhersoeuer gospel shalbe preached foretelleth deede mary shoulde honoured doctrine gospell shalbe praised vvherby gather workes valued opinion men testimony woorde god sayeth memoriall shall renowmed throughout whole worlde doeth comparison sharply reproue disciple consent people yea euen straungers dwell farthest partes world deede shall praised present froward condemne christ doth also louingly reprooue disciple thought honourably kingdome meete sentence callinge gentile testified whereuppon oure saluation established howe gospell shoulde preached throughout worlde haue shewed math 24 matth 26 mark 14 luk 22 14 one twelue • alled iudes iscariot went vnto chife priestes 15 saide ye giue wil delyuer vnto appoynted vnto thirty peeces siluer 16 time sought oportunitie betray 17 firste day feast vnleauened bread disciple came iesus saying vnto wilt thou wee prepare thee eate passeouer 18 said goe citie manne say maister saieth time hand keepe passeouer thine house diciples 19 disciple iesus giuen thē charge made ready passeouer 20 euen come sat twelue 10 iudas iscariot one twelue went away vnto high priestes betray vnto 11 heard glad promised would giue money therefore hee sought hee might conuenientlye betray 12 first day vnleauened bread sacrificed passeouer disciple saide vnto wilt thou go prepare thou maist eat passeouer 13 sent forth two disciple saide vnto go ye citie shal man meete bearinge pitcher water follow 14 whither soeuer hee goeth say yee goodman house master saith lodginge shall eate passeouer disciple 15 wil shew vpper chamber larg trimmed prepared make ready v 16 disciple went forth came citie found said vno thē made ready passeouer 17 euen hee came twelue 3 entred sathan iudas called iscariot number twelue 4 went way communed • ie priest captaines hee might betray ther • 5 si glad agreed giue money 6 cōsented sought oportunitie betray vnto people away 7 came day vnleuened bread passeouer must sacrificed 8 hee sent peter iohn saying▪ go prepare v passeouer may eat 9 saide wilt thou prepare 10 said vnto behold ye entred citie shall manne meete bearing pitcher water followe house entreth 11 say vnto good man house mayster saieth vnto thee lodging shal eate passeouer disciple 12 shall shew great hie chamber trimmed make ready 13 went found saide vnto made ready passeouer 14 whē hour • come sat twelue apostle admonition christe auailed litle mouinge heart iudas bettering without regard went presently make lewd couenaunt enemy wonderfull straunge amased thought hee hadde gotten losse oyntment meete excuse offence warned christes wordes felt onely mention buriall haue mollyfied heart hard iron thereby beene easilye gathered christe woulde offer himselfe sacrifice saluation mankinde wee see glasse howe blinde wicked couetous desire howe effectually bewitch minde iudas earnestly bent steale hee hardened long vse commit offence beecause sawe pray comming hee sticketh deliuer death sonne god aucthour life though hee holy admonition withdraw yet went forward violence vvherefore without cause lu doth expresly say satan entred gouerned spirit god hee could haue bin giuen robbery spoiles bin bondslaue satan luke meaneth wholly delyuered possession satan man desperate might run forwardes destruction though satan driueth v sinne dayly raigneth v carieth v greater liberty sinning yet said enter reprobate feare god ouerthrowne lighte reason put shame shaken possesseth sens god doth execute last kind vengeaunce vppon others alreadye ordeined destruction vvherefore let v learne repent tyme least long remaining hardnesse doe establysh kingdome satan v caught tyranny measure maddenesse must especiallye bee noted couetousnesse iudas cause fountaine great blyndnesse vvherby appeareth worthily called paule 1 tim 6 10 roote euils vaine thing demaund whether satan entred substantially iudas meete consider howe horryble monstrous thing menne created image god appoynted temple holy ghost shoulde onelye bee turned filthy stable synckes become accursed dwellinge house satan 17 first day vnleauened bread disciple came first demanded called day vnleauened bread goeth kyllinge lambe law hadde commaunded refraine leauen vntyll eate lambe knotte easily losed namely note referred day following mark luke doth euidently appeare therfore day kylling eating passeouer hand beginning euening disciple doe aske christ would eate passeouer doth harder question arise vpon christe obserued rite day whole nation celebrated publike passeouer iohn saieth plainly daye hee crucified holden iewes preparation sabboth passeouer went iudgment hall least shoulde defile themselues next day eate passeouer know many menne doe seeke shiftes auayle cannot shifted ouer cauilles kepte feast day whereon crucified christ bin lawfull daye haue doone execution vpon man helde solemne preparation buryall christ might eat passeouer demaunded beefell christ eat law wold take vnto selfe lybertie besides prescript rule lawe doe imagine iewes deferred passeouer purpose might destroy christ deuice well confuted bucer yea falleth away self vaine therfore doubt christ obserued day prescribed law iewes followed custom receiued first without controuersie christ slaine day sabboth sunne set put speed next sepulcher necessary keepe holy euening man doubteth passeouer feast dayes fell vppon day beefore sabboth olde custome deferred vnto next daye keepe two dayes holy together hard people iewes doe say law giuen presently people returned captiuitie babylon oracle frō heauen least seeme haue altred commaundements god rashlye manner ioyne two feast dayes together one iewes also graunt appeareth auncient recordes coniecture probable enough christ obserued passeouer day sabboth obseruing day appointed lawe wee knowe diligent carefull hee keepe euerye poynt law sith bound lawe hee might deliuer v yoke law would forgettte subiect chiefe point therefore hee rather omit vse outward ceremonie transgresse commandement god hadde giuen bee scorned wicked certeine iewes themselues deny ordained rabbines ofte passeouer fell neere vnto sabboth onely keepe holye one day followeth christ nothing law though keepe common custome 18 goe citie man matthew noteth certeine man two doe say two disciple sent straunger token giuen manne bearing pitcher water diuersitie easily reconciled matthew omitting miracle noteth manne knowne disciple without doubte came house founde one theyr acquaintaunce christ also authority commaunded shuld prepare place naming master presently obeieth though could haue poynted manne name yet rather direct disciple miracle whē shuld shortly see humbled yet faith instructiō might supported smal confirmation short space death manifest tokē declared god might know hee drawne necessitie hee yeelded owne free though may profited litle moment trouble yet remembraunce afterwardes profitable daye also profitable v know auoyding offence crosse christ time death appeared glorye godhead togeather infirmity flesh time hand though hee celebrated passeouer rightly according commaundement law yet seemeth purpose alleage cause might accounted ouerthwart therefore saieth hath cause make haste could obserue vsual custom shuld called greater sacrifice yet meane season sayd hee altereth nothing ceremonie doth thus oft rehearse time death hande might know dooth haste owne free obeye decree father hee ioyneth shadowish sacrifice true doth meanes exhort faythful compare olde figure fulfilled deede comparison dooth litle set forth force effect death passeouer giuen iewes onely ende might remember olde deliuerance christe hope come desired former beelongeth saying paul christ passeouer offred c 1 cor 5 7 13 disciple iesus giuen charge disciple doe obey ready minde bee noted frameablenes bee taught might haue doubted shuld follow man vnknowne whether obtaine housholder whiche maister commaunded demaunde sith knew hee onely despised also hated euerye doe doubtfullye enquire successe doe willingly obey cō mādement must hold rule desire try faith satisfied commaundement may go forward whether god commaundeth hoping successe hee promyseth let v careful 20 vvhen euen come hee sate downe eate passeouer doone standing trauailers make hast hauing shooes staffe vppe doe vse take meate speedily solemne rite beeinge finished interprete hee sate downe hee might suppe therefore euangelistes say euen come first euening slew lamb eat flesh thereof rost matth 26 marke 14 luke 22 21 eate hee sayde verelye saye vnto one shall beetray 22 exceeding sorrowfull beganne eueryone say vnto maister 23 aunswered said dippeth hand dish hee shall betray 24 surely sonne man goeth way written wo man sonne man betraied beene good man neuer bin borne 25 iudas beetraied answered said maister hee saide vnto thou hast said 18 sate table eate iesus said verelye say vnto one shall betray 19 began bee sorrowful saye one one 20 aunswered said vnto one twelue dippeth platter 21 truely sonne man goeth way written wo man sonne man betrayed hadde beene good man neuer beene borne 15 hee saide vnto haue earnestly desired eat passeouer suffer 16 saye vnto • hence forth eate vntill fulfilled kingdom god litle 21 yet behold hande betraieth table 22 truely sonne man goeth appoynted woe man betraied 23 began enquire among themselues doe 21 verely say vnto might make traiterousnes iudas detested setteth forth vilenesse circumstaunce satte together holy table deuised treasō stranger done might haue bin easilyer borne thing straunge incredible one neere shoulde woorke yea hauinge made concluded lewd couenant would thrust holy banket vnder pretence friendship therefore luke vseth phrase repugnancie yet beholde hande betrayeth though luke setteth downe saying christ celebration supper yet order time cannot bee certeinely gathered thereby wee know often neglected euangelists yet deny probable iudas present christ distributed signes body bloud 22 beganne euerye one say thinke disciple trembled men amased vse without cause vex themselues abhorre offence desire cleared suspition token reuerence beeing sharpely pinched doe disdainefullye aunswere maister euery one referreth himselfe iudgement must especialy seeke cleared mouth yet enioying good consciēce would freely witnesse far great offēce christ aunswere dooth neither put doubte poynt person iudas onely confirmeth whiche sayd euen one familyar guestes traytour though hard lefte suspence doubtefull time might exercise themselues consider heinousnesse offence yet commodity folowed therof lenewe prophesie fulfilled psal 41 9 55 14 15 eat sweete bread hath lifted vp heele furthermore iudas lordes admonish child al age dismaide discouraged houshold traytours hee experience head whole church must befall v member 24 surely sonne man goeth christ taketh away offēce might haue grieuouslye offended mindes godlye absurde sonne god traiterously betraied disciple giuen ouer pleasure enemy hee maye bee brought reproachfull death christ saith coulde god hee proueth decree testimonie scripture appointed hee reuealed beefore mouth prophet vnderstand wherto christes woordes doe tend namely disciple knowing whatsoeuer done gouerned prouidence god thynke life death ruled chaunce commodity doctrine stretcheth fruite christes death rightlye sanctified v appeareth hee rashlye caried crosse menne eternall decree god hee ordeined bee sacrifice washinge awaye sinnes world whence reconciliation christes appeasing father obedience vvherefore let v alwayes remember prouidence god whereunto iudas himselfe wicked one though willes striue must necessitie obey let alwaies remaine sure christ therfore suffered god pleased kind pacification yet christ doth say iudas pretence freed fault nothing god hadde appoynted though god vpright iudgment appointed death sonne price redemption yet notwithstanding iudas beetraying procured hys iust damnation full trechery couetousnesse though god would haue world redeemed yet cause iudas wicked traitour hereby see though men nothing yt god appointeth yet ar therby freed guiltines caried headlong sinne wicked affection though god hidden bridle directeth ende vnknowne minde nothing lesse obey decree two thing seeme nothing agreeable man reason god prouidence shuld gouerne doings men nothing done wil appointment yet shuld destroy reprobate whō executeth wil see christ reconcileth together making iudas subiect cursse thogh wrought god appointed god treasō iudas shuld properly called work god god turned treason iudas perfourme counsell knowe many interpreter would auoyd rocke acknowledge scripture fulfilled work iudas god prophet testified knew therfore might mitigate doctrine seemed somwhat sharp set downe foreknowledge god place decree holye ghost doth decide controuersie farre otherwise doth bring cause betraing christ written also appointed mat mar alleage scripture lu bringeth v straight celestial decre euē teacheth act christ betraied foreknowledge god determinate counsel litle herod pylat rest wicked thing wer foreordained hand coūsel god vvherby appeareth fōdly seek shift fly naked bare foreknowledge good word taught horrible vengeance doth remain wicked better neuer beene borne life though transitory ful innumerable trouble yet incomparable benefit god againe hereby gather also detestable wickednes doth extinguish precious gift god destroy bringeth passe better neuer haue tasted goodnes god yet clause worthy noted good manne haue beene born thoughe estate iudas shoulde bee miserable yet good god created appointeth reprobate daye destruction doth also meanes set forth glory▪ solomon teacheth secrete gouernment god defended al note suspition ruleth counsel work men touched euen 25 iudas answered though oft see guilty within themselues tremble feare yet feare blind tormēts blockishnes adioyned boldly proceede deny thing length thus preuaile impudency discouer secrete sinne iudas ensnared euill conscience could yet hold peace inward tormentor doth vex vntil feare doubtfulnes ouerthroweth also christ answere sharply reprouing blockish boldnes doth prouoke consider offence desired hide mind possessed deuilish fury could haue feeling example let v learn wicked bad excuse nothing el pul speedy iudgment vpon themselues matth 26 marke saide take deuide amōg 18 say vnto wil drink fruit vine vntil kingdom god come 19 tooke bread whē giuen thanks brak gaue saying bodye giuen you▪ remembraunce 20 likewise also supper took cup saying cup newe testament bloude whiche shed sith luke maketh mention christe tooke cup twise first demanded whether repetition one thing euangelistes doe vse sometime speake one thing twise whether christ tasted cuppe tooke againe second time latter seemeth bee likelye betrue know holy father obserued solemne manner tasting sacrifice vvherof saide psal 116 13 take cuppe saluation call vppon name lord thinke christ dranke holy feast according auncient maner otherwise could rightly solēnised doth luke expresly declare commeth speake new mistery maner whereof differed paschal lamb also receiued solemne vse giue thanks expresly said taking cup doubt praier beginninge supper hee neuer vsed come table without callinge vppon god nowe hee woulde doe agayne leaste hee shoulde omitte ceremonie shewed annexed holy sacrifice 26 dids eate doe vnderstand wordes newe farre excellent banket bee ioyned supper passeouer rather first ended plainely declared luke saith christ supped gaue cup absurd one mistery shuld seuered diuerse time doubt hee gaue cuppe presently deuided bread luke dooth specially speake cuppe doe also extend bread therefore eating christ tooke bread might call take part new supper giuing thankes certeine preparation entraunce consideration misterie supper ended taste holy bread wine securitie first shaken might wholly bent high mistery reason required euident testimony spiritual life thus distinguished iesus tooke bread vncerteine whether rite iewes hold day also vse housholder hidde vnder napkin peece bread taken whole loafe hee might giue euery family parte tradition man established vppon commaundement god cause curiously labour seeke beeginning may deuised afterwards subtiltie sathan darken mistery supper christe ceremonye vsed amongst iewes christe followed custome receiued yet would lead mindes disciple way chaunging vse bread end muste holden without question figure law abolished christ instituted new sacrament vvhen giuen thankes matthew marke vse word blessing whereas luke steede thereof doth vse word signifieth giueing thankes ambiguitie sense cuppe doe adde giueing thankes doe plainelye enough interprete former saying follye papistes much scorned whiche doe blesse signe crosse christ vsed exorcisme must remembred sayde euen nowe giuing thankes hadde relation spirituall mysterie though faythful commaunded giue thankes god beecause nourysheth transitory life yet christ regardeth onely common foode bent holy action giue thankes god eternall saluation mankinde meates goe downe paunch shuld prouoke stirre v praise fatherlye kindenes god howe much spiritual feeding soules prouoke enflame v earnest exercise godlynes take yee eate yee least become tedious onely briefly touch manner thing institution lorde conteineth vse farre may gathered euangelists appeareth first christ instituted supper disciple communicate amongst vvhereof followeth deuillish inuention one manne alone separating himselfe reste congregation doth priuatly deuoure supper himselfe disagreeable bread deuided amongst bedeuoured one alone therefore though papistes bragge haue substaunce supper lord mass yet indeede appeareth manye doe celebrate priuate mass manye bulwarkes sette vp deuill ouerthrowing supper christe wordes taught manner oblation offered christ supper hee commaundeth disciple take therefore hee onely offereth therefore imagination papistes offer christ supper proceedeth contrary autour certeinely merueilous chaunge mortall manne commaunded take bodye christe shoulde take vppon hym office offer vppe priest made offer vnto god sonne goe presently proue many sacriliges faigned oblation dooth abounde sufficient proue far thing like christ institution rather directly contrary bodye saye breade consecrated woordes bee figure token fleshe christe doe disallowe woord rightly truely vnderstoode bread ordained nourish body christe doth chuse sanctifie vse may beginne spirituall meate alteration chaunge whereof auncient writer church make mention yet must noted bread consecrated whispering breathing ouer euident doctrine fayth truely magicall inchauntment consecration directed dead element bread made figure body christ selfe v summe consecration nothing else solemne testimony v whereby lord appointeth earthly corruptible signe spiritual vse cannot except commandement promise openly declared edifying fayth vvhereby appeareth againe wickedly mistery prophaned papistes secrete whispering breathing christ doth consecrate bread hee telleth v body chaunge substaunce imagined onely noted alteration vse worlde beene long time bewitched subtilty deuil monstrous opinion transubstantiation brought admitte day light true interpretatiō word shuld vayn stand longer searching sense christe saieth bread body speaketh sacrament must necessity bee confessed sacrament consisteth visible sign wherunto thing signified conioyned trueth also well knowne olde signe often called name thing signified vvherfore man meanely exercised scripture deny sacramentall phrase speach must bee taken metonymically one omitte generall figure read euery scripture doe say oft outward signe saide dooth represent menne doe consent figure metonymia vvhere baptisme called lauar regeneration tit 3 5 rocke yeelded water father wildernesse called christe 1 corin 10 4 doue called holy ghost iohn 1 32 man deny signes called name thing signifie therefore commeth passe regard wordes lorde suffer common sacrament applyed supper wil haue simple litteral sense doth rule hold sacrament certeinely except wil graunt rocke substantially christ obiection weak wherewith vrge v interpret bread called body figure body pretend whole doctrine scripture ouerthrown neither haue forged late rule manner speache al men imbrace deliuered augustin authority auncient father name spirituall thinges improperly ascribed signes place scripture shuld expounded mention made sacramentes sith wee doe hold general rule receiued euery purpose doe make outcryes straunge matter hearde let mased men cry lyst shall accepted men wise modest sacramentall forme speaking wordes christ vvherof followeth bread figure body christ called body two kindes men doe arise v papistes bewitched transubstantion deny bread remayneth onely shewe without substaunce paule refuteth fancy affirming bread breake communion body christ 1 corint 10 16 nature sacrament abhorreth deuise cannot remain perfecte true perfect outwarde signe howe shall learne soules fedde flesh christ bread sette eye vaine shewe wil say sign christ said bloud cuppe therfore rule onelye wine also substaunce whereof cuppe made necessarily transubstantiated bloud sette downe matthewe henceforth drinke fruit vine dooth euidently declare wine delyuered drunke therefore follye papistes plainely confuted euery way others doe reiect figure presently frantike men receiue bread according opinion truely properlye body account transubstantiation matter without colour reason demaunded whether bread wine christ answer bread therfore called body vnder receiued answer easie gather name body vnproperlye transferred bread signe meruaile sith menne doe oft say christ spake respect sacramentall vnyon doe marke saye manner sacramentall vnion thing signified signe lord secret power spirit performeth promyseth latter master letter lesse derided papistes hytherto haue delyuered simple exposition wordes lord added vaine ydle signe set beefore v made indeed partaker body bloud faith take hold promise lord vain commaund disciple eat bread affirming body effect truely aunswere figure neither question amongst v whether christ doth truely onelye significatiuely offer himselfe vnto v supper though wee see nothing bread yet hee dooth neither deceiue mocke v feedeth soules flesh therfore true eating flesh christ onely shewed signe also deliuered verye deede woorth labour obserue heere three thinges least whiche spyrituall shoulde bee myxed signe nexte leaste christe shoulde bee soughte vppon earth earthlye elementes thirdlye least shoulde imagined another manner eating secret power spirit spireth v life christ obtain meane faith alone first said except ouerthrowe must distinction betweene signe thing signified neyther profitte sacrament except according rudenes capacitye lead v beholding earthly element heauenlye mistery whosoeuer shall discerne body christ bread bloud wine shall neuer vnderstande supper meaneth ende faythfull shoulde vse signes afterward let lawefull meane seeking christe follow let mindes rest vppon earth ascend high celestial glory dwelleth body christe cloathed wyth life vncorrupt shoulde cast awaye proper nature whereof followeth finite ascended aboue heauens least holde grosse imagination beeing vppon earth surely mystery heauenlye nothinge preposterous draw earth rather calleth v vppe last sayde noted kind eatinge must dreamed substaunce naturally descend soules doe eate flesh receiue life proportion likenes bread fleshe must kepte whereby wee taught soules fedde fleshe christ bodyes receiue strength bread flesh christ therefore spirituall nourishment doth therefore giue lyfe beecause holy ghoste dooth powre v lyfe though diuersitie betweene eating fleshe christ beleeue yet euidentlye knowne none feede vppon christ otherwise faith eating effect faith 29 say vnto mathew mark doe adde sentence holy supper christ giuen sign bloud cup vvhereof doe gather luke dooth set downe matter rehearsed litle knot easilye losed maketh litle matter christe shoulde speake euangelistes doe onelye applye themselues place shew disciple admonished aswell approachinge death maister new heauenlye lyfe neerer houre death hand strēgthened least shuld altogether fall away mind holy supper set death eye glasse without cause telleth againe dooth depart world sorrowfull message hee presently addeth comfort cause whye shoulde feare death better lyfe doth follow shuld haue said doe haste death maye passe thence blessed immortalytye neyther lyue alone kingdome god wyll haue fellowes mee lyfe doe see hee leadeth disciple hand crosse lyfteth vppe thence hope resurrection meete directed death christ might ascend ladder vp heauen since christ dyed receiued heauen meete wee beeholding crosse lead heauen may bee vnion made death recouery life promiseth shal glorified togeather himselfe appeareth plainelye woordes vntill shall drinke new obiection whiche doe make meate drinke agree kingdome god friuolous christ hath meaning disciple presently want company hee eate vntill meete togeather heauen society life shoulde described needeth helpes meate drinke saieth shall newe kinde drinking worde wee taught hee spake allegorically therefore luke hee saieth simply vntill kingdome god come summe christ commendeth vnto v fruit effecte redemption purchased death vvhere doe thinke fulfilled lord eate disciple resurrection farre minde estate betweene course mortall life mark life celestial kingdome god reuealed therfore said vnto mary touch haue yet ascended father disciple yet entred kingdome god partaker glory might drinke newe wine christ wee read christ dranke resurrection yet hee hadde sayde hee woulde vntyll disciple gathered kingdome god shewe repugnancye easilye answered hee dooth preciselye speake meate drinke fellowshippe present lyfe also wee knowe christe drinke time hee might eyther strengthen hymselfe meates eate hys disciple companye onelye proouinge hys resurrection whereof yet doubtefull hee myght lyfte vppe theyr mindes hygh therefore let v contented natural sense lorde promised hys disciple hee yet liued mortall man amongst vppon earth afterwards companion blessed immortal life lv 19 vvhich giuen two euangelistes doe omitte clause yet vayne therefore bread becom flesh christ v saluation purchased flesh crucified dooth profit none eate fayth againe colde manner eating almost purpose respecte sacrifice offered therefore whosoeuer desireth bee nourished fleshe christe lette consider offered vppon crosse might bee price reconcilation god whiche matthewe marke doe speake bread doe expresse cuppe namelye bloud shoulde bee shedde forgiuenesse sin clause must referred therefore wee may bee fedde rytelye fleshe christe wee muste beholde offeringe vppe sacrifice meete hee giuen sacrifice v might daily giuen vnto v mat 27 drinke yee purpose christ tie faith wholy vnto shuld seek thing without two token hee declareth life shutte vp nourishment mayntenaunce lyfe bodye needeth meate drinke christ might teach hee alone altogeather sufficient perfourme partes saluation attributeth vnto himselfe hee steede meate drinke vvherein wonderful kindenes appeareth willing prouide fayth submitte himselfe rudenes flesh much detestable sacrilegious boldnesse pope doubted breake sacred bande vvee heere sonne god togeather two pledge declared fulnesse lyfe hee bestoweth vppon lawe hath mortall man lybertie pull sunder thinges ioyned togeather god lorde dooth purposely commaund al men drinke cuppe whether sacriledge banish church vvee read sayde simply bread shoulde take vvhye doth name commaund drinke marke saieth expresly dranke faythfull shoulde take heede anye wicked innouation yet pope afrayde seuere commaundement durste chaunge violate lawe establyshed lorde hee hath forbydden people vse cuppe might proue reason rob hee pretendeth sufficient haue one kinde beecause one doth attend vppon bloud ioyned fleshe thogh lawful vnder pretēce abolish whol • acrament christ could likewise make v partaker self without outward help childish cauillations ar help vngodlines greater absurdity thē faithful wyllingly want suffer themselues depriued helpes lorde hath giuen therefore nothing canne lesse bee borne vngodlye rentinge thys mysterye 28 bloud haue shewed saide bloud shedde forgiuenes sinnes wee directed woordes sacrifice death christe without memorye whereof supper neuer celebrated rightly neither faithful soules otherwise satisfied farre forth hope god well pleased vnder name many meaneth parte world al mankinde opposeth many one haue said redeemer one man dye deliuer manye guiltines cursse neither doubted wil christ speaking make doctrine cōmon vnto many yet noted withal luke hee speaking disciple name exhorteth faithful apply shedding bloud vse therfore come holy table must haue general thought mind world redeemed bloud christ let euery man think sinnes washed away new testament luke paule vse phrase newe testamente bloud sense yet one couenaunt sanctified confirmed made effectual meanes spirituall drinking bloud hereby easie gather foolishly superstitious papistes like become greedilye doe snatche wordes though burst exposition holy ghost cannot reiected cup called bloud testament bloud reason bread vvhereof followeth called body testament body cause striue haue simple wordes christ beleeued shut eares forren exposition christ speaketh shal refuse fitte interpreter word declareth plainely calleth bread body cause hee maketh eternall couenaunt v sacrifice offered wee mygh • feasted fed spiritually two thinges worthy noted word testament couenaunt wee doe gather promise included holye supper vvhereby errour confuted deny faith holpen nourished strengthened encreased sacrament alwaies mutual relation betweene couenaunt god faith men epithite 〈◊〉 wil teach old figure end might giue place euerlasting eternal couenaunt therefore direct opposition betweene mistery shadowes lawe vvhereby appeareth much estate better father since sacrifice offered vppon crosse wee doe enioy whole perfect trueth mar 26 vvhen sung psalme three euangelistes omit diuine sermon sauior made io reporteth aswel house iourney said otherwhere purpose rather set downe hystory thinges doone doctrine doe note hee went willingly place whether iudas come might know dispensed momēts time willingly might meete betray matth 26 marke 14 luke 22 31 saide iesus vnto yee shall bee offended mee night written smite shephearde sheepe stocke shall bee scattered 32 risen againe wil goe galile 33 peter aunswered said vnto thogh men offended thee yet neuer bee offended 34 iesus said vnto verely say vnto thee night beefore cocke crowe thou shalt deny thrise 35 peter saide vnto thoughe shoulde dye thee yet deny thee likewise also said al disciple 27 iesus saide vnto al yee shall offended night written wil • shepheard sheep shalbe scattered 28 risen wyl goe galile 29 peter said vnto although al men offended yet would 30 iesus saide vnto verelye saye vnto thee daye euen night cocke crowe twise thou shalt deny thrise 31 said earnestly die thee wil deny thee likewise also said al 31 lord saide simon simon beehold sathan hath desired winow wheat 32 haue praid thee thy fayth fayle therfore thou art conuerted strengthen thy brother 33 said vnto lord ready go thee prison death 34 hee said tell thee peter cocke shall crowe day beefore thou hast thrise denied thou kn • west 31 yee matthew marke doe extend together al disciple luke saieth spoken peter alone though speach common yet probable christe spak vnto person one warned aboue rest also neede singular comfort least deny christ altogeather ouerwhelmed dispayre lv 31 behold satan two doe brieflye simply reporte disciple forewarned fall doctrine may plentifully gathered luke word christ doth speake historically trouble come expresly declareth haue conflict satan withal promiseth victory admonition profitable ofte trouble commeth vppon v set eies sleightes satan euen paule ephe 6 12 teacheth wee wrestle flesh bloud spirituall power c meaning therfore wordes vvhen shal shortly see ouerwhelmed know satan furnished weapon ouerthrow taketh fit occasion weakening faith therfore said doctrine profitable beecause oftē befalleth vnaduisednes circūuented neglect temptation wherof shuld afraid cō sidered thē firy dart mighty strong enemy thogh speaketh bitter cōtention wherewith disciple assaulted almost extinguishing faith yet doctrine extendeth satan goeth dayly seeking pray carryed outragious desire destroye v absurd slouthful carelesse therefore let v prepare selues extremity battail appeare know sathan desireth destruction doth subtilly diligently seeke al meanes hurt v shal come conflict let v know al temptation whence soeuer come forged shop enemye similytude winowing doth properly agree euery point wee haue place seene gospell compared fanne • • e wherewyth vvheate cleansed cha •• e heere signifieth simply winedew violently shake apostle death christe hardlier shaken woont therefore noted nothing pleaseth sathan lesse cleansing faithfull though tosseth ende yet rightly sayde euen wheat fanne shaken cast hither thither yea shal see little fell somewhat worse disciple meaning wordes lorde set downe mathew marke ye shalbe offended doe declare stricken almost ouerthrowne reprochful handling christ also discourage whereas beene dueties goe forward maister euen crosse drawne backe feare owne infirmity set ende praying sighing might flee sacred sanctuary god mat 31 wrytten vvith prophesie encourageth passe ouer offēce god ceaseth acknowledge shepe time scattered hether thether prophet hath spoken restitution church least extreme calamity hand shuld driue mind godly desperation affirmeth though gouernment confused ouertourned sorrowfull miserable dispersion yet grace god shuld conquerour though almost interpreaters restraine place zacharie 13 7 person christ alone yet apply bene sayde gouernment whereby people preserued safety shepheards taken doubt lorde meant time tyrannye antiochus churche spoyled good pastours lay waste lord suffered sword goe fearful liberty shepheards ouerthrowne miserably troubled estate people yet scattering hindered lord length outstretched arme would gather owne shepe togither though prophet doeth generally declare church spoiled shepheards yet doth truly properly belong christ chiefe shepheards whome safety church depended dead al hope might seeme taken away temptation extreeme redemer spirite life people shoulde sodainly caryed death begun gather flocke god togither much notable grace god remnant flocke wonderfully recouered againe confusion destruction vve see therefore christ applied thys testimony aptly least scattering nowe hande terrifie disciple aboue measure yet knowing owne infirmitye repose themselues vppon pastour therefore sense thinke haue yet tried owne weakenesse valiant strong enough shortly shall appeare zachariah foretold truth shepheard slaine shepe shoulde scattered meane season let promisse whyche added recreate comfort wil gather dispearsed shepe home himselfe place doeth teach vnitie safe keepeth sheepe togither vnder christes shepheards staffe 32 shall rise againe doeth euidently expresse whiche touched euen nowe disciple stricken wyth feare shoulde little time sheepe dispearsed going astray yet againe called backe shepefold christ doth simply say shal rise promiseth guide adopteth companion hadde stoode sounde may haue assurance doeth appoynt place whether gather together againe hee haue sayde gather scattered againe ierusalem 33 peter answeared though peter dissembleth speaketh sincere affection yet vaine confidence hys owne strength caried fonde bragge hee woorthily reprooued christ shortly grieuously punished rashnesse successe doth declare peter promised able performe made sufficient trial himselfe heereby also better perceiued blockish thing mā drunke trust himselfe againe admonished sonne god weakenesse addeth othe yeeldeth neither forsaketh thinge vaine opinion proceedeth greater boldnesse puffe vppe lofty bragging motion yet demaunded whether peter might hope promiseth himselfe also whether trusting promisse christ might promisse himselfe answeare promisse christe made disciple spirite inuincible fortitude belonged time renewinge followed resurrection therefore yet endued heauenly power peter trusting himselfe went beyonde boundes faith greatly offended two wayes hee preuentinge time rashly promised himselfe reposed himselfe promisse lord secondly closed eye passing owne infirmity doeth rather securely valiantly promisse himselfe reason would require therfore noted euery man mindefull owne infirmity flee assistāce holy ghost man shuld bolde take vpon lorde promiseth faithfull ought come prepared battel doubting mistrusting successe victory shuld couragiously resist feare fearfulnesse much doubtfulnesse signe distrust side blockishnesse must auoided driueth away care puffeth vppe mindes pride quencheth desire praying meane notably set downe paule phil 2 12 hee commandeth v make ende saluation feare trembling god worketh v one side prouoketh humbled seeke helpe yet againe least course shoulde make v slouthful hee exhorteth v behaue selues boldly therefore oft temptation doth assault v first lette v remember infirmity altogither ouerthrowne may learne seeke wanting v let v remember grace offered v may put v doubt forget owne infirmity wythout calling vpon god doe imagine themselues strong doe rashe souldiours rashly doe runne warres haue breathed surfetting thinke vppon nothing else flight maruell rest disciple peter reprooued doe yet fall rashnesse whereby appeareth howe little acquainted themselues example taught bold attempt thing hand god doeth leade v nothing transitorie sooner vanishe inconsiderate zeale disciple sawe nothing vile absurd forsake maister therfore doe iustly detest offence without assurance hope promisse neglecting prayer doe flie vaine boast constancie none mathew marke luke 22 35 sayd vnto sent without bagge scrippe shees lacked yee thynge sayd nothing 36 sayde nowe hath bagge let take likewise scrippe hee hath none let sell coate buy sword 37 say vnto yet whiche wrytten must perfourmed race euen wyth wicked numbred doubtlesse thinges wrytten haue ende 38 sayd lord behold two sword sayd vnto enough christes speache tendeth purpose yet spared disciple laid trouble vpō apt cōmendeth ease former time might willingly prepare thēselues sharper warfare ende hath yet kept simple yong nouices far shot reach dartes case somwhat gathering courage strength might prepared battel therefore muche shuld haue said estate hath yet easie pleasant child nourish tenderly nowe ful time hande wherein exercise men yet diuersity reacheth diuersity two time doth set downe without prouision matter quiet might haue prouided themselues wāted nothing went office much tumult heat care victual cast aside behoueth thē hast whether necessity calleth though christ doth especially remember wold 12 disciple yet withall hee declareth wee yet yonglinges weake faith shall haue long time truce giuen v vntill growe vp men therefore doe euill doe vse apply ease delites weaken strength faith let v doubt christ day hath regarde v thrust forward younglings vnmeete warre sendeth foorth conflicte hee furnisheth weapon power 36 nowe hath bagge hee doeth figuratiuely declare great trouble sharpe assault hand euen captaine meaning bring foorth soldiours fight shoulde crie alarme commandeth care sette aside shoulde apply themselues nothinge warre shoulde muche thinke victuall hee teacheth maner extreeme danger thing shoulde solde bagge scrippe might defende themselues weapon hee doeth call outward battaile onely vnder similitude going warres declareth howe hard conflictes temptation endure grieuous assault spiritual trouble shoulde beare also might willingly repose themselues vppon prouidence god first sayde hee biddeth remember god care went empty naked caryinge victuall yet prouided conuenient helpe god make haue experience neuer doubt againe helpe euer shall neede 37 yet wrytten force aduerbe yet christ declareth hath done al thing appertaining office vntill numbred wicked vngodly one company least vilenesse acte muche amase alleageth prophesie isaiah chap 53 12 certainty cannot otherwise expounded messiah sith sayd shoulde accounted amongst wicked became faithfull troubled sight though cruell much lesse alienated christ coulde otherwise redeemer taking reproofe shame wicked manne vpon apter remeady taking away offence absurditie doeth terrifie v wee acknowledge bee pleasure god nothinge done rashlye without good cause done appoyntmēt especially spoken long whiche appeareth successe therefore disciple hope redeemer god promised time past prophet isaiah testified shoulde beare punishment vppon might deliuer v guiltinesse shoulde suffice appeasing horrour disciple shuld make lesse account christ therefore hee addeth thing whiche appertained haue ende signifying nothing spoken vaine prophet phrase vsed greekes signifieth bee perfourmed bee brought effecte successe doth prooue soeuer prophet haue spoken rather auaile confirmation faith make v afraide doubt though one argument christ doeth strengthen comfort disciple prophesies perfourmed yet counsell selfe purpose god containeth small matter comfort namely christ became subiecte damnation deserued accounted amongst wicked might offer v wicked ouerwhelmed sinnes righteous father heereof accounted pure free sinnes god lambe themselues open therfore though god already exercised sonne taste thing come yet approching death woundeth deper striketh vnwonted feare seemed thing vnmeete diuine glory christ oppressed feare sorrowe many interpreaters haue carefully applied themselues seeke shift labour without aduice purpose ashamed feare sorrow redemption vanish away pearish ambrose sayd truely doe onely thinke matter excused neuer haue godlinesse maiestie admiration hadde done lesse borne affection therfore sorrowed cause sorrow delite eternal godhead set aside stricken loathsomnes infirmitie therefore boldly name sorrowe doe set forth crosse hee incarnate shewe truthe therefore hee take vppon griefe might ouercome exclude sorrowe haue commendation fortitude whiche rather beare woundes benummed griefe thus farre ambrose doe imagine sonne god free humane passion doe truely earnest acknowledge manne therefore sayde godheade christe rested hidde time suffering hee might fulfill partes redeemer farre containinge absurditie mysterie saluation coulde otherwise fulfilled cyril sayd rightly passion crosse willingly suffered christe sorte hee suffered willingly satisfie father saluation thou mayest easily learne prayer father possible lette cuppe passe respecte woorde god god naturally life selfe manne doubte feared death anye thinge made fleshe hee permitted fleshe shoulde suffer thinges pertained therefore verye manne hee feareth death nowe present doore sayeth father possible lette cup passe cannot otherwise let thou wilt thou seest howe nature manne euen christe himselfe suffereth thing belonging feareth woorde ioyned recouereth courage meete god lēgth concludeth thou seest respecte fleshe deathe christe voluntarie yet voluntary according father saluation life giuen vnto menne thus farre cyrill yet must bee distinguished betweene infirmity fleshe christ suffered doeth much differ v affection without sinne men doe exceede measure right moderation christ troubled sorrow feare yet murmured god remained fast true rule temperance maruel perfect pure al spot affection shewed wer pure vnspotted though witness humane infirmitie corrupt nature men nothing commeth defiled hath dreg therefore let difference holden christ afraid sorrowful without spot sinne al affection sinful doe breake excesse nowe kinde affection noted wherwith christe tempted mathew sayeth sorrowfull grieuously doubtfully troubled luke hee agonie marke addeth afraid whence cōmeth sorrow doutfulnesse feare vpon death conceiued somthing sorrowful horrible separation soule body certainly died onely might goe earth heauen rather takinge cursse vppon hym wherto subiecte might set v free therefore simply afraid death departure worlde fearful tribunal seat god eies iudge himselfe armed incōprehensible vengeance sinnes burden wherof laide vpon huge waight pressed downe vvherefore meruaile horrible depth destruction grieuously vexed feare doubtfulnesse 38 soule heauie maketh priuie sorrow might mooue haue like feeling hee knewe weakenes afterwardes might make ashamed slouthfulnesse kinde speach expresseth deadly wound sorrow haue sayd wythout life halfe dead sorrow ionas agayne remember cause great sorrow death selfe coulde haue vexed minde sonne god fealt doe iudgement god 39 went little vve haue seene lord otherwhere might stirred vppe pray vehemencie prayed oute company men sight men doe better gather sens togither may better bent whiche necessary oft would pray flee backe corner nay alwayes expedient great necessity • vrgeth heate prayer doeth freely powre selfe solitarie place profitable v pray alone sonne god neglected helpe shoulde madde pride v apply vse adde god alone iudge ambitiō feared faithfull soule doeth familiarly discouer selfe simply powreth prayer sighes care feares hope ioyes bosome god god permitteth many folly child pray alone sight men coulde wythout ostentation gesture also falleth downe vppon grounde doeth declare earnest zeale prayer though bowinge knee commonly woont vsed prayer signe honoure reuerence yet christ humbly lying vpon ground greatnesse sorrow framed himselfe miserable behauiour father possible doe striue vaine shewe thys prayer onely complaint yet verely though doe graunt request abrupte yet doubt christe prayed neither force desireth thinge impossible graunted prayer faithfull doe alwaies flow one course continually vnto ende alwaies keepe equall temperature alwayes framed distincte order rather intricate doubtful doe either contende themselues doe stoppe midst course euen shippe tossed stormes though bendeth hauen yet cannot alwaies holde right equall course calme quiet sea must noted sayde euen nowe christe hadde suche troublesome affection mighte shake pure moderation minde haue muche sounde vncorrupt nature man would beare stricken feare holden wyth doubtfulnesse necessity enforced amidst suche violent streames temptation wauer prayer hether thether reason praying auoid death presently restraineth himselfe submitting himselfe authority father correcteth reuoketh request hadde sodainly escaped demaunded howe coulde desire haue eternall decree father broken whereof ignoraunt thoughe condition added possible yet seemeth absurde make counsell god chaungeable meete hym holde coulde god reuoke counsell marke christ seemeth oppose power god decree thing sayeth possible thee power god yll applied ouerthrow truth making variable changeable aunsweare absurdity christ common course godly looking vppon counsell god shoulde poure desire wherwith enflamed bosome father faithfull making prayer doe alwaies climbe vppe looke secreates god sit ease consider possible done sometimes caried headlong heate desire exod 32 32 moses desireth blotted booke life paule rom 9 3 desired bee accurssed therefore prayer christ premeditated power force sorrowe wreasted sodaine speache presently corrected vehemencye made remember heauenly decree present coulde moment consider sent condition redeemer mākinde euen great sorrowe doeth often blinde eye thing cannot remēbred summe absurditye prayer alwaies present consideration thing keeping distincte order marke christ sayeth thing possible god tend end set power controuersie wyth vnchangeable truth constancy hope vseth come passe thing without hope recouerie throweth himselfe power god word cup pot sayd noted prouidence god disposeth men measure crosse affliction euen housholder measureth part euery seruant deuideth portion amōgst child neuerthelesse vve see christ restraineth affection euen first bringeth himselfe quickly order first may demanded howe wil free fault yet agreed god god rule good right followeth affection differ corrupt answear though true right line haue affection framed god yet certaine shewe ouerthwart difference faulty imputed sinne man desire see estate church quiet flourishing shoulde desire haue child god freed trouble superstition taken away rage wicked repressed shuld hurt sith thing themselues good faithfull may rightly desire though pleasure god otherwise wil haue sonne raigne amongst enemy child exercised vnder crosse victory faith gospell made glorious wyth contrary assault sathā vvhe see praiers may godly shew differ wil god god wold haue v alwaies exactly scrupulously search shall determine permitteth v search mete capacity vnderstanding yet question throughly answeared sayd euen affectiōs christ rightly ordred doth correct bringeth affection downe order haue order truely patient moderation wherof spake doeth appeare hys firste prayer much lieth refuseth denieth execute office mediator answear fault terrour death set came withall darknesse thinges beinge sette aside hee brake oute praier neither necessary subtilly dispute whether coulde forgetfull saluation one thing shoulde suffice v brake prayer auoiding death thoght thing might haue stopped man except first motion shoulde haue beene brideled runne tempered meete answear corruption nature cannot seene heate affection temperature christ honour must giuen sonne god iudge selues al affection flesh burne v breake froward stubbernnesse least haue dregges mixed wyth christ mooued sorrow feare yet kept himselfe within measure nay diuers partes song differing amongst themselues farre hauing discord rather make agreeable sweete harmonie christe notable example due proportion betweene wils god men without contrariety repugnācie differ amongst themselues place doeth euidently declare olde heretikes called monothelites folish imagined christ endued one wil neither yet god willed thing father therefore followeth affection humane soule distinguished secreat counsel god meete christ leade wil prisoner might make subiect wil god though wel ordred carefully must kepe vnder libertye affectiōs alwaies caried without cōsideration hedlong filled frowardnesse spirite god shoulde gouerne v would nothing agreable reason yet owe obedience god beare patience praiers alwaies graūted modesty faith graūt god shuld determine otherwise desire rule must especially holden haue certaine special promisse aske thing vnder condition god shoulde fulfil hath determined cannot resigning vowes vnto demanded christ profited praier apostle heb chap 5 7 sayth heard feare place may expoūded commonly red reuerence shuld agree christ simply feared death deliuered vvherof followeth feare greater euil driuē pray death sawe wrath god set stode seat iudgement loaden sin world necessary fear bottomlesse depth death therfore though sustained death yet sorrowes death losed pet teacheth act 2 24 wrastling went away conquerour apostle hath good cause say that▪ heard feare vnlearned men heere rise vp cry thing vnwoorthy christ afraid swallowed vp death woulde shoulde answeare feare doe thinke wrong drop bloud christ mortal sweat could neuer haue come fearfull vnwonted horror man day shuld sweat forth bloud abundance drop ranne ground shuld incredible wonder shuld befall man fear death would say faint womannish hart therfore deny christ praied father shuld deliuer gulf death ascribe daintinesse yea vnmete common man man obiect feare speake spring infidelity answer readie christ strickē horror curse god touched feling flesh faith remained safe sound integrity nature wrought felt without wounding tēptations pearce v sting mean season fondly imagine victory without strife would haue fele tēptations lawful think yt dissembled thing whē cōplained deadly sorrow soule neither euangelists lie saying sorrowful afraide 40 came disciple though neither discharged fear set free frō care yet remitting painful exercise praier toke solace betwene ther continuance praier required faithful shuld neuer depart frō speaking god rather exāple christ continue prayer holding lōg infirmity doeth suffer cease little time yet litle breathing return god ben smal cōfort sorrow haue disciple fellowes cōpanions cōtrary sharp encrease sorrow also forsaken though neded help yet willingly bore infirmity agony wold especially giue token hūbling wherof paul maketh mention phil 2 7 maruell sluggishnes whō chosen felowes added great heauy burden sorow doth expostulate matter thē dissemblingly feling soul declareth grieued forsaken iustly vpbraided sluggishnesse extreme sorrowes would abide watch space one houre 41 vvatch pray disciple slouthful master danger willed loke themselues feeling owne trouble might waken therefore christe declareth except watche pray presently ouerwhelmed wyth temptation haue said sith touched care yet haue regard selues matter hād take hede shall presently swallowed vp tēptation enter temptation fall downe vnder let v note prescribed ye maner shuld withstode determine selues vse owne power wit rather acknowledging infirmity shuld seke defēce strength lord therfore watching without praier shall auail nothing spirit ready lest shuld dant disciple fear doth gently correct slouthfulnes giuing comfort matter good hope first declareth though willing ready well yet must striue infirmity flesh therefore shalbe alwaies nedeful pray see readines praised least infirmity shuld cause dispair yet stirreth thē forward praiers wer yet sufficiētly furnished strength spirit vvherfore admonitiō doth properly belong faithful regenerate spirite god desire liue wel doe yet labour vnder infirmity flesh though grace spirit doeth flourish yet weake according flesh though disciple onely foretold owne weaknes yet lighteth vpon men christ speaketh heere generall rule gathered must diligētly watch praier power spirit hath yet force v often fall infirmity flesh except lord aid lift hold v vp cause shuld doutfully feare ther certain remedy set v sought neither far yet vaine christ doth promisse victory apply themselues praier may busily shake slouthfulnesse flesh 42 went away second time christ semeth word mat reporteth without feare freely wyth mind set liberty cōmit himselfe father doeth desire cup shuld passe frō passing request resteth rather vpon may obey coūsel god proceding expressed mar nay returned secōd time said rehersed praiers certainly think oft praid driuē fear horror seke escape death yet probable second time bēt yeld obediēce father bearing first temptation encouraged boldnes mete death luke doth distinctly report praid seueral time sayth troubled praid lōger earnestly ben cōtinual course praier know euangelists somtime omitting circumstance set downe sum therfore wher sayth christ • came end disciple setting shuld haue ben also clause wher declareth angel appeared heauen spake agony christ absurditie order thus inuerted might knowe angell sent vnto hym vaine necessitie sette downe doth declare cause setting downe afterward though strength giuen onely spirite god yet letteth god may vse angel minister heereby may gathered howe great affliction sonne god boare driuen haue helpe god set eye see 43 hee founde sleepe againe eye heauie sleepinesse came neither furfetting grosse blockishnesse muche delite flesh rather immoderate sorrowe luke declareth vvhereby doe better perceiue howe flesh bent slouth daungers themselues doe bring forgetfulnesse god sathan hath euery side apte fitte occasion entrappe v feare aduersitie hee maketh v drunke sleepe feare sorrowe shoulde stirre v vppe prayer hee ouerwhelmeth sences least flie vnto god menne doe flie away euery way estraunged god vntill gather hym circumstance also noted disciple sharply rebuked presently almost fall sleepe againe thys spoken cōpany three christ chosen chiefe companion vvhat shoulde become common sorte fell chiefe rehearsall also woordes vaine babbling christe condemned hypocrite vaine babbling thinke shall obtaine neuer asked sincerely heart christe hys example teacheth meete shoulde discouraged weary prayer doe presently obtaine requestes assault temptation extinguish desire prayer shoulde aske thirde time fourth god seemed haue denyed mathewe 26 marke 14 luke 22 45 came hee disciple sayd vnto sleepe hencefoorth take rest beholde houre hande sonne manne giuen hand sinner 46 rise lette v goe beholde hand betraieth 47 yet spake loe iudas one twelue came great multitude swordes slaues hie priestes elder people 48 nowe hee betrayed hadde giuen token ing whome euer shall kisse hee lay holde 49 foorthwith came iesus sayde god saue thee maister kissed 50 iesus sayd vnto friende wherefore arte thou come came layde handes iesus tooke 41 hee came thirde time sayde vnto sleepe hence foorth take rest enough houre come beholde sonne man deliuered handes sinner 42 rise vppe lette v goe loe betraieth hande 43 immediately yet spake came iudas one twelue great multitude swordes staues hie priestes scribe elder 44 betrayed hadde giuen token saying whome soeuer shall kisse take lead away safely 45 assoone hee come hee wente straight way sayde maister maister kissed 46 layed theyr handes tooke 47 yet spake beholde companye called iudas one twelue went came neare vnto iesus kisse 48 iesus said vnto iudas betraiest thou sonne man kisse • 45 sleepe hence foorth take rest▪ euident enough christe speaketh ironically must withall considered ende maner speache vsed sith christe preuailed nothing admonishing disciple doeth onely sharply reprooue theyr slouthfulnesse sayth though would slouthfull shall longer safe therefore meaning hetherto haue wasted woordes amongest yet cease exhort howe soeuer doe suffer sleepe yet ennemies allow enforce watch whether therfore added marke enough haue said time sleepe maner lord doeth oftē chastē slouthfulnesse men deafe woordes length compeld trouble awake vvherefore lette v learne speede giue eare woordes lorde least would draw v vnto willingly afterward wreasted v necessitie 46 rise let v go word declareth praier furnished new force willing enough die poynt hard cōbate infirmity fleshe wold willingly haue withdrawne frō death might haue good leaue father therfore praiers teares obtained newe force heauen wauered time want power vnder infirmitye flesh willingly taken vpon wil doutfully troublesome harde endeauour labour owne person might get v victorye nowe trouble appeased feare subdued might offer sacrifice free father doth stay flight doth willingly meete death 47 vvhile yet spake euangelistes doe diligently declare lord foresawe whatsoeuer befel whereby may certainly gathered drawne death outward violence far forth wicked executed secreat counsel god therfore though disciple set eye pitifull sight full terrour yet offred argument comfort wherwith might cō • ort themselues action selfe declared nothing done fortune christ foretold might direct beholde glory godhead armed company sent priestes gotten entreaty pilate captaine band men doeth appeare troubled vexed wyth bad cōscience al thing fearfully end shuld nede great force take christ knew defended force weapon therefore made diligēt preparance diuine power christ many instruction forced feele inwardly torment filled heart ful feare side wonderfull madnesse shewed selfe doubted force weapon rise god▪ 48 betraied doubt iudas restrained either reuerence lorde shame offence durst openly professe himselfe one enemy yea admonition marke sayeth gaue soldiours lead away warily therefore giuen doe imagine remēbred many meanes christ heretofore proued godhed meane season madnes wondred either friuolous dissimulation hide himselfe shoulde come sight sonne god would oppose witte men great power wicked driuen forwarde owne madnesse entangle themselues winding croked thought 49 god saue thee master doubt iudas one afraid peril master wordes pretēded pitiful affection therfore marke expresseth patheticall repetition master master though maiestie christ vrged yet deuill bewitched minde hoped throughly couer treason kisse flattering word therefore saluation acclamation pretence pitie doe iudge kisse thoughe ancient custome amongst iewes entertaine frends kisse yet iudas little departed christ semeth one afraid sodaine danger giue master last kisse shewe piety exceedeth rest seemeth hardly drawen maister meane season appeareth christes answeare profited nothing deceitfull dealing 50 frend wherefore art thou come expresly set downe luke iudas dost thou betray sonne man kisse reproofe vehement doeth wickedly abuse good master great honor bestowed vpon great treacherie ironical speache christ calleth frend obiecteth vnto ingratitude neare frende companion become traitour spoken psalme 41 55 13 14 straunger done might haue bene borne nowe familiar companion whome ate breade ioyfully went tēple lord hath lifted vp heele doe euidently see spake craft soeuer hypocrite doe couer themselues pretence soeuer seeme make shall appeare lord sinnes shalbe discouered yea greater iudgement shall light vpon receiued bosome christ doe traiterously rise vppe againste name frende wee saide carieth sharpe reproofe vnto mischiefe whyche christe beare hys owne personne muste knowe churche shall alwayes subiecte shee shall alwayes nourish traytours lier owne bosome therefore sayde little traitour came one twelue least suche example troubled aboue measure bothe meanes lorde would trie faith sathan oppresseth v churche without open ennemies within hypocrite forgeth secreat destruction yet whatsoeuer disciple togither taught woorshippe god sinceritie defection doe daily see doe prouoke v bothe feare studie true godlinesse paule sayeth vvho soeuer calleth vppon name lord lette depart iniquitie commaunded kisse sonne god behoue v diligently apply selues modesty beecause steede righte well ordred zeale dooth moste parte reygne v disordered rashnes euangelistes doe place conceale peter name iohn declareth dooth shortly text appear peter whoe heere noted though name sette downe yet may easilye gathered luke also fellowes hot doth speak vnto one saieth generally vnto suffer thus farre 52 put vp thy sword christ word confirmeth cōmaundement lawe wherein priuate men forbidden vse sword appoyntment punishment presently added must especially noted penalty left appointed pleasure men thereby reueng bloud god himselfe restraining v seuerely murder doth declare deare mankinde vnto first therefore wil defēded force might god forbidden strike law generall reason presently hee descendeth speciall heere moued question whether neuer lawefull violence repell vniust violence peter doe vngodly wicked theeues yet condemned tooke sword facte exception moderate defence could auaile christ seemeth tye men handes though question handled v vppon fift chapter yet againe wordes rehearse iudgemet first meete distinguish betweene ciuill court court conscience man resisteth theefe beecause lawes doe arme common enemy mankinde shall bee daunger publike punishment oft opposed defence vniust violence penalty god hath cō maunded earthly iudges execute ceaseth simple goodnes cause dooth free conscience guiltines except go pure affection therefore man may rightly lawfullye defend himselfe necessary put heate anger hatred desire reuenge disordered force minde defence may haue troublesome thing rare befalleth scarsly time christ hath good cause call disciple backe general rule altogeather abstaine sworde furthermore fanaticall men doe fondlye abuse testimonie might pull sword iudges say wicked strike sword doe graunt true lawefull man commit murther owne pleasure authour murther deny magistrate bee accounted amongst common order men minister god whome executeth owne iudgementes adde also christ wordes doth expresly giue power saieth murtherers shall putte death followeth sword put iudges handes may reuenge death vniustly slaine doth sometimes fall bloudy men punished meanes yet ordinary way wherby lord would haue cruell fiercenes wicked restrained least shoulde goe vnpunished nowe canonistes dare bold break impudency teach sword taken peter commaunded keepe vp vntill opportunity come draw fainte midst labour beginning work would strengthen v frō heauen vnto end feeling infirmity shuld cause make v slothful shuld restrain rashnes attēpting thing aboue calling also stir v vp praiers falling leafe certeinlye peter great courage v euen shewed strang token stout mind though preposterous boldnes yet tarrieth vntil shuld drawn iudgment seat hie priest vntil enemy force shuld threten death feared voice dāsel forth wt denieth master late seemed self soldiour inuincible euen death therfore let v remember force far able bear fal away shadow battel lord doth pay iust reward faithlesnes whē vnarmeth v weakeneth v shall afraid nothing haue cast away feare perfecte feare god flourished hart peter bene fortres inuincible naked vnarmed feareth whē yet far frō daunger 70 denied al circūstance maketh fault greater peter afraid deny master great company witness holy ghost wold purpose note verye light men might encourage v holde confession fayth deny christ weakelinges beeing shaken example doe wax faint doe asmuch v lyeth destroy manye soules wicked contemners god enemyes gospel defraude christe testimonye due vnto make holy name scorned men short bold free confession dooth strengthen godlye maketh vnbeleeuers ashamed falling away draweth publyk ruine faith reproach sound doctrine church therefore hygher place anye manne diligentlye hee must take heede cannot fall estate shal harme maner denyall set doth euidētly declare ye miserable sophisters auail nothing ambiguous shifting answeres bee time called yeeld reckoning faith peter dooth expresly abiure whole doctrine gospel denieth knew manne doth indirectly burye light redemption offered vnder person christ hee condemned vile filthy treachery heard lorde say little beefore confession fayth sacrifice acceptable god therefore denial cannot excused defraudeth god lawefull worshippe christe honour therefore lette v learne leauing simple free confession faith defrauding lawful testimony 71 maide saw mark word may rather gathered maid doth certeinly expresse besids former yet repugnācy probable one spoken • lew abroade mouthes first shuld speak many oft others withal came forth cō firme iudgement spread iohn reporteth question demaunded seconde time maide multitude men vvherby appeareth speach came frō damsel taken vp men stood assaulted peter another difference betweene mark three maketh mention crowing cock twise doe say cock crew peter denied lord thrise vnlosing knot hard marke reporteth nothing contrary hystory others doe passe ouer silence deliuereth plainly think christ saide peter cock crow meant crowing contained many course doubled cockes crow doe often iterate crowinges yet called one cockes crowing done one watch therefore mat luke iohn say peter denied lord thrise end cock crowing mark doth distinctly set one circūstance namely short space peter drawn deny thrise warned first crowing repented wee saye contrariety betweene prophane writer one rehearse matter left vntouched others ther • ore though reported mark doth differ yet repugnāt others worthy noted peter could escape simple denial doubleth ye offēce putting oth also litle u • ter whē vehemently vrged falleth • ursing wherby gather sinner doth fall carried worse worse doo beginne small sinnes doe runne headlong moste filthy heynous offence doe first abhorre iust vengeaunce god depriued helpe holy ghoste grannt sathan lyberty use 〈…〉 wholly tied boūd vnto may cast v 〈◊〉 •• ther dooth especiallye f • deniall fayth man feare crosse doth turne away pure profession gospell hee seemeth yet haue satisfied enemy runneth durst confesse sincerely dooth without coueringes altogether abiure also obserued peter fell thrise almost moment hereby appeareth slyppery redy fall oft satan vrgeth v truely wyll bee measure falling except lord outstretched hand shall holde v back force grace spirite quenched peter man came asked christ ready make hunded yea thousand denial therefore though filthy fall thrise yet lord spared restraining tongue enemy least shoulde moue moe trouble also necessary day hee bridle sathan leaste hee ouerwhelme v innumerable tentations though ceaseth beate v many engine yet lord prouidinge infirmitie beate backe force fury shoulde haue striue vnmeasurable heape tentations therefore haue great cause praise behalf mercy lord suffreth enemie haue scarse hundred part pleasure v 74 beganne curse third denial infidelity peter towards master breaketh vp great heap satisfied swearing leapeth ouer cursing wherein yeeldeth body soule destruction praieth cursse god maye lighte vppon hee knewe christe asmuch hee haue saide let come euill end haue thinge saluation god vvherein goodnes christ much admiration curing disciple raised deadly ruine place doth teach blasphemy spirit man infirmity flesh fall thogh deny known trueth peter truely hearde mouth lord detestable trechery deny men horrible vengeaunce doth remaine god aungelles slouthful feare crosse forsake confession faith litle preferred vaine death torment denial christ therefore wittinglye admonished casteth himselfe headlong yet hee obtaineth forgiuenes vvhereof followeth sinned infirmity incurable malice hee would willinglye haue yeelded vnto christ duety piety due vnto sparkes right affection beene quenched feare 75 peter remembred crowing cock christ also looked vpon luke witnesseth first despised crowinge cocke haue heard marke therefore meete christ shuld looke back vpon might come againe vnto selfe euery one v proue true selues v doth carelesly passe deafe eares say diuerse manifold songes birdes yet stirre v glorifying god woorde god doth euidentlye plainly resound vnto v doctrine lawe gospel mindes possessed brutish blockishnes onelye one day perpetually vntil shal vouchsafe look vpon v aloane conuerteth hart men yet worth labour note common maner looking looked vpon iudas yet became nothing better therby looking vpon peter ioyned secrete efficacy spirite eye beames grace pearced heart vvherfore let v know oft man shal fal cannot beegin repent except lorde looke vpon wept bitterly likely true peter went feare durst weepe witness wherin yet againe shewed infirmity vvherby gather hee deserued forgiuenes satisfaction obtained fatherly fauour god example taught though repentance halt yet hope well god despiseth weak repentance sincere meane peter secrete teares doe witnesse true repentaunce beefore god aungelles beeinge withdrawne eye menne doth set god aungelles teares doe flow innermost affection heart therefore noted doe see many doe shed tear plentifully long men look vppon whose eies secret presently waxe dry doubted ambition hypocrisie doe cause many shed teares powre forth none feare god iudgement yet demaunded whether true repentaunce requireth teares doe aunswere faithful oft drye eies mourne vnto lorde confesse faulte maye obtaine forgiuenes hainous offence blockish slouthful wounded sorow heauines ashamed euen powre forth teares therefore scripture findeth men guiltye sinnes exhorteth sackcloth ash matth 27 marke 15 luk 23 1 vvhen morning come chiefe priest elder peple tooke counsell iesus put death 2 led away
