appointed 1 anō dawninge hye priestes helde councill elder scribe whole council bound iesus led away deliuered pylate 1 whole multitude arose led vnto pilate 1 vvhen morning come vvhen chiefe priestes hys counsell examined christ aboute midnight length rising sunne determine bringe gouernour therin obserue forme iudgment least theyr haste shuld suspected shuld run pilate time tumultes vse yet probable sith christ brought council quickly consulted appointed long delay wold said time christ came shuld meete peter namely cockes crowing neere day vvherfore euangelistes meane remoued place report dawning day christ iudged death neither slacked anye time bold executing wickednes luke saide gathered morning must expounded beeginning laste action added afterwards haue said daye appeared lord confessed son god gaue sentence putting death liberty put death fury would haue laid outragious hand vpon pilate authority iudgements death enforced descend iudgment seat seeke catch snare former iudgment stoning stephen fel seditiously thinges vproare meete son god shuld solemne maner bee condemned earthly iudge might blot guiltines heauen 3 iudas seeing mat doth aduerb note certeine point time shortly addeth iudas saw hie priest refuse price treason cast temple came next waye caiaphas house iudgement hall staid vntil christe condemned therefore scarsly found day temple spak tragical fury council ioyned also withal death iudas wherin blinde obstinacy yron hardnes dooth better appeare saith iudas touched repentance repented hee displeased heinous offence committed god doth oftētimes open eies reptobate beginne feele sin abhorre ernestly sorow repēt said metame • ein also metan • ein therof also metan • ia true conuersiō man vnto god iudas therfore conceiued lothsomnes horror might turn vnto god rather ouerwhelmed dispaire might exāple mā wholy forsakē grace god paul doth good cause call godly profitable sorow 2 cor 7 10 leadeth repentaunce man shal stumble first entraunce confused mishapen sorrow shal profit nothing rather iuste reuenge doth god length plague wicked haue stubbornely despised iudgment doth deliuer bee tormented sathan without hope comfort true repentaunce disliking sinne conceiued feare reuerence god withal bringeth forth loue de • ire righteousnes vngodly farre affection would desire neuer make end sinning yea striue muche lyeth delude themselues god consciēce tormenteth blind horror wils striuing yt thogh hate sin yet feele sorrow doubtfulnes grieuous troublesom vnto thē hereof commeth passe sorow vnprofitable thē freely turne vnto god neither yet seeke better fast setled wicked desire pine awaye torment whiche cannot escape meanes saide euen god reuengeth obstinacy though god chastising elect hardly doth whē striue draw thē vnto yet woūds giueth doth heale time conuenient willingly come whose hand know hath smitten whose wrath afraid former therfore lesse flye feare iudgment god without hatred sin wounded incurable blow perish midst sorowes iudas giuē eare admonition christ bene yet place repentance despised louing calling saluation deliuered ouer serue sathan shuld cast headlong desperation papist taught truly schooles repentance nothing wanting iudas may founde theyr whol definition seene contrition heart confession moth satisfaction work speak wherby wee doe gather snatch bark omitte chief conuersion man god whil sinner broken shame feare renounceth may yeeld hymself obey righteousnes 4 vvhat v described sloth blockishnes hye priest admonished fearful exāple iudas doe yet remēber themselues graunte hypocrite vse slatter themselues colour themselues readines wherby would distinguish betweene cause iudas thought themselues partaker sin thogh abused trechery traitor iudas doth cōfesse sinned aduoucheth innocency christ whereof followeth sought destruction righteous manne▪ therfore guilty heinous murther douted god wold mark cōsciences hot yrō shuld discouer hiddē poisō let v learn oft see wicked terrified thing like many prouocatiōs v repētance neglect wherof obstinate doe double theyr fault also noted sin man al absolued entangled themselues euery way could much lesse authours wickednesse preuaile keepe themselues vengeance distinguishing themselues officer 5 hanged himselfe price doeth sathan sell baites wherewith allureth wicked time tourneth madnesse willingly cutting themselues hope saluation shall finde comforte deathe 30 piece siluer wherewith iudas betraied wel owne saluation christ himselfe casteth away though myght haue enioyed men doth onely depriue self sacrilegious hire price death christ also casteth away life though god stir hand yet wicked deceiued owne desire hauing desire depriue themselues vain good therof doe rather make halter themselues though become owne slaughter men executing vengeance vpon themselues doe mitigate diminish nothing wrath god towardes 6 lawful put heereby doeth plainly appeare hypocrite onely seeking outward shew doe mocke god prophane treasury imagine themselues thing pure neither doe regarde wicked couenant whereby lesse bounde themselues god vengeance iudas hainous offence lay vp price bloude holy treasury rather lawful take frō thence richesse offering temple neither taken place doe doubt thing polluted lay vp againe whence came pollution thēselues wicked endeuour couer sin much doth lord apply laying open hoped sinne buried honest cloke buy barren fielde buriall straungers wonderful prouidence god made successe cleane contrary field shuld eternal memorial treason hid gaue place name matter commonly knowne common consent called fielde bloude god commaunded mennes tounges speake reproache plausible matter prouide buriall straungers fal die hierusalem came thither farre countryes offer sacrifice portion gentile doe disallowe old menne haue wrytten token hope saluation giuen gentile included price bloude christe rather subtile deuice sure leaue finde corbana chalde woorde deduced hebrewe woorde corban whereof mention made 9 fulfilled doe graunte doe knowe howe hieremias name shoulde creepe neither doe muche laboure matter selfe doeth euidently declare name hieromiah errour putte zachariah thing redde hieremiah thynge come neare place aptly applyed maye seeme bee badly wreasted another sense wee holde rule whyche apostle followed citynge scripture shall bee easie bee knowen doeth aptlye agree christe whyche wrytten lorde complayned howe longe hee supplied office pastour gouernynge people hee bestowed hys labour vaine hee sayeth hee compelled wearisomnesse trauaile leaue labour therefore hee breakinge shepheards staffe refuseth shephearde sayeth afterwarde hee shoulde require wage giuen thirtie piece siluer woordes declareth lesse contemptuously accounted hee hadde beene base vile labourer hee compareth ceremony vaine deuices wherewith iewes recompenced hys benefites thirtie piece siluer vnto vnmeete vile hire hearde labourer therefore hee commaundeth shoulde bee caste potter temple hee haue sayde thys theyr goodly gifte whiche shoulde bee lesse reproachfull mee take contumelious offer lette rather bestow buy tile brickes wherewith may repaire chinkes hole temple nowe certainely christe appeared bee god hoastes agaynste whome people beginninge malignant vnthankefull hee reuealed fleshe meere whiche spoken figuratiuely deede visible manner fulfilled person therefore malice compelled bidde farewell withdrawe labour vnwoorthy valewed thirtie piece siluer contempte sonne god great shewe extreeme wickednesse price valued mathewe reporteth woordes zachariah doeth onely allude metaphore vnder lord complaineth vnthankfulnes people yet summe meaning al one iewes wholly ought themselues vnto lord without reproache sent away seruile hyre hee shoulde deserue gouerninge manye age anye hearde man one yeres labour therefore complaineth valued vile price hee shoulde inestimable ende sayeth vvhome child israel valued accused vehemently 11 herode hys menne warre despised mocked hym arrayed hym whyte sente hym agayne pilate 12 daye pilate herode made friendes togither ennemies 11 iesus stoode thoughe vncomely sighte farre differing dignitie sonne god hee shoulde drawne iudgement se • te prophane manne euill doer bandes pleade life yet must remembered doctrine crosse grecian foolishnesse iewes stumbling blocke consisteth saluation sonne god woulde stande bounde earthly iudge abide iudgement death wee beinge freed guiltinesse shoulde doubt come willingly celestiall throne god therfore consider profiteth v christ iudged pilate presently reproach vnworthy subiection shalbe wiped away certainly condemnation christ offendeth none either proud hypocrite blockish grosse contemners god ashamed owne wickednesse sonne god therefore stoode guilty mortall man suffered accused condemned might stande without feare god enemy endeuoured lay eternall infamie vpon must rather looke ende whereto prouidence god directeth v could remember fearfull tribunall seat god yet could freed thence christ hadde become guiltie vppon earth neuer yrke v glory bond againe oft doe heare christ stoode pilate heauy sorrowfull estate let v thereby take occasion comfort vsing intercessour may come foorth chearefully boldly presence god also appertaineth whiche presently followeth silence christ held peace priest vrged euerye side silence hee mighte open mouthes hence commeth notable power paule celebrateth rom 8 15 may cry full mouth abba father shall touch againe presently art thou king lewes thoughe thoughte ouerwhelme christ many sundry faultes yet probable tooke malitiously name king therby might procure enuie pilate therefore luke sette downe found peruerting people forbidding giue tribute casar saying offence odious pilate cared nothing keepe estate empire quiet appeareth iohn matter diuerslye handled whole course doth euidently appeare chief poynt accusation euen sathan also day endeuoureth vnder thys pretence bring gospel hatred suspition christe erecting kingdom weaken empire worlde ouertourne lawes king magistrate kinges part blinded pride think christ cannot raigne losse power therfore alwayes plausible action amongst wherwith christ vniustly charged therefore pilate neglecting accusation doeth especially rest vppon sedition found christe troubling thing state common wealth willingly condemned without delay reason asketh question kingdome though according three euangelistes answeare christ doubtful yet iohn may gathered christ freely confessed obiected withall cleared himselfe offence hee denied himselfe earthly king purpose vse diligence purge hymselfe guiltie doe vse euangelists doe sette downe halfe answeare shoulde haue sayde hee denied hee king yet ouerthwart ennemies noted quarrell wherewyth charged vndeseruedly 12 answeared nothing vvhy euangelists say christe held peace whose answeare reported euen nowe reason hee ready make defence hee willingly refrained neyther giue aunsweare kingdome desired loosed onely might shew himselfe redeemer promised time past euery knee shoulde bowe pilate wondered patience christ would willingly betray innocencie holding peace hee might readily haue • elled colde vaine quarrel integritye christ manifest iudge without defence pilate wished christe shoulde haue left cause vnansweared thereby lesse enuie might sette free thus farre pilate praise woorthy equitie fauouring innocencie christ vrged defende himselfe least wee wonder silence christ absurde thing behooueth v marke counsell god woulde hys sonne whome hee ordained sacrifice washing away sinnes though pure himselfe yet condemned guiltie person therfore christ kept silence might nowe become patrone might free v guiltinesse intercession held peace might glorye hys grace made righteous meanes fulfilled prophesie isa 53 7 ledde sheepe slaughter yet meane season witnessed good confession whereof paule maketh mention 1 tim 6 13 woordes deede might thereby procure thing priuately might thereby obtaine pardon mankinde lvke 4 pilate sayde sith christ beare punishment sinnes meete first cleared iudges owne mouth might appeare rather condemned others owne cause pilate durste dismisse freely tumult people hee willingly tooke occasion offered hee might referre hym ouer herodes iudgement herode whose surname antipas whome tetrarchie galile left iudea made parte prouince syria archelaus sent againe vienna though luke wil little shew herode appeased preset yet wil much seke gette fauour haue honest pretence keepe himselfe enuie auoide necessity condemning christ 9 herode sawe iesus exceedingly glad heereby appeareth drunke rather altogither madde wicked made theyr owne pride though herode woulde acknowledge christe sonne god yet accoūted least prophet wherfore wicked delited reproches ignominie bene iniuried time hee sight christe nowe hee hauing pleasure triumpheth conquerour vve see also howe prophet whome power god doeth shine loued wicked prophane men herode long wished see christe vvhy also desire heare hee might profite doctrine namely hee rather bare beholder diuine power godlily humbly reuerence ought wisedom flesh seke god woorkes may become subiecte power desire see seruaunts may auoide heare speakinge yea herode hoped myracle christe hadde yet rather lie guyltie feete allow teacher vvherfore maruaile god shoulde wythdrawe glorye vngodly would gladly haue hym make sportes iester 11 herode despised could otherwise christ despised proud manne pleased himselfe delites kingly honour richesse hee hadde contemptible estate yet herodes pride excused shutte vppe way grace god doubted god hee mighte plague former slouthfulnesse purposely hardened minde wyth suche sight hee vnwoorthy beholde sparke heauenly glory christe hee hadde long shutte eye full light wherewith countrey beene lightened luke declareth christe onely despised herode alone bande menne might know rare god haue righte honour prince courtes almoste courtier giuen vaine pompes sens ouerwhelmed muche vanitie doe eyther carelesly despise spirituall grace god else doe passe wyth closed eye contempt christe newe dignity purchased v nowe pretious god angel 12 made friendes christe token pledge friendshippe made betweene vngodly lette v learne howe contemptible child god religion selfe worlde probable bothe puffed vppe wyth ambition grew contention gouernment soeuer beginning dissention neither would yeeld least ioate right earthly affaire yet account made christe pilate doeth willingly send hym ouer herode like maner herode sendeth backe pilate day see iudges doe contende striue theeues wicked menne child god contemptuously reiected thinges nought hatred godlinesse doeth oft reconcile vngodly togither could agree nothing shuld conspire togither extinguish name god vngodly doe euery side deliuer child god deathe doe purchase mutuall friendshippe wyth great reward thinke moste vile doe hardly sticke euen manne shoulde cast crust bread dogge christ abolishing discord conclude another peace amongst v namely first reconciled god might godly holy consent partly help others maintain righteousnes partly myght striue brotherly dueties mutuall humanitie mathewe 27 marke 15 luke 23 15 nowe feaste gouernour woont deliuer vnto people prisonner would 16 notable prisonner called barabbas 17 vvhen gathered together pilate sayd vnto vvhether let loose vnto barabbas iesus called christ 18 knewe well enuie deliuered 19 also hee sette downe vpon iudgement seate wife sent saying haue thou nothinge doe iuste manne haue suffered manye thinges thys daye dreame reason 20 chiefe priestes elder hadde perswaded people shoulde aske barabbas destroy iesus 21 gouernour aunsweared sayde vnto whether twaine yee lette loose vnto sayde barabbas 22 pilate sayde vnto vvhat shall doe wyth iesus whiche called christe sayd hym lette hym bee crucified 23 sayde gouernour euill hath done cried sayinge lette crucified 6 nowe feast pilate deliuer prisonner vnto whomsoeuer would desire 7 one named barabbas whyche bounde followes hadde made insurrects insurrection committed murther 8 people cryed loude began desire would doe euer done 9 pilate answeared sayde vvill ye let loose vnto king iewes 10 knew hie priestes hadde deliuered enuie 11 hie priestes hadde mooued people desire woulde rather deliuer barabbas vnto 12 pilate aunsweared sayde againe vnto vvhat yee doe whome yee call kinge iewes 13 cried againe crucifie 14 pilate sayde vnto euill hath done cried feruently crucifie 13 pilate called togither hie priestes ruler people 14 sayd vnto ye haue brought manne vnto mee one peruerted people beholde haue examined hym haue found fault man thinges whereof yee accuse 15 yet herode sent loe nothing woorthye death done 16 therfore chastice let louse 17 necessitie must haue lette one louse feast 18 multitude cried sayinge awaye deliuer v barabbas 19 vvhich certaine insurrection made citie murther cast prison 20 pilate spake againe willing let iesus louse 21 cried saying crucifie crucifie 22 hee sayde vnto thirde time euil hath hee done finde cause deathe hym therfore chastice let louse 23 instante loud voyces required might crucified voice hie prsestes preuailed 15 feast gouernour wont described v partly vnappeaceable cruelty priest partly also furious obstinacy people must nedes wonderful madde satisfied conspiring death innocent mā except also despite set thiefe libertie sathan casteth vngodly headlong begin fall doe abhorre wickednesse neuer detestable menne blinded amased heape sinnes vpon sinnes doubted pilate might make yelde shame chose wicked man whome christ opposed might sette free hainousnesse crime whereof barrabas guilty haue caused people iustly haue hated least cō parison christ might set free neither priestes whole nation afraide shame desire seditious person murderer giuen vnto meane must consider counsell god whereby came passe christe worste men adiudged crosse iewes blinde furie doe rage god ordained sacrifice washing away sinnes world also suffered made inferiour theefe murtherer see sonne god broughte poynte manne rightly consider without great horrour loathing himselfe detestation owne sinnes hence also springeth small matter comfort christ therefore drowned depth ignominie deiection might procure ascension heauenly glory therefore accounted worse theefe myghte gather v societie angel god frute rightly esteemed shall enough enough abolishing offence crosse gouernour wont people choyse set one prisoner louse feast daye example foolishly wickedly brought manifest corruption woorship god nothing vnseemely solemnise holye dayes freeing sinnes punishment god hathe therefore armed magistrate sworde might seuerely reuenge sinnes whiche cannot bee tollerated without common daunger vvhereby appeareth hee woulde woorshipped violating lawes punishmentes order doe men profite rashly themselues deuise wayes serue god nothing shoulde attempted prescript rule worde vnder pretence honour doe oft serue reproches vvherefore must keepe sobrietie offer thyng god except require farre delited prophane giftes doe rather prouoke wrath 19 also sette downe thoughe meditation day might haue beene cause dreame yet without doubte pilate wife suffered trouble naturally doeth daily befall v speciall instincte god haue commonly thought deuill suborned woman end might hinder redemption mankinde likely drift priestes scribe earnest destroy christ therfore must rather taken thus god father diuers wayes approoued innocencie christe might appeare died cause others euen therefore shoulde oft cleared pilate mouth hee condemned lawfull satisfaction sinnes might appeare vndeserued condemnation mathew doeth especially report least manne shoulde wonder carefull endeuour pilate striueth tumult people life man despised certainly god trouble wife night stirred vp defēd innocencie sonne would deliuer death onely hee might testifie hee humbled beare punishment due others hadde deserued dreames vision haue spoken 20 chiefe priest euangelist noteth chiefe author mischief people pricked forward others excused lightnesse credite might know themselues bent christ sought pleasure priestes well forgatte equitie modestie owne saluation heereby taught howe hurtfull haue vngodly authority easily tourne common people whome nothing vnconstant hither thither offence purpose yet euangelist must noted people earnestly desired haue christ put death odious amongest greater part ambitiously desiring yeelde prelate without respecte equitie set tongue sale vngodly conspiracie fewe 22 vvhat shal doe iesus pilate saw blind madde great shame doubted delyuer notable offender death hee endeuoureth meanes touche might bring backe right way death christ bring shame vppon commonly reported iesu king christ shuld haue sayd haue pitie man least haue regarde owne honour straungers commonly thinke punishment corrected heate theyr cruelty meanes appeased yt wold go forward rather bee enemy publikely themselues priuately christe therefore marke pilate mighte vrge hardly hee sayeth also called iesus kinge declaring title common beene vsuall surname shame cast side doe boldly vrge death drewe ignominis whole nation iohn doeth report answeare three doe conceale namely haue king caesar hadde rather depriued hope redemption promised brought perpetual slauerie take redeemer offered god lv 16 therefore chastice let loose light offence cōmitted worthy death romane gouernours wont beat offended rod kinde punishmēt called chastisement therfore pilate doth vnrighteously freeing christ al offēce wold yet punish conuict smal crime doth testifie found fault worthy death saith innocency without exception therfore doth whip vse earthly men spirit god hath confirmed constant way righteousnes although desire mainteine equitie enforced yeeld smal iniuries account iust excuse thē fel grieuous sin doe chalenge thēselues praise worthy clemency somwhat spared innocent consider righteousnesse pretious life men violated wel rod axe concerning sonne god beene maner dismissed hadde borne reproache rod without worke saluation crosse euen royall chariot hath triumphed ouer ennemies wish world day filled many pilate doe see fulfilled member begun head vvith cruelty iewish priest cried christ put death doth popish clergy persecute seruaunts many iudges doe willingly yeelde rage make themselues butcher doe abhorre shed bloude may deliuer innocent death whip christ himselfe righteousnesse god else compel seruaunts god redēption life deny gospel make name christ subiect rod ye mean season pretēd violēce enemy colour faithlesse fearefulnesse well couered could excusable pilate deserueth great detestation though three euangelists omit yet appeareth iohn christ beatē rod yet pilate sought preserue life wofull sight might appease rage people yet iohn addeth withall could appeased vntill authour life put death mathew 27 marke 15 luke 23 24 vvhen pilate sawe hee auailed nothing tumult made toke water washed handes multitude saying innocēt bloud iust man looke 25 answeared al people sayde bloude v child 26 let barabbas loose vnto scourged iesus deliuered crucified 27 soldiours gouernour tooke iesus common hal gathered whole band 28 stripped put vpon scarlet roake 29 platted crowne thornes putte vppon hys heade reede right hand bowed knee mocked saying god saue thee kinge iewes 30 spitted vpon take reede smote head 31 thus mocked tooke roabe putte hys owne raiment ledde away crucifie 32 came found man cyrene named simon compelled beare crosse 15 pilate willing content people loosed barabbas deliuered iesus hee scourged hee might crucified 16 soldiours ledde awaye hall common hall called togither whole hand 17 cladi • purple platted croun thornes put head 18 began salute sayinge haile king iewes 19 smote • ead reede spat vppon bowed knee reuerence 20 mocked tooke purple put owne clothes hym ledde hym crucifie 21 compelled one passed called symon cyrene came countrey father alexander ru • u bear crosse 24 pilate gaue sentence required 25 lette lose vnto insurrection murther call prison whō desired deliuered iesus would 26 led away caught one symon cyrene comming field laid crosse beare iesus 27 followed greate multitude people woman woman bewailed lamented 28 iesus turned backe vnto sayde daughter ierusalē weepe wepe selues child 29 behold day wil come mē shal say blessed barren wombes neuer bare pappes neuer gaue sucke 30 shal begin say mountaines fal v hils couer v 31 thing greene tree shalbe done drie 32 2 others euill doer ledde slaine 24 vvhen pilate saw euen mariner haue tasted great force tempest last yeeld suffer themselues driuē contrary course pilate seeing vnable appease stir people laying authority iudge followeth mad outcry though striuen long resist yet necessitye doth excuse rather haue suffred thing haue neglected office sin made lesse childish ceremony vsed shuld wipe away blot offence drop water sacrifice could wash away may smal regard cleared fault god shewed people token detestation might fal might draw thē repent fury said thus beholde compel vnrighteous murther brought feare horror therfore shal become great vengeance god doth remaine chiefe author purpose euer pilate yet god wold meanes declare innocency son wherby might better appear sin condēned chief iudge world set tribunal seate earthly iudge condēned crosse wicked mā also set midst betwene two theues captain lothsomnes spectacle might first sight much trouble sens men reason considered punishment due v laid vpon christ guiltines taken away shuld dout come foorth presence heauenly iudge therefore water nothing preuailed pilate washing away hys fault shuld auaile day vse may purge eye impediment thereby may midst damnation clearly beholde righteousnesse christ 25 bloude v doubted iewes carelesly curssed thēselues cause good god vnaduised zeale caried headlong farre committinge sin vnpardonable shuld also solemne cursse cut themselues al hope forgiuenesse hereby gather carefully vnaduised rashnes must taken heed al iudgemēts wher men dare without regard examination please length frō blind headinesse necessary shuld fall madnesse iust vengeance god wherby plagueth pride voutchsafe make choyse right wrong iewes thought killing christ shuld god good seruice whēce commeth wicked errour vngodly stubbornnes contempt god himselfe vvherfore worthily throwne madnesse might purchase themselues vtter destruction question worship god holy mystery let v learne open eye reuerently soberly seeke know cause least hypocrisie audaciousnes shuld make v amased men without wit god neuer suffreth curssed speach come mouth people except impiety first ben desperate doeth iustly reuenge fearful vnwonted meanes yet incredible myracle hee reserued remnantes least couenant extinguished destruction whole nation adopted himselfe seede abraham might chosen nation priestly kingdom holy portion enheritance iewes one voyce doe conspire refusall great grace woulde say whole nation shuld pulled vp rote kingdom god god infidelity doth make manifest stedfastnes faith might declare made couenant vain wyth abraham exempted frely chosen general destruction truth doth alwaies go far beyond al let stop vnbelief man 26 let barabbas loose vnto three euangelist • set iohn recordeth pilate went vppe iudgement seat might thence giue sentence doe onely declare desire confused tumult people deliuer christ without cause death yet bothe noted assent shuld wrested wil yet shuld become iudge condemne pronoūceth innocent except son god pure sin death shuld haue ben clensed ben pledge punishment deserued still entangled guiltinesse sin therfore god would haue sonne condemned solemne maner might grace set v free cruelty punishment doth lesse auail strengthning faith feare god wrath terrifye v feeling sinnes humble v desire profite rightly meditating death christ meet begin greatnes punishment sustained shoulde afrayed sinnes shal come passe shal loath ashamed selues men wounded great sorow earnestnes meete shuld seeke help withal shuld feare men amased heart harder stone shoulde thoroughly wounded woundes sonne god hate detest sinnes washing away whiche sonne god suffered great paine horrible vengeaunce god doeth heere manifest selfe parte wee haue moste plentifull matter comfort sette v feared sinnes come god iudged sonne god hath freed v pretious rewarde onely die common maner deathe might purchase life v togither crosse tooke cursse vppon himselfe least vncleannesse shoulde remaine v 27 souldiours gouernour tooke iesus common hall gathered hym whole bande heaping vppe reproofes sette downe vaine god shoulde sette foorth begotten sonne beare kinde reproches knowe matter sport game therefore first meete consider haue deserued recompence christ offered stirre v vppe hope well filthinesse deserueth god shoulde abhorre angel spit vpon v christ might bring v presence father pure without spotte would himselfe spitte vppon defiled reproches vvherefore yll fauoured kinde dealing suffered vppon earth doth nowe purchase v fauour heauen also restoreth image god defiled almost blotted pollution sinne heere also doeth inestimable mercy god clearly shewe selfe cause woulde thus farre cast downe onely begotten sonne example christe prooued marueilous loue towardes v would refuse kinde ignominie saluation thing neede rather secreat meditation adorned foorth wordes meane taught measure kingdome god fleshly sences iudgement faith spirite long mindes shall setled world shall seeme contemptible v also ful shamefull reproches assoone shall lift vp heauen faith shall onely beholde spirituall maiestie christ shall blotte shame crosse spitting whipping buffeting reproches shall lead beholde hys glorye paule teacheth phil 2 10 8 giuen vnto name great power euery knee bowe willingly humbled himselfe death crosse vvherefore worlde doeth also day scorne christe lette v learne height faith ouercome offence neither let v regarde vngodly shall wickedly ascribe vnto christ ornamēts heauenly father shall clothe scepter wyth crowne shal adorne may placed farre aboue men also farre aboue angel great account made matter marke putteth purple steade scarlet probable christe apparelled costly garment vvhereby doe gather purple somewhat like euen painter picture doeth imitate truthe 32 found man cyrene circumstance set foorth extreme cruelty aswel iewish nation soldier douted euill doer wont beare cross euen place execution none strōg theeues wont crucified able beare burden estate christ far otherwise yt weaknes body might plainly shewe lambe sacrificed also may maimed whip hardly oppressed many iniuries fel downe vnder burden crosse euangelists report husbādman one account constrained soldier beare crosse maner punishment detestable thought shuld defiled shuld onely touch basest sort people enforced vile infamous office doth god nobilitate preacher vaine euangelists doe sette downe name also country child neither douted god wold beginning admonish v selues account estimation shall get dignity fame crosse sonne lv 27 followed though al people openly cō demned christ one voice yet see forgate doctrine myracles vnspeakable cruelty men scribe priest conspired put christ death luke hadde purpose namely might know people wickednes confusedly triūph shaken bridle god idle beholder sitteth heauen reuēger wil foorth teares vaine christe doeth simply reprooue weping yll without reason hee forewarneth haue farre greater cause weepe horrible iudgement god whiche hangeth ouer hee shoulde haue sayde death end beginning sorrowes hierusalem nation thus declareth cast pleasure vngodly god hath care punishmēt afterward followed doth plainly appear life christ deare god father euen men thought vtterly forsaken cast word declare strong couragious christ could haue spoken went constantly without feare death especially tendeth god yet regarded euen deformed base estate wicked proudly triumph conqueror shal long enioy mad ioy shortly ther shal come wonderful change doctrine also profitable v day acknowledge christ lesse beloued father without help time set much saluation spared begoten sonne hath giuen notable example vtterly ouerthrew holy citie onely made choise sanctuarie destroied togither inhabitant heereof let v learne take occasion meditate death christ god seuerely reuenged hee woulde neuer haue suffered son haue suffred end might sacrifice sinnes worlde 29 beholde dayes come denounceth hand common plague terrible hath beene heard vengeance god openly seene haue sayd nation consumed one onely kinde destruction shuld ouerthrowne manifolde heap great euils much better ouerwhelmed ruines mountaines swallowed vp earthquake wast away amongst seuere torment long destruction threat fell away vaine cruelty selfe fel far exceded lightning wordes appeareth iosephus speaches extreeme desperation wish couered mountaines cursse frute wombe christ doth word teach iewes shal feele length make warre mortall manne god enemy god doe receiue iust reward sacrilegious fury shoulde vaine desire oppose earth buckler vengeance god durst bold strike heauen selfe 31 doe thing greene tree christ sentence doth declare neither death shallbe vnreuenged neither iewes whose wickednesse ful ripe yea halfe rotten stand long common similitude proueth cannot fire wrath god presently deuoure burne vp vve know vse first cast dry wode fire moist grene burnt much lesse shall dry spared length woord doe may expounded indefinitely sence greene wood cast fire time thinke shall become dry old except man rather compare men god christ shoulde haue sayde wicked like vnto dry woode haue vniustly destroyed righteous haue turnes prepared god appoynted destruction escape hād heauenly iudge time giueth great liberty good innocent two wayes soeuer taken sum lamentation woman preposterous except withall wayt feare horrible iudgemēt god hangeth ouer vngodly oft bitternesse crosse troublesome v beyonde measure maye mitigated thys comfort god nowe suffereth child afflicted vniustly length suffer wicked shall go away vnpunished hope shoulde vpholde v shoulde necessitye fall downe vnder affliction though naturall vsuall make fire drie woode moist yet god followeth order graunteth reprobate quiet rest exerciseth diuers trouble therefore estate myserable esteemed doeth presently appeare ready remedy patiently wayte whole course god iudgement shall comfort see wicked gayne nothing small delay god shall humble hys faithfull one fatherly roddes wil rise drawne sworde agaynst whose sinnes refused bitter confection againe thrust vpon mockery afterward matthewe addeth souldiours giuing drinke vpbrayded could delyuer himselfe death vvhereby gather medicine beeing offred scorned weakenesse christ complained forsaken god concerning hystory set downe iohn sufficient note one thing christ cooling thirst asked cō mon drinke might giuen thrust vpon vineger mixed mirrhe gal hasten death bore tormentes patientlye wearinesse sorrow soughte haue death hastened also portion sacrifice obedience beare delay paine euen vtmost deceiued iudgement doe reckon vineger amongst tormentes inflicted much offence bitternes refuseth wine vineger yt might shew himselfe quietly go forward death according commaundement father impatiēcy sorrow driue hym headlong neither hinderaunce iohn sayeth righteousnes plenty good thing without feare might appeare angelles vile filthynes torne habite kept entraunce heauen christe himselfe suffered garmentes bee taken pray might enrich v rich victory entreat god pardon persecutor let might commit iust iudgement god knew appointed reprobat obstinate vvhē christ therefore saw partely iewish people partly soldiours madde blinde heate though said vnto verely saye vnto thee daye thou shalt paradise 39 passed circumstance doe containe great matter heere sette beefore eye humblinge sonne god lowest degree whereby may better appeare much saluation cost withall considering right paine due v bore stirred vp repentaunce spectacle god dooth openlye reueale v miserable estate haue beene hadde redeemer whatsoeuer thinges christ bore vppon must applied comforting v certeinly contention harder tormentes menne vexed checkes tauntes reiected forsaken god therefore dauid psal 22 7 8 9 bearing person christe trouble hee doth especially sword force armes deriding ye grace god attempted ouerthrow faith dauid also first christ suffred temptation least terrifie v daye noueltie wicked shall neuer wanting tryumph ouer misery common deuise sathan oft god doth comfort v according desire hideth help litle obiect hope vaine promise effect 40 thou destroyest temple doe charge christes doctrine vanity necessary doth shew deede power callenged himselfe desire speake euil depriued wit iudgement shortly might haue easily seene trueth saying christ hadde sayde destroy temple three dayes wil raise vp doe make proud triumph beginninges ruine looke end third day insolency wicked vse child god vnder pretence crosse doe endeuour cut hope lyfe come vvhere say immortal glory credulous menne foolishly boast lye without glory despised others liue poorely others hardly draw breath vnder continual trouble others tossed flying banishmēts others pine away prison others burnte brought ash present corruption outward man doth blinde doe imagine hope renewing life come bee vaine ridiculous wee must waite time appointed promised building neither must wee beare grieuously bee nowe crucified christe may afterwardes partaker resurrection thou bee sonne god vngodly doe require christe testimony power prouing himselfe sonne god cease sonne god vppon condition hee became man came world sacrifice death might recōcile mē god father therfore yt might shewed son god necessarye hang vpon crosse reprobate deny redeemer place son god except descending frō crosse shuld renounce cōmandement father reiecting washing away sin cast office laid vpon god let v hereby learn strengthen faith son god work saluation woulde remaine fastened crosse vntil partly cruel tormēts flesh partly horrible anguish spirite hee suffer death self least shuld befall v tempt god like maner see men let v suffer god oft shal seeme good vnto hide power againe according owne pleasure may execute conueniently appeareth wickednes obiection presently followeth king israel let come crosse wil beleeue meete thē accept king one described prophet isaiah expresly 53 zachariah 9 9 doe describe christ without forme afflicted condemned accursed broken poore contemned shuld enter roial throne therfore iewes preposterously desire one vnlike whome would acknowledge king doe declare haue regard king god promised giue thē contrary side faith may wholly reposed christ let v seeke help crosse hee cannot otherwise accounted lawful king israel perfourming partes redeemer hereby doe gather howe daungerous thing wandring deuises depart frō word god ye iewes imagined haue king wit deuised thē refused christ crucified thought absurd thing beleeue v best chief reason beleefe beecause cause willingly submitted ignominy crosse 42 saued others vnthankfulnes excused offended present abasing christ make account al miracle wrought sight cōfesse hadde saued others power meanes vvhy least behalf reuerēce manifest work god malitiously choake yea much lyeth endeuour quench light god shone miracle vnworthy iudge aright infirmity crosse beecause christe dooth presently deliuer death vpbraid weaknes vsuall amongst wicked measure power god presently seene whatsoeuer doth think cannot therefore doe charge weaknes oft doth obey peruerse desire lette v note christe hee easily could presently deliuer death would doth time neglect sauegard regarde saluatiō v al wold deliuer might deliuer v al therfore see thing make well edificatiō faith iewes owne malice drew maintenance vnbeliefe 43 trusteth god sathan hath said sharpe dort temptation hee faineth god forgetteth v doth helpe v speedily point time god waiteth vpon saluation child doth help time conuenient also preuenteth necessity scripture doth euery wher declare seemeth loue thē helpeth logicke leadeth v despaire trust loue god vaine helpe doth appeare openly prompteth mindes kind fallacie suborneth minister shall argue god hath regard sauegard reiecteth v hee deferreth help therfore behoueth v refuse argument faulty beloued god whō seemeth forsake time nay nothing absurd tie loue euery point time god promiseth deliuerer somtime hee shuld seeme winke aduersities delaye muste borne patience vvherfore contrary nature faith vrge aduerb god crosse trouble frameth patience stirreth vp praiers call vpon name rather testimony fatherlye loue apostle epistle hebrewes 12 6 declareth especiallye seene christ though beloued son yet hee deliuered death vntil borne punishmēt due v price redeemed saluation vvherefore priest againe deale peruersly doe conclude son supplieth roum appointed father 44 also theeues cast teeth matthew marke synecdoche doe attribute theeues proper onelye one appeareth luke neyther may speache seeme straunge two euangelistes hadde purpose declare christe rayled vppon euerye side euen theeues spared nowe hee halfe deade euen dauid psalm 22 7 8 beewayling calamity doth thereof •• ke occasion amplifie greeuousnes made shame men contempt people though doe omitte history worthy bee remembred luke reporteth theefe yet absurdity doe say christ derided yea euen theeues spoken euery perticuler person kind men nowe therefore let v come luke lv 39 one euil doer reproach son god suffered theefe great honour gotten v amongst angel shoulde acknowledge v brother meane set v example furious obstinacy wretched man seeing ceaseth vomit blasphemyes crueltie midst affliction desperate menne cannot escape torment doe vse bie frowardnes seeke reuenge thogh vpbraideth christ could neither saue himselfe others yet obiection striketh god wicked oft obtaine desire would willingly pull god heauen meete tamed affliction become gentle hereby appeareth hardnes euill hearte hardened could bowed punishment 40 aunswered miserable man set v rare example vnhoped incredible grace god partly sodenly death chaunged new man drawne backe euen helles heauen obtained moment forgiuenes sinnes wherein hadde beene drowned al life hee receiued heauen apostle first fruites new church firste therefore conuersion man dooth clearely appeare notable token grace god came proper instinct flesh cast great cruelty proud contempt god presently repent brought vnder hande god scripture teacheth repentaunce woorke grace much excellent befell beyond al men hope would ouer haue thought theefe last breath shoulde onely become godly worshipper god singuler maister faith piety whol world also mouth may learne rule true lawfull confession vttered first fruites repentaunce sharpe reprehension reproued vngodly frowardnes fellow addeth second humbling himselfe free confession sinnes attributing christ prayse due ryghteousnesse afterwardes testifieth wonderful faith casting himselfe wholly hys saluation defence christ yet saw hanging vpō crosse ready dye fearest thou god though interpreter doe wrest wordes diuersly yet simple meaning seemeth mee thus meaneth condemnation compelleth thee feare god theefe doth thereof take occasion exaggerate hardnes hys fellow brought extreame necessitye dooth beginne feare god al ambiguity may taken away reader admonished arrogant wicked raylet thought haue passed scoffing without punishment called backe iudgement seat god though hee beene life without feeling behoued tremble felt hand god armed shortly yelde reckening offence therefore signe desperate deuillish obstinacie god helde tied vp last iudgement come right minde beene droppe pietye heart man shoulde least enforced gather himselfe feare god nowe vnderstand meaning woordes desperate without feare god amended punishment en auto crimats doe interpreat present execution condemnation theefe sayd sith thou art midst death behooued thee wakened thou mightest acknowledge god thy iudge heereof gather profitable doctrine doe wholely sette themselues god taught humility correction shame doeth necessity driue holde peace soeuer endued feare god 41 vvee deede heare righteously reproofe gathered condemnation mighte seeme light vppon christe theefe dot • h heere make distinction betweene christe cause hys fellowe punishment whiche common hee confesseth iustlye laide vppon fellowe vppon christ putte deathe anye faulte hys owne crueltye ennemies muste bee remembered whiche sayde euen nowe theefe made notable shewe repentaunce suche god requireth euery v confesseth receiueth rewarde woorthy hath done especially must noted cruelty punishment hinderance hee submitted himselfe patiently fierce torment vvherefore doe truely repent sinnes lette v learne confesse willingly without dissimulation neede shalbe flee ignominie haue deserued onely meanes whereby may bury sinnes god aungels striue couer men vaine colour amongest diuers cloakes whiche hypocrisie vseth thys common euery man draweth others example might excuse himselfe theefe contrary side doeth lesse carefully defend innocencie christ simply freely condemne himselfe fellowe 41 lorde remember doe knowe whether euer beginning worlde example faith rare worthy remembred muche grace holye ghoste woorthy hadde admiration heerein shewed selfe euidently theefe onely neuer beene scholer christes schoole thrusting himselfe bloudy murthers hadde endeuoured quenche sense righteousnesse doth sodaine pierce deeper apostle rest disciple teachinge whome lorde himselfe hadde bestowed muche labour onely christe vppon tree execution woorshippeth king hee celebrateth kingdome horrible deformed basenesse calleth die author life truely hee beene instructed true faith hearde many thing office christ hadde also beene confirmed myracles yet knowledge couered cloude reproachfull death might vanishe away nowe woonderfull hee beinge rude yonglinge yea hys minde altogither corrupted presently first instruction vppon curssed crosse apprehend saluation celestiall glory wyth markes ensignes see christ adorned might lift vppe minde kingdome certainly hee shoulde clime deepest helles aboue heauens flesh thys fable laughed attribute man cast away condemned whome world could abide kingdome farre noble earthly empire heereby gather quicke eye mind wherwith beheld life death height ruine glory reproache victorye destruction kingdome slauerie theefe extolled faith christe nowe hanging vppon crosse ouerwhelmed curssinge heauenly throane woe slouthfulnesse doe reuerence nowe sitting right hand god doe fasten hope life resurrection go heauen whether entred nowe parte wee doe consider state hee besought christe mercy faith shall growe admiration torne body almost life waiteth last blow slaughter men yet reposeth himselfe onely grace christ first whence hath hope forgiuenesse death christe seemeth detestable conceiueth sacrifice good sauour effectuall wash away sinnes worlde courage regardeth torment nay forgetting himselfe caried hope desire better life doeth farre passe vnderstandinge man vvherefore let v ashamed learne mortification flesh patience excellency faith constancy hope zeale godlinesse maister whome lord sette ouer v humble pride flesh readilier man followeth nearer shall come christ 43 verily say thee though christ yet triumphed opēly ouer death yet sheweth effect frute abaced meanes declareth yt neuer thrust ye power kingdō nothing doth notably royally beseeme diuine king restore life whiche deade christ therefore though stricken hand god appeared shewe man halfe desperate yet ceassed sauiour world alwaies endued heauenly power performance office first heere noted hys incredible readinesse without delaye hee accepteth theefe louingly promiseth shall partaker blessed lyfe vvherefore doubted admit wythout exception kingdome whiche doe come vnto vvhereof may assuredly gathered shall saued hee mindefull v cannot shoulde forgette doe commende theyr saluation theefe easie passage heauen thing greatest extremitye rested vppon grace christ much shall christ conquerour death day reache foorth hande throne v may gather v fellowshippe life absurde since time hee nailed crosse hand wryting whyche v hath putte death sathan flight resurrection hath triumphed ouer prince worlde shoulde easie ready passage death life v theefe therefore soeuer ready die shall wyth true faith commit custodie soule christ shall driuen long time languish suspence christ accept desire wyth kindnesse vsed towardes theefe therefore awaye wyth stincking deuice sophisters retaining pain fault remitted see christ doeth presently deliuer punishment whome freeth guiltinesse neither lette theefe neuerthelesse beareth euen vttermost punishment whereto appoynted must heere imagine recompence steed satisfaction appeasinge iudgement god sophisters dreame lord corporall punishment doeth simply teache electe detest hate sinne therefore christ doeth set vpon lappe theefe brought fatherly correction deny himselfe sendeth fire purgatorie noted keyes gate kingdome heauen opened theefe popish confession satisfaction accoūted christ entreated repentance faith receiue came willingly heereby againe better confirmed whych touched euen nowe man shoulde disdaine walke steppe theefe followe went woorthy eternal destruction vngodly pride driueth himselfe frō entring heauen truely person theefe christe hath giuen vnto v common pledge assurance obtaininge forgiuenesse againe vouchsafed wretch great honour men casting owne glory glory mercy god alone euery one v would truely earnestly search himselfe great heape sinnes woulde woorthily make v ashamed selues woulde irke v take poore man meere grace obtained saluation guide standered bearer death christe brought foorth frute presently doe heereof gather soules doe depart bodyes doe remaine liue otherwise promisse christe shoulde iest whyche also confirmed wyth oathe yet place paradise lette v curiously subtilly dispute lette suffice v soeuer faith grafted bodye christe partaker life death shall enioy blessed ioyfull rest vntill perfect glory heauenly life shall fully reuealed comming christ one thing yet remaineth promiseth theefe take away present misery diminish thing corporall punishment vvhereby admonished grace god must esteemed iudgement flesh doeth oft fall god doeth suffer bee miserablye afflicted whome yet hee loueth therefore miserably vexed body let v take heed least bitternesse griefe take away tast goodnesse god rather let one comfort temper mollifie euils assone god taketh v fauour trouble euer doe suffer doe v towardes saluation shal come passe faith shall escape misery victory shall sweetely rest euen midst bearing affliction mathew 27 marke 15 luke 23 45 nowe sixte houre darkenesse ouer al land vnto ninthe houre 46 ninth houre iesus cried loude voyce sayinge eli eli lamasabacthanie god god hast thou forsaken mee 47 stoode heard sayde man calleth elia 48 straight waye one ran toke spong filled vineger putte reede gaue hym drinke 49 sayde let let v see elia come saue 50 iesus cried againe loude voyce yeelded vp ghoast 51 behold vaile temple rent twain toppe bottome earth quake stone clouen 52 graues open themselues many body sainctes whiche slepte arose 53 came graues resurrection went holy citie appeared vnto many 54 vvhen centurion watchinge interpreter doe think god sent darknes signe detestation god darkning sunne hide face moste filthy wickednes others say darknes visible sunne death sunne righteousnes declared others rather applye making nation blind followed shortly iewes reiecting christ taken amongst depriued light heauenly doctrine neither thing left besides darknes desperation rather thinke people would see light blockishe stirred vp darknes consider wonderful counsel god death christ vnwonted alteration order nature beene altogether hardned haue earnestly moued sens attende renewing woorld come meane sight full terrour closed eye passed darkeninge sunne woonderfull madnesse shoulde make v afraide must necessitye blockishe brute beastes warned woonder rigour heauenly iudgement ceased scoffing spirit amasednesse giddinesse wherwith god maketh reprobate drunken hath long striuen malice meane let v learne bewitched sleightes sathan glory god neuer manifest hidden least theyr mindes darkened seeing see sith general admonition profite v day let v know sacrifice wherewith redeemed lesse moment sunne fallen heauen whole frame world beene ouerthrowne may brought abhorre sinnes doe thinke darkening sunne ouer al quarter world thinke likely though one wryter another haue reprorted yet hystorie time renoumed notable myracle could concealed many others diligently searched set downe thing worthy remembrance appeared force man cry christ yet certain vehemencie griefe wrested certainly chiefe conflict sharper tormēts hys sorrowes comforted aide fauour father thought sort forsaken offered body price recōciliation god soule also bore punishment due v rightly became man ful sorrowes isai 53 3 speaketh truely foolish passing part redemption doe onely rest vppon outward punishmēt flesh end christ might make satisfaction v behoueful stand guilty iudgemēt seat god nothing horrible feele god iudge whose wrath exceedeth death therefore kinde temptation laid vpon christ god enemy nowe giuen ouer destruction taken horror wherin al mortal mē swallowed vp hundred time maruellous power spirite escaped victory maketh complaint dissemblingly maner plaier forsaken father many pretend spake thus according opinion common people fonde cauill inwarde sorrowe minde compelled forceably earnestly breake cry onely redemption serue eye wrought sayd euen offred pledge v beare deede iudgement god place seemeth absurde desperate speach passe christ answear easie though sence flesh beheld destruction yet faith fast setled heart wherein behelde god present whose absence complaineth vve sayde godhead gaue place infirmity flesh farre forth mete saluation end christ might fulfil partes redeemer vve haue also noted difference betweene sence nature knowledge faith wherefore cause hinder christ might minde conceiue alienation god farre sence see withall faith held god mercifull vnto doth euidently enough appeare two partes complaint woulde vtter temptation first protesteth fleeth god god shield faith valiantly repelled assault forsaking assaulted hym side short sharpe torment faith remained safe complaining forsaken yet trusted helpe god hand speache woorthy especially noted doth appeare holy ghost end might imprinted man memory woulde haue reported syrian tounge much shuld bring christ rehearsing word vttered mouth much theyr slouth thereby condemned vile make account christes great sorrow dreadful feare passed lightly place soeuer considereth christe toke vppon person mediatour condition might beare guiltinesse well soule body maruaile striue sorrowes death hee shoulde cast god begin couer reproche crosse honor burial truely threw enuie hatred whole nation yea great daungers doubted greatly strengthened secreate instinct spirit though one christes disciple yet durst neuer euāgelists report rich might know ouercame let wōderfull loftinesse mind otherwise cōpelled go backwards rich mē proud nothing difficult willingly abide contēpt common people wee knowe howe foule infamous worke shuld take dead body man crucified hand slaughter man greater estate wary also fearefull beene men giuen richesse vse flee danger except enboldned heauen dignity calling also set downe shoulde counsellour senator behalf also power god might shine forth one base sort men hired set worke stealth secreatly bury body christe hie degree honor stirred vp performe dutye incredible ready serue christ thus religiously euidently appeared whole action gouerned counsel hand god example taught rich men farre excuse defraud christ honor due rather guiltye double offence make hinderance kingdome god also praised righteousnes waiting kingdō god rote beginning righteousnes kingdō god vnderstande restitution promised christ excellency estate prophet euery promised comming christ could stand god gathered vnder gouernment men dispearsed abroad godlinesse ioseph poynt commended miserable state hee nourished hope redemption god promised hence also groweth feare god desire liue holily righteously could man giue himselfe serue god hopeth deliuered let v note saluation christe generally appoynted iewes promise common holy ghost doth giue testimonie fewe place doe heare ioseph vvhereby appeareth incomparable grace god buried malitious forgetfulnesse almost people brag ran euery men tounges christ shoulde come couenaunt god fixed mindes fewe whych beleeued spirituall renouation truely theyr blockishnesse horrible therefore marueile pure religion waxed vse hope saluation extinguished would god corruption vnhappy age lyke christ appeared redemer iewes whole world testified prophesyings prophet hee er • cted kingdome god bringing thing confusion right lawfull order hath appoynted v time warfare wherin exerciseth patience vntill shall come againe heauen perfourme kingdome hath begun vvhat one man doeth aspire yea little hope men almost bent worlde resurrection promised howsoeuer greater part forgetfull ende flitte hether thether let v remember vertue
