mighte prepare odour oyntments seconde day might solemnise funerall according order vvhereby doe know mindes perfumed better odour lorde breathed foorth death hee might lift higher brought sepulchre mathewe 27 marke luke 62 nowe next day followed preparation sabbath hie priestes pharisies assembled pilate 63 sayd sir remember deceiuer sayd yet aliue within three day rise 64 commaund therefore sepulchre made sure vntill thirde daye least disciple come night steale away say vnto people risen dead last errour shalbe woorse first 65 pilate said vnto ye haue watch goe make sure yee know 66 went made sepulchre sure watch sealed stone 62 next day hystorie purpose mathewe much shew obstinate furye scribe priest persecuted christ represent vnto v glasse wonderfull prouidence god approued resurrection hys sonne subtile men exercised fraudes treachery conspire amongst themselues deuise meanes whereby maye extinguishe memory dead man see haue preuailed nothynge except ouerwhelme faith resurrection truely endeour bring passe doe bring knowledge light set purpose certainly resurrection christ manifest least might haue hadde liberty denye prouided place witness graue therefore see lorde doeth deceiue subtile men also catching owne counsel snare draweth compelleth obey enemy christ vnworthy resurrection shuld made manifest meete impudency shoulde reproued pretence speaking euil taken yea theyr conscience conuinced shuld excused ignorance meane let v note god hired wage vsed theyr labour setting foorth glory christe sepulchre found empty haue colour lying left deny yt shuld stay frō mad vngodlinesse full testimonie mē right sound iudgement christ risen againe whose body laide sepulchre founde though souldiours set euery side watch 63 vve remember deceiuer sayd thought put inspiration god onely lorde might execute iust reuenge vpon sinne doth oft vexe blinde torment mindes guilty within thēselues especially might bridle filthy tōgues ye mean behold blockish vngodly cathan hath bewitched doe yet call deceiuer whose diuine power glorye late shewed forth many myracles truely striue cloud deriding darkenesse sunne spit may say face god suche example taught must season godly modest attentiuenesse consider glory god reuealeth self least brutish horrible blindnesse ensue hardnesse though first sight seemeth hard absurd vngodly shuld vily triumph ouer christ dead least liberty trouble v meete alwaies marke wisdome purpose lord wold apply ye wicked seeme themselues ouerwhelm whole doctrine christe myracles one blasphemye whiche doe proudly vomitte foorth god doeth vse meanes themselues deliuer sonne sinister note deceit therefore oft wicked shall quarrel prepare themselues peruert thinges shall giue themselues speake euill pleasure let v wayte quiet patient mindes vntill god shal lay open light darkenesse 65 haue watche pilate doth declare wordes doth refer owne pleasure may appoynt souldiours watch graunt tied deuising cauilles though durst without shame wrangle christ resurrection yet pilate signet rather shut vp owne mouth sepulchre mathew 28 marke 16 luke 24 1 nowe ende sabbath first daye weeke beganne dawne mary magdalene marye came see sepulchre 2 beholde great earthquake angel lord descēded heauen came rolled back stone dore sate vppon 3 countenance like lightning raimens white snowe 4 feare keeper astonied became dead men 5 angell answeared sayd woman feare yee knowe yee seke iesus crucified 6 risen sayde come see place lord laid 7 go quickly tell disciple hee risen dead beholde goeth galile yee shall see loe haue tolde 1 sabbath daye past mary magdalene marye mother iames salome bought sweete oyntments might come embalme 2 therefore early morninge first day weeke came sepulchre sunne yet rising 3 sayd one shall roll v awaye stone dore sepulchre 4 looked sawe stone rolled away great one 5 went sepulchre sawe yong man sitting right side clothed long white robe afraid 6 said vnto afraid ye seeke iesus nazaret hath beene crucified risen heere beholde place put 7 goe way tell disciple peter hee goe galile shall see sayde vnto 1 first day weeke early morning came vnto sepulchre brought odor prepared certain womē thē 2 found stone rolled awaye sepulchre 3 went founde body lord iesus 4 came passe amased therat beholde two men sodainly stoode shining vesture 5 afraide • owed face earth sayd thē seeke yee liueth among dead 6 heere 〈◊〉 • risen remember howe spake vnto yet galile 7 saying son mā must deliuered hand sinfull men crucified third day rise 8 remembred word nowe come poynte redemption hence springeth liuely hope reconciliation god christ came lower partes earth conquerour death might shew hadde power new life hande vvherefore paule 1 cor 15 14 doth rightly say gospell hope saluation frustrate vayne except beleeue christe risen deade finally righteousnesse purchased v entrance made heauen short adoption confirmed christe shewing power spirite resurrection prooued himselfe sonne god though manifested resurrection order fleshly wisedome would desire yet meanes pleased must also seeme best v came graue man seeing emptie place might first token next angel tell woman aliue shortly appeared vnto length apostle oft time little little led according capacity knowledge first beganne woman shewed himselfe seene also enioyned preach gospell apostle might scholemistresses slouthfulnes apostle first chastised feare lay almoste without life woman hasted busily sepulchre also throughly rewarded though purpose annoynt christ without fault 〈◊〉 still remained deade yet hee pardoning infirmitye bestowed vppon singular honour resigning office apostleship taken men thys maner made shew paule teacheth 1 cor 1 27 namely would chuse thinges whiche foolish weake worlde might pull downe pride fleshe wee shall rightly prepared learne article faith except laying pride doe submit selues taught testimonye woman faith tied vp narowe straight lord might prooue obedience would haue v become fooles would fully admit v knowledge mystery concerning hystorie mathew saith 2 mary came see sepulchre marke adioyning salome third sayeth bought sweete oyntments might annoynt body luke gathered came two three many knowe vsual amongst holy wryters great number set downe also probable coniecture mary magdalene companion whether shee sent ran owne accord came sepulchre rest woordes mathewe doe seeme note two came see shoulde haue seene appeared meanes howe annoynt christ meane concealeth office purposed minde perfourme one thing principal purpose speake resurrection yet demaunded howe labour woman mixed superstition please god doubt applie maner annoynting deade receiued father mighte sorrowe death seeke comfort hope life come graunt offended presently applied theyr mindes hadde heard spoken mouth maisters doe holde generall principle last resurrection defecte pardoned iustly defiled whole action doe say god oft time fatherly goodnesse accepteth doings sainctes without forgiuenesse please right reiected wyth ignominye punishment therefore appeared wonderfull goodnesse christe aliue kindly louingly mette woman wrongfully sought amongest deade suffered come sepulchre vaine may certainly determined man faith approache vnto hym shuld deceiued distance place shall lette faithfull shall enioy power spirite filleth heauen earth mar 1 vvhen sabbath day past effect whych mathew sayeth ende sabbath first day sabbath beg •• • wne likewise luke first day sabbath sith know iewes beganne theyr day assoone night beganne waxe darke meaning sabbath ended woman began consult amongst themselues going see sepulchre might come thither day morning two euangelists doe call first daye sabbath whiche first order betweene two sabbath vvhere others translated one ignorance hebrewe tongue caused manye erre • signifieth sometimes one sometimes first euangelists many place following hebrewe phrase sayd mi •• least ambiguitie shoulde deceiue haue plainly expounded meaning buying sweete odour hystorye luke differeth little markes woordes retourning citie shoulde prepare sweete oyntments according commaundement law rest one day toke iourney marke reporting two diuers thing • one text lesse regarde note distinction time luke mixeth togither iourney matter selfe well agree hauing kept holy rest departed house yet darke night might come sepulchre day first begin dawne must againe remembered touched though rite annoynting deade common many prophane nation yet lawfully vsed onely iewes▪ whome beene deliuered father might exercise themselues hope resurrection without respecte beene colde vaine comfort embalme dead corpes without sense know egyptian carefully applied thē selues way without profite god holy signe represented iewes image life euen death might hope receiue newe strength corruption dust resurrection christe throughe liuelye odoure 〈◊〉 sepulchre breath life dead abolished outward ceremony vvherfore needed meanes came rudenesse ignorance woman yet well vnderstand free corruption 3 sayd amongest themselues onely marke setteth downe thy • doubt sith others doe report stone rolled away angel easily gathered remained perplexed doubtfull counsell vntill way opened hand god hereby doe learne caried away zeale came thither without consulting sene stone layd vpon sepulchre kepe men frō entring thought leisure house astonyed feare admiration reason memory failed blinded holy zeale god doeth impute fault vnto math 2 beholde great earthquake lord reuealed presence glory many signes hee mighte better frame heart holy woman reuerence sith matter small moment knowe sonne god hadde gotten victory ouer death wherin summe saluation consisted meete taking away al doubt maiestie god openly plainly offer selfe seene mathewe therefore sayeth earthquake vvherein sens might discerne celestiall power spake meete woman wakened wonder might thinke vppon humane earthly thing lift vppe mindes woorke god newe vnlooked brightnesse godhead shewed selfe also apparel fourme angel beames might perceiue mortall man stoode shape man though brightnesse light whitenesse snow nothing great glory god colour must imagined desire know rightly yet outwarde note declaring neare doeth according capacitie infirmitie cal v himselfe must knowen onely offereth vnto v visible signes presence mindes might apprehend inuisible vnder corporal shape giuen taste v spiritual essence might spiritually seeke yet doubt outward signes ioyned inward efficacie might graue heart woman feeling godhead though amazed first yet appeareth text degree came themselues taught fele hand god present three euangelistes doe endeuour short doe passe ouer iohn doeth set forth large 20 chapter vnto 12 verse whiche knowe vnusuall matter amongest also diuersitie mathew marke doe make mention onely one angell iohn luke doe put two shew also repugnancie easily answered knowe figure synecdoche often vsed scripture therefore two angel seene first mary fellowes one office speake especially tourned mindes sufficient mathewe marke report message mathewe sayeth angell sate vppon stone doeth woordes sette shoulde least neglecteth course hystorie angell appeared presently noueltye straungenesse matter helde woman suspence doubt 4 feare keeper astonied lord terrified kepers shuld set hot yron conscience might compel feele diuine power least terrour auailed thus farre shoulde carelesly scorne thing presently dispearsed abrode resurrection though ashamed set tongue sale yet compelled nill inwardly acknowledge menne wickedly denie doubted free liberty speake familiarly confessed amongst acquaintāce durst speake openly hired money noted difference betwene two kindes feare mathew doeth compare togither soldiours accustomed tumultes terrified swallowed vp feare fell downe halfe deade power raised fallen prostrate woman likewise afraide presently receiued comfort whiche restored mindes almoste failing least beganne haue better hope certainly meete maiestie god strike suche horrour feare well godlye reprobate fleshe might silent presence lorde hath humbled brought electe obedience hee presently mitigateth feare least shoulde lie ouerwhelmed onely wyth sweetenesse grace healeth wound haue receiued leaueth reprobate without life feare doth distract suffereth pine away many slowe tormentes concerning soldiours like deade menne lay afraide menne distracted mindes without earnest affection yet withall forgate afraide remembraunce feare altogether blotted liuely effectuall feeling power god fled whereunto compelled giue place must especially noted sith feared like woman hadde comforte giuen might take away feare angel sayde onely womenne feare yee proposed vnto resurrection christ matter ioy comfort luke added reproofe sought liuing dead angell shoulde stirre vp least fall desperation 7 goe quickly tell disciple god doth adorne woman extraordinarie honour cōmaundeth instruct apostle principall poynt saluation marke commaunded name beare message peter excelled dignity fal vile need speciall comfort might knowe christ cast though filthily wickedly fallen nowe beene sepulchre seene token resurrection christe god denied honour hee shortly bestowed vppon woman heare angell say christ risen certesse heereby appeareth howe blockishe yet remained hee doeth fearefully runne againe lurking corner seene nothing mary sate weeping sepulchre vvherefore doubted shee fellowes beholding angell receiued rewarde patient wayting aungell sendeth disciple galile thinke done cause christ might shew himselfe many knowe beene long conuersant galile giue disciple larger space might iourney gather mindes somewhat knowledge place holpe might certainly knowe master behooued meanes confirmed least thinge shoulde wanting assurance faith loe haue tolde phrase speache angell confirmeth true spake hee would speake himselfe beene first author subscribeth christes promisse marke onelye bringeth minde wordes christ luke doeth prosecute speache disciple shoulde admonished christe behoued crucified c yet sense foretolde death togither resurrection also added remembred wordes lord whereby taught though profited badly doctrine christe yet pearished couered vntill due season shoulde budde foorth spring mathew 28 marke 16 luke 24 8 departed quicklye sepulchre feare great ioye run bringe disciple woorde 9 went tel disciple beholde iesus also mette saying god saue came tooke feete woorshipped 10 sayde iesus vnto thē afraid go tel brethrē go galile shal seeme 8 went quickly fled sepulchre trembled amased neither saide thinge man afraide 9 iesus risen gaine morow firste day weeke hee appeared first mary magdalene hadde cast seuen deuils 10 shee went tolde beene mourned wept 11 heard aliue appeared beleeued 9 returned sepulchre told al thing vnto eleuen remnant 10 nowe mary magdalene ioanna marye mother iames woman whiche tolde thing vnto apostle 11 word semed vnto fained thing neyther beleeued 12 arose peter ran vnto sepulchre looked saw linnen cloathes laid selues departed wonderinge himselfe come passe 8 departed quickly 3 euāgelists omit iohn doth report mary magdalen namely hauing yet seen ye angel returned city weping cōplained yt body christ taken away heere onely mention made seconde retourne citie shee fellowes caried newes disciple christ risen learned wel voyce testimonie angel seeing christ himselfe also christ shewed himselfe nowe ranne towardes disciple commaunded angell iourney befel seconde confirmation might boldly affirme lorde risen mathew sayeth went feare great ioy wordes hee meaneth comforted voyce angell yet withall stricken feare tossed perplexitie betweene ioye doubtfulnesse heartes godly sometime possessed contrary affection whiche conuersant course vntill length peace spirite doeth bring quiet estate faith beene perfecte thoroughly quieted putting feare flight nowe feare mixed ioy doth declare yet trusted throughly testimonie angell heere christ gaue notable testimony mercy meeteth doutfull fearefull might take away doubtfulnesse remained yet markes woordes doe little differ fledde feare amasednesse feare astonied harde answeare minde obey angell yet abilitie serued lord hadde loosed silence greater shewe repugnancie whiche followeth marke doeth say mette christ way appeared early morning magdalene luke maketh mention vision sith pretermission thing vnusuall euangelistes must seeme absurde v concerning difference betweene woordes mathewe marke maye bee magdalene partaker great good rest else synecdoche mathewe doeth extend proper one yet probable marke nameth onely shee others enioyed sight christ first peculiar maner fellowes also sawe christe order therefore mathewe doeth attribute generally thys woonderful token goodnesse christ reuealed heauenly glory miserable woman beene possessed seuen deuilles would sette foorth light newe eternall life began nothing iudgement manne contempt shame lesson christ declareth hee sheweth fauour towardes v howe liberally hee vseth prosecute course hee casteth downe pride fleshe 9 tooke feete seemeth agree word iohn declareth mary forbidden touche christ may easily reconciled lord seeing mary much bent embracing kissing feete shoulde commaunde departe superstition reprooued shewe ende resurrection marye drawne partly earthly grosse affection partly fond zeale lord suffred touch feete first meeting might nothing wanting assurance therefore presently doeth mathew adde worshipped lord signe doubtfull knowledge 10 iesus said vnto vve gather corrupt fear christ doth againe deliuer though arose wōdring matter yet contrary setled assurāce therefore end might lift vp themselues christ conquerour death commaunded good comfort taught word know rightly resurrection lorde faith haue conceiued dare glory made partaker life thus farre must faith profite least feare preuaile christ commanding shuld told disciple doth message gather church dispearsed togither againe erect faine faith resurrection doeth especially giue v life day behoued disciple haue life restored faln also noted incredible kindnes christ vouchsafeth call runagates moste cowardly forsaken name brother doubted calling louingly freely appease sorrow wherwith knew grieuously tormented hee accounteth apostle onely brother lette v know christ commanded message done might remaine v vvherfore must coldly hearken hystorie resurrection sith christ band brotherly kinred doth mouth louingly cal v receiue frute vvhere interpreaters vnder name brother vnderstand christes kinsmenne text doeth sufficiently confute errour iohn doeth expresly declare marie came disciple presently followeth luke womenne came apostle marke also agreeth wryting mary came told thing disciple wept mar 11 heard marke onely maketh mention testimony mary alone yet perswaded commaundemēts christ done generally al place doth better confirme sayd euen nowe repugnancie betwene euangelists one doth particularly assigne mary magdalene according others commen thoughe like degree disciple grown marueilous sluggish remembred fulfilled hadde oft time heard master woman tolde thing heard good cause matter incredible beene credite giuen report must needes exceeding blockish doe account fable dreame matter oft promised witnessed sonne god reported fulfilled whiche seene sith depriued right vnderstanding throughe owne vnbeliefe doe onely refuse light truthe doe reiecte fantasie luke declareth heereby appeareth yeelded temptation almoste taste christes woordes cleane forgotten lv 12 arose peter doe thinke luke hath heere inuerted order hystory easie gather woordes iohn iudgement amisse woord running▪ resolued preterpluperfect tence meanly exercised scripture doe knowe vsuall amongest hebrewes reporte afterwarde thing whiche omitted place luke circumstance doth exaggerate hardnesse apostle despised woman woordes yet peter seene sepulchre emptye manifest signe resurrection driuen admiration mathew 28 marke • luke 11 gone beholde watche came citie shewed vnto hie priest thing done 12 gathered togither elder tooke counsel gaue large money vnto souldiours 13 saying say disciple came night stole away slept 14 gouernour heare perswade saue harmelesse 15 tooke money taughte sayinge noised among iewes vnto day 11 nowe gone supposed matter selfe declareth soldiours whome keeping sepulchre committed corrupted rewardes ready lie priest appoyntment knewe well priest feared nothing reported christ arose third day death knew wer sent thether purpose keeping corpes might putte away report men therfore giuen gain yea seeking gain euery way hadde lost labour way doe deuise newe meanes gette money mathew sayeth watche came vncertaine whether subtile fellowes went alone counsel rest whether sent generall name seconde part coniecture seemeth rather true mathew doth afterwards say reward periurie giuen one two generallye souldiours certaine whether al part thē cōspired yet sought gain cruel vnappeaceable hatred priest christ sith guilty offence abuse euil conscience wrest mony almost wicked menne doe priest knowing owne leudnesse ende myght couer shame compelled corrupt souldiours large reward also doth heereby appeare reprobate haue cast themselues headlong sinne caught new sinnes would defend name men doe carelesly neglecte sinnes god wretch doe onely hire soldiours rewardinge also offence shoulde brought iudgement doe cast name life daunger compelleth besides losse money come great pearill obstinate furye suffereth goe backe vntill heape sinnes vppon sinnes 15 saying noysed greatest woorke god vengeance blinding iewes resurrection christ buried periurie soldiours vaine lie receiued heereby appeareth thynke christ risen deceiued voluntary errour worlde doeth willingly offer selfe deceiued fleightes sathan beene neede long searche man woulde haue opened eye armed soldiours doe say body christ stolen weake fearefull small vnarmed company men vvhat shewe colour doe adde done sleepe howe doe imagine stolne ben suspition disciple folowed vvhy made stirre therfore childish shift escaped without punishment matter come righteous stout gouernor pilate winking came passe great wickednesse escaped doe see doeth fal daily prophane iudges haue smal regarde truth ouerwhelmed deceit malice rather doe feare incommodity seeme ioyne leudnesse togither treacherous varlet thoughe may seeme hard god suffer false rumour spred extinguishing glory sonne yet iust vengeance honour must giuen due nation worthy cloud take light perceiue vayne friuolous lie greedily snatched vppe sith almost stumbled stone offence meete theyr eye shoulde darkened least shoulde see cuppe giddinesse giuen drinke shorte cast kinde madnesse spoken prophesie isai ninthe chapiter tenthe verse god would neuer haue suffered deceiued fond credulitie might depriue hope saluation hadde contemned redeemer euen kinde punishment hee doeth nowe chastice worlde lousing raynes reprobate may grow worse though lie preuaile amongst iewes yet let trueth gospell shoulde haue free passage euen endes earth alwayes went conquerour ouer lettes worlde mathew mar 16 luke 24 12 hee appeared vnto two fourme walked went countrey 13 behold two went day towne hierusalem three score furlong called emaus 14 talked togither thing done 15 came passe communed togither reasoned iesus drew neare went 16 eye holden coulde knowe 17 hee sayde vnto vvhat maner communication yee haue one another yee walke sad 18 one named cleopas answeared sayd vnto art thou onely straunger ierusalem haste knowen thinges whiche come passe dayes 19 said vnto thing saide vnto iesus nazaret whiche prophet mighty deede worde god people 20 hie priest ruler deliuered condēned death haue crucified 21 trusted haue deliuered israel touching thing day third day▪ done 22 yea certain woman amonge v made v astonied came early vnto sepulchre▪ 23 founde body came saying also seen • vision angel sayde aliue 24 therfore certain v went sepulchre founde euen woman sayd saw 25 sayd vnto f •• le slowe heart beleeue al prophet haue spoken 26 ought 〈◊〉 christ haue suffred thing enter glory 27 began moses prophet interpreated vnto scripture thinges whiche wrytten hym 28 drewe neare vnto towne went made though woulde haue gone 29 constrained sayinge abide v towardes nighte day farre spent went tarye 30 came passe hee sate table tooke bread gaue thankes brake gaue •• beholde two though marke doeth touch hystorie briefly mathew iohn say neuer woorde yet profitable knowen woorthy remembred vaine luke doeth diligently describe haue already oft time declared spirite god hath aptly directed workes euery euangelists could founde one two might hadde others diuers vision whereof iohn doeth make mention spoken three come seuerall circumstance shalbe woorth labour summar • ly noted two witness chosen lordes purpose shew apostle risen reproue slacknesse yet though preuailed nothing first afterward testimony furthered help due regarde amongst doubted name one whome luke little calleth cleopas maye gathered eleuen emaus ancient town small acco •• romanes afterwardes called nicopolis neither farre distant ierusalem three score furlong doe make seuen thousand foure hundred pace luke hath much regard note place respecte renoume certainty hystorie 14 talked togither signe godlinesse endeuoured nourish meane might faith christe though weake small talke tended purpose yt might oppose reuerēce maister shield buckler ye offēce ye crosse though inquiring disputing bewraied ignorance worthy reprehended whē admonished yt christ shuld rise shuld amased hearing yet aptnes taught yeelded way christe take away errour many 〈◊〉 purpose doe mooue question determined frowardlye refuse truthe haue desire quietly embrace truthe though sticke small obiections stay light scruple yet godly endeuour obey procureth fauour god stretched hand ledde perfect assurance cease wauer noted doe inquite christe done modest desire learne away opened furtherance v yea procure hym teacher euē prophane men filthy speaches driue farre away 1 • eye holden euangelist doeth expresly set down▪ least man thinke shape christes body altered therefore though christ remained like yet vnknowen eye holden whereby suspition ghoast false imagination taken awaye heereby taught howe weake sens neither eye eares doe office haue power ministred vnto daily heauen oure member naturallye furnished gift might better appear graunted v freely god keepeth vse owne hand eares heare eye see layed vp amongst daily benefites continually strengthen sens whole force would presently fade awaye doe graunt sens oft holden befel shuld grossely deceiued forme obiected yet god one example sheweth power directe soeuer power bestoweth vppon manne may knowe nature subiecte pleasure nowe corporall eye whose chiefe propertie see ofte pleaseth lord holden cannot discern thing set mindes better though remained integritie miserable corruption since light taken subiect deceiued many way oppressed grosse dulnesse doe nothing erre also doeth befall oft therefore commeth sharpnesse witte v discerne betwene truth falsehoode spirite wisedome chiefe dulnesse appeareth beholding heauenly thinges doe onely conceiue false shape thing true doe tourne cleare light darkenesse 17 vvhat maner communication yee haue one another doe see done openly christe doe daily finde perfourmed v secreat maner hys owne accorde hee insinuateth himselfe teache v said euen doeth euidently appeare answear cleopas though doubtfull perplexitie resurrection christe yet esteemed reuerently doctrine bent fall away doe tarie vntill christ manifesting himselfe shoulde preuent trauailer soeuer hee shoulde speake honourably rather small darkishe lighte cleopas doeth cast suche sparkes straunger might somwhat lighten minde ben rude ignorant name christ time odious infamous euerye place safe speake honourably christe without regard enuie nameth prophet god professeth himselfe one disciple though title prophet farre inferiour diuine maiestie christ yet smal commendation deserueth praise sith cleopas hadde purpose procure disciple christ whiche shoulde submitte themselues gospell vncertaine whether cleopas accordinge rudenesse spake basely christe meete whether purpose beginne rudiment best knowen hee might degree goe certainly little doeth simplie account christe common order prophet sayeth others supposed haue beene redeemer 19 mighty deede woorde forme woordes almost doeth luke actes 7 22 vse person stephen speaking praise moses sayeth mighty wordes deedes place doubted whether christ called mightye • deede respecte myracles hadde beene sayde hee endued diuine vertues prooue sent heauen whether shoulde reache meaninge excelled well facultie teaching holinesse life excellent giftes doe like latter sense neither addition vaine god people signifieth excellencie christe declared menne knowen euident trialles without fained vaine ostentation heereby may gathered briefe difinition true prophet namely hee woorde adioyneth also power woorkes shall onely endeuour excell amongest men behaue sincerely sight god 21 trusted shall appeare text hope conceiued christ taken away though woordes shoulde seeme first fight hystorie sette downe condemning christe might withdraw man tast gospel yt condemned prelate church cleopas opposeth hope redemption offence though doth afterwardes declare hee himselfe dooth fearefully staggering man remain hope yet doth diligently gather helpes soeuer vpholding probable spake third • day end lord promised would rise againe thirde daye furthermore hee reporteth woman founde body vision angel appeared beecause woman spoken empty graue also approoued testimony menne referred sum christe rysen godly manne doubtfull betwene fayth feare nourysheth fayth accordinge strength stryueth agaynste feare • 5 sayd vnto reproofe seemeth sharper harder meete respect weake man shall consider circumstance shal easily perceiue without cause lord gaue sharpe reproofe amongst whome bestowed long labour ill almost without anye fruite noted heere spoken onely restrayned two obiected common faulte fellowes might presently heare mouthes christ oft forwarned death also oft taught new spiritual lyfe confirmed doctrine oracle prophetes spoken deafe men blockes stone stricken horrour death turne themselues hether thether therfore doth iustly attribute stackering foolishnesse maketh slouth cause readier beleeue doth vpbraide excellent master slacke slow learn attentiue saying prophet hee shoulde haue sayde slouthfulnesse coulde bee excused fault onely themselues • ith doctrine prophet euident plaine selfe well expounded part menne doe beare blame theyr owne folly vnapt taught obstinate lette v note christ saw disciple slouthfull ende might waken hee beginneth reproouing must dealt whome haue tried either dull slouthfull 26 ought christ haue suffered th • se thing doubted christe spake office messias described prophets▪ least death crosse offensiue iourneying three foure houres hee space sufficient fully set foorth matter therefore christe doeth say three woordes hee ought suffer hee declareth large sent ende sacrifice death might wash away sin world might purging sacrifice offered taking awaye cursse might wash sinnes others guiltinesse luke therefore vehemencie setteth downe sentence interrogatiuely whereby gathered hee shewed reason necessity death summe disciple euill bee troubled death maister without could perfourme partes christ chiefe poynt redemption offering vp meanes shutte vp gate least shoulde come kingdome must noted diligently sith christ shoulde want honour shoulde accounted sacrifice sinnes onely way glory hys humbling reputation phil 2 7 hee arose redeemer see day amongst v sinne nothing sooner preposterous order amongst multitude doe royally declare christ king extol diuine praise scarce euery tenth doth think haue gotten grace death 27 began moses place doeth teach christe made manifest vnto v gospel namely knowledge prooued plainly law prophet man euer ready apte teacher gospell lorde hymselfe see fetched proofe doctrine law prophet man except began rudimentes disciple little biddinge prophet fare well myghte passe ouer perfecte gospell deuice easily confuted afterward shalbe sayd apostle minde opened shoulde wise without helpe lawe might vnderstand scripture vvherefore ende christe may day reuealed vnto v gospell necessarye moses prophet shuld come forth forerunner vvherof reader therefore admonished least shoulde giue eare fanaticall men suppressing law prophet doe wickedly maime gospell god would haue vnprofitable soeuer time spake owne sonne maner applied christe whiche euery read lawe prophet present purpose declare sufficient briefly note christ vaine called end lawe though moses rather shadowed foorth darkely farre expresse plainly yet without controuersie stocke abraham one head aboue vnder whome people grow one body couenant god made holy father shoulde broken vaine god commaunded tabernacle ceremony framed heauenly patterne foloweth sacrifice rite temple truthe else vaine frutelesse play argument doeth apostle handle many woordes epistle hebrewes holding principle visible ceremony lawe shadowes spirituall thing teacheth christe soughte whole priesthoode lawe sacrifice forme sanctuarie bucer also otherwhere doeth wisely diuine obscuritie certaine kinde interpreatinge scripture vse amongst iewes father deliuered vnto hand least follow vncertainties contented naturall simple maner euery founde amongest prophet apt interpreaters lawe christe therefore rightly collected lawe wee consider couenaunt christe made father made helpe mediator sanctuarie wherein god testified presence grace consecrated bloude lawe selfe wyth promise confirmed sprinkeling bloud one priest chosen oute people shoulde present himselfe name sight god mortall man holy habite menne hope reconciliation god offering vp sacrifice furthermore notable prophesie perpetuitye kingdome tribe iuda prophet themselues haue declared haue plainly described mediator yet themselues first knowledge moses office enioyned shoulde renew memory couenant plainly shew spiritual worship god establish hope saluation mediatour also might euidently declare meane reconciliation pleased god defer full reuelation vnto comming sonne superfluous interpretation 28 drewe neare vnto towne reason interpreaters imagine place emaus iourney long shoulde rest nearer lodging vve knowe seuen mile though manne recreation minde walke softly gone foure houres therfore dout christ went forwarde euen emaus nowe demaunded whether coulde dissemble eternall truthe god doe answeare sonne god bounde thys lawe shoulde make councels knowen yet simulation kinde lying knotte yet vnlosed especially sith many doe drawe example libertye lyinge doe answeare christ without lying fained saide like maner shewed himselfe trauailer reason like augustine answeare somewhat subtile lib 2 ad consentium cap 13 also booke question vpon gospel chap 51 hee woulde haue faining accounted amongest trope figure amongest parable morall hystories one thynge doeth fatisfie christe time couered eye wyth whome spake shewing himselfe person straunger might accounte common guest purpose going time pretended faininge matter deede doe woulde discouer maner departure manne deny goe separated company men deceiued disciple faining held somewhile suspence vntill ful time manifestation come vvherefore doe deale preposterouslye make patrone lying example haue colour dissemble anythinge imitate diuine power closing eye see vvherefore safer way holde prescript rule speakinge truely simplie lorde time disobeyed father lawe without bindinge himselfe literall priest performed simple meaning lawe weakenesse sens doe neede bridle 30 hee tooke breade augustine diuers others thoughte christ tooke bread reached ordinarie bread eaten holy signe body plausible spoken lord shoulde knowen spirituall glasse supper disciple looking vppon corporall eye knewe coniecture hath probable token proofe doe rather take luke woordes simply christ taking bread hand maner gaue thankes appeareth vsed special order prayer knew disciple beene familiarly accustomed note admonished might stirre vp sens meane season lette v learne master example ofte wee doe eate breade giue thankes authour life putteth difference betweene v prophane men mathewe marke 16 luke 24 13 went tolde remnant beleeued 14 finally appeared vnto eleuen • sate togither reprooued thē vnbeliefe hardnesse heart beleeued whiche seene 31 eye opened knewe taken sight 32 sayd betweene themselues heart burne within v talked v waye hee opened v scripture 33 rose vp houre returned hierusalem founde eleuen gathered togither 34 vvhich sayde lord risen deede hath appeared symon 35 tolde thing done way knowen breaking breade 36 spake thing iesus himselfe stoode middes sayde vnto peace 37 abashed afraide supposinge seene spirite 38 sayd vnto ye troubled • wherefore doubt arise heart 39 beholde handes feete selfe handle mee see spirite hath fleshe bone yee see haue 40 thus spoken shewed handes feete 31 eye opened woordes taught metamorphosis christ shoulde da • ell men eye varietie shape according poet imagine proteus fault rather eye loked holdē shortly vanished away eye body self inuisible god withdrawing force sight dulled maruel christ assoone knowen sodainly vanish away nothing needefull seene longer least themselues much bent earth shuld desire draw againe earthly life therfore farre necessary testifie resurrection reuealed himselfe seene sodaine departure taught shoulde soughte otherwhere world ascending heauen fulfilling new life 32 heart knowledge christ wrought disciple liuely feeling secreat hidden grace spirite wherwith wer endued god ofttimes worketh time know force spirite whereof yet void least cannot distinctly know haue feeling secreat instincte disciple conceiued zeale without feeling doe nowe remember since christ made known vnto length begin consider grace wythout tast perceiue beene blockish reproue thēselues slouth say came passe knew talked v pierced heart haue marked beene simply naked signe gather christ speach effectual enflame mind giue vnto honor spake mouth hart also burnt within heat spirit paul verely reioyceth 2 cor 3 6 ministery spirite giuen vnto scripture doth oft time adorn minister word title conuert hart lighten mindes renue men may become pure holy sacrifice doeth declare shall doe owne power rather lorde shall woorke founde togither one christ vtter outward voyce effectually frame heartes obedience faith doubted yt wrought singuler woorke heartes two lengthe might feele diuine heat inspired spake though woorde god alwayes fire yet firye force peculiar vnwoonted maner shewe selfe christes speache euident testimonie diuine power alone baptiseth holy ghost fire luke 3 16 yet lette v remember lawful frute heauenly doctrine soeuer minister kindle fire spirite heart may boyle purge yea burne oute affection fleshe shall truely stirre vppe feruent loue god carye vppe menne wholely heauen flame 33 arose houre circumstaunce time distance place doe shewe earnest desire two menne hadde carye message fellowe disciple sith eueninge entred lodging probable darke night knewe lorde troublesome trauaile three houres late night yet presently arise runne speede hierusalem certainly hadde come next day slacknesse beene suspected nowe hadde rather defraude themselues nightly rest make apostle pertakers theyr ioye speede haste yeelded credite tolde nowe luke sayeth arose houre bee supposed came midnight disciple luke doeth witnesse talking amongest themselues heereby therefore may carefulnesse earnest desire bee knowen passed almost night waking ceased make thorowe inquirie vntill resurrection christe shoulde many testimony fully knowen 34 vvhich sayde lorde risen luke woordes sheweth brought gladde newes apostle confirming mindes lykewise enformed another vision doubted rewarde mutuall confirmation bestowed vppon god recompence godlye diligence also may gathered circumstance time peter hadde retourned sepulchre hee woonderfull carefull vntill christe reuealed himselfe vnto therefore daye hee hadde visited sepulchre hee obtained request nowe doubted gratulation amongest eleuen thys lorde hadde appeared symon thys seemeth agree wyth markes woordes sayeth two beleeued eleuen howe coulde refusinge newe witness shoulde wauer doubtinge already certaine saying risen deede graunt matter controuersie first doe answeare general speache vsed figure synecdoche harder lesse apt thomas obstinate rest also doe easily gather perswaded men amazed doe vse haue quietlye meditated matter knowe suche doe thereby fall diuers doubtes soeuer appeareth luke greater part feare exstasie onely willingly embrace sayd striued distrust clause deede take away al occasion doubting little shall see fell agayne third time admiration wauerings 36 iesus himselfe stoode middest vvhere iohn reporteth hystorie large differeth certaine circumstance marke noteth somewhat otherwise concerning iohn sith onely gathereth thing omitted luke two may easily reconciled truelye diuersitye summe matter except man woulde mooue controuersie time sayd iesus entred euening hystorie set luke appeareth late night appeared namely disciple returned emaus doe thinke time euening precisely vrged rather sayd may aptly commodiously applied late time night apostle euening night shut dores kept themselues secreatly within house thē christ came vnto iohn doeth note first beginning night simply noteth day passed sunne set yea midnight christ came vnlooked amongest disciple yet question ariseth matter marke luke doe report eleuen gathered togither christe appeared vnto iohn sayeth thomas absent absurditie number eleuen put apostle thēselues though one away company wee sayde euen nowe matter selfe declareth iohn doth distinctly sette downe particular poyntes purpose report thinges omitted others also doubt one hystorie sette downe three sith iohn doeth expresly declare disciple sawe christe onely twise hierusalem went galile sayeth thirde time hee appeared sea tyberias noted two vision namely befell next morrowe resurrection followed eight dayes thoughe rather expounde second marke doe greatly stande nowe doe retourne luke woordes doeth saye christe diuine power opened himselfe doores shutte yet woorde standinge noteth suche matter could lord sodainly night stand midst except entred wonderfully fourme salutation sette downe peace wherby hebrew signify wisheth vnto glad prosperous successe 37 afraide iohn maketh mention feare sith also sayth christ shewed hand side disciple may supposed omitted somewhat neither vnwonred thing amongst euangelists study compēdious touch part learne luke amased strangenesse sight durst beleeue owne eye little made accounte lorde risen assuredly spake matter well knowen vnto doe beholde eye sens shaken admiration imagined spirit though errour without fault came infirmitie yet forgotten themselues afraid delusion though thought mocked yet rather incline image resurrection proposed vision spirite christ himselfe shuld present liue euen late dead vpon crosse suspected deceitfull vision vaine ghost afraid thought beene shewed spirite saw deede 38 vvhy yee troubled woordes warned shoulde cast feare mindes gathering sens togither might iudge matter whereof good triall long men holden perturbation blind manifest light therefore ende disciple may conceiue sure knowledge commanded consider matter setled quiet mindes second parte christe reprooueth faulte namely wauering betweene diuers thought hindred selues hee sayeth doubtes doe arise signifying knowledge truthe therefore choaked seeing shoulde see doe suppresse peruerse imagination rather giuing libertye giue preheminence truely doe prooue experience true euen cloudes skie cleare morning caried vppe high darken cleare light sunne doe permit owne reason muche libertie arise woorde god euident v taken sight mete appeareth shewe absurditie sifting reason either side make search cannot otherwise mindes doutfull matter caried hether thether meane must holden sobrietie least flesh shoulde lift vppe selfe higher meete shoulde send foorth thought farre heauen 39 see handes maketh corporall sens witness least shoulde thinke setteth shadowe steade body first distinguisheth corporall man spirite hee say sight feeling shall prooue manne deede conuersant cloathed flesh crucified yet beareth markes sith christ sayeth body palpable compacte sounde bone note distinguisheth spirite place aptly truely alleaged men refellinge grosse errour transubstantiation breade body locall presence body preposterous menne doe imagine holy supper would haue body christ appeareth signe body meanes followe hadde chaunged owne nature shoulde cease wherby prooued body christe himselfe doe except side pearced feete boared woundes nailes also handes christ whole sounde heauen cauill quickly answeared question onely shape appeared speaketh true nature flesh doth attribute proper may felt may differ spirite therefore also day necessary difference shoulde remaine betweene flesh spirit christes woordes appoynted may gathered euer woundes must accounted thys lesson teacheth v christe rather rose v himselfe conquerour death endewed blessed celestial immortalitie yet sake would time beare markes crosse truely wonderfull fauour towards disciple hadde rather want somwhat himselfe perfecte glory resurrection shoulde bee defrauded suche helpe faith foolish olde wiues fantasie imagine yet remaine wounded shall come iudge worlde marke 14 hee appeared vnto eleuen sate togither thinke participle • akeimenois heere vsed sittinge downe meate doe translate sitting together done without reason yet agreed vppon firste vision heere described time suppe midnighte also table hadde beene ready prepared shoulde agree wyth whyche luke sayeth little christe demaunded whether hadde anye meate eate phrase vsed hebrewe sitte downe rest place reproofe whyche followeth rather belongeth first vision seconde iohn witnesseth disciple reioyced hadde seene lorde morrowe passeouer vnbeliefe reprooued seemeth muche restrained many restraine word marke thomas onely therefore hadde rather expounde simplie christe hee firste appeared apostle blamed beleeued whiche hadde beene eye witness resurrection thoughe hardnesse heart condemned alone gaue credite menne beinge conuicted successe matter selfe woulde yet accepte testimonie lorde therefore sith peter marye cleopas fellowe first witness resurrection onely subscribed christes wordes followeth rest apostle iniurie lorde beleeued woordes whiche yet nowe prooued true effecte vvherefore hardnesse heart worthily reprooued corrupt obstinacie added slouthfulnesse sette purpose desire suppresse appeared true purpose extinguish glory maister reprooue vanitie amasednesse hindered yeelding themselues taught short heere wilfull peruersenesse condemned sayde blinde slouthfulnesse sometime hardneth men otherwise neither wicked rebellious mathewe marke luke 24 41 yet beleeued net ioy wondered sayde vnto haue yee heere meate 42 gaue piece broyled fishe honie combe 43 tooke eate 44 sayd vnto word whiche spake vnto yet must fulfilled wrytten • lawe moses prophet psalmes 45 opened vnderstanding might vnderstand scripture 46 sayd vnto thus wrytten thus behooued christ suffer rise againe dead third day 47 repentance remission sinnes preached name among nation beginning first hierusalem 48 nowe ye witness thing 49 beholde sende promisse father vppon tary yee citie hierusalem vntill yee endewed power hie 41 vvhile yet beleeued place also sheweth purpose beleeued whiche doe purpose theyr minde beleeue sith earnestly bent beleeue vehemencie affection helde bounde could rest certainly ioy whereof luke maketh mention arose cause faith yet hinderance faith could gette victorie therefore lette v note howe suspitious vehemencie affection though arise good beginning yet carieth v ouerthrowne right way vve also admonished diligently shuld striue hinderance faith sith ioy conceiued presence christ cause apostle incredulitie againe perceiue louingly kindely christe vseth infirmitie refuseth holde vppe newe supply ready fall though hauing obtained newnesse heauenly life neede meate drinke angelles yet hee willingly submitteth himselfe common order mortall menne course life made himselfe subiecte necessitye meat drinke exempted eateth meat ende may perswade disciple resurrection see without regarde himselfe became wholely oures true godly meditation hystorie wherein faithfull may wade profitably forsaking curious question corruptible meat disgested nourishment shoulde immortall body christe take thereby became excrement pleasure created thing nothing tourne little meate nothing seeme good therfore christ tasted deede fish honey combe might shew himselfe man doubted diuine power consumed needefull nourishment doubt angel abraham table hadde bodyes eate dranke deede yet doe therefore graunt vsed meate drinke infirmitie flesh sith abraham sake cloathed shape man lord granted also seruaunt heauenly guestes shoulde eate tent also graunt body taken time done message brought nothing deny became meates 44 woordes though mathew marke shall afterwarde appeare speach galile vnlike yet doe thinke probable luke doeth nowe reporte whiche befell morrowe resurrection iohn deliuereth daye hee breathed vppon hee might giue holy ghost doeth agree luke woordes shal presently followe opened mindes might vnderstand scripture christe also woordes doeth sharply reprooue grosle slouthfull forgetfulnesse admonished shoulde rise againe shoulde astonished neuer thing beene spoken wordes doe signifie much say vvhy stay matter straunge vnlooked whiche haue yet often time spoken vvhy doe rather remember wordes haue hitherto accounted true shuld haue beene well knowen nowe doctrine come passe summe christe doeth secreatly complaine hauing spred doctrine labour spent vaine amongst aposties also doeth sharply reproue slouthfulnesse sayeth deliuereth new thing called mind beene spoken law prophet haue knowen childehoode ignorant whole doctrine godlinesse yet nothing absurde embrace speede whiche perswaded proceede god holden generall rule whole nation religion contained lawe prophet heere sette downe full diuision place scripture besides lawe prophetes psalmes added thirde place whiche thoughe may right numbered amongest prophesies yet haue thyng proper distincte yet two folde diuision whiche haue seene doeth notwithstandinge comprehende whole scrypture 45 hee opened minde lorde executinge office teacher hadde profited little nothing amongest disciple nowe beginneth teache inwardly spirit woordes throwne vaine ayre vntill mindes lightened gifte vnderstanding true woorde god like vnto candle giueth light darkenesse amongst blinde vntill eye lightened wardly lorde whose onely gifte lighten blinde psalme hundreth sixe fortye eight verse heereby appeareth howe greate corruption nature light life offered heauenly oracle doeth profite v nothing nowe vnderstanding perceiue shoulde right howe shoulde able yeelde obedience therefore must granted weake euery way heauenly doctrine otherwise profitable effectuall v farre spirite doeth frame mindes vnderstande heart subiecte yoake therefore may become sitte disciple necessary trust owne witte cast away aske light heauen also leauing folish opinion free deliuer selues gouerned god without cause paule first corrinthians third chapter eighteene verse doth commaunde menne become foolish may wise god light spirite cannot extinguished worse darknesse trusting owne witte furthermore lette reader obserue disciple hadde eye minde opened wherewith without helpe god might discerne mystery comprehēded scripture fulfilled spoken hundreth nineteene psalme eighteene verse lighten mine eye may consider maruellous woorkes thy lawe god doeth giue suche spirite childrenne shoulde abolishe vse woorde rather make frutefull vvherefore fanaticall menne doe wickedly vnder pretence reuelations graunt themselues libertie despice scripture doe reade heere apostle christ worketh daily spirit directeth vnderstand scripture carye vaine imagination demaunded christe hadde rather loose labour space whole three yeres open eye presently doe aunsweare first thoughe fruite labour doeth speedily appeare yet vnprofitable lightened newe also felte profite former time doe take mindes opened onely might afterwardes apt learne thing shoulde taught might call memorie profite doctrine hearde vaine furthermore ignorance space three yeares doeth teache v profitable lesson obtained knowledge newe meanes heauenly light adde also christe shewed euident token godhead hee onely minister outwarde voyce giue sounde eares secreate power pearsed mindes declareth belongeth alone paule denieth doctours churche 1 corrinthians 3 7 yet noted apostle voyd depriued light vnderstanding knew principle smal taste whiche hadde accounted beginning true vnderstanding vaile remooued doe see christe plainely lawe prophet 46 hee sayde vnto wrytten texte quarrel confuted whiche doe pretende outwarde doctrine vaine haue v nature power vnderstande ende say shoulde lorde speake deafe see spirite christe inwarde maister perfourmeth parte labour minister teacheth lost christe endewed spirite vnderstandinge doe receiue fruite teacheth scripture euen amongest reprobate thoughe outwarde voyce vanisheth awaye deade yet notwythstandinge maketh inexcusable concerninge woordes christ gathered principle necessary soeuer wrytten shoulde fulfilled god witnessed nothing prophet hee woulde certainly bring passe woordes wee taughte must chiefly learned law prophet sith christe ende soule lawe without besides knowledge soeuer obtained vaine friuolous vvherefore manne shall desire profite best scripture lette bee alwayes bente thys poynte nowe christe doeth heere firste sette downe death resurrection afterwardes fruite whiche shall come v bothe whence commeth repentaunce forgiuenesse sinnes oure olde manne crucified christe romanes 6 6 verse throughe wee maye arise newnesse life sacrifice death sinnes cleansed filthinesse washed bloude righteousnesse obtained resurrection therefore hee teacheth cause matter oure saluation muste soughte hys death resurrection thence proceedeth reconciliation god regeneration newe spirituall life therefore plainely expressed well forgiuenesse sinnes repentance cānot preached name neither hope imputation righteousnesse neither growe deniall selues newnesse life farre foorth become righteousnesse sanctification 1 cor 1 30 haue entreated large another place summe gospel better reader thence seeke thing whiche haue forgotten burdened repetition 47 amongst nation beginning first doeth christ lengthe declare euidently hee concealed grace redemption brought doth generally appertaine nation though calling gentile hadde beene oft foretold prophet yet beene reuealed iewes • huld easily admit hope saluation therefore vntill resurrection christ supposed redeemer one speciall people wall first broken downe straungers scattered abroade might gathered sheepefolde lorde yet meane season least couenaunt god might seeme bee vaine christe placeth iewes first degree commaunding first beginne hierusalem god peculiarly adopted stocke abraham meete shoulde preferred rest worlde right first begotten ieremiah assigneth vnto 31 9 paule also doeth euery obserue order diligently ephes 2 17 sayeth christ comming preached peace whiche neare straungers farre 48 nowe ye witness yet doeth send foorth publish gospel declareth purpose appoynted might prepare themselues time partly consolation mitigateth sorrowe partly spurre hee correcteth slouth vvhen guiltie themselues late falling away meete haue sorrowfull heart christ beyonde hope bestoweth vppon incredible honour enioyning publishe embassage eternall saluation whole worlde meanes doeth onely restore perfectly greatnesse new grace doeth throughly abolish remembrance offence yet withall sayde pricketh forwarde least shoulde slacke slouthfull publish faith whereof ordained preacher 49 beholde send promisse least apostle afraied owne weakenesse hee comforteth hope newe grace come vppon saye though thinke youre selues vnmeete great burden yet cause shoulde discouraged supply heauen power knowe wanting nowe might better confirme hope maketh mention holye ghost promised father ende myghte readily prepare themselues woorke god meeting theyr distrust encouraged promisse christ substituting himselfe father place taketh vppon perfourme gifte wherein doeth againe chalenge himselfe diuine power part glory whiche god othe denied giue isai 41 8 endew weake men heauenly power therefore belongeth christ followeth god spake time past mouth prophet though god promised speciall grace apostle christ bestowed yet must generally noted mortall man himselfe meete preaching gospell farre foorth god cloathing spirite supplieth nakednesse want certainly paule doeth exclame apostle alone 2 cor 2 16 shall founde meete thing declareth mortall man meete great woorke necessary soeuer minister gospell god stirreth vppe endued heauenly spirite therefore promised teacher churche wythout exception euery palce tarry ye least shulde rashly run forth teach time christ cōmandeth quiet silent vntill yt appoyntment sending foorth shall vse helpe time conuenient profitable triall obedience hauing vnderstanding scripture endewed grace spirite yet lord forbadde speake helde peace dumbe men know desirously woulde shewe themselues abrode thinke could doe praise admiration may delay christ would punishe slouthfulnesse presently gone daye galile commaundement vvhat soeuer matter taught nothing must attempted calling lord vvherefore thoughe wanted habilitie teache publikely yet let containe themselues priuate men silence vntil shal leade foorth hande theater commaunded stay hierusalem must vnderstode returne galile shal little heare mathew though reuealed himselfe seene hierusalem yet chaunged first determined galile therefore meaning woordes giuen commaundements place appoynted yet yet remaine silent time vntill furnish wyth newe power mathewe 28 marke 16 luke 16 eleuen disciple went galile mountain wher iesus appoynted 17 sawe woorshipped doubted 18 iesus came spake vnto saying power giuen vnt • heauen earth 19 goe therefore teache nation baptising name father sonne holy ghost 20 teachinge obserue thinges euer haue commaunded 〈◊〉 wyth alwaye vntill ende worlde amen 15 sayd vnto g • yee world preache gospell euery creature 16 shall beleeue baptised shalbe saued beleeue shalbe damned 17 • ken shall followe beleeue name shall cast deuils shal speake wyth new tonges 18 shall take away serpent shall drinke deadly thinge shal hurte shall lay handes sicke shall recouer 16 eleuen diciples mathewe passing ouer thing haue reported three doeth onely teache eleuen disciple sent apostolicall office purpose haue often seene prosecute perticular partes hystorie seemed sufficient holy ghost directed stile gathering testimony togither sette downe summe suche doe see therefore mathewe doeth chuse especially appertained v namely christ appeared disciple also created apostle shoulde carye embassage eternall life coastes worlde though mention made mount place yet wee doe gather place galile noted mary yet maruel hauing seene christe twise already shoulde yet doubt hym manne like referre first manifestation shall absurditie therein euangelistes doe sometime vse mixe diuers thing togither must seeme absurde remnant feare shoulde driue againe newe wauering knowe oft christ appeared afrayd amased vntil mindes setled ofte seeing vvherefore sense iudgement doubted first vntill christe approched nearer familiarlye vnto hee verilye certainelye knowen woorshipped brightnesse diuine glorye made manifest maye reason driue sodainly doubt led afterward woorship habite seruaunt laide aside appeared nothinge celestiall 18 iesus came spake vnto doubted comming tooke away scruple mathewe declareth disciple hadde office teachinge enioyned hee sayeth christe firste spake owne power wythoute cause small authoritie coulde suffice heere behooueth haue great diuine empire commaundeth lyfe eternall shoulde promised name worlde shoulde brought vnder gouernement doctrine shoulde preached whiche ouerthrowinge euery highe thinge shoulde brynge mankinde vnder preface christe doeth onely stirre vp disciple execute office boldly freely establisheth faith gospell continue age certainly apostle could neuer haue beene perswaded take harde matter hande excepte knewe reuenger sate heauen power giuen wythout fortreste beene impossible preuaile thing doe heare hee whome doe serue doeth gouerne heauen earth one thing throughly furnished ouercome lettes concerning hearer contemptible estate doe preache gospell doeth weaken hinder faith lette learne lifte vppe eye authour himselfe whose power maiestie gospell must esteemed shal come passe shall bold despise speaking hys minister doeth expresly make himselfe lorde king well heauen earth preaching gospell bringing menne obedience doeth erecte throne kingdome vppon earth regenerating newe life calling hope saluation hee openeth heauens hee may exalt blessed immortalitie angel onely crept belowe worlde beene drowned bottomlesse pitte death lette v remember christe alwayes authoritie father giuen vnto hym flesh may speake plainely person mediator gloryeth eternall power worlde created receiued nowe hee ordained iudge worlde noted thys empire manifestly knowen vntill hee risen dead length adorned ornamēts mighty king shewed himselfe authoritie thither also appertaineth saying paule phillippians 2 9 hee humbled hymselfe wherefore god hath exalted giuen name aboue euery name c thoughe sittinge right hande father sette ascention heauen later order yet resurrection ascention heauen thing mutually ioyned togither christe hath good cause speake royally power 19 goe therefore thoughe marke hee hathe declared christe appeared eleuen disciple doeth presently set downe commaundement preachinge gospell yet hee doeth note action presentlye done doe gather texte mathewe thys done went galile summe preachinge gospell euerye shoulde brynge nation obedience faith seale confirme doctrine seale gospel mathew simply commaunded teache marke setteth downe kinde doctrine shoulde namely preache gospell shortly also added restrainte teache obserue soeuer thinges lord commaunded heereby learne apostle shippe vaine title honour office laboure therefore nothinge absurde intollerable • asked menne chalenge honour raininge idlenesse doe reiecte office teaching pope rome bande doe proudly boast succession sustained person common peter colleague mean season haue care doctrine baudes priest bacchus venus wyth face beseche doe thrust themselues place heare created preacher gospell thoughe ashamed bewray owne impudencie yet reader sounde iudgement one worde strang enough ouerthrow fantasticall hierarchie man successour apostle serueth christe preaching gospell shorte soeuer doeth performe dueties teacher doth falsly wrongfully take name teacher priesthode new testament spirituall sworde woorde kill menne sacrifice god vvhereof followeth degenerate counterfait sacrisicers whiche doe applye office teaching teache nation heere christe taking away difference doeth make gentile equall iewes doeth generally admitte fellowshippe couenaunt thither also appertaineth woorde going prophet vnder lawe restrained within boundes iuda nowe partition wall ouerthrowne lorde commaundeth minister gospell goe farre abroad spreading doctrine saluation coastes worlde thoughe dignitye first borne touched euen nowe shoulde firste remaine amongest iewes yet inheritance life common gentile fulfilled prophesie isaiah like christe giuen light gentile mighte bee saluation god vnto outmost part earth isai 49 6 markes meaning creature peace preached housholde message commeth also whiche farre straungers howe necessary apostle shoulde plainly admonished callinge gentile doeth thereby appeare hadde receiued commaundement goe vnto greatly afraide defile themselues doctrine act 10 28 baptising christe commaundeth shoulde baptized shoulde giue name gospell professe selues disciple partlye mighte witnesse vnto eternal life god partly might outward signe faith men knowe signe god doeth witnesse vnto v grace adoption grafteth v body sonne might account v flocke therefore spirituall washing wherewith reconcileth v vnto himselfe new righteousnesse represented god confirmeth grace vnto v zeale soeuer doe offer themselues baptisme like maner binde faith giuing obligation also sith apostle haue dueties expreslye committed charge togither preachinge gospell followeth lawfull minister baptisme doe also minister doctrine therefore libertie hath beene graunted priuate men also woman baptise agreeable institution christ nothing else meere prophanation also first place appoynted doctrine true differēce set betwene mysterie adoulterous rite gentile wherwith enter thēselues religion vntill god word shal giue life earthly elemēt made sacramēt v superstition hath preposterous emulation work god folish men frame diuers sacrament according owne pleasure want woorde soule vaine toyishe shadowes vvherefore let v note power doctrine commeth passe fignes doe put newe nature outwarde washing flesh beginneth spirituall pledge regeneration doctrine gospell goinge right consecration steade wherof popery hath brought vppon v magicall exorcismes therefore sayde marke shall beleeue baptised woordes christ doeth onely exclude hypocrite hope saluation beinge without faith onely puffed vp outward signe hee ioyneth baptisme holy bande doctrine nothing else addition christe commaundeth reache commaundeth baptise willeth onely beleeuers receiued baptisme baptisme seemeth rightly ministred except faith goe vnder pretence anabaptist haue stirred much baptisme infant yet harde answeared manne shall consider reason commaundement christ commaundeth embassage eternall saluation caryed gentile hee confirmeth adding seale baptisme good cause beleuing woorde sette baptisme sith gentile altogither straungers god fellowship elect people otherwise haue beene lying signe offer forgiuenesse sinnes gift spirite vnbeleeuers yet member christ knowe gathered faith dispearsed nowe demanded vppon condition god adopted sonnes straungers cannot certainly denied hee accepted fauour hee extendeth child nephewes comming christ shewed himselfe generally father gentile iewes therefore necessary promisse time past made iewes shoulde also daye force amongest gentile thy god god thy seede thee gen 17 7 wee see faith entred church god accounted member christe also called enheritance saluation yet baptisme meanes separated faith doctrine though yong infant doe yet reason age take holde grace god faith yet god accepting theyr parent doeth also embrace doe therfore deny rashly done baptise infant whereto lord doth call promiseth god name father place doeth teache full euident knowledge god beinge darkely shadowed foorth vnder lawe prophet lengthe sprange foorth vnder kingdome christe olde father neuer durst call god father hadde taken hope christe theyr head neither altogither ignorant eternall wisdome god fountaine light life also one confessed principle god shewed forth power holy ghost arising gospell god much manifestly shewed vnder three person father reuealed himselfe plainly sonne liuely expresse image christ himselfe lightening world cleare brightnesse spirite made himselfe knowen without cause heere expresse mention made father sonne spirite force baptisme cannot apprehended otherwise beginning free mercy father reconcileth v vnto himselfe hys begotten sonne shall christ himselfe appeare v wyth sacrifice death length holy ghost shal also come whome washeth regenerateth v length maketh v partaker good giftes see rightly know god except faith distinctly conceiue three person one essence efficacie frute baptisme doth come thence god father adopteth v sonne spirit purged silthinesse fleshe refourmeth v righteousnesse mar 16 shall beleeue promisse added might allure mankind faith againe terrifying vnbeleeuers followeth denounced sentence grieuous destruction maruel saluation promised faithful beleuing begotten sonne god accoūted amongst sonnes god endued righteousnes grace spirit regeneration possesse summe eternal life baptisme ioyned faith gospell might know therein engraued marke saluation auailed testifie grace god christ vnproperly sayd saued beleeue baptised though must also noted necessarily required saluation necessity pearish obtaine ioyned faith halfe cause saluation testimony graunt necessity laid vpon men neglect signe grace god though god infirmitye vseth help deny grace tied vnto maner may say simply necessary onely respecte obedience second part christ condemneth doe beleeue meaneth rebellious refuse saluation offered doe draw vpon themselues grieuous punishment onely ensnared common destruction mankinde sustaine fault owne ingratitude 17 token shall follow beleue lord myracles confirmed faith gospell long hee conuersant world nowe causeth flourish time come least disciple shuld thinke yt tied corporall presence great purpose diuine power christ shuld flourish amongst faithfull might manifestly appeare risen dead wherby doctrine might remain continue name immortall furnisheth faithfull gift must drawn know giftes diuersly disposed power myracles shoulde hand giuen common whole church signes one wrought auailed cōfirmation christ doth rightly name beleuers generally meaning therfore faithful shuld minister power ben wonderful christ absence seale gospel might ye sure iohn 14 12 promiseth shal doe greater thing setting forth glory deity christ sufficient beleeuers furnished power though christ doeth expresse whether wold gift shuld time remaine euer church yet probable myracles promised time setting forth gospel newe yet obscure may fault vnthankfulnes world depriued honor yet think properend myracles doctrine gospel beginning wāt approbation certainly see vse ceased long least example rare may gathered like common age yet either preposterous couetousnes ambition followed wrought least shuld without myracles altogither fained vain myracles themselues meanes gate opened sathans falsehodes false sleight shuld succeede place truthe vnder pretence signes simple might led away right faith certainly meete curious men content lawful allowance seking newe myracles deluded deceit reason christ otherwhere foretold kingdom antichrist ful lying sign mat 24 24 paul testifieth 2 2 9 vvherefore myracles may rightly confirme faith let mindes containe themselues sobriety wherof soeuer shal thinke good shall also themselues depend vpon mouth one maister may procure disciple vnto themselues beholde christ lay charge vpon apostle could discharge vsing onely power man doth comfort hope helpe heauen promiseth present sayeth first kinge heauen earth hand power gouerneth thing therefore pronowne must red word great force sayd apostle would throughly doe duety must looke spirite hande stretched heauen may helpe v respecte body great way distant v doeth onely spreade efficacie spirite throughe whole worlde doeth also verely dwell v furthermore noted spoken apostle lorde promiseth helpe age vnto ende worlde therefore muche hee haue sayd weake soeuer minister gospel haue want thinges chiefe captaine may become conquerours ouer assault world plaine experience
