wisheth lorde spirit wisdome strength prosperous successe gouernement often call mynde saying christe wherin maketh great accoūt dutie humanitie bestowed vpon gathering together stranger maketh account done therewithall remember vnto great honour hee hath vouchsafed promote hath made citie place one dwell common inne church lodge hospitalitie hath cōmended amongst heathen hath also bin accounted one chiefest vertues therfore whomsoeuer wold condemne extreeme barbarisme manner altogether vnciuill called axenous men giuen hospitalitie farre excellent praise bicause lord hath appointed troublesome miserable time vnto whose tuition godly might cōmit thēselues vnder whose feather innocent might shrouded tyrannie antichrist lesse sauage sacriligious doth chase driue away country natiue soyle hath also dedicated holy house amongest vnto owne name may worshipped sincerely whosoeuer indeuoureth either publikelie cut priuilie take away least part two doth goe disfigure citie beeing spoyled principal ornament also maliciously enuieth helth therof althogh godly good turnes done vnto christ dispearsed member doe cause wicked like dog bark yet ought one recōpence suffice yt angel frō heauen childrē god partes worlde doe blesse may freely despise rotten railing make conscience neither ashamed spue whatsoeuer god thē going slander doe begin first blaspheme god althogh self occasion doth inflame ye hatred many yet ought whit afraid therfore long wil assist fury hath promised yt faithfully keepe city wherin doctrine gospel preached resting place prepared godly mē whō world cānot away omit speak neede care pacifying kinde enemy seeing mā hateth gospel sake wold either haue destroied oppressed admit graunt sworn enimies soūd doctrine hate cause saue see defend yet setting light practises threatnings must valiantly maintain two inuincible fortress ye worship pure religiō godly care nourish church christ hath cōmitted may broude vnder wing touching railinges wherwith pope meritorious brawler doe molest v yt fallē away frō church dissent frō sea rome would god could testifie full cōfidēce god angel wee far distāt frō pollutiō acquit selues y• crime vse lay charge make boast catholike church haue left part al doctrine law gospel free filthy corruption haue prophaned whole worship god stink superstition haue afraid corrupt god decree inuētions yea multitude error wherwith haue subuerted al religiō vniuersal sufficiēt ouerwhelme destroy church 100 time therfore cā neuer extol highly deserueth infinit goodnes god wherby come passe wee escaping myraculously deadly gulf haue anchor faith firmly fixed soūd eternal truth god truly one cōmentarie shall sufficiētly testifie hope papistrie nothing el monster composed innumerable error satā church obiect vnto v confused thē babylō mean season wil freely cōfes ye truth far enough distāt filth pit whose contagion doth spread self far antichrist doth cōplayne slipt away compelled mourne many vice wherwith hath infected world remaine amongst v vnto v restored sincere puritie doctrine perfect religion simple worship god right order sacramēts deliuered christ chifest cause amongst v reformatiō maners amēdment life ought great part yet mindful vnbrideled libertie wherewith papistes doe freely waxe wā ton god cannot accustome thēselues christes yoke therefore whereas aduersaries ende may cause vnskilful vniustly hate v contemptuously crie haue broken good order discipline false slander refuted sufficiently one thynge though wee doe hold peace nothyng aboute whiche wee haue greater contention amongest selues namely rigour men thynke immoderate seeinge able verye well witnesse mee fellowes office wee seuere straite necessitie office doeth require also inforce v bee doe rest safely iudgement cō scicience otherside may easily iudge though matter ridiculous impudencie aduersaries behalfe may speake somewhat particularly selfe although persuaded worlde doeth know haue instructed church many writing yet thoght would worth ye paine monumēt therof extant dedicated vnto skilleth much kinde doctrine set men know haue taught although haue endeuoured profite people cōmitted vnto euen death bookes haue hitherto published meete doctrine whiche hath flowed citie vnto nation far wyde shoulde bring foorth fruit pentifully neglected owne place yet hope cōmentarie peculiarly cōsecrated vnto name wil take deeper root memory thing may com passe beseech liuing god deeply write hart may bee blotted subtile sleight satā hand giue successe vnto labor hath late giuen mee minde desire nothing thē faithfully care saluatiō al furthermore profes world far frō diligēce good shepheard exacted frō vertues greatnes excellēcy mine office require cōtinually god bewaile mine estate troubled many vice whiche hinder course dare prot • st wāt faithfulnes good meane wicked cease repine speak dutie well refute slander shalbe part suppresse holy authoritie wherin excell farewell right honorable lordes ought reuerence christ vnto whose tuition commit geneua first ianuary 1553 argument vpon iohn well knowen woorde euangelium gospel doth signifie amongst grecian scripture chiefly taken ioyfull happie message grace giuen v christe ende may learne despising worlde f • aile rich pleasure therof desire incomparable treasure whole hearte imbrace offered vnto v naturally engrafted v wee see wicked doe namely reioyce inordinately vaine pleasure worlde bee touched either none el slender feeling spirituall good thinges therefore ende god may reforme v fault calleth message commandeth published cōcerning christ name euangelium gospel hee doth thereby tell v true perfect ioy el without doubt wee haue blessed life pointes perfect certaine bee extende woorde gospell vnto free promise god also dispearsed lawe prophetes neither bee denied god often doth testifie hee bee mercifull vnto men forgiue sinnes doth also offer christe whose propertie wheresoeuer hee shineth spreade abroade beames ioy therefore confesse father wee partaker one gospel touching faith free saluation yet spirite doth vsually speake thus scripture gospel published christe came let v also retaine maner speech let bee definition gospel haue set solemne publishing proclayming grace reuealed christe respect gospel called power god saluation beleeue god doth therein make manifest righteousnesse also called embassage whereby reconcileth men vnto himselfe furthermore inasmuch christe pledge god mercie father loue towardes v therefore also proper matter gospel heereby commeth passe history declare christe appeared flesh dyed raysed vp againe death length receiued vp heauens properly called gospel although new testament called name according reason late alleadged yet come passè vse custome parte doth testifie christ exhibeted vnto v flesh dyed ro • againe death called synecdoche bare historie sufficient yea profite nothing vnto saluation euangelistes doe simplie shewe christe borne hee died became conquerour death doe also declare ende borne ende died rose againe fruite reape thereby yet difference amongest three set downe large life death christe euangelist standeth vpon doctrine wherein office christe force death resurrection declared doe conceale christe came end might bring saluation worlde might make satisfaction sinnes sacrifice death finally might point fulfill function mediatour like iohn doth also stande somewhat vpon historicall narration doctrine sheweth vnto v force fruite christ comming appeareth plainly euangelist whereas drift make christe manifest former euangelistes bring forth may speake body iohn bringeth foorth soule vvherfore vse commonly call gospel key openeth gate vnto vnderstanding whosoeuer shall perfectly vnderstande power force christe heere plaine wordes set downe hee shall reade profite thynges deliuered concerning manifestation redeemer thought iohn mooued write cause ende hee might defende diuinitie christe againste wicked blasphemy ebion cerinthus doth eusebius hyerome report according opinion olde writer whatsoeuer occasion caused write time yet bee doubted god farther prouide churche therefore hee indite euangelistes shoulde write hauing deuided partes amongst hee might make one perfect body nowe dutie linke knit together foure wee suffer selues bee taught one mouth together vvhereas haue placed iohn fourth order respect time wherein hee writ contrary order profitable reading beeing afterwarde aboute reade matthewe christe giuen v father may first learne iohn end reuealed ¶the holy gospel iesus christe according iohn 1in beginning word word god woorde god 2 beginning god 3 thinges made without made nothing made 4 life life light men 5 light shineth darknesse darkenesse comprehended commentarie john caluine 1▪ beginning worde exordium hee sheweth eternal diuinitie christe ende wee may knowe hee eternall god made manifest fleshe furthermore drifte thereof requisite mankinde shoulde bee restored sonne god seeing power thing created sithence hee alone doth breath life strength creature may remaine state especially seeing hee hath shewed man manifest token well power grace euen fall adam hee ceased bee liberall bountifull towarde posteritie doctrine needefull bee knowen seeing wee muste seeke health life without god howe shoulde faith leane rest vpon christe vnlesse wee fully persuaded whiche christe teacheth place therefore euangeliste teacheth woordes wee doe depart eternall god wee beleeue christe secondly benefite life nowe restored dead hauing nature yet perfect fountaine cause life seemeth mee reason moued call son god word hee first eternall wisdome god secondly expresse image counsell speech called marke printe minde men also vnfitly applyed vnto god say maketh himselfe knowen vnto v worde signification worde logo fit purpose logo doth signifie amongest grecian definition reason account subtilly play philosopher aboue capacitie faith see spirite god farre allowing suche subtiltie applying himselfe vnto weakenesse keeping silence hee cryeth howe soberly wee ought bee wise suche hidden mystery furthermore god reueale himselfe creating worlde word laid vp himselfe double relation former vnto god latter vnto men seruetus proudest knaue spayne euer brought foorth feigneth eternall worde take beginning reuealed creation worlde time power thereof knowen external worke euangelist teacheth farre thing place doth assigne beginning time worde saith beginning goeth beyond age ignorant dog barketh arrians somtimes cauill namely god beginning create heauen earth notwithstanding eternal word beginning doth rather respect order betoken eternitie euangelist preuenteth shift hee saith god worde began bee time must needes bee must finde course time god truely iohn intende particle name distinguish word thing created many thinges might come mindes men worde shew foorth force nature could knowen therfore saith must cleeue world thing created alwayes ioyned god worlde nowe wheras wrest word beginning vnto beginning heauen earth doe make christ subiect common order worlde statly exempted place wherein doe cruell iniurie onely sonne god also euerlasting father spoile wisdome haynous offence imagine god without wisdome must confes must el seeke beginning word saue eternal wisdome god seruetus obiecteth word cannot bee comprehended time moses bringeth god speaking god hee openly known within vntill time began come euā gelist cutteth al occasiō mad dotings whē affirmeth without exceptiō word god doth manifestly recall v frō al momēts time gather ye perpetual stat • preterimperfectense verb leane weake reasō word say doth expresse continuall course iohn shoulde haue saide hath beene must reason strongly waightie matter one thing brought ought suffice v euāgelist sendeth v eternal secret place god wee may knowe worde hidden time reueale selfe externall framing world refreshe strengthen worlde must needes come passe thinges whiche siue haue shall straightway decay brought nothing finally iohn doth testifie commeth passe benefite worde paul actes 17 28 ascribeth doe excell liuing creature shoulde say common life giuen vnto mē life ioyned light vnderstanding furthermore hee separateth man creatures▪ wee doe better perceiue power god selues vnderstanding hee sheweth thinge giuen peculiarly namely created like beast indued minde placed higher degree furthermore seeing god doth vaine kindle light mindes followeth created end may acknowledge authour great singuler goodnesse seeing hath powred thence v light fountaine whereof worde ought vnto v steed glasse wherin may cleerely see diuine power worde 5 light shineth darknesse might haue obiected nothing el vanitie lying appeare light men testimony diuinitie christe whereof euangelist maketh mention verse going quite put third degree said life men certaine thing farre excellent mouing breathing euangelist preuenteth obiection first doth tel v light wherwith men endued beginning esteemed according present state corrupt degenerate nature light turned darknes yet meane saith light vnderstā ding quite put shine yet certaine sparkle light darke mist man minde reader vnderstande sentence hath two member saith men nowe far perfect nature wherwith indued beginning affirmeth minde haue light euery part drowned darknes doth miserablie da • e mean glory christ darkened corruption nature euangelist proueth yet certain rēnants light remaining midst darknes may shew diuine power christ part therefore euangelist doth confesse minde man blinded may rightly iudged ouerwhelmed darknesse might vse milde worde say light obscure mistie meaning plainly expresse miserable estate fal first man whereas affirmeth light shineth darkenes doth whit appertaine vnto commendation nature corrupted rather taketh away cloke ignorance darkenes comprehended although sonne god alwayes inuite men vnto himselfe small light remaineth v yet yet euangelist saith thing good successe seeing saw since time man estranged god ignorance doth oppresse ouerwhelme minde light soeuer remaineth lyeth without effect choked vp thing proued dayly experience whosoeuer bee regenerate spirite god seeing excell reason manifestly declare man created breath vnderstand yet come vnto god leading reason nay truly doe much come towarde vnderstanding nothing el meere vanitie whereupon followeth man altogether destitute saluation vnlesse god put helping hande againe sonne god doth powre light thē yet dull cānot cōprehend frō whence light cō meth carryed away dotings vaine imagination become altogether foolish light remaineth yet corrupt nature hath two principall partes seede religion ingendered men secondly ingrauen conscience difference betweene good euill pray fruit ariseth heereof saue religion doth degenerate thousande monster superstition conscience ouerthroweth iudgement maketh mixture vice vertue briefe naturall reason neuer bring men vnto christ nowe furnished wisedome gouerne life borne vnto excellent artes learning likewise doeth vanish away without fruite furthermore wee muste note euangelist doeth onely speake naturall giftes doth yet touch grace regeneration two distincte vertues sonne god former whiche appeareth creation worlde order nature whereby hee renueth restoreth nature decayed hee eternall worde god world created power thing retaine life haue receiued man adorned especially excellēt gift vnderstanding although fall hee haue lost light vnderstanding yet seeth vnderstandeth yet quite abolished hee hath naturally grace sonne god yet hee darkeneth light remaineth yet blockishnesse frowardnesse remaineth sonne god take vppon new office mediatour hee may vnto christe hee might beare witnes himselfe preaching iohn tend ende might take heede doctrine myracles christe sent god hee doth confirme calling iohn doth make mention thereof way sufficient passiuely referred vnto person iohn acceptable sight god yet notwithstandyng doe willingly referre vnto fruite whiche men shoulde receyue 7 hee came witnesse setteth downe briefly end callyng namely light place commonly expounded two wayes certaine restraine vniuersall note vnto regenerate spirit god made partaker liuely light augustine induceth similitude schoolemaster one haue schoole citie hee generally come worlde sense pleaseth mee better beames spread abroade light throughout mankinde also saide wee knowe men haue peculiarly aboue liuing creature indued reason vnderstanding carrye ingrauen conscience difference betweene right wrong therefore man vnto whome commeth feelyng eternall light certayne frantike brainsicke fellowes wrest place hauing rashly caught may therby gather grace illumination offered vnto men like sort let v remember euangelist intreateth place onely common light nature farre inferiour vnto faith doubtlesse man shall enter kingdome god quicknesse foresight minde onely spirite christ openeth gate heauen elect secondly let v remember light reason god gaue vnto men darkened sinne doe scarce appeare certaine small sparkle thicke darknesse offered seeing doe nowe obtaine selfe thing occupyed although hebretians doe oftentimes take name power yet heere relation vnto doctrine gospel doe rightly beleeue christe preached vnto v speake ordinarie meanes whereby lorde bringeth v vnto faith must diligently noted many men foolishly forge themselues confused faith without vnderstanding doctrine like amongest papistes nothing common degenerate child boasting faith arrogateth nothing carnall begetting acknowledgeth hath receiued goodnesse whiche hath grace god alone therefore iohn saith gentile beleeue christ vncleane borne sonnes god wombe fashioned againe god may begin bee seemeth haue put blooddes plurall number ende hee might better expresse long succession stocke part iewish boasting able directly proue came patriarkes continuall course fleshe man doe signifie one thing iudgement see cause fleshe shoulde taken woman manie doe thinke augustine rather euangeliste repeateth one thing diuers wordes hee beateth better imprinteth deepely men myndes although doe properly respect iewes dyd bragge fleshe yet may generall doctrine gathered place proper nature neither doth proceede v wee accounted child god lorde owne wyll free loue begate v heereupon followeth first faith proceedeth v fruite spirituall regeneration euangelist saith man beleeue vnlesse hee begotten god therefore faith heauenly gift secondly faith colde bare knowledge sithence none beleeue hee fashioned againe spirite god notwithstanding seemeth euangelist dealeth disorderly putting regeneration faith seeing rather effect faith therefore bee set hym answeare doe well agree doe conceiue incorruptible seed faith wherby borne againe newe diuine life yet notwithstanding faith worke holy ghost dwelleth sonnes god alone therefore diuers respectes faith part regeneration entrance kingdome god may number v amongest child whereas spirite doth illuminate mindes doth appertaine vnto renuing v meanes faith doth flowe regeneration fountaine receiue christ faith doth sanctifie v holy spirite therefore saide beginning adoption although may another plaine redie distinction brought lorde inspireth faith hee begetteth v againe secretely secrete meanes knowe beeing indued faith lay holde vpon liuely feeling conscience grace adoption also newnesse life giftes holy ghoste seeing faith doeth receiue christe saide bringeth v sort possession good giftes according sense begin child god vntyl time haue faith sobeit inheritaunce eternall life fruite adoption wee see howe euangelist ascribeth saluation grace christe alone surely howe narrowly soeuer men doe sift themselues shall finde nothing meete child god christe hath bestowed vpon 14 woorde made fleshe dwelt amongest v wee sawe glory glory begotten father ful grace truth 14 worde made flesh nowe teacheth sort christe came whereof made mention namely hauing put flesh shewed himselfe openly worlde although euangelist doth briefly touch vnspeakeable secrete mysterie sonne god put man nature yet breuitie merueilous plaine certaine foolishe fellowes doe heere delude toye friuolous shiftes saide woorde made fleshe god sende sonne worlde made man hee conceiued minde worde shadowish vaine conception minde wee haue shewed true person essence god expressed worde moreouer worde fleshe greater force expresse minde hee saide made man meaning shew vnto howe vile base estate sonne god came downe highnesse heauenly glory sake vvhen scripture speaketh man contemptuously hee calleth fleshe therefore albeit great difference betweene spirituall glory woorde god rotten dregges fleshe yet notwithstanding sonne god abase hymselfe muche hee tooke vpon flesh subiect great miserie flesh takē place corrupt nature paule doth oftentimes take mortal man although doth contempt signifie frayle brittle nature psalme 78 39 hee remembred fleshe isay 40 6 fleshe grasse suche like place yet must note herewithall kinde speeche wherein synechdoche inferiour parte comprehendeth whole man therefore apolinaris dote feigned christe take vpon body man without soule wee may gather infinite testimony hee lesse indued soule body scripture calleth men fleshe doth therefore depriue soules therefore sentence plaine word begotten god beginning worlde whiche alwayes abide father made man poynt faith wee must chiefly holde two thinges two nature christ dyd growe togeather one person one christe god man vnitie person doth whit let nature may remaine distinct diuinitie doth retaine whatsoeuer proper humanitie hath also seuerally whatsoeuer belongeth it▪ therefore whensoeuer satan goe heretikes ouerthrowe sounde doctrine diuers dotings hee alwayes brought one error eyther christ sonne god man confusedly neyther diuinitie remained hym neyther cōpassed true nature mā el clothed fleshe hee double two nature thus dyd nestorius time past plainely confesse nature hee made one christe god another man contrarie eutiches acknowledge one christ sonne god man left hym neither two nature feigned mixed together seruetus day feigneth anabaptist christe confusedly cōpounded double nature diuine man woorde hee affirmeth hee god receiue vaine gloss diuinitie turned time humaine nature nowe againe humane nature swallowed vp diuinitie wordes euangeliste serue fitly refuting sacriligies vvhen hee saith worde made fleshe vnitie person plainely gathered hence meete shoulde bee another man beside alwayes god▪ seeing said god made man againe seeing woorde woorde attributed distinctly vnto christe hee man followeth christe ceased bee whē made man nothing altered eternall essence god put vpon fleshe finally sonne god began bee man suche sorte notwithstandynge hee yet eternall woorde whiche hath beginnyng time dwelt expounde fleshe vnto christe house doe vnderstande meaning of▪ euangelist doubtlesse doth assigne vnto christe perpetuall abiding amongst v saith conuersant amongest v season word escen • sen hee vseth fet tabernacle therfore doth signifie nothing el saue yt christ execute functiō vpon earth inioyned appeare one moment onely abide amongst men vntil time finish course office heere may question moued whether doth speake men generall himselfe alone disciple sawe theyr eies whiche hee saith doe rather allowe latter hee addeth hy wee sawe glory although glory christe might haue beene seene men yet vnknowen greatest parte blindnesse fewe saw manifestation glory whose eye holy spirite open summe christ knowen man shewed himselfe farre greater excellent thing vvhereupon followeth maiestie god extenuated although compassed flesh laide hid indeede vnder humilitie fleshe yet sent foorth brightnesse thereof place note improprietie doth rather betoken true sounde approbationephe 5 8 paule saith walke fulnesse grace christe fountaine wee must draw shall hereafter declare large may expounded hypallage true grace expositiuely thus ful grace truth perfection wil repeate maner speeche againe thinke himselfe thinges bee redeemer messias indeede excellent token mark▪ wherby ought haue beene knowen men 15 iohn doth testifie himselfe cryed saying hee whome saide whiche commyng mee set mee hee excellent th • n 〈◊〉 16 wee haue receiued fulnesse grace grace 17 lawe giuen moses grace truthe • e iesus christe 18 man hath seene god time begotten sonne b • father hath shewed 15 iohn doth testifie nowe hee declareth maner preaching iohns verb presentense denoteth continuall act truely doctrine ought alwayes bee force voyce iohn sounde continually eares men putteth afterwarde worde cryed hee may signifie doctrine iohn obscure either harde bee vnderstoode whispered eares fewe preached christe openly loude voyce first sentence tendeth ende sent christes cause therefore absurde thing hee shoulde florish christe shoulde lye vnderfoote hee saith saide word meaneth whole intent beginning make christ knowen ende sermon like hee coulde otherwise execute office embassage thē calling disciple vnto christe hee commeth mee although fewe monethes elder christ yet speaketh place age exercised office prophete space christe came abroade therefore maketh himselfe former christ time therefore christe succeeded iohn respect publik manifestation followeth thus word worde hee made mee first sense christ preferred iohn excellent therefore gyueth place christe prouerb goeth giueth light beare came time hee sheweth let may preferred desert dignitie becommeth men excell either giftes god degree honour remaine degree may inferiour christe 16 fulnesse nowe beginneth preache office christe hee conteineth himselfe aboundance good thinges wee must fet part saluation god truly well life righteousnesse vertue wisdome well hydden v wee cannot attaine thereunto plentie thing laide open v christ wee may fet thence readie flowe vnto v owne accorde make way faith briefe saith plainely good thing sought without christe although sentence consisteth vpon moe member sheweth first v poore altogether voide spirituall good thinges christ aboundeth ende hee may helpe want may diminish pouertie hee may fill poore hungry secondly hee telleth v soone departed christ wee doe vaine seeke euen one droppe goodnesse god woulde haue goodnesse whatsoeuer remaine alone therefore shall finde angel men bee drie heauen vaine earth bee barren finally thinges nothing worth wee made partaker giftes god meanes christe thirdly telleth v neede bee afraide want thing • drawe fulnesse christe perfect pointes shall perceiue well neuer drawen drie iohn maketh himselfe one rest modesty sake may plainely appeare none excepted yet doubted whether hee speake generally mankinde vnderstand onely made partaker good thinges christe reuealed fleshe certaine godly men liued vnder lawe drawe fulnesse iohn addeth difference time like true hee doth commende set foorth plentifull aboundance good thynges christe brought foorth commyng wee knowe benefites god tasted sparingly vnder lawe soone christ reuealed fleshe powred great aboundance euen vnto full anye v hath greater aboundance spirite abraham speake ordinarie dispensation manner meanes dispensing therefore ende iohn may better inuite disciple vnto christe telleth aboundance good thinges want offered although shall absurditie therein extend farther yea text may read thus verye well father beginning worlde drawe giftes christe although lawe giuen moses yet obtaine grace thereby notwithstanding haue shewed like best namely iohn doth place compare v father comparison▪ hee may amplifie giuen v grace grace well knowen howe augustine expoundeth place namely al good thing giuen v god eternall life repaide merites due rewarde poynt liberalitie god doth reward former grace crown giftes v truely godly finely saide fit place sense plaine thou shouldst take worde anti comparitiuely shoulde say whatsoeuer grace lorde heapeth vpon v doe like sort flowe fountaine may also bee vnderstood note finall cause receiue grace nowe lorde may accomplishe worke saluatiō notwithstanding rather subscribe vnto iudgement say wee watered grace powred vppon christe reco •• e christe hee doth onely giue v god father hath bestowed vpon might flowe vnto v conduit oyntmente wherewith hee annoynted hee myght annoynt v togeather hym wherevppon hee called christe wee christian 17 lawe giuen moses preuention wherein hee preuenteth contrarie obiection moses greatly esteemed amongest iewes hardly admit thing contrary therfore euāgelist teacheth far inferior ministerie moses power christe also comparison doth little beautifie power christe seeing iewes make great account moses attribute vnto honour might bee euangelist telleth small thing moses brought compared grace christe otherwise great let thought lawe whiche doe obteine christe alone must note contraposition setteth lawe grace truth meaning lawe wanted truth iudgement taken firme sound stabilitie thing worde grace vnderstande spirituall fulfilling thinges bare letter whereof contained lawe two voyces may referred hypallage vnto one thing saide grace wherein truth lawe consisteth reuealed length christ sense shall remaine maketh great matter whether thou couple together distinguish truely certaine euangelists meaning image spirituall good thing shadowed law perfectly fulfilled christe whereupon followeth thou separate law christe remaineth nothing vaine figure respect paul saith collos 2 17 therein shadowes body christ yet notwithstā ding must imagine thing shewed deceitfully lawe christ soule quickneth otherwise dead lawe shooteth heere another marke namely force law selfe without christ euangelist saith sounde thing found vntyll wee come vnto christe furthermore truth consisteth obteine grace christe lawe could giue v therefore take worde grace generally aswell free remission sin renuing hearte seeing euangelist doth place briefly note difference betwene old new testament described large ier 31 31 hee cōprehēdeth vnder worde whatsoeuer belongeth vnto spirituall righteousnesse partes thereof two god doth reconcile himselfe vnto v freely imputing sinnes doth ingraue heartes men lawe doth frame men inwardly spirite obey wherby appeareth law falsly vnproperly expounded sobeit retaine keepe thē back comming christe 18 man hath seene god time fitly added confirme next sentence withall knowledge god gate whereby enter fruition goodnesse therfore seeing god doth reueale himselfe vnto v christe alone followeth heereupon must desire craue thinges christe course doctrine diligentlye bee noted nothynge seemeth bee common euery one v doth receiue thinges god doth offer vnto v according measure faith fewe thinke must bring vessell faith knowledge god wherby may draw saith man hath seene god time vnderstoode externall sight bodily eye hee giueth v vnderstande generally seeing god dwelleth light none come vnto cānot knowē christ liuely image furthermore doe commonly expounde place wise seeing bare maiestie god hidden selfe coulde neuer comprehended saue forasmuch reuealed self christe therefore god knowen father christe doe rather thinke euangelist doth heere holde comparison namely farre better estate estate father god layde hid secrete glory hath made himselfe sort visible certainely christe called expresse image god doeth appertaine vnto peculiar benefite newe testament also euangelist noteth place certaine newe vnwonted thing saith begotten bosome father declare vnto v otherwise beene hydden therefore setteth foorth manifestation god came vnto v gospel whereby hee distinguisheth v father putteth v like paule also intreateth large third fourth second corinthian saith yt veale vnder lawe god seene plainely face christe man thinke absurde thing father depriued knowledge god prophetes doe euen day beare light v answeare simply preciselie denyed attributed vnto v comparison made say betweene lesser greater little sparkle liuely light whose full brightnesse doth lighten v day man obiect god seene face face say sight compared god wont shewe himselfe darkly farre appeared plainely doe say saw face face therfore haue respect vnto time meane sawe god saue couered many boughtes singuler vision almost excellent rest whiche moses obteined mount exod 33 23 yet god saith plainely thou wilt able see face thou shalt see backe metaphore signifieth full time full euident reuelation yet come must also note father alwayes turne eye towarde christe time desirous see god doe vnderstand behold god eternall word also bente minde affection hearte vnto promised reuelation christe respect christe himselfe saith eight chapter abraham sawe r • day furthermore succeedeth turne contrary therefore remaineth sure certaine god inuisible hath nowe appeared christe saith sinne bosome father trāslated men saide admit bosomes impart secret place counsel brest therfore teacheth sonne knowe euen secrete councels father wee maye knowe haue breast god opened gospel 19 testimonie iohn iewes sent nowe doth hee descend vnto famous testimonie giuen embassadours priestes might carry ierusalem therefore saith iohn flatly confesse wherefore sent god first may question asked ende priestes asked doe commonly thinke hated christe gaue false kinde honour iohn knowe christe othersome say iohn pleased better order stocke priestes neither like bee true seeing promise selues christe shoulde haue prosperitie would haue feigned themselues false christe owne accorde therefore think moued reason nowe long time wanted prophet iohn came abrode sodainly vnlooked mindes lifted vp expectation moreouer thought commyng messias drewe neere least priestes shoulde seeme waxe sluggishe office shoulde either neglect dissemble great matter demaunde iohn therefore nothing craftily beginnyng rather moued desire redemption desire knowe whether iohn bee christe beginneth change order vsed church yet doe deny ambition retaine right great force yet meant nothing lesse translate honour whiche christes vnto another neyther doe thing vnmeete person beare seeing gouerners church god stoode vpon see mā thrust himselfe rashly start vp authour new sect vnitie faith broken amongst people man bring new forraine rite therefore appeareth fame iohn published abrode mooued mindes men gouerned wonderfull prouidence god testimonie might famous 20 confessed confessed plainely without doubting feigning worde confesse taken generally former place hee declared matter repeated againe expresse forme confession therfore answered flatly christ 21 art thou elia doe rather call elia moses vnderstande prophete malachie elia shoulde day starre messias rise yet aske question reason opinion fasly taken vpon whereas thought soule man 〈◊〉 one body another whilest malachie prophet saith elia shoulde sent imagined elia time achab come wherefore iohn answered worthily truly elia hee speaketh according theyr meaning christe true interpretation prophete affirmeth elia art thou prophete erasmus doth falsly restraine vnto christe whereas article added force place embassadours doe sufficiently declare afterwardes meant another prophete christe gather thus thou neither christe elia prophet therefore wee see meant diuers person othersome doe thinke asked whether one old prophet yet doe like exposition doe rather hereby meane office iohn whether ordained prophete god whilest denyeth lyeth modesty sake hee doth separate himselfe number prophetes sincerely hearte yet answere contrary title whiche christe giueth christe adorneth iohn title prophete yea hee addeth hee prophete wordes hee doeth nothing el purchase credite authoritie doctrine doth also extoll excellencie office enioyned iohn respecteth another thing place namely particular commandement ordinary custome prophetes hee onely christes cryer shall appeare plainely similitude whosoeuer bee sent embassadours light matter haue name authoritie embassadours sobeit haue particular thing giuen charge prophetes furnished particuler prophesies exercise propheticall function matter weight hande two embassador sent one whereof doth tell heere shall speake matter latter haue businesse giuen charge dispatche shall former embassage accounted portion part principall embassage fared iohn vnto god enioyned nothing el prepare disciple christ sense gathered circumstance place text must marke contrary member followeth saith hee baptisme consisteth truth signe secondly hath nothing administration externall signe al force efficacie power christe alone defendeth baptisme forasmuch trueth thereof dependeth vppon another meane season hee extolleth dignitie christe taking himselfe power spirite men may looke vnto christe alone best temperature minister doth borowe authority hath christe hee doth also referre vnto attributing baptisme must confesse christ alone doth perfourme baptisme doth represent haue nothing bare administration signe double kinde speeche vsed scripture concerning sacrament place teacheth 〈◊〉 regeneration sinnes washed away ingrafted body christe olde man crucified wee rise againe vnto newnes life truely doth hee couple power christe ministerie man truly minister nothing el hande christ therfore suche phrase doe shewe man giueth christe bringeth passe man sign • instrumente • wee fall easily superstition secondly men pull themselues honour take god according naturall pride therefore ende scripture may subdue tame sacriligious pride doth sometimes distinguishe minister christ place may know minister doe nothing amongst toucheth sluggishnesse way knewe christ ought chiefly respect pure al streames good thinges doe flowe fountaine god doth receiue v fauour imputing sinnes therefore ende iohn may bring v vnto christ beginneth free pardon sinnes haue furthermore worde lambe synecdoche likely iohn respect vnto paschal lambe briefe must note iohn vsed phrase whiche fit forcible teache iewes like daye doe better vnderstand vse baptisme force remission sinnes purchased death christe wee heare wee washed purged thereby filthinesse meane whyle seeyng iewes commonly thinke superstitiously sacrifice correcteth fault way tellyng end serue worst abuse sacrifice repose confidence signes therfore iohn setteth christe hee doeth testifie hee lambe god vvhereby giueth vnderstand sacrifice iewes offer able make satisfaction sinnes figure truth whereof shewed christe himselfe putteth • nne singuler number maner iniquitie say maner vnrighteousnes doth alienate god men taken away christ saith sinne worlde extendeth grace generally vnto mankinde least iewes shoulde thinke sent bee redeemer doe gather hereby worlde bounde giltinesse mortall men without exception giltie vnrighteousnesse god haue neede reconciliation therefore iohn speaketh generally sinne worlde meaning bring v feeling owne miserie exhort v seeke remedie benefite offered vnto men duetie imbrace men may fully assured nothing hindereth finding reconciliation christ sobeit haue faith guide bring thē vnto furthermore setteth downe way meanes take away sinnes vvee knowe beginning worlde conscience accuse went busily deserue pardō thēce came many kind sacrifice whereby thought god pacified yet deceiued confesse truly corrupt rite pacifying came holy beginning namely god ordeined sacrifice direct men vnto christe notwithstanding euerie man inuented himselfe way owne whereby please god iohn calleth v backe vnto christe alone teacheth v god mercifull vnto v benefite alone taketh away sinnes vvherefore hee leaueth nothing sinner doe flie vnto christe whereby ouerthroweth humane satisfaction sacrifice redemption nothing el wicked inuentions diuell founde crafte woorde taketh may bee expounded two maner wayes either christe tooke burden vpon wherewith oppressed said bare sinnes vpon tree say saith correction peace laid vpon doth abolish sinnes latter dependeth vpon former therefore receiue willingly namely christe doth take away sinnes bearing therefore although sinne doe still remaine v yet touching iudgement god none abolished grace christ imputed vnto v neither doeth displease mee chrysostome noteth verbe presentense signified continuance satisfactiō hee made alwayes force doth teach simplie yt christ taketh away sin setteth downe also maner howe namely hath reconciled father vnto v benefite death doth meane woorde lambe let v therfore knowe reconciled god grace christe runne vnto death doe perswade selues fastened vnto crosse propitiatorie sacrifice wherby giltines taken away 30 saide hee briefly comprehendeth thynges affirmeth christ said preferred followeth hereupon iohn nothing el tryer sent sake whereby euident againe christ messias furthermore reckoneth vp three thing place saith man commeth giueth v vnderstand respect time might prepare way wee may knowe remaineth store giftes wee want may easily gather wordes iohn baptist saith vpon see spirite descending remaining vpon hee baptiseth spirite much say spirite appeared ende visible shape rested vpon christ hee myght water fulnesse touched briefly baptise spirite namely giue baptisme effect leaste bee vaine voyde thing spirite doth power 33 vpon thou shalt see ariseth harde question iohn knewe christe doth refuse suffer come baptisme woulde surely say thus one whome hee knewe ought rather bee baptised • f thee▪ certaine doe answere knew farre reuerenced excellent prophete knewe hee sonne god colde answere euerie man must obey calling god without respect person therfore ther dignitie man excellencie ought hinder v office therefore iohn done iniurie god baptisme hee saide thus saue onely sonne god therefore must need hee knew christ first first wee must note intreate place knowledge commeth familiaritie continuall vse although therefore hee knewe christe soone hee sawe yet doth cease bee true one knowe another common custome men beginning knowledge came god yet neuerthelesse question seemeth bee throughly answered saith sight spirite marke showing hee yet seene spirite hee speaketh vnto vnto sonne god doe willingly subscribe vnto iudgement thinke signe added confirmation sake much iohns sake sake onely iohn saw spirite rather himselfe bucer citeth place moses • itly come vnto christe contempt wherewith despiseth man 41 vve haue found messias euāgelist turneth worde messias greeke might make knowen vnto world kept close amongst iewes furthermore ordinary title king like annointed solēnly mean ignorāt one king annoynted god vnder whō hope perfect eternal felicitie especially seeing tried vnstable earthly kingdome dauid furthermore god raysed vp brought oppressed diuers sorrowes vnto waiting messias hee manifestly declare vnto cōming drew neere prophesie daniel excelleth rest plain touching name christ doth attribute vnto king doe prophet maketh proper vnto redeemer came passe mention made messias christe vnderstood none saue redeemer greater wōder receiued muche desired men mouth al men 42 thou art simon c christ giueth simon name falleth commonly amongst men according euent past according seene hee make stone first hee saith thou art simon sonne iona setteth downe name father vnperfectly cōmon enough name translated tongue shall manifestly appeare last chapter sonne iohanna iohn asmuch say shalbe another maner person thē neither doth make mention father honor sake affirmeth came base stock estimation among men yet whit hinder frō making man inuincible force therfore euangelist reciteth prophesie simon new sirname giuen meane prophesie much christ foresaw peter wold constant faith foretold would giue therfore setteth foorth title grace wherewith determined indue afterward cause hee saith sirname deferreth vntill time come thou shalt called cephas saith meete godly bee peter stone beeing founded christe may made fit build vp temple god alone called singuler excellencie meane papistes laughed put christ steed may foundation church hee rest founded christ twice ridiculous whilest make stone head ther extāt repetition gratianus doltishe canon vnder name anacletus changing hebrewe name greeke making difference betweene cephale cepha thinketh peter made name head church furthermore cepha rather chaldean hebrew name vsuall kinde pronunciation captiuitie babylon therefore doubtfull thing wordes christ hee promiseth peter would neuer haue hoped therein doth set foorth grace vnto al age former estate whit hurt seeing excellent title declareth made new man 43 next day iesus would goe foorth galilee founde phillip hee said vnto follow 44 phillip bethsaida citie andrew peter 45 phillip found nathanael saith vnto haue found iesus sonne ioseph nazareth moses writ lawe prophetes 46 nathanael saide vnto good thing come nazareth phillip said vnto come see 43 follow asmuch minde phillip inflamed one word follow christ thereby gather great force word doth appeare alike god doth cal many without fruit strike eares vaine sound therefore externall preaching worde selfe vnfruitfull saue doth wound reprobate death yt may made inexcuseable god whēas ye secret working ye spirit doth quicken must need sens must bemoued men may redie follow whither soeuer god calleth therefore must desire christe hee wyll shewe foorth power gospel v phillip followed christe particuler maner commaunded follow euery one v fellowe vnseparable companion yet notwithstanding calling figure calling men hee beth • aida seemeth name citie put set purpose ende goodnesse god may appeare manyfestly three apostle vve knowe sharpely christ threatned cursed citie el vvherefore wicked cursed nation receiued god fauour bee accounted brought hell whereas hee vouchsafeth aduaunce vnto great dignitie whome deliuered deepe dungeon hee maketh apostle excellent benefite benefite worthie bee remembred 45 phillip founde nathanael howsoeuer proude men despise young beginning childhoode churche yet dutie see espie greater glory god estate kingdome christe mightie gorgeous begynning know great aboundance spring little seede furthermore wee see heere phillip desire edifie andrew vve see furthermore modestie coueteth goeth thing saue haue learne cōmon master al men vve haue found iesus appeareth hereby slender portion faith philip cannot speake foure wordes concerning christe intermingleth two grosse errours hee maketh sonne ioseph falsly assigneth vnto nazareth countrie yet notwithstanding coueteth sincerely profite brother make christe knowen god doth alowe diligence hath also prosperous successe vvee must euery one v doe indeuour keepe selues within bond neyther doth euangelist recite thing worthie commendation phillip hee doeth twice disgrace christe declareth doctrine howsoeuer corrupt intangled errour profitable ende thereof haue christe made knowen calleth iesus sonne ioseph foolishly maketh nazarite vnskilfully meane season bringeth vnto none vnto sonne god borne bethlaim neithey doth hee forge false christe haue one knowen described moses prophetes therefore see principall thing doctrine may one meanes come vnto christe heare v manie doe dispute subtilly concerning christe doe notwithstanding inwrappe darken subtilties hee neuer bee founde like sorte papistes wil say iesus sonne ioseph know wel name meane depriue power shewe shadow steed christ vvere better stammer grosly phillip retaine true christe bring feigned christ eloquent craftie kinde speeche side day many poore idiot ignorant eloquence rhethorike doe notwithstanding teach christe faithfully pope diuines deepe speculation therefore place teacheth v must hautilie refuse simple vnlearned speake anye thing christ vnfitly direct v vnto christ least drawne away false gloss men christe let v alwayes haue remedie readinesse •• sincere knowledge lawe prophetes 46 nazareth first nathanael starteth backe offended countrie christe declared phillip first deceiued speech phillip vttered without consideration taketh certaintie phillip thought foolishly thē foloweth preposterous iudgemēt proceeding frō hatred contempt place vve must mark diligently holy man almost stopt way himselfe▪ hee coulde come vnto christe vvhy rashly beleeueth phillip spake falsly concerning secondly opinion conceiued possest minde hee hoped good thing nazareth therefore vnlesse wee take good heede selues shal free danger truly satan goeth dayly keepe v comming christe lettes causeth many lye bee spreade abroade daily may either cause v hate el suspect gospel end • may bolde taste ceaseth also work another feate whereby make v contemne christe wee see stumbling stone humilitie crosse vnto many appeareth aswel christe head mēbers▪ cā scarse warie shal tempted shift satan let least helpe v foorthwith come see nathanael suffered double errour corrected saying phillip therfore let v first shewe selues easie taught obedient dyd hee let v refuse enquire whereas christe selfe readie take v doubtes trouble v erre greatly whiche read sentēce affirmatiuely coldly spoken secondly wee know citie nazareth reputation answere phillip doth sufficiently declare worde doubting distrust 47 vvhen iesus saw nathanael comming vnto saith behold israelite indeed guile 48 nathanael saith vnto whence knowest thou mee iesus answered saide vnto phillip called thee thou wast vnder figge tree saw thee 49 nathanael answered saide vnto rabbi thou art sonne god th •• art king israel 50 iesus answered saide vnto saide may pull visor face hypocrite defineth briefly true israelite doth also take away offence arise reason • wicked stubbornne • nation would accounted child abrahā holy people god shortly deadly enemy profitable doctrin place christ doth see v thinke must needes bee bringeth v backe againe turned away 49 thou art sonne god maruell hee knoweth sonne god diuine power respect doth call king israel thing doe seeme hang together nathanael hath respect vnto farther thing already hearde messias vnto doctrine doth adioine confirmation giuen holdeth also another principle sonne god shall come shew himselfe king vnto people god therefore doth worthily acknowledge king israel sonne god truly faith muste stick essence christ may speake must marke power office shoulde little auaile knowe christe vnlesse second thing shoulde added thereunto one toward v ende hee sent father heereby commeth passe papistes haue shadowed christ care apprehende bare essence • yet neglected kingdom cōsisteth power sauing furthermore nathanael sayth king israel whose kingdome notwithstanding reacheth vnto farthest partes worlde confussion limited according measure faith hee come farre knowe hee appointed king worlde rather child abraham shoulde gathered together place whole worlde might israel god vve largenesse kingdome christe reuealed must leape ouer straites meane season let v exercise faith hearing woorde according nathanael let v establish meanes possible let remaine buried let breake forth 50 iesus answered doth reprehend nathanael though hee credulous rather approuing faith voyce hee disciple called also may thence gathered simplie thriftilie hee liued liued together may seeme absurd thing man beeing rich may appeare want wine doth inuite foure fiue moe christes cause amongst poore bidding easie free afraide shame riche doe entertaine gestes daintily gorgeously ought poore men doe retaine old maner mutuall communication yet seemeth againe vnciuile thing bridegrome suffereth gestes want wine middest supper point man rashe vnprouident haue much wine sufficient gests answere nothing told place doth oftentimes chaunce especially wher wine dayly vsed secondly text doeth shewe banket almost ended wine fayled haue alreadie well filled according custome gouernour feast saith thus men doe set worser wine drunke thou hast kept best till moreouer doe doubt gouerned prouidence god might place myracle 3 mother iesus saith may doubt arise whether hope something sonnes hand • aske somthing seeing yet wrought myracle may also looking thing handes put minde cheere vppe gestes weerie godly exhortion shoulde also moderate shame bridegrome might take hereby furthermore thinke wordes carefull pitie holy woman saw banket might bee troubled bidden thinking honorably enough entertayned might murmur bridegrome desired comforte chrysostome thinketh went purchase fauour selfe sonne woman vse commonly doe coniecture without reason doth christ churlishly giue repulse answere although neither ambition neither affection flesh driue yet shee therein offend shee passe • bound carefull sorie discōmoditie another desirous cure som one meanes point curtesie bee ascribed vnto vertue yet meane season might haue darkened glory christ intruding selfe although must also note christ said thus much hersake others modestie godlinesse greater neede sharp reprehension secondly call mother word christ see yt mē forbid extolling honor name mother superstitiously marie translate thing vnto proper god therfore christ speaketh vnto mother wise might deliuer vnto age perpetuall cōmō doctrine least immoderate honour mother darken diuine glory furthermore well knowne howe necessarie admonitiō grosse filthy superstitiōs followed afterward marie made queene heauen hope life health world furthermore mad fury went thus far decked thing tooke frō christe whō left naked whē wee doe cōdemne execrable blasphemy vttered son god papist cal v wicked enuious yea wickedly falsly report like enemy impugne honor holy virgin thogh much honor due vnto vnles shee bee made goddesse honour thrust christ place adorned wt sacrilegious title therefore cruell iniurie marie whē may disfigure false praise take frō god houre yet come meaning delayed hitherto thoughte vpō cared meane sheweth wil care matter whē opportunitie shal serue therfore blameth mother hastie putteth hope wil shew som myracle holy virgin acknowledgeth doth trouble biddeth minister whatsoeuer shal bid thē sheweth yt hoped som new thing doctrine reacheth farther oftē lord doth make v wait deferreth help therfore sluggish doth rather moderate work may thing due season wrested place vnto fatall appointment time ridiculous neede speake one worde refutation sometimes called hour christe appointed father afterwarde call time commodious fit fulfill father commandements place challengeth vnto himselfe free libertie take choose time wherein hee worke myracle 5 mother saith minister holy virgin sheweth token true obedience owe vnto sonne matter touche humane office diuine power therefore resteth modestly vpon answere also exhorteth men like sort obey commandement confesse indeede virgin said thus according present circumstance shee denie shee authoritie matter christe would whatsoeuer pleased yet marke drift sentence reacheth doth first abandon depriue self power whiche shee might seeme vniustly haue taken selfe doth shee acknowledge belongeth wholy christe commaundeth doe shall commaunde therefore taught generally place wee desire thynge christ otherwise obtaine petition vnlesse depend wholy vpon haue respect vnto finally doe whiche commanndeth v sendeth v vnto mother doth rather bid v come vnto himselfe 6 water pot according budaus supputation wee gather water pot bigge holde much seeing firkin maketh fiue twentie potles euery one thē contained least sextarie according measure countrie therefore christe ministred vnto great plentie wine namely might suffice hundred fiftie men merie banquet moreouer aswell number water pottes manner selfe serueth prouing truth myracle two thre pottle many might haue suspected bin fet place turning water wine bin done one vessell certaintie myracle beene plaine euident therfore vaine euangelist maketh mentiō number neither doth expresse vaine much contained furthermore arose superstition manye great vessel stande rite washing lawe god world alwayes much externall thing iewes contented plainnesse god appointeth alwayes toying continuall sprinkling superstition ambitious doubted serued also pompe like see day papistrie thinges soeuer said appertaine worship god applied vnto vaine bragging boasting therfore double fault first occupie thēselues feigned superfluous ceremonie without commandement god secondly ambition reigne furniture vnder pretence religion furthermore wickednesse certaine knaues time poperie wonderfull durst first thrust waterpots small quantitie secondly vnequall measure euen day tryall temperance sparing temperate middest aboundancepsal 4 12▪ like paul doth boast taught doe abound hunger 11 beginning myracles meaning wordes first christe myracles angel tolde sheepheards borne doe say first myracle whiche christe cana galilee though hee chosen place shew power reade neuer twise rather drift euangelist note order course time christ kept declaring power kept hymself home like priuate man vntill thirtie yeere olde soone hee baptised began come abroade doe function euident testimony declare ende sent father therefore maruell deferred first token diuinitie vntill tyme great worship marriage christe onely vouchsafe bee present marriage banket also adorne first myracle hee wrought certaine olde canon extant wherein cleargie men forbidden goe mariages cause forbidding least beholding wantonnes whiche part vsed shoulde seeme allowe farre better haue brought much grauitie thither might haue tamed libertie froward dissolute person graunt themselues secrete corner let rather example christ vnto v law let v thinke nothing profitable done wee reade hee shewed glory shewed time famous glorious token whereby might euidently appeare son god looke many myracles shewed vnto worlde many signes diuine power due time shew glory come would knowen according commandement father whence also gather ende myracles saying much beene saide christ wrought myracle end might shew foorth glory vvhat must thinke myracles make glory christ obscure disciple beleeued disciple must needes bee faith whereas hitherto followed vncertaine doubting faith begin length addict themselues vnto acknoweledge messias preached vnto great mercifulnesse christ accounteth disciple weake faith truely doctrine reacheth generally vnto v faith nowe growne vp perfection time infancie yea man perfect necessarie v goe forward beleeuing alreadie beleeue forasmuch dayly goe forward toward marke begin beleeue therefore let haue obtained first fruites faith alwayes striue goe forward fruite also myracles shewed place namely muste referred vnto confirmation increase faith hee wresteth end corrupteth depraueth whole vse therof like see papistes make boast feigned myracles ende ouerwhelme faith turne away men mindes christe vnto creature 12 went downe capernaum mother brother disciple hee tarryed many dayes 13 iewes easter drewe neere therefore iesus went vppe hierusalem 14 hee found temple certaine solde ox sheepe doues money changer also sitting 15 hauing made whip small cordes hee cast temple sheepe ox hee powred money money changer ouerthrewe table 16 said vnto solde doues haue away thing hence make father house house merchandize 17 furthermorepsal 68 10 disciple remembred written zeale shyn • house hath eaten vp 12 hee went downe capernaum euangelist passeth ouer vnto newe historie purposed gather together thing worthie remembring three omitte hee setteth downe time done whereof speake rest also doe make recitall reade heere christe diuersitie time doth shewe like fact therefore christe purged temple twise filthy prophane occupying first beginning embassage secondly hee depart worlde vnto father ende wee may vnderstand summe must briefly discusse thynges order stoode ox sheepe doues temple sell sate money changer wanted honest cloke might boast occupying kept profane rather belong vnto holy worship god euerie man might haue readie whiche hee would offer vnto lorde truely commodious godly men haue readinesse manner oblation meanes bee troubled running hyther thyther therefore maruell christe displeased wee must note two reason priestes abuse buying selling vnto gayne owne couetousnesse mocking god bee borne secondly howesoeuer men doe excuse themselues yet soone doe little digresse commaundement god worthie bee reprehended haue neede corrected cause chiefly christe take hande purge temple like hee doth plainely affirme temple god place merchandize heere may question asked hee rather beginne doctrine seemeth troublesome preposterous way set hande redresse faultes time remedie doctrine applied christe respect vnto another thing time nowe come hee went publikely function whiche inioyned hym father meant sort take possessi temple shewe signe diuine authoritie ende men might take better heed vnto doctrine needefull awake drousie sleepie mindes newe vnaccustomed fact temple sanctuarie celestiall doctrine godlinesse seeing would restore puritie doctrine conuenient proue lorde temple moreouer hee coulde meanes restore sacrifice exercise godlinesse vnto theyr spirituall ende taking away abuse therefore whiche hee entrace vnto reformation hee sent father briefe meete iewes shoulde bee stirred vp example wayte strange thing christes handes furthermore conuenient shoulde bee admonished corrupt peruerse worshippe god least shoulde refuse bee reformed brother vncertaine whye brother dyd accompanie vnlesse peraduenture also goe hierusalem well knowne hebrewe tongue doth comprehende vnder worde brother maner kinsman 13 iewes easter therefore went vp greeke woorde worde came euangelist put copulatiue coniunction steede causall worde meaning wordes hee came ende myght keepe passeouer ierusalem purpose double end seeing sonne god subiect lawe sake would shew figure perfect obedience subiection owne person keeping straitly commandementes lawe secondly might doe good multitude hee vsed almost alway opportunitie therefore often saide afterwarde christe came ierusalem vpon feast dayes let reader note hee ende first hee might together rest obserue exercise godlines instituted god secondly might publyshe doctrine greater assembly people 16 make father house euangelistes doe write spake seuerely sharply second casting namely made father house denne theeues necessary thus doe seeing former reprehension fruitlesse nowe warneth plainely doe prophane temple god turning vnto strange v temple called house god god would called vpon peculiarlie would shew power finally appointed spirituall holy rite christe doth affirme hee sonne god may challenge himselfe title authoritie purge temple furthermore christe doeth place render reason fact gather fruite meete wee stande chiefly vppon sentence therefore doth hee cast buyer seller temple ende hee may restore god worship corrupted man fault folly vnto integritie theerof may meanes restore againe holinesse temple vvee knowe temple built ende might bee shadowe thinges liuely shape wherof extant christ therfore end might remaine holy god bee applied vnto spirituall v cause saith lawfull turne market place setteth maximum god institution must alwayes holde keepe therefore shiftes soeuer satan doeth delude v whatsoeuer doeth digresse little commandement god let v knowe wicked fayre colour disceaue withall worship god holpen furthered faithfull thinges readie hande woulde offer god ordeined temple v christe doth passe thing might haue bin obiected contrarie order god set church day like temple said olde temple agreeth well properly congregation church celestiall sanctuarie god vpon earth vvherefore wee must alwayes haue maiestie god eye residēt church defiled pollution sanctitie thereof shall remaine shall nothing committed contrary worde god 17 disciple remembred heere men doe trouble themselues vaine demaunding disciple remembred scripture wherof yet ignorant neither must wee thinke place scripture came mindes then▪ afterwarde taught god consider themselues fact christe meant founde place scripture direction holy ghost truly cause work god doth appeare vnto v doth afterward reueale vnto v purpose tract time fit bridle bridle boldnes withall least wee murmur god time thinges doth approued iudgement vve also taught god doth keepe v doubting wee must paciently wayte time perfect knowledge restraine great hastinesse naturall vnto v god doth deferre full manifestation workes ende may keepe v within boundes modestie meaning therefore word disciple length vnderstande christ enforced zeale house god wherwith inflamed take away profanation vvithout doubt dauid meaneth temple god synecdoche whole worship god whole verse thus zeale thine house hath euen eaten vp rebuke rebuked thee fel vpon mee vvhere second member agreeth first yea nothing el saue plain repitition sum dauid careful reuēge glory god willingly offer head vnto rebuke reprobate cast god yt enflamed great zeale one affection swallowe vppe doth testifie endued feeling bee doubted prefigure person thinges properly agree vnto messias therefore euangelist saith one marke whereby iesus knowen disciple reuenger restorer kingdome god note followed scripture might thinke christ became surely man shall euer knowe manner person christe ende thinges suffered doe serue vnlesse taught guided scripture vvherefore euerie one v shall desire profite knowledge christe shall haue neede meditate diligently continually vpon scripture dauid maketh mention house god vaine intreateth glory god although god sufficient himselfe contended himselfe alone yet wyll haue glory bee set foorth churche vvherein sheweth manifest token loue towarde v knitteth glory togeather saluation vnsoluble knot resteth men frame themselues follow christe seeyng generall doctrine set foorth vnto whole body example head paule teacheth rom 15 3 let v suffer much v lyeth holy temple god meanes defiled yet mean must beware man passe boundes vocation vve must v zealous sonne god lawfull euerie one v take whippe wee may correct vice hand wee haue power neither office enioyned v 18 therefore iewes answered said vnto signe doest thou shew v thou doest thing 19 iesus answered said vnto destroy temple three dayes rayse vp 20 therefore iewes saide temple built sixe fortie yeeres wil • thou set vp three dayes 21 spake temple bodie 22 therefore hee rose againe dead disciple remembred saide vnto beleeued scripture woordes whiche iesus spake 18 vvhat signe doest thou shewe v vvhereas none great multitude none cattell seller none money changer laid hand vpon driue away violently may hereby gather smitten god afraid stood amazed therefore vnlesse altogether blinded myracle euident enough one many one vnarmed valiant men vnknowen man great prince durst venture doe great acte resist seeing farre superiours saue handes fayled • broken yet haue cause aske question euery man make alteration yf thing corrupt displeasant temple truely free al men condemne corruption priuate person set hande take away shall bee accused rashnesse taken vp custome sell temple christe take hand new vnaccustomed thing doe good right require proue hee sent god take vnto maximum grounde lawfull chaunge thyng publike administration without certaine calling commandement god erred woulde allowe calling christe vnlesse shewed myracle neyther thing prophet seruaunts god alwayes vsed shew signes work wonder neyther god binde hymself vnto necessitie therefore wickedly appoynt god law asking signe vvhereas euangelist saith iewes aske question without doubt hee meaneth multitude stoode whole bodye churche shoulde say one two said thus people 19 destroy temple allegoricall kinde speeche christe spake thus darkly set purpose hee thought worthie plaine answere like doth testifie another placemat 13 15 speaketh parable vnto cannot vnderstande secretes kingdome heauen first hee denyeth vnto signe requyred eyther would haue fruitlesse el knewe fit time hee also sometimes graunt something vnto importunate prayer therefore must needes bee great let made refuse doe yet meane season giueth vnderstande power shoulde approued established common myracle least shoulde thereby excuse themselues coulde greater testimonie christe diuine power desired resurrection dead hee doth insinuate figuratiuely doth vouchsafe make flatte promise briefe handeleth vnbeleeuing deserue doth also acquit himselfe contempt yet euident obstinate christe knew well enough affected heere may question bee asked seeing hee dyd manye diuers myracles whye toucheth one place aunsweare concealed myracles resurrection alone sufficient stoppe theyr mouthes withall secondly hee would set power god mocked laughed euen cause hee speake allegorically glorye resurrection thirdly say hee vttered fit matter woordes doth shew hee authoritie power ouer temple seeyng hee able doe muche buylding true temple god although hee applyeth woorde temple vnto circūstance matter yet body christ called temple fitly conueniently euery one body called tabernacle2 cor 3 4 soule doeth dwell therein body christe house diuinitie wee knowe sonne god put vppon nature eternall maiestie god dyd dwell fleshe whiche hee tooke sanctuarie whereas nestorius abuse place might prooue one christe god man may easily refuted hee gathered thus sonne god dwelte fleshe temple therefore two diuers nature one coulde case bee god man argument may bee applyed vnto men shall followe hee one man whose soule dwelleth bodye tabernacle therefore phrase foolishly wrested take away vnitie person christe 〈2 page missing〉 iudgement must stande moreouer faith onely depend vpon myracles yet taken roote gospel could neither stedfast stable▪ childrē god indeed holpē miracle may come faith yet truely beleeue whē maruel power god yt beleeue simply doctrine true submit thēselues througly vnto therefore whereas mention made generally faith let v know certaine faith onely apprehended minde doth afterward easily vanish away fastened hearteiam 2 17 26 iames calleth dead faith true faith doth alwayes rest vpon spirite regeneration note workes god alike fruitefull men • bring som vnto god strike othersom blind motion doe mark power god yet cease wander cogitation 24 iesus commit vvhereas certaine doe expound christe take heede knew honest faithfull seeme mee expresse euangelist meaning sufficiently also whiche augustine bringeth concerning bee instructed principle religion farre vnconuenient rather iudgement meaning euangelist christe account true disciple contemned friuolous light person vve must diligently note place yt professe christe accounted sight must also adde reason followeth immediately knew men nothing dangerous hypocrisie cause vice common almost man doth like himselfe while wee deceiue selues vaine flatterings thinke god eye doe dasle aswell heere ta • ght great difference betwene iudgement seeth cleerely thing escape v considereth thinges hidden fountaine innermost affection hearte whiche blinde eye false glistering brightnesse salomen saith god doth weigh ballance heartes men doe flatter themselues wayes therefore let v remember onely true disciple christepro 21 2 alloweth alone • ittest iudge arbitrator case nowe question asked whether euangelist saith christ knewe men hee meaneth spake late appertaineth vnto mankinde doe extend vnto mankinde thinke place whole worlde condemned wicked vnfaithfull dissimulation truely true saying nothing bee founde men christe vouchsafe number amongst see doth agree text therefore doe restraine vnto mentioned might doubt arise christ came knowledge euangelist preuenting question answereth christe well knowe thinges knew mē might good • ight decerne betweene men christe therefore knoweth heart neede one tell teache manner person knew nature affection mind might worthily account aliants vvhereas doe aske question whether wee may suspect haue shewed v token honestie christe nothing appertinent vnto present place estate farre vnlike christe knewe rootes tree wee doe onely knowe frutes appeare nature euerye tree furthermore seeing loue paule doth testifie suspitious lawefull v haue sinister suspition men whome wee know without cause least alwayes deceiued hypocrites1 cor 13 4 least church bee muche laide open wicked deceites subtiltie vnto v person nicodemus fraile brittle faith men beeing mooued myracles sodaine beleeue christe man seeing order pharisee ruler nation shoulde haue farre exceeded others common sort reigneth concerning corrupt nature man whiche right entrance schoole christe beginning wee must bee framed profite goe forwarde celestiall doctrine summe sermon christ made namly must become newe men sobeit wee bee christes true disciple goe wee must note circumstance euāgelist reckoneth vp place let hynder nicodemus submitting himselfe wholy vnto christe pharisee title honour nicodemus amongest owne companie euangelist doeth giue hym title honour sake rather noteth let hinderance kept comming christe freely willingly vvhereby taught excellent worlde part intangled wicked snare yea see many fast tyed whole life doe little desire come vnto heauen vve haue el taught cause called pharisee boast bragge sole interpreter lawe vnderstād marrow hidden meaning scripture cause called selues pherussim although austere kind life purchase vnto essene fame report holines yet dissent common life custome men eremite therefore sect pharisee greater estimation furthermore euangelist doth say nicodemus order pharisee one chiefe nation 2 hee came vnto iesus night came night wee doe thereby gather fearefull eye yet blynded owne gorgeousnesse peraduenture shame also hinder ambitious men doe thinke fame quite gone descend seate mastership order learner neither doubted hee puffed vp foolish opinion knowledge finally seeing made great accounte himselfe woulde loose one inche height yet hee bringeth foorth seede godlinesse hearing great prophete god appeared doth contemne neglecte doctrine came heauen somewhat desirous heare desire came feare reuerence god friuolous curiositie doth moue many enquire new thing greedilie questionlesse religion feeling conscience enforce nicodemus desire knowe doctrine christe familiarly although laid hid long time though beene dead yet soone christ dead brought foorth fruite man wold euer haue hoped rabbi wee knowe wordes import much hee shoulde haue saide master wee knowe thou art come master teacher muche learned men commonly called master nicodemus saluting christe former place according common custome doth call common name afterward affirmeth sent god teacher vpon principle dependeth authorie teacher church seeing wee must wise worde god must heare none saue whose mouth god speaketh vvee must also note although religion much corrupted almost quite abolished amongst iewees yet maximum still remaine lawfull teacher came god none doe proudly carelesly bragge title god false prophetes haue heere neede discretion whereby spirites may tryed therfore nicodemus addeth doth manifestly appeare christe sent god god doth mightilie bewray power denied god present taketh thing men doe confesse god wont worke minister alone mean may seale confirme function whereunto hath called vaine seeing lorde would alwayes haue myracles seales doctrine moreouer doth well maketh god authour myracles saith none doe signes vnlesse god much shoulde affirme done man power god reigneth doth manifestly appeare briefe seeing double fruite myracles one make preparation vnto faith secondly doe better confirm beeing conceiued worde god nicodemus profited well former part learneth myracles christe true prophete god yet seemeth scarce firme enough seeing prophetes otherwise delude vnskilful deceit true myracles proue themselues bee minister god difference shall betweene truth lying faith doe depend vpon myracles yea moses doth flatly affirme wee tryed meanes whether loue god vve doe also well knowe admonition peter paule faithfull beware lying signes wherewith antichriste shall blinde eye many answer commeth passe iust permission god may bee deceiued subtiltie satan worthiedeu 13 3 say hinderance vnto godlymat 24 24 power god may appeare vnto elect miracles2 2 9 may vnto approbation true sounde doctrine paule doth reioyce apostleship begetting doe change v sentence generall whiche comprehendeth mankinde christ said thus vnto one fewe cannot come heauen vnlesse first borne againe might coniecture speaketh certaine person speaketh followeth nothing v whiche corrupt bee necessary whole euery part renued must needes followe corruption spread abrode euery concerning matter wee speake shortly erasmus following cyrillus iudgement doe confesse sense necessary hope saluation falsly included vnder signe concerning place meanes bee persuaded thinke christe speaketh baptisme beene due time wee must alwayes marke intent purpose another body borne renued minde heart grace spirite therefore hee putteth spirite water one thing neyther ought seeme hearde racked vsuall maner speakyng scripture mention made spirite adde woorde water fire expresse force thereof haue sometimes christe baptiseth holy spirite fire fire meant nothing el spirite doth onely shewe doth worke v whereas doth heere put water first skilleth much yea christe meaning thereof carnall borne forasmuch come abrode worlde mortall men nature sauoureth nothing el flesh doth heere make plaine distinction betweene nature supernaturall gift whereas mankinde corrupt person adam alone commeth much begetting ordinance god like hee decked v one man spoyled v giftes therefore euerye one v doeth much drawe vice corruption parent corrupted together adam alone soone hee fallen away god take away giuen man nature also ariseth another question certaine remaine giftes god degenerate corrupt nature whereupon followeth wee altogether wicked vvee may easily answere giftes lorde hath left v fall considered themselues worthie prayse seeing infection euill doth infect part shall sincere thing founde v voyd al corruption vvhereas haue knowledge god frō proper al seruants god doe onely deliuer doctrine sure certaine god doth sende bable thinges knowe doubtfull matter frameth schoole may teache others thinges themselues haue learned furthermore christe setteth forth vnto v title certaintie doctrine prescribeth vnto minister rule modestie doe thrust owne dreames coniectures doe set abroche men inuentions wherein soundnesse let beare faithfull true witnesse god let euery man therefore take heede reuealed vnto god least man passe bound faith finally let man speake thing hath heard lord furthermore must note christ doth place confirme doctrine oath may greater authoritie v yee receiue testimonie added ende gospel may loose iote credite vnthākfulnesse men truth god beleeued fewe reiected euery worlde deliuered contempt let therfore maiestie thereof bee lesse regarded whole worlde almoste doth proudly despice doth obscure impietie although meaning wordes simple one yet may gather double doctrine place first doe set light gospel haue disciple vpon earth christ say although receiue doctrine neuertheles remaineth certaine sure incredulitie men shall neuer bring passe god shall continue true euer shall escape scotfree day doe discredit gospel seeing holy veritie god vve must bee armed shielde may goe forward obedience gospel stubbornnesse men vve must holde ground faith grounded god seeing wee haue god authour though extolled aboue heauens must rather careleslie treade vnderfoote behold farre whole worlde infidelitie certaine shoulde trouble v vvhereas christ complaineth testimonie receiued gather therby fatal thing word god throughout al age beleeued fewe wordes yee receiue doe belong vnto greater number almost vnto whole body people vvherfore cause small number godly faithfull shoulde discourage v 12 haue tolde earthly thinges christ concludeth bee imputed nicodemus like doe profite doctrine gospel saith selfe sufficient apt instruct men seeing descendeth vnto earth may lift v vp heauen auncient vice men desire taught subtillie wittily hereby commeth passe many men doe greatly delight deepe hidden speculation hereby commeth passe men doe lesse esteeme gospell cannot finde therein loftie speech fill eares therefore vouchsafe occupie thēselues studie common base doctrine intollerable wickednesse doe giue lesse honour vnto god speaketh cause doth abase himselfe vnto rudenesse therefore whereas god doeth speak vnto v grosly common stile scripture let v know doth sake vvhosoeuer doth boast offended humilitie maketh cloake couer vnwillingnesse submit himselfe vnto worde god lyeth
