proper one nature bee translated vnto wee neede seeke aunswere therefore christe heauen hath put flesh stretching foorth brotherly hand may carry v vp heauen 14 moses doth plainely declare ende hee reuelation common vnto men faith hath sight beholding wherewith shee may see christe hee present like paul saithgal 3 1 plainly depainted crosse hee truly preached vnproper farre fet similitude bodily food appointed vnto present vse yet paul doth also testifie spirituall mysterie place also serpent kept vntill suche time superstition people turned idoll induce thinke concerning brasen serpent man thinke otherwise doe contend 16 god christ openeth first cause fountaine saluation least doubt remaine mindes haue quiet resting place vntill time come vnto ye free loue god therfore like cā seek whole matter saluatiō el saue christ must mark whēce christe came vnto v offered vnto v sauiour thing plainly deliuered vnto v place namely yt faith christ doth giue life vnto al mē christ brought life vnto v heauēly father wil haue mākind whō loueth perish must marke order diligently originall saluation handeled wicked ambition ingrafted nature straightway creepeth mindes diuelish imagination concerning owne merites therefore feigne god mercifull vnto v cause hee iudged v bee worthie bee regarded scripture doth euery extoll meere simple mercy may abolish merites sole meaning christe wordes hee setteth downe cause god loue wee goe higher spirite locketh gate mouth pauleeph 1 5 teaching loue grounded purpose truly manifest christe said thus ende hee might drawe men respecting themselues vnto mercie god saith plainely god moued deliuer v marke something v worthie great benefite assigneth glory deliuerance wholy vnto loue doth better appeare text saith sonne giuen vnto men may perish vvherupon followeth vntill time christ doth vouchsafe helpe v beeing lost appointed vnto eternall destruction paule also sheweth circumstance time namely loued whenas yet enemy sinnero 5 10 surely sin doth reigne shall finde nothing wrath god bringeth death therfore mercy alone reconcileth v vnto god may also restore v life yet kinde speech seemeth contrarie manye place scripture whiche doe laye firste foundation god loue toward v christe without shew god doth hate v must remēber said secrete loue wherewith god imbraced v floweth eternall purpose aboue cause grace wil haue shewed vnto v whereby lifted vp vnto hope saluation doth begin reconciliation gotten christ seeing must needes hateth sin shal persuaded loueth v vntill suche time sinnes purged respect whereof worthily angrie v blood christ must come betweene reconcile v vnto god time feele fatherly good wil wee heare former place god giue sonne die v loued v foloweth straightway christ alone ought properly fixe faith hath giuen begotten sonne whosoeuer shall beleeue may perish say ye right beholding faith set christ may beholde breast god powred loue firme sounde shoare leane vnto death christ pledge worde begotten hath great force set foorth vnto v vehemency god loue toward v men easily persuaded yt god doth loue thē end might take away doubtfulnes hee setteth downe plaine word yt god loue v dearely spared son sake therfore seing god hath declared loue toward v sufficiētly whosoeuer cōtented testimonie doth yet doubt doth christ small iniurie one common sorte deliuered vp death rather must thus thinke selues looke howe great account god doth make sonne precious saluation vnto price whereof would haue death onely begotten sonne himselfe bee christe called name good right onely sonne nature doth make v partaker honour adoption ingrafted bodie hee beleeueth may perishe singuler commendation faith deliuereth v eternal destruction meaning plainely expresse although seeme borne vnto death yet certaine deliuerance offered faith christe death doth otherwise hang ouer head whit bee feared added also vniuersall note hee may inuite men generall vnto participation life also hee may cut excuse vnbeleeuers ende tendeth worde worlde hee vsed although shal nothing founde worlde worthie god fauour yet sheweth fauourable vnto whole worlde hee calleth men without exception vnto faith christ nothing el entrance life yet let v remember life promised vnto shall beleeue christe commonly yet faith common vnto men christe lyeth open vnto men yet god doth onely open eye elect may seeke faith furthermore herein appeareth wonderfull effect faith doe thereby receiue christe giuen v father namely may make v heires eternall life deliuered giltinesse eternall death hath purged sinnes sacrifice death least thing hinder god frō taking v child therefore seeing faith doth imbrace christe efficacie death fruit resurrectiō maruell also thereby enioy life christe yet doth appeare sufficiently yet faith doth make v partaker life whether bee christe doth regenerate v spirite righteousnesse god may liue force v whether beeyng purged blood sinnes iudged iust god free pardon truely certaine two alwayes ioyned together intreate place certaintie saluation wee must especially note reason liue cause god doth loue v freely imputing vnto v sinnes therefore sacrifice mentioned name whereby togeather sinnes death curse abolished haue alreadie declared drift two member namely wee may know wee recouer life christe whereof wee depriued selues miserable estate mankinde redemption saluation order 17 sent confirmation sentence next going god sent sonne hyther vnto v vaine came destroy therfore followeth proper office god giue saluation vnto beleeue cause man shoulde doubt carefull howe escape death seeing vnderstande god purpose christe shoulde deliuer v worde worlde repeated againe ende man may thinke excluded bee holde way faith iudge taken place manie place condemne wheras saith yt came cōdēne worlde setteth downe therein proper ende comming neede christe come destroy v vtterly perished therefore must consider thing christ god meant helpe v infinite goodnesse sake might saue v beeing lost often sinnes testifie v often satan doth pricke v forward despayre wee must holde vp buckler god woulde haue v perish euerlastingly hath ordeined sonne bee sauiour worlde whereas christe another place saith came iudgement hee called stone stumblyng whereas hee saide fall many accidentall thing may speake thyng commeth chaunce refuse grace offered worthie finde hym iudge reuenger wicked • ilthie contempt vvhereof appeareth euident token gospel whereas properly power god vnto saluation vnto beleeue vnthankfulnesse many causeth turne destruction2 cor 10 16 paule expresseth verie well boasteth hath readinesse vengeance wherewith hee punishe aduersaries doctrine obedience godly shall bee fulfilled much hee shoulde say gospel appointed chiefly principally vnto faithfull bee vnto saluation afterwarde shall turne destruction vnbeleeuers contemning grace christ rather haue authour death life hee beleeueth condemned vvhereas doth often diligently inculcate point faithfull danger death wee may gather hence howe necessarie certaintie stabilitie hope conscience may continually feare tormented therefore affirmeth againe doth damnation remaine shall beleeue thing expound large first chapter presentence taken place future according custome hebrewe tongue haue faithfull free feare damnation next sentence hee beleeueth c signifieth vnto v remedie whereby man escape death hee shoulde say remaineth nothing death reiect life giuen thē christ seeing life cōsisteth faith alone putteth preterperfectence verbe emphatically might better expresse vnbeleeuers quite vndone must note christ speaketh peculiarly whose impietie shall bewray selfe manifest contempt gospel although true neuer way escape death flie vnto christe yet christ intreateth place preaching gospel spread abrode throughout whole worlde vttereth wordes agaynste doe wickedly malitiously extinguish light god hath kindled 19 iudgement light came worlde men loued darkenes light workes euill 20 euery one doth euill hateth light commeth vnto light least workes bee reproued 21 doth truth commeth light workes may made manifest done god 19 iudgement preuenteth murmuring complainings profane men wont vtter great rigour thinke god dealeth sharpely woulde wishe seemeth harde matter perish beleeue christ therfore least man ascribe damnation vnto christ teacheth bee imputed euery man owne fault reason infidelitie witnesse euill conscience vvhereby appeareth wickednesse vnbeleeuers doeth keepe backe comming christ thinke signe tokē dānation set downe place christ intent purpose tame wickednesse men least accustomed maner turne theyr backes chide god hee handle vniustly whilest doth punish incredulitie eternall death therefore sheweth iudgement iust subiect false slaunders deale frowardly preferre darknesse light doe owne accord flie light offered hatred light doth spring giltie wicked minde shineth many goodly shew holinesse notwithstanding enemy gospel euer appeare holy angel questionlesse hypocrite refuse doctrine christ cause saue loue lurking dennes whereby filthinesse may couered therefore seeing hypocrisie alone doth make god bee displeased men giltie vnlesse blinded pride flatter thē selues vice would ready willing receiue doctrine gospel 20 whosoeuer doth euill meaning hate light cause euill muche lyeth desire couer sinnes whereupon followeth set purpose nourish matter dānation driuing away remedy therfore much deceiued think carried godly zeale rage gospel seeing rather abhor light may freely flatter themselues darknesse 21 doth seemeth spoken vnproperly absurdly vnlesse confesse righteous speake truth regenerate spirite god vvhich thing agreeth perpetuall doctrine scripture wee know faith roote fruit good woorkes doe spring end augustine may resolue doubt hee expoundeth wordes doth truth thus hee acknowledgeth howe miserable destitute power doe well indeede true preparation vnto faith inforced feeling pouertie flie vnto grace god contrarie christe minde meaning simplie affirme deale sincerely doe desire nothing light workes may proued tryed tryall made doth better appeare spake truth god cleane deceite man inferre falsly ignorantly men conscience doe accuse faith commeth christe doth say elect doe beleeue may winne prayse good workes declareth onely infidel woulde doe vnlesse theyr owne conscience accuse furthermore christe vseth worde truth beeing deceiued externall shew workes doe consider lurketh therefore saith perfect men dissembler willingly come foorth sight god onely fit giue iudgement workes workes saide place done god alloweth good according rule hereby wee may learne wee must iudge woorkes vnlesse beholde light gospel reason altogether blinde 22 thinges came iesus disciple land iudea conuersant baptise 23 iohn also baptizing aenon nigh vnto salim muche water therefore came baptised 24 iohn yet cast prison 25 therefore arose question betweene disciple iohn iewes concerning purging 26 came vnto iohn said vnto rabbi thee beyond • rdan whome thou bearest witnesse beholde baptiseth men come vnto 27 iohn answered saide man cannot receiue thing vnlesse bee giuen heauen 28 selues witness mee saide christe 〈◊〉 sent 22 thinges iesus came likely soone feast day past christ came part iurie nigh citie aenon placed tribe manaffes euangelist saith much water whereof store iurie cosmographer doe write two city aen • n salim farre meeting iordan iabec nigh whereunto place scythopolis wordes may gather christ iohn baptize put al body water although wee neede stande much externall ryte agree spirituall veritie institution rule lord forasmuch cā coniecture nighnes place cause many rumor spread abroade much talke concerning worship god lawe estate church two new baptizers risen together whereas euangelist saith christe baptized referre vnto first beginning began publikely execute function inioyned father although disciple yet named place authour baptisme omitting minister nothing name commandement concerning whiche thyng speake somwhat beginning next chapter 25 therefore arose question c vaine euangelist saith place yt arose question amongst disciple iohn lesse instructed doctrine boldly doe offer themselues dispute ignorance alwayes blinde others set vpon might haue excused vnfit enter combate doe owne accorde prouoke iewes deale therin rashly wickedly wordes import thus much moued question besides offend reasoning rashly farther skill woulde reache matter knewe great fault much intend defende lawefull vse baptisme defende master cause authoritie might remaine safe sounde thinges worthie reprehended knowing true maner baptisme doe set sacred institution god laughed peruerse ambition take master part christe therefore appeareth combe cut one woorde obiected christe also baptize occupied person man lesse regard doctrine vvee taught example ende come driuen rather wicked affection beare towarde men reale god therefore admonished one thing respected meanes regarded christe alone chiefe concerning purging question purging iewes diuers kindes washinges appointed lawe contented appointed lawe moreouer obserue many diligently receiued elder vvhereas christe iohn doe bring new rite maner washing plentie varietie count absurd thing 26 thou barest witnesse argument goe eyther make christe inferiour iohn make bound iohn receiued honour account benefite adorne christ honourable title though duetie thus prayse yea principall dignitie sonne god cryer therefore meete shoulde preferre iohn christ commended testimonie vvhereas say men come vnto wordes proceed peruers emulation afraid least master forsaken multitude 27 man cannot doe referre vnto christ accuse disciple wicked holdnesse god goe aboute take christe father giuen therefore haue meaning came god preferred short space vnto great honour therefore vaine doe striue put downe god hath exalted hande othersome doe think exclamation whereinto hee bursteth indignation disciple little profited truly thing absurd goe make one common sort make inferiour vnto minister whome heard often christ therefore iohn might well enough say lost labour teach men deafe dull vntill time renued minde rather opinion expound iohn namely hee saith owne hande make great measure v god would haue v sonne god himselfe take honour man common sort dare desire giuen lord cogitation deeply rooted mindes men sufficient bridle ambition furthermore ambition corrected abolished plague contention shoulde also taken away commeth passe euery man exalteth himselfe meet saue depend vpon god may contented degree assigneth vnto v 28 witness iohn chideth disciple beleeued wordes hee oftentimes tolde christ therefore remained nothing seruant subiect son god ye rest must note place denying christe leaueth nothing vnto subiect vnto head minister another church extolled obscure honour head saith hee sent prepare way christe kinges apparitors wont doe 29 hee hath bride bridegrome friend bridegrome whiche standeth heareth reioyceth ioy voyce bridegrome therefore ioy full 30 hee must encrease must deminished 31 commeth aboue aboue earth earth speaketh earth commeth heauen aboue 32 hath seene heard doth testifie man receiueth testimonierom 3 4 33 hath receiued testimonie hath set scale god true 34 god sent speaketh wordes god god giueth spirit measure 29 hee hath bryde similitude hee better confirmeth christ alone exempted common sort men marryeth doth therefore bid friend vnto mariage may make bride common vnto thē departing right hee may admit bee partner marriage bed rather mariage honourablie reuerēced may made holy christ doth call minister vnto function teaching haue brought churche vnder may vsurpe themselues gouernment may vse faithfull diligence associate vnto himselfe great excellent thing men bee set ouer church may present person sonne god therefore friend sonne god adioyneth vnto himselfe may celebrate marriage together must marke difference mindeful degree doe take themselues proper bridegrome summe much soeuer teacher doe excell yet must hinderaunce vnto christe hee must chiefe alone must rule churche must gouerne worde similitude oftentimes vsed scripture lorde set foorth vnto v holy bonde adoption wherewith ioyneth v vnto selfe offereth himselfe truly v enioyed v may good right doth hee require handes faith mutuall loue wife oweth husband furthermore marryage fulfilled christe respect whose flesh bone areeph 5 29 paule teacheth chastitie hee requyreth consisteth chiefly obeying gospel wee suffer selues meanes carried away pure simplicitie therof paule doth teach 2 cor 11 2 therefore must subiect christ alone must head wee must go aside hayres bredth plaine doctrine gospel alone hath principalitie glory may retaine right place bridegrome vvhat doe minister truly sonne god calleth may serue wayte vppon celebration holy mariage vvherefore part mean endeuour present bride put trust pure virgin vnto husband vvhich thing paule boasteth hee doth place afore cited winne church rather thēselues thē christe doe vnfaithfully violate wedlock adorne greater honour christe doth vouchsafe bestow vpon v whilest committeth custodie bride vnto v much wicked infidelitie vnlesse indeuour reserue title right wholy vnto himselfe therefore ioy fulfilled meaning hath obtained summe petition remaineth nothing el desire seeth christe reigne heard according deserueth vvhosoeuer shall thus affected setting apart respect himselfe extolleth christ contented honour shall gouerne churche faithfully fruitfully whosoeuer shal misse marke little shalbe filthie adulterer neyther shall able thing el corrupt bride christe 30 hee must encrease hee goeth farther whereas extolled vnto high dignitie lorde hee saith temporall nowe must beleeue sunne righteousnesse risen therefore doth onely driue away shake vaine smoke honour rashly heaped vppon errour men also circumspect true honour whiche lord bestowed vppon doe darken brightnesse christe cause saith hath hitherto accounted great prophete placed high degree time vntyll christe shoulde come deliuer vp light meane season doth testifie suffer contented minde himselfe bee brought naught christe may replenishe whole worlde beames pastours church must follow desire iohn • oupe downe head shoulder lift vp christe 31 hee commeth fr • aboue hee sheweth another similitude much christe differeth rest▪ howe farre excelleth compareth king chiefe captaine speaking high tribunall iudgement seate hearde reuerence gouernment teacheth sufficient speake lowe settle saith christ came aboue onely god appeareth nothyng heauenly full maiestie seconde member common translation hath earth greeke bookes doe agree together reading suspect repetition thought superfluous rased vnlearned men much say hee earth smelleth beginning according estate nature abideth earthly order therefore hee affirmeth proper christe alone speake high came downe heauen heere may question asked whether iohn came also heauen touching calling function therefore lorde hearde speaking mouth hee seemeth doe iniurie heauenly doctrine deliuereth answere spoken simply way comparison minister considered apart speake heauen great authoritie god commaundeth soone begin set christe must body longer apostle vnto hebrewes 12 25 comparing law gospell together saith seeing escaped free despised spake vpon earth take heede yee despise heauen therefore christe acknowledged minister hee remayne lorde alone contented degree seruaunts especially matter commeth comparison distinguished may chiefe 32 hee heard saw iohn goeth forward office ende may make readie disciple christe hee commendeth doctrine certaintie thereof vttereth nothing receiued father seeing hearing set manner doubtfull opinion vaine rumor manner inuentions giueth vnderstande taught nothing knewe well man say deserueth small credite hath nothing hath hearde aunswere meaneth worde christe taught father bringeth nothing diuine reuealed vnto god agreeth person christe forasmuch sent worlde father interpreter embassadour afterwarde hee reprehendeth vnthankefulnes worlde refused certaine faithfull witnesse wickedly haynously also hee remoueth stumblyng blocke might turne away many frō faith hinder course many wont muche depende vppon iudgement men many esteeme gospel according contempt world least whē see euery reiected preuented preiudice loth slow beleeue therefore often see waywardnes worlde yet let admonition kepe v constant obedience truth came god vvhen hee saith man receiueth meaning almost none faithfull compared vnto huge multitude wicked 33 hee receiued testimonie▪ heere exhorteth incourageth godly imbrace doctrine gospel without feare shoulde say cause bee ashamed smalenesse number sithence haue god authour faith alone aboundantly sufficient v like vnto therefore although whole worlde doth discredit gospel yet ought keepe backe godly subscribing vnto god haue also wherin may quiet pacifie thēselues know beleeue gospell nothing el subscribe vnto oracle god meane gather propertie faith leane vnto god established word subscription vnlesse god doe speake first doctrine faith distinguished frō man inuentions also vncertaine doubtfull opinion must answereable vnto truth god exempted doubting therefore god cannot lye absurd thing faith wauer armed defence shall continue victorers continually engins soeuer satan goe trouble shake v place also taught howe acceptable sacrifice faith god maketh account truth cannot greater worship whilest faith professe true doe giue due honour men cannot greater iniurie doe beleeue gospell hee cannot spoyled truth glory maiestie must abolished truth sort shut vp gospel hee haue knowen vvherefore vnbeleeuers leaue nothing god much lyeth impietie doth whit impayre credit god much lyeth reproue accuse vanitie vnlesse stony excellent title wherewith faith adorned ought kindle mindes feruent desire great honour whereunto god doth vouchsafe extol miserable wretch nature nothing el lying vanitie accounted meete approoue subscription holy trueth god 34 god sent hee confirmeth sentence next going sheweth haue truly deale god receiue doctrine christe christe came none saue heauenly father therefore god alone speaketh truly giue lesse honour vnto doctrine christ thē ought doubt acknowledge diuine measure place expounded two maner wayes doe extende vnto common dispensation god fountaine good thinges neuer drawen drie emptied powreth gift vpon men aboundantly take water vessell distribute doe length come vnto bottome need feare thing god aboundance giftes shall neuer large exceede whensoeuer newe liberalitie exposition seemeth haue colour sentence indefinite yet rather follow augustine doth interprete bee spoken christe neither ought let yet mention made christ member seeing last member doth take away doubtfulnesse restrained vnto christ might seeme spoken generally manie without doubt wordes added expositiuely father hath giuen sonne thing hand loueth therefore read one text worde presentence doth signifie continuall act although endowed spirite according chiefest perfection yet notwithstanding floweth continually fountaine farre wide hee therefore vnfitly saide euen also receiue father man rather expound simplie alteration tence straunge verbes sense manifest spirite giuen christe measure facultie store grace wherein excelleth limitted measure paul teacheth 1 cor 12 7 eph 4 7 spirite giuen euery man according measure giuing none aboundeth vnto full seeing mutuall bonde brotherly participation man sufficient himselfe apart one haue need another christ differeth v father hath powred vpon infinite aboundance spirite truly spirit must remaine without measure may receiue fulnesse said first chap ende tendeth followeth immediately father hath giuen thing hand iohn doth onely woordes shew foorth excellencie christe also ende vse plentie wherewith endowed namely appointed arbitratour father may distribute vnto men seemeth good vnto expedient paul doth declare large 4 chap vnto ephesian cited late therfore much soeuer god doth inrich child diuersly proper christ alone haue thinges hand 35 father loueth sonne hath giuen thing hand 36 hee beleeueth sonne hath eternall life hee beleeueth sonne shall see life wrath god abideth vpon 35 father loueth sonne meaneth reason doth hate men vve may easily answere intreateth common loue wherewith god loueth men hath created workes singuler particuler loue beginning sonne doth flow vnto creature loue wherewith embrasing sonne embraceth v also doth cause impart vnto v good thing hand 36 hee beleeueth sonne added may knowe must aske good thinges christ also vnderstād know maner enioy furthermore teacheth enioying consisteth faith without cause forasmuche wee possesse thereby christe bringeth righteousnesse life fruite righteousnes whereas faith christ called cause life wee doe thereby gather life contained christe alone made partaker thereof grace christe men doe agree concerning point life christ cōmeth vnto v som men vnderstand thus beleeuing receiue spirit doth regenerate v vnto righteousnesse doe obtaine saluation kinde regeneration although confesse true wee renued faith spirite god may rule v yet say free remission sinnes first formost considered whereby made acceptable vnto god also say hope saluation grounded doth consist alone righteousnesse meanes imputed vnto v god saue whilest doth impute vnto v sinnes beleeueth set v life christ sweetnesse thereof might allure v condemneth vnto eternall death whosoeuer doe beleeue christ meanes doth amplifie benefite god telleth v way escape death saue deliuerance haue christ sentence dependeth hereupon al lost adā office christ saue lost worthily abide death refuse saluation offered vve said late doth properly appertaine vnto doe reiect gospel reuealed vnto although mankinde bee wrapped destruction yet remaineth heauier double vengeance refuse christe deliuerer doubtlesse intent baptist denouncing death vnbeleeuers prick v forwarde vnto faith christ furthermore manifest righteousnesse whiche worlde doth thinke hath▪ without christe condemned brought nought woordes neither cause man obiect vniust dealing otherwise godly holy perish cause beleeue vain holines feigned men besides giuen christe hee putteth phrase see life steede enioy life ende hee may better declare remayneth hope v vnlesse wee bee deliuered christe hee saith wrath god abideth vpon vnbeleeuers although augustine doth teach doth much displease vsed word abide may knowe wee appointed vnto death euen mother wombe wee borne child wrath least doe willingly admit suche kinde allusion holde true plaine meaninge haue set downe death doth lie vpon vnbeleeuers doth keepe downe neuer escape truly althogh wicked reprobate cōdēned naturally yet bring vpon themselues another death infidelitie ende power giuen minister gospel binde iust vengeance besalleth man stubbornnesse shoulde binde themselues bondes death shake wholesome yoke god chap 4 1 therefore lorde knewe pharisee heard iesus make baptise disciple iohn 2 although iesus himselfe baptise disciple 3 left iudea went againe galilee 4 must needes goe samaria 5 therefore came citie samaria called sichar nigh field iacob gaue sonne ioseph 6 vvell iacob iesus wearie iourney sit downe thus vpon vvell much almost sixt houre 7 came woman samaria drawe water iesus saith vnto giue mee drinke 8 disciple gon away citie buie meate 9 woman samaria saith vnto howe thou seeing thou art iews doest aske water mee samaritane iews meddle samaritanes 1 therefore hee knewe euangelist intreat conference betwene christ samaritane doth first set downe cause iourney seeing knewe pharisee euill affected would put himselfe danger furie time cause departed iudea giueth v vnderstand christ came set purpose samaria might dwell went galilee must needes go meet requisite occupied gathering togeather sheepe israel vntil time open gate gospel resurrection therefore whereas vouchsafed impart doctrine vnto samaritanes extraordinarie thing may speake thing came chaunce goe aside galilee woulde knowne thing wyshed answere knew doe hee vse opportunitie time misse let slip one minute therefore would finish course order moderation became wher also taught must frame mindes terrified feare goe forward dutie rashe pull downe danger vpon owne head furthermore shall keepe meane becommeth whosoeuer shall diligent vocation shall follow lorde euen middest death shall cast away themselues rashly shall walke wayes therfore let v remember must goe vocation doth requyre euangelist saith pharisee christ enemy scribe friendes sect time reigne rage vnder pretence godly zeale question whether enuie christ hauing mo disciple bent towarde iohn studie maintaine dignitie fame wordes carry another meaning whereas greeued iohn gather disciple vnto ne • le mindes saw came vnto christe vnto iohn iohn professed nothing el cryer son god began greater resort vnto christ well finished function resigne vp christ little little office teaching baptising 2 although iesus himselfe baptise called christ baptisme handes wee may knowe baptisme esteemed according person minister whole force thereof dependeth vpon authour whose name whose commandement bestowed vvhence gather singuler consolation whilest doe know baptisme lesse force wash renue v sonne god giuen v doubtlesse set purpose abstaine externall administration signe whilest conuersant world might make knowen vnto al age baptisme doth loose whit force whilest ministred mortall man briefe christ doth baptise v inwardly spirite must make like account signe selfe wee receiue handes mortall man christe himselfe reaching hande heauen stretch vnto v baptisme christe giuen mortall man manner person soeuer minister shall cease bee christes sufficient refute anabaptistes affirme baptisme corrupted vice minister dotings sake trouble church like augustine vsed argument fitly donatist 3 vvhich called sichar hierome epitaph paula doth thinke corruptly read thus whereas rather read sichem truly manifest latter auncient true name likely word sichar vse euangelist time vve agree concerning place citie situated side mountaine gari • inhabitant whereof murdered traiterously simeon leui ge 34 29 abimelech inhabitaunt thereof borne afterwarde make leuell wt ground commoditie place great citie built thirde timeiudg 9 45 hieroms time called neapolis euangelist putteth matter doubt adding many circumstance appeareth moses gen 48 22 io 24 32 fielde iacob gaue sonnes ioseph also men graunt mountaine garizin nigh vnto sichem vve declare anon temple builte moreouer questionlesse iacob familie dwelt long time forasmuch also buie possession contrary custome father might dwell quietly 6 iesus wearie iourney feigne wearie wearie indeed end might bent take pitie vpon v sory v tooke vpon infirmity apostle teacheth hebrewes 4 15 hereunto appertaineth circumstance time maruell werie thirstie hee rested selfe vvell mid time day seeing day rising sun vntil going downe thereof twelue houres long sixt houre noone vvhē saith sate thus hee doeth expresse gesture weary man 7 giue drinke asked water woman doth simplie cause may haue matter teach thirst enforce desire drinke could hinder vsing opportunitie teache gotten hee preferreth woman saluation owne necessitie therefore forgetting thirst though leasure opportunitie talke end may instruct true godlines passeth cunningly visible water vnto spirituall water watereth minde heauenly doctrine denied giue water 9 thou seeing thou art iewe exprobration wher requiteth common contempt nation well knowne samaritanes raskall kind people gathered togeather aliants iewes good cause hate corrupted worship god retaine many peruerse corrupt rite yet notwithstanding questionles iewes part cloake carnall hatred zeale lawe ambition enuie great force many greeue countrie appointed possessed samaritanes worship god violated notwithstanding iust cause disagreement sobeit affection beene rightly framed therefore christ sendeth disciple preach gospell first forhiddeth turne aside vnto samaritanes mat 10 5 woman doth whiche ingrafted almost men desirous haue account made v hardly suffer selues despised common disease nature euerie man woulde haue vice please men man doe reproue v finde fault vice angrie one wel another let euery man examine himselfe shall finde seede pride minde vntill time shall bee rooted spirite god therefore woman knewe superstition nation condemned amongest iewes doth deride person christ vvhereas followeth iewes dealing samaritanes thinke woman said think euangelist doth put way exposition truly skilleth much whether sense chuse thinkes agreeth well woman doth floute christ sort vvhat lawfull thee aske drink seeing account v profane man rather expound otherwise contend may iewes abhorre samaritanes haue said abused false colour zeale easie matter thē passe measure befalleth commonly suffer themselues led wicked affection 10 iesus answered said vnto thou diddest know gift god saith vnto thee giue drinke thou wouldest haue asked shoulde haue giuen thee liuely water 11 woman saith vnto syr thou hast neither thing draw withall vvell deepe whence hast thou liuely water 12 art thou greater father iacob gaue v vvell hee himselfe dra • nke thereof sonnes flockes 13 iesus answered said vnto euery one drinketh water shal shirst againe 14 shall drinke water shall giue hee shall bee thirst againe euer water shall giue shalbe made well water leaping eternall life 15 woman saith vnto syr giue water may thirst may come hither draw 10 iesus answered christe hauing taken occasion beginneth preach grace power spirite simple woman altogether vnworthie haue talke certainely wonderfull example goodnesse wretched woman harlot sodainly made disciple christ sonne god although hee shewed like token mercie v woman truly whore men distained haynous offence excellencie v bring foorth haue vouchsafed bestowe vpon v heauenly doctrine honour adoption neither came passe chaunce talked suche person lorde doth shewe vnto v vnder tipe doth chose worthinesse doth impart doctrine saluation truely seemeth bee wonderfull purpose first fight passe ouer many great men iurie meane season talke familiarly woman requisite person expressed true saying prophet isay 65 1 found sought haue openly appeared vnto asked mee said vnto enquired behold thou diddest knowe gift god doe reede two member thou diddest know gift god talketh thee distinctly latter interpretation former singuler benefite god haue christ present brought euerlasting life sense shalbe plaine steede copulatiue coniunction put expositiue particle thou diddest knowe gift god namely talketh thee wordes wee taught doe knowe christe wee vnderstand father hath giuen v good thinges hee himselfe offered vnto v knowledge beginneth feeling owne pouertie man must first touched malady hee seeke remedie therefore lord inuiteth drunken dry full hungrie may eate drinke ende shoulde christe sent vnto v fulnesse spirite vnlesse emptie hath profited much feeling want doth nowe acknowledge great need hath another man helpe enough grone vnder misery vnlesse hope readie helpe added thereunto meanes shoulde doe nothing el pine away sorrowe rather whiche thing befalleth papistes kill selues vnprofitable superfluous wearisomnesse running hyther thyther sone wee see christe doe wander vaine seek remedie none founde go straightway vnto therefore true profitable knowledge grace god knowe offered vnto v christe reached vnto v hande christe doeth also tel v effectuall knowledge good thinges doeth pricke v forwarde desire doth inflame mindes thou diddest knowe saith hee thou wouldest haue asked furthermore drift wordes nothing obscure intent sharpen woman desire least lightly reiect life offered hee haue giuen thee liuely water word christ doth testifie petition directed vnto shall void truly without hope desire aske shoulde waxe colde seeing christe doth preuent come vp ready satisfie remaineth longer place sluggishnesse lingering one woulde thynke spoken v al vnlesse euery man vnbeliefe hinder although translated word water vnto spirite according thing present yet metaphore vsuall enough scripture hath good reason drie barren ground ioyce sappe v vntill time lorde doth water v spirite spirite called el pure water another sense namely wipeth away purgeth blottes filth whereof full like place secret quickening whereby restoreth v life defendeth finisheth spoken expounde doctrine gospell whereunto confesse name doth agree doe thinke christ doth vnder comprehende whole grace renouation know sent ende hee might bring newe life therefore iudgement meaning set water want good thinges wherewith mankind oppressed troubled furthermore doth onely call liuing water effect quickening water alludeth also vnto diuers sortes water therfore called liuely floweth liuing fountaine 11 syr thou neither hast thing draw samaritanes despiced iewes despice againe therefore woman doth first set light christe consequently doeth flout shee knew well enough christe doth speake figuratiuely requiteth contrary figure say promiseth able perfourme secondly shee accuseth arrogancie preferreth himselfe holy patriarche iacob iacob saith contented well owne vse vse familie hast thou better water doth sufficiently appeare corrupt comparison euen setteth seruant master dead man liuing god yet many doe day fall vice vvherfore must take good heede doe extoll men person high darken glory god▪ truly gift god reuerently reuerenced wheresoeuer appeare therefore meete honour men excell godlinesse indued rare giftes yet farre foorth god doe alwayes surpasse christe gospel may shyne bee seene brightnesse gorgeousnesse worlde muste yeeld vnto vvee must also note samaritanes falsly boaste progenie holy father day papistes whereas bastardes adulterous seede doe proudly bragge father mocke taunt lawfull child god although samaritanes come iacob accoding flesh yet altogether growen kinde alienated true godlinesse beene wrong kinde boasting whereas cuthites originall least gathered together profane gentile yet doe cease falsly pretend vse name holy patriarch ende must needes befall doe wickedly reioyce light men must depriued light god haue fellowship holy father whose title abuse 13 euery one drinketh water small effect soeuer christ doth see doctrine take consequently mocked yet doeth proceede plainely expound hee said hee setteth downe vse water one serueth body time force perpetuall quickening soule body subiect corruption helpes wherewith fostered must fraile britle quickeneth soule must needes bee eternall contrarie woordes christe faithfull inflamed desire plentifull grace euen vnto ende life doth meane wee drinke first day much serue v haue need onely meaning holy spirite fountaine runneth continually neede feare shall wyther away renued spirituall grace therfore although thyrst whole life yet certain haue drunken spirite one day onely short time flowing continually may neuer forsake faile v faithfull thirst whole life vehemently yet meane abounde liuely ioyse howe lyttle grace soeuer haue receiued doth quicken continually neuer altogether drie vvherefore sufficiencie set desire onely drinesse thing plainly expressed word next following shall 〈…〉 containe water leaping vnto eternall life continuall 〈◊〉 signified cherisheth mortall life heauenly eternitie therefore grace christ doth flow vnto v short time doth powre selfe euen vnto blessed immortalitie ceaseth flow vntil vncorruptible life doth begin throughly made perfect giue mee water questionlesse woman doth knowe well enough christ doth speake spirituall water despiseth shee counteth promise good nothing doctrine haue passage long speaketh anthoritie amongest v therefore woman doth interrupt hym way shee shoulde say thou makest great bragges see nothing thou canst doe thing let see indeede 16 iesus saith vnto goe call thy husband come hyther 17 woman answered said vnto haue husband iesus said vnto thou hast said well haue husband 18 thou hast fiue husband thou hast thy husbande saide • thou truly 19 woman saith vnto syr see thou art prophet 20 father worshipped mount yee say ierusalem place men ought worship 21 iesus saith vnto woman beleeue houre commeth whenas neither mountaine neither ierusalem yet shall worship father 16 call thy husband seemeth appertaine nothing vnto matter yea man may thinke christ discouraged abashed frowardnesse woman doth turne talke vnto matter saw floute taunt saide applyed meete medicine vnto ladie striketh woman conscience feeling sinne againe excellent token mercy draweth almost would come willingly haue already touched chiefly noted must bee wounded feeling sin carelesse almost dull make smal account doctrine christ vntyll time cited appeare iudgement seat god compelled feare iudge whome despice sort handeled doubt gainstand doctrine christ ruffianly brabbling may perceiue know shall escape scotfree furthermore great stubbornnesse som neuer giue eare vnto christe til time subdued violence therfore often see oyle christ vnsauerie must mingled vineger may begin haue tast yea haue v need neuer earnestly affected moued whē christ speaketh vnlesse awaked repentance therefore man profite aright schoole christ hardnesse must bee tylled subdued declaration owne miserie plough knowledge onely doth take v daintines may longer bold mocke god therefore time contempt worde god come vpon v fitter remedie euerie man doe stirre vp consider vpon sinnes may wearie himselfe afraid god iudgement may humbled obey whome hee time despise haue husband fruite admonition doth yet appeare whereby meant pricke forward woman minde vnto repentance truly drunken loue selues doth keepe v fast sleepe doth rather make v dull first pricking cannot awake v christ doth also fitly cure slownesse hee presseth sore strongly doth manifestly cast teeth haynous offence although thinke doth heere touche whoredom saith fiue husbandes thought came passe wanton disobedient woman enforced husband diuorced therfore expound word thus whereas god ioyned thee lawful husband thou hast made ende sinning vntill time beeing made infamous diuorcemēts thou didst set forth thy self common strumpet 19 syr see thou art c appeareth fruite reprehension woman doth modestly acknowledge fault prompt readie heare christ doctrine refused requireth craueth ye accord therfore said euen beginning true aptnes taught repentance opening gate enter schoole christ womā teacheth v example teacher offered v must vse opportunitie least vnthankful towarde god doth neuer send prophetes vnto v doth inuite v vnto himselfe reaching hand vnto v must hold paul teacheth sent vnto v god excell facultie teaching rom 10 15 20 father false thinke reprehension troublesome lothsome slid craftily vnto som matter nay rather passeth frō specie vnto genus frō particuler thing vnto generall beeing taught throughly concerning sinne shee wil instructed pure worship god doth shee wel orderly asketh counsell prophet least erre worshipping god like sort inquire god sort wold worshipped nothing peruerse pleasure feigne diuers kind worshippings without word god furthermore know wel enough continuall strife betweene iewes samaritanes cōcerning rule right worshipping althogh cuthites stranger carried samaria whē ten tribe exiled enforced stripe take vppon rite lawe professe worshipped god israel wee reade 2 king 10 27 yet religion lame manye wayes corrupted amongest whiche iewes coulde away contention waxed hot building temple mount garizin manasses sonne iohn chiefe prieste iaddi brother builde time darius last king persian hold iudea hand sanabales gouernour manasses hauing married duke daughter ende hee might whit inferiour brother made himselfe priest allure drawe vnto reward reuoltes hee coulde iosephus writeth eleuenth booke antiquitie accounted solemne thing amongest forsakers true godlinesse defend themselues example father samaritanes may gather woman wordes father saith shee worshipped mount certaine persuaded cause offer sacrifice erected peruerse kinde worship followed stubbornnes readie enough catch al clokes graunt deed yt light person stounge pricked sometimes foolish zeale waspe straightway without iudgement take example haue hearde holy men vice common paynt errours fact father may easily see papistrie place doth notably teach v disorderly men deale setting apart commandement god doe frame themselues according example father must note many wayes worlde wont offend point oftentimes falleth greater sort folow father accoūted father day see yt papist full mouth bable father giue place prophetes apostle haue named fewe worthie honour huddle vp great companie men like themselues el descend vnto corrupt time wherein although grosse barbarisme much gotten vpper hand yet religion doctrine verie much corrupted therefore must diligently note difference none accounted father saue knowe well child god secondly haue deserued degree honour excellencie godlinesse moreouer men doe oftentimes offend establishe common lawe father factes common people doth thinke doe giue due honour vnto father vnlesse exempt number men whilest remember men might erre wee mixe vice vertue hand ouer head whereupon followeth wicked confusion maner liuing seeing men action examined according rule law make ballance subiect weightes finally whereas imitating father much esteemed worlde doth thinke doth offende freely third vice wicked emulation namely neither endowed spirit furnished cōmandemēt take example one father hath done like priuate man shoulde sworde reuenge iniuries brethrenexo 2 12 moses priuate man shoulde punish whoremongersnum 25 8 phinees heereuppon rise fierce cruel furie kill owne child many thynk iewes would like father abraham though precept generalgen 22 2 offer vp thy sonne isaac rather particuler triall one man pride much trust men selues part bringeth foorth emulation whylest men doe arrogate thēselues ought euery man contented owne measure mean season father haue true follower great many ape also shall throughly weigh wisedome writing auncient father confesse greatest part monkery flow fountaine therefore vnlesse erre willingly must alwaies take heede spirite euerie man endowed euery man calling requyreth meete euery one giuen euerie man charge like vnto third vice namely confusion time whilest posteritie occupied example father doe thinke another maner working prescribed lorde vve may thanke ignorance infinite heape ceremony wherewith church ouerwhelmed time poperie immediately beginning church men began offend point foolish folowing iudaisme greater force haue beene iewes sacrifice least christian want pomp inuented rite offer vp christe estate christes church haue euer whit worse shadowes ceased whereby brightnesse christ might darkened madnesse ranne afterwarde raged without measure therefore least erre point must alwayes take heede vnto present rule time past perfume light holy garment altare vessel like rytes please god namely nothing acceptable precious sight obedience christ comming order chaunged therefore must consider appointeth v doe gospel least wee doe rashly follow father obserued vnder law godly keeping holy rytes shoulde day wicked sacrilege deceiued samaritanes consider example iacob difference time lawful patriaks erect altar euery place yet ordained lorde afterward choose god giuen commandement temple shoulde builded mount syon former libertie ceased respect moses said deut 12 8 yee shall doe euery one • seemeth good owne eye ierusalem longer bethel bethauen see state question samaritanes take example father rule iewes grounded commandement god although woman hitherto obserued custome nation yet shee contented therewith vnderstand worship maner worship lawfull pray dayly euerie whereunto sacrifice annexed might publike solemne profession religion 21 beleeue mee woman first part answere doth briefly abolish ceremoniall worship instituted vnder law seeing saith houre hand hath proper peculiar place worshipping giueth v vnderstande tēporal instituted moses time whē wall separation shalbe taken away meanes hee extendeth worship god farther deliuered former straites euen samaritanes may made partaker thereof vvhen hee saith houre doth come putteth presentence insteed future notwithstanding meaning abrogation lawe hand concerning temple priesthood externall rite calling god father seemeth way set father wherof woman made mention hee say god common father men may worshipped euery without difference place country 22 worship know worship know saluation iewes 23 houre commeth true worshipper shall worshippe father spirite truth father requireth haue worship 24 god spirite worship must worship spirite truth 25 woman saith vnto knowe messias shall come called christe therfore shall come hee shall tell v al thinges 26 iesus saith vnto talke thee doth large expound touched briefly concerning abrogating law yet doth deuide sum speech two member former hee condemneth manner worshipping god vsed among samaritanes superstition error doeth testifie iewes worship god wel lawfully addeth cause difference certaintie worship iewes vsed appeare vnto worde god samaritanes certaintie mouth god secondly hee declareth rite iewes kept hytherto shortly haue end 22 worship know sentence worthie remembred wherein taught must assay nothing rashly chaunce religion vnlesse knowledge present doe longer worship god false imagination ghost therfore thunderbolt throwen downe good intent cal know men doe nothing el erre opinion doth rule without word god commandemēt christ taking vpon country cause person doth teache iewes doe much differ samaritanes vvhy commeth saluation saith wordes giueth vnderstand doe exceede one point god concluded couenant eternall saluation restraine vnto christ came iewes truly sithence promise god sure certaine saluation saue doubt christ doth preferre iewes cause doe worship vnknowen power one god reuealed himselfe vnto hath adopted people word saluation must bee vnderstood wholesome manifestation heauenly doctrine doth say rather committed alone might enioy alludeth iudgementesay 2 3 vnto foretold prophet lawe come syon separated time frō people vpon conditiō pure knowledge god might length flowe vnto whole worlde notwithstanding summe god worshipped aright vnlesse worshipped according certaintie faith must need proceede frō worde god wherupon foloweth yt fal away vnto idolatry whosoeuer depart frō worde god christe doth plaine wordes testifie idol vaine fictiō set vp insteed god mē ignorāt true god hee doth cōdemne ignorāce vnto whō god hath reuealed soone destitute light word darknes blindnes reigne must note yt iewes brokē couenaunt eternal life vnfaithfulnes established father depriued treasure kept yet yet driuen church god nowe seeing denie sonne haue nothing doe father must thinke haue fled frō pure faith gospel vnto inuentions howsoeuer flatter themselues stoutnes worship god according mind men traditiōs yet one voyce thūdering heauē doth ouerthrow whatsoeuer diuine holy thing think haue worship knowe therefore end religion may approued god must needes leane vnto knoweledge conceiued worde 23 houre commeth latter member concerning abrogation legall worship followeth vvhen saith houre commeth shall come teacheth order deliuered moses shall perpetuall heb 9 10 vvhen saith houre nowe maketh end ceremony telleth time reformation fulfilled meane alloweth temple priesthood rite annexed thereunto touching vse time past furthermore ende may declare god neither bee worshipped ierusalem mount garizin taketh vnto deeper principle namely true worship cosisteth spirite thereupon followeth rightly called vppon euery yet first may question asked sense worship god called spirituall end wee may vnderstand must note opposition betweene spirite external figure betwene shadowes truth therefore worship god said consist spirite nothing el inward faith hearte bringeth forth inuocation secondly puritie conscience deniall selues beeing giuen obey god may vnto holy sacrifice heerupon ariseth another question whether father worship spiritually vnder lawe answere seeing god alwayes lyke himselfe hee allowed worship beginning worlde saue spirituall worship agreeable vnto nature vvhich thyng moses doth sufficiently testifie doth many place declare ende lawe tend end people shold cleaue vnto god faith pure conscience prophetes doe clearely expresse sharply inueigh hypocrisie ye people thought satisfied god offered sacrifice executed externall pompe need inferre many testimony common euery yet notable place fiftie psalme second isayas verse fiftie eight threescore sixt micheas fift amos seuenth worship god sort spirituall vnder law yet notwithstanding intangled many external ceremony seeme smell carnall earthly thing therefore paule calleth ceremony flesh beggerly elemēts world like sort authour hebrewes saithgal 4 9 old sanctuarie appurtenance earthlyheb 9 1 therefore may fitly say worship law substance spirituall respect forme sort carnall earthly way shadowish truth whereof appeareth plainely nowe see wherein iewes agre v wherein dissent v god would age worshipped faith prayer thansgiuing purenesse heart innocencie life neyther euer delighted sacrifice lawe diuers addition spirite truth lye hid vnder diuers shadowes veile temple beeing rent nothing obscure couered vve haue indeede day certaine externall exercise godlinesse whereof ignorance hath neede suche meane sobrietie doe darken plaine truth christ finally haue plainely expressed shadowed vnto father difference confounded time poperie quite ouerthrowen lesse thicknesse shadowes time past time iudaisme cannot denied christe doth put manifest difference betwene v iewes starting hole soeuer seeke escape manifest vnlike father externall forme worshipping god spiritually tyed ceremony abolished cōming christ therfore much lyeth spoyle church christe presence whosoeuer doe burthen immoderate companie ceremony neither doe passe vaine colour many common people haue great neede helpes day time past amongest iewes wee must alwayes respect sort lord would haue church gouerned alone knoweth best expedient v certayne nothing contrary order god hath appoynted grosse twice carnall pompe reigneth papistrie shadowes lawe indeede couer spirite visares doe altogether disfigure vvherefore wee must case winke filthie vnseemely corruption howsoeuer craftie men fearefull correct vice doe obecte thinges indifferent therefore indifferētly taken truly tollerable rule christ hath prescribed violated true worshipper christ seemeth briefly way touche stubbor nesse many whiche brake foorth afterwarde know stoutly iewes defend ceremony whereunto accustomed although sentence reacheth seeing knew worlde would neuer free corruption therefore separateth true right worshiper peruers feigned vvith testimonie furnished let v doubt condemne papistes al inuentions contemne reproches need haue feare heare bare plaine worship doth please god papistes doe contemne full stuffed ceremony doth vaine pompe fleshe profite whereby christ doth testifie spirit extinguished appeareth plainly goeth worship god spirite truth namely taking away shadowes olde rite simply retaine spirituall worship god truth god worship consisteth spirite ceremony certaine accidentall thing heere must note againe truth compared lying externall accession figure substance spirituall worship pure plaine say 24 god spirite confirmation drawen verie nature god seeing men flesh maruell thinges please aunswerable nature hereupon commeth passe inuent manie thing worship god whiche full vaine boasting haue soundnesse meete first weigh throughly haue god doth agree flesh fire water one cogitation ought suffice bridle wantonnesse wit occupied worshipping god hee vnlike vnto v thinges please v doe displease admit hypocrite blinded pride afraide make god subiect rather luste yet let v know modestie hath lowest roome worship god howsoeuer thinke pleaseth according flesh furthermore cannot ascend vnto hignesse let v remē ber must fet rule word wherby may directed father doe oftentimes cite place arrians proue diuinitie spirite falsly wrested thyther christ doth place simply affirme father spirituall nature therefore moued friuolous thinges men wont reason lightnes 25 mesiias shall come although religion vncleane mixed many error amongest samaritanes yet certaine groundes taken lawe imprinted mindes ye messias likely seeing woman gather christ wordes vnwonted kinde change hande shoulde befall churche god shee straightway call minde christ vnder hoped perfect manifestation thinges vvhen saith messias shal come seemeth speake time nigh hand truly appeareth euery many argument mindes menne wayte cōming messias restore thing miserablie destroyed gone decay doubt woman preferreth christ moses prophetes office teaching comprehendeth three thinges wordes first doctrine law altogether perfect rudiment deliuered vnlesse farther thing shee would haue saide nessias shoulde shewe thinges secrete opposition betweene hym prophet part dutie bring scholers vnto marke entred brought course secondly woman declareth shee hopeth suche christe father interpreter master teacher godly last sheweth better thing perfect thing bee desired doctrine yea vttermost marke wisedome beyonde whiche lawefull goe woulde god boast bragge pillers churche christe would imitate poore simple woman woulde rather contented plaine doctrine christe challenge take themselues wote note kinde mastership authoritie bring inuentions frō whence came religion pope mahomet saue onely wicked addition whereby feigned themselues fill vppe doctrine gospel though vnperfect without dotings whosoeuer shalbe throughly instructed christ schoole shall seeke himselfe master nay shall case admit 26 hee speake thee vvhen hee confesseth woman hee messias without doubt offereth himselfe teach ende hee may answeare hope shee conceiued therefore seemeth mee shee desired greater store doctrine quenche thirst withall woulde haue suche testimonie grace bee extant euen poore woman end myght declare vnto men hee neuer neglect office desirous teacher therefore doubted hee deceiue man whome hee shall finde bee readie scholler doe thinke muche submitte themselues vnto wee see many proude profane men doe hope perfect wisedome turkes papistes worthie beeing driuen innumerable delusion bee drowned labyrinth wordes speake nessias sonne god hee setteth foorth worde messias seale scale doctrine gospel wee must thinke annoynted father spirite god rested vppon hym hee myght bring vnto v message saluationisay 6 1 isayas doth testifie 27 meane season came disciple maruelled hee talked woman yes man saide vvhat seekest thou speakest thou 28 therefore woman left water pot went citie saide vnto men 29 come see man hath tolde thing whiche haue done christe 30 therefore went citie came vnto 31 meane disciple asked saying master eate 32 said vnto haue meate eate know 33 therefore disciple said amongest themselues hath man brought thing eate 34 iesus saith vnto meate doe sent mee fulfill worke 27 maruelled vvhereas euangelist writeth disciple maruelled might two cause might moue thē unto either ye vilenes person offend thē el thought iewes defiled talke samaritanes although thinges spring godly reuerence master yet euill wonder absurd thing vouchsafe doe poore simple woman great honour doe rather looke vppon themselues truly finde lesse matter wonder seely men ofscourings people extolled vnto highest degree honour yet euangelist saith durst aske worth marking taught theyr example bee thing wordes deedes god christ seemeth straunge vnto v must immediatly giue selues leaue murmur boldly must rather keepe silence modestie vntill time bee reuealed vnto v heauen know yet furthermore ground worke modestie feare god reuerence christ 28 therefore shee left waterpot euangelist setteth downe expresse feruentnesse desire signe hast returneth citie leauing waterpot behinde nature faith soone wee made partaker eternall life desire haue cōpanions neither knowledge god lye buried idle men heartes shewe selfe psalme 116 10 must needes true haue beleeued therefore speake must much note earnestnesse gladnesse woman small sparkle faith doth kindle shee scarce tasted christ yet whenas prayse throughout whole citie therfore shall great shame haue gone reasonable well forward schoole waxe sluggish seemeth rather bee worthie reprehension ignorant throughly soundlye taught passeth bound faith answere haue delt rashly taken vpon herselfe office teaching seeing desire stir vp citizen heare christ speake say forgetting herselfe shee went beyonde reache doth play part trumpet bell may inuite men vnto christ 29 see man speaketh place doubtingly may seeme haue much moued christ authoritie aunswere vnfit intreat great mystery according small talant endeuoureth bring citizen point submit themselues taught christe furthermore good spurre pricke forwarde withall seeing knew manifest plaine token prophete sithence able iudge doctrine inferiour preparation profitable fit therefore whilest heare hee opened hidden thinges woman gather prophet lorde beeing set downe beginne giue eare doctrine although woman goeth farther shee biddeth consider whether bee messias contented one thing persuasion shoulde seeke alreadie found christ knew find promise doth lie saith christ told thinges haue alreadie said yt christe reprehend whoredom alone word sinnes committed life layde charge euangelist doth recite euery sentence taught summarily christ set former present life might tame tatling tongue meane wee see woman inflamed godly zeale whit spare herselfe estimation might set foorth christ name doth abstaine reckoning vp shame reproche 32 haue meate great meruell wearie hungry refuseth meate man say doth ende hee may instruct v example suffer pouertie hee continually aymed another marke teache meate ought simply refused must marke circumstance care present businesse doth constraine doth wholy possesse minde truble neglect meate yet doth professe earnestly bent execute father businesse commandements neither eate drink doth shew former latter owne example teacheth kingdome god ought bee preferred commodity bodie indeed god doth giue v leaue eate drinke drawen away whiche chiefest euery man occupied vocation man say cannot meate drinke must neades hinderāces draw away time good study graunt true lorde according fauourablenes doth giue v leaue care flesh much neede requireth ceaseth meane space prefer obediēce god ought doth cherish ye body moderately soberly although must also beware addicted vnto houres yt must readie defraud selues meate god doeth appoint v vnto businesse houre offering v opportunitie seeing christ opportunitie offered now▪ doth imbrace armes whiche might escape therfore forasmuch busines inioyned father constraine must needes let thing alone douteth set light meate shame woman leaue waterpot runne call people lesse feruentnes appeare christ finally shall thus determine selues loose cause liuing life shalbe hard matter keepe best meane shall set end life serue lord may bee led away euen present perill death shall doubtlesse make account meat drink metaphore meate drinke hath much greater grace fet due season present talke 34 meate meaning doth make greatest account nothing wherewith delighted wherein practiseth himselfe willingly earnestly like dauid 19 11 psa end may cōmend law god doth say precious vnto sweet honnie therfore end may follow christ must serue god diligently must also willing commandements labour must nothing troublesome vnto v furthermore christ addeth may fulfil will▪ doth sufficiently declare father whereunto bent namely fulfill function inioyned euery man must haue respect vnto calling least man say yt laid vpon god tooke vpon owne pleasure rashly know well enough christ function namely kingdome god restore lost soules vnto life spread abrode light gospel finally bring saluation vnto world excellencie thing cause wearie hungrie forget meat drinke yet reape small comfort hereby heare christ carefull man saluation vnto great pleasure care doubtles need doubt like affectioned toward v day 35 say yet foure monethes commeth haruest behold say vnto lift vp eye see region white vnto haruest 36 reapeth receiueth reward gathereth fruite vnto eternall life hee soweth may reioyce reapeth 37 herein saying true one soweth another reapeth 38 haue sent reape laboured • others haue laboured haue entred labour 35 say prosecuteth former sentence hee said accoūted chiefest thing father work declareth ripe comparing vnto haruest like corne ripe haruest stay longer otherwise corne fall away spirituall corne ripe doth testifie must case delay delay bringeth danger see ende similitude brought namely expresse cause hast worde say meant note much bent men mindes vnto earthly thing vnto heauenly desirous haue haruest carefully count moneths dayes mean wonder see sluggish gathering heauenly wheat dayly vse doth argue frowardnesse onely v naturally also scarse pulled away heartes seeing men prouide ye earthly life aforehand think ful negligently vpon diuine mattersmat 16 3 christ saith another place oye hypocrite iudge according face heauen maner day tomorrow shalbe know time visitation 36 reapeth receiueth reward proueth another argugument diligent ought work lord namely large glorious reward laide vp labour▪ promiseth fruit corruptible fraile fruit although addeth concerning fruit may bee expounded two maner wayes either may declaration hyere vtter one self thing diuers wordes el may commend diligence increase kingdome god hee repeate chap 15 16 haue chosen may go bring fruit fruit may remaine truly thing ought greatly encourage minister word neuer faint vnder labor whilest heare prepared heauen crowne glory know also fruite haruest shal precious god also eternall end mentiō made reward euery wher scripture end merites workes may esteemed thereby throughly tryed shall rather found worthie punished sluggishnes rewarded diligence therefore shall nothing remaine best labourer saue flie humbly craue pardon lord dealeth fatherly v end may amende sluggishnes better incourage v otherwise faint harted vouchsafeth repay vnto v free reward furthermore far frō ouerthrowing righteousnes faith doth rather establishe whence commeth god findeth v thing worthie rewarde saue hee hath endowed v spirite know spirit earnest pledge adoption secondly commeth passe god doth giue great honor vnto vnperfect corrupt workes saue hath reconciled v vnto freely imputing vice cleaue vnto workes accepteth contrarie desert summe place labour paine apostle take ought seeme greeuous vnto thē seeing know profitable themselues fruitfull church christ soweth wordes christe teacheth v man shall need cōplaine apostle shall gather fruit men tillage must note amplification sob sighes men complaine fruites theyr labour giuen vnto others whit hinder newe possessour may reape corne sowen another much ioyfull ought reaper whereas mutuall consent mutuall ioy reioycing end may better vnderstande place wee must note opposition betweene sowing reaping sowing doctrin law prophet seed cast ground remaine greene corne doctrine gospell bringeth men vnto perfect ripenesse fitly compared vnto haruest law far frō perfection length exhibited christ vve also wel know cō parison paul maketh betwene childhood manhood tēdeth endgal 4 • finally forasmuch ye cōming christ brought wt present saluation maruell gospel wherein gate kingdome heauen set open called haruest propheticall doctrine yet neuerthelesse hyndereth whit father vnder lawe gathered god barne similitude referred vnto manner teaching childhoode church continue vntill end law gospell preached youth thereof immediately succeede saluation began waxe rype whiche prophetes onely sowen seeing christe spake wordes samaria seemeth extēd sowing vnto law prophetes expound aswel gentile iewes graunt indeede alwayes certaine granes godlines scattered throughout whole world doubt god sort sow excellent sentence extant philosopher profane writer hand forasmuche seede corrupt roote corne might thence haue sproung although neither good naturall choked huge heape errours absurd thing compare hurtful corruptiō vnto sowing secondly spoken agreement ioy cānot applyed vnto philosopher like yet doubt dissolued christ seemeth sort speake samaritanes answere although al thing corrupted amongest samaritanes yet hid amongest seede godlinesse whence commeth redie seeke christe hearde one word saue learned lawe prophetes redeemer come iudea trulie peculiar possession lorde tilled prophetes som portion seede brought samaria also without cause christ saith seede waxen rype euen also man doe obiect apostle chosen sent preach gospel vnto whole worlde may easily answere christ speak time dyd require vnlesse hee commendeth samaritanes seede propheticall doctrine although filled▪ manye weedes hope fruite whiche almost rype 37 saying true common prouerb whereby declare many oftentimes reape fruit men labour although otherwise hath taken paine doth hardly suffer man take away fruite seeing apostle haue prophetes partner ioy yet notwithstanding cannot hereby gather prophetes themselues doe knowe thinges done day church christ drift prophetes taught long lyued example wee taught must neuer loyter often wee may spread abroade kingdome god afraid least facilitie subiect false tale oftentimes vnprofitable let v aske christ spirite counsell direct v worde better expresse maner faith namely conceiued worde god may boast haue son god master truly alone vpon whose authoritie may safely rest present openly may speake vnto v mouth mouth yet whomsoeuer wee 49 lorde come downe seeing going forward suite doth length obteine would may gather therefore reprehended christ woulde vtterly haue reiected refuse prayer rather ende might reforme vice stoppe comming true faith must remember said common reprehension people greater peculier reprehension one man preposterous superfluous petition must needes amended cut meanes hurtfull lettes may taken away furthermore courtears wont commonly bee daintie proude willingly hardly dealt must note man humbled owne necessitie feare least depriued sonne neither angrie neither repine entertained somewhat vncourteously christ passed ouer chiding modest silence vve haue experience euen selues daintinesse wonderfull vnpaciencie churlishnesse straunge vntill suche time beeing brought vnder aduersitie wee bee compelled lay away pride loftie lookes 50 thy sonne liueth appeareth first singuler courtesie christ fauourablenes pardoneth ignorance rudenesse man extendeth power farther hee hoped desired christe comming woulde heale sonne thought sicke might cured disease persuaded dead coulde raised vp againe therefore requesteth make hast least death preuent therfore seeing christ pardoneth faultes may hereby gather greatly esteemeth euē slēder faith also worthy noting christ obeying desire doth graunt farre thē desired hath testimonie present health son▪ heauenly father graunting oftētimes petition touching circumstance doth worke helpe v meanes looked may learne appoint nothing vvhen hee saith sonne liueth meaning deliuered dā ger death man beleeued wordes came furnished persuasion christe prophete god therefore hee readie beleeue snatch one worde hauing caught lay vp deepely mind although thinke honourably power christ ought yet shorte promise worke minde newe hope sodaine hee surely thinke life sonne included woorde christe readinesse ought receiue woorde god farre hauing present effect alwayes hearer profite much hearing many sermons▪ man beeing almost half profane hauing heard one worde vvherefore wee must diligent stirre vppe sluggishnesse must first pray vnto lorde wil stirre vp heartes may lesse readie beleeue ready bountifull promise 51 going downe described effect faith togeather▪ force word like christ word restore childe life point die father recouereth sonne safe one moment faith therfore let v know often lorde offereth vnto v benefites power alwayes prest performe whatsoeuer promiseth vnbelief doe stoppe confesse continuall yea often commonly seene lorde doth straightway stretche foorth hande helpe v often deferreth hee hath reason profitable v certaine far cause delay doth rather striue lettes hinderance therefore help appeareth presently let v consider howe great vnbeliefe least slender weak faith maruel wil haue benefites perish rashly throw vpon grounde bestowe vpon holde lappe faith readie receiue although doth helpe childrē one maner way yet shall neuer man faith voyde shall alwayes perceiue true prophete teacheth promise god doe make hast seeme linger 52 therefore hee asked asked seruants sonne began amende came passe secret motion god end truth myracle might plainly appear euen nature wickedly bent choake light power god satan goeth manie shiftes hee may darken beholding sight workes vvherefore must needes made plaine euident may praysed amongest v may remaine place doubting howe vnthankfull therefore soeuer men yet circumstance doeth suffer excellent worke christe bee ascribed vnto fortune 53 hee beleeued house seemeth absurd thing euangelist maketh mention beginning faith man whose faith commende neither worde bed walked sabboth day 1 feast day although euangelist doeth plaine word expresse day yet may well gesse meaneth vvhitsuntide recited done immediately christ came galilee went ierusalem immediately easter going samaria made account foure monethes vntill haruest entring galilee healed ruler sonne euangelist addeth immediately feast day followed therfore course respect tyme persuadeth v thinke speaketh place pentecost although greatly striue matter iesus came vnto feast day vnto ierusalem partly greater opportunitie spread abroad doctrine reason cōcourse people partly must obedient law might deliuer men bondage law haue said el alreadie 2 poole beside sheepe market circumstance place added whence gather myracle obscure knowen vnto place much frequented fiue porch doe declare nighnesse temple also require thus much moreouer euangelist saith flatly many sicke folkes layde touching worde selfe learned worthily reiect vaine surmise ierome maketh betheder bethesda interpreteth house flock place mention made poole nigh vnto sheep market also reason reade bethseda▪ place fishing therefore opinion sound expound place pouring ashd doth signifie amongest hebritians flowing euangelist dyd pronounce esda maner chaldean common vse tongue require thinke water brought thither conduct priestes might draw thence vnlesse peraduenture place called water powred pypes iudgement called sheepe market sheepe brought thither offered vp sacrifice 3 multitude sate may bee sicke folkes laide porch aske almes people wēt way went temple worship also wont buy sheepe whiche would offer sacrifice meane god heale number euery feast day meanes might set foorth worship appointed lawe holinesse temple notwithstanding may seeme absurd thing seeing reade thing done time religion florishe yea seeing myracles wrought extraordinarily prophetes time power grace god appeare plainely myracles wont thynges decayed almost vtterly brought confusion aunswere iudgement two cause seeing spirite dwelt prophetes sufficient witnesse testifie god presence religion need confirmation time law established signes needed god ceased confirme commaundement hee giuen innumerable testimony time christ comming drew neere destitute prophetes state miserable sore tempted euery side need extraordinarie helpe least shoulde thinke vtterly forsaken god thus discouraged vtterly haue fainted fallen away know malachie last prophet therefore concludeth doctrine thus chap 4 4 iewes may remēber law giuē moses vntil christ appeare seemed god profitable thing let destitute prophetes season ende might earnestly desire christ receiue greater reuerence reuealed meane least temple shoulde want testimonie sacrifice al worship whence saluation shoulde come vnto worlde lorde retained iewes gift healing might knowe vaine separated nation god himselfe god openly testifie healing sicke hee reached hand heauen allow kinde worship prescript lawe secondly doe doubt suche signes hee taught time redemption hande christe authour saluation drewe neere ende men mindes might better awaked suppose vse myracles y• time double first iewes might knowe god present might remaine constant obedience law secondly might bent wayte newe vnwonted estate lame blinde withered end may knowe common disease whiche lorde cure euangelist expresseth certaine kindes thereof remedy men inuent cānot cure halt blind withered wythered truly sorowfull sight see suche multitude men manifolde deformitie member yet glory god dyd clearely shine beholding great well ordered armie nothing famous excellent whē power god doth amend restore want nature also nothing beautifull sweete infinite goodnesse helpeth misery man therefore lorde would haue noble theater extant wherein maiestie might appeare borne aboutes also maner stranger said euen least ornament temple god stretching hand make knowen present 4 angel indeed proper peculier worke lord cure sicke wont vse hande diligence angel committed vnto angel charge respect angel called power might god doth resigne vp power vnto sit idle himselfe heauen working mightily doth wonderfully make knowen power vnto v therfore men deale wickedly peruersly
