naaman assyrian prophet sent vnto iordan haue leprosie cured contemned first mocke yet length hee perceiueth deed god doth worke contrary man reason yet notwithstanding doth neuer deceiue mocke v meane troubling water manifest token god doth vse element freely owne pleasure doth challenge himselfe effect worke vice cōmon ascribe vnto creature belongeth god alone shalbe point much foolishnes seeke cause health troubled water therfore doth commend external signe beholding sicke may compelled looke vnto authour grace 5 certaine man euangelist gathereth diuers circumstance make myracle credible long continuance disease taken away hope curing cōplained hee depriued remedie water hee oftentimes went throwe himselfe water vaine man helpe heereby appeareth plainely power christe purpose serueth hee commaunded take vp bed men might know hee healed meanes saue benefite christe seeing ariseth sodenly strong limb whereof lame sodaine change ought much stir vp moue mindes beholder 6 vvilt thou • e made whole doth aske question doubt matter partly may kindle desire y• grace offered partly might make witness present attentiue myracle might otherwise escape whilest thought vppon matter falleth oftentimes matter chaunce sodaine therefore preparation necessarie two cause 7 haue man sicke man doth almost al v wont doe▪ • includeth god helpe cogitation neither dare hee promise himselfe hee conceiue minde whereas christ doth pardon infirmitie may therin beholde mercifulnesse euery one v tryeth dayly whilest doe stick fast meanes nigh v hee doeth stretching hand hidden place contrary expectation declare howe farre goodnesse exceedeth weakenesse straightnes faith furthermore must instructed example suffer thirtie yeeres long time wherein god deferre benefite helping miserable man yet notwithstanding determined bestow vpon beginning long soeuer therefore make v wayte let v grone vnder miserie yet • ksomnesse long time doe discourage v although appeare end misery prolonged yet must alwayes persuade selues god wonderfull deliuerer doth easily remoue hinderance power 9 sabboth christ knewe well enough great offence woulde followe immediately see man goe bearing burdenier 17 21 lawe doth plaine wordes forbid beare burden vpon sabboth day double reason christe set foorth spectacle setting part respect danger namely common people might better knowe myracle secondly might occasion ministred way made excellent sermon hee made immediatly furthermore knowledge myracle greatly bee esteemed ought haue passed offending people especially seeing hee readines lawefull excuse wherewith though pacifie wicked yet sufficiently refute false slaunders therefore must note rule though whole worlde fret fume v yet must wee publishe glory god preache workes farre foorth expedient workes knowen neither must wearied discouraged although desire fall well would wee set eye end whereof haue spoken leape ouer boundes dutie 10 therefore iewes said vnto healed sabboth lawfull thee take vp thy bed 11 answered hee made mee whole said vnto mee take vp thy bed walke 12 therefore asked man said vnto thee take vp thy bedde walke 1 • furthermore healed kn • iesus withdrawen himselfe multitude place 14 afterward iesus found temple saith vnto beholde thou ar • healed sinne least worse thing happen vnto thee 15 man went tolde iewes iesus healed 16 therefore iewes persecute iesus sought slea thinges sabboth day 10 sabboth forasmuch stoode men vpon defend religion sabboth doe well good cause accuse man excuse hee made doth satisfie doe nowe begin offend therein ought haue loosed knewe cause beare burden haue said breaking sabboth christ laide burden vppon shoulder vnburden authoritie therfore admonished place beware rash iudgement vntill wee doe throughly knowe reason euery man • fact vvhat thing soeuer contrarie worde god without doubt deserueth condemned oftentimes falleth deceiued point let modestie goe together quiet inquisition end iudgement may sound sober iewes possessed wicked affection stay make inquisition stop gate iudgement moderation suffered themselues taught offence taken away brought vnto knowledge gospel farre fruit nowe wee see howe farre theyr sinne reached wherein sinned namely dyd admit iuste defence defense thus healed answere dyd nothing commaunded doe authoritie power commaund although hee vnderstood yet christe yet persuaded sent god tryed diuine power hee doth thereby gather indowed authoritie must needes obey also seemeth worthie blame myracle doth remooue obedience law indeede confesse leaneth vnto fighteth reason scarse stronge enough yet doe offend double neither consider extraordinarie work god neither yet suspend iudgement vntyll time haue heard prophet furnished worde god 13 hee knew christ woulde haue glory great worke vanish away yet woulde haue first knowē famous time would professe himselfe authour thereof therefore withdrew himselfe little iewes might iudge thing self wt respect person hence may gather cannot bee attributed faith man hee healed knoweth phisition cured yet seemeth direction faith tooke vp bed commaunded mine part denie secrete motion faith say doth plainely appeare text destitute sound doctrine wherein rest pure light 14 iesus found wordes doe plainely shew christ therefore lie hid time memorie benefite might perish doth come abroad owne accorde meaning haue worke first knowen haue himselfe knowen authour therof furthermore place conta • neth profitable doctrine christ saith beh • lde thou art healed meaning doe wickedly abuse god benefites vnlesse moued vnto thankefulnesse neither doth christ cast teeth giuen doth admonish man tell healed cause mindfull grace receiued might worship god deliuerer duryng whole life therefore god doth instruct v vnto repentance pricke v forward light punishment hee doth exhort v vnto goodnesse clemencie yea generall ende aswell redemption god gift haue v wholy addicted knit vnto furthermore cannot bee vnlesse remember pain punishment haue alreadie escaped hee hath obtayned pardon doe exercise himselfe meditation duryng whole life also admonition teacheth v harme soeuer suffer imputed sinnes doubtlesse calamity doe come chaunce▪ many light punishment chasten v therfore must first acknowledge hand god smiteth v 〈◊〉 imagine blinde brunt fortune aduersitie secondly must giue god honor seeing 〈◊〉 best father hee taketh pleasure misery therefore hee doeth neuer handle v roughly vnlesse offended sinnes vvhen forbiddeth sinne doth require free sin comparison made former life christe doth exhort hereafter amend life continue like least worse thing god v good light punishment wherewith gentle father doth correct v tender daintie child compelled put vppon new strange person therfore taketh whip hand came fiercenes withal denoūceth law leui 26 14 18 deu 28 15 psa 32 9 yea testimony vsual scripture therfore yt often time punished new misery may thanke owne stubbornnesse like vnbroken horse mule vntamed beastes therefore maruell god doe breake v peeces cruel punishment hammer indifferent punishment cannot amend meete broken bend conclude vse punishment may made take better heed hereafter stubbornly resist first second stroke strike seuen fold harder hauing shewed token repentance short time returne vnto nature doth sharply punish forgetfull lightnesse full sluggishnesse worthie noted man mercifully fauourably lord suffereth v suppose drew nigh vnto old age yet must needes taken disease first flower age peraduenture sicke childhood consider greeuous punishment paine many yeeres certain god cannot accused great seueritie punish man halfe dead long sicknesse therefore lightly punished let v learne commeth passe lorde doth mittigate greatest rigour punishment infinite goodnesse sake let v also learn paine fierce cruell lord adde something thereunto often thinketh good questionles miserable men doe oftentimes pull downe vppon themselues horrible wonderfull tormentes complaintes whilest say plague cannot augmented thinges hidden treasure saith lorde deut 32 34 vve must also note small fruite chasticements god bring foorth v christe exhortation superfluous may gather thence man soule yet well purged vice truly vice doe take deeper roote v plucked vp one two dayes curing disease soule harder contented remedy small time 15 man went meant nothing lesse purchase enuy vnto christ also looked nothing lesse would rage christ therfore godly affection whenas would honor phisition due honor iewes vomite poyson doe accuse christ breaking sabbaoth doe also burst extreame crueltie 17 iesus answered father worketh vntill time worke 18 cause therefore iewes sought rather kill breake sabboth also call god father making equall god 19 therefore iesus answered said vnto verily verily say vnto son doe nothing himselfe saue shall see father thing doth sonne doth like sort 17 father vve must mark manner defence christ vseth doth answere law concerning keeping sabboth temporal abrogated doth rather say broken sabboth worke god indeed shadowish ceremonie whereof christe made end comming paule teacheth col 2 16 17 state present cause consisteth men commanded rest owne workes therfore circumcision work god men contrarie sabboth▪ christ standeth vpon point holy rest troubled woorkes god rest commanded law moses reason doth excuse fact also bare bed appurtenance part myracle nothing el approuing secondly thanksgiuing preaching abroade glory god reckoned among workes god breaking sabboth foote hande set foorth grace god yet christ doth chiefly speake himselfe iewes offended meane doth testifie health hee restored sicke man testimonie diuine power affirmeth sonne god maner working common father doe nowe large dispute vse sabboth cause commaunded touching present place religion sabboth farre breaking hindering course workes god doth rather graunt place alone doth lawe commaunde men rest owne workes saue may applie sens emptie free easie men like vnto god point hee kept holy day ceasing troublesome action world doe aspire vnto heauenly rest therefore sabboth god loytering sound perfection bringeth quiet estate peace neither sonne lesser father could doe nothing himselfe father obiect distinction person meant word might knowen christ father yet notwithstanding depriued internall power working deceiued neither word spoken gouernment shoulde sit idle heauen like priuate man answere easie spoken much respect god men nothing changed god whilest hee hath made christe chiefe king lord heauen earth hee himselfe sonne worketh heauen sluggish king wont doth declare power christ doth shewe himselfe present thing doe wordes signifie al may honour sonne saue father bee acknowledged worshipped sonne therefore dutie seeke god father christ beholde power worship followeth immediately hee honoureth sonne defraudeth god lawfull honour men confesse god worshipped sense naturally ingrafted v hath taken suche deepe roote heartes man dare absolutely denie god honour meane mindes men vanish away seeking god without way hence came many feigned god hence came many peruerse worshippings therefore shall finde true god el saue christ neyther shal worship aright way saue kissing sonnepsal 2 12 dauid teacheth iohn witnesseth el 1 iohn 2 12 hath sonne lacketh father also turkes iewes doe gorgeous title adorne god whome worship wee must note name god separated christ nothing el vaine fiction therefore whosoeuer wil haue worship approued true god let turne aside christe neither estate father vnder lawe although beholde christ obscurely vnder shadowes yet god neuer reueaie himselfe without christe nowe since christe reuealed sleshe made king worlde must bow knee vnto may bee subiect god seeyng god father hath commaunded hym sit ryght hande imagineth god without christe hee lameth one parte hymselfe 24 hee heareth worde expressed manner order worship least man thinke placed externall ryte onely frioulous ceremony doctrine notwithstanding boldly brag name christe doth place require honor hand saue obey gospel vvherupon followeth honor soeuer ye hypocrite giue vnto christ nothing el ye traiterous kisse iudas although call king 100 time yet doe spoile kingdom al power whilest beleeue gospel doth also set foorth fruit obedience saith hee hath eternall life ende may willing performe ought hard hearted submit himselfe willingly vnto christ hauing reward eternall life set yet see winneth vnto great boūtifulnes frowardnes rather willingly perish submit selues vnto son god yt may saued goodnesse therefore christ comprehendeth thinges wordes rule godly sincere worship requireth handes way whereby hath restored v vnto life sufficient v vnderstand taught namely came rayse dead vnlesse also know doth deliuer v death affirmeth wee doe obtaine life hearing doctrine vnderstanding woorde heareth faith doth immediately shew selfe faith hath place eares heart furthermore haue el declared whence great force faith matter therefore cause old father trouble thēselues refuting ye false slander arrius knaue obiect sonne equall father hee doe nothing himselfe holy men doe answere sonne doth good right acknowledge hath receiued father whatsoeuer hee hath whome respect person taketh beginning first al christ doth speake bare diuinitie clothed slesh teacheth esteemed according outward shewe hath higher thing man secondly must marke hath doe intent refute iewes goe set god therefore denyeth doth thing according manner men hath god guide gouernour dwelleth vve must alwayes remember often christ doth speake selfe taketh himselfe proper man hath respect vnto iewes falsly say one common sort men like sort whatsoeuer aboue man doeth referre vnto father worde iudge doth properly belong vnto doctrine yet doth also appertaine vnto administration say hath father bee authour thinges vnto rule therefore hee reuenger iudgement true concludeth woordes deedes reprehended suffereth himselfe doe thing father commaundeth ought sure certaine without controuersie right soeuer doth spring flow god modestie ought first maximum godlinesse amongest v reuerently thinke workes worde god name god ought sufficient proue iustice righteousnesse bee fewe founde persuaded god iust vnlesse compelled graunt god doth shewe vnto v righteousnesse experience restraine vnto sense flesh think otherwise wit doth tel v licentious impietie let bee certaine vndoubted consequent right true whatsoeuer god cannot god must true wordes iust righteous workes wee also taught way doe well take nothing hande vnlesse god guide helper whole worlde ryse v afterwarde let inuincible defense suffice v erreth followeth god seeke mine owne christe doth place set owne father contrarie thing doth onely refute vaine surmise thought rather enforced humane boldnesse thē gouerned authoritie god therefore denieth hath desire owne desire separated commaundement father 31 testifie selfe hee doth place whit discredit owne testimonie another place stoutly defendeth maner graunting christe sufficiently instructed furnished another hee passeth beeing beleeued himselfe saith according common custome men beleeue witnesse beare selfe let let testimonie force knowe accounted true lawfull euery man saith himselfe although doe otherwise speake truth man sufficient witnesse owne cause although vniust dealing sonne god reckoned number contained yet christ doth plainely cast teeth nothing malice hinder keepe backe beleeuing therefore see circumstance maketh much matter sent vnto iohn aske beeing desirous learne messias yet set light confirmation thereby one man borroweth testimonie another cannot want help estate god christ otherwise for▪ philosopher say vertue needeth helpe another hath man himselfe wherewith vnderprop truth god burning light farther argument vnthankefulnesse followeth blinde owne accorde seeing light god set vp eye therfore mening word god wold haue eree hee appointed iohn bee light brightnesse might direct asmuch therefore acknowledge bee sonne god commeth passe voluntarie error followeth another exprobration passe light offered thē shut eye also set purpose abuse oppresse christ withall readie extol iohn aboue iust degree arise malicious vnfaithfull purpose least place left sonne god christe doeth finely compare wicked abuse heauenly light vnto wantonnesse like good man house set vp candle night season seruants may doe worke hath commaunded doe doe translate vse thereof vnto banquetting maner naughtinesse furthermore wordes christe doth accuse iewes hee doth admonish v general doe abuse wander hyther thyther godly teacher god hath appointed direct v right way experience time teacheth profitable admonition god doth take men gouernment whole course life euen vntil come last marke sendeth prophet gouernours distemperature men rather leape frowardly without going forward goe forwarde walking inconstancie lightnesse hauing despised reiected perpetuall direction carryed vnto theyr sodaine affection therefore saith time houre word hee toucheth foolishnes thought eternall light god could extinguished fraile vaine frowardnes deale papistes day many godly teacher soeuer lord hath giuen churche burning light draw vnto contrary vse determined blinde owne eye beholding light neither doe abuse lightes choake light god doe also triumphe oftentimes darknenesse boast doltish inuentions blabbes brawler pure doctrine gospel christ doth place affirme iohnphil 2 15 paul maketh common faithfull hauing worde life ought shine worlde lightes christ teacheth belongeth properly father hee saw despise workes father hath giuen mee bringeth foorth two thinges whereby proued bee son god father saith doth testifie myracles sonne god came world gaue sufficient testimonie holy scripture let v alwayes remember drift wil acknowledged promised messias hee may bee hearde therefore doth proue one indeed ye scripture speaketh question whether myracles bee sufficient proue seeing prophetes wrought like answere signes god shewed hand prophet reached farther vnto end appointed namely might shew minister god coulde haue authoritie meanes god meant highly extoll sonne purpose god bee accounted ende myracles therefore vnlesse possessed wickednesse shut eye owne accord christ might haue made plaine vnto power signes one hee 37 father sent hath testified neither euer heare voyce see shape 38 haue word abiding beleeue sent 39 search scripture thinke haue eternall life testifie mee 40 wil come vnto mee may haue life 37 sent falsly restrained vnto voyce heard baptisme saith pretertence father hath testified may giue vnderstand commeth abrode vnknowen god marked long agoe lawe prophetes brought markes wherby might knowen therefore doe interprete god testifie sonne often put olde people hope saluation promised perfect restoring kingdome israel iewes ought haue conceiued forme image christ scripture manifested • lesh contemne present consequently reiect doe thereby declare yt haue tast law thing christ doth also cast teeth boast knowledge lawe byn brought vp god bosome neither haue yee hearde voyce christ hath cōplained receiued inueigheth sorer blindnesse saith neuer heard voyce god neuer saw shape metaphoricall speech wherein teacheth briefly alyantes knowledge god men doe make knowen themselues voyce countenance god vttereth voyce voyce prophetes sacramēts doth put vpō visible forme wherby may knowen according slender capacitie doth know god liuely image hee doth sufficiently bewray hee worshippeth power himselfe hath framed therfore paule saith vaile put ouer eyes2 cor 3 13 cannot see glory god face christ 38 haue worde true profiting word god taketh roote v beeing fastened heartes may haue certaine seate christ saith heauenly doctrine hath place amongest iewes receiue son god setteth foorth euery casteth teeth worthily god spake vaine moses prophet drift purpose moses call men straight vnto christ whereby appeareth manifestly disciple reiect christe secondly shall hee haue worde life abiding driueth away life selfe shall hee vnderstand doctrine lawe extinguisheth much lyeth soule lawe lawe without christ vaine neither hath substaunce nigher therefore euery man knoweth christe much hath profited worde god 39 search scripture vvhereas christ said hath father witnesse heauen haue saide referred vnto moses prophetes followeth plaine exposition saith testimonie extant scripture toucheth againe vaine boasting professed haue life scripture catch dead letter neither doth absolutely reprehende seeke life scripture seeing appointed vnto v ende vse iewes thinke scripture quicken whenas knewe true meaning thereof yea seeing choake light life contained therein howe shall lawe giue life without christe doth quicken vve taught place must fet knowledge christ scripture imagine christ according owne pleasure shall length haue nothing shadowish ghoste steede therefore must first al hold christe knowen aright meanes saue scripture followeth wee must reade scripture end may finde christe vvhosoeuer shall misse marke howsoeuer wearie himselfe whole life learning hee shall neuer attaine vnto knowledge truth shal wisedome without wisedome god furthermore commaunded seeke christe scripture affirmeth place studie shall voide father doth sort testifie sonne doth vndoutedly reueale vnto v hindereth great many looke vpon negligently superficially running ouer neede great attentiuenesse therfore christ commandeth searche treasure deeply hidden vvherefore iewes doe abhor christ imputed theyr slugishnesse haue lawe dayly handes euident brightnesse god glory shineth moses doe desire veile couer brightnesse wel knowen old testament vnderstoode worde scripture christ began first manifested gospel hee whome lawe prophetes bare witnesse openly shew himselfe gospel 40 yee • oth againe cast teeth nothing letted malice take life offered scripture saith ascribeth cause ignorance blindnesse vnto frowardnesse stubbornnesse truly seeing offered himselfe courteously vnto must needes wilfully blinde sithence fled light set purpose yea seeing couet ouerwhelme sun thier darknes christ doth sharply chide good cause 41 receiue glory men 42 knowe haue loue god 43 came father name receiue another come owne name yee receiue 44 yee beleeue receiue glory one another seeke glorye commeth god alone 45 thinke accuse vnto father one accuseth moses trust 46 beleeue moses woulde also beleeue mee hee writte mee 47 beleeue writinges beleeue wordes 41 receiue glory men holdeth reprehending least suspected handle owne cause saith first preuent passeth glory man neither passeth neither sory owne sake seeth himselfe despised truly greater dependeth vpon men iudgementes seeing wickednesse whole worlde take nothing diminishe highnesse one heyre standeth vpon refuting false slaunder extolleth aboue men inueigheth freely obiecteth vnto contempt hatred god although wee bee far distant christ degree honour yet must contemne sinister iudgements men truly must take great heed cō tempt selues doe prouoke v vnto wrath let v rather learne angrie cause honour due vnto god giuen let holy iealousie burne vexe v often wee see worlde vnthankfull doth reiect v 42 haue loue god loue god place taken whole sense godlinesse man loue god must receiue wholy submit himselfe vnto like againe loue god doth reigne desire obey cause moses putteth downe briefe law loue god hearte c deut 6 5 43 came christ proueth argument iewes neither loue reuerence god wil greedily receiue false prophetes refuse submit themselues vnto god hee taketh thing men graunt signe froward wicked minde men doe subscribe willingly vnto lye setting apart truth man doe obiect doth come passe part rather errour malice wee may easily answere man subiect deceit satan saue far foorth preferreth lye ye truth certain peruers greedinesse commeth passe god speaketh v vnto deafe men satan findeth v redie willing heare saue turned away righteousnesse desire vnrighteousnes owne accord although must note christ speaketh properly god hath illuminated peculiarly hee vouchsafed graunt priuiledge vnto iewes instructed law might keepe right way saluation certain giue eare false teacher vnlesse desire deceiued therefore moses saith false prophetes arise people tryed examined meanes • eut 13 3 whether loue lord god seemeth many innocent simplicitie without doubt hypocrisie blindeth eye lurketh within mind certaine yt god doth neuer shut gate knocke neuer deceiued seeke sincerely2 th 2 10 therefore doth paule truly ascribe vnto vengeance god power deluding graunted satan may beleeue lye hauing reiected truth approue vnrighteousnesse saith men doe perish haue receiued loue truth might saued day dissimulatiō many discouered addicted vnto pope deceite wicked superstition fret fume gospel poysoned furie mindes framed vnto feare god feare also beget obedience name father false prophetes boast title day pope doth full mouth boast christ vicar yea satan hath deceiued miserable men vnder colour alone since beginning christe doth place note thing selfe colour doth testifie came father name cause sent father doth faithfully dispatch commanded doe furthermore distinguisheth marke lawfull teacher church false corrupt teacher therfore whosoeuer extoll themselues doe arrogate vnto themselues authoritie owne ouer soules place teacheth reiected without feare accounted seruant god must haue nothing separated wee examine pope doctrine euen verye blinde shall see hee came owne name 44 might seeme hard matter houshold schollers law prophet childhood condemned grosse ignorance made enemy truth yea might seeme vncredible thing christ telleth letteth beleeue namely ambition take away soundnesse minde speaketh properly vnto priestes scribe puffed vp pride could submit themselues vnto god excellent place teacheth ye gate faith shut whose mindes possessed vaine desire earthly glory bodie worlde must needes wander vanish away cannot goe forward vnto god man doth prepare himselfe vnto obedience heauenly doctrine thinketh ought seek especially whole life approue selfe vnto god peruers confidence wherby hypocrite extoll thēselues god seemeth greater let worldly ambition knowe scribe sore sicke also disease vve may easily answere christe mening pluck face false visour holines wherwith deceiued ignorant people therefore doth finger poynt grosser vice whereby men might perceiue nothing lesse woulde bee accounted againe although hypocrisie boast self god yet alwayes ambitious worlde men yea vanitie puffeth v vp euen wicked confidence whylest wee stande rather owne iudgement men god doth truly set god iudge hee must needes fall downe flat discouraged throwen downe therfore seeke glory god alone must needes confounded shame himselfe flie vnto free mercie truly haue respect vnto god doe see themselues condemned lost remaineth nothing whereof may boast besides grace christ desire glory shall alwayes ioyned humilitie touching present place christe giueth v vnderstand men otherwise prepared receiue doctrine gospel saue turne sens hauing drawen world vnto god alone doe earnestly consider haue deale forgetting delight wherewith wont deceiue themselues may discend owne conscience vvherefore maruell gospel doe finde day easie taught seeing ambition carryeth men hyther thyther maruell also many doe fall away profession gospel carryed away owne vanitie doe flie away vvherefore wee ought earnestly seeke one thing contemptible castawayes sight worlde beeyng cast downe selues wee may reckoned amongest child god 45 thinke vve must take order obstinate stubborne see profite nothing doctrine friendlye admonition cite appeare god iudgement seate mocke god openly manie doe carelesly mocke vaine flatterings set enemy feignyng mercifull vnto day gyants doe wickedly treade vnderfoote whole doctrine christ doe yet notwithstanding waxe proude god deare friendes persuade papist christianitie el saue amongest scribe christ disputeth place vvhereas great contemners lawe yet boast much moses afraide set christ buckler threatned himselfe would vnto heauie vntoilerable aduersarie knew would haue contemned therefore denounceth accusation prepared moses deceiued thinke difference set downe place betweene office christ moses office law accuse infidel christ doth respect might take hypocrite confidence falsly boast reuerence moses like day man obiect vnto papistes holy teacher church haue deadly enemy whose title wickedly corrupt furthermore let v learne hereby must boast scripture vaine vnlesse worship sonne god ye true obedience faith shall rise accuse v last day whome god raysed vp witness vvhenas saith hope moses doth accuse thē superstition ascribe cause saluation vnto moses meaning wickedly leane vnto moses aid could haue patrone wicked stubbornnesse 46 ye beleeue sheweth moses shalbe accuser wit refuse doctrine know greater iniurie done seruants god doctrine despised slandered secondly lord hath made minister word must also defender therfore gaue vnto prophet double person teach ye godly vnto saluation length thrust thrugh reprobate testimonie vvheras christ saith moses writ needeth long proofe amongst know christe end law soule therof man contented therwith doth desire see place counsel first reade diligently epistle hebrewes wherwith also stephen sermon agreeth 7 • chap act secondly marke paule applieth testimony vnto purpose cōfesse deed ther place wherin moses doth openly preach christ end serued tabernacle sacrifice ceremony saue might figure formed according first example shewed mount therefore without christ moses ministerie vain againe see doth continually call backe people vnto couenant father established christ somuch yt maketh christ ye principall point ground worke couenant neither vnknowen holy father alwaies respect vnto mediator longer treatise would agree breuitie desire 47 beleeue word christ seemeth place make himselfe lesse credite moses knowe heauen earth shaken voyce gospel christ frameth speech vnto vnto speaketh without doubt authoritie lawe holy amongest iewes coulde bee christ inferiour vnto moses hereunto appertaineth opposition writinges wordes doth therby exaggerate infidelitie truth god written table yet credite amongest chap 6 1 afterwarde went iesus ouer sea galilee called tyberias 2 followed great multitude sawe myracles hee vpon diseased 3 iesus went vp mountaine sate disciple 4 easter feast day iewes neere 5 therefore iesus lift vp eye sawe great multitude came vnto hee saieth vnto phillip vvhence shall wee buse bread may eate 6 furthermore hee saide trying hee himselfe knewe hee would doe 7 phillip answered two hundred pennie woorth bread sufficient euerie one may take little 8 one disciple said vnto andrew simon peter brother 9 heere lad hath fiue barly loues • two little fish amongest many 10 iesus said make men sit downe much grasse place therefore men sate number fiue thousand 11 iesus tooke loaues hauing giuen thankes hee gaue disciple disciple set like sort fish much would 12 satisfied said vnto disciple gather fragment remaine nothing bee lost 13 therefore gathered togeather filled twelue basket fragment remained fiue barly loaues eaten 1 afterward went iesus vvheras iohn wont gather wordes deedes christe three passed ouer place repeateth historie myracle set downe contrary custome doth certaine purpose may thence passe ouer vnto christe sermon hee made day following capernaum matter ioyned together vvherefore although haue narration aswel yet hath peculiar thing tendeth another end shall see say done anone death iohn baptist circumstance time note cause departure christe soone tyrant haue handes imbrewed blood waxe cruell euen distemperature drinking doth make drunkē men thristie therfore christ meaning pacifie furie herod absence hee taketh sea galilee lake genesara vvhen saith called tyberias doth better expresse place whyther christe went neither lake thus called part thereof neere banke whereon tyberias stood 2 followed great multitude hereupon followed desire follow christe soone seene power myracles persuaded great prophet sent god euangelist passeth ouer whiche three recite part day spent teaching healing sicke almost sunne set requested disciple would send people away sufficient gather summe briefly vpon occasion might leade bring v vnto rest text shall follow afterwarde see first al desirous people heare christ hauing forgotten themselues doe quietly waite night desert place vvherfore dulnes rather sluggishnes much vnexcuseable seeing far frō preferring heauenly doctrine christ care hunger euery little let doth call v away meditating vpon eternall life yea falleth seldome christe findeth v free hinderaunces world vve v far following desart mountaine scarse one amongst ten yt afoord receiue home amidst commodity although bee common disease throughout world yet certaine man apt kingdome god learne desire foode soule earnestly hauing shaken suche daintines belly shalbe let vnto flesh doth alwayes pricke v forward seeke commodity thereof wee must also note againe christ doth willingly take care neglect themselues neither doth wait stay vntill time hungrie crie perish pouertie haue meat prepareth meate requested man say continual thing oftentimes see godly whilest vtterly addicted vnto kindome god yet hunger almost pine away hunger answer although christ proue faith pacience meanes yet doth behold heauen pouertie carefull help far foorth expedient v helpeth answere doth good cause though bee hidden v 3 went vp mountaine vvithout doubt christ sought som secrete place vntill feast day easter therfore said sate downe mountaine disciple hee tooke counsell according man meane season counsel god otherwise willingly obey although therfore eschew sight men yet doth suffer himselfe brought foorth famous theater hand god greater resort desart mountaine populous citie fame also became greater reason myracle hee stand midst market tyberias▪ wherfore taught exāple take counsel concerning thing present fall otherwise thought sory god aboue v order thing 5 saith vnto phillip rest say wee doe place reade haue spoken phillip alone spoken absurditie likely phillip spake thought therfore christ answereth peculiarly like immediately bringeth andrewe speaking whereas doe assigne speech vnto together tryeth disciple person phillip whether looke myracle wrought seeth conceiue nothing touching extraordinarie remedie thē awaketh mind fast sleepe might least haue eye open behold present thing drift thinges whiche disciple bring may diswade christ keeping people longer peraduenture doe therein priuately prouide themselues least suffer som part discommodity vvherefore christ holdeth purpose neglecting obiections 7 two hundreth peniworth bread seeing pennie according budeus account worth foure penny sterling two penny turnois amounteth vnto three pound ten shillinges sterling deuide summe amongest fiue thousand men euery hundred shall haue seuenteene penny half penie let thousand woman child added vnto fiue thousand shall finde phillip giueth vnto euery head halfe farthing buy little bread peraduenture supposed thing happeneth great companie moe seeing disciple poore full money andrew meant terri • ie christ greatnesse summe shoulde say sufficient ritches feede people 10 make men sit downe although dulnesse disciple worthie reprehended yt soner lifted vp vnto hope came mindes attribute much vnto power meete yet readie obedience deserueth small praise doe obey commandement knowing hee meant doe successe shoulde haue doe like readinesse people obeying vncertaine end commanded one word sit downe true tryall faith god commandeth men walke darknes end may come passe let v learne bee wise owne conceite thing confused notwithstanding looke prosperous euent whē follow god guide doth neuer deceiue 11 hauing giuen thankes christ hath taught v example must begin prayer often touch meat thing soeuer god hath appointed vse doe inuite v prayse signes infinite goodnesse fatherly loue thanksgiuing paule teacheth 1 tim 4 4 certain solemne sanctification vse thinges may begin pure vvhereupon followeth sacrilegious profaners giftes god deuoure neglecting god admonition much noted see great part worlde gorge themselues beastly manner vvhereas would haue bread giuen disciple encrease theyr handes hereby taught one v doth seeke anothers profite lorde doth blesse labour may wee gather summe whole myracle cōmon rest christ shew diuine power ioyned liberalitie also vnto v confirmation sentence wherein hee exhorteth v first seeke kingdome god promiseth thing shall bee added hee tooke care brought vnto sodaine force motion hee wanting vnto v wee seeke constant purpose minde first haue saide suffer hungrie yet hee neuer suffer thē destitute ayde meane hath good cause reason hee doth helpe v saue extremitie moreouer christ declare giue spirituall life vnto worlde hee also appointed nourish body aboundance good thinges giuen hande may powre v like water conduit although doe call conduit vnproperly seeing hee rather ye liuely fountaine flowing eternall father1 cor 1 3 therefore paule wisheth vnto v good thingeseph 5 20 father hee teacheth wee must giue thankes god father thinges neither office proper eternall diuinitie father hath also made flesh steward v hande may feede v although doe dayly see myracles yet doth christ lesse liberally shewe power feeding v truly doe reade hee vsed new strange meanes often would giue supper vvherefore shalbe preposterous petition desire haue meate giuen straunge maner moreouer christ prepared great dainty people must contented barly bread dry fish openly see wonderfull power supper although doth day fill fiue thousande men fiue loaues yet doth cease feede whole worlde myraculouslydeut 8 3 vve count paradoxe strange thing man doth liue bread woorde proceedeth mouth god tyed externall meanes nothing harde depend vpon prouidence god hence commeth trembling see haue bread readie hand man doe well consider vpon thinges hee shall compelled see blessing god al maner food myracles nature waxe vile amongst v continuance neither much letted point dulnesse maliciousnesse hee rather compasse ye heauen earth wandering gadding mynd hundred time behold god offering self vnto 13 filled twelue basket matthew writeth whenas foure thousand men satisfied seuen loaues remained many basket full loauesmat 15 37 therefore seeing lesse store like sort sufficient greater number men remaineth almost twise much wee doe hereby plainely see great force blessing god beholding whereof wee shut eye owne accorde vve must also note way although christ doth command fill basket myracle might made knowen yet doth exhort disciple vnto thriftinesse saith gather yee lette nothing lost greater liberalitie god ought prouoke v vnto wastfulnesse therfore let haue aboundance remember shal giue account immoderate store vnlesse bestow ouerplus diligently faithfully vpon good v suche god alloweth 14 therefore men seene myracle iesus wrought said truly man prophete shall come worlde 15 therefore iesus knew would come carry away might make king departed againe mountaine alone 16 euening disciple went downe vnto sea 17 going ship came ouer sea capernaum nowe darke iesus came vnto 18 sea swell great winde blow 19 therefore gone forwarde fiue twentie furlonges thirtie see iesus walking vpon sea drew nigh vnto ship afraide 20 hee saith vnto afraid 21 therefore would haue receiued ship ship ariued land whereunto went 14 therefore men myracle seemeth haue successe doe acknowledge christ bee messias christ drift doe turne knoweledge cōceaued cōcerning christ vnto another end vice ouer cōmon amongest men corrupt lye ouerthrow god truth sone hath reuealed vnto thē yea seeme bee entred right way degenerate themselues 15 might make king vvhereas men determined giue vnto christ title honour king proceede reason point greatly deceiued take themselues libertie make king scripture saith belongeth god alone psal 2 6 haue set king c secondly sort faine kingdom namely earthly kingdome altogether contrarie person let v hereby learne dangerous thing inuent thing according reason matter appertaining vnto god forsakyng worde god nothing froward quicknesse wit cannot corrupt doth colour zeale helpe contumelious god disordered worshippe man shoulde impugne glory set purpose vve know furious endeuours enemy extinguish christes glory extreamest violence nayled vpon crosse meanes saluation obtained world christ himselfe triumphed gloriously ouer death satā suffered made king quite ouerthrowē spirituall kingdome gospel bin eternally slaundered hope saluation quite extinguished successe feigned worshippinges honour rashly inuented men haue doe onely dishonour god hauing spoyled true honour vve must also note worde carry away would carry away christe saith euangelist woulde violently make king although vvherfore desirous haue honor giue vnto approued must alwayes regard requireth truly thrust vpon god honour inuented themselues doe iniurie sort seeing obedience foundation true worship furthermore doe hereby learne reuerently must remaine pure simple worde god sone turne aside little truth infected leauens nowe made vnlike selfe worde god promised redeemer king inuent owne head earthly kingdome giue kingdome contrary worde god often doe mixe opinion worde god faith doth degenerate friuoulous coniectures therefore let faithfull accustome themselues vnto modestie least satan carry away peruers feruentnesse zeale doe violently runne vpon god like gyants worshipped aright imbrace offering himselfe vnto v wonder headlong boldnesse fiue thousand men afraide least prouoke weapon pilate empire rome thē creating new king certaine would neuer haue gone farre vnlesse trusting oracle prophetes hoped god side meanes haue vpper hande meane season doe erre feigning kingdome prophetes commend therfore farre hauing god indeuours christ doth rather withdraw himselfe thing caused miserable men wander longe darknesse tyme papistrie god absent bolde pollute worshippe theyr inuentions 16 disciple went downe questionles christe meant stay sight vntill suche time companie gone vvee know hard matter stay vprores people beene openly assayed conceiued theyr mindes rumour ben spread abroad afterward easie matter haue wiped away blot meane season employeth time prayer euangelistes doe report peraduenture god father woulde redresse distemperature people goeth ouer lake myraculously profitable disciple confirme faith againe fruite spreadeth farther people mighte easily gather came thither owne power anye ship beset banke hee must necessitie launch could scarse haue pulled away thence vnlesse seene disciple goe another way 17 darke iohn passeth ouer many circumstance whiche put striuen certaine houres contrarie winde likely first darknes night began arose tempest say christ appeared disciple fourth watch gesse yet middest lake christe appeared vnto iohn saith gone siue twentie thirtie furlong deceiued think sayled crosse vnto banke bethsaida nigh wherunto luke doth testifie myracle wrought capernaum ship arriued placed one side plinie sift booke saith lake six myles broade sixteene long iosephus third booke ye warres iewes saith hundreth furlonges long fortie furlong broade furthermore forasmuch eight furlonges make myle may easily gather hence much one doth disagree wt howsoeuer euangelist drift teach great danger christ shewed himselfe vnto may seeme bee absurd thing christ disciple troubled others sayle quietly lorde doth thus exercise child oftentimes great daungers may freely familiarly know deliuerance 19 afraid euangelistes expresse cause feare thought spirite cannot shalbe cast downe afraid see spirite thinke either satan doth delude v god doth foreshew thing iohn doth place glasse set eies knowledge haue christe without worde hee bringeth shewe bare token diuinitie doe fall away vnto inuentions euery man forgeth idoll insteede christe errours minde followeth trembling confused feare minde soone beginneth speak voyce gather euident sound knowledge also shineth myndes ioy gladsome peace wordes great weight afraide wee hereby taught wee haue large matter confidence presence christ aloneioh 18 6▪ may bee quiet voide care appertaineth vnto christ disciple shal see afterward wicked throwen voice cause difference sent iudge vnto destructiō reprobate vnbeleeuers wherefore cannot abide behold swallowed vp godly doe acknowledge giuen mediatour soone heare named thing certaine pledge god loue owne saluation pluck vp heartes raysed death life behold ioyfully cleare heauen sit quietly vpon earth hauing vpper hande euils set aide danger hee doth comfort worde lift vp hee doth also deede take feare staying tempest 22 day following multitude stoode beyonde sea saw ship saue whereinto disciple went iesus came disciple sea disciple wente awaye alone 23 furthermore ship came tyberias nigh place eat bread lorde giuen thankes 24 therefore multitude sawe iesus neither disciple • went vp also ship came capernaum seeking iesus 25 found beyond sea said vnto master camest thou hyther 22 day following euangelist reciteth circumstance wherby multitude might gather christ passage diuine one ship saw launche without christ day following came ship another place wherein carried capernaum found christe therefore remaineth came thyther myraculously wordes small consequence yet notwithstanding sense plaine enough former member iohn saith one ship went banke presence christ afterward addeth came ship tyberias wherein multitude came sate vpon banke besetting landing place least christe shoulde escape 23 nigh place eate bread meaning word doubtfull may expounded thus either tyberias nigh place filled christe fiue loaues ship arriued bank nigh place better like latter exposition bethsaida nigh whereunto luke expresseth myracle wrought midway betweene tyberias capernaum therefore ship came downe frō vpper place sayled along banke vpon multitude stoode bee doubted arriued take passingers vvhen iohn saith againe christe gaue thankes superfluous repetition meaning christ obtaine prayer loaues might sufficient feede manye men withall wee colde slouthful slow prayer therefore beateth one thing twise 25 ouer sea vve said yt citie capernaum situate banke tyberias standeth parte lake brodest bethsaida foloweth afterward capernaum lyeth neathermost part farre going iordan whereas iohn placeth beyond lake must vnderstoode region directly placed lake croked neathermost part reason creeke went betweene could iourney without going farre therfore euangelist saith beyond sea common custome streight passage vnlesse went water 26 iesus answered said verily verily say vnto yee seek haue seene signes haue eaten loaues filled 27 labour meate perisheth meate remaineth vnto eternall life sonne man giue hath god father sealed 28 therfore saide vnto shall doe may worke work god 29 iesus answered said vnto worke god beleeue hath sent 26 iesus answered christ doth answer question may set foorth vnto power myracle doeth rather chide runne headlong without hauing consideration true lawfull reason render sought christ another thing christe himselfe therefore fault noted seeke christe belly sake myracles yet cannot denyed respect vnto myracle yea euangelist saide mooued myracles followe christ abuse myracles vnto straunge end doth worthily cast teeth haue greater respect vnto bellie vnto myracles say goe forward workes god ought beene true profiting haue acknowledged christe bee messias haue giuen themselues taught gouerned haue gone toward heauenly kingdome god beeing guide looke hand bee well world furthermore spoyle christe principall power giuen father cause reuealed himselfe vnto mē cause may reforme endowed holy ghost according image god may leade euerlasting life clothed righteousnes therfore skilleth much respect christ myracles yt doth desire attaine vnto kingdome god sticketh fast commodity present life seeketh thing fill bellie like day many would gladly embrace gospel beeing voide bitternes crosse bring delight flesh yea see many offer themselues serue christ may liue merily freely hope gain feare sake whome please doe professe themselues christ disciple therefore chiefest thyng seeking christ contemning worlde seeke kingdome god righteousnesse thereof men well persuaded themselues assure themselues seek christ well corrupt whole power christ accustomed manner doth double word verilie hee would oathe bring light vice lyeth hid vnder hypocrisie 27 vvorke teacheth whereunto would haue wh • lie bent namely vnto eternall life reason gr • ssenes nature alwayes addicted vnto earthly thinges therefore doth first correct disease ingendered v sheweth must doe doctrine simple plaine labour incorruptible meate knew men sens tyed vnto earthly care doth first commaund acquit themselues snare may arise vp heauen forbiddeth labour may get themselues dayly foode telleth must preferre heauēly life earthly cause liuing godly stranger world may make hast heauenly countrie secondly wee must marke drift place corrupt power christ addicted belly earthly thinges hee sheweth ought seeke hym cause ought seeke vseth metaphor agreeable vnto circumstance communication mention made meate might haue said without vsing figure behoueth setting aside care worlde striue attaine vnto heauenly life run meate like beastes christ frameth speech metaphorically calleth meate whatsoeuer doth appertaine vnto newnes life vve know soules fed doctrine gospel whilest worketh effectually v power spirite therefore seeing faith life soule thing soeuer nourish faith compared meate hee calleth kinde meate vncorruptible saith remaineth vnto eternall life may know soules fed day brought vp vnto hope blessed immortalitie lord beginneth worke saluation may finish vntyll day christ therefore meet receiue giftes spirite may ken pledge eternall life although reprobate doe oftentimes refuse meate hauing tasted thereof doth remaine yet doe faithfull perceiue force soule abiding perceiue force spirite neuer fraile giftes yea neuer falleth away reason friuolous gather word worke doe merite euerlasting life workes christ haue said doth figuratiuely exhort men applie study vnto meditating vpon heauenly life whereas wont otherwise bee set wholy vpon worlde christ remoueth doubt saith giueth meate man doth obtain industrie hath gifte shew contrarietie word yet two thing easily agree together spirituall meat soule free gift christ standeth v vpon endeuour made partaker great good thing hath god father sealed confirmeth sentence next going appointed father end old writer falsly wrest place vnto diuine essence christ said sealed print expresse image father doth intreat place subtilly eternall essence commanded inioyned office furthermore must hope hand furthermore fit metaphor alludeth vnto auncient custome sealed ringes would establish authoritie christ may seem take thing himselfe affirmeth office laide vpon father decree father reuealed grauen seale summe seeing euerie man office feed ye soules vncorruptible meat christ commeth foorth promising himselfe authour great good thing addeth moreouer approued god sent vnto men marke seale hereupon foloweth studie shall voyd shall offer soules christe fead let v know therefore haue life offered v christ euerie one v may looke attaine vnto y• al aduē tures sure haue successe notwithstāding also taught giltie falshood theft god whosoeuer attribute praise vnto saue vnto christ vvhereby appeareth papist false forger pointes doctrine whosoeuer put christ place meanes saluation often mar seale god authentical blotting wicked boldnes vnspeakeable falshood least yt fal ye horrible giltinesse let v learn reserue perfect vntouched christ giuē father 28 vvhat shall c multitude vnderstood well enough christ exhorted striue go higher vnto cōmodities life must occupied earth whō god • alleth vnto another place aske questiō som point deceiued know way labor think god doth giue v hand sonn whatsoeuer necessary vnto spirituall life first demaund must doet afterward name work god wander without mark bewray know grace god althogh seem proudly murmur christ reprehend vndeseruedly say doest thou think haue care eternall life doest thou commaund v vnderstand work god workes hee requireth alloweth • 9 worke god spake workes christe reclaimeth thē vnto one work alone namely vnto faith vvhereby giueth v • nderstand al vaine whatsoeuer men goe without faith faith alone sufficient god requyreth one thing v beleeue certaine secrete opposition betweene faith men study indeuours hee haue saide men indeuours vaine go please god without faith running way goe towarde marke therefore excellent place much soeuer mē doe miserablie wearie themselues whole life yet theyr labour vaine vnlesse faith vnto rule liuing gather place faith gift god deceiued christ doth teach god worketh v requireth haue notwithstanding seemeth bee absurd thing god allow nothing saue faith alone loue must contemned neither doe office godlines loose place honor therfore howsoeuer faith chief yet work superfluous vve may easily answere faith doth exclude either loue good worke seeing comprehendeth thē faith called worke god wee possesse christ made child god may gouerne v spirite therefore christ doth separate faith fruites thereof maruell say place head helme therein vve haue said third chapter worde beleeue doth signifie vve must alwayes remember may know force faith must define christ wee beleeue giuen v father men cauill rotten nought worth vnder colour place doe hold iustified workes faith doe iustifie seeing called first principal worke manifest enough christe speaketh vnproperly calleth faith worke paule compareth law faith law workes together secondly whenas say men iustified workes vnderstand workes merite whereof men purchase fauour god faith bringeth nothing vnto god doth rather present man emptie poore god may filled christ grace vvherefore passiue worke may call whereunto rewarde repaied neither doth giue vnto man righteousnesse saue receiueth hee doth call bread obiect manna vnto therfore sufficient set another bread doctrine simple soules liue inward power may say borow life christ hee commeth vnto defineth manner eating namely receiue faith neither doth whit profite vnbeleeuers christ bread life continue alwayes emptie christ made bread wee come hungrie vnto may fill v come vnto christ beleeue haue one signification place former worde effect faith expressed namely enforced feeling pouertie flie vnto christe aske life furthermore gather place eating christe nothing el saue faith onely reason scarse fitly enough purpose graunt indeed eate christ otherwise saue beleeuing • • ating selfe rather effect fruite faith faith neither doth faith behold christe alone far imbraceth may made dwell v maketh v grow one body haue one life finally one therefore true christ eaten faith alone also vnderstand sort faith ioyneth v hee shall neuer bee thirst seemeth added contrary reason office bread quench thirst howsoeuer doeth satisfie whiche may compel man externall motion yet notwithstanding effectuall motion holy spirit maketh men vnwilling willing vvherfore false prophane none drawen saue willing man shew himselfe obedient vnto god owne motion men follow god willingly haue hath framed heartes obey 45 written prophetes christ confirmeth whiche saide testimonie iesaias man commeth vnto saue father draweth calleth prophetes spirite wherby drawen may necessarily beleeue two member quite ouerthrowen libertie free whereon papistes doe dreame wee begin come vnto christe father hath drawen v beginning faith v neyther preparation againe doe come whome father hath taught doth giue earnest faith faith selfe therefore doe willingly obey direction spirite parte grace sealing god draw v reaching hand left v choise 51 liuely bread doth oftentimes repeate thing neither thing needefull knowen euery man doth perceiue owne part hardly wee doe beleeue howe easily quickly doe forget vve desire life doe wander frowardly foolishly wayes seeking greatest sort doth lothsomely refuse offered vnto doth feigne vnto himselfe life without christe howe many christe alone satisfie therefore superfluous repetition whilest christe doth often affirme alone sufficient giue life doth challenge himselfe alone tytle bread hee may plucke myndes feygned hope liuing hee doth call liuing bread called bread life y• sense wherein called liuely hee doth oftentimes make mention comming downe heauen spirituall vncorruptible life shall found worlde shape whereof passeth vanisheth away heauenly kingdome god often putteth worde eate exhorteth v vnto faith maketh v inioy bread vnto life vaine vouchsafe reach foorth hande may put bread mouth yea lord doth euen reach vnto mouth tast som gorge thēselues winde othersome like tantalus nigh vnto meate selfe sluggishnes hungrie bread whiche giue secret force giuing life wherof spake might bee referred vnto diuine essence doth discende vnto seconde degree teacheth life consisteth fleshe may bee drawen thence truly wonderfull purpose god hee hath set v life fleshe wherein matter death mean prouideth infirmitie whi lest doth call v aboue cloudes inioy life sheweth vpon earth lift v hidden place kingdome meane season correcting pride nature hee alloweth humilitie obedience faith whilest commaundeth craue life rest stay flesh see contemptible obiected contrarie flesh christ cannot giue life subiect death selfe immortall secondly doth agree nature flesh quicken soules answere although power doe come thyng el flesh yet let title doeth aptly agree thereunto eternall worde god fountaine life fleshe doeth powre vnto v conduit life resteth say inwarde diuinitie sense called liuely imparteth vnto v life borroweth shalbe plaine enough consider cause life namely righteousnesse although righteousnesse doe flow god alone yet wee haue fully giuen vnto v onely flesh christ redemption man fulfilled offered sacrifice satisfaction sinnes obedience perfourmed towardes god might reconcile vnto v also sprinckled sanctification spirite receiued heauenly glory death ouercome therefore followeth partes life placed man canne iustly complaine depriued life hid farre vvhich giue life worlde worde giue diuersly taken former giuing whereof hee maketh mention done daylye namely often christe doth offer himselfe vnto v seconde place meaneth onely giuing done vpon crosse offered himselfe vnto father sacrifice hee gaue himselfe vnto death life men inuiteth v reap fruite death nothing profite v sacrifice offered vnlesse eate holy banket furthermore must note christ challengeth himselfe office sacrificing flesh vvhereby appeareth wicked sacrilege papistes pollute themselues doe masse vsurpe proper priest onely 52 therefore iewes striue amongest themselues saying hee giue v flesh eate 53 therefore iesus said vnto verilie verilie say vnto vnlesse shall eat flesh sonne man shall drinke blood haue life 54 hee eateth flesh drinketh blood hath eternall life downe heauen father eat manna dyed eateth bred shall liue euer 52 therefore iewes striue hee nameth iewes againe honour sake may cast teeth vnbeliefe doe receiue familiar doctrine concerning eternall life least enquire vnmodestly thing yet dark doubtful signe frowardnes contempt saith contende doe dispute contentiously stoppe way themselues cannot come vnto knowledge truth neither simplie reprehended aske concerning meanes reprehension fall vpon abraham blessed virgin therefore either deceiued ignorance deale vncourteously passing ouer lust boldnesse contend whiche euangelist doth condemne doe tosse worde wickednesse iewes enquyre manner eating rather imputed vnto slouthfulnesse vnto obedience faith keepe knot doubtes vnloosed willingly wittingly losed v word lord vvherfore onely lawfull enquire manner eating flesh christ also profitable v know farre foorth expounded scripture away twise stubborne colour humilitie one saying christ sufficient affirmeth flesh meate deede willingly blinde rest heretikes may haue colour willingly ignorant christ conceaued holy ghost beleeuing seed abrahā search farther vve must holde moderation secrete workes god desire knowe setteth downe worde 53 verilie verilie say vnto indignation wring christe oath saw grace refused proud contempt▪ doth vse plaine doctrine doth also intermingle threatnings make afraid withall denounceth eternall destruction vnto shall refuse fet life flesh hee shoulde say despise fleshe knowe yee remaineth hope life vengeance remaineth contemners grace christe▪ doe wickedly perish pride bee vrged precise seueritie may proceede flatter themselues doe threaten death vnto sicke men refuse remedy shall wicked doe endeuour much lyeth abolish life selfe saith flesh sonne man hath great force toucheth contempt arise thereupon saw like vnto men meaning therfore wordes contemne pleasure humble base sight flesh yet life included contemptible flesh whereof depriue selues shall finde el quicken grosse error mē old thought infant depriued eternal life vnlesse sacrament lord body giuen speaketh supper euerlasting participation wee haue without vse supper boemians dealt well whenas prooue testimony vse cuppe ought bee common vnto general touching infant christ institution doth barre partaking supper cannot yet try themselues obserue memorial death christ institution maketh cup cōmon vnto together bread hee commaundeth v drinke thereof 54 hee eateth flesh repetition superfluous confirmeth harde beleeue soules otherwise fed flesh blood bodie susteined meate drinke therefore late testifie vnto men remaineth nothing death seeke life el saue flesh hee doth encourage godly vnto good hope whilest promiseth life vnto fleshe note dothe often adioyne resurrection vnto eternall life saluation shall lye hid vntill day therefore man feele haue christe saue hauing ouercome ye world doth set last resurrection eye appeareth plainely wordes place vntruly expounded supper true thrust vnto holy table lord made partaker flesh blood men find life lyke sort truly byn foolish vnseasonable thing reason concerning supper yet instituted therefore certain doth intreate continuall eating faith yet notwithstanding also confesse ther nothing said place figured supper indeed perfourmed vnto faithfull christ would haue holy supper bee seale sermō reason iohn maketh mention supper therefore augustine followeth naturall order whilest expounding chapter doth touch supper vntil come vnto end teacheth mysterie represented sacrament often church doe celebrate holy supper place euery day place sabboth dayes 55 flesh meate indeede confirmeth thing wordes body pyneth away hunger shall soule perish hūger vnlesse refreshed heauenly bread whē affirmeth flesh meate indeede giueth v vnderstande soules hungrie want meate therefore thou shalt finde life christ thou shalt seeke matter life flesh▪ must boast paule nothing excellent v saue christe crucified soone departed sacrifice death see nothing death neither doth bring v way vnto feeling diuine power saue onely death resurrection therefore embrace christ seruaunt father may shew himselfe vnto thee prince life made himselfe poore meanes inriched aboundance good thinges humbling descending hell hath lifted v vp heauē taking vpō curse crosse hath erected noble ensigne righteousnesse therefore peruers interpreter leade away soules flesh christe doth christe make mention apart blood conteined vnder fleshe answer hee respect vnto ignoraunce maketh mention meate drinke seuerally telleth v life giueth respectes perfect least feigne vnto selues halfe life vnperfect life hee say shal want part life eate flesh drink blood also y• supper agreeth doctrin contented signe bread addeth also cuppe hauing double token life may learne content alone doubtlesse man shall finde part life christ saue hee shal bee perswaded hee vnto whole perfect life 56 hee eateth flesh another confirmation seeing alone hath life himselfe prescribeth meanes inioy eate flesh say meanes wherby made saue faith directed vnto flesh shall neuer come vnto christ god neglecteth hee man vvherefore thou wilt haue thing doe christ thou must aboue thing beware thou loath flesh vvhen saith abideth v much say bond vnitie meanes groweth one v faith leaneth vnto death furthermore may againe gather hence maketh mention outwarde signe many infidel receiue yet continue aliants frō christ furthermore place refuted doting iudas lesse receiue body christ rest whilest christ reached bread vnto doctrine foolishly restrained vnto externall signe must hold said doctrine set downe sealed certaine iudas neuer member christ secondly absurde imagine flesh christ dead without aspirite last laughed doe dreame eating christ flesh without faith seeing y• faith may say mouth stomacke soule 57 liuing father hath sent christ hath hytheto taught must made partaker life passeth ouer vnto principall cause first beginning life father preuenteth obiection might seeme take god appertaineth vnto made himselfe cause life therfore maketh himselfe authour life sort graunteth giuen another ministreth vnto others let v also note sentence applied vnto capacitie vnto christ spake doth compare himselfe vnto father respect fleshe although father beginning life notwithstanding eternall worde also properly life christ entreateth place eternall diuinitie setteth himselfe v reuealed himselfe vnto world clothed flesh therefore saith liueth father doth agree bare diuinitie neither yet doth appertain simplie selfe vnto humane nature title sonne god reuealed flesh secondly know christe doth commonly ascribe vnto father diuine thing soeuer himselfe must note three degree life reckoned vp place liuing father hath first place foūtain yet placed farre hidden sonne followeth whō haue laid vnto v fountaine life powred vnto v third life doe draw wee know summe god father whose power life farre distant v christ placed middle second cause life may come vnto v thence otherwise lie hid god 58 bread returneth vnto comparison manna flesh began haue ended speech thus cause yee preferre moses hee fedde father desert seing giue farre better meat bring heauenly life said bread said come downe heauen tasteth earthly corruptible thing breatheth immortalitie kingdome god tryed power manna bent feed bellie whereas double vse manna iewes christ disputeth place loke vnto nothing corporall meat life soule fraile groweth better vntil whole man shalbe renued 59 thinges said synagogue teaching capernaum 60 therefore many disciple heard saide hard counted wonder ryse troupe conspire together maner example shal say vvherfore let v deeply imprint mind historie lest time doe murmur christe hee speaketh secondly wee see anye suche like thing others let theyr pryde trouble faith 60 hard saying nay rather hardnes heart saying reprobate wont sort gather together stone worde god whereat may stumble runne headlong christe harde stubbornnesse complaine word harde ought rather make soft whosoeuer shall humblie submit himselfe vnto christ doctrine hee shall finde harde sharpe matter therin shalbe vnto vnbeleeuers shall stubbornely set manner reuoltes conferred christe bin better hope opened way vnto doctrine murmur amongst themselues exclude themselues frō learning therefore nothing better doe first vnderstand lord meaning come straightway vnto may open vnto v doubtes doth offend christ seemeth place much remoue offence encrease yet man doe narrowly weigh cause offence sentence ought haue appeased mindes low base estate christ saw eye seeing clothed flesh differed nothing common sort men vnto let could giue place diuine power hauing pulled away vaile reclaimeth vnto beholding heauenly glory say conuersant amongst men doe make one person christ applie proper one vnto 63 spirite giueth life wordes christ teacheth doctrine successe amongest iewes whereas spirituall liuely findeth eares scarse wel prepared place hath diuersly expounded first requisite knowe true naturall meaning wordes hereby shall easily see christ drift denieth flesh doth profite chrysostome iudgement doth well referre vnto iewes carnall confesse indeede force man wit doeth vanishe awaye quaile heauenly mystery meaning christes wordes vnlesse violently wrested lyke sort sense shoulde bee farre fet contrarie namely illumination spirite doth quicken neither doe say well say flesh christ doth profite insomuch crucified bringeth good vnto v eaten must rather eate may profite v crucified augustine thinketh word alone selfe ought vnderstood ought ioyned spirite agreeth thing selfe christ doth simplie respect maner eating therfore doth exclude manner commoditie could none bee reapt flesh doth affirme shall vnprofitable bee separated spirit whence hath flesh doth quicken saue spirituall therefore whosoeuer shall remaine earthly nature flesh shall finde nothing dead shall lift vp eye vnto power spirit wherwith flesh besprinkled shall perceiue called liuely vaine verye effect experience faith know flesh meate indeed yet profiteth nothing namely meate haue life god reconciled vnto v haue partes saluation fulfilled profiteth nothing esteemed according y• beginning nature ye seed abrahā selfe subiect death shal giue life receiueth spirite wherewith feedeth v vvherefore ende may nourished indeede must bring spirituall mouth faith breuitie sentence short thought christe thus thought ought thus deale vnbeleeuers therefore brake speech sentence vnworthie haue speech meane neglect godly readie taught haue heere fewe woordes may satisfie aboundantly wordes speake alludeth vnto sentence next going taketh worde spirit another sense spake secrete power spirite doth finely applie vnto doctrine spirituall doubted whether ambition moue thē desire christ might become famous although graunt yet manifest contemptiblie mocke doe thinke dealeth according reason counsell yea cast foolishnesse teeth woulde something distrusting himselfe dare come abroad may seene men vvhen say thy disciple may also see doe speake continually would gather himselfe euery whole nation adde afterward thou wilt knowen men meane season thou lyest hid thou doest thing thou doest desire honour al men may speake thee make mē looke vpō thee set world men amongst liued without honour may also another sense bee gathered wordes thou doest thinges seeing thou arte endewed greate power thou purchasest fame vnto thy selfe myracles loose whatsoeuer giuen thee god thou spendest heere vaine whereas fit witness iudges see great slacknesse men considering vpon workes god christes kinsman woulde neuer haue spoken thus vnlesse troden vnder foote plentifull testimony diuine power ought haue receiued reuerenced great gaue counsell amisse concerning matter whiche knewe secondly proueth altogether carnall saith world cannot hate thē peace world must redeemed wicked consent vnto vice manner euill 7 hateth testifie worlde taken place men borne againe retaine owne nature therefore whosoeuer begotten againe yet spirite christ pronounceth aduersaries condemneth workes sobeit stay selues vpon christ iudgement must needes graunt whole nature man corrupt peruers right thing sincere thing good thing proceede thence behold v doth please long abideth home himselfe nowe christe saith hated doth testifie workes world euill giueth v vnderstand gospel cannot rightly preached whole worlde must cited giltie god iudgement seate meanes may trodē flesh blood may brought nought according spirite shall come shall reproue pride arrogancie deadly chiefest vice man spirite alone maketh v meeke gentle suffer selues bee reprehended consequently offer selues slaine sworde gospell 9 said thinges vnto hee abode galilee 10 brother gone vp went himselfe vnto feast also openly priuilie 11 therefore iewes sought holy day said 12 much murmuring concerning company said hee good said nay seduceth multitude 13 notwithstanding
