setteth v christ hated worlde came priuily citie vntill suche time necessitie office dyd compell showe himselfe openly sobeit nothing miserable bee pulled away christe accursed bee peace whiche costeth deare wee muste renounce christe 11 therefore iewes wee must consider state church stande iewes time gape promised redemption hungrie yet christ appeareth vnto thē stand doubt hereupon arise confused murmuring diuers speech murmur priuilie signe tyrannie priestes scribe taken themselues truely horrible example seeing church vpon earth shoulde set v confused disfigured disorder gouerne steed shepheardes doe keepe people vnder feare terrour whole bodie filthie wastnesse dolefull dissipation iewes hee vnderstandeth common sort accustomed heare christ space two yeeres doth seeke hee appeareth according common custome say hee speake knowen man yet notwithstandyng woorde doth shew earnestly affectioned hytherto stande alwayes doubt 12 much murmuring giueth v vnderstande wheresoeuer men assemble themselues company falleth often great assembly passed secrete speech concerning christ dissentiō wherof mētion made place doth declare diuers iudgements men concerning christe euen middest church wee afraide receiue christ condemned long agoe part nation wee must armed sort troubled dissention whiche reigneth day againe may see great rashnesse men matter appertayning vnto god wold haue bin licentious small busines soone ariseth question concerning sonne god holy doctrine doe iudge rashly vvherfore must keepe much greater moderation least doe rashly condemne life eternall truth god sobeit worlde doe count v deceiuers let v remember christe markes meane season wee doe indeede declare speake truth furthermore place sheweth great multitude euen whereas body self confused alwayes thinke well sober minded ouerrunne many mad 13 notwithstanding man spake openly hee calleth chiefe gouernours iewes place whose power gouernment hate christ suffered word spokē either part greeued haue slaundered thought best way burie name forgetfulnesse enemy truth haue tryed cannot preuaile crueltie would couet nothing thē yt remembrance thereof may suppressed goe brought vnder feare kept silence altogether tyrannicall haue saide vnbrideled libertie hath place estate churche well ordered libertie kept vnder feare man dare say thing miserable estate power christ appeare bee much excellent wonderfull getting audience amongest armed enemy furious hatred suche fearefull gouernment defend truth say open mouth 14 halfe holy day past iesus went vppe temple taught 15 iewes wondered saying knoweth man learning seeing hee neuer learned 16 iesus answeared saide doctrine mine sente mee 17 man doe shall knowe doctrine whether god speake selfe 18 hee speaketh himselfe seeketh owne glory hee seeketh glorye sent man speaketh truth vnrighteousnesse 19 moses giue lawe none doth lawe doe ye seeke kill mee 14 went vp temple wee see christ feare fayled duetie cause tarying hee might make sermon famous assemblie therefore may sometimes giue place daunger opportunitie well must omitted neglected hee teacheth temple doth according auncient order custome god commaunded many ceremony hee woulde haue people occupied colde vain sightes cō moditie myght appeare requisite doctrine bee ioyned meanes outward rytes liuely image spirituall thinges haue forme worde god • ow priestes almost dumbe scribe corrupt pure doctrine leauen false gloss christ tooke • ppon office teaching good cause seeing chiefe priest doth shortly affirme hee doth take hand nothing father commandement 15 iewes marueiled deceiued thinke yt christ talke picked greatly liked of▪ iewes doe wonder take occasion despice therefore vnthankfulnes men doe alwaies willingly find matter erre esteeming workes god god doe worke ordinarie meanes common way say meanes appeare vnto eye doe hinder v like vailes seeing hand god therefore acknowledge nothing humaine vnwonted power god doe appeare aboue order nature meanes commonly knowen astonied passeth away dreame haue moued al sens throughly pride wee make account reason whereof doth appeare merueilous token grace power god christ taught master yet notwithstanding excell excellent knowledge scripture yea neuer scholler excellent teacher master▪ cause iewes despice grace god doth exceede capacitie therefore admonished example let v learne vse greater reuerence weighing workes god wont 15 doctrine mine christ telleth iewes whiche vnto offence rather ladder ought carry vp behold glory god shold say vvhen see teacher trayned vp schoole men confesse hee taught god heauenly father would therfore rather haue sonne come carpenter shop schooles scribe ende beginning gospell might famous least man shoulde thinke forged vppon earth least man shoulde feigne man authour thereof likewise christe choose himselfe ignorant men idiot apostle suffered continue grosse ignorance three yeeres taught one moment might bring foorth newe men consequently angel came downe heauen mean season christ sheweth whence must set authority spirituall doctrine namely frō god alone wheras denieth yt doctrin father hath respect vnto capacitye auditorie therein higher opinion man therefore concession graunting suffereth himselfe thought differ father notwithstanding speaketh nothing commaunded summe teacheth father name man neither proceed man may freely contemned vvee see argumeent winneth authoritie doctrine namely referring vnto god author therof vve see also right reason hee desireth bee heard namely hee sent father teacher therefore meete hee haue whosoeuer doeth take vppon office teaching beleeued 17 man preuention cutteth contrary obiections▪ seeing many aduersaries euerie man might easily murmur doest thou tell v name god doe acknowledge thou camest vvhy doest thou enforce vpon v principle graunt vnto thee thou teachest nothing commaundeth thee therefore christ gathereth right iudgement doeth flowe feare god reuerence therefore mindes framed vnto feare god easily know whether true preacheth vvherby toucheth also way commeth passe cannot discerne saue chiefe point vnderstanding faileth namely godlinesse desire obey god sentence chiefly noted satan lyeth wayte v continually setteth snare euery side hee may take v subtiltie place christ armeth v well take heed may neuer subiect seducings namely readie obey god faile v lighten v light spirite may able discerne truth lying therefore nothing hindereth v iudging aright saue vnapt taught stubborne iustly punished hypocrisie often satan doth delude v moses telleth vsdeut 13 3 false prophetes arise tempted prooued lord shall neuer deceiued shalbe right heart heereby appeareth wickedly foolishly many men doe keepe back themselues studie desire learne feare whilest afraid least erre spoken vaine knock shall bee opened vnto let v rather doubt bee fully perswaded spirite discretion giuen vsmat 7 7 continuall guide wholy giuen serue obey god men desposed erre shall length perceiue vaine cloakes colour ignorance truly whosoeuer doe doubt day rather nourish doubting either reading hearing earnestly enquire truth god see men doe carelesly contemne god generall principle one man say prayeth dead distrusting owne wit dare condemne wicked mē inuent concerning purgatorie meane season graunt himselfe libertie play whoremonger another man say hee hath wit enough distinguish betweene pure doctrine christe corrupt inuentions men meane hee haue enough steale forsweare finally men holde nothing pretende vayle doubting matter day called question bewray manifest contempt god matter nothing darke therfore cause wee shoulde marueile doctrine gospel day receiued fewe seeing feare god rare worlde word christ 〈◊〉 contained true definition godlinesse namely readie follow god heart man vnlesse abandon himselfe owne conceit speake selfe vve must note christ woulde haue v iudge euerie doctrine haue v receiue without doubting god doth freely permit v refuse yt man setteth downe marke onely whereby may discerne betwene doctrine 18 hee speaketh himselfe hath hytherto taught cause men blinde gouerned feare god addeth another marke doctrine selfe whereby may know whether man doctrine god doctrine soeuer doth set foorth glory god holy diuine doctrine soeuer doth serue ambition men doth darken glorie god extolling doth deserue credite ought sharply reiected therfore shal neuer erre shall set face glory god aime shal neuer deceiued shew right shal try touchstone brought name god vve also taught hereby man faithfully vndertake office teacher church saue void ambition shall take one thing hand al might maine glory god vvhen saith vnrighteousnes giueth v vnderstand ther wicked deceitful thing doth whiche becommeth good sincere minister god 19 moses euangelist doth recite wordes christ order doth onely gather briefly principall pointes thing appertaine vnto summe whole matter priest scribe incensed healed man sick palsey professed zeale law▪ end may refute hypocrisie draweth argument matter person al licenciously pamper themselues vice neuer knowen law gathereth thence touched loue desire law truly defence sufficient proue matter admit graunt paint wicked vniust hatred false colour yet notwithstanding followeth hereupon christ well committed thing cō trarie appointment y• law must set mittigatiō fault men offence christ doth place ioyne two member together former appealeth vnto conscience enemy seeing proudly boast patrones law plucketh visure face obiecteth vnto graunt themselues leaue breake law often therefore cared lawe done descendeth vnto matter selfe shall see full perfect defence consisteth vpon partes therfore summe member zeale law despicers therof vvhereupon christ inferreth iewes enforced vnto great madnesse cause whilest couet kill sort must pul wicked lurking dennes often set themselues god sound doctrine feigning doe vpon godly affection day bitter enemy gospel stoute defender papistrie haue nothing wherewith doe purchase fauour moued feruentnesse zeale life bee throughly examined altogether polluted filthie crime doe openly mocke god vvho knoweth grosse epicurisme doth reigne pope courte doe bishop abbot shamefully couer filthinesse shew religion doth appeare monkes also suche brawler giuen ouer vnto wickednes lust couetousnes al monster wickednes life doth crie haue quite forgotten god seeing ashamed make boast zeale god church brideled answere christ 20 companie answered said thou hast diuell seeketh kill thee 21 iesus answered said vnto haue done one 24 iudge according outward sight iudge right iudgement 20 thou hast diuell much said▪ thou art mad common • speech amongst iewes exercised doctrine men possesed diuel whenas go mad vnderstanding reason taken truly light moderate chasticements fatherly correction god handeleth v hardly sharply seemeth strike v hand rather vse ye diuel executioner minister wrath multitude chideth christ single circumcised iurie exāple doth defend fact althogh doth simply reason like thing comparison greater thing lesser circumcision healing man sick palsey like worke god christ proueth second excellent benefite extended vnto whole man furthermore cured man onely corporall disease comparison haue nothing worth circumcision appertaineth health soule excellent therefore christ ioyneth spirituall fruit effectually curing man sick palsey doe rather imbrace former exposition iewes maliciously reprochfully find fault work wherein grace god doth plainly appeare circumcision much honor think sabboth right saue shall bee giuen according truth matter soone person come abroade turne eye sens men vnto truth doth vanishe away admonition ought force cause matter necessarie haue heauenly doctrine hand therfore sought take man laid hand hower yet come 25 certaine men ierusalem namely knew lying wayt ruler knewe greatly christ hated common people wee saw little counted dreame doting therfore knewe often see straunge worke god marueile indeed meane season commeth consideration god power minde dutie wisely weigh workes god especially seeing wicked haue assayed thing doe hinder course gospel would desire may surely think endeuours void god able throw hand set 27 know whence man heere doe see howe great blindnesse men iudge diuine matter vice almost ingendred haue witte enough lay stumbling blockes themselues may come vnto knowledge truth doe oftentimes fall offence subtiltie satan may driue away moste men christ way plaine equall euery man would feigne vnto himselfe offence long ruler knew christ multitude would haue beene letted vnbeliefe alone whenas impediment remoued inuent new cause least come vnto christ yea whereas meet moued example ruler farre following right willingly stumble first step euen men haue begun well wont faile sort vnles lord direct going euē vnto end furthermore argument wherwith hinder themselues prophet haue testified beginning christ shalbe vnknowē know whence man came therefore bee taken christ hereby taught dāgerous thing teare peeces scripture consequently christ himselfe may iudged halfe himselfe god promised deliuerer seed dauid challengeth office euery vnto himselfe proper himselfe therefore requisite god reuealed flesh hee might redeemer churchmich 5 2 micheas assigneth place christ borne thee bethleehem shall arise captaine may gouerne people immediately speaketh higher going therefore hidden secrete miserable men whilest respect nothing christ saue subiect contempt doe rashlye gather promised therefore let v learne behold christ humble ye flesh humilitie despised amongest wicked may extoll v vnto heauenly glory bethlehem haue beene borne man shall vnto v gate may goe vnto eternall god 28 therefore iesus cryed hee inueigheth bitter wordes theyr rashnes pleasing themselues proudly false opinion exclude themselues knowledge truth shoulde say whilest know thinges know nothyng truly worse plague confidence little knowledge men haue doth make drunken doe carelesly reiect whatsoeuer contrarie meaning hee speaketh tauntingly saith yee know mee yee know whence came selfe setteth true opinion falsely conceiued say whilest haue eye fastened vpon earth doe also thinke wholy subiect thinges therefore contemne base start vp god testifie came heauen therfore howsoeuer doe reiect mee god indeede acknowledge calleth god true sense wherein paule calleth faithful saith vnsaithful continueth faithfull cannot denie himselfe 2 tim 2 23 drift whit credite gospell diminished howsoeuer worlde doe goe supplant much soeuer wicked pull christ yet doth remaine perfect truth god remaineth alwayes sound like himselfe christ seeth despised hee farre yeelding doth rather couragiously tryumph mad arrogancie set nothing becommeth al faithfull endewed inuincible heroicall stoutnes yea faith shall neuer firme stable vnlesse set light frowardnes wicked arise christe 〈◊〉 doth especially become together destroy derideth endeuours goe thinges vaine vntill time time appointed father come casteth stubbernesse teeth doe onely refuse grace offered vnto doe also furiously resist doth also threaten shalbe taken away shortly vvhen saith hee toucheth vnthankfulnes whereas hee giuen father whereas descended heauenly glory whereas inuiting vnto himselfe familiarly desired nothing present yet admit hym vvhen saith yet little telleth god long suffer grace filthilie despiced meane season hee giueth vnderstande neither life death subiect time appointed father must fulfilled goe vnto sent mee word called flood plurall number whiche necessarie vnto spirituall life soule bee briefe aswell perpetuitie giftes spirite aboundance thereof promised v place doe thinke water doe flow bellie beleeuers endowed spirit doth impart part vnto brother ought mutuall participation amongest v notwithstanding sense seemeth bee simple whosoeuer shall beleeue christ shall haue well life springing like christe said fourth chapter hee shall drinke water shall neuer bee thirst whereas ordinarie drinke doth quenche thirst short time christ saith doe draw vp faith spirite whiche fountaine water leaping vnto eternall life yet notwithstanding doth teach faithfull full christe first day afterward neither hungred thirst rather enioying christ doth kindle new desiring sense isrom cap 8 10 spirit like liuely fountain runneth alwaies faithfull like paule also doth testifie life v although doe yet carry matter death relikes sin truly seeing euerie one made partaker giftes spirite according measure faith perfect fulnes thereof life mean season faithful aspire oftentimes vnto new encreasings spirit going forward faith first fruites haue vnto sufficient vnto continuaunce life heereby wee also admonished howe small measure faithe seeinge grace spirit scarse drop little little v run like flood yeeld vnto christ due place ought faith make v able receiue saith scripture doe restraine vnto former member vnto latter doe extend vnto whole sentence againe iudgement christ doth assigne certaine place scripture taketh testimonie commō doctrine prophet often lord promising aboundance spirite doth compare vnto liuely water doth chiefly respect kingdome christ directeth mind faithfull thyther therfore prophesies concerning liuely water haue fulfilling christ alone hath opened reuealed vnto v hidden treasure god therefore grace spirite powred vpon wee may draw fulnesse therefore worthie miserablie perishe called gently mercifully christ doe wander hyther thither spake spirite spirite sometimes called name water cleannesse proper purge filthinesse place like maner phrase vnlike namely destitute ioyce humor life saue whenas spirit god doth quicken v doth water v secret force figure synecdoche vsed ye part life comprehended vnder one worde water vvhence also gather whosoeuer regenerate spirite christ bee accounted dead howsoeuer boast themselues liue spirite yet vve know spirit eternall euangelist saith grace spirite powred vpon men christ resurrectiō appeare openly long christ conuersant world vnder humble shape feruaunt speaketh comparatiuely like new testament set olde god promiseth spirit vnto faithful neuer giuen vnto father disciple receiued first fruites spirite whence commeth faith spirite therefore euangelist doth simply denie grace spirit giuen vnto godly christ giuing spirite vntill time yet remayneth one question whether vnderstandeth place visible grace spirite regeneration fruite adoption answere spirite appeared visible giftes glass promised comming christ yet doth hee properly intreat place power spirit whereby borne againe made new creature therefore christe glorious indued great maiestie gouernment doth sit right hand god doe lie vpon earth poore hungrie almost voide spirituall giftes bee imputed flownes weaknesse faith 40 therfore many companie heard word said indeed prophet 41 said christ others saide shall christe come galilee 42 saith scripture christ shall come seed dauid towne bethlehem 43 therfore strife companie furthermore certaine would catch man laid handes 40 therfore many companie nowe euangelist reciteth fruit spring last sermon namely whilest one thought one thing another another arose dissention amongest ye people vvee must note iohn speaketh professed enemy christ hated sound doctrin cōmō sort mē ther shold haue bin greater integritie reckoneth vp three sort first confesse deed iesus prophet whereupō gather loath doctrine againe appeareth light friuolous confession whenas allowe teacher yet neither vnderstande tast hee meaneth teacheth could imbrace christ indeed prophet vnlesse acknowledge sonne god authour saluation yet good thing perceiue diuine thing christ bringeth reuerence might easily passe afterwarde vnto saith docilitie second sort better flatly confess • christ others doe gainesay whereupon ariseth conflict example taught ought maruel day men diuers strife cut asunder vvee heare ther arose schisme reason christ word amongest gentile stranger faith euen middest church christ euen principall place church shall therfore doctrine christ blamed matter tumult yea howsoeuer whole world rage ye truth god precious must wish yt may receiued euē vvherfore cause conscience faint whilest see euen wil reckoned amongst people god striue amongst thēselues diuers opinion although must also note dissentiō hath beginning properly frō ye gospel certaine sound agreement men saue certaine truth whereas therfore keepe peace amongest themselues ignorant god proceedeth rather som amazednes true consent agrement briefe dissentions soeuer arise whenas gospel preached cause seed therof laid hid man awaked sleepe begin stirre like vapour proceede thing sunne although doe appeare vntill sunne arise 41 shall christ come least seeme rashly reiect christe arme themselues testimonie scripture althogh wickedly wrest christ yet shew truth deceiued make christ galilean whence came ignorance saue contempt thought much enquire christ appeared vnto notable title borne bethlehem sonne dauid nature ashamed slouthfull small thing snort carelesly mystery kingdome heauen also worthie noting diligent seeke excuse whereby may turne away themselues christ otherwise marueilous slouthfull sluggish receiue sound doctrine behold men wont frame thēselues stumbling block scripture least come vnto christ lead v hand vnto christ 43 certaine wordes euangelist giueth v vnderstand despise christ also adioyned vnto wicked reiecting crueltie desire hurte superstition alwayes cruel whereas endeuoures vain must attributed vnto god prouidence christ hower yet come said trusting father aid couered aboue danger 45 therfore minister came vnto high priest pharisee saide vnto night although one 51 doth law iudge man vnlesse shall heare first shall know doth 52 answered said vnto art thou also gal • lee searche see hath arisen prophet galilee 53 euery man went vnto owne house 45 therfore minister came may see blinde arrogancie wicked loue doe adore greatnes honour wherein excell worlde afraid proudly tread vnder foote equitie right thing fall otherwise would would gladly ioyne heauen earth together whilest wicked priestes demaund christ brought vnto highly extoll power nothing ought haue gainstood cōmandemēt 46 neuer man men doe confesse combes cut tamed word christ alone yet doe repent neither giue due honor vnto word true neuer mā yt spake y• diuine power enforced feele moue heart might giue themselues wholy vnto god meete shoulde iesaias myght fulfilledesay 11 4 shall throwe downe wicked breath mouth moreouer shall afterwarde see sought might put death fell backward beaten downe beetle confounded voyce christe therefore let v learne force christe doctrine doeth euen terrifie wicked seeing turneth destruction let v rather endeuour bee softened broken see many day like vnto minister although doctrine gospel doth cause woonder willes yet far submitting themselues vnto christ notwithstanding remain tent enemy others worse deface defame slaunders doctrine know assuredly conuict owne conscience god 46 also deceiued rate minister notwithstanding keepe vnder obedience woordes meane absurd vnmeete thing stand although people doe faile must marke argument vnderpropped doe proudly vaunt christe say hee hath onlie riffe raffe vnskilfull men side ruler euery notable man set expresse pharisee name fame aswell knowledge holinesse aboue men prince prince obiection seemeth indeed haue colour vnlesse gouernours ruler church haue authority nothing set well neither estate also continue long good order vvee know great distemperature common people wherefore must needes deformed confusion ensue immediately euery man may listeth therefore authoritie gouerners necessarie bridle moderate order church prouided law goddeut 17 9 ther question controuersie arise knowledge thereof high priest power men offend doe challenge themselues chiefest authoritie doe refuse submit themselues vnto god god gaue vnto high priest iudgement would haue giue sentence according lawe therefore authoritie soeuer pastor haue subiect word god brought vnder highest lowest god alone may aboue pastours execute office well sincerely challenge themselues authoritie shalbe holy lawfull boasting whereas bare authoritie men extolled without woorde god vaine friuolous bragging falleth oftentimes wicked doe rule church must beware attribute nothing vnto men soone depart woorde god vvee see almost prophetes vexed griefe gorgeous title prince prieste churche oftentimes obiected ouerwhelme doctrine papist furnished day weapon doe otherwise rage aduersaries christ prophetes horrible blindenesse mortall man afraid set god satā driueth vnto madnesse set ambition truth god meane season part giue reuerence vnto worde god may driue away brightnesse whole worlde may desperse vaine smoakes therof • stood bad case saluation depende vppon ruler faith vnstable shoulde stand fall theyr becke 4 • ▪ companie first part point pride trusting title priesthood would bring al men subiection vnder tyrannously despice men beeing nothing worth like alwayes reprochfull men whosoeuer haue better liking themselues ought contempt brother doth follow immoderate loue selues pronounce whole common people accursed cause colour ignorance lawe another thing lay hid vnder namely thought holinesse saue order like day whi • lest popish shauelings doe onely make b • ast title church despice lay men cal like profane men end god doth appertaine generally vnto child god may gathered together vnto obedience faith • 0 nicodemus said vnto euangelist describeth nicodemus vnto v indifferent man neither dare take vpon earnestly defend godly doctrin neither yet suffer truth oppressed vvhen saith came night serueth partly commendation partly discommendation vnlesse loued doctrine christ durst neuer haue set himselfe f • tie wicked knew whisper hee hated daunger therefore dare say something though faintly shineth small sparkle godlines hart seeing doth freely defend christ •• e doth therein bewray great fearfulnesse diligently many whilest doe pretende like vnto nicodemus hauing visure doe thinke mocke god freely admit wee doe graunt require differ nothing ni • odemus yet pray doth example helpe thē nicodemus saith christ condemned vntill heard truly might much said thiefe royster well knowen famous better giltie acquitted innocent condemned secondly howsoeuer hee desireth lighten person christ leaueth iudgemēt deale vnskilfully thinke wrote neither doe allow subtile saying augustine thinketh difference lawe gospell noted meane • christ write table stone man dust earth christ woulde rather declare matter nothing vnworthie hearde likeas man draw lynes vpon wall whilest another speaketh turne away backe signe declare hee taketh heede vnto thing spoken seeing satan doth day endeuour diuers meanes lead v away right course teaching wee must lightly passe ouer manye thinges obiecteth vnto v papist molest v muche lieth many fruolous cauils cloudes dispearsed ayre godly teacher doe occupie thēselues dispearsing euery one shal begin penelope webbe therefore tr • stes doe nothing el hinde course gospel wisely contemned 7▪ amongest • free hee spake according custom law god hath appointed witness shoulde owne handes slea wicked doersdeut 17 7 according iudgemēt giuen ende might greater religion bearing witnes many men doe runne headlong periurie may ouerwhelme brother think make deadly wounde tongue selfe reason force amongest men though wicked slaunderers brought vnto present matter doe lay away fierce spirites wherewith came puffed vp although wordes christe doe differ prescript lawe god simply admonish shoulde condemne man tongue saue might slea handes place christ requireth perfect innocencie witness man take vpon reuenge fault another man saue perfect pure free fault himselfe must take spoken v spoken namely whosoeuer doth accuse another doe appoint vnto himselfe law innocencie otherwise doe seeke haue euill deed punished rather enuie person ye men meane season seemeth take away iudgement ye world man dare professe himselfe punisher wickednes iudge shall found whose conscience shall bee giltie point witnesse shall come abroad subiect offence therefore seemeth driue away witness common place iudgement al iudges seate iudgement answere simple forbidding whereby christ forbiddeth sinner doe dutie correcting fault men hypocrite alone reprehended wordes seuere yea cruel iudges men faultes doe gently flatter themselues owne vice therefore man owne sinnes shall hinder correcting faultes men need shall require let also punish hate whatsoeuer condemned aswell himselfe others yea wee must begin euery man doe aske owne conscience witnes iudge himselfe descend vnto others shall come passe shal staues end sin without hatred men 9 accused conscience appeareth great force euill conscience hath although wicked hypocrite determined mocke christ cauils yet soone pricketh one worde striken flie away vvith hammer must breake pride hypocrite wit wee must call backe vnto god iudgement although may shame suffer amongst men shall forceable feare god notwithstanding great matter doe confesse themselues giltie owne accord whilest flie away ashamed vve must also note circumstance expressed immediately one exceed another honor much sooner touched giltines would god much shamefastnesse scribe doe able day pope behalfe yt may ouerthrowe christ become shamelesse polluted offence boast may reprochfull without punishment furthermore must note much feeling sin wherewith scribe touched differeth true repentance must moued iudgement god notwithstanding must flie corner fight iudge let v rather run straightway vnto craue pardon iesus left alone spirit wisedome brought passe wicked departed hauing tempted christ vaine neither doubted wee shal escape ouercome al engine enemy sobeit suffer selues gouerned spirite falleth therfore oftentimes oppressed neglecting lying waite nothing carefull take counsell trusting wisdome consider necessarie gouernment spirit v saith christ remained alone left multitude common people taught al scribe brought foorth adultresse trouble longer vvhen said woman abode christ let v learne example nothing better v brought giltie iudgement seat submit selues quietly meckly obediently vnto iudgement 11 neither condemne thee said christ doth simply acquit woman place doeth set libertie neither maruell would take nothing vpon meet person sent father gather together lost sheep israel therfore mindfull vocation exhorteth woman vnto repentance comforteth promise grace gather hence adulterie bee punished death must necessitie graunt reason inheritance diuided christ would make himselfe 〈◊〉 • ayes man busines betwene two brother yea manner wickednes shalbe exempted frō punishment ye lawes adulterer forgiuen repentance word god wherin pardon offered vnto v although exhortation doth respect time come yet remembrance former life doth also humble sinner 12 therfore iesus spake vnto againe saying light world • e followeth shall walke darknes shall haue light life 13 therfore pharisee said vnto thou doest testifie thy selfe thy testimonie true 14 iesus answered said vnto although testifie selfe testimonie true know whence came whither shall go yee know whence came whither shall go 12 light world omit historie next going ioine communication christ sermon whiche made ye last day feast notable title take away difference betwene iewes gentile generall sentence also betwene learned idiot betweene gouernors common sort first must note necessitie seeking light doubtlesse none offer themselues bee illuminated christe saue shall first acknowlege world darknes altogether blind therfore let v know meanes obtaine light shewed vnto v christ condemned blindnes light soeuer think el compared darknes thicke night christ sheweth thing common others challengeth proper perticular vvherupon followeth sparkle true light without commeth deede kinde brightnes onely like vnto lightning doth nothing el make eye dasel furthermore wee must note force part lightning restrained vnto person christ although farre v respect body yet doth shew vnto v light dayly doctrin gospel secret power spirite yet doe wee know perfect definition light vnlesse learne illuminated gospel spirit christ may know hidden fountaine knowledge wisdome hee followeth exhortation put doctrine promise added immediately doth confirme whenas heare danger erring whosoeuer doe suffer christe rule must stirred vp follow hee himselfe draweth v hither stretched hande also large great promise ought bee great force certaine haue sure way middest darknesse shall caste eye vpon christ short time vntill come vnto marke self word future tense import much shall walk darknes shall haue light life purpose serueth last thing wherein continuaunce light plainely expressed vvherfore need feare least faile v middest iourney seeing bringeth v vnto life genetiue case taken adiunct noting effect maner hebricians said liuely light furthermore maruel raigneth grosse thick mist error superstition world seeing fewe beholde christ 13 therfore pharisee said obiect wont cōmonly saide man trusted owne cause true testimonie put steed lawfull testimonie one worthy beleeued short mening looseth word • vaine vnlesse haue proofe 14 testifie christ maketh answere testimonie credite authoritie enough priuate man cō mon sort men beareth farre person saith knoweth whence commeth whither goe • doth exempt himselfe cōmon sort men therefore meaning wheras euery mā suspected cause prouided lawes man beleeued whenas speaketh owne cause taketh place sonne god far aboue world hee reckoned common sorte men hee adorned priuiledge father hee bring men order word alone know whence came woordes hee affirmeth hee hath beginning world hee came god therefore vniust absurd thing doctrine diuine shoulde subiect lawes men beeing cloathed forme seruaunt despised humilitie fleshe hee doeth also call backe vnto glory resurrection come excellent token godhead whiche hidden vnknowen vvherefore meane estate haue hindered iewes frō submitting themselues vnto embassadour god promised vnto long law vvhē saith knoweth know meaning vnbelief doth whit impayre glory furthermore seeing hath declared vnto v faith must despice backbitings whispering wicked cannot grounded god vnlesse far aboue greatest height world end gospel may haue maiestie amongst v must alwayes take heed vnto heauenly glory christ heare speaking world remember whence came maner empyre hee hath hauing ended embassage humbled himselfe season sitteth vpon right hand father euery knee may bowed vnto 15 iudge according flesh iudge man 16 iudge iudgement true alone father sent mee 17 furthermore written law testimonie two men true 18 testifie selfe father sent • th testifie 19 therefore said vnto thy father iesus answered neither know father knowe shoulde also verilie knowe father 20 wordes spake iesus treasurie teaching temple man 〈◊〉 hand houre yet come 15 iudge according flesh may expounded two maner wayes either iudge according wicked iudgement flesh iudge respect person flesh sometimes taken outward shew man sens well agree place whether affection flesh beare rule respect person preuaile iudgement neither truth equity haue place yet seemeth sense sure wee set flesh spirite hee doth denie lawfull meete iudges cause haue spirite guide iudge man also interpreter vary distinguish thus iudgeth man doe refer vnto time seeing vpon earth yet take vpon office iudge augustine bringeth exposition suspendinge iudgemente former distinction meanes agree bee two member sentence christ iudgeth iudge iudgement firme authenticall diuine therefore doe restraine former member saith iudgeth rather vnto circumstance presēt place ende hee may better proue enemy giltie pride hee vseth comparison vsurpe vnto themselues libertie iudging preposterously yet cannot away hym teacheth simplie abstaineth office • iudge 16 iudge correction least seeme altogether depart right iudge saith iudgement true deserueth authority authoritie commeth thence hee doth nothing father commaundeth wordes alone import much say one number men considered person whiche father hath laid vpon doth rather plainly chalendge himselfe diuinitie might truly worthily wit godhead laid hid vnder vaile flesh bringeth foorth father wherein plainly appeare notwithstanding wordes tend end accounted diuine whatsoeuer doth teacheth 17 furthermore written law argument might seeme weake first blush man suffered beare witnesse owne cause must remember saide euen nowe namely christ ought exempted common sort men neither priuate man neither doth yet handle owne priuate businesse maketh himselfe differ father doth applie himselfe vnto capacitie hearer respect office father minister therefore maketh authour doctrine 19 vvhere thy father questionles enquired tauntingly father besides according accustomed pride despitefully receiued spake concerning father doe also mocke hee doeth highly extoll father hee beginning heauen therfore word denie care much christ father attribute thing vnto sonne sake heereupon christ boldly contemned euery day thinke sent god neither know mee doth vouchsafe giue flat aunswere doeth flatly cast teeth ignorance wherein flattered themselues enquired concerning father yet neuerthelesse whenas sonne eye seeing saw therefore iust punishment pride suche wicked vnthankfulnesse despised sonne god shewed vnto familiarly shold neuer come vnto father shall mortall man ascend vnto highnesse god vnlesse bee lifted vpon high hand furthermore god abase christ vnto humilitie basenesse men might reach foorth hand worthie driuen away heauen reiect god drawing neere vnto sort let v know selfe thing saide v whosoeuer aspireth vnto god beginneth christ must needes wander labyrinth vain called image father haue said elswhere depriued right true knowledge god passing ouer christ doe striue like giaunts come vnto heauen whosoeuer shall direct minde sens vnto christ shall straightway led vnto father apostle doth falsly say 2 cor 3 18 glasse gospel wee doe plainely behold god vnder person christe incomparable reward obedience faith humbleth himselfe christ doth pearce aboue heauens euen vnto misteries angel doe beholde adore 20 wordes spake hee c treasurie part temple holy offeringes laid vp therefore famous place vvhence doe gather christ spake word great assemblie men people might haue lesse excuse also euangelist commendeth vnto v wonderfull power god enforced suffer christ taught openly temple sought late kill seeing quiet gouernment temple might rule tyrannicall lust able cast christ one becke seeing yt bold take vpon office teaching straightway lay hand vpon therfore see god get audience assist least cruel beastes touch euen almost iawes hee maketh mention againe houre may know liue die man god 21 therfore iesus said vnto againe go ye shall seeke ye shall die sinnes vvhether goe thither yee come 22 therfore iewes said hee kill himselfe hee saith whether goe cannot come 23 said vnto beneath aboue worlde world 24 therefore said vnto shall die sinnes▪ vnlesse shal beleeue shall die sinnes 21 goe seeth good amōgst obstinate denounceth vnto destruction end doe refuse gospel rashly throwen ayre must needes breath sauour life death summe word wicked shall perceiue great dammage haue reiected christ offering himselfe vnto willingly late shall place left repentance end may terrifie nighnesse punishment saith first wil gone shortly signifieth gospel preached vnto short time passe ouer opportunitie shall alwayes acceptable time dayes appointed saluation▪ likewise christ knocketh gate day must straightway goe meete him▪ least wearie slouthfulnesse withdrawe himselfe v truly hath knowen many experiment time greatly ought bee afraide departure christe must first note sought christ euangelist speaketh conuersation true sought vain falsly promise woulde present often sinner grone therefore christ meaneth would seeke true faith men brought great distresse doe seeke deliueraunce euery vnbeleeuers would couet haue god bee mercifull vnto meane season cease flie god calleth comming consisteth faith repentance set hardnesse heart god discouraged despayre fret fume god briefe farre desiring come truly vnto god leaue place ayde vnlesse denie neuer doe like sort wicked soeuer ye scribe wold willingly haue applied vnto thēselues redēption promised hand messias christe would haue transfigured himselfe vnto nature therefore christ threatneth wordes denounceth vnto vnbeleeuers shalbe brought strait haue despised doctrine gospel shalbe enforced crie vnto god yet owling shall vaine haue said seeking doe seek expressed plainly enough next clause saith shall die sinne teacheth cause destruction shalbe disobedient rebellious god euen end shal see manner sinne 22 vvill hee flea himselfe scribe goe forward onely carelesse contempt also frowardnes mocke said cannot follow thyther whyther go say kill himselfe confesse wee cannot beare companie doe make account christ absence thought superiours thinges therfore bid packing whither hee horrible dulnesse satan doeth bewitch wicked drunken slouthfulnesse throw themselues middest fire god wrath doe see fury many day hauing conscience made amazed doe make mock al heare feareful iudgements god although certaine laughter teeth forward digged within blind pricking burst furious nickerings like mad men 23 beneath vnworthie taught meaning onely strike short chidinges place affirmeth doe receiue doctrine doe altogether loath kingdom god furthermore comprehendeth vnder wordes worlde beneath thing soeuer men haue nature maketh gospell sharpnes quicknesse man minde disagre gospel heauenly wisedome minde resteth vpon earth therfore man shall meete disciple christ saue shall fashion spirite cause faith rare worlde mankinde naturally estraunged turned away christe saue whome lifteth vp peculier grace spirite 24 shall die sinnes putteth plurall number nowe whereas vsed singuler sense saue meant note former place vnbeliefe cause fountaine euilles vnbeliefe sinne alone doth make v giltie eternall death god say hyperbollically doth estrange v frō christ depriueth v grace whence haue set deliueraunce sinnes therefore iewes doe obstinate malice refuse medicine vnto deadly euill hereby commeth passe made bondslaues satan cease heape sinne vpon sinne make themselues gilty againe againe therefore addeth vnlesse beleeue doubtlesse lost haue meanes whereby recouer saluation saue flying vnto christ wordes contained great force thinges vnderstood whatsoeuer scripture doth attribute vnto messias commaundeth v hope handes notwithstanding summe restoring church beginning whereof light faith whence spring righteousnes newnesse life certaine old writer falsly applie vnto diuine essence christ whereas intreateth office towarde v sentence worth marking men doe neuer sufficiently consider euils wherein drowned againe although enforced acknowledge theyr destruction yet neglecting christ looke vnto vaine remedy vvherfore must holde vntill time deliueryng grace christe doe shewe selfe raigneth innumerable sinke euils 25 therefore said vnto art thou iesus saide vnto beginning doe also speake vnto 26 haue many thinges speake iudge hee sent true speake thinges worlde haue heard 27 knewe spake vnto father therefore iesus saide vnto 28 vvhen yee haue lifted vp sonne man shall yee knowe doe nothyng selfe like father hath taught mee thynges speake 29 hath sent father hath left alone doe alwayes thinges please 25 beginning muche deceiued take beginning nominatiue case christ place affirme eternall godhead doubtfulnes ye greeke yet notwithstanding greek interpreter doe also vary amongest themselues doe agree preposition vnderstood many doe expound aduerbially christ say principally bee holden also chrysostome doe reade one text beginning also speake vnto haue manie thinges speake iudge vvhich sentence nonnus also gather verse yet reading vsuall semeth mee bee true reading furthermore interprete ten arch • n beginning iudgement sense start vp sodaine promised time past nowe doe come abroade hee addeth doe also speake vnto wherby meaneth testifieth plainly enough sobeit eares causall coniunction oti put simplie render reason christ would prooue hee beginning speaketh affirmeth doctrine doth agree euerlastingnesse whereof maketh mention ought bee accounted insteede vndoubted confirmation may thus resolued according beginning alreadie time past like also confirm againe truly nowe speake agreeth also oracle age sure approbation bee briefe answere consisteth vpon two member vnder worde beginning comprehendeth continuall course age since couenant god established father vvhenas saith doth also speake ioyneth present doctrine olde prophesies teacheth dependeth thereupon vvhereupon followeth cause iewish ignorance neither beleeue prophetes gospel one christ set euery feigne prophetes schollers respect vnto eternall couenant god meane season refused christe promised beginning offer himselfe vnto 26 haue many thing speake saw sung song vnto deafe men proceedeth farther talke doth pronounce god reuenge doctrine contemne authour thereof saith would accuse malice wickednesse doth minister vnto large matter doe omit father hath commaunded teache hee shall foreslow duetie surely defende deliuer worde wicked sacrilegious contempt men saying christ tendeth almost vnto ende whereunto paule 2 tim 2 13 wee shall denie continueth faithfull cannot deny himselfe briefe threateneth iudgement god vnto vnbeleeuers doe beleeue worde must need defend truth true stabilitie faith persuaded god alone sufficient establish authoritie doctrine although whole world doe refuse serue christe trust ayde may safely conuince whole world lying thing haue heard saith vttereth nothing saue hath receiued father approbation doctrine minister sheweth proceedeth god speaketh furthermore know christ play part minister therefore marueile hee doe therefore desire heard bringeth commaundements god vnto men example prescribeth common lawe vnto whole church none heard saue hee speaketh mouth god like casteth downe peruers arrogancie men thrust thēselues without word god doth furnish arme inuincible constancie godly teacher well assured theyr conscience calling whilest haue god guide may boldly triumph mortall men 27 knew heereby appeareth dull men whose mindes satan doth possesse could nothing bee certaine cited vnto throne god altogether blinde thyng chaunceth also dayly vnto enemy gospell furthermore making blinde ought teach v feare 28 vvhen ye haue lifted vp christ offēded dulnes euangelist noteth affirmeth againe altogeather vnworthie heare mouth haue saith al sens bewitched therfore vnderstand nothing thinges speake shall time whē shal know prophet god conuersant amōgst spake vnto thus must deale wicked must called precisely vnto iudgement seate highest iudge knowledge whereof christ maketh mention late wicked drawen vnto punishment wylles acknowledge god iudge shoulde haue meekely reuerenced neither doth promise vnto amendment life saith plainely shall striken new vnlooked feare god wrath dulnesse wherein rest shall bee taken themgen 3 7 eye adam opened ashamed seeking lurking dennes vaine might length perceiue lost although knowledge adam might haue beene selfe vnprofitable turned good grace god reprobate ouerwhelmed despayre haue eye opened ende may see destruction god doth bring kinde knowledge diuers way oftentimes scourged learne god angrie thē sometimes hee vexeth inwardly without vsing outwarde torment sometimes suffereth sleepe vntill hee call worlde worde lifted vp christ meaneth death maketh mention death hee may foretell although extinguish according flesh yet shall profite nothing say doe proudly mock speake vnto vngodlinesse shall shortly goe farther wit euen vnto death shall triumph obteyned desire shall shortly perceiue wicked destruction howe much death differeth destruction vseth word lifted vp may pricke purpose drowne christ neathermost hell affirmeth hope shalbe frustrate euent shalbe farre contrarie may indeed alludeth vnto external maner death wit lifted vp vpon crosse yet chiefly regard glorious successe followed shortly contrary expectation triumph gloriously ouer satan god angel hauing blotted hande writing sinne abolished giltinesse death vpon crosse triumph beganne length appear • vnto men gospel preached thing chaunced afterward christ rise graue ascend heauen vvhich thing must hope day whatsoeuer wicked doe inuent oppresse christ doctrine church shall onely spring vp willes shall turne wicked endeuours vnto greater encrease kingdome haue alreadie saide referred vnto diuine essence christ vnto office onely thing doth also appeare text denieth doth thing saue onely according father commaundement much say sent god discharge dutie faithfully doe nothing selfe doe rashly thrust selfe doe thing worde speake tendeth ende namely vnto office teaching christ proue doth nothing without father commandement saith speaketh according teacheth therefore summe word administration yee condemne nothing myne doe onely execute god hath enioyned wordes heare mouth alone doth gouerne calling authour whereof let v remember haue sometimes touched wordes applyed vnto ye capacitie hearer iudged christ one common sort men denieth diuine thing soeuer hath say man neither man ye father teacheth v maketh onely schoole master church therfore affirmeth taught father 29 sent boastath againe god whose conduct aid doth thing wil present least labor vain without fruite say ye power spirit god ioyned ministerie godly teacher must endowed confidence doubt fully assured hand god wil nigh vnto thē whilest pure cōscience shew thēselues bee minister vnto requireth god doth furnish worde may beate ayre cold vain sound giueth successe secrete working spirite doth also couer thē ayde enemy beeing throwen downe may stande inuincible whole world truly looke vpon themselues owne habilitie must need fall euery moment therfore way stand persuaded vpholdē hand god must note cause christ doth professe god side shall neuer destitute aid namely dependeth wholy vpon doth serue faithfully aduerbe alwaies importeth thus much doth obey god part altogether without exceptiō addicted serue obey therfore couet trie presence god wee must submit reason vnto gouernment wit possesse part gouernment god blessing shalbe absent study shal vain sobeit appeare time ioyful shew prosperous successe yet end shalbe vnfortunate vvhen christ saith left alone complaineth way vnfaithfulnesse nation wherein almost finde none ioyne handes hym neuerthelesse sheweth one thing sufficient hath god reuenger must also encouraged day least discouraged smalnesse number faithfull although whole worlde gainstand doctrine yet alone moreouer appeareth hereby foolish boasting papistes passing ouer god doe make boast theyr multitude 30 spake thing many beleeued 31 therfore iesus said vnto iewes beleeued shall abide worde disciple indeed 32 yee shall knowe truth truth shall make free 33 answered seed abraham neuer serued man sayest thou yee shall free 34 iesus answered verily verily say vnto euery one doth first al admonish v sufficient man begin well vnlesse proceeding euen vnto end answerable meanes doth exhorte haue tasted doctrine vnto perseuerance faith whē affirmeth disciple deede haue taken deep sure roote worde may abide giueth v vnderstand bee many disciple profession notwithstanding disciple indeede neyther doe also deserue bee accounted distinguisheth hypocrite marke haue falsly made bragge faith doe either faint soone begunne runne el middest race faithfull goe constantly forwarde vnto mark therfore muste wee bee constant christe may take v disciple 32 yee shall know truth hee saith shall know truth come vnto knowledge therof yet rude scarce taught b c vnto christ speaketh therefore maruell hee promise vnto greater vnderstanding doctrine sentence generall therfore muche soeuer euery one v hath profited gospel let know hath neede new encreasings christ vouchsafeth bestow reward vpon constancie maketh familier although doth nothing el meanes augment gift least man thinke thing repaied vnto man merit fastneth word hart spirite doth dayly wipe away clowdes ignorance mindes darken brightnesse gospel therfore end truth may reuealed vnto v full must striue attaine vnto knowledge therof earnest constant affection furthermore truth christ teacheth beginning vntill end doth lighten litle beginning small sparkle doth length lighten perfect light faithfull vntill shalbe fully confirmed sort ignorant know notwithstanding obscure small knowledg faith whiche effectuall vnto saluation truth shall make free commendeth knowledge gospel fruite reape therof one effect namely maketh v free furthermore vncomparable good thing vvhereupon followeth nothing better desired knowledge gospell men feele bondage confesse miserable thing seeynge gospell deliuereth v followeth treasure blessed life proceedeth must note maner libertie christe speaketh place namely setteth v free tyrannie satan sinne death sobeit obtaine benefit gospel appeareth hereby seruaunts sinne nature accorde obey righteousnesse regeneration commeth faith whereby appeareth libertie commeth gospel let papist packing let proudly extoll free let v gilty cōsciences bondage let v say boast christ alreadie set free doth notwithstanding grone yet desiring fully set free 33 seed abraham vncertaine whether euangelist bringeth men speaking thinke thus falleth great multitude answere made vnto treasure end said haue reioyced saw day christ may know yt nothing wherof made greater account fruite faith doe faithfull reape beeing content christ alone whō fully perfectly blessed haue quiet merie conscience truly man knoweth christ aright saue giueth honour hee stay himselfe wholy vpon expound thus abraham dead perceiue presence christ appeared vnto worlde make time desire time seeing diuers time true deed comming christe reuealed vnto holy spirit death looked whole life cannot tell whether subtile exposition agree wordes christ 57 fiftie yeeres goe refute saying christ thing vnpossible maketh himselfe equall abraham dyed many yeres agoe himselfe yet 50 yeres olde although christ yet foure thirtie yeeres age yet graunt age least shoulde seeme deale precisely straightly say thou wilt make thy selfe olde thou canst boast thou art fiftie therefore doe cōiecture face shrieueled age required mention made place yeeres according ascending descending sun busie themselues nothing vaine surmise pap • taught christe liued aboue fiftie yeeres case receiued 58 abraham made vnbeleeuers doe iudge according carnal sight christ telleth hath somwhat greater higher man shape beeing hidden sens flesh onely seene eye faith respect affirmeth might haue seene holy father appeare flesh yet vseth wordes saith abraham borne wordes exempteth himselfe common sort men challengeth himselfe heauenly diuine power feeling perceiuing wherof spread abroad beginning worlde throughout age although wordes may expounded two manner wayes thinke may agree eternall godhead christ simplie compare place moses exod 3 14 doe stretch power grace christ inasmuch redeemer worlde common age therfore agreeth saying apostle christ yesterday day euer heb 13 8 text seemeth require said abraham earnestly desire day iewes would beleeue addeth euen also furthermore rendring reason shall bee strong enough vnlesse vnderstand hee euen knowen mediatour god pacified yet notwithstanding grace mediatour force age depended vpon eternall godhead therefore saying christ containeth excellent commendation diuine essence furthermore wee must marke solemne forme asseueration verily verily neyther doe mislike chrysostome thinketh great weight presentense verbe saith haue beene whereby signifieth equall state beginning world vntil end therof neither saith abraham made attributing vnto beginning 59 therefore tooke vp stone bee thought according appointment law christ bestoned vvhence gather great madnesse rash zeale haue eares know matter haue handes readie commit slaughter doe doubt christ deliuered himselfe secrete power yet vnder showe humilitie would plainely shew foorth diuinitie woulde leaue somewhat humane infirmitie vvhereas bookes haue passed midst erasmus coniectureth vnaduisedly taken 4 chapter luke also worth noting wicked priestes scribe hauing driuen away christ dwelleth fulnesse godhead doe keepe possession externall temple sore deceiued thinke haue temple voide god day pope adherent seeing hauing driuen away christ haue polluted church boast foolishly false visure church chap 9 1 iesus passed saw man blinde birth 2 disciple asked saying master sinned man parent borne blinde 3 iesus answered neither man sin parent workes god may made manifest 4 must worke workes sent day night commeth man worke 5 long shall worlde light worlde 1 hee saw man blinde chapter euangelist describeth giuing sight blinde man mixing therewithall doctrine setteth foorth fruite myracle birth circumstance amplifieth power christe blindnes could cured man remedy suffered tyll hee came man state hauing brought mother wombe hereupō offered vnto disciple occasion mooue questiō whose sinne punished blindnesse first seeing scripture doth testifie affliction whereunto mankinde subiect doe proceede sinne often see man miserie cannot cogitation must needes come minde discommodities wherewith oppressed punishment laid vpon hand god wont erre three maner wayes seeing euerie man sharpe iudge men vse like seueritie meet themselues brother aduersitie doe acknowledge god iudgement god doe sharplye chasten mee winke mine owne sin euery man ought begin himselfe weighing punishment hee may spare none lesse himselfe vvherfore wil equal iudges case let v learn quick eyed rather owne euils men second errour immoderate rigour soone man touched hand god expound bee deadly hatred makyng haynous offence small faultes almost hope saluation contrarie wee scarce giltie owne sight small faulte haue commited greeuous crime thirdly offend think generally condemned whō god doth lay crosse tryal haue said late certaine sure misery doe proceede sinne god doth punish diuers cause doth punish sinnes world due deferreth punishment vntill life come may sharper handleth faithful somtimes hardly haue offēded greeuously may hereafter mortifie vice flesh yea sometimes respecting sinnes doth proue obedience el teach patience wee see holy iob oppressed miserie aboue men yet hee vrged sinnes god respect vnto another thing namely godlines may better declared euen aduersitie therfore peruers interpreter assigne aduersities indifferently vnto sinnes manner punishment equall god respect another thing punishing men euery man desarts vvherefore must note two thing place yt iudgement doth begin part house god 1 pet 4 17 therfore doth sharply punish owne child whē haue oftended passing ouer wicked whip much sharpe correcting faultes church secondly ther diuers end doth afflict men lesse make peter paule subiect hangman cruell murtherers vvhence gather punishmentes men alwayes cause extant bee pointed finger whereas disciple according common sense doe demaund manner sinne god punish blinde man soone borne doe much season aske whether hee sinned borne although absurd question taken common surmise friuolous opinion common amongest men appeareth euen place scripture beleued flitting soule one body another wherof pythagoras dreame may see deepe labyrinth man curiositie especially boldnes adioyned thereunto saw borne lame spurre blinde stark blinde som hauing monstrous body vvheras became reuerence hidden iudgements god would haue euident cause workes fall away vnto childishe toyes throu ••• rashnes thought soule whē one life past • lit new body ther suffer punishment due vnto life spent neither iewes ashamed day tosse filthie doting synagogue heauenly oracle example taught take good heed least enquire iudgements god beyond meane sobrietie wandering errour minde doe carry v away throwe v headlong horrible dungeon monstrous elect people god light wisdome kindled lawe prophetes yeelde vnto grosse forged tale god sharply punish boldnes nothing better modestie considering workes god mind may breake foorth admiration often know reason thereof tongue may cry iust art thou lord righteous thy iudgements although cannot comprehended disciple aske concerning sinnes parent vnnecessarie although innocent sonne punished father faulte soule hath sinned shall dye ezech 18 20 yet threatning vaine lord doth cast offence father bosomes child taketh vengeaunce euen vppon thirde fourth generation exod 20 5 therefore wrath god remaineth oftentimes many age euen vpon one house like blesseth posteritie faithfull sake doth also cast wicked stocke appointing according iust iudgement father together child vnto like destruction neither man meanes complaine hee punished vndeseruedly another man offence grace spirite wanting euill crowes must needes bring foorth euill egges occasion moued apostes doubt whether lord punished fault parent sonne 3 neither hath man sinned christe doth simplie acquit blinde man parent fault doth denie cause blindnes sought sinne whiche said god hath sometimes purpose layeth sorrowes misery vpon men punish sinnes therfore know cause affliction wee must restraine curiositie least iniurious vnto god malicious towarde brother • therfore christe sheweth another reason man borne blinde workes god might declared saith one worke plurall number workes long blinde shewed token god seueritie whereby rest might learne feare humble themselues followed afterward benefite deliuerance wherein appeared wonderfull goodnesse god wherefore christ drift wordes stirre vppe mindes disciple hope myracle yet neuerthelesse teacheth generally cause ought counted theater worlde iust lawfull enough god doth glorifie name cause men chide god hee maketh instrument glory side whether hee appeare merciful seuere 4 must worke doth testifie hee sent ende may declare glory god restoring sight blinde furthermore borroweth similitude common custome life sunne rysen man riseth vnto labour night appointed rest psalme 104 22 therefore hee calleth time appointed father wherein work giuen charge day euery one called vnto publike function must apply selfe doe whiche office doth require vnto workes done day time furthermore must gather thence generall rule life euery man vnto day vvherefore shortnesse day doth prick forward workemen vnto diligence industrie least darknes night ouertake thē new begun worke seeing see short time life graunted v let v ashamed waxe sluggish idlenesse finally soone god calling doth giue v light wee must linger least opportunity escape v 5 long shalbe world expound haue beene added preuention might haue thought absurd thing christe shoulde appoint vnto himselfe time worke feared least night shoulde oppresse men therefore hee doth separate selfe men yet notwithstanding saith hath appointed time wherein must worke compareth himselfe vnto sunne whiche although lighten earth brightnesse thereof yet setteth taketh away day therefore giueth v vnderstande death shall bee setting sunne shall extinguish darken light shall take sight world neuerthelesse teacheth hee brought foorth fleshe hee true bright shining day world although god lightened age yet christ brought foorth comming new vnwonted brightnesse vvhereupon bringeth time apt fit set foorth father glory cleere day wherein god woulde euidently reueale himselfe marueilous workes ariseth question appeared greater power god death christ fruite doctrine also myracles paule 2 cor 4▪ 6 doth apply properly vnto time preaching god beginning world commaunded light shine darknesse shine gospel face christe christe doeth time lesse spread abroade bright beames worlde openly conuersaunt amongest men answeare christ fulfilled course function wrought lesse mightily minister thē himselfe world deede true first let ought haue done enioyned father time reuealed flesh ende secondly hindereth whit corporall presence true singular day world brightnes wherof spread abrode throughout age whence holy father time past whence haue day light day saue giuing reuealing christ hath alwaies sent farre wyde bright beames make continuall day vvhereupon followeth whosoeuer haue christ directer wander groping darkenesse confusedly without order like blinde men neuerthelesse must note sense like sunne doth open vnto eye men beautifull stage heauen earth order nature god hath reuealed sonne principall glory workes 6 vvhen said spit vpon earth made clay spittle laid vppon eye blinde 7 said vnto goe wash poole siloa thou interprete sent went therfore washt came seeing 8 therfore neighbour seen begger said sate begged 9 othersome said truly othersome said like saide hee 10 vpon earth christ purpose restore sight blinde goeth matter sort first sight may seeme absurd annointing eye clay hee doth sort double blindnsse would haue thought hee either mocke miserable man el toyed like man distract meaning meanes prooue faith obedience blinde man might example vnto men small token faith blinde man hauing embraced bare worde doth beleeue assuredly haue sight restored vnto vpon hope hee maketh hast goe thither whyther bidden also excellent commendation obedience doth simplie obey christ although many thing persuade contrary also declaration true faith godly minde contented plaine worde god doth promise vnto selfe thing seemeth bee otherwise vncredible readinesse obedience doth followe faith immediately hee doth quietly submit himselfe bee gouerned god whiche perswaded vnto faithfull guide questionlesse suspition feare mocking come blinde man mynde easie matter break impedimēts seeing perswaded safetie selfe followe christ man obiect blinde manne knewe christe hee might gyue vnto due honour vnto sonne god confesse indeede hee dyd beleeue sent god submitting himselfe vnto doubting yt spake truth seeth nothing diuine yea hee addict himselfe wholy vnto christ small knowledge faith deserueth much praise 7 vvash poole siloa certaine vertue either ye clay ye water siloa cure eye christ adorne myracles externall signes freely either hee might accustome faithfull vnto vse signes hee might shew thinges subiect might declare much power creature woulde giue yet doe demaund clay made dust spittle doth signifie expound haue figure christe dust doth betoken earthly nature flesh spittle came mouth diuine essence worde omit allegorie hath selfe subtiltie soundnesse contented simplicitie like man first created clay christ vse clay framing eye againe prooue myracle came passe hereby blind man extol grace christ testimony therfore euāgelist gathereth al circumstance vaine whereby truth myracle plainely appeare 11 went washed happie successe therfore pharisee said man god keepeth sabboth othersome said man sinner doe myracles discention amongest 17 say vnto hym beene sometimes blinde sayest thou hee hath opened thine eye saide hee prophete 13 bring narration whiche shall followe immediatly doth declare wicked farre profiting workes lord vrged power therof doe vomit poyson inwardlye conceiued sight restored blinde man ought haue made euen stonie mindes softe least pharisee beeing stricken newnesse greatnesse thyng ought haue pawsed long vntyll suche time coulde enquyre whether worke wrought god hatred christ driueth headlong vnto madnesse doe condemne heare done euangelist nameth pharisee sectes beare christe secte couragious defende present state hypocrisie alwayes cruell proude therefore seeing dyd swel false opinion holinesse doctrine ye gospel woū ded chiefly condemned feigned righteousnesse especially fight owne power kingdome vnder colour defending lawe vvheras euangelist recordeth multitude brought blinde man vnto pharisee vncertaine ende purpose scarse anye dyd know enuiously pharisee set christ therefore may many flatterer sake set purpose assay darken glory myracle notwithstanding thinke seemeth bee like bee true greater part people suspending owne iudgement falleth sometimes meane make dayes men iudges gouernours meane season blinde owne accorde bring darknes vpon themselues sun may darken light disordered religion common people doth worship wicked tvrants church vnder colour diuine reuerence contemneth god himselfe aswell worde workes least doth vouchsafe haue respect vnto 14 sabboth christ choose sabboth day set purpose would giue matter offence vnto iewes alreadie sufficiently tryed man sicke pa • sey wold also cauilling worke therefore doth preuent offence hee might haue done easily saue onely defense enemy taken hand malitiously woulde serue setting foorth power god sabboth day vnto steede whetstone sharpen enquire whole matter doe gaine pray question asked diligently carefully denie christe restored sight blinde finde fault circumstance time doe denie woorke god seeing sabboth broken thereby firste haue decided question whether diuine worke breaking sabboth suffer see saue onely beeing blinded wicked affection maliciousnesse see nothing • furthermore beene alreadie sufficiently taught christe benefites god giueth vnto men disagree sabboth doth circumcision woordes lawe doe commaunde men cease owne workes workes god thererfore take errour strongly refuted alreadie manifest truth bee imputed vnto obstinate wickednesse least erre cause saue onely pleaseth doe papistes doe cease bring often time friuolous rotten cauils haue byn answered hundreth time therefore must doe wit wee haue opportunitie must refute much v lyeth wickednesse burden slaunder gospel false enuie defence howe iust soeuer stoppe mouthes wee must weary must couragiously tread vnder foote wicked desire whiche haue speake euill wherewith goe oppresse v take vnto themselues maximum • wee doe willingly graunt vnto bee hearde doe depart church breake vnitie faith doe 〈◊〉 passe ouer whiche chiefly discussed haue plainely expounded thousande place pope traine nothing lesse churche ye hotchpotch cōpounded many corrupt inuentions infected many feigning superstition doeth much differ sincere faith shall neuer bring passe furious wantonnesse truth wee haue often soundly testified shall length haue vpper hande like sort pharisee take maxime christ people approue hee god whosoeuer keepe sabboth day vniustlie falsely obiect worke god breaking sabboth day 16 man sinner sinner voide religion side indifferent iudge iustly think hee godly religious man furnished excellent power god worke myracles although argument seemeth scarse strong enough god doth promise euen false prophetes shall sometimes worke myracles know satan doth imitate workes god like ape may deceiu • take heede yea tranquillus reporteth vespasian alexandria sit midst market place giue iudgement requested blinde man woulde annoynt eye spittle • rapis shewed remedie sleepe vespasian would rashly set himselfe bee mocked men could hardly much adoe perswaded doe yet friendes importunate vpon granted blind man request eye opened sodainly vvho therefore reckon vespasian amongest seruants god adorne praise godlinesse answere amongest godly suche feare god▪ myracles vndoubted mark power holy ghost commeth passe iust iudgement god satan doth deceiue vnbeleeuers false myracles delusion thinke lie late recite suetonius doe rather ascribe vnto iust vengeance god seeing iewes contemne many suche excellent myracles chirste length deliuered handes satan according deserued haue gone forward pure worship god myracles christ haue confirmed doctrin law haue risen vp vnto messias himselfe ende lawe trulie christ manifestly testifie giuing sight blinde hee messias men refuse acknowledge god workes seeing doe sluggishnesse also malicious contempt refuse worthie giuen ouer god vnto subtiltie satan therefore let v remember must seeke god sincere affection hearte hee may reueale himselfe vnto v power spirite wee must obediently heare worde may decipher true prophetes deceiuing myracles shall come passe myracles shall profite v wee shall bee subiect seducinges satan touching men although doe well speake reuerently myracles wherein power god appeareth yet doe bring reason strong enough prooue christ bee accounted prophete god neither yet would euangelist haue answere bee accounted oracle hee doth bring light wicked stubbornenesse enemy christ catching somewhat maliciously wherewith may finde fault admonished doe whytte yeelde dissention amongest dissention worst hurtfull euill church christe doeth sowe matter discorde euen amongest doctor church vve may easily answere onely intent purpose christe bring men vnto god father stretching hand dissention arise proceede wickednesse desire come vnto god therefore doe cut church peeces diuision whosoeuer obey truth god better men doe disagree amongest themselues fall away together one consent frō godlinesse therfore often dissention appeareth wee must alwaies consider whence springeth 17 say vnto beene blinde diligently enquire mightily doth truth god shewe selfe man would quench flame blowing therfore often wee see wicked assay thinges may length • ppresse trueth god cause afraid carefull euent shall doe nothing el meanes kindle light thereof furthermore demaund blinde man hee thinketh therfore passe iudgement set heyre hope man striken feare answere according woulde haue point lord deceiueth truly seeing man common sort setting nought theyr threatnings doth boldly affirme christe prophete grace god thanked boldnesse myracle sobeit hee confessed couragiously freely christ prophete yet vnderstand sonne god shamefull vnbelief discouraged feare doe either denie keepe silence know sitteth right hand god father shal come thence iudge whole world therefore seeing blind man choake small sparkle knowledge wee must endeuour may free perfect confession shine againe perfecte brightnesse hath shined heartes 18 therefore iewes beleeued blind receyued sight vntyll called parent receiued sight 19 asked saying sonne say borne blind therfore doth see 20 parent answered saying know sonne hee borne blinde 21 howe hee nowe seeth know hath opened eye know hath age aske shall speake selfe 22 thinges said parent feared iewes iewes already conspired man shoulde confesse christe cast synagogue 23 therfore said parent hath age aske 18 beleeued vve must place note two thinges doe beleeue myracle done owne accorde blinded wicked hatred beare christ see manifest euangelist reporteth beleeued reason demaunded douted blindnesse voluntarie doth keepe seeing manifest worke god eye yea conuict doe yet
