parentes blind man doe take one halfe manifold captious interrogation whereunto answere testifie sonne blinde mother wombe hereupon followeth hee doeth see naturally eye opened myraculously passe ouer latter thing odious silence bewray vnthankefulnesse truely seeing great benefite god powred vpon haue beene feruently bent praise magnifie name afraid much lyeth bury grace god saue make theyr sonne witnesse steede hee may lesse enuie greater credite declare whole matter done although doe wisely inuent middle meanes whilest selues eschew danger yt may testifie concerning christ ouerthwartly mouth sonne yet let mouth euangelist spirite may condemne softnesse doe meane season owne dutie therefore much vnexcusable doe ouerwhelme christe doctrine myracles power grace vnfaithfull denyall 22 conspired place teacheth custome excommunication auncient vsed age neither excommunication newly inuented punishment vsed time past apostataes despicers lawe turned vnto disciple christ therfore vnderstand ryte excommunication arise auncient discipline churche secondly began late fault one age wicked men corrupt holy institution god sacriledge god would shoulde forme correction beginning wherewith rebel might bee kept vnder high priestes scribe tyrannously abuse power vexe innocent withall also length wickedly resist god doctrine seeing truth christ mightier thē able resist y• order lawe shake lightning excommunication oppres done euen amongest christian canne scarse expressed barbarous tyranny false bishop vse bringing vnder common people none might bee bold mutter doe see great crueltie wrest dart excommunication worshipper god must thus perswade selues whenas excommunicatiō turned wrong end may safely contemned whenas god giue vnto church law excommunication arme tyrante hangman swoord cut throates soules prescribed rule gouerne people vpon cōdition himselfe might chiefe gouernour might haue men bee minister officer therefore let false bishop send lightning shall please yet shall make none afraide vaine crackes saue beeing yet taught voyce chiefe sheephearde true sheepefolde doe wander fro doubtfull conclude see vnder subiecte christe certaine depriued lawfull power excommunication vvee must feare least exclude v congregation christe life health banished rather couet ioyned vnto christe must willingly depart pope synagogue farre feare casting must hinder v although ryte excommunicating wickedly corrupt old church yet would christ haue extinguished comming hee restored puritie thereof might againe bee force amongest v although raigne day filthie profanation holy discipline papistry must rather reclaime vnto auncient integritie great diligence abolish thing neuer well framed world holy lawes god doe degenerate corruption man fault follie satan shoulde haue great libertie hee coulde bring nought whatsoeuer hee doth corrupt vvee haue day baptisme supper finally religion whereof hee hath left parte free pollution 24 therfore called man againe blinde saide vnto giue glory god know man sinner 25 therfore answered saide knowe whether hee bee sinner one thing know whereas blinde see 26 therfore saide vnto againe thee howe opened hee thine eye 27 answered told alreadie yee heard heare againe also made disciple 28 therefore rayled said thou disciple wee moses disciple 29 vvee knowe god spake vnto moses wee knowe whence fellowe 30 man answered said vnto truly wonder yee know whence hath opened mine eye 31 know god heareth sinner man worshipper god doe heareth 32 beginning hath heard man hath opened eye hath borne blinde 33 vnlesse man god hee coulde doe nothing 24 therefore called second time questionles enforced shame called blinde man tryed bee firme constant vehemently striue god doe oftentimes intangle selues tye themselues faster doe question may make say say beautifull preface whenas doe exhort giue glorie vnto god doe imperiously commaund answere hee thought according meaning therefore vnder colour name god require handes seruile obedience giue glory god although request may referred vnto circumstance cause blinde man doe darken glory god attributing vnto man benefit hee receiued yet rather subscribe vnto opinion thinke solemne forme vsed required oath man euen iosua 7 19 doth sweare achan wordes wil wring true confession garment stollen wordes teach men god little blasphemed man shold vnder colour name deceiue truly often sweare must remember preface truth may lesse precious vnto v thē glory god men sweare farre reuerence great part thinking god denyed name called vpon defend maintaine lye withall doe come rashly contemptuously sweare thinges stuft periuries meane see hypocrite euen whilest pretende greatest reuerence god deceiue euen impudently mock also proceed get blind man sweare wordes wickedlie without great reproch god god doth meanes bring wicked counsel light howsoeuer goe diuers colour paint feigned shadowes couer 25 know whether sinner blind man seemeth somwhat digresse feare free testimonie neither must thinke doubted thing christ word sound doe rather thinke hee spake ta • ntingly hee might nettle confessed prophet sawe preuailed suspending iudgement concerning person setteth thing selfe therfore graunting wanteth mocke 26 therfore said vnto againe seeing wee see wicked earnest wicked action let v bee ashamed sluggishnesse cold busines christ seeing yt euerie hunt matter cauill may darken miracle lord doth excellently driue away endeuours vnuincible constancie blind man doth stand stoutly opinion doth also childe freely sharplie doe goe asking many question couer truth whiche knowen manifest furthermore casteth teeth peruerse hatred christe saith yee bee disciple meaning although shalbe hundreth time conuict yet possessed sort malitious deadly affection neuer yeeld wonderfull boldnesse base person obscure fellow yea one begging almost nought set doth freely prouoke fury priestes small preparation faith make bolde come vnto battle excuse make beeing great preacher gospell time tranquilitie dumbe time danger furthermore interrogation also made iest ye meaning therof moued euill sincere desire truth vrge aske question diligently 28 therefore rayled like whatsouer ray linges force furious wrath minister vnto ragingly cast one many called ā reuolt law iudgement could disciple christe must fall away lawe moses make two thing cōtrarie one looke vnto beautifull colour afraide departe doctrine moses true rule godlinesse must heare prophetes god surely speake least faith bee carryed euery doctrine man true principle doe set certaintie haue lawe moses lye say moses disciple turned away ende lawe hypocrite wont pull god peeces pretende name christ soule lawe paule teacheth rom 10 4 vvhat shall lawe separated dead body example taught god hearde aright saue onelie hearer giueth good care vnto voyce may perceiue meaneth speaketh vvhē say cannot tell whence christ referred vnto countrie place borne vnto propheticall office obiect haue knowledge calling may receiue cōming god 30 truly wonder toucheth way nothing moued singuler myracle feigne know calling christ say vnseemely token god power counted nothing calling christ proued testified yet notwithstanding purchase credite amongst end hee may vrge theyr sluggishnesse wickednesse hee amplifieth excellencie thereof since man remember neuer hearde man thing vvhereupon followeth malitious vnthankfull winke willingly manifest worke god therefore gathereth sent god whiche furnished great power spirite purchase credite himselfe doctrine 31 know god heareth sinner deceiued whiche think blind man spake thus according opiniō cō mon people word sinner taken place also wicked vngodly person little continuall doctrine scripture god heareth none saue call vpon truly sincere heart seeing faith alone openeth vnto v gate vnto god certaine wicked driuen away comming vnto yea doth testifie doth abhorre prayer doth loath sacrifice hee biddeth child come vnto singuler priuilege spirit adoption alone cryeth heartes abba father rom 8 15 briefe man rightly prepared pray vnto god saue hath heart purged faith ye wicked doe profane name god prayer doe rather deserue punished sacrilege obtaine thing may welfare therefore good reason blinde man bringeth christ came god seeing readie graunt petition 34 answered said vnto thou art altogether borne sinne teachest thou v cast 35 iesus hearde cast found saide vnto beleeuest thou sonne god 36 answered said lord may beleeue 37 iesus said vnto thou hast seene hee speaketh thee hee 38 said beleeue lord worshipped 39 said iesus come iudgement world see may see see may made blinde 40 heard pharises said vnto also blinde 41 iesus said vnto blind haue sinne yee say see therefore sinne remaineth 34 thou art borne sinne doe thinke alluded vnto blindnesse • common custome amongest proude men vexe aduersitie miserie therefore mock hee come mother wombe marke wickednesse common opinion amongest scribe soules one life past flit newe body suffer punishment former sinnes vvhereupon men set downe manifest truth born blind polluted corrupt sinnes soone borne vvee ought learne corrupt iudgement must alwayes measure euery man sinnes whip god lorde wee saw hath diuers end layeth misery vppon men besides hypocrite doe mocke miserable man also refuse reprochfully holy good admonition thing common man abide taught whō despiseth furthermore seeing must alwaies heare god whomsoeuer speake vnto v let v learne despice man god may alwayes find v meek redie taught although vse simple man one whereof account made teache v worse plague pride stoppeth care cannot vouchsafe heare giue v profitable good counsell god doth oftentimes choose vile base person set purpose teach v admonish v hee may bring downe loftines cast cut although may cast temple violence yet doe thinke euangelist meaneth otherwise excommunicate casting couered colour law agreeth better text cast reprochfully y• matter bin weight fame shold haue come vnto christ christ hearde doe thereby coniecture solemne ryte earnest matter example taught little cursings enemy christ cared cast congregation wherin christ reigneth horrible iudgement giuen vpon v deliuered vnto satan banished kingdome sonne god must accord slie frō place wher christ ruleth worde spirite man expell v far must feare tyrannous iudgement wherewith wicked mocke seruants christ 35 found kept still synagogue feared least estranged christe hee haue drowned destruction dayly wicked wandered without temple christe met christe receiueth cast priestes embraceth raiseth vp lying prostrate offereth life vnto one condemned death haue also tryed time beginning luther like reprehende grosser abuse pope scarse slender tast christianitie pope cast lightning cast romish synagogue christ reached hande vnto throughly knowen vnto nothing better v bee farthest enemy gospell christ may come nearer vnto v doest thou beleeue sonne god hee speaketh vnto iewe hauing instructed childe doctrine law learned god promised messias therefore interrogation importeth much christe exhort follow messias addict himselfe wholy vnto although vseth honorable name wont vse messias accounted sonne dauid time 36 vvho may beleeue answere blinde man appeareth although knewe yet certaine manifest thing concerning christ yet redy easie taught word import much say readie imbrace soone shalbe reuealed vnto must note blinde man desirous taught christ prophete hee alreadie perswaded christ sent god vvherfore doth rashly submit faith vnto doctrine 37 thou hast seene blinde man coulde set farther forwarde woordes christe saue vnto bare colde hungrie porcion parcell faith christe maketh mention either power sent father broughte vnto men principal thing faith know sacrifice death sinnes purged wee reconciled vnto god resurrection tryumph ouer death beeing ouercome wee renewed spirite beeing dead vnto fleshe sinne may liue vnto righteousnesse hee onely mediatour spirit earnest adoption finally part eternall life euangelist doth either recite communication christ el doth giue v vnderstand blinde man gaue christ name might hereafter begin bee disciple doubt iesus mening haue know christ might bring beginning faith vnto full knowledge 38 hee worshipped question may whether hee gaue vnto christ honour due vnto god worde euangelist vseth signifieth nothing el saue bowing knee signes testifie worshippe reuerence thinke hereby meant rare vnwonted thing namely blind man gaue farre honor christ man prophete yet notwithstanding doe thinke come farre knew christ god reuealed flesh therfore meaneth worshipping seeing blind man perswaded iesus sonne god beeing traunce reason wondering hee dyd throwe downe himselfe 39 come iudgement iudgement cannot simply taken place punishment laid vpon wicked despicers god extended vnto grace illumination therefore christ calleth iudgemēt restoreth thing cōfused scattered abroade lawfull order yet notwithstanding meaning done wonderfull counsell god contrarie common sense men truly man reason iudgeth nothing vnconuenient shoulde bee made blinde light world doe see therefore one secrete iudgements god whereby casteth downe man pride furthermore must note blindnesse mentioned doth much come frō christ man fault neither doth man owne nature properly make blind seeing yt reprobate desire nothing el quēch light must need eye minde infected wickednes frowardnesse must blinded light offered vnto briefe sithence christe owne nature light worlde thing accidentall som made blinde comming yet may question asked againe seeing men generally condemned blindnesse see answere spoken tauntingly concession vnbeleeuers althogh blinde doe yet notwithstanding thinke sharpe quicke sight pusted vp confidence doe vouchsafe heare god wisedome flesh hath fayre shew without christ world doth comprehende true wisdome therefore christ saith men doe see carried owne sense fantasie deceiuing themselues others vnder foolish hope wisdome accounting vaine imagination wisdome men become blinde soone christe appeareth brightnesse gospell foolishnesse whiche lay hid darknesse infidelitie discouered deeper drowned darknesse iust iudgement god loose little light remained men truly born blinde yet shine sparkle yet darknesse corrupt depraued nature men may differ bruit beastes nowe man puffed vp proud confidence trust hath reason refuse submit god hee shall seeme wise without christe brightnesse christe shall make foolish vanitie man minde beginneth appeare heauenly wisedome commeth abroade christe meaning expresse word haue said greater thing hypocrite doe stubbornly resist god time christ doeth beginne shine soone light commeth neerer rebell god open warre open enemy therefore frowardnesse vnthankfulnesse causeth blindnes doubled god doth eyther put altogether pluck iust iudgement eye depriued true light doe know summe place christ came worlde hee may illuminate blinde bring vnto madnesse seeme themselues wise former place maketh mention giuing sight proper cause comming hee came iudge worlde rather saue perished paule 2 cor 10 6 saith god hath vengeance readinesse rebellious addeth also punishment shall take place obedience godly shalbe fulfilled neither ought vengeance restrained vnto person christ hee dayly minister gospell vverefore must take good heede least v doe pull downe vpon pate horrible punishment fond opinion wisdome experience teacheth v truly christ vttered sentence see many men smitten spirite giddinesse furye cause saue onely cannot abyde rising sunne righteousnesse adam liued time endued true light vnderstanding lost diuine good thing desiring see mor • lawfull nowe wee drowned blindnes thus humbled lord wee yet neuerthelesse making blinde appeare day noone day light gospell doth driue hypocrite headlong extreame madnes 40 certain pharisee heard▪ perceiue wounded saying christ yet seem haue byn ye worst sort opē deadly enemy abhor christ would adioyne themselues vnto men could abide heare christe vaine man fit disciple christes saue hath put himselfe thing men farre furthermore interrogation spring indignation thought open iniurie done vnto reckoned amongest blinde also hath show proud contempt grace christ together mocke say canst thou therefore become famous without reproch shall suffer thou shalt purchase vnto thy selfe honour shame whereas thou promisest newe light blinde get thee hence packing thy benefit pay deare lightning thou mayest hereby prooue wee haue beene blinde hytherto▪ hereby appeareth hypocrisie alwayes proud poysonfull point pride content themselues wil lose nothing haue poysonfulnes yt whē disease shewed netled sore hurt doe chide christ hence commeth contempt christ grace offereth great force worde also meaning although rest blinde yet vnmeete reckoned amongst common sort vice familier placed aboue men almost drunkē pride doe forget men blinde wordes may haue double meaning eyther ignorance somewhat extenuate fault vnlesse manyfestly conuict would striue set purpose truth disease ignorance medicinable would acknowledge wordes christ shall haue fifteenth chapter confirme former sentence come spoken vnto haue sinne c followeth heere text say see end opposite may better answere one another seemeth better agree expound blinde knowing blindnesse doth seek remedie disease sort summe shalbe acknowledge griefe altogether vncurable thinke sound yee cōtinue desperate vvhen saith haue sinne whiche blinde hee doth excuse ignorance innocent without giltinesse hee speaketh iewishe churche much vnlike vnto respect vve must also marke ende purpose whereof haue spoken namely weake conscience afraide faint see enuiously bent gospell reigne churche steede wolues theeues therefore without cause christe doth testifie false teacher flatteringly soeuer doe insinuate thēselues▪ doe alwayes offer deadly poyson end may bent driue away like vnto admonition away dignitie office furthermore woorde sheepheard applyed vnto men subal •• rnum call placed vnder another christ doth impart honour vnto minister hee doth yet notwithstanding remaine shepheard well difference betweene gaue life price satisfaction hee shed blood purge soules offered body sacrifice whereby might purge sinnes pacifie god wrath stirred vp v cā thing ye minister gospell haue need although men doe referre vnto generall well iewes gentile yet disciple christ yet doubt respect vnto calling gentile calleth gathering together olde people sheepefolde beeing taken people worlde growe bee peculiar people god bee one body▪ god adopted vnto iewes appoynt vnto rite ceremony certaine boundes least shoulde bee myxed vnbeleeuers although free couenaunt eternall life made christ doore folde therefore hee calleth sheepe marke another sort summe pastorall office christ shut vp within corner iurie reacheth father augustine saith true place within ye churche many wolues without many sheepe could accounted nothing lesse themselues sheep doth word teach shalbe doth rather refer vnto hidden election father sheep vnto god perceiue shepheard like another place said enemy time loued v rom 5 9 10 respect paul doth also say knowen god knew gal 4 9 also meaning election god stedfast sure nothing perish haue saued calling length time reueale secrete counsell god wherby men ordeined vnto life certainely effectuall whylest doth regenerate vnto spirit sonnes begottē flesh blood notwithstāding ariseth question gentile brought bee gathered vnto iewes meete iewes cast away couenant god made father yt might offer thēselues serue christ▪ againe conuenient gentile take vpon yoke lawe ingrafted christ might become companion iewes must wee marke distinction betweene substance couenant externall addition gentile coulde meanes submit themselues vnto ye faith christ saue imbracing eternall couenant wherein saluation worlde grounded meanes prophesi • fulfilled straungers shall speake language canaan isay 19 18 againe seuen gentile shall catch holde cloake one iewe shall say walke you▪ zach 18 23 againe shall come far go vp mount syon therefore abraham called father many nation gen 17 5 come east vvest sit downe kingdome god mat 8 11 touching ceremony middle wall whiche paul saith taken away ephe 2 14 wee ioyned vnto iewes vnitie faith touching substance ceremony abolished least thing might keepe back ioyning hand v shall one flock al child god may grow one body▪ doe confesse one catholike faith one body must necessitie haue one head onely one god saith paule one faith one baptisme therefore must one called one hope eph 4 4 although stock doth seeme diuided diuers fouldes yet faithfull dispearsed throughout whole world enclosed common hedge 〈…〉 preached vnto sacrament vse forme prayer thinges requisite profession faith marke meanes wherby flocke god gathered togeather namely one shepheard voyce hearde meaning wordes church subiect christ alone subiect gouernment taketh heed vnto doctrine estate thereof well ordered papistes shew v thing amongst let inioy title churche whereof boast muche christe bee silent maiestie troden vnder foote holy ordinaunces mocked thing vnity diuelish conspiracie worse execrable disorder flattering abroade therfore let v remember must alwayes begin head cause prophetes doe describe restoring church doe alway ioyne dauid king god say neither church god doth reigne neither kingdome god honour shepheard ascribed vnto christ 17 therfore doth father loue mee higher cause father loueth sonne voyce heard vain heauen welbeloued sonne god well pleased mat 3 17 hee made man sake father loued end might reconcile v vnto himselfe maruell doth affirme loued therfore saluation deare vnto owne life wonderful commendation god goodnesse toward v ought worthilie cause v loue wholy hee doth powre vpon v loue due sonne referreth vnto v vnto finall cause truly christ need put vppon flesh might beloued redeeming v might pledge father mercy may take againe death christe whereof disciple heard might make thē little sorowfull yea might greatly shake faith comforteth hope resurrection immediately ensue say woulde die vpon condition may swallowed vp death may rise againe conquerour straightway must day thinke vpon death christ doe therewithall remē ber glory resurrection acknowledge haue life hauing entred combate death hath ouercome mightily tryumphed victoriously 18 man taketh mee comfort wherwith disciple may vphold thēselues death christ dyeth doth willingly offer himselfe sauegarde •• ocke furthermore doth deny men haue power put death saue asmuch suffer doth also exempt himselfe manner force necessitie vve stand another state must necessitie die sin christe himselfe also borne mortall man voluntarie submission bondage laid vpon therefore christes intent fortifie disciple least seeing shortly caried away put death shold haue bin discouraged oppressed enemy might acknoweledge die redeeme flocke wonderfull prouidence god continuall profite doctrine death christ continuall sacrifice sinnes therfore voluntarie sacrifice according saying paul rom 5 19 wordes lay downe self may expounded two maner wayes either christ putteth life hee himselfe remayning perfect man put cloathes hee dyeth owne accord commandement hee calleth v vnto eternall counsell god father end may know carefull saluation gaue v sonne great soeuer hee bee christ himselfe came world might shew himselfe obedient vnto father sheweth marke wherat aymeth thinges prouide v 19 dissention therefore againe amongest iewes saying 20 many saide hee hath diuell madde▪ doe yee heare 21 othersome saide wordes one hath diuell diuell open eye blinde 22 hierusalem feast dedication winter 23 iesus walked temple porch solomon 24 therefore iewes compassed saide vnto howe long doest thou holde soule doubt thou christ tell v freely 25 iesus answered haue tolde yee beleeue workes doe father name testifie 26 yee beleeue yee sheepe said vnto 27 sheepe mine doe heare voice know follow mee 28 doe giue vnto eternall life shall perish euer neither shall man take hand 29 father hath giuen mee greater man take hand▪ 30 father one 19 dissention fruite christe sermon gathered vnto selfe disciple doctrine hath also many aduersaries ariseth thereupon dissention diuided amongest selues one body churche one consent professe worshipped god abraham followed lawe moses nowe soone christe doth appeare beginne disagree beene true profession christe principall bond charitie whose office gather together thing scattered abroade haue broken agreement discouer hypocrisie manye light gospell vnder false colour boast people god euen day frowardnesse many doeth cause church troubled dissention contention waxe • yet trouble peace doe lay blame vpon v call v schismatikes contentious person papistes doe chiefly lay crime charge doctrine hath disturbed quiet estate churche would meekely submitte themselues vnto christe yeeld vnto truth motion shoulde shortly bee pacified seeing doe fret fume againste christe suffer v bee quiet vppon condition vnlesse truth god bee extinguished christ banished kingdome doe vniustly burden v crime dissention men see imputed vnto bee lamented truly church pulled peeces inward ciuill discorde better bee separate selues wicked doe agree togeather contempt god therefore wee must alwayes diuisions marke bee departe god pure doctrine 20 hath diuell slaunder christe odious slaunder possiblie men may afraid refuse heare wicked doe furiously shut eye breake proude contempt god least compelled yeelde vnto yea prouoke others vnto like madnesse worde christ may heard silence doctrine christ well enough able defende selfe slaunders doe faithfull meane answeare say word one hath diuell much require iudgement might giuen according thing selfe troth prouerbe doth sufficiently defende selfe ayde stay faith wicked shall neuer able bring passe power wisdome god shal shine gospel 2 • ierusalem feast dedication shold say innouations temple polluted consecrated againe meanes iudas machabeus ordeined shoulde yeerely feast famous day new dedication might remember grace god made end antiochus tyrannie christ appeared according custom temple preaching might bring foorth greater store fruite great assemblye men euangelist calleth salomon porche temple sanctuarie onely appurtenance temple neither doth meane olde porch sometimes built salomō quite pulled chaldean peraduenture first iewes returned captiuitie babylon called name beeing built according patterne olde one might haue greater dignitie secondly herode builder new temple 24 therefore iewes compasse questionlesse subtillie set vpon christ least yt principall authours counsell purpose cōmon people might without fraud desire iesus would make openly knowen sent god deliuerer go craftily captiously stirre vp voice multitude might either murdred tumult el roman might lay hand vpon vvhereas complaine stand doubt doe thereby pretend vehemently desire promised redēption desire christ doth continually trouble molest mindes true affection godlines el found satisfie mind truly pacifie saue christ himselfe saith come vnto yee weary loaden refresh soules shall find rest▪ mat 11 28 therfore come vnto christ must prepared men feigne themselues bee doe vndeseruedly accuse christ hytherto established faith themselues blame attained vnto sound perfect knowledge perpetuall thing amongst vnbeleeuers rather wauer fro grounded certaine sure worde god wee see day manye men seeing shut eye accord spread abroade clowdes doubting whereby may darken cleare light gospel also see many light spirit flying friuolous speculation finde certaine station resting place whole life vvhen desire christ make himselfe knowen openly freely boldly meaning insinuate himselfe longer ouerthwa • ly certaine long circumstance accuse doctrine obcuritie notwithstanding plaine shrill enough vnlesse fallen amongst deaf men history teacheth v wee cannot escape deceit slaunders wicked wee called preach gospel vvherfore must watch diligently moued herewithall new matter shall befall v whiche befell master 25 haue told lord doth dissemble christ yet notwithstanding doth teach apt learne bot doth rather cast teeth malice wickednesse wherin become obstinate profited nothing hitherto taught word work god therfore blameth know say doctrine easie enough vnderstood selfe fault wickedly maliciously resist god hee doth afterward speak work may proue guilty double stubbornnes besides doctrine euident testimonie myracles vnlesse vnthankfull vnto god therfore repeateth twise beleeue may manifestly proue vnto wilfully deafe shoulde heare doctrine blind shold behold work token extreeme desperate wickednes saith hath done workes father name ende thereof might make power god knowen whereby might made manifest came god 26 sheep sheweth higher cause doe neither beleeue myracles doctrine namely reprobate must note christ purpose boast god church least theyr vnbeliefe whit discredite gospell pronounceth gift beleeuing speciall truly necessarie men knowen god men may know saith paule galat 4 9 againe must needes whome god regardeth must alwaies continue turned away man murmur say cause vnbeliefe god power alone make sheepe answere free fault seeing men voluntarie wickednesse reiect grace god doth purchase vnto himselfe muche credit sufficient wilde beastes doe neuer waxe tame vntill suche time chaunged sheepe spirit god shall vaine assay lay blame fiercenesse wildenesse vpon god proper nature summe christe giueth v vnderstande maruell bee fewe obey gospell cruell vntamed beastes whosoeuer brought vnto obedience faith spirite god vvherefore vnmeete absurd thing authoritie gospell depend vpon faith men rather let faithfull consider much bound vnto god whereas others continue blindnes drawē vnto christ illumination spirite moreouer minister gospel haue place wherewith may comfort themselues labour bee profitable men 27 sheepe proueth argument drawen contrary sheepe obey gospell god doth call effectually hath chosen christ sheepe tryed faith truly name sheepe therfore giuen vnto faithful submit themselues vnto god gouerned hand chiefe shepheard hauing laid away former wildnesse shew themselues easie guided obedient also small cōfort godly teacher howsoeuer greater part worlde doth hearken vnto christe yet hath hee sheepe knoweth knowen againe let endeuour much lyeth bring whole world vnto christe sheepfold falleth would wish let content one thing▪ shalbe gathered together diligence sheepe rest haue expounded 28 shall perish • uer vncomparable fruit faith christ commaundeth v sure certaine voyde care gathered sheepfold faith wee must also note vnto proppe certaintie leaneth namely hee wil faithfull keeper saluation doth testifie hand sobeit yet sufficient saith kept safe power father excellent place whereby taught saluation elect lesse sure power god inuincible▪ furthermore christe would speake rashlye vaine meaning make vnto promise may remaine surely fixed mindes therefore gather christ drift wordes faithfull elect may sure saluation vve compassed strong enemy great weakenesse farre death euery moment yet greater mightier whiche keepeth whiche committed vnto keepe behalfe cause feare life daunger doe also gather heereby howe vaine hope confidence papistes leaneth vnto freewill vnto owne power vnto merites workes christe doth teache bee farre otherwise remember worlde middest wood amongest many robber besides vnweaponed alwaies pray also acknowledge haue matter death shut vp doe walke safetie trusting vnto keeping god alone finally saluation therfore certaine sure hand god faith weake readie bent fall god hath taken v hand strong enough hee able driue away engine enemy breath mouth alone profitable v looke vnto least feare temptation doe discourage v christ intende shewe meanes howe sheepe mighte bee safelye conuersaunt amongest wolues man take father hande copulatiue heere put steed illatiue christe gathereth inuincible power god saluation godly subiect enemy must god necessitie ouercome hath v vnder tuition hand 30 father one intent preuent scoffes wicked might obiect power god nothing appertaine vnto might promise vnto disciple sure ayde thereof therefore hee doth testifie hee father ioyned togeather hee sheepe shall neuer want ayde old writer abused place myght proue christ consubstantiall father christ doth dispute concerning vnitie substance concerning agreement whiche hath father namely whatsoeuer christe doth confirmed power father 31 therfore iewes tooke vp stone againe stone 32 iesus answered haue shewed many good workes father doe yee stone mee 33 iewes answered saying stone thee thy good workes sake thy blasphemie thou whereas thou art man doest make thy selfe god 34 iesus answered written lawe haue saide yee god 35 hee called goddes vnto worde god spoken scripture cannot bee broken 36 doe yee say hee doth blaspheme father hath sanctified sente worlde said sonne god 31 therefore iewes tooke vp stone againe godlines doth enflame zeale god defending glory whome spirit • god doth gouerne vnbeliefe mother fury diuell doth pricke forward wicked desire nothing slaughter end issue doth shew minde asked christ open confession whereof feigned themselues desirous doth make mad yet notwithstanding doubted thus violently carryed oppres christ vnder colour iudgement according prescript law god commaundeth false prophetes stoned deut 13 5 32 many good workes christ doth onely place denie cause thus rage doth accuse vnthankfulnesse vniustly recompence god benefites saith hee deserued well handes one worke two beneficiall vnto many thinges secondly proueth vnto onely vnthankefull vnto rather god calleth himselfe father minister hath brought power light might bee knowen vnto saith father meaning god authour thereof summe god intent bee made knowen vnto mee hath bestowed excellent benefites vpon hand trie mee muche haue done nothing amongest worthie thankes prayse therefore must needes bee furiously persecute mee giftes god interrogation forceable pricke conscience withall spoken simplie affirmatiuely 33 thy good workes sake howsoeuer wicked doe make open warre god yet neuer offend without honest colour therefore rage sonne god beeing yet content crueltie doe owne accord accuse make themselues patrones reuengers god glory vvherefore necessarie good conscience bee vnto v brasen wall whereby wee may able beate backe reproches slaunders wherewith strongly assaulted howsoeuer wickednesse brauely painted howsoeuer slaunder v cause v euill thought time feight god cause wil denie himselfe defende truth wicked doe neuer want cloakes colour burden seruants god also added thereunto hard impudencie ouercome cease speake euill wee haue neede meekenesse patience hold v vp vnderproppe v vntyll ende scripture referreth woorde blasphemie generally taken amongest profane writer euery rayling vnto god poynt maiestie derogated slaundered thou whereas thou art man two sort blasphemy either god dispoyled owne honour thing forged vpon vnmeete contrarie nature therefore hold auouch christ doth blaspheme commit sacriledge mortall man doth vsurpe himselfe god honour deed true definition christ nothing el man doe offend vouchsafe behold diuinitie appeared myracles 34 written hee refuteth crime laide charge denying sonne god defending well said although doth rather applie answere vnto person throughly expound matter selfe hee thought sufficient present refute wickednesse hee doeth rather way insinuate plainely expresse sense calleth himselfe sonne god argument vseth taken thing equal greater lesser scripture calleth goddes lorde hath laid honourable function therfore farre worthie title honor god hath separated excel men vvherupon followeth wrong malicious interpreter admit former doe take occasion offence latter testimonie christ cite psa 82 6 vvhere god chideth ye king iudges earth abuse gouernment might tyrannously owne lust oppresse miserable commit manner wickednesse vpbraideth beeing vnmindefull whence great dignitie doe profane name god christ applieth vnto present matter called god god minister gouerne worlde like respect scripture doth also call angel god thē glory god shineth abroade worlde vvee must note phrase vnto worde god spoken meaning appointed certaine commaundement god vvhence gather empyres gouerments rashly begin neither yet man errour appointed god haue ciuill order kept amongst men haue v gouerned authoritie lawes respect paule saith ro 13 2 rebel god whosoeuer resist power ther power god man obiect calling god also alloweth yet notwithstanding husbandmē neatheardes coblers called god answere generall thing shoulde called god called vnto certaine kinde life christ speaketh kinges whome god hath extolled vnto higher degree may rule excell briefe let v know magistrate called god cause god hath committed vnto gouernment vnder worde lawe christ doth camprehend doctrine • god gouerne old church prophetes •• terpreters lawe psalmes also worthilie accounted addition appurtenance lawe scripture cannot broken importeth much doctrin scripture cannot violate 36 vvhome father hath sanctified godlly haue certaine common sanctification christ challengeth himselfe place farre excellent thing namely alone separated power spirite maiestie god might shew themselues like said chap 6 27 sealed father properly referred vnto christ person much reuealed flesh therefore two ioyned togeather sanctified sent world must also vnderstand ende vpon condition hee sent namely might bring saluation god myght respectes prooue shewe himselfe sonne god say doth blaspheme arrians time past wrest place might proue christ god nature diuinitie pleasure another errour may easily refuted christ doth place dispute himselfe hee ought bee knowen myracles man flesh doubtles neuer comprehend eternall diuinitie vnlesse imbrace much giuen father bee redeemer moreouer must remember whiche touched christ doth plainly openly amongest disciple testifie hee doeth rather stande vppon refuting slaunder cauill enemy 37 doe work father beleeue 38 doe although beleeue mee beleeue workes may know beleeue father • 39 therfore sought againe apprehend hee escaped theyr hande 40 hee went againe beyond iordan place iohn first baptise • ayed 41 many came vnto said iohn truly myracle thing • soeuer iohn said true 42 many beleeued 37 doe workes least iewes shoulde obiect vaine make boast sanctification whatsoeuer depende thereupon doth againe repeate myracles wherein hee shewed manifest token diuinitie kind grauntyng say haue vpon condition bounde beleeue mee thing selfe appeare manifestly may freely reiect god doe openly testifie hee calleth work father deed diuine wherein appeared greater power coulde bee ascribed vnto man 38 doe workes father hee sheweth openly guiltie wicked sacrilegious contempt giue honour vnto manifest workes god second graunting saith although suffer doubt doctrine least shall lawfull denie workes haue shewed god therefore doe openly reiect god man setteth knowledge faith inferiour order doth cause doe vnbeleeuing froward men doe neuer yeeld vnto god vnlesse ouercome enforced experience robellions knowe beleeue yet notwithstanding god doth farre foorth beare v knowledge workes may doth prepare v vnto faith knowlege god hydden wisdome doth follow faith order obedience faith openeth vnto v gate kingdome heauen father mee repeateth thing hee saide wordes father one drift al administration differeth father father saith 〈…〉 diuine power doth shew selfe father • doe nothing without direction authoritie mutuall coniunction betweene mee father neither doth speake place vnitie essence reuealing diuine power christes person whereby appeare sent god 39 therefore sought take vvithout doubt might pull temple stoned doubtlesse iurie asswaged wordes christ saith hee escaped handes could meanes come passe saue wonderfull power god vvhereby wee taught laide open vnto lust wicked whiche god doth restraine bridle often thinketh good 40 hee went bey •• iordan christ went ouer iordan least hee fight continually without great fruite therefore hath taught v example must vse opportunitie concerning place wherunto departed reade 2 chap ver 28 41 many came vnto concourse doth shew christe sought wildernesse end might foreslowe office might erect sanctuarie god wildernes seeing ierusalem owne seate obstinately refused truly horrible vengeance god seeing temple chosen god denne theeues church god gathered together base place iohn truly gather christe excellent iohn wrought many notably myracles whereas iohn myracle ought alwayes iudge myracles myracles ioyned vnto doctrine small importance haue sometimes alreadie saide furthermore speeche vnperfect compare christe iohn doe onely expresse one member secondly take thing men graunt iohn great prophet god endewed singular grace spirit therfore reason fitly christ preferred iohn came passe certaine prouidence god iohn otherwise greatest prophete yet notwithstanding bee set foorth myracle whereby proued respect christe might account bee made whatsoeuer thinges seemeth said thus added euangelist hee might teache v persuaded double reason beleeue christ deed see 〈◊〉 iohn bare true myracles purchase vnto dignitie chap ii 1 certaine man sick called layarus bethania towne marie marthe sister 2 mary aunointed lord oyntment wiped feete hayre whose brother layarus sicke 3 therefore sister sente vnto saying beholde hee whome louest sicke 4 iesus hard said sicknes vnto death▪ glory god sonne god may glorified 5 iesus loued martha sister layarus 6 therefore hee heard hee sicke abode place two dayes 7 afterwarde saide vnto disciple let v goe iury againe 8 disciple say vnto master iewes sought euen kill thee doest thou goe thither againe 9 iesus answered twelue houres day man walke day time stumbleth hee seeth light world 10 man walke night hee slumbleth hath light 1 certaine man sicke euangelist passeth ouer vnto another historie conteineth famous myracle besides christ shewe singuler token diuine power raysing lazarus death hath also set eye liuely image resurrection come last act conclusion time death draw neere maruell therefore especially set foorth glory worke remembrance whereof would haue deeply imprinted mind might certaine sealing former thinges christ raysed vp dead nowe sheweth power vpon rotten stinking carkasse circumstance serue myracle set foorth glory god shall bee noted place order saith lazarus bethania towne mary martha likely expressed lazarus famous amongest faithfull sister holy woman wont lodge christ appeareth luk 10 38 monkes bablers time papisti • e grosly erre made castellu •• little towne streete castle proceedeth like ignorance feigne mary sister lazarus infamous wicked woman whereof luke maketh mention 7 37 annoynting cause errour manifestly appear christ oftentimes annoynted diuers place sinnefull woman luke maketh mention annoynted christ ierusalem liued mary thing bethania afterward streete pretertense euangelist vseth annoynted must referred vnto time thing done haue hande vnto time euangelist write say mary whiche afterwarde powre oyntment caused murmuring amongst disciple 2 beholde hee whome thou louest sick short message yet christ might gather two sister meant vnder cōplaint modestly insinuate praiers would helpe forbidden vse long forme prayer yet summe must cast eares misery soeuer doe vexe v god bosome may send remedie doe woman deale christ doe familiarly lay griefe doe hope released thereof vve must also note conceiue hope obtaine helpe loue christe continuall rule praying aright loue god certaine present health loueth forsaketl 4 iesus heard meaning answere deliuer disciple care least shoulde greeued sawe carelesse friend daunger therefore least shoulde meane season carefull hee saith sicknesse vnto death rather promiseth shalbe vnto new matter glory furthermore although lazarus dead yet christe restoreth shortly vnto life respecting end saith sicknesse vnto death member glory god set perpetuall argument wee know euen whilest wicked perish glory god doeth lesse manifestly appeare destruction saluation godly christ dyd properly place speake glory god ioyned office furthermore appeared fearefull power god myracles christe sweete bountifull therefore seeing affirmeth perill death hee shew foorth glory glorie father wee must consider wherefore sent father namely hee may saue destroy furthermore speech great importance glory god sonne god may glorified doe gather thereby god bee knowen person sonne honour soeuer requireth giuen vnto may giuen vnto sonne therefore chap 5 23 honoureth sonne doth honour father vvherefore turkes iewes doe vaine pretend worship god seeing rayle vppon christ enuiously bent yea meanes endeuour pull away god himselfe 5 iesus loued martha thing seeme first blush bee contrary christ tarryeth two dayes beyonde iordan regarding lazarus life yet said loue sister seeing loue causeth carefulnesse ought haue runne vnto furthermore seeing christ glasse god fauour wee caught delay must esteeme loue god present estate thinges hee doth oftentimes deferre aide requested either may sharpen feruentnesse praying may exercise pacience may also accustome v obey therfore let faithfull craue god helpe doe also learne suspend petition time hee stretche foorth hande slowly helpe necessitie seemeth requyre howsoeuer linger yet doth hee neuer sleepe forget bee meane season let v certainly persuaded haue loueth saued 7 afterward saith doth length declare cared lazarus whan disciple thought hee forgotten least preferred thinges life lazarus therefore exhorteth passing ouer iordan goe iurie 8 master euen iewes sought vvheras disciple terrifie christ doe peraduenture much sake respect selues euery one afraid himselfe like daunger common therefore seeing withdraw themselues crosse ashamed confesse much pretend carefull master hath fairer shew thing befalleth manie dayly foreslowe duetie feare crosse gather themselues many cloakes colour couer softnesse withall least seeme defraude god due obedience without iust cause 9 twelue place hath diuersly expounded haue thought taught wordes mindes men mutable take sometimes new counsell euery houre farre christ meaning neither vouchsafed recite vnlesse common prouerbe therfore let v content naturall plaine meaning first christ boroweth similitude frō ye night day mā iourney darke maruell stumble oftentimes goe astray fall light sunne sheweth day time way ther may danger calling god like vnto day light suffereth v wāder stumble therefore whosoeuer doth obey worde god taketh nothing hand without commaundement hath also heauen guide directer vpon hope may safely take way without feare psalm 9 11 whosoeuer walketh wayes hee hath angel keepe guiding hee defended least hee dash foote stone therefore christ trusting aide goeth forwarde couragiously iurie fearyng stonyng wee daunger going astray god dutie ye sun giueth v light doth gouerne course vve taught wordes often man doeth submit himselfe vnto owne counsel without calling god whole life nothing el wandering erronious course seeme themselues wise aske mouth god haue spirite gouernour action blinde goe grabbing darknes right way well assured calling god haue god alwayes go v certaine hope prosperous successe doth ensue rule framing life cannot bee god doeth gouerne happily haue neede knowledge faithfull scarse set one foote forward follow satan doth lay thousand stumbling blockes way hee sheweth diuers daungers euery side endeuoureth meanes stop way whenas lorde doth bid v goe forward hauing lighted light must goe forwarde couragiously although many deathes doe stop way doth neuer bid v goe forwarde doth therewithall encourage v adding promise may certainly persuade selues shal fal well v whatsoeuer take hande commandement charriot whereinto whosoeuer shall climbe shall neuer faynte wearisomnesse yea let harder carryed chariot yet furnished winges wee shall alwayes find way get vntill come marke aduersitie doeth befall faithfull aduersitie helpeth forward vnto saluation summe eies god shalbe alwaies ouer keepe shall obedient readie marke becke againe doe gather heereby often men neglecting despicing worde god doe rashly flatter themselues take hand whatsoeuer pleaseth course life accursed lorde vengeance alwayes prepared boldnesse blinde lust christ diuideth day twelue houres according olde custome although dayes doe differ sommer vvinter yet alwayes twelue houres daye twelue night 11 hee spake thinges saith vnto friende lazarus sleepeth goe awake 12 therfore disciple said lord sleepe shalbe safe 13 howbeit iesus spake death thought hee spake naturall sleepe 14 therefore iesus said plainely vnto lazarus dead 15 glad sake may beleeue let v goe vnto 16 thomas surnamed didimus said vnto felow disciple let v go also may die 17 therefore iesus came founde hee lyon graue foure day alreadie 11 friend sleepeth hee said sicknesse vnto death least disciple bee much troubled thing vnlooked doth also declare dead putteth hope resurrection rudenesse wonderfull vnderstand saying christ sleepe although metaphoricall kinde speech yet often vsed common scripture ought haue bin wel knowen vnto al iewes 12 sleepe safe vvhen say sleepe wholesom lazarus mean way exhort christ goe thyther yet doe craftily wrest wordes christe vnto owne commoditie thought hee spake sleepe doe willingly catch occasion escape daunger augustine many cunningly play philosopher worde sleepeth namely applyed vnto death cause easie matter god rayse dead life v toawake sleep may gather continual vse scripture christ thought thing yea seeing selfe translation common also amongest profane writer without doubt came vse mean saue dead cark lyeth without sense fealing euen body man sleepeth cause sleepe vnfitly tearmed image death homer called brother death furthermore whereas worde sleeping body onely signified certaine mad felowes foolishly wrest vnto soules depriued vnderstanding daunger death furthermore christe setteth foorth power saith come may awake lazarus although easinesse resurrection expressed woorde sleepe yet christe sheweth lord ouer death saith awaketh restoreth life therfore iesus said thē plainely vnto singuler goodnesse christ could suffer great grossenesse disciple truely deferred endow greater grace spirit season renued moment myracle might bee greater vvhen saith glad sake meaning absence profitable power haue byn obscure holpen lazarus nigher workes god doe drawe vnto ordinarie course nature base doe waxe glory thereof doth lesse appeare thing doe dayly trie hee reache foorth hande lay holde vpon helpe therefore ende disciple myght acknowledge resurrection lazarus indeed work god requisite deferred might farre remedie could come meanes man must remember saide fatherly sufferance god represented ye person christ therfore god doth suffer v ouerwhelmed grief long time languish let v know hee doeth meanes prouide safetie vve truly doe grone carefull sorrowfull lorde reioyceth welfare appeareth poynt double gentlenesse doth pardon fault doth ioyfully find meanes redresse may beleeue doth meane first beginning faith confirmation faith already begun much small weake neuerthelesse telleth would haue beleeued vnlesse hande god openly shewed 16 thomas hitherto disciple endeuoured pull backe christe thomas readie follow without confidence doth arme himselfe christ promise may follow ioyfully quietly wordes distrust let v goe may dye whereas became sure life furthermore relatiue may bee expounded well lazarus christ expound spoken lazarus taunt saide good shall doe comming thither vnlesse peraduenture cannot otherwise doe dutie friendes vnlesse die together yet doe rather allow sense thomas doth refuse die christ haue said floweth rash zeale rather haue encouraged faith promise 18 bethania high ierusalem almost fifteene furlong 19 many iewes came vnto martha mary might comforte brether 20 therfore martha hearde iesus come came meet mary sate home 21 therefore martha saide vnto iesus lord thou hadst heere brother deal 22 nowe knowe also whatsoeuer thou shalt desire god god giue thee 23 iesus saith vnto thy brother shall ryse againe 24 martha saith vnto know shall rise againe resurrection last day 25 iesus saith vnto resurrection life beleeueth though dead yet shall liue 26 euery one liueth beleeueth mee shall neuer die doest thou beleeue 27 shee saith vnto truly lord beleeue thou art christ sonne god shoulde come worlde 12 bethanie euangelist doth diligently prosecute thinges serue vnto certaintie historie sheweth nigh ierusalem vnto towne bethanie least shoulde maruell many friendes came thence comfort sister whō god would haue beare witnesse myracle although moued dutie curtesie yet gathered together secrete counsell god ende least resurrection lazarus obscure shoulde haue onely beare witnesse thereof owne family proued malicious vnthankfulnesse nation manifest token god power shewed famous place great assemblie people euen almost gate citie vpon stage doth straightway vanish sight yea iewes shutting eye maliciously set purpose see eies truly new strange thing men doe alwayes greedily gape myracles altogether dull blockish consideration thereof distance place noted two mile furlong containeth sixe hundred foote hundred fiue twentie pas 19 might comfort thing came god respect vnto another thing haue alreadie saide furthermore appeareth house lazarus sister full dignitie honourably reuerenced naturall thing death friendes bring vnto men sorrow heauines dutie whereof euangelist maketh mention disalowed saue corrupt excesse whiche reigneth part life doth corrupt thing self discommended 20 therfore martha heard martha went towne wee shall afterward see peraduenture reuerence sake might receiue priuily daunger freshe memorie rage enemy yet scarse wel appeased somewhat pacified departure christ galilee might breake fresh soone heard hee returned 21 lord thou hadst heere beginneth complaint although shee doeth meanes modestly signifie vnto shee wold much shold say thou couldest thy presence haue deliuered brother death yea thou canst euen god denie thee nothing speaking thus doth rather fauour affection keepe selfe vnder rule faith confesse indeede wordes partly proceede faith say ther certaine disordered affectiōs mixed thē carryed beyond boundes whence hope brother haue died christ present truly conceiued promise christe therefore remaineth doth rather obey owne desire submit selfe vnto christ poynt faith shee ascribeth vnto christe power singuler goodnesse promiseth heard christ agreeth faith must alwayes hold mutuall consent betweene worde faith least man doe forge vnto himselfe thing rashly besides worde god moreouer martha sticke much corporal presence christ therefore faith martha mixed intangled immoderate desire altogether voide superstition could shine perfect brightnesse certaine sparkle appeare wordes 23 thy brother shall rise againe wonderfull gentlenesse christe pardoning vnto martha faultes whereof haue spoken promiseth vnto owne accord durst precisely openly aske 24 know shall rise againe appeareth greate fearfulnesse martha shee doth extenuate saying christ vve said euen went farther meete shee feined vnto selfe hope owne imagination shee falleth contrarie vice shee stood trembling christe reached hande vvherefore wee must take heed thinges take vnto selues friuolous hope heere winde destitute worde god againe lord doe finde heartes eyther shut el straitly restrained openeth mouth martha meante gather answere thing durst hope wordes christe say thou meane last resurrection doe doubt brother shall rise againe last day hope doe comfort selfe cannot tell whether hath farther meaning 25 resurrection life christe doth first al affirme resurrection life done doeth seuerally expounde member sentence former place calleth selfe resurrection restoring death life former order state life mankinde drowned death therefore man shall bee made partaker life saue hee shall first rise death christ doth teache hee beginning life addeth afterwarde perpetuitie continuaunce life worke grace furthermore expositiō foloweth immediatly doth manifestly declare speaketh spirituall life beleeueth although hee shall bee dead yet shall hee liue vvhy christ resurrection doth regenerate spirite child adam estranged frō god sin may begin lead new life vvhich thing haue handeled largely chap 5 21 24 ver paule vnto ephesian best interpreter place ephesian 2 5 5 8 let bee packing babble men prepared motion nature receyue grace god much shoulde say dead men doe walke men doe liue breath endowed sense vnderstanding tendeth destruction part facultie soule corrupt turned away right vvhereby commeth passe yt death reigneth euery estranging god death soule therefore beleeue christ wheras dead begin liue faith spirituall resurrection soule doth sort quicken soule self may liue vnto god according said chap 5 25 dead shall heare voyce sonne god shall heare shall liue surely excellent title commendation faith powring life christe v deliuereth v death 26 euery one liueth beleeueth mee exposition second member namely christ life doth neuer suffer life fall away hath gyuen preserueth vnto ende become men greate frailtie fleshe hauing obtained life shoulde afterward left vnto themselues therefore continuall estate life must grounded vpon power selfe christ hee may finish hath begunne faithfull saide neuer dye cause soules borne againe vncorruptible seed haue spirite christ abiding whereby continually quickned although body subiect death sinne yet spirite life righteousnesse rom 8 10 outwarde man dayly corrupted farre impayring theyr true life euen helpeth forwarde inwarde man renewed day day 2 cor 4 16 yea death selfe certaine setting free bondage death doest thou beleeue christ seemeth firste sight intreate spirituall life cause hee may withdrawe minde martha present desire martha desire haue brother restored life christ answereth authour better life namely quickneth soules faithfull heauenly power doe doubt meaning comprehende double grace therefore commendeth generally spirituall life giueth vnto giue tast thereby power hee would afterward shewe raysing vp lazarus 27 truly lorde end martha may prooue beleeue heard christ resurrection life maketh answere beleeueth christe sonne god indeed knowledge comprehendeth selfe summe good thing must alwayes mark end messias promised office prophetes doe attribute vnto martha confesseth shoulde come confirmeth faith prophesies prophetes vvhereupon followeth full restoring thinges perfect felicitie hoped hand finally sent cause may erect set order true absolute estate kingdome god 28 vvhen said thinges went called sister mary secretly saying master present calleth thee 29 soone shee heard shee ryseth straightway commeth vnto 30 iesus yet come towne place martha met 31 iewes therefore home comfort seeing mary arose sodainely went followed saying shee goeth vnto graue shee may weepe 32 therefore mary came iesus shee sawe shee fell feete saying vnto lorde thou haddest beene heere brother beene dead 33 therefore soone iesus saw weeping iewes whiche came weeping gro • ed spirite troubled himselfe 34 hee sayde haue laide hym say vnto come see 35 iesus wept 36 therfore iewes said behold loued 37 certaine said could opened eye one blinde bring passe man die 38 iesus groned againe himselfe came vnto graue 〈◊〉 stone laid vpon •• called sister likely christ stayed without towne request martha least come assemblie men feared daunger christ late hardly escaped middest death therefore least comming shoulde noysed abroade telleth sister priuilie master present word master doth shew account godly matrones make christ although profited much became yet great matter wholy addicted themselues disciple sodaine departure mary might come meet doth little testifie reuerenced 31 therfore iewes although christ suffereth martha returne home might draw aside sister companie yet christe intend thing namely might haue iewes see myracle doe case thinke vpon new matter men brought thyther darknes secret prouidence god whyther went thinke yt mary goeth vnto graue wont doe seek haue sorrow stirred vp disease reigneth commonly euery husband depriued wiues parent child wiues husbandes child parent kinsfolkes friendes doe increase ambitiously mean possible mourning solemne thing finde diuers inuentions ende indeede whereas affection men alreadie inordinate prick forward newe prickes ende may vehementlye greater force resiste god dutie pull backe mary least beholding sepulchre gather matter mourning dare vse sharpe remedie euen themselues doe nourish intēperancie grief beare • cōpanie falleth oftentimes consolation little worth beare friendes much 32 shee fell downe feete falleth downe foot doe thereby gather worshipped house aboue cō mon order manner men although wont prostrate themselues kinges ruler yet christ selfe princely loftie thing himselfe according flesh mary falleth downe feete another ende neither would haue doone vnlesse shee beene perswaded hee sonne god lord thou hadst although seemeth speake honourably christ sort yet haue late declared corruption wordes doubtlesse power christ whiche replenish heauē earth ought haue bin restrained vnto corporall presence 33 hee groned spirite vnlesse christ sorrowed togeather woulde haue stood rather fierce countenance conformeth himselfe vnto euen vnto weeping declareth agreement euangelist seemeth iudgement expresse cause affection saith saw mary rest weep although doubt respect vnto higher matter namely vnto common miserie man vnderstood commaundement father giuen wherefore sent worlde namely might deliuer v frō euilles v deed meaning declare earnest affection minde therefore rayse vp lazarus help remedie doth testifie deepe groning spirit feeling griefe teares touched misery like sort felt doth groning perturbation agree sonne god seemeth absurd thing say christ subiect humane passion one number men thinke hee sorrowed reioyced wayes saue receiued himselfe affection often thoght good secret dispensation augustine thinketh euangelist said confirmation opinion christe troubled himselfe whereas men carried affection doe tyrannously rule trouble mindes therefore thinketh meaning wordes christe otherwise quiet minde free manner passion owne accorde grone sorrowe iudgement plainenesse agreeth better scripture say sonne god put vpō flesh also willingly take vpō man affection might differ brother thing sinne excepted meanes glory christ whit impayred seeing submission said haue voluntarie wherby came passe like vnto v affection soule submitted himselfe beginning must thinke voide free hath proued himselfe bee brother may know haue mediatour easily pardon infirmity readie help hath felt himselfe man obiect seeing humane passion corrupt likely common sonne god v answere great distance betwene v christ affection corrupt cause runne headlong intemperately neither keepe meane christ voide corruption framed obey god yea affection men corrupt froward two manner wayes first carried troublesome motion neither ordered according true rule modesty secondly doe alwayes arise lawfull cause least referred vnto lawfull ende call intemperancie man reioyceth sorroweth much suf • ieient much god doth permit also many doe rather refuse brideled furthermore vanitie minde causeth v lament bee sorrowfull thing importance cause much addicted vnto world thing christ passion goe beyond meane none iust taken reason right iudgement ende may plainely appeare shall good profitable distinguish betweene first nature man created god degenerate nature whiche corrupt sinne vvhen god dyd create man gaue affection dutifull obedient vnto reason disordered rebellious accidentall fault nowe christe take vppon humane affection without disorder whereby commeth passe hee whiche obeyeth passion flesh hee doth obey god christe troubled himselfe vehemently moued yet contained selfe within boundes father briefe conferre passion shall lesse differ faire cleere water runneth pleasantly doth differ pudly muddy fomes furthermore sole example christ ought bee sufficient v teach v refuse stony hardnes stoicks whence must fet rule principall perfection must rather studie hauing corrected tamed stubbornnesse wherewith affection • intangled reason adam sinne follow christe guide may bring v order paule 1 thess 4 13 doth require hand stonie blockishnes commaundeth v moderate mourning wee swallowed vp sorrow vnbeleeuers haue • hope euen cause dyd christe take vppon affection power may subdue corruption soeuer 36 beholde hee loued iohn describeth place vnto v double iudgement christ former sort men said behold loued although think honourablie became doe attribute nothing vnto humane yet doe speake iustly modestlye doe maliciously backbite hee deliuered lazarus death although commend power christ whereof spake nothing yet doe without certaine vpbraiding appeareth sufficiently thereby knewe myracles christ wrought yet vnthankefulnesse much filthie afraide murmur cease one point like sort men haue alwayes vnthankfull vnto god proceede vnlesse graunt desires▪ wee doe breake foorth complaining seeing hath alwayes wont help hitherto doth forsake disapoint mee heere reigneth double disease first doe rashly desire expedient yet wil make god subiect desire of▪ flesh secondly importunate beggers run headlong feruentnesse wilfulnesse rashnesse time 38 vvhen iesus therefore groned againe christ commeth vnto sepulchre idle beholder chāpion preparing himselfe vnto combate maruell grone againe violent tyrannie death ouercome eye expound groning proceede indignation vnbeliefe whereof haue spoken offende way seemeth vnto fit namely rather behold thing selfe thē men follow diuers circumstance doe set foorth power christe raysing lazarus death namely space foure dayes ye graue couered • stone christ commandeth taken away presence 39 iesus saith vnto take away stone martha sister 〈◊〉 saith vnto •• inketh hath dead foure dayes 40 iesus saith vnto said vnto thee thou beleeue thou shalt see glory god 41 therefore tooke away stone laid dead iesus lifted vp eye said father thanke thee thou hast hearde mee 42 knowe thou hearest mee alwayes companie standeth aboute haue saide may beleeue thou haste sente mee 43 vvhen spoken wordes hee cryed loude voyce lazarus come foorth 44 hee dead came foorth bounde hande foote bandes face bounde napkyn iesus saith vnto loose hym let goe 39 lord stinketh signe distrust shee fully persuaded power christe becommeth roote euill measureth infinite incomprehensible power christ sense flesh nothing agreeth lesse life rottennesse stinke martha gathereth hee alreadie past remedie pe •• er cogitation doe possesse mindes god sorte driuen away v hee cannot fulfil accomplish worke v truly wanted martha haue brother lie graue continually cutting hope life selfe shee doeth also endeuour stoppe way christe keepe hym backe raysing vppe yet shee intended nothyng lesse commeth passe weaknesse faith drawen hyther thyther fight selues whilest reaching one hand craue helpe god put backe whē offered vnto v martha lied said know whatsoeuer thou shalt desire god hee giue thee confused intangled faith helpeth little vnlesse come vnto matter bee applyed vnto vse martha may see manifold defect want faith euen best came first meete christe small testimonie godlynesse yet doth cease let therfore end may make way grace god may come vnto v let v learne attribute farre greater power vnto sens comprehend sobeit first promise god sufficient force v yet least let v stay selues martha whē confirmeth v second third time 40 say vnto thee reproueth distrustfulnesse martha shee conceiued sufficient hope promise heard appeareth place somewhat saide martha iohn doth set downe worde worde although haue said christ meant thus much hee called selfe resurrection life therfore martha condemned doth wayt work god thou beleeue said cause faith openeth eye may see glory god shining woorkes faith maketh way power goodnes god may shew foorth selfe towards v said psal 81 11 open thy mouth wide fill like side vnbeliefe stoppeth way god doeth keepe handes fast shut respect said another place iesus coulde shew myracle vnbeliefe math 13 58 power god tyed vnto wil men much lyeth driue away let wickednesse vnworthie reueale himselfe vnto commeth passe oftentimes god doth ouercome let yet notwithstanding often hee plucketh backe hande helpyng vnbeleeuers doth cause doe admitte accept beeing enuironed straytes vnbeliefe thou shalt see glory god note myracle called glorye god wherein whilest god sheweth foorth power hande glorifieth name martha length content second saying christ doth suffer stone remoued saw nothing yet heareth sonne god vaine commaund doe doth willingly depend vpon commandement alone 41 iesus lifted vp eye token mind well framed pray ende man may rightly call vpon god must ioyned cannot vnlesse lifted vp aboue earth hee ascend vp heauens done eye seeing hypocrite drowned deepe filth dregges flesh seeme sterne countenance draw heauen vnto child god must sincerelie perfourme doe feigne neither yet must lifteth vp eye toward heauen include god cogitation euery filleth heauen earth men mindes neuer escape acquit themselues grosse inuentions •• surmise base earthly thing god saue onely lifted vp aboue worlde scripture calleth v thyther testifieth heauen god seate touching lifting vp eye continuall ceremonie lawfull prayer cannot want publicane prayeth countenance turned towarde earth doth neuerthelesse pearce heauens faith yet profitable exercise whereby men awake stirre vp selues seeke god yea feruentnesse prayer doeth affect moue body oftentimes besides meditation doth willingly folow minde certainely without doubt christe lifted vp eye towards heauen hee carried thither singuler vehemecie moreouer wholy father would also bring others vnto besides himselfe thanke thee beginneth thankes giuing although asked nothing although euangelist doth declare prayed plaine word yet questionles went petition otherwise could heard bee thought hee prayed time gronings whereof euangelist maketh mention nothing vnlikely raged inwardly himselfe men amazed wont doe hauing obtained lazarus life giueth thankes vnto father furthermore acknowlegeth receiued power father hee confesseth father minister applyeth hymselfe vnto man capacitie sometimes defending openly diuinitie challendgeth himselfe whatsoeuer proper god sometimes content beare person man graunteth glory diuinitie vnto father euangelist reconcileth thinges together one worde well saith christe heard father giueth thankes men may knowe hee sent father may confesse hee sonne god maiestie christ could comprehended highnesse power god appeared flesh carryed vp rude dull sens men degree vnto highnesse seeing would wholy maruell hee apply himselfe vnto v diuers wayes yea maruell hee doe abase himselfe sake suffered himselfe humbled v 42 know thou didst alwayes preuention least man shold think highly father fauour could readily worke myracles soeuer would therefore hee giueth vnderstand agreement betweene hym father denieth nothing yea hee neede make prayer seeing hee knewe father commanded end might better made knowen vnto men worke god called therfore vpon father name man obiect vvhy rayse dead may easily answere certaine meane appointed counsell god myracles muche knewe sufficient proue gospell 43 hee cryed loud voyce touched hand call vpon voyce diuine power therein better shew selfe doth therewithall set foorth vnto v hidden wonderfull power force worde howe doth christ restore life dead saue word therfore shewed visible token spiritual grace raysing lazarus whiche doe dayly trie fealing faith whilest sheweth voyce doth quicken 44 bound bandes euangelist doth diligently reckon vp kerchiffe bandes ende wee may knowe lazarus came graue sort laid iewes also retain manner burying day hauing wounde bodie linnen cloath wrap head apart kerchiffe loose thing remayned amplifie glory myracle iewes might also feele handes worke god eye beholden christ could haue made lazarus shake bandes wherewith bounde haue caused fall away owne accord intende haue handes stood bee witness thrise ridicolous papistes gather auriculer confession thence christe say restored lazarus life woulde haue disciple loose therefore sufficient v reconciled god vnlesse church doe also forgiue sinnes whereby doe coniecture disciple appointed loose lazarus nay rather gather commaunded iewes doe ende might take occasion doubting 45 many therefore iewes came vnto many beholde thinges iesus done beleeued 46 wente vnto pharisee tolde iesus done 47 therfore high priestes pharisee gathered councell said doe wee man doth many myracles 48 let goe thus men shall beleeue romanes shall come take away place nation 49 one called caiphas high priest yeere said vnto yee know nothing 50 neither doe yee consider expedient v one man die people nation doe perish 51 said himselfe asmuch hee chiefe priest yeere prophesied iesus shoulde dye nation 52 nation hee might gather togeather one child god dispearsed 45 many therefore christe suffer myracle hee wrought bee vnfruitfull meanes hee brought vnto faith must note double vse myracles namely may either prepare v vnto faith confirme v faith euangelist toucheth former place hee meaneth speaketh maruell reuerence diuine power christe submitted themselues vnto disciple otherwise bare myracle could haue sufficient vnto faith therefore must vnderstand nothing el place worde beleeued saue onely readinesse imbrace doctrine christ forsake christe appeareth detestable vnthankfulnesse rather horrible madnesse wherby gather blinde madde vngodlinesse resurrection lazarus ought haue softened euen stonie heartes worke god vngodlinesse doth infect marre bitternes poyson therefore men profite myracles god must haue cleane heartes feare god although see heauen earth goe together neuer cease refuse sounde doctrine may see day many enemy gospel sight manifest euident hand god like mad men▪ yet notwithstanding doe meane season craue myracles handes ende saue may shewe themselues monster men resistin • stubornely christ brought vnto pharisee done consideration reason hypocrisie sharpe set resist gospel like sort doth afterward expresse thē name whenas saith councell gathered together themselues part priest euangelist nameth specially fannes set fire fury whole companie 47 therefore high priestes gathered togeather lesse monstrous blindnesse described place priest vnlesse beene dull blockish ought haue touched least reuerence christe euident token diuine power nowe meete togeather set purpose oppresse glory god beholding whereof become amazed doe plaine wordes make boast would make warre god seeing cannot suppresse christ without subuersion god power doe questionlesse fight againste openly without doubt sacrilegious boldnes infidelitie alwayes proude contemner god doth straightway breake lifteth vp horne god men haue long time wrasteled god still ende endeuour like giant climbe vp aboue heauens without anye feare god confesse christe wrought many myracles whence hee great power therefore doe openly addresse thēselues suppresse power god appeareth ye myracles christ mean god slake althogh dissēbleth time laugheth foolish arrogancie vntil y• time foorth wrath come psal 2 12 vvhat doe wee wordes accuse slouthfulnesse shoulde say came passe delay christe creepeth farther able behauing themselues stoutly breake course boldnesse wicked whereby challenge themselues thinges hande doe whatsoeuer seeme good owne eye successe worke subiect desire man doe well weigh thinges doe place set owne industrie power god coulde exceede god theyr diligence 48 wee let goe vvhat doe let goe certainly haue said euen fully persuaded stop way christ may goe farther diligent withstand christ bin som seducer bin dutie haue medled matter least lead away sheepe lordes flocke confesse myracles doe sufficiently declare cared god whose power doe carelesly hautily contemne roman shall come couer wickednesse fayre colour namely desire preserue common wealth feare troubled least tyranny fall ground feigne carefull temple worship god name nation estate people wherefore doubtlesse doe seeme vse colour may deceiue preach vnto people consult together apart secrete seeing guiltie falshood owne conscience doe vtter counsel meaning grosse euident soeuer vngodlinesse yet hath alwayes almost hypocrisie accompanie doth inwrap selfe croked boughtes lurking corner deceiueth vnder shew vertue chiefe drift showe shape grauitie moderation wisedome might deceiue others thought also deceiued vaine visure much feigned iust occasion persecute christ hypocrite although conscience doth inwardly accuse yet doe make themselues drunken vayne inuentions may seeme innocent sinning neuerthelesse manifestly contrary themselues beginning men confesse christ wrought many myracles nowe afraide romanes helpe enough enough power god sheweth selfe present myracles romanes shall come euangelist meaneth summe deliberation auoide daunger hang ouer head say romanes shall vnderstande thing renued state publike bee feared loast sende armie destroy nation temple worship god peruerse consultation whiche auoiding daungers cannot escape vnlesse wil turne aside right course vve must first see god commaundeth haue done euent soeuer shall befall v must continue sure certaine men thinke best make away christe least discommoditie doe befall suffer goe forwarde begun sent god vvill reiect prophet god may redeeme peace roman counsel doe feare god truly heart passe bee lawfull right vnlawfull wrong depend vpon chaunce onely way take godly good counsell seeke see doth please god secondly follow couragiously whatsoeuer prescribeth bee discouraged feare although wee bee compassed thousand deathes action continually directed according euery blast winde according wil god alone vvhosoeuer doth boldly despice daungers least hauing ouercome feare doth simplie please god shal length haue happy ende god doth blesse contrary hope constancie grounded obedience worde wicked caution little good feareful doe entangle themselues snare historie haue y• forme shape age liuely depainted vnto v desire accounted prudent circumspect haue song oftentimes mouth must take care common tranquillitie innouation goe free many daungers haue burdened v false enuie finde better way burying christe preuent tumult haue good successe wicked contempt grace god whilest inuent remedie pacifie tumultes withall doctrine saluation may abolished nay rather shall befall wicked whereof afraide notwithstanding howsoeuer wicked doe obtaine hope yet vnmeete rewarde pacifie worlde offendyng god place vncertaine whether speake temple countrie thought safetie consist temple pulled downe sacrifice solemne worshippe god calling vpon name cease therefore care religion became carefull temple againe profitable maintenaunce estate church carried away countrie againe yet remember captiuitie babylon whiche sharpe vengeance god againe common amongest prouerbe oftentimes repeated law kinde casting lorde cast land therefore gather church cannot continue safetie vnlesse christ destroyed 49 one called caiphas short consultation caiphas suffer stande doubt long furthermore hee assigneth one way obtaine health safety slea innocent behold great wickednes men breake doe rather take counsell according sense reason flesh without feare god according worde god doe thinke profitable cannot without displeasing authour goodnes much caiphas say must prouoke wrath god thinges may goe well vvherefore let v learne neuer separate profitable lawfull seeing wee must hope good thing ioyfull thing saue blessing god promised vnto wicked rebellious seeke helpe handes diuell vnto faithfull walke plainely wayes god yet reason colour common commoditie ought alwayes bee weight said euen people safe wicked death innocent whole body man whilest throate onely cut breast thrust swoord vvho high priest hee doth call high priest yeere yerely office wheras sold money giuen vnto diuers men contrary prescript law god would haue honour ended vnlesse man die thinges order turned topsie turuie came passe romanes
