oftentimes chaunge priestes furthermore euangelist saith caiphas spake himselfe spake vnderstood madde man one frensie spake thought euangelist meaneth superiour mouing tongue god meant shewe foorth mouth greater matter came minde therfore caiphas time double tongued vomited wicked cruell counsell purpose put christ death conceiued minde god turned tongue another way might also vnder doubtfull word vtter prophesie god would haue heauenly oracle proceede euen seate high priest iewes might without excuse although man conscience crue touched yet perceiued afterward blockishnes deserued pardon neither yet wickednesse caiphas whit hynder tongue beeing instrument holy ghoste god rather respect vnto priesthood instituted vnto man person reason touched voice comming high place might better hearde might haue reuerence weight like sort blesse people mouth balaam endowed spirit prophesie papistes ridiculous doe thereby gather accounted oracle whatsoeuer pleaseth bishop rome blunder first al admit graunt thing vaine alwayes prophet high priest yet must proue necessitie bishop rome created commaundement god priesthoode one man abolished comming christe neither doe wee reade afterwarde ordeined one man gouerne church admit graunt secondly title honour high priest translated vnto bishop rome must marke good priest embraced caiphas prophesie conspyre together put christ death may subscribe vnto iudgement let obedience farre v may driue v vnto horrible apostacie denying sonne god caiphas doth one voyce blaspheme also prophesie obey saying doe contemne prophesie catch blasphemie vve must take heed least befall v giue eare vnto romane caiphas otherwise similitude vnperfect furthermore aske question whether wordes high priest prophesies caiphas prophesie hee afterward condemne chiefest principall poynt faith blasphemie whence gather extraordinarie whereof euangelist maketh mention preposterously takē example 51 iesus shoulde die euangelist doth first declare summe saluation cōsisteth christ gather v together one mean recōcileth v vnto ye father whose power fountaine life vvhence doe also gather mankinde scattered abroade estraunged god vntill time child god doe growe together vnder christe head communion saint preparation vnto eternall life abide death christ doth gather vnto father shall see againe sixteenth chapter therefore paule ephe 1 10 teacheth christ sent ende hee might gather together thing heauen earth vvherfore enioy saluation brought vnto v christ must remoue dissention one god angel amongest selues death christ cause vnitie pledge thereof whereby tooke thinges vnto himselfe yet gathered together dayly gospell christ sheepfolde 52 nation euangelist meaning reconciliation made christ also extended vnto gentile called child god miserable scatteryng abroade wherein wandered make enemy god answere haue saide el sonnes child breast god themselues wandering lost sheepe yea nothing lesse sheepe rather wolues wild beast therfore counteth child god election euen called begin length reuealed vnto themselues vnto others faith 53 therefore day tooke counsell put death 54 therefore iesus walked openly amongest iewes went thence int • region nigh vnto desart citie called ephraim aboade disciple 55 iewes easter hande many countrie went vp ierusalem easter might purifie themselues •• 56 therefore sought iesus said amongest themselues sto • de temple thinke yee came vnto feast 57 priestes pharisee giuen commaundemente knowe hee shoulde tell might take 53 tooke counsell put death euangelist saith christe fled againe seeing knewe enemy furiously pursue yet let v remember flie hee myght withdrawe himselfe father calling purpose present himselfe readie suffer death willinglye time god appointed furthermore counsell whereof euangelist maketh mention much concerning death christe might finde meanes howe supresse alreadie decreed amongst made away deliberation onely remaine might accomplish determined 54 vvhich called ephraim thinke name citie heere set downe either corruptlie pronounced el new name know great alteration made tongue captiuitie babylon also howe much fashion lande chaunged vvhen speaketh disciple christ hee meaneth al receiued doctrine continually wont liue together house 55 many countrie went vp c easter myght purifie themselues • latly commaunded purifie selues offering passeouer therefore euangelist saith came manie lawefull vncleane care saye tooke vppe sanctifiyng accord priuate affection forbidden eate althogh prepared rite feast day drift euangelist shew howe famous christe howe greatly hee spoken throughout iurie meete together partes temple especially bent seeke christe talke together concerninge seeke manner menne yet seeking hym declare tyrannie priestes cause appeare openly chap 12 1 iesus therefore sixe dayes easter came bethania lazarus beene dead raysed vp dead 2 therefore made banquet martha serued lazarus one sate meate him▪ 3 tooke marie pounde oyntment spicknard precious annoynted feete iesus wiped haire house filled sauour oyntment 4 therefore one disciple iudas iscariot simon sonne whiche betray said▪ 5 vvhy oyntmente solde three hundred penny giuen poore 6 said cared poore theefe bag carry thinges giuen▪ 7 therfore iesus said shee hath kept vntill day buriall 8 haue poore alwayes yee haue alwayes 1 iesus c came bethania vve see iudgement ouer rash thought iesus would come whereby wee taught must make hast patient quiet mind stay vntill opportunitie come whereof wee know christ came first bethania might goe thence ierusalem three dayes meane intent giue iudas fit time place betray might sacrifice readie appointed houre neither ignoraunt shall befall goeth willingly offered vp vvhereas came bethania sixe dayes easter may gather matthewe marke hee stayed foure dayes iohn doth expresse day wherein banquet made vnto wherein annoynted mary likely done long ariuall furthermore think annoynting whereof matthew marke make mention deceiued therin respect y• time moueth two euangelists say christ annoynted make mention two dayes answere easie double iohn saith christ annointed first day hee came might haue done redie depart althogh haue said alreadie coniecture lik true annoynted day two departure certaine iudas barganed priestes christe sent two disciple prepare passeouer must need one day betweene least euangelists adde waited fit time betray christe hire therefore hauing made mention two dayes adde historie annoynting set downe first done last reason seeing recited wordes christe know two dayes sonne man shalbe betrayed adde omitted howe vpon occasion hee betrayed disciple appeareth sufficiently annointed bethania matthew marke say supt simon leper iohn doth expresse house doth sufficiently shewe supt place lazarus martha whylest maketh lazarus one sate meate hee inuited together christe neither disagreement matthew marke say head annoynted euangelist feete annoynting head ordinarie whereupon plinie counteth poynt much ryot certain annoynt ancles three agree together mary annoynt christ plentifully powred great store oyntmente therefore whereas iohn speaketh feete much said whole body christ annoynted euē vnto foot augmentation word foot appeareth better followeth addeth mary wipe feete hayre house filled smell simple liquor drawen narde compounde confection made smellyng thing therefore maruel house filled smel 4 therefore one disciple saith murmuring iudas followeth matthew attributeth vnto disciple generall marke certaine vsuall thing synecdoche apply vnto many belongeth vnto one although seemeth mee thing like bee true murmuring began iudas alone rest moued consent vnto easie matter diuers affection kindeled v whispering fannes principally backbitinges much bent vnto sinister iudgements doe take place v great credulitie rashnes beleeuing spirit god reproueth apostle teacheth v vnto v example readie credulous heare malitious speech 5 vvhy oyntment pound common oyntment cost plinie doth testifie ten penny man affirmeth highest price best oyntment three hundred ten penny euangelistes agree together costly oyntment wherefore without cause iudas doeth valewe hundreth penny summe amounteth vnto fiftie poundes french money according budaeus account furthermore forasmuch daintinesse almost hath included superfluous ryot greater losse money colour iudas murmuring haue said mary bestowed som small cost shee haue excuse seeing hath wasted great summe money vpon matter importance hath done iniurie poore might haue greatly relieued therewithal therfore fact deserueth pardon 6 theefe rest apostle condemne mary euill affection rashly iudas coloureth couereth wickednesse honest cloake speaketh poore cared example taught monstrous beast desire haue losse iudas thought sustained hauing matter stealing taken doeth driue vnto great outrage feareth betray christe likely onely lyed vnto others poore de • rauded also flattered himselfe inwardly hypocrite wont doe beene light offence betraye christ might thereby recompence damage receiued one cause moued betray christ hee might pull againe vnto pray escaped som maner meanes indignation conceiued reason gaine lost caused determine betray christ maruell christe woulde choose man steward knew theef thing reach haulter hang himselfe withal mortall man must make answere place iudgementes god deepe dungeon neuerthelesse fact christ must made comon rule commit caring poore office wicked vngodly man god hath giuen v law wherein hath set downe • e must called vnto gouernment church vnto office law wee may violate▪ christ estate far vnlike vnto seeing eternall wisdome god suffered secrete predestination take place person iudas 7 suffer vvhenas christ commandeth thē let mary alone hee teacheth men wickedly vniustly molest neighbour without cause procure cōtention matter nothing christ answere longer euangelists yet summe al one annointing wherwith iudas found fault defended reason done bury therfore christ doth alow ordinarie worship ought cōmonly vsed church wold haue dutie done vnto dayly would rather haue said thing giuen buriall truly god careth externall pompe yea seeing hee seeth man nature much bent vnto carnall rite doth oftentimes cōmand v sparing sober thing wherfore mistake christ much infer answer god delighted costly gorgeous worshipping seeing rather excuse mary vnto extraordinarie dutie ought made common rule worshipping god day buriall c saith oyntment kept meaning powred vain season according ye circumstāce ye time said saued kept said vp safe may brought foorth due time certaine would haue burdened sumptuous dainty would haue su •• ered saith yt mary according ye custome might doe last dutie furthermore annoynting body thē vain ceremony rather spirituall signe set eies men hope resurrection promise yet dark christ yet risen againe iust cause called ye first fruit rise againe 1 cor 15 20 therfore faithfull neede suche helpes yt might direct thē vnto christ yet absent therfore annointing christ superfluous thē seeing shortly buried annointed haue laid graue disciple knewe thus much yet without doubt mary inforced sodaine doe direction spirite whereon thought christ applieth vnto hope resurrection much disalowe commoditie selfe might reclaime wicked churlishnes soeuer christ would haue childhood old people gouerned exercise absurd thing v assay like neither coulde doe without iniurie christ hath driuen away shadowes comming resurrection yet fulfilled figure lawe requisite buriall shoulde bee adorned externall rite smell resurrection hath strength enough selfe without nard oyntments quickeneth whole worlde let v remember iudging concerning men factes must stand christ iudgement alone whose iudgement seat must stand 8 yee haue poore alwayes vve must note saide extraordinarie fact marie place distinguished common worship christe vvherefore ape true follower couet worship christ pomp sumptuous apparrell christe allow done rather forbid done afterward vvhereas saith alwayes diciples must bee referred vnto manner presence wherewith carnall worship costly honour agree present v grace power spirit dwelleth v doth also feed v flesh blood appertaineth nothing vnto bodily worship therefore pompe soeuer papist inuent worship christ withall bestow vpon vaine seeing hee doth openly refuse vvhereas saith poore shall alwayes v although toucheth therein hypocrisie iewes yet may gather profitable doctrine thence sacrifice whiche god alloweth smell sweete almes deedes wherewith pouertie poore holpen cost rightly bestowed worshipping god 9 great companie iewes knewe hee came iesus sake onely myghte see lazarus also hee raysed vppe dead 10 chiefe priestes tooke counsell togeather put lazarus death also 11 many iewes depart beleeued iesus 12 morrow great multitude came • east whē • ard iesus came ierusalem 13 tooke braunches palme tree went meete cryed hosanna blessed commeth name lord king israel 14 iesus founde young asse sate thereon written feare n • daughter syon thy king commeth sitting vpon colt asse 9 therefore multitude knewe nigher time christes death drawe requisite name praysed spoken amongst men ende might preparation vnto perfect faith death euāgelist mētioneth especially yt fresh myracle lazarus raysed vp death famous christe showe therein singuler token diuinitie god would haue many see vvhen saith came iesus sake also lazarus hee meaneth lazarus sake gaue honor apart might see manifest token christ power lazarus tooke counsell togeather furious madnesse goe kil manifestly appeare raised death god spirite gyddinesse wherewith satan pricketh forward wicked make ende madnesse although god doe set heauen earth sea agaynst wicked consultation described cause may knowe enemy christ brought vnto great stubbornnesse errour madnes furious wickednes afraid euē make war god himselfe secondly may know power god nothing obscure lazarus resurrection extinguish vngodlines could inuent remedie make away innocent man cruell detestable death seeing satan whole drift suppresse least darken workes god dutie bent continually meditate thereupon 12 next day great companie euangelistes set downe entrance christ large yet euangelist comprehendeth summe vve must first note christes purpose namely came ierusalem owne accorde hee might offer himselfe die requisite death bee voluntarie wrath god conceiued v could appeased meanes saue sacrifice obedience hee knew successe haue yet crucified wilbe entertained receiued people king solemne rite yea declareth manifestly beginneth kingdome going die although comming celebrated great assembly people yet vnknowen enemy vntill time proued true messias fulfilling prophesies shall see place would omit nothing might serue perfect confirmation faith great multitude came feast therefore straungers far ready dutie godlines vnto sonne god citizen ierusalem notwithstanding ought haue example vnto others sacrifice dayly temple alwayes sight whiche thing ought haue kindeled heartes desire seeke god principall doctor church sanctuarie god light therefore theyr vnthankfulnes filthie hauing excercises childhood doe either refuse el neglect redeemer promised frō beginning hath common vice almost age men doe much boldly despice god nigher familiarly offereth himselfe vnto greater zeale feruentnesse hauing left house come together celebrate feast day enquired diligently christ whēas heare yt commeth citie goe meete welcom questionles raised vp meet sort ye secret instinct spirit vve reade done earthly prince call subiects vnto sounde trumpet voyce cryer take possession kingdomes christe gathered together people vehement motion spirit might salute king vvhen multitude would haue made king wildernes withdrew priuily moū taine time thought vpon kingdome saue one might haue bellyes well filled lyke brute beastes therfore christe coulde yeeld vnto foolish disordered desire vnlesse would deny himselfe cast function enioyned father doth chaleng kingdome hee receiued father confesse indeede common people went meete throghly know nature kingdome christe respect vnto time come neuerthelesse suffered doe nothing agree spiritual kingdome 14 boughes palme tree went meet palme tree token victory peace amongst menne olde also woonte vse braunches palme tree asscribe empyre vnto humbly craue pardon one conqueror notwithstanding seemeth menne tooke braunches palme tree handes token mirth ioy seeinge entertaine new king cryed hosanna woorde testifie acknowledge messias iesus christe whoe promised tymes past father whose hand hope redemption saluation hundred eighteenth psalme crye taken made touchinge messias ende saintes might feruentlye continuall petition desire comming receiue great reuerence hee reuealed giuen therefore like bee true yea truelye may gathered prayer aunciente euery amongst iewes consequentlye euerye mannes mouth therefore menne wished well vnto christe spirite god goinge beefore theyr woordes chosen cryers make knowne messias come woord hesanna compounded two hebrew wordes signifieth asmuch saue make safe pray thee hebritians pronounce another sorte namely hosiahna vsuall thinge pronunciation corrupted often wordes translated another tongue notwithstanding although euangelists wrote greeke yet retained hebrewe worde end might better declare multitude vse solemne forme praier first delyuered dauid receiued continually time time amongst people god sanctified peculyerly vnto end vse might blesse kingdome christ end tendeth followeth immediately blessèd commeth name lord also happy prayer ioyfull prosperous successe kingdom whereupon felicity restoring church god depende dauid seemeth rather speake himselfe christ psalme must resolue doubt first neyther hard thing wee know end kingdome established dauid hys posteritie namely might certeine entraunce eternall kingdome bee manifested appoynted time neither dauid stay himselfe lorde doth euer turne eies al godly vnto prophet whatsoeuer dauid say himselfe referred good cause vnto king shuld arise according promise seede redeemer hence haue gather profitable admonition member church lord dooth stirre v vppe euen day vnto self desire wherewith would haue faithfull bee moued vnder lawe namelye hearte wish kingdome christ may flourish haue good successe onelye prayer wee doe testifie end may encouraged pray wee must note setteth downe woordes shall vse vvoe bee therefore vnto sluggishnes doe either extinguish coldnes choake luke warmnes feruentnes god stirreth vppe meane season let v know prayer shall bee vaine whiche make god direction instruction onely let v sluggish weary asking wil faithfull gouernor kingdome hee may defend inuincible power ayde maiesty thereof continue stande though cease doth florish gorgiously oftentimes ought doth rather decay see day horrible scattering abroad disorder yea wastenesse certeine happeneth throgh sinnes appeareth verye small almost restoring therof least goeth slowly forward let v impute vnto slouthfulnesse vvee craue daylye god kingdome may come scarse one hundreth beggeth earnest feruently therefore iustly depriued blessing god cannot aforde aske moreouer taught word god alone saueth defendeth church neither doth challeng commaunde thing attributed vnto saue owne therefore hauing tongue directed craue wil preserue christ kingdome wee confesse god himselfe onelye authour safety kingdome may stande estate vseth thing men diligence yet hath framed made meete owne hand secondly vseth helpe menne preserue kingdome christ sorte alone doth begin accomplish thing meanes power spirite commeth name lord vvee must first marke phrase meaneth come name lord hee commeth name lord intrudeth rashly vsurpeth himselfe honour falselye rightly called hath god guid authour action title belongeth vnto ye lawfull minister god prophet commeth name god directed spirit god deliuereth doctrine sincerely vnto men hath receiued heauen king commeth name whose hande god doth gouerne people spirit ye lord rested vpon christ head whosoeuer haue appoynted rule church haue subiect power gouernement yea streames flowing fountaine properly said haue come name lord neither doth excel others degree gouernment god doth wholy reueale himselfe vnto v dwelleth godhead bodily saith paule col 2 9▪ hee expresse image god finally true immanuel vvherefore saide haue come name god singuler kinde right god reuealed part time prophet whole therfore must begin head whēas wil speake good minister god false prophetes doe proudly boast name god doe vaunt themselues vnder false colour whereas notwithstanding carried vehement motion diuell destroy church must vnderstand opposition lord may scatter abroade bring naught cannot blesse christ must curse pope sacrilegious tyrannie hath set vp christe hee shaketh curse v thunder bolt lightning great force yet may safely contemne vaine proud wordes contrarie holy ghoste setteth place horrible curse wherwith may drowned euen deepe pit hell glory pompe neither hath need high priest pronounce curse seeing christ endow child power hee confirmed crie euangelists doe say 14 iesus found young asse▪ euangelistes doe distinctly set downe part historie namely christ sent two disciple fet asse enough iohn writ last briefly note summes thing handeled rest alreadie hereby commeth passe omitteth many circumstance show contrarietie troubleth many easily taken away vvhereas matthew saith christe sate vpon asse colte must bee taken spoken sen •• •• doe thinke sate first vpon asse afterwarde vpon colt frō surmise draw allegorie sate first vpon iewish people long time accustomed beare yooke lawe afterward made gentile subiect vnto wilde young asse simply true christ ride vpon asse brought together damme hereunto wordes prophet agree hath repetition common enough amongst hebritians expresseth one thing twice diuers wordes vpon asse saith vpon c • lte asse accust •• med yoke euangelist studieth briefe omitomitting former member doth bring latter furthermore iewes themselues enforced expound prophesie zacharie conteined nienth chapter nienth verse thē fulfilled messias yet doe mocke v deceiued shadow asse giue honour messias vnto sonne mary faith leaneth vnto farre testimony neither doe whenas say iesus christ begin heere came ierusalem sitting vpon • e appeared glory became sonne god wee haue first chapter diuine power appeared chiefly resurrectiō must despice confirmation god wonderful prouidence set open men vpon stage prophesie zacharie fulfilled entrance feare sentence prophete euangelist repeateth must first note mindes cannot quiet meanes • deliued feare trembling meanes saue christ doth reigne amongst v prophete vseth wordes exhorteth faithfull light glad euangeliste hath expressed howe mindes reioyce true ioy namely deliuered feare wherewith men tormented vntill time reconciled vnto god haue peace proceedeth faith rom 5 1 therefore haue goodnesse christ deliuered tyranny satan yoake sinne broken giltinesse dissolued death abolished doe freely make boast trusting ayde king vnder whose tuition whilest need feare daunger void feare long wee liue worlde hope leaneth vnto christ surpasseth feare vvhē christ yet farre prophete commaunded godly time mery ioyfull come behold saith thy king shall come therefore feare sithence come wee doe enioy presence must much valiantly wrastle feare safe enemy wee may worship king meekly ioyfully prophete spake time vnto syon house seate churche god hath gathered vnto himselfe church whole world yet promise properly directed vnto faithfull submit themselues vnto christ may reigne bringeth christ riding vpon asse giueth v vnderstand kingdom shalbe void worldly pompe gorgeousnesse rich might requisite shewed externall figure end men might openly acknowledge spirituall 16 thinges knew disciple first iesus glorified thē remembred thing written done thing vnto 17 multitude therefore called lazarus graue raysed vp dead bare witnesse 18 therfore multitude met hearde hee wrought myracle 19 furthermore pharisee said among themselues yee see yee preuaile beholde world gone 16 thinges knew disciple seede springeth vppe sone cast ground fruit work god appeareth apostle minister god fulfill prophesie cannot tell doe heare people crie confused crie christ plainely saluted king yet doe yet vnderstand ende meaneth therfore vnto vaine spectacle vntill time lorde doth open eye vvhen said remembred length thinges written cause grosse ignoraunce noted went knowledge namely scripture guide teacher directe mindes vnto pure right consideration blinde vnlesse word god doe goe v although euen sufficient worde god doth shine vnto v vnlesse side spirite doe illuminate eye otherwise blind euen perfect light christ vouchsafed bestow grace vppon disciple resurrection full time yet come wherein poured abundantly rich spirit vntill time receiued heauenly glory wee vii chapter ver 39 let v learne example iudge thing appertain vnto christ according scripture according prop • er sense flesh let v secondly marke peculiar grace spirite doeth instruct v tract time least wee dull considering vpon workes god interprete member thing written doone thinges vnto thus disciple first remember thinges done vnto christ rashly men rashly mocke businesse gouerned prouidence god requisite thinges fulfilled written therfore resolue thus thing vnto written 17 multitude bare witnesse hee repeateth againe said alredie many stirred vp fame great myracle came meete christ went troupe cause rumour raysing againe lazarus death euery dispersed therefore men iust matter cause ministred vnto giue honour due vnto christe vnto sonne marie seeing excellent power made knowen vnto 19 yee see ye preuaile wordes pricke forwarde themselues vnto greater madnesse certaine vpbraiding sluggishnesse shoulde say common people fell away vnto christ themselues flacke faint harted manner phrase common amongest desperate fellowes prepare themselues assay euen verye last vttermost thing enemy stubbornly bent euil must farre constant good purpose 20 certaine went vppe worship holye day greekes 21 therefore men came vnto phillip bethsaida galilee requested saying syr wee see iesus 22 phillip came tolde andrew againe andrew phillip tell iesus hymselfe 23 iesus answered saying houre commeth sonne man must glorified 24 verily verily say vnto vnlesse wheat corne fallen earth shall die abideth alone dye bringeth forth much fruite 25 loueth life shall destroy hateth life world shall keepe vnto eternall life 26 man serue mee let follow mee shall minister bee also man shall serue mee shall father honour 20 certaine doe thinke gentile vncircumcised followeth shortly came worship straitly forbidden lawes rome procōsules magistrate sharpely punish man founde fell vnto iudaisme hauing left worship countrie lawfull iewes dispersed asia grecia come ouer sea offer sacrifice temple secondly iewes woulde neuer haue suffered gentile mingled amongest solemne worship god would haue thought temple themselues sacrifice polluted meanes although came iewes yet dwelt farre beyonde sea maruell euangelist bring stranger men whiche knewe al thing done ierusalem place nigh thervnto therfore meaning inhabitant iurie came village city vnto feast intertaine christe king fame spread abroade also vnto dwelte beyonde sea whiche came farre countrie worship might doe also countrie iohn speaketh solemne kinde worship ioyned sacrifice although religion godlinesse tyed vnto temple yet lawfull offer sacrifice vnto god el neyther ark testimonie tokē god presence el euery man worship god dayly spiritually owne house yet requisite holy men whiche vnder lawe shoulde outwardly professe religion shoulde make suche profession commaunded moses shoulde present selues temple face lorde vnto end festiuall dayes appoynted bee menne dyd take suche longe iourney without greate charge trouble mighte neglecte externall profession godlinesse excuse wee haue day wee doe testifie wee worshippe true god owne house worship lawe ceased yet lorde hath left vnto church baptisme holy supper publike ryte prayer faithfull may exercise themselues therfore neglecting thing doth bewray studie godlinesse cold v 21 came vnto phillip signe reuerence goe straightway vnto christ desirous haue phillip make way may come vnto reuerence doeth alwayes bring foorth modestie selfe whereas papistes hereby gather dead must called vpon may patrones christ god father ridiculous necdeth refutation greekes speake presence phillip calleth vpon dead separated like vnto pray fruites man boldnesse hath graunted self libertie wander without bound worde god papistes foolishly rashly inuent owne braine inuocation saint ende may get themselues false colour cloake worde god corrupt rack scripture afraide set laughed shamefully 23 houre commeth many doe expound death glory christ thereby declared therefore thinke christ doth shew time death hand rather referre vnto preaching gospel said knowledge immediately spread abroade throughout partes world meant meanes preuent despayre casting downe death myght bring disciple sheweth cause bee discouraged doctrine gospell shall neuerthelesse published throughout whole world furthermore least cogitation concerning glory doe vanish away shortly shalbe adiudged die hanged vpon crosse length buried preuenteth time sheweth 〈◊〉 slaunder death doth whit hinder glory vseth fit comparison concerning matter vnlesse saith wheat corne shall die rot remaineth drie barren death seede doth quicken better fruite may come thence summe christ compareth death vnto sowing whilest seemeth tende destruction wheat cause farre greater encrease although admonition necessary instant yet hath continuall commoditie church meete wee begin first head terrible showe ignominie curse appeareth death christ doth darken glory also take quite away sight therefore wee must sticke abide death alone wee must also consider fruite resurrection brought foorth nothing shall keepe backe glory shining euery afterward must passe vnto member doe thinke wee perishe death life also like vnto continuall death colloss 3 3 therefore shall quite vndone vnlesse comfort doe helpe v wherewith paule lifteth v vp outward man corrupt inwarde man renued day day 2 cor 4 16 let therfore continual meditation godly whenas oppressed diuers sorrowes misery brough • vnto greatest strait whenas pinched hunger nakednes disease vexed iniuries thinke shalbe continually swallowed vp death • owing shall bring foorth fruite due time 25 loueth life christ adioyneth exhortation vnto doctrine must die may bring foorth fruite must patiently suffer god mortifie v setteth loue life hatred thereof must vnderstand know hate life loue intangled immoderate desire life cannot leaue world willingly said loue life contemning life doeth goe vnto death valiant minde said hate life life simplie hated good cause reckoned amongest chiefest benefites god faithfull must willingly cast away keepeth backe comming vnto christ likeas man shake shoulder troublesome vnprofitable burden make hast go som place briefe euill selfe loue life stranger alwaies bent toward y• mark lawfull maner louing life wee continue long lorde thinketh good alwayes readie depart fame pleasure may conclude word carrying hand offer vn god sacrifice vvhosoeuer addicted vnto life beyonde destroyeth life throweth eternal destructiō y• word perdere doth signifie place loose thing loue dearely destroy word anima vsually taken life doe take place place affection christe saide hee yeeldeth much vnto desire flesh destroyeth soule far fet y• simple plaine hee hath best way enioy life continually neglecteth furthermore end sense may better appeare clause worlde expressed must repeated twice sense may men euil prouide life loue world men doe truly know howe may saue life despice worlde truly whosoeuer tyed fast worlde hee doth owne accord depriue himselfe life whereof wee shall bee heires vnlesse pilgrimes stranger worlde therefore beastly affection whiche reigneth vnfaithfull while desiring include beeing worlde hereby commeth passe euery man bent saue selfe doth estraunge himselfe kingdome god true life hateth life haue already saide spoken comparatiuely wee must despice life often hindereth v liuing vnto god meditation heauenly life doe beare greatest sway heartes worlde shal able keepe v backe also answered question may obiected place many mē stay despaire cause chiefly wearie life notwithstanding say men doe prouide saftie soules health othersome die ambition doe also throw thēselues headlong eternall destruction christ doth plaine word place cōmend hatred contempt fraile life faithfull conceiue feeling better life therfore whosoeuer doth looke vp heauen hath yet learned saue life furthermore christ added latter member end might terrifie desirous earthly life much drowned loue world cannot easily forget cannot walke towardes heauen asmuch christ doeth violently awake v absurd thing sleepe deadly sleepe 26 man shall serue mee end death may bee lesse bitter troublesome vnto v christe doth inuite v vnto example vve shall ashamed refuse honour become disciple admitteth v number child vppon condition follow way himselfe prescribeth doth goe v vnto death therefore bitternesse death assuaged doth become sweete whilest condition die common v togeather sonne god therefore farre must loath christe cross sake must rather therefore desire die end tendeth yt followeth shall minister also requireth minister refuse submit themselues die seeing see goe meete seruant separated master futuretence woorde shalbe • put steede imparatiue mode manner hebritian • thinke consolation chist promise shalbe partaker resurrection greeueth die together whiche saide seemeth like true consolation added afterward father shal defraude christ minister hyre haue kept companie continually well life death 27 soule troubled shall say father saue mee 〈◊〉 therefore came houre 28 father glorifie thy name therfore came voyce heauen haue 〈◊〉 glorified glorifie againe 29 therfore multitude stood heard sayd thundreth said angel spake vnto 30 iesus aunswered saide voice came mee sake 31 nowe iudgement worlde nowe shall prince worlde bee cast 32 shall lifted vp earth drawe men vnto selfe 33 spake signifying manner death shoulde die 37 soule sentence seemeth first disagree much speech next goyng manifest token heroyicall hearte exhort dye also die willingly matter requireth nowe flyeth death doth confesse faintnesse hearte yet notwithstanding wee reade nothing place cōuenient like euery mā taught owne experience wittie fellowes laugh marueile doubtlesse cannot vnderstood without practise profitable yea necessarie saluation sonne god bee thus affected vvee must chiefely consider death sacrifice wherewith hee pacified wrath curse god furthermore could vnlesse shoulde take himselfe giltinesse therfore must need death dyed full horrour could make satisfaction v hee must needes feele horrible iudgement god vvhence wee may better gather crueltie sinne heauenly father sharply punish begotten sonne therefore let v know death sport pastime christe hee throwen euen extreame torment sake neither absurde thing sonne god thus troubled diuinitie hidden shewing foorth force sort rest might make roome sacrifice christ himselfe dyd put vpon fleshe also humane affection indeed voluntarie affection hee enforced feare submitted himselfe willingly vnto feare yet notwithstanding wee must thinke hee feared indeed feignedly although vnlike men affection tempered obey god iustice haue said el also commeth another commoditie hence vnto v beene perturbation christe reason feare death v woulde thinke example appertaine vnto himselfe doublesse graunted vnto v die without feeling sorrow griefe whenas heare hard strength encourage selues follow neither doth infirmitie flesh feareth death hinder v adioyning selues vnto captaine companion striue wrastle shall say see plainely deare price sonne god pay saluation whilest brought euen greatest straites found wordes wherewith might expresse vehemencie griefe neither yet counsell according man remaine flieth vnto prayer desireth deliuered death againe doth also see appointed eternall counsell god sacrifice sinnes doth correct petition huge sorrowfulnes wroung doth owne hand pull backe himselfe hee may stay himsefe wholy vpon father vve must note place siue degree complaint possesseth first place breaketh vnmeasurable sorrow secondly perceiued need remedie least ouerwhelmed feare asketh himselfe shoulde doe thirdly hee getteth vnto father desireth deliuer fourthly calleth backe petition hee knewe contrary calling desireth suffer whatsoeuer rather fulfill function enioyned father lastly beeing content glory god alone forgetteth thinges setteth nothing seemeth vndecent sonne god petition doth escape vnaduisedly whiche hee must call backe againe renounce hee may obey father confesse indeede foolishnes crosse wherewith proud men offended wherat stumble lorde glory abased himselfe manifestly doeth loue towarde v appeare vve must remember said humane affection christe free pure free sinne reason framed tempered obey god neither let christe may feare death naturally yet may desire obey god namely according diuers respect hence proceedeth correction therefore come houre howe soeuer hee feareth death selfe yet notwithstanding considereth ende sent office redeemer doth require offereth feare conceiued fealing nature gouerned father rather tamed • ame free libertie addresseth himselfe doe god commanded doe sobeit requisite affection christe whiche free pure vice shoulde thus brought vnder hee might obey father diligent must point seeing many enemy god v slow affection frō flesh let therfore meditatiō godly yt violence themselues vntil denie themselues vve must also note must bridle affection flat contrarie god also hinder course calling although otherwise wicked corrupt ende may better appeare must place god first degree sincere perfect man second whiche god gaue adam christe last infected sin god rule wherunto must subiect lower nowe pure nature shall rebell god selfe yet shall man bee preuented many hinderance although wholy framed right vnlesse bring vnder affection may obey god therfore christ one single combate ceased feare feared naturally whenas acknowledgeth doth please god otherwise haue double combate must wrastle stubbornnes flesh hereby commeth passe euen valiant champion doe get vpper hand without wound father saue mee vve must keepe order often vexed feare tormented sorrowe heart straightwaies lift vppe themselues vnto god nothing worse hurtfull nourish within tormenteth v see great part world gnawe themselues blinde torment iust punishment slouthfulnesse arise vppe vnto god feele release ease 28 father glorifie thy name sheweth wordes preferreth father glory thing yea setteth nothyng life respecte thereof true moderation petition doe sort desire god glory thing giue place thereunto recompence oughte satisfie v aboundantly beare suffer thinges quiet minde grieuous troublesome vnto v haue glorified woordes import much sayd finish haue begun doubtlesse god doeth leaue worke handes vnperfect psal 138 8 god intent purpose preuent offence crosse doeth onely promise death christe shall glorious doeth also set many ornament wherewith already adorned 24 thundered like monster multitude astonied became amased sawe manifest myracle doe heare deafe eares confused noyse god vttered plainly blockish yet doe greatly diminish maiestie voyce god faine angell authour thereof also common thys day god speaketh plainly inough gospell force efficacie spirite doeth shewe selfe whiche ought shake heauen earth doctrine cold amongst many proceede mortall man vnto word god balde barbarous like vnto thunder notwithstanding question whether voyce sounded heauen vain answer euangelist doeth heere ascribe vnto multitude doeth belong vnto part thereof besides apostle sinister interpreter euangelist hys meaning briefly note wont commonly happē world wit whē part hearing god speak plainelye alowd doth heare 30 sake christe neede confirmation father care lesse v must holde maxima▪ like christ put vpon flesh sake good thinges soeuer receiued father bestowed vppon sake againe also true voice came heauen respecte people doubtelesse hee hymselfe hadde neede anye externall myracle furthermore heere certeine secrete kynd exprobration iewes deaffe like stone heare voice god seeing god speaketh theyr sake theyr vnthankfulnesse hath excuse whilest doe hearken 31 iudgement world lord hauing ended combate hauing cōquered feare also death triumpheth doth royally shew forth fruit death might haue beene cause casting downe discouragement vnto disciple thinke woord iudgement doth signifie reformation thinke signifieth damnation doe rather agree former sorte expound thus world shall restored good order hebrew word misphat translated iudgment doth signifie good order knowe without christe nothing confusion world although christ begunne already erect kingdome god yet death beginning well ordered estate perfect restoring worlde yet must note good order cannot worlde vnlesse kingdome sathan first abolished flesh bee brought nothing whatsoeuer contrary righteousnes god fynally mortification must needes goe beefore newnes worlde vvherefore christ pronounceth prince world muste cast discipation deformity proceed hence whilest sathan vsurpeth tyranny iniquitie dooth get vpper hande therefore sathan cast world reclaymed backsliding brought vnder gouernment god anye man demaund sathan cast death christ ceaseth make warre continually aunswere casting restrained vnto small time excellent effect christes death described appeareth dayly •• 32 vvhen shalbe lifted vp maner appointing iudgment doth followe namely christ lifted vp vpon crosse shal draw al men vnto may lift vp earth heauen euangelist saieth christe shew manner death therfore doubted sence crosse shalbe like chariot wherein may lifte vp men vnto father might seeme haue beene lifted vp earth end might haue nothing doe men afterward hee pronounceth shall fall farre otherwise namely hee maye drawe vnto himselfe fastned wholly set vppon earth although allude vnto forme death yet hee meaneth generally death shalbe breach whereby shall bee separated men new way drawe earth heauen saith men referred vnto child god flocke yet doe agree chrysostome teacheth christ vsed vniuersall word church gathered aswell gentile iewes according shall bee one shepheard one sheepefold aboue 10 16 old latine translation hath wil draw thinges vnto augustine holdeth ought read agreement al greeke bookes ought greater force amongst v 34 multitude aunswered haue heard lawe christe alldeth euer saist thou sonne man must lifted vp son manne 35 therefore iesus sayd vnto yet litle light walke whilst yee haue light least darknes catch walketh darknes knoweth whether goeth 36 vvhilst ye haue light beleeue light ye may child light thinges spake iesus going away hid 34 vve haue heard law questionlesse intent malitiously cauill wordes christ therefore maketh blinde owne wickednes see nothing clear light deny must take iesus christe saide die whereas law attributeth vnto messias perpetuity expresly set downe law christ shal dye kingdome shal florish vntill end world men take occasion cauill seconde member beginning errour esteme gorgeousnes kingdome messias according sense fleshe hereby commeth passe refuse christ correspondent vnto surmise vnder word law also comprehend prophet present tence put steede future tence word abideth according hebrew phrase interrogation son man conteineth mock christ yeeld ouercome short refutation vvhereby appeareth arrogant ignoraunce importeth much said go thy wayes boast thy selfe christe seeing thine owne confession proueth thou art vnlike vnto 35 yet litle although lord doth gently admonish answere yet doeth therewithal prick sharply chideth could see light doth also denounce light shalbe taken shortly vvhē saith remaineth smal time light confirmeth already said concerning death although doth meane light corporal presence gospel yet hee alludeth vnto departure shuld say shal go away wil cease light litle shal darknes able impare vvhen hee saieth light present toucheth way passe ouer light shut cies therefore giueth vnderstand vnworthy haue obiectiō answered minister vnto themselues matter errour owne accord vvhen saith light shineth vnto short time thing common al vnbeleeuers scripture promiseth sonne righteousnes shal arise vnto child god shal neuer sit isai 60 19 sunne shal shine vnto hereafter day moone night lord shalbe vnto euerlasting light yet must al men walk circumspectly darkenes doeth followe contempt light vvhich thing also cause thick night darknes ouerwhelm whole world bicause vouchsafed go forward brightnes heauenly wisedom appeared vnto christ shineth vnto v gospel end may folow way saluatiō whiche sheweth therfore men vse grace god asmuch lieth extinguish light whiche offered end may terrifie telleth miserable estate men destitute light doe wander theyr whole life cannot moue foote forwarde without daunger slyppinge fallynge christe pronounceth darknes vnlesse giue v light hence gather force quicknes man minde seeing thing whā mistreile guid without christ 36 beleeue light hee exhorteth possesse lighte fayth calleth child light like true heires doe enioy vntill end thinges spake iesus may seeme merueilous matter withdrewe himselfe receiued willingly may readily gather euangelists speach concerneth enemyes grieued godlye desire good playne men straungers went meete christ followed euen temple hee hit amongst scribe multitude citie 37 furthermore although wrought many miracle beleeued 38 woordes isaias prophet might fulfilled whiche hee spake lorde whoe hath beleeued reporte vnto whome aime lorde reuealed 39 therfore could beleeue isay saith againe 40 hee hath blynded eye hardened theyr hearte may see theyr eye vnderstand theyr heart conuerted may heale 41 thinges sayeth iesaias hee sawe glorye spake 37 although wrought least shoulde hinder manne christ despised amongst iewes euangeliste remoueth stumbling blocke shewing furnished excellent euident testimony might make doctrine credit yet blinde see power glorye whiche shined plainly miracle therefore must first holde christ faulte beleeued amongst iewes hee didde aboundantly testifie manye miracle hee therefore vniust thing contrary reason vnbeliefe whit discredit self thing might haue caused many stand doubte whence came iewes dull visible power god moue nothing iohn goeth namely faith ariseth common sense man singuler rare gift god sayde christe scarse fewe shoulde beleeue gospell 38 wordes iesaias iohn meaneth necessity laide vpon iewes reason prophesie neither iesaias vtter thing chap 53 1 rom 10 16 saue whiche god reuealed vnto hidden treasure counsel shuld haue happened although prophet said nothing known shuld haue befallen vnlesse god made knowne mouth prophet euangeliste setteth beefore eye glasse matter otherwise darke vncredible almost lorde hath beeleeued sentence hath two member former esay hauing already begunne speake christe seeing hee foreseeth whatsoeuer eyther speake apostle shuld afterward publish reiected iewes beeinge astonyed great wonder cryeth lorde shal beleeue report second member acknowledgeth cause witte men come vnto theyr owne industry god dooth illuminate men generall dooth onely vouchsafe graunt grace spirite vnto fewe obstinate vnbeliefe many ought haue hindered faythful amongst iewes soeuer reason ought also perswade v ashamed gospell althogh haue disciple yet must especially note reason added wit reuelation god doth make men faythful well knowne woorde arme meante power god prophet telleth v arme god whiche included gospell dooth lye hidde vntyll suche time bee reuealed hee doth also testifie menne generallye partaker reuelation vvhereuppon followeth manye beeinge voyde thys inwarde lyghte lefte theyr blindenesse hearing cannot heare 39 therfore could beleeue somwhat harder beecause wordes doe sound way stopt iewes power beleeue cutte prophesie prophet adiudged vnto blindnes beefore chuse eyther two answere absurdity could otherwise come passe god foreseene wee must note bare plaine foreknowledge god cause thing although must much respecte foreknowledge god place iudgment vengance god doth declare seeth heauen menne wil doe himselfe wil doe namely strike wicked dulnesse giddinesse may bee auenged wickednes set downe nigh inferiour cause god wil haue word nature wholsome cause death destruction vnto iewes wit deserued wickednes impossible escape punishment god determined cast reprobate sense turne vnto light worde darknes latter prophesie vnlyke former prophet doth testifie none doe beleeue saue whome god dooth illuminate free good pleasure cause wherof doth appeare seeing men lost alike god doth mere mercy goodnes distinguish thinketh good rest maketh mention hardning heart wherewith god reuenge punish wickednes vnthankfull people marke degree wickedly confound mixe together diuers place scripture 40 blinded eies place taken sixt chapter iesaias lorde telleth prophet time paynes shall bestow teaching shall haue fruit saue onely people shall made worse therefore saith first go tel people hearing heare ye heare say send thee speake vnto deaffe afterwarde hee addeth make blinde heart people c wordes giueth v vnderstand appointeth worde punishment vnto reprobate end blindnes may made thicker thereby may deeper drowned darkenes horrible iudgmēt god doth ouerwhelme mindes menne light doctrine depriued vnderstanding • yea bringeth darknes vppon onely lyght furthermore must note thing befalleth woorde god accidentally doth blinde menne nothing vnconuenient trueth differ nothing lyinge bread life shuld become deadly poyson disease shuld encreased medicine imputed vnto wickednes man turneth life death furthermore wee must note lord doth sometime make men mindes blinde himselfe depriueth iudgement vnderstanding somtimes sathan false prophetes hee maketh foolyshe iuglinges somtimes also minister doctrine saluation vnto hurtfull deadly prophet doe apply themselues diligently function commit fruit labor vnto lord althogh fal wold wish must faint faile let rather sufficient know god alloweth labour although vnprofitable men yea smell doctrine whiche wicked make deadly themselues good sweete god paule doth testifie 2 cor 2 15 heart sometimes taken scripture place seate affection place manye thys word meant intellectiue part soule call lyke sorte moses saieth deut 29 4 lord hath giuen thee hearte vnderstand may see eye let v remember prophet speaketh vnbeleeuers hadde already refused grace god certeine menne nature vnlesse lorde frame hath chosen vnto obedience therfore condition men lyke indifferent beginning wicked rebelled god owne accorde wickednes vengeaunce taketh place beeing cast reprobate sense cease runne owne destruction therefore lorde haue conuerted floweth fault themselues vnto themselues authours dispayre word prophet wee taught briefly sort beginne turne vnto god namelye lighteneth heartes must needes bee turned away long ouerwhelmed darknesse sathan side force diuine light pulleth v vnto transformeth v image god fruite conuersion added healing woord prophet meaneth prosperous estate blessing god consequentlye deliuerance al misery procede wrath god befal reprobate contrary nature word muste mark opposition contrary vse namely woord preached vnto v end may illuminate v may know god aright may turne v vnto god reconcile v vnto end may blessed happy 41 thinges saieth iesaies least reader thinke testimony cited season iohn telleth plainely prophet teacher one age onely glory christe rather reuealed vnto hee might beare witnesse thinges happen time reigne end serued propheticall reuelations saue might deliuer handes hadde receiued god euangeliste taketh thing menne doe graunte iesaias saw glory christe whence gathereth hee applyed doctrine vnto estate kyngdome whiche shoulde bee 42 notwithstanding many euen ruler beleeued confesse pharises least cast synagogue 43 loued glory men glory god 44 iesus cried said beleeueth beleeueth sent 45 seeth seeth sent 46 came light world end euery one beleeueth may abide darknes 42 notwithstanding seeinge iewes didde frowardlye reiecte christe confused noyse fearcenesse myght seeme hadde conspired together notwithstandinge euangeliste saieth euen middest great maddenesse nation many well minded example grace god worthy bee remembred impiety hath gotten vpper hande certeine vniuersall plague infecteth partes body infection thereof therefore singuler gift god remaine sounde middeste people corrupt although grace god appeareth euen daye world much soeuer vngodlynesse contempt god doe rage euery infinite companye doe endeuour vtterly banish doctrine gospel yet findeth many bie place rest whereby commeth passe fayth hath resting place least shee quite banished world woorde euen great force gospell deadlye hated amongst ruler vncredible thinge anye one shuld found whiche faythfull much power spirit wondred pearced thyther entraunce although faulte one age onely ruler stubborne rebellious christe honor rich dignitie haue pride almost alwaies keepe thē company vvherefore hard matter menne tamed willing humility beinge puft vppe arrogancye doe scarse acknowledge themselues men therefore man soeuer excellent word let wise trust much greatnes least hinderaunce vvhereas hee saieth many must take either parte halfe compared vnto others whereof great multitude many cō sidered themselues pharisee hee seemeth speake vnproperly separateth faith confession hearte man beeleeueth vnto righteousnes mouth confession made vnto saluation neither faith kindled heart must put forth flame aunswere place declared weake faith lukewarm rather cold briefe iohn meaneth embraced doctrine christ knew proceede god yet liuely fayeth faith endowed power requisite christ giueth vnto spirit feare constancy may bold freely without feare confesse haue learned although doe think altogether dumbe yet confession free enough euangelist iudgement doth flatly denye made confession faith lawfull profession openly giue name vnto christ vvherefore let man flatter himselfe couereth cloaketh faith point least incurre hatred men much soeuer hate name christe yet feare bee excused compelleth v turne aside euen litle confessing thereof note also lesse strength constancy ruler ambition doth reigne parte nothing seruile may briefe earthly honour bind men golden fetter cannot doe duety freely therefore base low estate must therewith much rather contented free manye least worste snare neuerthelesse great noble men must striue estate least vnto hinderance keepe backe submitting themselues vnto christ iohn saieth afrayde pharisee lawful man call himselfe disciple christ priest scribe beecause outragious kynd crueltye menne coloured zeale zeale defend relygion excellent vertue lyeth hypocrisie vnder canne bee worse plague vvherefore wee must instantly desire lord gouerne v certeine sure rule spirit least cast synagogue beeholde thing hindered witte feare infamy shuld haue beene cast synagogue furthermore heereby appeareth howe great frowardnes men doth onely corrupt beste ordinaunces god turneth deadly tyranny excōmunication ought haue beene string sinow holy discipline might haue punishment readines manne despise church brought passe whosoeuer confesse christes banyshed company faithfull likeas pope dooth daye falselye pretende lawe excommunication may practise lyke tyrannie dooth blind madnesse thunder cast lightening agaynst godly dooth also endeuoure throwe downe christ heauenlye seate yet ashamed impudently pretende tytle holy iurisdiction wherewith christ didde adorne hys church 43 loued euangelist doth plaine word set downe men became superstitious onely auoide reproach amongst men ambitiō force amongst feare god followeth set free vaine feare cōsciēce let reader mark great ignominy fearfulnes condemned god dissemble cloake fayth amongst men feare enuy vvhat preposterous yea beastly preferre vaine praise men iudgemente god yet pronounceth possessed suche madnesse auoide enuy menne pure faith must confessed good cause apostle 11 27 doth commend inuincible constancy moses saieth waxed hardye seene inuisible whiche woordes hee giueth v vnderstand man hath fastened eye vppon god heart shall strong hard adamant therefore hence commeth softnesse maketh v fall awaye vnto vnfaithful disimulation al sens waxe dull beholding world sincere beholding god put away al smoke honour rich let go shake theyr eares thinke wicked denying christ lighte veniall sinne seeing spirit pronounceth contrary filthy monster heauen earth shuld go together loue glory men doth signifie place desirous esteemed amongst men therefore euangeliste meaneth men addicted vnto woorlde hadde rather please menne god moreouer whylest euangelist accuseth denyers christ crime hee dooth also declare excommunication litle sette high priestes abuse contrarye equitie ryghte vvherefore lette v knowe vaine terrifyinge cursinges excommunication soeuer pope dooth thunder againste v wee knowe assuredly hee goeth aboute nothinge else saue onelye leade v away christ 44 iesus cryed sentence tendeth ende christe may encourage vnto iust vnbowable constancy saith yet contained herein reprehension whereby meant correcte wicked feare cry serueth make vehemēt doctrine onely exhortation also prick forward sum faith christ doth leane vnto mortal man vnto god findeth nothing christ diuine yea beholdeth god face thence gathereth absurd thing shuld faint quaile doubtful cannot god greater iniury trueth bee sufficiente v therefore man hath rightly profited gospel leaning vnto confidence hope beleeueth men god doth persist strong quiet al engine satan therefore end may giue god honour let v learne must stande faith world doth faile also satan doth trouble supplant whatsoeuer vnder heauen faithful said beleeue christ doe abyde beholdinge hee manne hee compareth himselfe place father commaundeth v haue respecte vnto power god beecause weakenes fleshe hath selfe strength vvhen shall afterward exhort disciple beleeue hys wordes shall haue another meaning god set place man christ set midst withal giftes ought haue sufficient force retaine fayth 45 seeth take sight knowledge ende may set rest conscience otherwise subiecte many tossinges turmoylinges calleth v vnto father stabilitie faith certeine firme cause aboue world christ truely known glory god shineth maye knowe assuredly faith wee haue doth depend vpon man grounded eternal god riseth flesh christ vnto diuinity thing must setled continually hart also must vtter self tongue without feare need shal require 46 came light end hee may make disciple stout strong proceedeth yet preaching certeinty fayth doth first testifie hee came worlde hee might light whereby men may deliuered darknes errours also assigneth meanes attaine vnto great goodnes saying whosoeuer beleeueth c furthermore hee accuseth vnthankefulnes taught gospel doe separate themselues vnbeleeuers excellēt good thing called darknes light lesse excuse haue choake light kindled slouthfulnes cō tempt wordes great force came light world althogh christ light beginning yet doth vain adorne title came fulfill function light ende may haue distinct degree hee teacheth rather light vnto others vnto secondly angel also men thirdly reuealed flesh end might shew forth perfect brightnes vniuersall word seemeth put set purpose partly end might make goodnesse common vnto faithfull without exception partelye might shew vnbeleeuers therfore perishe darknes flye light accord nowe wisdome world gathered togeather shall founde one sparkle true light huge heape shall rather lump without forme much proper christ alone deliuer v darknes 47 man shal heare word shal beleeue iudge came iudge world saue world 48 reiecteth doth receiue word hee hath one shal iudge word haue spoken shal iudge last day 49 haue spoken self father sent gaue mee commandement shal say shall speake 50 know commandement eternal life thing therfore speake father hath told speak 47 man shall heare woordes hath entreated grace exhorted vnto constancie faith beginneth nettle rebellious although doeth place also mitigate seuerity whereof vngodlinesse woorthy sette purpose reiecte god omitteth iudge hee came rather saue men vve must first vnderstande speaketh place manner vnbeleeuers willingly wittingly doe reiecte doctrine gospell shewed vvhy christ condēne hauing laid away person iudge place end menne may encouraged repent offereth saluation vnto men generall holdeth armes abroade embrace men although meane season amplifieth fault smal circumstance refuse gentle sweete inuitation much said behold stand cal men hauing forgotten person iudge mine purpose allure al men deliuer destruction seeme twise destroyed already therefore man condemned contempt gospel saue despising louely message saluation would owne accorde bring destruction vppon himselfe worde iudge appeareth contrary saue heere taken condemne thys ought referred vnto proper naturall office christ vnbeleeuers greuously condemned gospel sake accidentall thing naturall haue else sayde 48 reiecteth least wicked shoulde flatter themselues might play wātōs christ freely addeth place horrible denunciation though say nothing yet doctrine sufficient condemne like saieth else haue neede anye iudge moses whome made theyr boast aboue 5 45 meaning therefore wordes beeing enflamed earnest desire haue saued doe abstaine mine authority condemning whollye bente saue whiche loste maye therefore thinke escaped hand god howsoeuer hold peace word haue despised fitte iudge doth receiue wordes latter member expoundeth former hypocrisie naturally engrafted men canne nothing readily onely word boaste ready receiue christ know cōmon boasting euen amōgst worst men vvherefore must marke definition christ reiected doe imbrace pure doctrine gospell papistes doe full open mouth blunder name christ soone sincere trueth brought abroad nothing detested amongst men kysse christe iudas therfore let v learne include word giue worship obedience requireth word speake authority gospell coulde haue greater commendation giuen power iudgement attributed vnto according word last iudgment shal nothing else approbation doctrine gospell christe selfe shal goe vppe iudgement seate hee affirmeth hee wil giue sentence according word whiche preached denuntiation ought make wicked sore afrayd shall able escape iudgment doctrine proudly floute notwithstanding christ meaning depriued feeling maketh mention last iudgement telleth punishment shal manifestly appeare doe mocke againe godly may gather hence inestimable comforte howsoeuer condemned world yet doubt acquited heauen beecause wheresoeuer faith gospell hath place iudgemente seate god erected saue cause wee passe papist peruerse iudgements long trust right faith doth surpasse angel 49 speake myselfe least outwarde shape manne whitte impaire maiesty god christ dooth euer nowe call v vnto father cause dooth hee often make mention father truely seeing wickednes translate iot god glory vnto must needes word came god whereunto iudgement ascribed place christ distinguisheth himselfe father simplye according diuine persō rather according flesh least doctrin esteemed maner men shuld lesse weight importāce conscience subiect doctrine lawes mē reason shuld agree christ bringeth word saith shal iudge came frō mā according saying ia 4 11 one lawgiuer c moreouer gather hence monstrous sacriledge pope durste tye mennes soules vnto inuentions thys meanes hee taketh hymselfe sonne god whoe sayeth speaketh onelye according father appointmente 50 commaundement eternal lyfe hee commendeth againe fruite doctrine ende al menne may willingly submitte themselues thereunto nowe meete wicked doe feele god vengeaunce refuse wil haue vnto authour life chap 13 1 holye daye easter iesus knewe houre come go worlde vnto father seeing loued world vntil end loued 2 vvhen supper ended deuil put hart iudas son simon iscariot betray 3 vvhen iesus knew father giuen al thing hand came god go vnto god 4 rose supper layd cloathes hauing taken linnen towell girded 5 put water bason began wash disciple feete wype towel wherwith girded 6 therefore came simon peter saith vnto lord doest thou wash feete 7 iesus answered said vnto doe thou knowest yet thou shalte know hereafter 1 holy day iohn passeth ouer many thinges sette purpose knew matthew luke recited hee himselfe taketh hande handle whiche hee knew omitted number hystory washing feete although plainely declare afterward end christ washed disciple feete yet doth one word place sette constant perpetuall loue wherewith hee loued declared token although hee taken sight yet might certeinelye perswade themselues loue quenched death vvhich perswasion muste sticke faste euen heartes daye woordes christ loued euen vntil end world vvhy doth describe apostls periphrasis saue onely may know christe cared muche daungerous harde warfare wee vvherefore although seeme farre christ yet must knowe hath respect vnto v loueth conuersant world neither nede doubt beareth lyke affection euen instant loued hee might goe worlde vnto father phrase woorthy nothing referred vnto christ knowledge knew death passage vnto heauenly kingdome god if▪ bee made haste thither ceased loue hys woont cause shoulde thinke affection altered asmuch first begotten dead definition death doth appertaine vnto whole body church passage vnto god whome faithfull estranged 2 vvhen supper done vvee shall anon handle large hys place whole purpose christ washing disciple feete also fruite hystory let v follow text saieth done time iudas determined betraye christe onely might shew forth wonderfull patience christ could abide wash wicked false traitours feete also chose time sette purpose wherein would play last acte life euen deathes dore saith iudas conceiued intent purpose betray master instigation perswasion deuill serueth expresse crueltye wickednes horrible tragical fact wherin efficacie force sathan shew forth selfe true men commit wickednes whereunto sathan doth pricke thē forwarde cruell execrable euery fact wee must much consider fury deuill dooth carrye men forsaken god hither thither althogh man concupiscence kindled fanne satan yet doth cease furnace selfe hath fire selfe receiueth mouinge fanne willingly wicked without al excuse 3 vvhen iesus knew father giuen thinges hand thinke added cause end wee may knowe whence christ quiet minde witte hauing alreadye ouercome death lyfted vppe minde towarde triumph whiche immediately follow menne woont tosse many thing fro mindes afraide euangeliste giueth v vnderstand motion christ although immediately betrayed iudas yet knew father hadde giuen thinges manne aske howe afterwarde sorrowfull hee swette bloud aunswere thinges necessary shuld afraid death yet notwithstanding hee fulfill whole function mediatour 4 laid away clothes▪ vnderstande hee laide awaye vpper garment coate know men east part world vse long garmentes wordes follow shortly beganne wash • eete c doe rather expresse christ purpose external acte euangelist saieth afterward began peter 6 lord doest thou wash feete speach proper one abhorreth absurde vndecent thinge hee asketh christe doth doth lay hand vpon modesty laudable obedience worthe sighte god manner worship honour yea true onely rule humilitie submit selues obey god haue sens bound end may allowe without controuersie whatsoeuer saith doth please therefore must chiefly keepe law rule worshipping ready without delay subscribe giue consent soone commā deth thing 7 vvhat vve taught wordes must simplye obey christ although see reason haue v doe well ordered house coūsel power good man house alone seruauntes must foote hande doe willeth thē therfore proud yt refuseth god commaundeth hym though know reasō thereof moreouer admonitiō reacheth farther wit trouble v ignoraunt thinges god haue bee hidden v time kind ignoraunce better learned manner knowledge suffer god wiser selues 8 peter saith vnto thou shalt neuer wash feete iesus answered sayinge shal wash thee thou shalt haue part 9 simon peter saieth vnto lorde feete onely hand head 10 iesus saith vnto washed hath neede washed saue feete al cleane ye cleane al 11 knew betrayer therefore said ye al cleane 8 thou shalt wash modesty peter hitherto excusable although cleane without fault notwithstanding offendeth grieuously yeeldeth reproued common vice stubbernnes commeth vnto errour fayre coulour refusall proceede reuerence doth simply obey saying desire maintain christe honour doth loose grace therfore true wisdome fayth allow reuerently imbrace doone rightly orderlye whatsoeuer doth proceede lord cānot otherwise hallow name vnlesse perswaded good reason whatsoeuer doth flesh euer repine froward yeelde vnto 〈◊〉 honour vnlesse constrained briefe vntill time manne dispoyle himselfe liberty iudge workes god although endeuoure honor god himselfe yet pride shall alwayes lye hid vnder colour humilitie shall wash thee answere christe maketh doth yet expresse end determined wash disciple feete teacheth similitude fet soule body doth new thing agree person washing disciple feete meane whil sheweth foolishly pet wise thing doth befal v like sort oftē lord shal begin striue v long holdeth peace men think disagree rashly hee nothing readily one word refute excuse soeuer pretend christe hys lord maister peter thinketh absurd thing shuld wash foot whē refuseth duty hee refuseth chiefest thing saluation sentence dooth also comprehende generall doctrine wee filthy polluted god vntill christ doe wype away filthinesse seeing challengeth himselfe alone office washing let euery manne offer vncleannesse vnto washed may haue place amongst chyldren god wee goe must marke woord wash dooth signifie place referre vnto free forgiuenes sinnes othersome referre vnto newnes lyfe third sorte extend vnto last doe willingly admitte christ doth wash v wypeth away sinnes satisfaction sacrifice may come god iudgemente hee washeth v agayne abolysheth wicked corrupt lustes fleshe spirite beecause shall appeare shortelye texte hee speaketh grace regeneration flatly think holde speaketh place washing pardon 9 lord onely feete vvhen peter heard lost vnlesse suffer himselfe washed christ offered thing necessity length fitte mistresse tame therefore ceasing longer contend yeeldeth bee washed ouer confesseth indeede great soeuer hee yet wholly polluted naturally filthines therefore good nothing washed one part onely heere hee erreth lykewise rashnes maketh accounte benefitte hee hadde alreadye receiued hee speaketh hee hadde beene indued remission sin yet sanctification spirit therefore reprehended place christe good cause hee putteth minde giuen although teacheth bee vnder personne one manne mindefull grace haue receyued consider themselues haue neede yet hereafter first saieth faythfull cleane cleane euery parte blot longer cleansed principall part witte whilest kingdome sinne taken away righteousnesse god hath vpper hande like manne shoulde saye al bodye whole infected vniuersall disease therfore meete testifie newnesse life christ disciple seeing affirmeth authour puritie similytude also applyed vnto present matter least peter shulde reiect washinge feete absurd christ washeth euen head feete chuseth bee disciple lower part men must daily purged hath purged child god wholly regenerated first day liue heauenlye life altogether doe rather remaine certeine reliques fleshe stryue whole lyfe therefore affection care worldly called feete metaphorycallye spirite possesse partes v wee shoulde haue nothing doe longer filthinesse worlde nowe part soeuer carnall farre vncleane creeping vpon grounde least treading myre christe doth alwayes find thing purge v furthermore intreateth place remission sinnes renuing wherby christ exempteth quite lustes flesh little little continuall succession 10 cleane minor proposition sillogisme whereuppon followeth washing feete doth become properly yet exception added euery man may examine himselfe peraduenture iudas might bee touched desire repent although intent betimes arme disciple least crueltie haynous fact bee reuealed continent trouble conceiued heart endowed heauenly grace notwithstanding doth conceale name set purpose least shut gate repentance forasmuch desperate admonition serued none ende augment fault disciple profited much diuinitie christ plainely appeare vnto thereby againe perceiue puritie singuler gift spirite 12 therefore washed feete taken cloathing sitting downe againe saith vnto know yee haue done 13 call mee master lord ye say well 14 therefore lord master haue washed feete must also wash one anothers foot 15 haue giuen example haue done vnto may doe also▪ 16 verily verily say vnto seruant greater master neyther apostle greater sendeth 17 yee know thinges happie yee ye doe 12 therefore doth length declare end christ wash disciple feete put concerning spiritual washing digression purpose vnlesse peter made stay christ spoken nothing concerning matter therefore doth render reason wit ye lord master giuen example godly must follow least man grudge abase hymselfe doe maner dutie base vile soeuer bee brother equal hence commeth contempt charitie whilest euery man maketh account meet despiceth al men almost neither intent teach modestie also prescribe rule loue one doe serue another loue mutual bondage helping neighbour know yee haue done vvee see christ kept thing disciple smal time hee proued obedience reuealed due time whereof meete shoulde ignorant neither doth stay nowe vntill time aske preuenteth owne accord thing shall befall v likewise suffer selues bee led vnknowen wayes hand 14 lorde master argument drawen greater lesser pride suffer v retaine equalitie amongest selues ought christ excelleth doth abase himselfe may make prowde men ashamed forgetting order degree doe exempt selues brotherly fellowship doeth mortall man thinke himselfe refuse beare burden brother apply himselfe condition men finally doe dueties wherein vnitie church contained summe man doth take much vpon doth thinke conuersaunt amongest weake brother vpon condition hee may submit himselfe meekely gently vnto office whiche seeme vncomely filthie vve must also note christ telleth giuen example neither must make fact example generall may follow papist boast doe keepe fast lent imitating therein example christ must first mark whether end disciple frame themselues doe like vve reade thing wherfore lesse peruers emulation assay flie heauen moreouer whereas ought haue followed christ became ape rather follower ordeine euery yere publike washing feete vpon stage thinke haue fulfilled bare vaine ceremonie excellently haue done suffer themselues freely contemne brother onely haue washed twelue men feete pull peeces christes member cruelly consequently euen spit christ face vvherefore comicall pompe nothing el meere filthie mocking christ neither doth christ place commende vnto v yeerely ryte hee commaundeth v bee readie duringe whole life washe feete brother 16 verily verily say vnto prouerbiall sentence vse whereof reacheth farther notwithstanding bee applyed vnto present circumstaunce vvherefore deceiued iudgement take generally christe place exhort disciple beare crosse true vsed purpose hee addeth afterwarde blessed know doe doth deserue bee called true knowledge doth bring faithfull far may become like head rather vaine imagination whilest beholde christe thinges christes without v gather hence vntill suche time man shall learne submit himselfe vnto brother knoweth whether christ master forasmuch man doth submit himselfe vnto brother respect many men doe also exercise themselues sleightly coldly duty loue appeareth heereby farre yet frō full light faith 18 speake knowe whome haue chosen scripture may bee fulfilled hee eateth bread mee hath lifted vppe heele agaynste mee▪ 19 tell doone done may beleeue 20 verily verily say vnto receiueth shal send receiueth • receiueth receiueth sent mee 18 speake hee giueth vnderstand againe one amongest disciple nothing lesse deede disciple doth partly iudas sake ende may make inexcusable partly rest companie least iudas fall doe subuert neither doeth encourage stand neuerthelesse calling though iudas doe fall felicitie whereof make mention common men hee teacheth much earnestly desired must much constantly abide therin nowe hee attributeth thing election shall stand man power fraile yeeld euery blast fall euery vehement motion vnlesse lorde vphold hand gouerneth hath chosen engine soeuer satan doth erect yet shall preuaile shall perseuere firme constant euen vntil end neither doth affirm must confesse yt receiue perseuerance frō electiō also beginning godlines cōmeth passe one man doth addict himselfe vnto worde god another euen elected againe commeth passe man goeth forwarde right course godly life saue god purpose stable finishe worke hath begunne • ande finally fountaine difference betweene child god vnbeleeuers former sort drawen vnto saluation spirit adoption carried headlong destruction vnbrideled flesh otherwise christ might haue saide knowe euerie one end may arrogate nothing themselues may rather acknowledge differ iudas grace owne power setteth free election may grounded vvherefore let v learne partes saluation doe depend thereupon whereas hee reckoneth iudas another place amongest elect another manner speech contrary speaketh place temporall election whereby god appointeth v vnto certaine kind work saul elected bee king yet reprobate christ intreateth eternall election wherby made child god wherby god hath predestinated v vnto life worlde made god doth sometimes adorne reprobate ye gift spirit may execute function whereunto called princely vertues appear time saul iudas excel notable gift meet apostle christ y• sanctificatiō spirit ye lord doth vouchsafe bestow vpon none saue child farre vnlike renueth minde heart ende may bee holy without blame sight secondly hath liuely roote neuer plucked vp god doth repent selfe adoption meane season remaineth sure certaine gift god election whenas haue embraced christ doctrine faith doe also followe life onely cause blessednes whereby distinguished reprobate destitute grace spirite wickedly perish haue christ keeper gouerneth v hand defendeth v power furthermore christ giueth place euident testimonie diuinitie first al saith iudgeth manner men secondly maketh himselfe authour election knowledge whereof speaketh proper god thing effectuall testifieth hee choose chosen creation worlde excellent token diuine power ought moue spirite prophesie psal 41 10 othersome think vnperfect sentence wherein principall verbe must vnderstood reade one texte scripture may fulfilled hee eateth bread mee hee lifteth vp heele mee shalbe nothing wanting furthermore lift vp heele doth signifie metaphorically set vpon man craftily vnder pretence friendship may oppressed vnawares must suffer thing patiētly also christ member christ head patterne hath suffered truly hath ordinarie thing almost age church hath greater deadly enemy housholde churche vvherefore least suche crueltie doe trouble faithfull let accustome themselues betimes
