treason iudas wrought beginne bring disciple vnto faith faith encreased whenas came vnto experience thing heard mouth christ may double sense meaning word may say beleeue thing come passe knew al thinges hee wanted nothing thing scripture doth testifie concerning christ doe agree reasonable wel wordes reader may choose whether 20 verily verily say vnto either new speech set downe place whiche vnperfect el christe preuenteth offence arise reason wicked fact iudas euangelistes doe alwayes knit togeather whole sermon christ doe sometimes gather together diuers sentence briefly although likely christ meant cure preuent offence appeareth plainly apt wee receiue woundes euill example wherby commeth passe falling away one man doth wound two hundreth extinguish faith constancie tenne twentie godly men scarse edifie one therefore seeing christ set monster eye necessary reach hand vnto disciple least beeing stroken noueltie goe backwarde neither hee respect vnto thē prouided come also otherwise remembraunce iudas might hurt v much day whenas diuell cannot estrange v frō christ causing v hate doctrine maketh v either weary el causeth v contemne minister admonition christ doth shew vniust thing vngodlinesse certaine behaue themselues wickedly vngodlily theyr office whit empayre apostolicall dignitie reason must haue respect vnto god author ministerie shall finde nothing worthie contempt secondly christ himselfe appointed father onely teacher speaketh apostle therfore whosoeuer doth vouchsafe receiue minister gospell reiecteth christ god christ foolish papist absurd whilest wrest title commendation establish tyrannie first al adorne themselues men begged feather wheras nothing like christ apostle secondly although graunt apostle christ meant nothing lesse place thē giue right vnto men thing receiue christ sendeth giue place may fulfill function enioyned 21 vvhen iesus said thus troubled spirit said verily verily say vnto one shall betray mee 22 disciple looked one vppon another doubting whome hee dyd speake 23 furthermore one iesus disciple whome iesus loued leaned vppon breast 24 therefore simon peter beckoned vnto hee aske hee spake 25 therefore leaned vpon iesus breast saith vnto lorde 26 iesus answered shall giue soppe haue dipped hee dipped soppe hee giueth iudas sonne simon iscariot 27 soppe satan entred therefore iesus saith vnto thou doest doe quickly 28 none sate meate knew said vnto 29 thought iudas bagge iesus said vnto buy thinges whereof haue neede holy day giue somewhat poore 21 iesus said thus holy apostolicall office excellent filthie detestable treason iudas therefore horrible monster make christ himselfe afraide sawe holy order wherein maiestie god ought haue shined polluted incredible wickednesse one man ende tendeth whiche euangelist addeth afterwarde hee testified wit monstrous thing could haue beleeued beeing simply vttered saith christ troubled spirite end may know hee shewed token troubled man countenance wordes altogether affected minde spirite taken minde soule neither men opinion expound christ moued violent motion spirite brake foorth wordes confesse deede spirite gouerne christes affection euangelist meaning otherwise passion within feigned requisite wee know zeale set v end may follow wee may horriblie afraide monster doe ouerthrowe holy order god church 22 therefore looked one vpon another know nothing themselues made doubt saying christe iudas amazed wickednesse touched disciple made great account christe certainely persuaded spake nothing vnaduisedly satā quite pluckt hearte iudas reuerence hee harder stonie rock beate backe admonition although christe seemeth deale somwhat vncourteously vexeth innocent season yet doubtfulnesse profitable christ iniurie expedient euen child god vexed heare iudgement wicked ende may examine themselues beware hypocrisie occasion giuen thereby examine themselues life place teacheth wicked must touched sometimes wee doe poynt finger vntill time god doth bring light hand sometimes secrete disease church may hide meane season wickednesse men rype may discouered therfore must keepe meane 23 vvhom iesus loued particular loue wherewith christe loued iohn doth manifestly testifie alwayes repunaunt vnto loue loue othersome consisteth whole loue haue respect vnto god euery man excelleth giftes god wee loue muche christ dyd neuer misse marke least iote fareth farre otherwise v vanitie nature bee draw nigher vnto god louing men loue men shall neuer wel framed amongest themselues vnlesse referred vnto god vvhereas iohn saith hee leaned vppon iesus breast might seeme vndecent thing day suche maner sitting meate time sate table doe hauing put shoe leaning vpon coushins sate halfe vpright bed 26 shall giue sop man demaund end serued reaching sop poynt traytor seeing christ might haue named openly hee woulde haue knowen aunswere token iudas made knowen one bewrayed myghte see knowe hym also verye profitable iohn shoulde knowe ende hee mighte afterwarde reueale vnto others time christe deferre make iudas knowen end may easily suffer hypocrite vntill brought light vve see iudas yet condemned mouth iudge sate amongest others condition neuer whit better haue place amongst child god 27 satan entred seeing certaine iudas conceiued great wickednesse persuasion satan said satā entred first al alredy reigne heart oftentimes said beleeue confirmed faith long agoe addition faith called faith iudas wholy addicted vnto satan furious force caried vnto exreamest thing satan said haue entred saint goe forwarde degree inasmuch oftentimes encreased new gift saide filled holy ghost asmuche wicked doe prouoke god wrath vnthankfulnesse lorde doth giue ouer satan bondslaues dispoyled spirite light reason consequently humane sense fealing horrible vengeance god men giuen vp reprobate sense differ almost nothing bruite beastes yea runne headlong wickednesse beastes abhorre therefore must walke carefully feare lord least ouercome goodnesse wickednesse deliuer v vp length lust satan sop christ reached made place satan rather iudas receiued sop gaue himselfe wholy satan occasion cause furthermore great mercifulnesse christ ought haue softned euen breast iron desperate vncurable obstinacie deserueth god shoulde iust iudgement make heart harde satan whylest wee heape coales fire vppon enemy heades well vnto altogether vncurable sinke deeper destruction neither ought well bee blamed seeing heartes ought haue enflamed thereby loue v augustine thought vntruly soppe sacrament bodye christe forasmuch reached without action supper men dote foolishly thinke diuell entred iudas essentially say euangelist speaketh force efficacie example taught fearefull punishment prepared al profane god benefit abuse thou doest doe quickly christ doth exhort iudas may thought enforce rather voyce one detesteth thing endeuoured hytherto call backe diuers wayes vaine speaketh vnto man past al hope perish seeing thou art determined perish therein doth hee play part iudge adiudgeth vnto death desireth haue cast away haue cast away themselues owne fault briefe christ causeth iudas perishe whether hee affirmeth one 28 none sate meate either iohn tolde none yet heard christ el striken yt wel wit yea thought iohn great quandary happened doth oftentimes happen church fewe faithfull descerne hypocrite lord doth manifestly condemne 29 hee giue somewhat poore appeareth sufficiently place poore christe yet hee gaue somewhat little vnto poore end might prescribe vnto v rule apostle woulde otherwise haue gessed spake poore vnlesse hee beene accustomed helpe poore 30 therefore hee hadde taken soppe hee went night 31 vvhen gone iesus saith sonne man glorified god glorified 32 god glorified god shall also glorifie shal straightway glorifie 33 little child yet little yee shall seeke haue said vnto iewes whither goe cannot come doe also say vnto 34 new commandement giue vnto yee loue one another haue loued doe also loue one another 35 shall men knowe disciple shall loue one another 31 sonne man glorified last houre hand christ knewe well weake courage disciple hee meant therefore vnderproppe least shoulde altogeather discouraged onely remembraunce crosse christ causeth v tremble day vnlesse comfort doth meete v conquerour satan sinne death triumph vpon crosse therefore might haue befallen disciple immediately see lord carryed crosse loaden manner reproches might sorrowfull vncomely spectacle haue ouerwhelmed hundred time vvherefore christ preuenteth danger calleth backe beholding death outwardly vnto spirituall fruit therefore howsoeuer ignominie appeare crosse might selfe confounde faithfull yet christ doth testifie crosse vnto glorious member ensueth next god glorified added steede confirmation strange thing amongest common sorte sonne man glorified death amongest men reprochfull god accursed therefore sheweth wil purchase himselfe glory death namely hee gloryfieth god father vncomparable goodnesse god appeared vnto whole worlde vpon crosse christe vppon gorgeous theatre glory god shineth euery creature neuer excellent euident vpon crosse whereupon made wonderfull chaunge thing damnation men shewed sinne abolished saluation giuen vnto men finally whole worlde repayred thinges brought order although worde oftentimes taken hebrewe beth signifieth muche yet rather translate simplie god glorified sonne man speech seemed emphaticall fuller force vvhen saith god glorified coniunction copulatiue muste bee resolued causall iudgement 32 god bee glorified christ gathereth shal triumph gloriously death wherin purpose glorifie father father seeke owne glory death sonne made partaker glory therefore promiseth shall shortly come passe ignominy shall bee done away suffer short time shall great honour appeare death thing also fulfilled death vppon crosse farre darkening dignitie christ doth appeare asmuch incredible loue towarde mankinde infinite righteousnesse making satisfaction sinne pacifying god wrath wonderfull power ouercomming death subduing satan finally setting open heauens shewe foorth perfect brightnesse nowe doctrine also extended vnto v although whole world conspire together defame v yet wee shall endeuour seek god glory sincerely hart need doubt glorifie v againe christe augmenteth comfort shortnesse time promiseth shall bee straightway furthermore although glory began day resurrection yet toucheth heere chiefly spreading abroade thereof followed immediately raising vp dead power gospell spirit created vnto himselfe new people proper renowne christe death fruite whiche flowed thence saluation men 33 little child yet little could departure master make disciple sorrowfull therefore telleth time bee long doth also exhort vnto pacience lastly ende hee may take vnseasonable feruentnesse desire telleth cannot follow immediately vvhen hee calleth little child teacheth faire speech therfore depart careth health saluation seeing loueth tenderly hee put vpon himselfe fleshe ende may brother greater vehemencie loue expressed name saith hee repeateth vnto hee saide vnto iewes 7 34 true touching wordes difference sense saith cannot folow end may suffer temporall absence paciently doth bridle end may keepe themselues standing vntill haue fulfilled warfare vpon earth therfore doth exclude kingdome god euer doth iewes doeth onely commaund wayt paciently vntill gather kingdom heauen 34 new commaundement giue hee addeth exhortation vnto consolation loue oue another hee say whilest absent body declare louing one another taught mee vaine let principall desire let chief meditation men agree hee calleth new commaundement men thinke reason seeing litterall externall whatsoeuer appointed law time past concerning loue christe write heartes faithfull spirit think newe lawe whiche hee publisheth newe manner may haue full force iudgement farre set farre christ meaning doe thinke therefore called newe commaundement although law doth call v backe vnto loue yet intangled many ceremony appurtenance doctrine loue doth plainely appeare contrary loue perfectly set downe gospel without shadowes therefore doe altogether reiect interpretation thinke christ spake simplie wee knowe lawes diligently kept first little little slip man memory vntil length growē vse therefore ende christe may deepely imprint doctrine loue mindes hee commendeth newnesse hee say wyll haue remember commaundement continually lawe newly giuen bee briefe see christes drift place exhort vnto loue ende myght neuer suffer selues bee ledde away frō studie therof doctrine slip theyr mind furthermore learne dayly experience necessary admonition hard matter retaine loue men doe inuent vnto themselues newe wayes worship god setting apart satan putteth many thinges heades wherein may occupie themselues commeth passe thinges vaine endeuour mocke god deceiue themselues therefore title newnes may stirre v vp oftentimes embrace loue meane season let v knowe called new began please god nowe first seeing called elswhere fulfilling law loue one another loue also extended euen vnto stranger al one flesh al created image god image god shineth clearely regenerate meete bande loue bee stronger amongest christ disciple loue seeketh cause god shee hath roote thence thither referred knoweth euery man bee childe god willingly earnestly doth imbrace againe cannot mutuall affection loue saue gouerned spirit therfore christ toucheth y• first degree loue place againe must mark goodnes god doth extend spread abroad selfe vnto throughout whole worlde euē must loue euē bee enemy hee setteth v example afterward 15 12 ouertake far v least wee goe forward toward marke 35 shall men know christ confirmeth againe hee said haue beene taught schoole vain shall loue one another say selues shall knowe disciple profession amongest men shall also proued true seeing christe distinguisheth straungers marke weary themselues vaine hauing left forsaken loue doe take vpon newe feigned kindes worshipping vanitie raigneth day poperie neither superfluous christ standeth much vpon point better agreement betweene loue selues neighbour betweene fire water loue selues keepeth sens fast tyed loue quite banished neuerthelesse wee thinke wee doe duetie poynt well throughly satan hath many sleight enticement deceiue v therfore whosoeuer christ deede desireth knowen god let frame direct life loue brother let continually styrre vp vnto 36 simon peter saith vnto lorde whither goest thou iesus answered whither goe thou canst follow nowe thou shalt follow afterward 37 peter saith vnto lorde follow thee lay downe life thee 38 iesus answered wilt thou lay downe thy life mee verily say vnto thee cocke shall crow vntill thou haue denied thrise 36 lord whither goest thou question dependeth vppon saying christe haue said vnto iewes c appeareth ignoraunt peter hauing oftentimes told christ departure troubled like sort heard strange thing although like point wee heare daylie christes mouth thinges soeuer fit necessary bee knowen vnto vse life come matter wee striken like nouices vnto nothing euer said peter declareth desirous christes carnall presence counteth absurd thing stay behinde christe went vnto place vvhither goe christe brideleth wordes immoderate desire peter hee speaketh precisely sharpely becommeth master yet doth tamper anon sharpnesse saying hee teacheth shall time shall bee separated place taught make desire subiect vnto god passe boundes doe time leape ouer let v least suffer brought backe bridle least discouraged let consolation whiche added immediately helpe v christe promiseth shall come passe wee shall bee gathered vnto hym meanynge peter yet rype enoughe beare crosse yet like corne blade yet must formed strengthened tract time may follow vvherefore must pray god hee encrease v dayly hath begunne v meane must creepe vntill shal better able runne christe beareth v whilest yet soft tender let v learne cast away weake brother yet farre marke desired men may run great feruentnesse men must encouraged likewise goe slowly hold way must hope well 37 vvhy cannot follow thee peter declareth word tooke christ answere heauenly hee perceiueth admonished owne infirmitie whereby gathereth owne vice hindered hee cannot follow christ forthwith yet hee persuaded men puffed vp nature confidence trust repose owne vertue power therefore wordes peter declare opinion haue naturally selues wit attribute wee ought vnto owne strength hereby commeth passe dare take hande thing without crauing god ayd notwithstanding able doe nothing themselues 38 vvilt thou lay downe thy life sake christ would contende peter woulde haue waxe wise owne experience like fooles neuer wise vntill haue caught harme peter promiseth inuincible constancie matth 26 33 34 35 speaketh according sincere meaning minde confidence full rashnesse considereth graunted vnto example appertaineth vnto v let euery man learn examine want imperfection least puffed vp vaine confidence vve cannot much perswaded grace god carelesse presumption flesh reprehended place seeing faith doth rather beget feare carefulnes cocke shall crow boldnesse rashnesse doe proceede frō knowing selues peter reproued stout souldier without battaile daunger hauing tryed strength yet thinketh able somthing punished arrogancie deserued let v mistrusting owne strength learne flie vnto lorde betimes hee may vnderproppe v power chap 14 1 let hearte bee troubled beleeue ggd beleeue also mee 2 father house many mansion tolde goe prepare place 3 shall goe prepare place returne againe take vnto may also 4 whither goe know way know 5 thomas saith vnto lorde know whither thou goest howe wee know way 6 iesus saith vnto way truth life man commeth vnto father 7 knowen mee knowen father also time know haue seene 1 let heart bee troubled without good cause christe confirmeth disciple many wordes hard fearefull combate prepared doubtlesse small tryall shoulde shortly see hanging vpō crosse sight nothing el matter extreeme dispaire therfore seeing yt time houre great perturbatiō hand sheweth remedie least ouercom fal flat neither doth encourage exhorting teacheth also whence must fet strength wit faith whō acknowledge sonne god hath strength enough himselfe defend saluation vve must alwayes marke circumstance time christ would haue disciple stand stoutly valiantly thing might seeme go hande ouer head therefore wee must also apply vnto selues buckler beare bruntes cannot shall feele diuers motion must striken fall therefore faithfull said troubled leane vnto word god although brought great straites yet stand strong vpright yee beleeue god may also read imparatiue mode beleeue god beleeue mee yet former reading agreeth better vsuall heere shewed way stand wee haue alreadie said namely faith doe leane vnto christe beholde euen present helpe v outstretched hand maruell faith father placed former place shoulde rather haue saide vnto disciple beleeue god yt beleeued christ christ expres image father must first cast eye vpon cause came vnto v faith myght begin goe vp vnto father christe respect vnto another thing men confesse must beleeue god sure axioma whereunto men subscribe without adoe yet scarse one amongest hundreth beleeueth indeede bare maiestie god farre distant v also satan casteth manner cloudes mystes eye keepe v beholding god vvhereby commeth passe faith seeketh god heauenly glory light man attaine vnto vanisheth away also flesh doth owne accord put head thousand immaginations may turne v away beholding god aright therefore christ setteth himselfe v marke whereunto faith bee directed shall finde place readinesse may rest hee true immanuel soone sought faith answereth v within one principall point faith must directed vnto christ alone least wander must staide least faint temptation true tryall faith doe neuer suffer selues pulled away christ promise made vvhen popish diuines dispute cōcerning obiect faith rather bable doe make mention god haue respect vnto christe gather wisdome inuentions must needes quaile euery small blast prowd men ashamed christ humilitie therefore flie vnto vncomprehensible power god shall neuer faith come heauen saue submitteth selfe vnto christe appeareth looke vnto humble god neither shall faith euer bee strong vnlesse seeke stay christe weakenesse 2 father house christ absence cause disciple sorrowe hee testifieth goeth away cause may remaine separated haue place also kingdome heauen requisite suspition shoulde betaken away christ ascende vnto father hee myght leaue behinde vpon earth care place falsly wrested vnto another sense christ teach distinct degree honour kingdome heauen saith many mansion diuers vnlike suche sufficient many say roome himselfe also disciple told interpreter doe vary heere doe reade one text thus mansion prepared alreadie would haue tolde goe prepare rather minde distinguish thus heauenly glory prepared alone woulde deceiue therefore woulde haue tolde place prepared none mee father otherwise go prepare place iudgement text requireth wee reade thus followeth immediately shall goe away prepare place wordes christe giueth v vnderstande ende departure prepare place summe son •• god ascende heauen himselfe alone hee may dwell apart rather may bee common inheritaunce godly meanes head may ioyned member yet ariseth question estate father death christ ascended heauen gather commonly faithfull soules included limbe christ saith shall place time 5 thomas saith vnto although thomas answere seemeth disagree christ saying first blush yet hee determined whit discredite master yet question howe hee denieth yt christ affirmed answere somtimes saint confused knowledge knowe manner reason thing certaine laid open calling gentile foretolde prophetes according true sense faith yet paul doth testifie ephe 3 5 vnto hidden mysterie therefore forasmuch apostle beleeued christe flit vnto father yet knowe obtaine kingdome thomas obiecteth good cause knewe whither went hee gathereth thence way obscure wee enter course must knowe whither goe 6 way althogh christ answereth directly vnto question whiche asked yet omitteth nothing profitable knowen requisite thomas curiositie bee brideled therfore christ disputeth estate shalbe father stādeth vpō necessarie point thomas would willingly haue heard christ would heauē likeas sometimes wearied curious speculatiōs meet v occupied som matter witte may partaker blessed resurrection furthermore summe sētence whosoeuer enioyeth christe hee wanteth nothing cause striueth goe beyond farthest perfection whosoeuer content alone setteth downe three degree hee say beginning middle ende vvhereupon followeth must beginne must goe forward must end vve neede desire higher wisdome leade v vnto eternall life testifieth wisdome found way obtaine lyfe become new creature affirmeth also thing must sought el saue telleth v furthermore way wherby alone may come thither therefore least fayle v poynt giueth v hande go astray humbleth himselfe farre directeth euen sucking child hauing professed himselfe guide hee leaueth middest race maketh partaker trueth maketh reape fruite thereof length whiche better excellent thing inuēted seing christ way cause ignoraunt weake complaine hath forsaken seeing hee trueth life hath also himselfe wherwith able satisfie perfect finally christ speaketh blessednes sayd late touching obiecte faith men doe rightly iudge confesse blessednes consisteth god alone deceiued afterward whilest seeke god else christ pull away sort true perfect diuinitie mē take trueth place sauing light heauēly wisdom othersom take substance life al spiritual good thing may set shadowes figure firste chapter grace truth made iesus christ think yt trueth ought taken perfection faith way ought taken beeginning first rudimentes summe anye man turne aside christ nothing erre man stay wholy vppon shalbe fedde nothing else winde vanity else man go beyond shall finde death steede lyfe man commeth vnto father exposition sentence nexte going hee way cause leadeth v vnto father trueth life therfore apprehende lay hold father may truely said concerning inuocation praiers heard saue onelye christes ayde assistance christ intreate place prayer vnderstand simply men feigne vnto themselues meere labirinths often hauing left christ striue come vnto god christ proueth life wee possesse god alone whō foūtaine life vvherfore al diuinitie without christ confused vaine also foolish false corrupt although proceede somtimes excellent speaches pholosophers yet haue nothing fraile also entangled peruerse errours 7 knowne mee confirmeth haue already sayde curiositie foolish daungerous menne content doe desire come vnto god bie wayes confesse nothing better knowledge god nigh vnto insinuateth himselfe familyarlye wander owne speculation seeke aboue cloudes cannot afoarde beholde present therefore christ reprehendeth disciple beecause doe acknowledge fulnes godhead reuealed vnto see saith haue known hetherto rightly lawfully beecause know yet liuely image father expressed time hee addeth onely hee may myttigate bytternesse reprehension also hee maye accuse vnthankefulnesse sluggishnesse vnlesse consider weigh giuen spoken rather commendation doctrine hee questionlesse old writer doe amisse fet testimony hence defend christ diuinitie christ doth simply dispute whoe hee selfe maner one ought acknowledge rather title power essence therefore father said sonne full diuinitie dwelleth sheweth forth power againe christ sayde bee father beecause hee sheweth diuine power hee one wordes speak hee proueth effect must seeke god else saue onely affirmeth doctrine manifest euident testimony god presence asmuch heauenly diuine indeede manne obiecte contrary prophetes accounted sonnes god spake diuinely inspiration spirit god authour doctrine wee may dooth workes must bee restrayned vnto myracles hee proceedeth rather former sentēce maiestie god doth shew selfe doctrine shuld say work god deede whereby may know assuredly god abide therefore work vnderstande token god power 11 beeleeue mee hee requireth firste disciple handes beleeue testimonie whilest affirmeth hee sonne god beecause hitherto slowe hee touchcheth sluggishnes way saieth hee sufficiēt euen reproue wicked vnbeleeuers beateth againe father father superfluous haue good tryall howe nature dooth pricke v forward vnto vaine curiositie gone without christ shall onely haue vnlesse member beene added especially seeing memory fraile calling minde god benefites thing haue neede straunge example god hath bestowed vpon v al maner good thinges thinke liueth longer rest one fortnight cause christ maketh mention onely present power apostle saw eye hee promiseth shal continuallye feele afterward truly diuinitie declared long conuersant vpon earth departed vnto father faithfull trye sufficiente testimony token thereof either blockishnesse el malytiousnes dooth hinder v doe neither consider god work christ workes god notwithstanding troubleth many apostle saieth shal doe greater workes hath done omitte answeres vse made content alone must first marke christ meaneth witte power whereby proueth sonne god farre tied vnto presence body shall sette forth greater experiment absent followed wonderfull conuersion worlde immediately christe ascention wherein christ diuinitie shew selfe mightely hee conuersaunt amongst men see approbatiō christ diuinitie included persō spread abroad throughout whole body church dooing wherof maketh mention neither proper apostle onelye common euery one godly appertaineth vnto whol body church goe vnto father reason disciple opposition dooth amplifie excellencie grace god dooth vouchsafe bestowe vppon alone meaning small gyft whereof world depriued sense isaias saieth also 60 1 behold darkenes shall couer earth myste fountaine neuerthelesse woordes christe doe declare nothing canne perceiued concerninge holye spirite humane sense hee knowne experience fayth alone worlde saieth hee cannot receiue spirit beecause knoweth yee knowe beecause hee abydeth therefore spirite aloane whiche reuealeth himselfe vnto v dwellinge v beeing otherwise vnknowne vncomprehensible 18 leaue orphanes place teacheth menne able present spirite doe also beholde farre soeuer distant body▪ liue may double sense meaning word eyther sentence may confirmation next member may read selfe faithfull shall liue cause christ liueth willingly embrace former sense notwithstāding doctrine gathered life christ cause life dooth first al note cause difference shalbe seene world christ cānot seene saue according spiritual life wherof ye world depriued world seeth christ merueil death ye cause blindnesse soone man beginneth liue spirit also endowed eye see christ falleth therefore beecause life also ioyned christe life floweth thence fountaine dead selues life wherein flatter selues wicked death therefore wee occupied obtaining life must turne eies toward christ must translate life vnto selues faith conscience may fully assured free al daunger death long christe liueth sure certeine life life member dead 20 day many referre vnto daye pentecost continuall tenor one day noted rather time christ shewed forth power 23 iesus aunswared saide vnto anye manne loue mee hee keepe woorde father loue wee come vnto wil abide 24 loueth keepeth saying word haue heard mine sent 2 • hee hath preceptes hee repeateth former sentence agayne true tryall loue toward consisteth therin keepe commaundementes vvhereof putteth disciple often minde least misse marke bent fall awaye vnto carnall affection wee loue something else christ vnder name christ vvherunto appertaineth paul likewise 2 corin 5 16 although haue knowne christe according flesh yet doe know therfore let v new creature haue preceptes christ signifieth well instructed keepe frame man selfe life according rule loueth christe speaketh men preuent god theyr loue absurde thing enemy reconciled v vnto himselfe rom 5 10 woordes iohn 1 io 4 10 well knowne loued first loued v first disputeth place cause effect therfore falsely gathered loue wherewith embrace christ goeth loue god towards v order christes meaning shall bee blessed shall loue beecause shall loued father againe god beginneth loue thē first al haue testimony fatherly loue engrauen heartes end tendeth mē ber followeth immediately show selfe vnto knowledge goeth loue confesse christe meant thus much hee wyll graunt vnto pure woorshippers obseruers doctrine shall goe forward dayly fayth make drawe neerer familiarly vnto gather hence fruite godlynes going forwarde knowledge christe hath promised giue vnto hath reiecting hypocrite hee maketh goe forward faith whoe haue imbraced doctrine gospel hart frame themselues wholy obey heereby commeth passe seeing many goe backward scarse see euery tenth person go forward right course beecause greater part vnworthy haue christe reueale vnto note greater knowledge christ set v singuler reward loue toward christe wherupon followeth vncomparable treasure 22 iudas saieth vnto without cause hee asketh whye christ containeth light amongst fewe sonne righteousnes whole world ought lightened therefore seemeth vnmeete thing hee shew forth bright beames onely vnto spread abroade brightnesse euerye without difference christe aunswere dooth expounde whole question beecause mention made first cause christe dooth keepe himselfe close parte reuealeth himselfe vnto fewe say trueth hee founde menne like beeginning altogeather stranger wherefore hee canne chuse none loueth chuseth enemy may bende heartes loue hee chuseth enemy hee maye bende heartes loue yet would hee touch difference present beecause serued purpose meaning exhort disciple vnto earnest study godlines might goe forward better fayth therefore contented distinguishe marke worlde keepe doctrine gospel marke followeth beginning fayth effect calling christ admonished disciple else wher free calling hee putteth minde selfe thing afterwarde hee dooth onely bydde studie keepe doctrine lead godly life furthermore christ sheweth woordes doe rightly obey gospell witte dueties externall action doe arise loue handes feete whole bodie labour vaine vnlesse loue god doe reigne heart may gouerne externall member forasmuch certeine doe keepe christes commaundementes inasmuch wee loue followeth perfect loue canne found world man canne keepe commaundements perfectly yet god accepteth obedience desire sincere endeuour attaine vnto marke 23 father loue vve haue already declared loue god placed seconde order didde followe godlynesse cause loue faithfull may fully perswaded god accepteth obedience doe gospel maye euer nowe looke newe encreasings giftes vvee come vnto whiche loueth mee hee shall perceiue grace god abydeth hee shall bee encreased daylye giftes god therefore speaketh loue eternall loue wherewith hee embraced yet borne beefore creation worlde fealeth heartes maketh v partaker adoption moreouer hee meaneth firste illumination degree fayth whereby faythfull muste goe forwarde continuallye according matthew 13 12 hath shal giuen therefore papistes doe falsly gather place double loue wherewith loue god fayne wee loue god naturally hee dooth regenerate v spirit preparation wee deserue grace regeneration scripture dooth teach euerye experience selfe dooth crye wee altogether turned awaye god infected filled hatred vntill suche time hee chaung heart therfore must note purpose christ father come maye confirme faithfull perpetuall hope grace 24 hee loueth mee beecause faythfull mingled amongste vnfaythfull muste needes bee tossed diuerse stormes raginge seaes christe confirmeth againe admonition bee carried awaye euil example hee shoulde saye regarde worlde depende thereuppon beecause alwayes bee despyse mee doctrine holde faste grace euen vntyll ende haue embraced neuerthelesse hee giueth v also vnderstande worlde iustlye plagued vnthankfulnes perisheth blindnesse bewrayeth wicked hatred christe contempte true ryghteousnesse woorde yee heare leaste disciple shoulde fainte fayle stubbernnesse worlde hee purchaseth aucthoritie doctrine againe hee testifieth god feigned manne vppon earth consisteth strength fayth wee knowe god guide wee grounded else saue onely eternal trueth therfore howsoeuer worlde dooth goe madde frowardnesse yet let v followe christe doctrine mounteth aboue heauen earth vvhen hee saieth woorde hee applieth himselfe vnto disciple hee say manne beecause hee delyuereth faythfully enioyned father neuerthelesse wee knowe asmuche hee eternall wisdome god hee onelye fountaine doctrine prophetes spake hys spirite whiche beegynning 25 thing haue spoken vnto whilst 26 comforter holye spirite whome father shall sende name hee shall teache thinges shall tell thinges whiche haue tolde 27 peace leaue peace giue vnto worlde giueth giue vnto let heart troubled feare 28 haue heard haue said vnto go come vnto loue verely would reioyce haue said go vnto father father greater 25 thinges haue spoken hee addeth cause maye bee discouraged although haue profited faith oughte hee didde spreade abroade seede doctrine whiche laye hydde tyme disciple therefore exhorteth hope well vntill doctrine bring forth fruit maye seeme bee vnprofitable nowe summe hee testifieth hadde plentifull matter comforte doctrine hearde beit appeare vnto hee byddeth bee good courage vntyll spirite inwarde mayster doe speake selfe thing heartes admonition verye profitable v vnlesse wee doe vnderstande whatsoeuer christe teacheth commeth vppon v loathsomenesse irketh v bestowe labour vaine thinges obscure must bring ready docilytie easines taught wee muste giue eare retaine attentiuenes profitte wee oughte schole god aboue thinges wee haue neede patience vntyll spirite doe reueale whiche wee seemed haue hearde reade oftentymes vaine vvherefore lette desire learne quail • v neither fall dispaire doe vnderstande christe meaninge speaketh lette v know spoken v spirite shall tell length thinges haue spoken isaias 29 11 denounceth punishment vnto vnbeleeuers woord god vnto closed booke lorde dooth also oftentimes humble bee meanes therefore wee must waite paciently meekely time reuelation neither must refuse worde therefore seeing christ dooth testifie office proper holy ghost teach apostle alreadye learned mouth followeth outward preaching vaine nothing worth vnlesse teaching spirit added thereunto therefore god hath double manner teaching hee soundeth eares mouth manne speaketh vnto v within spirite dooth sometimes one moment sometimes diuerse time seemeth best marke thinges promyseth spirit shall teache hee shall tell hee shall bring memory thinges whatsoeuer haue tolde vvhereuppon followeth hee shall forge newe reuelations vvee may refute one woorde inuentions soeuer sathan hath broughte church beeginning vnder colour spirite mahomet pope haue common principle religion perfection doctrine contained scripture certeine higher thing reuealed spirit sinke haue anabaptistes libertine drawne theyr dotinges time seducing spirite spirite christe whiche bryngeth anye inuention whiche agreeth gospell christ promyseth spyr • te whiche shall confirme doctrine gospell subscriber haue declared beefore sende spirite father name 27 peace leaue word peace meaneth prosperous successe menne woont wish one another meete togeather one parteth another word peace importeth thus much hebrew tongue therefore alludeth vnto cōmon custome countrey shuld say leaue farewel addeth immediately peace far valewe vsually amongst menne haue peace mouth parte onely cold ceremony sake wish vnto manne good earnest yet canne giue deede christ telleth peace placed bare vaine wish ioyned effect summe hee departeth body peace continueth disciple shall alwayes blessed blessing let heart troubled correcteth feare againe disciple conceiued departure saieth hadde cause feare beecause doe onelye wante corporall presence doe enioye true presence spirite lette v also learne contente manner presence neyther let v pamper flesh doth alwayes tie god vnto externall inuentions thereof 28 yee loue vvithout doubt disciple loued christ yet otherwise ought carnal thing mixed could suffer bee taken away loued spiritually coulde nothing haue pleased better returne vnto father beecause father greater th • n place diuersly wrested arrians ende might proue christ secondary god obiect lesser father father held maintayned trueth end might cutte occasion cauill say ought bee referred vnto humane nature arrians wickedly abuse testimonie answere father neither right neither yet agreeable mention made place either humane nature christe ne yet hys eternall diuinitie according capacitie infirmitie maketh himselfe meane betweene v god truely wee able attaine vnto highnes god christe came downe vnto v end might lift v vp thither saith hee reioyce returne vnto father last mark whereat must ayme hee dooth declare woordes hee differeth father end came vnto v might vnite v vnto god vntill come thither wee stande midle race wee doe also imagine onelye halfe christe rent christ vnlesse bring v vnto god place paule like 1 cor 15 24 saide christ delyuer vppe kingdome god father god maye christ reigneth onely humane nature asmuch hee god reuealed flesh shall put kingdome wit diuinity appeareth face christ shal thē reuealed self difference paul describeth place chiefeste last perfection diuine brightnes beames whereof beganne shine christ ascention ende matter may appeare plainelye wee muste yet speake somewhat grosly christ doth compare father diuinitie owne place neither doth compare humane nature diuine essence father rather compareth present estate heauenly glory whereunto receiued immediately shuld say desire kept world better ascēd heauē therfore let v learne behold christ abased flesh may leade v vnto fountayne blessed immortalitie made guide may lift v vp vnto sphere sunne moone may make v one god 29 haue told beefore come passe come passe may beleeue 30 speak many thing vnto prince world commeth hath nothing 31 world may know loue father father hath commanded arise let v go hence 29 haue told requisite disciple oftentimes admonished matter beecause hydden mystery farre exceeding humane capacitie hee saieth foretelleth come passe may beleeue come passe profitable confirmation faith call minde christe prophesies saw fulfilled hee spake beefore yet seemeth kynd grauntinge christe say yet able receiue hidden mysterie pardon vntil thing come passe shal vnto stede interpreter expoūd doctrin therefore although seemed season singe vnto deaffe menne yet appeared afterward word spread abroade aire seede sown vppon ground christ speaketh place word euent thinges death resurrection ascention grow togeather one doctrine ingender faith v 30 speake many thinges meaning make disciple giue care vnto woorde deeplye imprinte mindes doctrine ynough thing causeth moste parte loathsomnesse feruentlye desired haue hande willingly receiued shall taken away therefore hee denounceth hee wyll shortly departe ende may desirous heare doctrine although christ doth cease teach v whole course life yet sentence may also applyed vnto vse asmuch lyfe short must vse opportunitie prince world commeth hath nothing mee hee might haue sayde simply slattly hee dye shortly houre death nowe hande hee vseth circumlocution ende hee may fortifie theyr mindes least terrified suche vnseemely horryble kinde death fainte beleeue christe crucified nothing else seeke lyfe hell saieth firste power graunted vnto sathan afterwarde hee addeth hee yeelde cause beecause hee enforced necessitie hee may obey father deuill called prince worlde beecause hee hath kingdome separated frō god manichee feigne hee exerciseth tyrannye worlde god permission therefore often heare epithite giuen vnto satan let v ashamed miserable estate howe proude soeuer menne bee bondslaues sathan vntyll regenerate spirite christe mannekinde comprehended place vnder worde worlde one delyuerer delyuereth v horrible slauery seeing punishment layde vppon sinne first manne likeas encreaseth dayly worse worse new sinnes let v learne hate selues sinnes vve holden captiue vnder sathan gouernment yet notwithstang seruitude dooth make v blamelesse seeing voluntary furthermore wee must note attributed vnto deuill place whiche done wicked men seeing carryed violente motion sathan worthily accounted worke whatsoeuer doe hath nothing came passe sinne adam sathan hath rule death hee could haue touched christ free al sinne vnlesse willingly submitted although suppose word reach farther wonte expounded interpreter say thus sathan findeth nothing christ matter death forasmuch hee cleane al spot sinne iudgement christ doth onlye speake cleannesse place also diuine power subiect death requisite disciple shoulde knowe yeelded infirmitie leaste shuld thinke honourably power ought former sentence also included general sentence bound sathan dying death vvhence gather tooke turne submitted himselfe vnto death 31 world may know doe read al one text world arise let v goe hence sentence may bee perfect othersome read woordes aparte thinke thing lacking heere skilleth much concerning sense whether chuse leaue middest vvee must chiefly note decree god placed chiefest place least shoulde thinke christ carryed away vnto death violence sathan thing befall besides counsell purpose god god hath ordayned sonne mediatour would haue sinnes world purged death ende might come passe hee suffered sathan triumph ouer season conquerour therefore christ resisteth satan may obey father decree consequently hee maye offer obedience price righteousness arise let v goe hence doe thinke christ went place hee saide thus spake thinges follow whilest walked forasmuch iohn addeth afterwarde christe went seemeth likely christ meant exhort disciple shewe lyke obedience vnto god whereof sawe excellent patterne brought forth moment chap 15 1 true vine father husband man 2 hee wil take away euery braunch beareth fruit mee whatsoeuer braunch bringeth fruite hee purge maye bringe foorth fruite 3 cleane word haue spoken vnto 4 abyde mee braunch cannot beare fruite selfe vnlesse abide vine neither vnlesse ye shal abide 5 vine braunches abideth • n beareth much fruit without yee nothing 6 manne shal abide mee shal cast dores branch shall bee withered shall gather shall cast fire shall burne 1 vine summe similitude wee barren dry nature saue asmuch engrafted christ draw new force following others haue translated amp • los vine clemata braunches vit • properlye plante selfe fielde sette vine call vineyarde although taken sometimes vineyard self cicero ioyneth litle fieldes litle vineyardes poore men togeather branch armes vine spreadeth vpon earth forasmuch clema dooth also signifie amongst gretians vine ampel • vineyard rather incline vnto opinion christ compareth himselfe vnto lande sette vine v vnto plantes themselues although wil contend manne matter meane admonishe reader followe shall seeme bee probable text lette v first remember rule must obserue parable wee must discusse property vine must onely see summarily ende christe applyeth similitude three principall partes thereof wee haue power doe good father dooth trimme v purging v hauing roote hee taketh away vnfruiteful branch may burne beeing caste fire menne almoste ashamed denie haue goodnesse whiche haue god doe afterwarde feigne vniuersall grace giuen naturallye engendred christ standeth chiefly vppon poynte vitall sappe floweth alone whereuppon followeth nature menne vnfruitfull voide al goodnesse none tasteth nature vine vntill ingrafted giuen onely electe speciall grace therefore father first authour good thinges planteth v hand beeginninge lyfe christ beeginne rooted vvhen hee calleth himselfe true vine muche hee shoulde haue said vine deede therefore men doe wearie themselues vaine seeking strength el shall come profitable fruite saue braunches spring 2 euery braunche men corrupt othersome doe maliciously suppresse othersome choake slouthfulnesse grace god stirreth vp maketh carefull wordes pronounceth vnfruitefull braunches shall remoued vine heere may question moued whether hee without fruite ingrafted christ aunswere men thinke many vine haue indeed roote vine lorde calleth people israel prophetes vineyarde beare name churche externall profession whosoeuer bringeth fruite wordes hee teacheth faithfull haue neede continually trimmed least grow kinde bring foorth good thing vnlesse lorde doth oftentimes set hand trimme neither shall bee sufficient made partaker adoption vnlesse god continue course grace v maketh mention pruning flesh aboundeth superfluous hurtfull vice full grow spring vp without end vnlesse wee bee purged hand god vvhen hee saith vine pruned may bring plentifull fruite hee teacheth howe godly ought goe forwarde course godlinesse 3 yee cleane hee telleth alreadie tryed said planted also purged sheweth meanes purging wit doctrine neither doubted hee speaketh externall preaching whē expresseth plaine wordes worde heard mouth man voyce hath great efficacie selfe vttered mouth asmuch christe worketh hearte spirite voice selfe instrument purging neuerthelesse christ doth meane apostle free vice setteth experiment whereby may learne necessary continuance grace furthermore commendeth doctrine gospell vnto fruit therof end may sharpened continually meditate thereupon seeing vine dresser knife▪ purge filthinesse 4 abide mee hee exhorteth againe desirous carefull retaine grace wherewith endowed carelesnesse flesh neuer sufficiently awaked christe drift keepe v vnder wing hen keepeth chickins least carried away lightnesse flie thence owne destruction therefore end hee may proue hee began worke saluation may leaue halfe vndone promiseth spirite shall alwayes effectuall v wee selues fault abide mee saith readie abide againe abideth bringeth foorth much fruite word declareth fruitful braunches haue liuely roote 5 vvithout mee yee doe nothing conclusion application whole parable long without canne bring foorth good fruite suche acceptable sight god vnfit well papist onely extenuate also quite weaken sentence yea doe altogether mocke although confesse worde able nothing without christ yet dreame haue power sufficient selfe yet worketh together holpen grace god cannot abide man bee debased shoulde conferre bring somewhat himselfe cannot easily mocke manifest wordes christe glose inuention papistes able doe nothing without christ yet holpen haue somewhat selues besides grace contrary christ affirmeth nothing selues braunch saith beareth fruite selfe therfore doth place commend help grace worketh togeather doth quite depriue v power vnlesse himselfe giueth v therefore particle without must resolued thus foloweth cauill pretende braunch hath somewhat nature another graft beareth fruite bee brought vineyard beare nothing may easily answered christ reasoneth thing braunch hath nature cleaue vine meaneth rather begin bee made braunches whilest grow encrease receiuing nourishment certainely scripture sheweth el vnprofitable drie wood vntil time 6 man shall abide mee setting punishement vnthankfulnesse againe hee sharpeneth stirreth vp againe vnto perseuerance thing deede gift god yet exhortation nexte going sheweth may bee fully assured god heareth prayer whenas shall desire bee made fruitefull serueth much set foorth glory notwithstanding doth also kindle desire well end effect nothing meaning expresse far greater thing commonly suppose thinke hee speaketh place secrete loue god father bare alwayes towarde sonne misse marke seeing christ intended rather lay bosome certaine pledge god loue towarde v therefore subtile saying doth nothing appertaine vnto place father hath alwayes loued himselfe sonne loue heere mentioned must bee referred vnto v christ doth testifie beloued father asmuch head church like necessary v hee seeketh know beloued without mediatour intangleth himselfe labyrinth wherein hee shall neyther finde way going therefore wee must behold christe wherein shall finde pledge god loue laide open loue god altogether powred might flowe member hee title giuen hee welbeloued sonne good father resteth wee must note ende god may accept v therefore may beholde fatherly loue god toward v glasse hee loued apart owne sake onely may ioyne v vnto father himselfe abide loue doe expound thus christe requireth mutuall loue • ciples othersome deale better take loue christ actiuely haue v enioy loue wherewith hee hath loued v euer therefore hee telleth v wee must take heed depriue selues thereof many men refuse grace offered many men throw away hand therefore wee receiued christes fauour must beware wee fall thence owne faulte vvhereas doe inferre vpon wordes force efficacie grace god vnlesse bee holpen constancie friuolous thing neither doe graunt spirit doth require hāds thing power doth shew done want strength wee may craue hand som likeas christ exhorteth v place vnto perseuerāce must trust owne cunning strength must beseech commaundeth confirme v hold vpon free loue christe good conscience newnesse life truly christ doth reconcile faithfull vnto f •• end may play wanton freely may keepe vnder father hand gouernment gouerning spirite vvhereupon followeth cast away loue christ proue true obedience disciple man obiect firmenesse saluation doth therefore depend vpon selues answere christes wordes falsly wrested part obedience faithfull vse toward much cause hee continueth loue toward effect loue commeth passe answere calling saue onely mooued spirite free adoption seemeth harde condition laid vpon v keepe christ commandements wherin
