worde keepe also 21 thing vnto name haue knowen sent 16 haue chosen mee doth yet plainly declare must thanke grace deseruing chosen extolled vnto great honor whenas hee denyeth chose wordes import much say whatsoeuer haue haue gotten owne art industrie feigne cōmonly mutual concourse god grace man opposition haue chosen chosen doth attribute wholy christe whiche wont diuide betweene man beene said man moued owne accord seeke christ vntill sought hee speaketh place common election godly whereby adopted ye child god particuler election wherby ordayned disciple preach gospell apostle chosen freely merite vnto function wee must needes thinke election farre free whereby made heires eternall life child wrath accursed seed moreouer christ doth commend place grace wherby chosen apostle ioineth y• former grace wherby ingrafted body church yea comprehendeth generally word dignitie soeuer bestowed vpon neuerthelesse graunt intreateth manifestly apostleship intent pricke forward disciple doe dutie stoutly taketh matter exhortation free fauour vouchsafed shewe vnto bound lord feruent ought doe duty requireth handes otherwise cannot auoide crime filthie vnthankfulnesse vvhereby appeareth nothing ought enflame v studie liue well godlily confesse haue receiued wee haue god handes haue nothing owne well beginning saluation par • e follow therupon doe flow free mercy furthermore appeareth plainly thereby true sentence christ chose apostle might seeme vnfit men although hee woulde haue perpetuall monument grace bee extant person paule saith 2 cor chap 2 16 shall found meet goe embassage wherein god doth reconcile mankinde vnto himselfe yea mortall man represent god person therefore christ alone maketh v meete election therefore paule fetteth apostleship grace rom 1 5 againe gal • thians 1 15 saith separated mother wombe yea forasmuch vnprofitable seruauntes euen seeme excellent shall bee sit least calling vntill elected neuerthelesse higher degree honour whereunto euery man extolled let remember hee bound vnto god haue apointed election hidden vntill reuealed indeed man called vnto office whereunto appointed paul place cited late hath said separated mother wombe addeth afterward hee created apostle god thought good lord himselfe doth testifie ieremie ier 1 5 knowen mother wombe notwithstanding hee calleth time vnto office prophet yet may man may come rightly framed vnto office teaching yea ordinarie thing church manne bee called saue furnished necessarie giftes christ maketh himselfe authour maruell forasmuch father worketh worketh father therfore aswel election ordaining common may goe nowe doth declare end made mention grace ende might make goe merily willingly theyr worke dignitie apostleship idle striue great straites therefore christ pricketh forwarde may flie labour griefes danger argument taken end secondly christ reasoneth effect saith yee may bring fruite cannot almost bee man shoulde apply worke earnestly • outly vnlesse hope labour bee fruitfull therefore christ saith endeuours shall bee vaine readie obey neither doth prescribe vnto apostle place calling requireth promiseth happie successe least faint waxe cold scarse expressed great force comfort hath many tentations whiche doe dayly inuade christes minister therefore often wee thinke labour lost let v remember christe shall length bring passe shall bee vaine wee goe promise taketh place appeareth fruite day craftie mate seeme worlde bee wise doe mocke floute endeuours vaine rashe endeuour vaine ioyne heauen earth togeather meane season reape fruite desire forasmuch christ hath promised side reward labor shall follow length lyeth hid time let v labour diligently middest mockage world dutie may question asked christ saith fruite shall bee perpetuall whenas saith fruite may remaine doctrine gospell getteth soules vnto christe vnto eternall saluation many thinke perpetuitie fruite doe extend sentence farther wit church shall stand euē vntill ende worlde labour apostle yeeldeth fruite euen day preaching one age shall spreade abroad church may come new encrease death vvhenas saith fruite hee speaketh gotten industrie whereas notwithstanding paule teacheth 1 cor 3 7 water plant nothing truly creation church excellent worke god glory therof ought ascribed vnto men lorde sheweth power hand men least labour vaine wont translate vnto proper himselfe neuerthelesse let v remember christ doth adorne disciple beningly may encourage puff vp whatsoeuer yee shall aske member • added abruptly many men may thinke seeing function teaching doth farre surpasse man strength moreouer many inuasions satan neuer endured saue power god therefore least apostle faint christe helpeth preuenteth excellent ayde hee say shall haue doe able fulfill function father faile haue made minister gospel vppon condition father may stretch foorth hande helpe often ye shal desire name help truly wheras teacher doe eyther faint slouthfulnes fall downe flat despayre commeth passe none meanes saue waxe slouthfull praying therefore promise christ stirreth v vp call vpon god whosoeuer shall acknowledge successe worde commeth god hee shall offer labour feare trembling contrarie man trust owne industrie neglect god helpe shal cast away speare buckler whenas come matter shall doe good hath taken great paine furthermore must take heed two vice arrogancie distrust men doe carelesly passe ouer god helpe thinke haue matter hand alreadie many men faint difficultie doe consider fight god power ayde vnder whose cōduct go warfare 17 thinges commaund also added good time ende apostle might know mutuall loue amongest minister chiefly required end may edifie churche god desire concord greater impediment whenas euery man laboureth apart doe one helpe another therfore vnlesse minister doe retaine brotherly fellowship amongest themselues may may erect huge heapes scattered abroad neuerthelesse shalbe building church 18 world hate christ hath armed apostle vnto sight doth also exhort vnto pacience gospell cannot preached world goe mad vvherfore cannot godly teacher shall escape enuie hatred worlde christe foretelleth time least befall whiche wont befall fresh water souldiers reason vnskilfulnes bold see enemy come fight afraide neither doth forewarne disciple cause least newe vnlooked thing befall doth also confirme owne example vnmeete thing seeing world hate represent person haue world alwayes like selfe fauourable v leuer translate verbe ginoscete indicatiue mode although man rather haue imparatiue doe gaine say sense altered greater difficultie word foloweth next seeing calleth himselfe former disciple may referred aswell vnto time vnto dignitie former exposition vsuall wit christe hated world disciple doe rather allow latter seeing christe doeth farre excell yet free hatred world minister must refuse like estate saying agreeth twice first chapter 27 30 verse commeth preferred former 19 world another consolation worlde doth hate cause separated true felicitie glory deliuered frō destruction mean clause doth signifie place separate nowe chosen ye world foloweth yt part world separated frō rest perish god mercy place christ cōprehēdeth vnder word worlde regenerate spirite god setteth church world shal see fully 17 chap yet exhortatiō paul cōtrary doctrin ro 12 18 haue peace al mē much lyeth exception added importeth asmuch shold say must take heed lawful v least mā beare much corruption world desire hath please may another questiō obiected yet seethe wicked world cōmōly hated also accursed truly world doth nothere loue own▪ answere earthly men moued according sense flesh neuer hate sin indeed far foorth care losse gain doth moue thē althogh christ meant deny world waxeth hot inwarde discord rageth within self meaning shew world doth hate faithful god appeareth also hereby foolishly anabaptist dote gather one argument seruants god bicause displease part mē may redily obiect many whiche world namely whō filthy cōfusiō thinges deliteth fauour doctrine many world hate desirous haue politike order remaine 20 rem • mber word may also read indicatiue mode remēber without great alteratiō sense yet iudgement imparatiue mode doth better agree cōfirmatiō sentence next going christ said world hated excel disciple meet seruant bee better estate thē master furthermore hath spoken person maketh mētiō also doctrine nothing troubeth godly whē see doctrine whiche god proudly cōtēned men horrible monster beholding wherof may make strongest breast heart quaile whilest part remember sonne god himselfe lesse trie stubbornnes cause maruel ye doctrine god little reuerēced amōgst mē calleth doctrine referred vnto ministerie one onely master church would haue doctrine taught first preached afterward apostle 21 thing fury worlde monstrous whilest rageth doctrine saluation christe sheweth reason thereof carried headlong destruction blinde ignoraunce man would warre god openly therefore blindnesse ignoraunce god causeth worlde carelesly fight christ therefore must alwayes haue respect cause neither haue true consolation el saue testimonie good conscience hereby must mindes lifted vp likewise vnto thankfulnesse whilest world doth perish blindnesse thereof god hath vouchsafed make v partaker light neuerthelesse must hold hatred christ doth proceede dulnesse minde whenas god knowen say oftentimes vnbeliefe blinde wicked doe vnderstand perceiue nothing knowledge confused doth vanish away straightway thing haue handeled large el 22 come spoken vnto haue sinne haue excuse sinne 23 hee hateth hateth father also 24 done workes amongest man hath done haue sinne haue seene also heard mee father 25 worde written law may fulfilled hated nothing 26 comforte • shall come sende vnto father spirite truethe whiche proceedeth father hee shall testifie mee 27 doe also testifie mee beginning 22 come said iewes hated gospel knew god least man thinke serueth mittigate offence hee addeth maliciously blinde man shoulde shut eye least hee bee compelled behold light otherwise might haue beene obiected againste christe know thy father thou doest redresse errour vvhy hast thou least tryed whether altogeather vnapt bee taught hee answereth hath executed office good faithfull teacher vaine malice woulde suffer returne vnto foundenesse minde furthermore meaning make men afraide vnder theyr person doe either refuse truth god offered vnto resist willingly knowe although remaineth terrible vengeance god yet christe hath respect rather vnto disciple hee may encourage certaine hope victorie least time yeelde vnto wickednes wicked whenas heare end wee may triumph middest battell shoulde haue sinne christ seemeth graunt wordes vnbeliefe sinne thinke so▪ augustine thinketh somewhat soberly yet commeth vnto sense faith remitteth blotteth sinnes hee saith summe vnbeliefe condemneth truly said forasmuch vnbeliefe doth keepe men beeing deliuered giltinesse death fountaine cause euill disputation doth nothing appertaine vnto present place word sinne taken generally according circumstance cause handeled christ say ignoraunce meanes excusable malitiously refused god person likeas call giltlesse iust pure acquit one fault wherof giltie therfore absolution christe restrained vnto one kinde sin taketh iewes cloake ignorance contempt hat • ed gospell yet heere ariseth newe question yet whether vnbeliefe sufficient condemne men comming christ noe frantike fellowes gather falsly place whosoeuer died christ comming without faith doubtfull suspensed state vntill christ shew himselfe vnto many place scripture extant whiche testifie onely conscience sufficient make guiltie death saith paule rom 5 14 reigned vntill moses worlde another place epistle 2 12 teacheth shall perish without lawe haue sinned without lawe christ meaning truly graunting wordes whereby hee giueth v vnderstande remaineth nothing iewes pretend mittigate fault haue reiected life willingly wittingly offered vnto excuse whiche hee graunteth doth quite acquit doeth extenuate greeuousnesse wickednesse according seruaunt knoweth master despiceth shalbe sorer beat luke 12 47 christ meant promise pardon vnto others holde enemy conuicted reiected grace god stubbornly end might euidently appeare vnworthy pardon mercie must note speaketh bare comming ioyned doctrin giltie great fault presence body contempt doctrine deliuered made vnexcusable 23 hee hateth mee excellent place whereby taught man hateth doctrine gospel bewrayeth vngodlinesse agaynst god many men pretend another thing word loath gospell yet seeme bee excellent worshipper god trifle contempt god lurketh within commeth passe christ discouereth hypocrisie many ye light doctrine cōcerning thing haue spoken chap 3 20 vpon place hee doeth euill hateth light againe cha 5 23 honoureth soone honoureth father 24 done workes hee comprehendeth iudgement vnder worde workes token diuine glory whiche hee shewed proued plainely myracles power holy ghost testimony sonne god maiestie begotten sonne plainely appeare first chapter concerning myracles whiche wrought commonly obiected neither wrought greater moses prophetes answere knowen christ excelleth myracles respect minister properly authour hee vsed owne name owne commaundement owne power worke myracles haue saide comprehendeth generally testimony heauenlye spirituall power whereby diuinitie reuealed haue seene heard hee concludeth enemy cannot escape running away much despised power whiche altogether diuine might manifestly appeare god shewed foorth power plainely sonne wherefore vaine say deale mortall man place teacheth v attentiue readie weigh woorkes god wherein whilest hee sheweth power hee haue due honour giuen ascribed vnto himselfe vvhereupon followeth vnthankfull towardes god malicious whosoeuer darken giftes passe ouer contemptuously 25 may bee fulfilled contrary nature seemeeth vncredible nothing contrary reason hate god therefore christe saith mind infected great wickednesse hated nothing without cause vvhereby amplifieth wickednesse christe citeth place psal 35 19 saith nowe fulfilled thing dyd befall dauid hee may touch obstinate wickednesse nation discending lineall discent great graundfathers vnto fourth generation reigne without ende hee say better father hated dauid without cause lawe hee meaneth psalmes doctrine prophetes nothing el appurtenance lawe know moses ministerie endure vntill time christ furthermore calleth law honour sake may sorer pricked familiar title say haue lawe giuen heritable right wherein see manner liuely painted 26 christ hath told disciple gospel ought neuer whit lesse esteemed hath many aduersaries euen church setteth testimonie spirite vngodly furie wherwith consiences vnderpropt neuer fall say worlde shall rage doctrine shall mocked othersome shall also accurse shalbe violent motion shall bee able ondermine firmenesse faith holy ghost 〈◊〉 bee giuen hee may establishe testimonie truly ayde whenas world vprore truth god sealed vp hart spirite doth despice whatsoeuer world subiect men iudgements fall faith shoulde bee ouerwhelmed hundred time dayly therefore must note must stand amongest many turmoyles wit wee haue receiued spirite worlde spirite god may know thinges giuen v god hee witnesse doth mightily beate downe scatter abroade ouerthrowe thing soeuer world hath set vpon high darken suppresie god truth vvhosoeuer shall endowed spirit far frō discouraged hatred contempt worlde euery one shall ouercome whole worlde meane season wee must beware depend vpon respect men long faith shall wander sort yea soone shall goe sanctuarie god must needes waner miserably therfore must bee called backe vnto inwarde secrete testimonie spirite faithfull knowe giuen heauen spirite said testifie christ retaineth stayeth saith alone may seeke part saluation el calleth comforter againe end may feare long trust ayde christ meant fortifie faith title least faint temptation must also applied vnto present circumstance calleth spirit truth must vnderstande opposition men carried diuersly without witnesse neither doe rest soundly wheresoeuer speaketh deliuereth men mind doubting feare deceit saith hee send father againe hee proceedeth father serueth augment weight authoritie testimonie spirite sufficient suche strong inuasions many forcible engine vnlesse persuaded came god therfore christ sendeth spirite heauenly glory end may know man gift sure pledge god grace vvhereby appeareth fryuolous subtiltie grecian denyed vnder colour wordes spirite proceedeth sonne christ nameth father heere wont end may make v behold diuinitie 27 yee beare witnesse christe giueth v vnderstande testimonie spirite apostle haue themselues alone enioy themselues alone spreadeth selfe farther abroad bee instrument spirite spake mouth vve see faith commeth hearing yet hath certaintie hath seale earneste spirite menne know sufficiently mist man minde thinke faith conceiued naturally preaching side many brianesicke men cannot away preaching whilest yt breath secrete reuelations inspiration wee see christe ioyneth thinges togeather therefore although faith vntill spirite god lighten mindes seale heartes yet must wee fet vision oracle cloudes worde nigh v mouth heart deu 13 14 ought haue sens tyed set fast vpon isay saith excellently 59 21 couenaunt saith lorde spirite haue put vpon thee woordes haue put thy mouth shall faile c clause yee haue mee beginning added cause may know apostle deserue credite saw thinges eies preach saith iohn haue hard haue seene hand haue handeled 1 iohn 1 1 lorde would prouided meanes might bee nothing wanting whiche might approoue gospell fully chap 16 1 thinges haue spoken vnto yee may bee offended 2 shall make straungers sinagogue houre commeth whosoeuer shall kill hee may thinke hee doth god good seruice 3 thing shall doe vnto haue knowen father yet mee 4 haue spoken thinges vnto houre commeth may remember haue tolde haue spoken thinges vnto beginning 5 goe sent none asketh mee whither goest thou 6 haue spoken thinges sorrow hath filled heart 7 tell truth expedient goe goe comforter come vnto shall goe send vnto 1 thing haue spoken vnto saith againe none thinges hath spoken superfluous seeing fight combates prepared furnished lawfull weapon time meane season hee giueth vnderstande doe well muse vppon doctrine shall able resist let v also remember spoken v also whiche spoken apostle first wee must note christ sendeth battel vnarmed therefore • man faileth warfare saue fault owne slouthfulnesse neither must wee waite stay vntill come vnto present matter must endeuour acquainted speches christ may enter combate need requireth neither neede wee doubt wee shall obtaine victorie long admonition christ remaine deepely imprinted mindes whenas saith leat yee bee offended hee giueth v vnderstand neede feare least turned aside righte course thing appeareth heereby fewe doe rightlye learne doctrine menne seeme remember free daunger doe quayle yeelde enter battaile rude ignoraunte therefore lette v buckle weapon vnto v neuer fall away v 2 straungers synagogue light offence trouble mindes withall driuen like wicked menne company godly least boast people god made bragge title church faythfull onely subiect persecution vnto reproach slaunder paule saieth 1 cor 4 9 10 notwithstanding christ byddeth stand stoutly euen inuasion although thrust synagogue yet neuerthelesse remayne kyngdome god summe wee muste discouraged peruerse iudgements menne must valyauntly endure reproach crosse christe cō tent one thing god alloweth cause menne vniustly wickedly condemne furthermore gather heereby minister gospel onely euil intreated professed enemyes gospel slaundered sometimes euen seeme houshold church yea pillar scribe pharisee priestes apostle cō demned boast appointed god iudges church indeede ordinary gouernment churche power function iudgeing came god frō men corrupted al order god appoynted theyr tyranny came passe power graū ted vnto edification nothing else monstrous oppression seruauntes god excommunication ought haue beene medicine purge church turned banish godlynesse seeing apostle tried time cause pope cur shuld greatly terrifie v wherwith thundreth v testimonie gospel muste feare least hurt v olde one apostle yea ought desire nothing wee may straungers congregation christ banished neuerthelesse let v note discipline god ordayned church beginning abolyshed grosse abuse seeinge sathan wholly occupied may corrupt al god institution must yeelde vnto may quite takē away corruption god hath establyshed euer therefore excommunication lesse reclaimed vnto pure lawful vse baptisme supper lord houre commeth christ persisteth yet offence enemy gospel doe challenge take themselues authoritie thinke offer holy sacrifice vnto god whē put faythful death self hard matter innocent shoulde cruelly vexed farre harder farre troublesome thing iniuries whiche wicked doe child god accounted iuste punishmentes doe theyr wickednes must place much ayde good conscience may suffer selues bee thus oppressed time vntil time christe appeare heauen reuenger cause owne wonder enemy truth seeing conscience doe accuse onely deceiue men doe also chalenge themselues praise vniust crueltie god answere hipocrites howsoeuer conscience doth accuse • atter themselues deceiue themselues ambitious cruell proud cloake al vice colour zeale ende may carelesly slatter themselues added also vnto certeine furious drunkennes handes haue beene imbrued bloud martyr 3 thing shal vnto vaine doth often cal apostle vnto consideration cause vnbeleeuers doe rage know god yet notwithstanding spoken mittigate offence apostle may despise • ury loftie mind falleth oftentimes authoritie wherein wicked excell pompe appeareth doe shake modest godly mindes contrary christ commaundeth disciple rise holy magnanimitie may contemne aduersary onely errour blindnes doe driue forward brase wall certeinelye perswaded god side resist v destitute reason wordes taught grieuous great euill ignoraunce god causeth euen murtherers father seeke praised wickednes 4 houre shal come yee may remember hee repeateth saide already shadowishe philosophye must brought practise vse preacheth concerning matter may indeede declare taught vaine vvhen saieth yee may remember commandeth first lay vp thing mindes haue heard againe remember neede shal require lēgth giueth vnderstand smal importance prophecieth thing come haue told beginning asmuch apostle yet tender weake long christe conuersant fleshe hee spared good mercifull maister suffered laid vpon thē able beare therfore great neede confirmation rest persecution telleth thē estate altered new estate prepared dooth also exhort prepare themselues vnto cumbat 5 new go vnto mittigateth moste excellent consolation sorow might conceiue departure necessary liued hitherto daintily called heereafter vnto great hard sightes vvhat shuld haue befallen vnlesse shuld haue known christ gouernour saluation heauen go vnto father nothing else bee receiued heauenly glory may enioy principal gouerment therefore remedy sorrow set although christ absent body yet hee sit right hande father may defend faithfull power hee reprehendeth two faultes apostle place much addicted visible presence flesh secondly soone taken away oppressed sorow lyfted vppe eye higher thing doth commonly befal v doe alway fastē christ sens done appeare would wish feigne selues matter dispayre seemeth falsly obiected apostle aske whither master goeth seeing enquired diligently matter may easily answere aske lifted vp mindes vnto hope thing ought principally haue done sense therfore sone heare departure afraid neither yee consider whither go end 7 tell trueth testifieth absence shall bee profitable may cease desirous haue present eye vseth kinde oath carnall nothing harder v plucke mindes preposterous affection whereby pul christ heauen vnto v expresseth kind profitablenes could otherwise endowed holy ghost vnlesse forsake world presence christ farre profitable bee desired whereby giueth himselfe vnto v enioyned grace power spirite present eye neither muste moue question whether christ could set downe spirit whē vppon earth taketh thing al mē graunt whatsoeuer father hath decreed certeinly soone lord hath declared haue done foolishnes dispute possibilitie 8 shal come shal reproue world sinne righteousnes 〈◊〉 iudgement 9 sinne beleeue 10 righteousnesse beecause goe father yee shall see mee 〈◊〉 11 iudgement prince world iudged 12 haue yet manye thinges speake vnto cannot beare 13 shal come wit spirit trueth shal lead al truth neither shal speake himselfe whatsoeuer thinges shal heare shal speak shal tel thing shal come passe 14 shal glorifie shal take mine show vnto 15 al thing father hath mine therefore said vnto shal take mine shew vnto 8 vvhen yee shall come omittinge diuersitie exposition whiche obscuritye place hath broughte forthe onelye affirme whiche doe thinke dooth beste agree christ meaning hee promised spirit disciple commendeth excellency gift effect spirit shal gouerne vphold defend alone shal spread abroad force farther shal reproue world saith shal onely abide shut vp shall spreade abroade himselfe power throughout whole worlde therefore hee promiseth vnto spirite shall iudge world whome preaching shalbe liuely effectuall shal bring order passing boundes beefore throughe vnbrideled lyberty holden feare reuerence must note christ speaketh place secrete reuelations power spirite appeareth externall preaching gospel voice menne commeth passe voice manne pearceth mindes doth take roote finallye bringeth foorth fruite making fleshy heartes stony heartes renewinge menne themselues saue spirit christ doth quicken otherwise shuld dead letter vaine founde paul teacheth excellently 2 cor 3 6 boasteth minister spirite god wrought mightely doctrine sense therefore apostle shal haue spirite giuen shall bee furnished celestiall diuine power maye exercise authoritie haue iurisdiction throughout whole world attributed rather spirite shall haue power owne seeing shalbe onely minister instrumentes spirite alone shall gouerne thinke comprehendeth vnder word world aswel truely conuerted vnto christ reprobate hypocrite spirit reproueth men two manner wayes preaching gospel touched throughly humble themselues willingly subscribe vnto iudgemente readily whereby condemned othersome although conuicted cannot escape guiltinesse yet doe yeelde heart neyther doe submit themselues vnto authority dominion spirit rather beeinge subdued frette inwardly confounded doe yet cease nourish stubbernnes heart see spirite ought reproue world apostle witte god reuealed iudgement gospel wherewith conscience smitten beganne feale mysery grace god word elenchein taken place conuicte contained 1 corinth • 4 24 shall bringe small lighte vnderstanding place paul saith prophecie vnbeleeuer idiote doe come reproued iudged secretes heart made manifest paule intreateth place properly one kinde reprouing wit lord bringeth elect vnto repentaunce gospel yet appeareth euidently heereby spirit god doth sound man voyce compell men vnacquainted yoake acknowledge submit themselues gouernment question end christ said thus doe thinke noteth cause hatred whereof made mention say world doth hate cause spirite shall vrge world side doe rather subscribe vnto teach christe didde intende thing haue alreadye touched beeginninge verye requisite apostle shoulde knowe gyfte spirite promysed small gyft therefore excellencie thereof descrybed god shall meanes erecte iudgemente seate iudge whole world 9 sinne remayneth see reproue sinne christ seemeth make infidelytie onely cause sinne diuersly wrested interpreter sayd declare euery one teacheth thinketh vve must firste note iudgement spirite beginneth declaration sinne beginning spiritual doctrine menne begotten sinne haue nothing themselues matter sinne furthermore christ maketh mention infidelitie ende hee mighte shew nature man selfe bond wherby vniteth himselfe vnto v fayth vntil beleeue wee without deuided therefore word importe much haue said spirit shall come shal declare proue sinne reigneth world without therfore infidelitie named place separateth v christ bringeth passe nothing left v sinne shorte corruption frowardnes man nature condemned word least think one drop righteousnes v without christ 10 righteousnes vve must note course degree whiche christ setteth downe hee saith worlde must reproued righteousnes doubtlesse menne shal hunger thriste righteousnes yea shal loathsomnesse refuse whatsoeuer shall spoken vnlesse shal touched feeling sin especially must thus thinke faithfull cannot profitte gospel vntil shalbe first humbled cannot vntill come knowledge sinnes proper function law call conscience vnto god iudgement wounde feare gospel cannot rightly preached muste bring sinne vnto righteousnes death life therefore must needes borrow first member law wherof christ spake heere vnderstand righteousnes haue grace christ christ placeth ascention vnto father without cause like paule testifieth rom 4 24 hee rose againe iustification sitteth nowe right hande father may exercise whatsoeuer power giuen may fulfill al thing finally filleth world smel righteousnes heauenly glory spirite pronounceth gospell onely meanes whereby iudged iuste therefore second degree fet conuiction sin spirite may conuince worlde accounted true righteousnes wit christ hath appointed ordained kingdome life ascending heauen sitteth right hand father end may establish true righteousnes 11 iudgement take word iudgement damnation want reason christ addeth immediately prince world iudged thinke sense dooth better agree witte soone light gospell lighted spirite reuealeth state world rightly orderly framed victory christ whereby threwe sathan empyre hee saye true restoringe whereby al thing reformed christ himselfe possesseth kingdome alone hauing subdued conquered sathan therefore iudgement set confused disordered thing maye speake brieflye contrarye disorder man call rightnesse straightnesse whiche sense oftentimes taken scripture sense therefore long sathan ruleth mixeth troubleth thinges filthy euill fauoured confusion workes god stripped tyrannye by▪ christ world reformed appeareth good order spirite conuinceth world iudgment christ restoreth bringeth thing order gone decay hauing ouercome prince iniquitie 12 haue yet many thinges christ sermon coulde preuaile much amongst disciple rudenes cause doubt yet many thinges yea scarse taste thinges whiche ought haue refreshed throughly vnlesse weakenes flesh hindered therefore could acknowledging want shuld feare stand doubt therefore saith vnable beare thē shall tell higher thing tendeth end incouraged hope better profiting bee discouraged meete shuld measure grace wherwith shuld endowed according present feeling seeing farre heauen summe biddeth good courage weake soeuer beecause vnderpropping whereunto might leane saue onely doctrine christ telleth tempered might receiue yet yt hope higher plentifull shortly shuld say yet sufficient establish haue heard suffer litle ye shal shortly taught spirit shall ye want nothing hee shall resolue yet rude nowe question thinges whiche apostle sitte learne yet end papist may thrust owne inuentions steede god oracle wickedly abuse place christe promised say vnto apostle new reuelations therefore must stay scripture aboue calleth first say augustine saith shal answere readily wordes seeing christ held peace v saye thinges hee dare saye hee prooue vaine rashe although hee say thinges true canne affirme without diuine testimonie thinges lord would vtter time wee haue surer reason christ wordes refute spirite called perfect maister truth christ promysed apostle hee promised saue might deliuer handes wisdome receiued spirit giuen guide directer executed office enioyned spirit brought trueth cōprehended writing sum doctrine vvhosoeuer thinketh ought thing added doctrine lame halfe full perfect doth accuse disciple fraudulent dealing doth also blaspeme spirit doctrine didde write proceeded fresh water soldiours nounces addition beene superfluous fithence writinges euerlasting table reuelation promised giuen nothing added vnto without cruell iniury spirite furthermore papist ridiculous come matter themselues define secretes apostle vnable bere childish diriges nothing vaine foolysh forsooth spirite must needes come downe heauen apostle might learne hallow chalice altar baptise belle blesse holy water celebrate masse therfore doe noddies child learne thinges haue finger endes therefore manifest papist doe mocke god seeinge feigne thinges came downe heauen doe lesse smell misteries cere proserpina contrary sincere wisdome spirite let v vnlesse vnthankfull god reste vppon doctrine whereof apostle aucthors writinges declare seeing chiefest perfection heauenly wisdome deliuered vnto v may make man god perfect colloss 1 28 let v thinke lawefull v goe beyond height breadth depth placed knowe loue god shewed vnto v christe ephe 3 18 knowledge excelleth knowledge saieth paule like teacheth treasure wisdome knowledge hidden christ colloss 2 3 hee forgeth vnknowne christ whome liuely depaynted preaching may seene crucified eye hee saith vnto galathians third chapter first verse least shoulde anye doubt remaine christe declareth afterwarde owne wordes thinges apostle could beare hee shall declare vnto thinges shall come saieth doe restraine vnto spirite prophecie iudgment meaneth rather estate spirituall kingdome whiche shoulde come suche apostle saw shortely resurrection could in▪ case comprehend therfore doth promise thē prophecy concerning thing shuld happen death giueth thē vnderstand nature kingdome shalbe sorte glory farre greater nowe conceiue mindes treasure hidden wisdome heauenly aungels doe learne church admiration paule expoundeth vnfoldeth epistle ephesian first chapter vntil ende fourth vvherefore cause shuld fette pope tresurie chest shal speake himselfe confirmation clause hee shal leade trueth vve know god fountaine truth certeine sound thing without vvherefore end apostle may safely assuredly beleeue oracle spirite christ affirmeth diuine hee say floweth god spirit shal bring yet maiestie spirit whitte diminished woordes hee god inferiour father referred vnto capacitie minde doe sufficiently comprehende reason vale put betweene great reuerence ought receiue thinges spirite reuealeth vnto v therefore expresse mention made diuinitie like hee called el earnest wherby god doth confirme vnto v saluatiō seale wherby sealeth vnto v certeintie thereof sum christ meant teach doctrine spirit worlde bred ayre shal come secrete place heauenly sanctuary ephe 1 3 14 hee shall glorifie christ telleth spirite shall come may erect new kingdome rather may establish glory giuen father many men dreame christ taught onely might deliuer first rudimentes might send disciple afterwarde higher schoole meanes make account gospel law said galath 3 24 haue beene schoole maister olde people errour borne followeth christ hauing taken leaue made end ruling nothing thrust spirit place fountaine flow sacrilege pope mahomet although antichristes doe much differ one another yet haue one principle witte entred right faith gospel yet must fette perfection doctrine somwhere else may throughly pullish v scripture obiected pope saith ought stay spirite came vpon afterward hath lifted v vppe aboue many addition mahomet saith without alcharan men alwayes continue child therefore world falsly bewitched vnder colour spirit depart plaine trueth christ soone spirite pluckte away word christ gate set open vnto manner dotinges seducinges like way deceiuing hath beene assayed time many frantik fellowes doctrine written seemed litterall therefore pleased thē coine new kinde diuinitie consist vpon reuelations see litle superfluitie christ admonition shuld glorified spirit would send end might know office spirit establish christe kingdom defend confirme euer whatsoeuer father hath giuen end serueth doctrine spirit may lead v away schoole christ rather tha • voice may established whereby commanded heare otherwise take somewhat christ glory reason added shall take mine saith christ woordes giueth v vnderstand receiue spirit end may enioy benefites dooth giue v wee may washed bloud christe sinne may abolished v death old man may crucified resurrection may able reforme v vnto newnes life finally may partaker good thinges therfore spirit giueth v nothing aparte christ taketh christ powreth ouer v must thinke doctrine doth illuminate v may lead v away euen litle christ may fulfil paul saith 1 cor christ made vnto v wisdom againe openeth treasure hidden christ sum enricheth v rich christe may shew forth glory al thing 15 vvhat thing soeuer father hath mine christ might seeme take father chalengeth cō fesseth hath father imparteth vnto v spirit saith al thing father hath speaketh person mediatour must draw fulnes hath alwaies respect vnto v hath bin said see part men deceiue thēselues passing ouer christ seeke god expound common sonne whatsoeuer father hath inasmuch god hee intreateth much place hidden inward may call power office enioyned towarde v finally commendeth rich may inuite v enioy thē reckoneth spirit amongst gift receiue father hand 16 litle see againe litle yee see goe father 17 therfore certeine disciple said amongst themselues hee saith vnto v litle ye see againe litle yee shall see goe father 18 therefore saide saieth litle w • te saith 19 therefore iesus knew would aske said vnto enquire amongst selues said litle ye see againe litle ye shal see 20 verely verely say vnto ye shal weepe mourne world shal reioyce ye shal sorowful sorow shalbe turned ioy 16 litle ye see christ foretold disciple oftētimes departure partely might endure valiant courage partely might earnestly desire grace spirite whereof much desirous long christ present body let v take heede therefore read lothsomly christ beateth vaine first al telleth shalbe taken shortly ende depriued sight wherein onely rested may yet cease good courage secondly promiseth ayde absence yea promiseth shalbe restored agayne shortly shalbe taken away sort witte presence holy ghost although othersome expound second member otherwise yee shall see shal rise againe death short time shal receiued heauen seemeth mee woordes beare sēse litle ye shal see yea rather doth lighten mittigate sorrow absence consolation shal long commendeth grace spirite whereby wil present continually shuld promise wil returne shortly shall depriued sighte long tyme neyther ought accounted absurd thing saith seene whilest dwelleth disciple spirit although seene bodily eye yet presence known certeine experiment faith true paule saieth 2 cor 5 6 faythfull absent god long conuersante vppon earth walke faith sight true may worthily boast meane season haue christ abyding fayth • leaue vnto member head possesse heauen hope therefore grace spirite glasse wherein christ wyl beholden according paule place 16 althoughe wee haue knowne christ according flesh yet doe know manne christ let new creature goe father doe expound disciple shuld see christ shuld bee heauen vpon earth doe rather referre vnto second member yee shall see shortlye death destruction may separate mee passage heauenly glory whence diuine power shall come euen vnto therefore hee meant iudgement teach estate hee stand death might contente spirituall presence might thinke anye whitte worse liued longer mortall man 19 iesus knew although lord doth seeme sometimes speak deaffe men yet doth length prouide rudenes doctrine vnprofitable standeth v vpon doe endeuour neither pride slouthfulnes may added vnto slowenes let v rather shew selues humble desirous learne 20 yee shal weepe mourne hee sheweth cause foretolde departure hand also adde promise concerning speedy returne witte might better know necessary ayde spirit prepared saieth hee hard sore temptation soone shalbe taken away death world shal triumph shall great heauines worlde shall account selfe blessed miserable therefore thought good furnish necessary weapon vnto fight speaketh time betweene death sending spirite faith laid oppressed hidden sorrow shalbe turned ioy hee meaneth ioy wherewith endued hadde receiued holy ghoste free afterward sorrow al sorrow heauines suffer swallowed vp spiritual ioy vve know apostle enuied slaundered manye cause mourning long liued renued spirite put feeling former infirmitie might hero • call loftines easily treade vnder foote euilles soeuer brought vppon therefore presente infirmitie conferred place power spirite wherewith endowed shortly almost ouerwhelmed time afterward fight ioyfully also triumphe gloriously middest battels althogh must also note doth meane meane season betweene christ resurrection death apostle followed afterward also christ say ye shal lye prostrate time spirite shal set vppe shall new ioy begin shalbe augmented cōtinually vntil ye reioyce perfectly receiued heauenly glory 21 woman bringeth forth hath sorow h • ure come whē hath brought forth sonne remembreth affliction ioy man borne world 22 ye haue sorow therfore wil see againe heart shal reioice man shal take ioy 23 houre ye shal aske thing verely verely say vnto whatsoeuer ye shal aske father name shall giue 24 hitherto haue ye asked nothing name aske yee shal receiue ioy may full 21 woman bringeth forth hee confirmeth sentence next going similitude yea expresseth meaning plainlye witte heauy heart shal changed ioye doth also conteine self matter ioy falleth oftentimes prosperitie followeth aduersitie menne hauing forgotten former sorrow wholly giue ouer themselues vnto ioye yet sorow went cause ioy christ giueth v vnderstand sorrow shal suffer gospel sake shalbe fruitfull certeinly ende sorrowes must nedes vnhappy vnlesse blessed christ crosse christ hath victory included self alwaies christe doth good cause cōpare sorow conceiued thence vnto sorow womā trauaile recompenced rewarde thereof whilest child brought light doth make womā trauaile ioyful similitude shuld agree vnlesse sorrow cause ioy member christ whilest made partaker passion likeas traueiling childe byrth womanne cause birth child vve must also apply similitude vnto sorow paine womā sharpest thē doth soonest vanish away small lightening disciple heard sorrow endure long must apply vse doctrine vnto selues wee regenerate spirite christ v ioy wipe away feeling myseries saye like woman traueiling childe byrth moued onely sight childe sorrow remayneth longer haue receiued first fruites onely slender scarse feele smal drop spirituall ioy sprinckeled vpon sorrow may mittigate bytternes thereof yet smal portion doth shew far ouerwhelmed heauines behold christ faith doe neuerthelesse triumph euen extreame myseries neuerthelesse estate creature trauaile byrth euen vntill last day redemptiō let v know must also grone vntil deliuered continual misery life see manifestly fruit faith sum faithful like womē lying childbed inasmuch borne againe christ entred celestiall kingdome god blessed life like womenne great childe trauaile childebirth asmuch beeing yet captiues prison flesh desire attaine vnto happie estate heth hid vnder hope 22 man shal take away ioy continuance ioy doth litle encrease price thereof followeth heeruppon griefes light suffered paciently continue short time furthermore christ telleth v woordes true ioy world must needes bee depriued ioyes hath seeketh onely transitory thing therefore must come vnto christ resurrectiō wherin euerlasting stabilytie meaneth wil see disciple shal visit againe grace spirit may continually enioye sight 23 ye shal aske thing▪ christ hath promised ioye disciple inuincible strength add constancy setteth foorth grace spirit wherwith endowed wit great light vnderstanding shal lift vppe euen vnto hidden misteries heauenly great • lacknes thē time doubt stick euery smal point child read english cānot go throgh one line without many stop offece almost euery word christ hindered profiting shortly illuminated holy spirit longer staied hindered wisdome god familiar wel known thē went forward misteries god without stop stay apostle ceased euen extolled vnto highest degree wisdō aske mouth christ doth onely make comparison double estate place christ shuld say rudenesse shall corrected doe stop staye euery smal trifle shuld ea • ily pearce euen vnto highest misteryes place ieremy 31 34 euery manne shall teach neighbour saying know lord shall al know least saieth lord prophet doth take away doctrine neither abolysh ought al flourish kingdome christ soone shal • e taught god saith shalbe place left grosse ignoraunce whiche possesseth mindes men vntill sunne righteousnes giue lighte vnto beames spirit furthermore seeing apostls differ nothing child yea like blockes men well knowne manner person suddeine taught spirit vvhatsoeuer yee shal aske father declareth whence shal haue new store witte shal lawful thē ful mouth draw vp much shall neede god foūtaine wisdome shuld say neede feare least destitute gifte vnderstāding father shalbe ready enrich al aboundance al good thing teacheth woordes spirit promised therfore whō promised maye waite themselues slouthfull sluggish rather may earnestly bent desire grace offered sum promiseth wil execute office mediator may liberally could desire obteine father whatsoeuer shal aske ariseth hard question whether began call vpon god christes name first al could neuer otherwise merciful vnto men saue mediator sake christ speaketh time come heauenly father wil giue disciple whatsoeuer shal aske christes name new vnwonted grace seemeth wee maye gather long conuersant vpon earth yet play part aduocate praiers faithfull might accepted thing expresseth also plainely hitherto saith ye haue asked nothing name likely apostle obserued forme praier appointed lawe wee know father wont pray without mediator seeing god many exercise acquaint fourme praier saw high priest enter sanctuary name al people saw sacrifice offered daily praiers church might established god therefore one ground principle faith men cal vpon god vaine without mediatour christ testified sufficiently disciple mediatour knowledge obscure could yet rightly frame praiers vnto name neither absurditie praied vnto god vnder hope mediatour according prescript law yet notwithstanding wel vnderstand meant veile temple yet extended maiesty god yet hiddē vnder shadow cherub true priest yet entred sanctuary heauen might make intercession yet cōsecrated way bloud meruail thē yet known mediatour since appeareth heauen father v reconciling vnto v sacrifice miserable men maye boldnes come thither hope surely soone christ hadde made ende purging sinnes receiued heauen shewed himselfe manifestly mediatour must note often repetitiō clause must pray christes name end may know wicked profaning name god man dare present iudgement seate passing ouer perswasion shalbe surely fixed mind god wil giue v willingly freely whatsoeuer shal aske sonnes name wee shall call vnto selues diuerse patrones place ayde v shall content alone doth often gently offer v aide helpe furthermore said pray christes name whē make aduocate purchase fauour v father handes although plaine wordes expresse name 24 aske referred vnto time manifestation follow shortly vvherefore inexcusable day darken parte doctrine feigned patronage saintes requisite old people turne theyr eye vnto shadowish priest sacrifice beastes often disposed pray therfore vnthankful vnlesse fasten al sens vppon true priest giuen v mediatour haue easie ready entraunce vnto throne glory god addeth last al ioy may ful whereby giueth v vnderstand wee shall want nothing vnto perfect plentie al good thing nothing vnto sum requestes petition nothing vnto quiet sufficiencie wee aske god name whatsoeuer shal neede 25 thing haue spoken vnto prouerbes houre commeth wil longer speake prouerbs wil tel openly father 26 houre ye shal aske name say wil aske father 27 father loueth haue loued mee haue beleeued came god 28 came father came world againe leaue world go father 25 thing haue spoken prouerbes christ intent purpose encourage disciple hoping wel shal profit better may think doctrine heare vnprofitable although learne much thereby suspition might haue come mindes christ would vnderstood made doubt set purpose therfore telleth shal come passe shortly shal feele perceiue fruit doctrine might procure loathsomnes mind reasō darknes therof mshl doth somtims signifie amongst hebritiās prouerb prouerbs haue moste part figure trope cōmeth passe therby hebritianse cal mshl • darke speaches notable sentence gretians cal apohthegmata haue part doubtful obscure thing therefore sense seeme speak vnto figuratiuely plaine manifest speaches speake vnto shortly familiarly may nothing doubtful hard doctrine vve see haue alreadye touched disciple encouraged hope better profiting leaste reiect doctrine doe yet well vnderstande meaneth vnlesse hope profiting enflame v desire learne must needes waxe cold matter doth manifestly declare christe spake darkly vsed easie grosse kind speach spake disciple rudenes great amased depend vpon mouth vvherefore darknes much doctrine mind truly thing befalleth v day word god hath title giuen vaine light darknes doth darken brightnes thereof thinke heare meere allegory hee threatneth prophet esa 28 11 wil barbarous vnto vnbeleeuers reprobate stammered paul 2 cor 4 3 saith gospel hidden sathan hath blinded mindes resoundeth confused thing moste parte weak rude cannot vnderstoode although theyr mindes altogether dark mind vnbeleeuers yet it▪ couered cloudes lorde suffereth v thus dull season may humble v feeling pouertie yet maketh doth illuminate hys spirit profit sort word well known familyar end tendeth latter mēber hour commeth shal come immediately wil speake figuratiuely truely spirit taught apostle nothing else saue thinges heard christ mouth whē shed forth bright beames vpon heart hee driue away darknes hearing christ speake new fashion easily vnderstand meant vvhen saith wil tel father▪ teacheth drifte doctrine may bring v vnto god placed perfect felicitie remaineth one question saith place graunted discipls know misteries ye kingdō god vnto whō cōfesseth spak darkly prouerbs mat 13 11 putteth difference betweene rest common people speaketh vnto common people parable aunswere great ignoraunce disciple lightlye taste maister meant separateth frō flock blind without cause saieth word hath bene hitherto allegoricall vnto respecte manifest light vnderstanding would giue shortly grace spirite therefore thinges true far passe vnto woord gospel vnsauerie young beginner respect new wisdome spirite brought 26 houre repeateth cause againe celestial treasure shall opened liberally witte shall aske name christ whatsoeuer shall haue neede god deny nothing shal asked son name seemeth disagreement word christ addeth
