epistle hebrewes confirmeth self thing 7 25 aunswere christ dooth simply deny place intercessour onely meaning father shalbe inclined towarde disciple shall willinglye readily giue whatsoeuer shall pray father saieth shall meete infinite loue towarde shall preuente patrone whoe shoulde otherwise speake christ said make intercession v vnto father let v imagine carnall thing falling father knee hee didde humbly pray v power sacrifice whereby hee reconciled god vnto v alway greene effectual bloud wherwith purged sin obediēce perfourmed continual intercession made v notable place whereby wee taught haue heart god soone haue set name sonne 27 haue loued me▪ vve taught word onely hand coniunction god ioyned vnto christ ioyned faith feigned proceedeth sincere affection signifieth woord loue man beleeueth christ purely saue loueth imbraceth whole heart vvherefore well expresse force nature faith word sobe • god beginne loue v haue loued christ followeth beeginning saluation selues preuent grace god many testimony scripture opiniō sentence promise god wil make loue 1 ioh 4 10 saith loued first superfluous gather place nothing certeine thē doctrine lord calleth thinges rayseth vp dead adioyneth himsel▪ vnto stranger maketh fleshy hart stony hart appeareth vnto seeke answere men number elect beloued god calling hiddē maner loueth al created yet reconciled worthily coūted god enemy paul saith ro 5 10 sort said place loued god loue christ haue pledge fatherly loue afraid seuere iudge hated v 28 came father speach setteth forth vnto v christ diuine power faith shuld firmly fixed vnlesse lay hold vpon diuine power death resurrection two pillers faith helpe v litle nothing vnlesse heauenly power annexed thereunto vnderstand ought imbrace christ witte faith doe weigh consider purpose power god whose hand offered vnto v neither must take coldly came god must know also end wherefore came wit might vnto v wisdome sanctification righteousnesse redemption second member whiche added noted perpetuitie continuance power disciple might think temporall benefite master sent redeemer worlde therfore said returned vnto father ende may bee fully persuaded none good thinges doe fall away departure hath brought powreth force effect resurrection heauenly glory therefore left world receiued heauen putting infirmity yet neuerthelesse grace forcible toward v sitteth right hand father may enioy gouernment al whole world 29 disciple say vnto behold speakest thou plainely speakest prouerbe▪ 30 know thou knowest thinges hast need man aske thee question beleeue thou camest god 31 iesus answered doe yee nowe beleeue behold houre shall come commeth nowe wherein shall bee scattered euery man owne yee shal leaue alone although alone father 32 thing haue spoken yee may haue peace ye haue tribulation worlde • e good courage haue ouercome world 29 disciple say vnto hereby appeareth effectuall consolation lifted vp vnto great ioyfulnesse mindes cast downe discouraged yet notwithstanding certaine disciple knew yet christe speech import althogh comprehended yet yet smel refresh thē cry master speaketh plainely without figure passe measure yet according meaning testifie truth vvhich thing doe also trie day hath tasted little doctrine gospell enflamed fealeth force small quantitie portion faith knowen plato yea sighes sob spirite god stirreth vp heartes godly doe sufficiently testifie god worketh secrete meanes aboue capacitie otherwise paule woulde call vnexpresseable ro 8 26 vve must thus thinke apostle felt profiting might truly testifie christe wordes altogether darke vnto deceiued seemed themselues wiser errour proceeded thence knew sort gifte soirite therefore reioyce time man thinke rich hath one crowne gold gather certaine signes christ came foorth god boast wanted nothing el farre knowledge yet long vnderstood christ afterward 31 yee beleeue disciple great good liking themselues christ telleth remembring infirmitie must rather keepe themselues within compasse vvee doe neuer know sufficiently lacke farre wee fulnesse faith vntill come vnto serious experiment tryall thing selfe doth declare weake faith thoght perfect christ calleth back disciple vnto pronounceth shal come passe shortly shal leaue persecution like touchstone trie saith whiche whenas appeareth small men begin tremble shrinke together puffed vp therefore christe interrogation ironicall made iestingly haue saide doe ye boast therefore filled faith triall hand shall bewray emptinesse securitie must brideled thus whilest passeth measure much might seeme either faith disciple extinguished hauing forsaken christ ran vp answere howsoeuer faith cast downe faint fayle yet remained something whence newe slippes myghte spring 32 alone correction added ende may know christ whit impayred forsaken men seeing trueth glory grounded himselfe doth depende vpon faith worlde chaunce bee forsaken whole world yet neuerthelesse hee remaineth perfect god needeth help saith father bee much say god side hath neede borrow thing menne vvhosoeuer shall ponder thinges shall stand stedfast whole world like fall neither shal falling ouerthrowe faith doe giue god due honour vnlesse hee alone sufficient v 33 thinges haue spoken vnto hee repeateth againe necessary comfortes vsed giue hee proueth reason much sorow tribulation prepared therefore must first note admonition godly may bee persuaded life subiect great miserye may prepare themselues suffer indure therefore seeing worlde vnto v like surging sea wee shall find true peace el saue christ nowe must note meanes way enioy saith shall haue peace goe forwarde doctrine vvill haue mindes quiet free middest affliction let v take good heede vnto sermon christ shall giue v peace bee good cheere sluggishnesse ought corrected diuers affliction wee must bee awaked seeke remedie misery lord wil haue v discouraged rather fight ioyfully whiche cannot vnlesse certaine haue successe fight knowing whether shall haue victorie desire endeuour shall fall ground therefore christ calleth v fight hee furnisheth v sure hope victorie although must neuerthelesse take paine furthermore alwayes v great matter trembling hee telleth v must hope cause hee hath ouercome worlde himselfe alone sake shall come passe almost oppressed selues wee may able safely contemne miserie soeuer lyeth vpon v beholde great glory whereunto head hath attained vvherefore wee desire christian must seeke bee free crosse let v content one thing long fight vnder christes banner wee notwithstanding daunger euen conflict christ comprehendeth place vnder woorde worlde whatsoeuer contrary saluation godly especially corruption satan abuseth hee may deceiue v chap 17 1 thinges spake iesus hee lifted vp eye towarde heauen said father houre come glorifie thy sonne thy sonne may also glorifie thee 2 thou hast giuen power flesh may giue life thou hast giuen 3 eternall life may knowe thee true god iesus christ thou hast sent 4 haue glorified thee vpon earth haue finished woorke thou hadst giuen mee doe 5 glorifie thou mee father thy selfe glory thee worlde 1 thinges spake iesus lorde made ende preaching vnto disciple concerning bearing crosse set comfortes whereunto might leane persist vvhen hee promised comming spirite hee put better hope hee intreated glory excellencie kingdome nowe turneth himselfe vnto prayer good cause doctrine waxeth colde vnlesse made effectuall god therefore giueth example teacher doe onely take paine lowing seed woorde intermingle prayer craue god helpe blessing may make labour fruitefull summe prayer christe sealing vp former doctrine might bee sure selfe also disciple might stedfastly beleeue iohn saith christ prayed lifting vp eye toward heauen small signe zeale feruentnesse christe testified deede gesture rather heauen affection minde earth might talke familiarly god looked vp toward heauen god shut vp doeth also fill earth maiestie appeareth chiefly secondly beholding heauen doth admonish v power god doth farre surpasse creature purpose serueth lifting vp handes prayed seeing men slacke slowe nature earthly nature doth bend downewarde haue neede stirred vp thus yea haue neede chariot carry vp vnto god couer imitate christ truly must take • ceremony expresse minde let inward affection mooue handes feete tongue whatsoeuer haue vvheras publicane luke 18 13 rightly pray vnto god casting eye contrary sentence although beeing confounded sinnes cast downe himselfe yet humilitie hinder craued pardon boldnesse meete christe pray another sort nothing whereof needed bee ashamed againe certaine dauid himselfe prayed sometimes one sort sometimes another matter required father houre come christ desireth haue kindome made famous may otherside set foorth glorye father hee saith houre come although hee declared myracles kinde power sonne god yet spiritual kingdome yet obscure shined shortly man obiect nothing lesse glorious christ death wat hand answere appeareth vnto v great renowne death hid wicked know world reconciled vnto god sinnes purged curse taken away satan ouercome end tendeth christ petition death may bring foorth fruite power heauenly spirite decreed eternall counsell god saith houre come appointed man god ordeined yet prayer superfluous christ doth depende vpon god yet notwithstanding knew hee ought desire promised surely come passe god whatsoeuer hath determined whole world sleepeth also gainstandeth yet neuerthelesse dutie ask whatsoeuer hath promised vse promise stirre v vp pray thy sonne may glorified giueth v vnderstand mutuall illustration glory father end doth christ appeare saue may leade v vnto father vvherupon followeth honour soeuer giuen vnto christe farre diminishing father honour doth establish vve must alwayes remember person christe beareth place must consider diuinitie alone speaketh much god reuealed flesh according office mediatour 2 thou hast giuen hee proueth againe asked nothing saue agreeable father likeas perpetuall rule prayer aske god woulde giue owne accord nothing preposterous vtter whatsoeuer list power fleshe • e meaneth rule gouernment giuen christ father made king head must note ende wit may giue life therefore christe tooke vpon rule gouernment much owne sake saluations sake therefore meete submit selues vnto christ willingly wee may obey god nothing amiable subiection seeing vnto v cause eternal life christ saith made gouernour whole world end may giue life vnto men generall restraineth grace vnto giuen giuen father hath also put reprobate vnder answere elect peculiar flock hath taken keepe shepheard therefore kingdome christ extended indeed vnto men wholesome onely elect willing obedience doe followe voyce pastour hee compelleth obey whether wil vntill doe length breake peeces yron scepter 3 eternall life may knowe doth define manner giuing life wit illuminateth elect may know god aright doth intreate place fruition life hope men come vnto life ende may well throughly vnderstand sentence must first knowe al death vntill god shine vnto v life alone soone hath appeared vnto v possesse faith wee doe also enter possession life hereby commeth passe knowledge truly worthily said wholesome saue v furthermore almost euery word hath weight meaneth place manner knowledge god transformeth image god faith faith yea one faith whereby ingrafted body christe made partaker adoption god heires kindome heauen god knowen face christ alone liuely expresse image therefore said may knew thee christ thou hast sent father placed first referred vnto order faith minde afterward discend vnto christe know god sense god knowen length mediatour put betweene two epithites added true necessary first faith doe distinguish god al vain inuentions men hauing embraced firme certaintie bended whither ne yet faint wauer secondly persuaded imfect thing god content alone whereas doe resolue thus may knowe thee art god alone cold therfore sense may acknowledge thee true god christ seemeth meanes dispoyle himselfe right name diuinitie man answere word god applyed vnto christ well father question shalbe moued concerning holy ghost▪ father sonne one god spirite driuen degree absurd vve may easily answere man take heede vnto manner speech christ vseth euery gospell iohn whereof haue often tolde reader alreadie ought bee acquainted therewith christ appearing shape man signifieth vnder person father might essence maiestie god therefore father christe true god god promised ye world redeemer long ago one vnitie veritie godhead shalbe found christ christ humbled cause myght lift v vpon high vvhenas come thither diuine maiestie doth shewe foorth self knowen wholy father father knowen wholy summe hee separateth christ diuinitie father doth know yet true god hee doth rather forge himselfe straunge god therefore commaunded know god christ hath sent stretched hand inuiteth v vnto himselfe vvhereas doe thinke vniust thing men doe perish ignoraunce god alone commeth passe thereby consider fountaine life power god alone straungers depriued life come vnto god faith infidelitie doth hold v necessarily death man obiect iust innocent haue iniurie done otherwise bee condemned wee may easily answere right sincere thing men long continue owne nature renued paule testifieth image god knowledge worthie labour gather three pointes togeather kingdome christe bringeth life saluation colloss 3 10 secondly men doe receiue life thence christ office giue life vnto men elect father hath committed tuition thirdly life placed faith christe bestoweth vppon whome hee illuminateth saith gospell whereby gather gifte heauenly wisedome illumination common men proper elect true gospell offered vnto men christe setteth foorth place hidden effectuall manner teaching whereby child god alone drawen vnto faith 4 haue glorified thee hee saith thus cause god made knowen vnto worlde doctrine also myracles glory god wee knowe vvhenas addeth hee hath finished worke inioyned hee meaneth hath fulfilled whole course calling due appointed time wherin receiued heauenly glory hee doth onely speake office teaching doth also cōprehēd part ministery althogh principal part remained yet wit sacrifice death wherwith purge sinnes al men yet houre death present speaketh suffered death alreadie therefore summe hee may sent father possession kingdome asmuch hauing ended course remained nothing el doe saue hee might bring foorth fruite effect thinges power spirite done vpon earth according commaundement father according paule philippian second chapter seuenth verse hee abased himselfe taking himselfe shape seruant therfore hath father exalted hath giuen name c 5 vvith glory thee desireth glorified father would haue father glorifie inwardlye without witnesse tha • beeing receiued heauen hee may gloriously shew foorth greatnesse power euery knee may bowe vnto c place 10 therefore clause father set earthly transitorie glory former member like paule rom sixth chapter tenth verse saith dyed sinne liueth vnto god expresseth blessed immortalitie afterwarde declareth desireth nothing himselfe may appeare flesh creation worlde speake plainely diuine maiestie alwayes may shine person mediatour man flesh hee put excellent place whereby wee taught christe fleshe temporall god glorye eternall hee selfe also alwayes moreouer manifest distinction made heere betweene person person father vvhence wee gather god eternall worde god also eternall begotten father beginning worlde 6 haue declared thy name menne whiche thou gauest mee worlde thine thou gauest mee haue kepte thy woorde 7 nowe haue knowne thinges whiche thou hast giuen mee thee 8 haue giuen wordes thou gauest mee haue receiued haue knowen indeede came foorth thee haue beleeued thou hast sent mee 9 pray pray worlde thou hast giuen thine 10 mine thine thyne mine glorified 11 longer worlde worlde come vnto thee holy father keepe name thou hast giuen mee may one one 6 haue declared thy name christ beginneth pray vnto father disciple commendeth safetie like affection loue wherewith suffer death straightway first reason commendation haue embraced doctrine whiche maketh men child god truly indeede faithfulnesse diligence wanting christ call al men vnto god labour effectual profitable elect preaching commō men declare make manifest name god neither ceased hee • ouch glory amongest obstinate vvhy saith hee declared vnto fewe saue elect alone doe profite taught inwardly spirite gather therefore men doctrine set taught truly effectually whose mind illuminated christ assigneth cause vnto god election putteth difference passing ouer declared name father vnto othersome saue giuen vvhereupon followeth faith floweth secrete predestination god therefore giuen vnto men generall men doe appertaine vnto christ vvhen addeth thine thou gauest eternitie election first noted secondly must consider christ declareth elect alwayes god therefore god distinguisheth reprobate faith merite meere grace whilest farthest estraunged yet accounteth owne hidden counsell certaintie consisteth giueth sonne keepe hath chosen least perishe wee must turne eye vnto may knowe assuredly order child god god predestina •• tion hidden selfe reuealed vnto v christe alone haue kept thy worde third degree first free election second giuing whereby passe ouer christes tuitiō receiued christ gathered faith sheepfolde worde god soone forgotten amongest reprobate taketh roote elect whereby said keepe 7 haue knowen chiefest thing faith expressed whilest wee beleeue christ sort faith stayeth beholding fleshe conceiueth diuine power saith know thing thee thou hast giuen mee meaneth faithfull doe perceiue whiche haue celestiall diuine truly vnlesse lay holde vppon god christ must needes stagger continually 8 haue receiued hee expresseth manner thys knowledge haue receiued doctrine taught least manne shoulde thinke doctrine manne sprange vppe earth professeth god authour thereof hee sayeth woordes thou haste giuen mee haue giuen vnto hee speaketh according custome person mediatour minister hee sayeth hath taught onely hee receiued father muche estate fleshe yet base diuine maiestie lay hidde vnder shape seruaunt doeth rather signifie god vnder person father neuerthelesse must remember iohn testified beginning muche christe eternall woorde god alwayes one god wyth father sense therefore thys christe faithfull witnesse god amongest disciple faith might grounded onely trueth god seeing • father himselfe spake sonne receiuinge whereof speaketh commeth thence declared father name vnto effectually haue knowen deede hee repeateth selfe thinge woordes hadde touched christe came foorth father sent father muche went al th • se thing father hath summe faith must straight way beholde christe yet conceiue earthly contemptible thing hym caryed vpwarde vnto diuine power maye fullye perswaded hath god soeuer god perfectly vve must also note vseth worde knowen former member afterward woord beleeued meanes teacheth v nothing rightly knowen concerning god saue faith great certaintie faith may worthely called knowledge 9 pray christ hath hitherto rehearsed whiche might purchase fauour disciple father nowe hee frameth prayer selfe wherein hee declareth hee asketh nothynge whiche agreeable father hee doeth onelye commende vnto father whome hee loueth hys owne accorde hee sayeth flatly hee prayeth world carefull none owne flocke whiche hath receiued father hande yet may seeme absurde thynge canne better rule prayer inuented wee followe christe guide maister commaunded praye menne againe christe himselfe prayed afterward indifferently menne father pardon knowe doe answeare prayer make yet notwithstanding restrained vnto electe vvee must desire manne euery manne may saued comprehende al mankinde cannot yet distinguish electe reprobate yet neuerthelesse pray kingdome god maye come doe also pray destroy ennemies thys onely difference wee pray saluation menne wee knowe created image god whiche haue nature whiche wee haue wee leaue destruction goddes iudgement whome hee knoweth reprobate another speciall reason prayer recited heere whiche ought bee followed example christe prayeth accordinge bare feelinge faith loue beinge entred secreat place heauen hee setteth eye secreat iudgements father hidden v longe wee walke faith furthermore wee gather wordes god chuseth whome hee thinketh good vnto selfe worlde may bee heyres life difference commeth mennes merites dependeth vppon hys meere good menne whiche place cause election man must beginne wyth faith christe sayeth flatly father whiche giuen hym certaine giuen cause may beleeue faith floweth thys giuinge giuinge bee beginninge faith election doe goe order time remaineth wee confesse chosen freely whome god haue saued worlde nowe seeinge christe prayeth electe alone wee must needes haue faith election wee haue saluation commended father therefore doe great iniurie faithfull whiche goe blotte knowledge election mindes depriue christe voyce consent furthermore peruerse dulnesse menne refuted woordes vnder colour election doe giue themselues vnto flouthfulnesse whereas ought rather sharpen prouoke v desire praye christe teacheth hys owne example 10 mine thine heereunto belongeth former member hee shall surely hearde father commende none sayeth vnto thee saue whome thou acknowledgest thine owne haue nothinge separated thee therefore shall take repulse seconde member hee sheweth hee hathe iust cause care elect owne father thinges spoken confirmation faith vvee must seeke saluation anye else saue onely christe vvee bee content christe vnlesse wee knowe wee possesse god hym therefore wee must knowe holde vnitie whyche betweene father sonne whyche causeth diuision betweene agreeth seconde member hee addeth afterwarde hee glorified disciple followeth meete hee saluation side good signe token confirme faith christ neuer neglect saluation shall glorified v 11 nowe worlde hee sheweth cause whye hee prayeth earnestlye disciple witte shall shortly depriued corporal presence vnder rested hytherto long hee conuersant hee browded vnder winge • henne doth chickine hee departeth prayeth father couer sauegard doth respect prouideth remedie feare may rest vpon god vnto hee deliuereth hand hande gather small comforte hence heare sonne god much carefull safetie whenas leaueth according body must gather thereby respecteth v day also whilest world may prouide misery heauenly glory holy father whole prayer tendeth ende disciple may discouraged estate bee woorse corporall absence master seeing christ gyuen season keeper restoreth againe father hande hauing fulfilled function heereafter may preserued protection power summe whenas disciple depriued beholding fleshe christ suffer losse god receiueth tuition whose power euerlasting hee prescribeth manner preseruing may bee one looke father hath determined saue gathereth holy vnitie faith spirite sufficient men conspire together manner way clause added euen wee vnitie shall happy represent image god father christ waxe doth receiue forme ring wherewith sealed expounde shortly howe father christ one 12 vvhilest world haue kept thy name • thou hast giuen mee haue kept none hath perished sonne perdition scripture might fulfilled 13 come vnto thee thinges speake worlde may haue ioy fulfilled themselues 12 vvhilest worlde christ saith hath kept father name maketh minister hath done nothing saue power god ayd therfore giueth v vnderstand vnlikely perishe power god extinguished departure seemeth absurd thing christ resigneth dutie keepe vnto god cease keeper hauing finished course life vve may readily answere speaketh place visible keeping ende death christe truly long vpon earth neede borrowe power whereby might keepe disciple wholy referred vnto person ye mediator appeared time vnder person seruaunt hee commaundeth disciple lift vp sens straightway heauen whenas shall begin lacke externall ayde vvhereby gather christ doth lesse keepe faithfull day time past another sort diuine maiestie appeareth manifestly vvhom thou hast giuen mee vseth argument againe vnmeete thing father cast away whome sonne kept commaundement euen vntil end ministerie say haue faithfully executed perfourmed enioyned mee thee least thing perish hande nowe seeing thou takest againe thou hadst giuen keepe thy part duetie prouide may remaine safe vvhereas acepteth iudas doth without reason although elect true naturall flocke god yet dignitie office beare shew neither would man haue thought otherwise long stood excellent order therefore concerning grammer vnproper exception weigh matter requisite christe shoulde speake thus according common meaning men least man thinke eternall election god whit weakened destruction ruine iudas hee added also sonne perdition whiche wordes giueth v vnderstand god knew long agoe fall happened sodainly sight men hebrewes doe call sonne perdition lost man giuen ouer destruction scripture might bee fulfilled referred vnto next sentence iudas fell away scripture might fulfilled man shall falsly gather thence falling away iudas rather bee imputed god himselfe necessarily enforced doe reason prophesie euent thyngs must bee ascribed vnto prophesies therefore foretolde therein doubtlesse prophetes denounce nothing el come passe though held peace therfore must set cause thinges thence confesse nothing commeth passe ordeined god question concerning scripture whether foretelling prophesies doe lay necessitie vpon men haue already shewed false christe intendeth lay cause iudas destruction vpon scripture meant take away matter offence might haue shaken many weake soules meanes whereby taketh away spirite god hath testified time past come passe almost afraid see heare new thinges come sodainly verie profitable admonition reacheth farre commeth passe day men faint reason offence saue onely remember testimony scripture wherewith god hath well armed whilest hath time foretold euils soeuer see 13 thingsspeake worlde chirst sheweth praied disciple earnestly doubt careful sory state come rather might remedie carefulnesse heauinesse vve knowe howe greatly mindes bent vnto externall helpes wee espie offer themselues wee catch greedily doe suffer selues bee pluckt away easilie therefore christe prayeth vnto father presence disciple needeth say thing may take doubting speake saith hee worlde heare mee heartes may quiet safetie alreadie safegarde seeing christ put hand god calleth ioy disciple conceiue haue briefly whereof authour cause pledge nothing feare vnquietnesse v haue peace quietnesse christ alone 14 haue giuen thy worde world hath hated worlde world 15 doe aske thou shouldest take worlde thou shuldest keepe euill 16 world world 17 sanctifie thy truth thy worde truth 18 thou hast sense mee worlde haue also sent worlde 19 sanctifie selfe also may bee sanctified truth 14 haue giuen thy worde hee commendeth disciple father another cause haue neede helpe worlde hateth hee doth also set downe cause hatred haue embraced worde god worlde cannot away hee shoulde say thy part defend hated world thy wordes sake vve must remember harde lately ende prayer christ ioy may fulfilled v therefore often furie worlde kindled v sort seeme bee farre destruction let v straightway learne hold vp buckler god neuer forsake labour gospell hee saith disciple worlde separated worlde whomsoeuer regenerateth spirite therefore god wil suffer sheepe wander amongst wolues sheweth himselfe pastour 15 doe aske thou shouldest take worlde teacheth wherein safetie godly consisteth beeing exempted trouble shoulde liue ease daintily may remayne safe middest daungers god helpe neither doth tell father expedient hee doth rather prouide infirmitie may temper petitiōs part passe boundes way meanes prescribeth summe doth promise disciple father grace yt may set thē free care labour promiseth grace may minister vnto inuincible strength enemy may suffer thē ouerwhelmed huge heape combates shall suffer therefore wee couet preserued according rule whiche christe hath deliuered wee must wishe free euilles neither must pray god translate v blessed rest let v bee content certaine sure hope victorie let v meane season resist euilles valiauntly whiche wee may escape christ hath prayed vnto father summe christ taketh wold haue soft slouthfull yet notwithstanding deliuereth euill may ouerwhelmed haue striue hee suffer wounded death 16 worlde likeas hee repeateth againe whole worlde hateth end heauenly father may beningly help doth also declare hatred procedeth offence fault world hateth god christ 17 sanctifie thy truth sanctification comprehendeth kingdome god righteousnesse thereof wit god doth renue v spirite confirmeth prosecuteth vnto ende grace renouation therefore requesteth first father woulde sanctifie disciple woulde addict wholy vnto himselfe challenge holy flocke secondly hee assigneth meanes manner sanctification without cause brainsick men doe babble many thing foolishly concerning sanctification yet passe ouer god truth wherby consecrateth v vnto himselfe mē ful foolish trifle cōcerning truth doe meane season neglect woorde christe saith plainely truth el saue worde truth god doth sanctifie child woorde taken gospell whiche apostle alreadie hearde proceede▪ mouth master shortly preach vnto others sense paule teacheth ephe 5 2 6 churche made cleane fountaine water worde life god alone sanctifieth gospell power vnto saluation euery one beleeueth rom 1 16 whosoeuer hee bee departeth meane hee must needes waxe vile truth taken place excellencie light heauenly wisedome wherein god reuealeth himselfe vnto v hee may conforme v make v like owne image externall preaching worde doth selfe reprobate wickedly profane let v remember tha • christe speaketh electe whome spirite doth regenerate effectually woorde seeing apostle altogether voide grace wee must gather christ wordes sanctification finished v first day wee goe forwarde whole life vntill god doe fulfill v righteousnesse haue put flesh 18 thou hast sent mee confirmeth prayer another argument wit apostle haue one calling saith doe put vppon person thy commandement haue borne hytherto therefore must needes bee furnished thy spirite may bee able beare great burthen 19 sake doe sanctifie selfe doth plainely declare wordes fountaine sanctification doeth flowe wrought v doctrine gospell wit hee hath consecrated dedicated himselfe vnto father holinesse might come vnto v blessing spread abroad first fruites vnto al fruite spirit god sprinkleth v christe holinesse maketh v partaker thereof imputation meanes said bee made vnto v righteousnesse 1 cor 1 13 also saide bee made vnto v sanctification hath offered v vnto father sort owne person wee may bee renued spirite true holinesse furthermore although sanctification doe appertaine vnto whole life christ yet made apparant sacrifice death hee appeared y• true priest consecrate temple altar vessel people power spirite 20 pray shall beleeue mee theyr worde 21 may one thou father thee may one also v worlde may beleeue thou hast sent 22 haue comprehendeth disciple hytherto wit vnto disciple gospell vnto ende worlde certainely notable matter hope wee beleeue christ doctrine gospell wee neede doubt wee alreadie gathered apostle faithfull custodie least v doe perish prayer christ quiet hauen wherein whosoeuer arriueth free danger shipwracke muche christ sworne solemne wordes careth greatly safetie beginneth apostle safetie wherof certaine might make v also certain selues shalbe safe therefore often satan assaulteth v let v learne holde vp buckler wee vaine ioyned vnto apostle holy mouth sonne god safetie v might included bundle therefore nothing ought vehemently pricke v forwarde embrace gospell vncomparable good thing v offered god hand christ may bee preserued destruction ought worthily preferre loue care thereof thinges slouthfulnesse worlde point wonderfull men desirous bee safe christ deliuereth sure certaine way meanes obtayne whiche man turne aside remaineth good hope yet scarse one amongst hundreth doth vouchsafe receiue offered gently vvee must note manner speech christ prayeth shoulde beleeue wordes teacheth wee haue sometimes said faith must looke vnto member whiche foloweth next worde doth well expresse force nature faith doth also confirme v familiarly know faith grounded gospel deliuered apostle therfore howsoeuer worlde condemne v thousand time let one thing suffice v christ acknowledgeth v owne commendeth v vnto father woe papist whose faith wandereth farre rule ashamed spue execrable blasphemie nothing conteined scripture whiche doubtfull may bee wrested hither thyther therefore tradition church teacheth beleeue let v remember sonne god iudge doth allow faith alone conceiued doctrine apostle furthermore sure testimonie thereof shalbe founde el saue writing vve must also note phrase shal beleeue worde signifieth faith commeth hearing instrument wherewith god draweth v vnto faith externall preaching men vvherefore god properly authour faith men themselues minister wee beleeue paule also teacheth cor 3 5 21 may one c placeth ende drift felicity againe vnitie good cause destructiō mankinde estraunged god also lame scattered abroad selfe therfore contrary restoring therof grow together one body aright like paule placeth perfection church ephe 4 3 faithfull agree together amongst themselues one spirit saith apostle prophetes euangelists pastours giuen cause place effectuall woorking measure euery member encreaseth selfe vnto edifiyng therfore often christe speaketh vnitie let v remember horrible filthie scattering abroad world without secondly let v know interprete thus precisely christ one father eternal god contention arrians enforced wreste shorte sentenses straung sense christ intended far thing carry v vp vnto bare beholding hidden diuinitie reasoneth end ought therfore one otherwise vnitie hath father shuld vaine vnfruitful therfore end may rightly comprehend intente effecte christ father one take heede stripe christ person mediatour consider rather head church ioyne member texte shall stand best least vnitie sonne father vaine vnprofitable power must spread abroad throughout whol boby godly vvhence also gather one christ powreth substaunce v hee maketh v partaker power spirit life whatsoeuer good thing hath receiued father world may beleeue doe interprete word world elect dispearsed world taken throughout whole chapter reprobate rather contrary opiniō moreouer immediately separateth word wherof maketh mention al euangelist put word beleeue vnproperly know acknowledge wit whilest vnfaithfull beeing conuinced dwelleth sendeth forth beames heauenly righteousnes holynes god dooth make knowne vnto v daily infinite meanes besides fatherly hee loueth v marke adoption farre exceedeth rest good right addeth furthermore thou hast loued thou hast loued woordes meant note cause beginning loue aduerbe likenes must resolued coniunction causal shoulde haue saide thou hast loued christ alone vnto whō title beloued belongeth heauenly father loueth al member also loue wherwith hath loued head church loueth none christ although aryseth shew contrarietie christe saieth haue seene else infinite loue god toward worlde cause gaue onely begotten sonne 3 16 cause must go effect gather menne beloued god father without christ ordained redeemer answere mercy wherewith god moued toward vnworthy yea enemy reconciled thē vnto called place loue truly goodnes god woonderfull vnable comprehended man wit bearing good wil fauourable vnto men could hate hee tooke away cause hatred least thing hinder loue purged therefore iustified fayth properly god wee begin beloued length child father loue wherby came passe christ ordained wee shoulde bee chosen freely yet vnborne notwithstanding already lost adam hidden god breast doth far exceede capacity man minde man shal euer finde god fauourable saue shall lay hold vppon pacified christ like christe taken away al taste god loue dooth vanish away wee may fully assure selues soone engrafted bodye wee neede feare least fall god loue doubtlesse foundation cannot ouerthrown loued father hath loued 24 father thou hast giuen may see glory thou hast giuen creation world 25 iust father worlde hath knowen thee haue knowen thee haue knowen thou hast sent 26 haue declared thy name vnto declare loue wherewith thou hast loued may 24 vvill put steade desire speache speache one commaundeth desireth yet may haue dowble meaning either would haue disciple enioy hys externall presence god would bring length kingdome heauen whether goeth expound woordes see glorye enioye made partaker glory christ hath perceiue experiment faith christ howe great maiestie mine owne part hauing well weighed thinges thinke christe speaketh perfecte blessednesse godly hee shoulde saye hys request satisfied receiued heauen effecte doe referre seeing glory sawe glory christe small glimmering light doeth come thoroughe chinkes vnto man shut vppe darkenesse nowe christe desireth may goe farre forwarde maye enioy perfecte brightnesse openly heauen summe desireth father woulde leade foorth continuall proceeding vnto perfecte beholding glory thou hast loued dooth also farre better agree person mediatour bare diuinitie christ hard thing god loued wisdome text leadeth v vnto thing howsoeuer receiue doubted christ desired disciple might ioined might see glory kingdome spake hee head church saieth loue father cause vvherfore followeth loued inasmuch ordained redeemer world vvith loue father loue creation world might haue wherein might loue elect 25 iust father compareth disciple world hee may thereby amplifie commendation fauour father must good right excellent onely know god whole world reiecteth christ commēdeth good right singular affection vnbeliefe worlde hindered frō knowing god calling father iust hee derideth worlde wickednes therof shuld say howsoeuer world doth proudly contemne god refuse yet nothing taken frō done vnto honour iustice shal continue whole sound himselfe word teacheth v fayth godly must grounded god doe neuer faint although whole world fall like day must condemne papistry iniustice may defend god praise preserue himselfe christ saith absolutely disciple knewe god putteth two degree himselfe knew father disciple knew sent father addeth immediately declared vnto father name commendeth haue said knowledge god separateth rest world meane season wee must note order faith described place son came bosome father doth onelye know properlye therefore desire come vnto god must needes receiue christ comming meete addict themselues vnto hee shall length lift vp disciple vnto god father hee known himselfe 26 haue declared wil declare christ indeede execute office teacher yet vsed hidden reuelation spirit onely sound voice make father manyfest meaninge therefore taught apostle effectually fayth yet weake promyseth vnto greater proceedinges profit better time come prepareth hope greater grace spirit although speaketh apostle may gather common exhortation thence wee study go forward dayly think wee haue runne wel haue yet far go long compassed aboute flesh loue c thou maist loue loue wherewith thou hast loued may spread selfe abroade euen vnto loue wherewith god loueth v speake properlye loue saue wherewith hath loued sonne beeginning might make v also acceptable amiable vnto certeinly haue sayd litle hated god touching selues without christ beginneth loue v thē grow body well beloued sonne vnestimable priueledge fayth know father loued christ sake might may partaker loue continuallye must note particle whereby wee taught otherwise comprehend loue whereof speaketh vnlesse christ dwel v father cannot behold sonne hath body together wee wyll haue beeholde v must member indeede chap 18 1 vvhen iesus spoken thinges went disciple ouer brock cedron garden whereinto entred disciple 2 iudas knew place also betrayed iesus came thither often disciple 3 therefore iudas receiued band minister priest pharises came thither lanternes lightes weapon 4 seeing iesus knew thinges soeuer come vpon hee went said vnto seeke yee 5 answered iesus nazareth iesus said vnto iudas betrayed stoode 6 therefore soone sayde vnto went backward fell ground 1 vvhen iesus spoken thinges hystory iohn omitteth many thinges read three euangelistes doth good aduisement like determined gather many thinges worthy remembred conceale therefore let reader borrow thinges euangelistes wantinge heere ouer brooke cedron greeke article added brook name cedar like crept errour mention made oftentimes valleye brooke kidr • n scripture place called reason darknes beecause valley hollow therefore darke although doe contend matter bring onely whiche like true wee must especially note euangelists purpose shewing place meant shew christ went forth willingly vnto death hee cometh place knew iudas knew familiarly saue may willingly offer vnto traitor enemy neither vnaduisednesse rashnesse deceiue seeing knew al thing hand iohn addeth afterward went mete therefore died constrained owne accord might volūtary sacrifice without obedience sinnes ben purged furthermore entreth garden may hide himselfe might haue freer space pray desired thrice deliuered death contrary willing obedience whereof haue spoken meete wrastle difficulty daungers might length get victorie hauing subdued horrour death maketh haste vnto death freely ioyfully 3 therefore iudas iudas commeth furnished souldiours great garde signe euill conscience feareth alwayes cause certaine receiued band menne president pleasure sent also tribune captaine thousand footemen garrison soldiours alwaies citie feare sodaine tumultes president himselfe alwayes carie companie soldiours wayted vppon whether soeuer went rest seruaunts priestes iohn nameth pharisies apart whose madnesse hotte cared religion 4 seeing iesus kn • euangelist setteth downe plainely willingly christ went vnto death yet doth also shew great power breathed one voyce woorde ende may knowe wicked could doe suffered hee answeareth courteously man whome seeke yet throweth downe ground violent whirlewinde yea thunderbolte therefore hee wanted power stay restraine hand thought good woulde obey father whose decree knewe called die hence gather horrible fearful christ voice shalbe wicked shal sitte vppon iudgement seate iudge world stode lambe ready offred vp sacrifice depriued maiestie loke throweth enemy sodaine one word armed fre feare word accuse doth answer hee vvhat shall befall hee shall come bee iudged men iudge quicke dead base simple apparell heauenly glory angelles meant shew token force efficacy isaias 11 4 giueth voyce prophet reckeneth amongst power vertues christ shall strike earth rodde hys mouth shal flea wicked breath lip paul suspendeth deferreth fulfilling prophesie vntill ende 2 thes 2 8 yet see wicked fall daily fury pride voyce christ seeing fell ground came binde christe visible token signe shewed feare wicked doe feele inwardly whether wil christ speaketh minister seeing thing accidentall voyce christ whose propertie lift vppe miserable men laide death shall doubtlesse shew foorth force towarde v may lift v vp euen vnto heauen 7 therefore asketh againe whome seeke yee saide iesus nazato beereth 8 iesus answered said sayd vnto therefore ye seeke let depart 9 word might fulfilled spoken thou hast giuen one haue lost 7 therefore asked againe heereby appeareth force blindnes hath wherewith god striketh mindes wicked horrible amasednes sathan hath bewitched iust iudgement god ox ass doe fall touched feeling menne hauing tried diuine power christ manifestly doe goe forward lesse carelesly hadde seene much shadowe man yea iudas himselfe yet moued therefore let v learne feare god iudgement wherby reprobate deliuered handes sathan made astonied bruite beastes doubtlesse sathan carried headlong furious force vnto carelesse boldnes phrensines canne throwe downe man headlong violently blindnes wicked run headlong god cast reprobate sense deale onely flye feele power indeede may bended wil sooner broken hundred time wil yeelde finallye wickednes vnto vaile hindereth beholding looking vnto light god obstinacy doth make harder stone least shuld time suffer themselues bee tamed 8 told see sonne god dooth die willingly may blot transgression obedience also fulfilleth office good shepheard toward stocke defending hee seeth inuasion wolues hee waiteth ne staieth vntil come sheepe whose keeper hee made setteth time vvherfore let v doubt often either wicked men deuils doe inuade shal haue aide present v meane season christe prescribed rule pastours owne example must follow wil fulfill office aright 9 haue lost sentence seemeth brought season appertaineth rather vnto soules vnto body christ preserue keepe apostle safe sound euen vntill last end eternal saluation might alwaies safetie amongst continual daungers middest death aunswere euangeliste speaketh simplye corporall death rather meaning christ sparing time prouide eternal saluation let v consider weak yet think would haue doone beene examined tried quick therefore forasmuch christe would haue tempted tried aboue strength whiche hee giuen deliuered eternal destruction hence may gather general doctrine although tried faith many temptation yet shal neuer come extreame daunger hee wil giue v strength also ouercome truely see hee beareth infirmitie oftentimes beareth backe driueth away many endeuours practises wicked encountering thē seeth feeble ripe enough yet finally neuer bringeth forth vnto battel vntyll well furnished appoynted euen perishing may perish beecause gaine prepared aswell death lyfe 10 simon peter hauing sword drew smote hie priest seruaunt cut right eare name malchus 11 therfore iesus saith vnto peter put vp thy sword sheath wilt thou drinke cup father hath giuen 12 band captaine minister iewes tooke iesus bound 13 led away vnto anna first father law cayphas whiche high priest yeers 14 caipha • giuen counsell iewes expedient • one man die people 10 therefore simon peter euangelist describeth peter foolish zeale went defend maister otherwise lawful doe hee taketh vpon ventureth great daunger christes sake couragiously valiauntly hee respecteth calling requireth god suffereth fact deserueth small praise christe reprehendeth sharplye let v know condemned persō peter men dare assay owne head vvhich doctrine especially bee noted nothing common vnder colour zeale defend whatsoeuer doe skilled whether god doe allow men think right whose whole wisdom meere vanitie see corruption peter zeal yet ought cō tēted one thing christ pronoūceth doth please wee se • wanted good haue christ called backe death haue suffered eternal shame reproach layeth violent handes vpon captaine soldiours rageth respect like robber murtherer resisteth power ordayned god seeing christ ouermuch hated world one facte might haue beene colour al slander false report wherewith enemy burthened falsely secondly preposterous proue declare faith sword cannot tongue vvhen called confesse denieth without maisters commaundement rageth maketh much vvherefore seeing wee admonished notable example let v learne moderate zeale wantonnes flesh itcheth alwayes bold god commaundeth let v knowe zeale shal haue bad successe long wee dare go beyond woorde god may sometimes may like beginninges well shal punished length rashnes therefore let obedience foundation thing take hand vve taught furthermore determine defende christes cause doe alwayes walke vprightly vice wherefore muste much diligently praye vnto lord hee gouerne v action spirite wysdome 11 put vp thy sword commaundement christ disaloweth peter fact must note reason lawfull priuate man resist furnished publike authoritie may gather three set christes generall sentence shal smite sword shal perish sword therefore must beware go aboute violence weapon resist enemy yea prouok v vniustly saue far forth lawes publike autority doe permit v whosoeuer doth passe bound calling althogh whole world commend yet shal facte neuer approoued god cup hath giuen seemeeth special reason mete christ shuld dumb might led like lambe slaine yet taken example patience required al hand scripture compareth affliction vnto potion good man house doeth distribute deuide meat drinke amongst child householde god hath power ouer v handle euery man seemeth best whether make v mery prosperity humble v aduersity sayde giue v sweete bitter drinke drinke potion ordained christe hee shoulde suffer death vppon crosse reconciliation world therefore sayeth must drinke cuppe father hath measured reached like sort must prepared suffer yet brainsicke men hearde deny ought seeke remedy disease euils whatsoeuer least refuse cuppe god reacheth vnto v know must die meete ready die know time death lord suffreth v preserue life helpes hath ordained vve must suffer disease sicknesse patiently howe grieuous soeuer flesh yet long euident deadly may seeke ease remedy must beware assay nothing saue lawful woord god finally doe alwaies remaine surely fixed heart lord may done cease drinke cuppe giueth seeking deliuered euilles misery wherewith pressed downe 12 bande captaine may seeme absurde thing christ threwe soldiours downe grounde wyth voyce doeth nowe suffer himselfe taken meant submit himselfe vnto enemy length neede woorke myracle shewing diuine power double commodity serueth remooue stumbling blocke least thinke christ yeelde ouercome infirmitie secondly proueth willing suffer death therefore defended hys power aduersaries farre foorth profitable obey father refrained himselfe might sacrifice let v remember body sonne god bounde soules might loosed snare sathan sinne 13 brought vnto anna euangelists passe ouer doeth much belong vnto summe hystorie nothing woorthy remembered done peraduenture commodiousnesse place mooued put christ anna house vntill chiefe priest could call councell high priest yeare meaneth high priesthoode yearely office many haue thought falsly caiphas high priest time whiche appeareth plainely iosephus continuall honour according prescript lawe neither ended saue onely death ambition ciuill discorde caused presidēts rome hauing put one priest chuse another pleasure excell mony fauour vitellius threw downe caiphas ionathas sonne anna succeeded 14 vvhich giuen counsel euangelist repeateth caiphas sentence 11 50 god vsed vncleane mouthe vnfaithfull wicked high priest publish prophesie like hee directed tongue balaam contrary desire hee compelled blesse people desired cursse king balacke sake num 24 5 15 simon peter disciple followed iesus high prieste knewe disciple therefore entred high priest hall iesus 16 peter stoode without doore therefore disciple went forth whome high priest knewe spake porter brought peter 17 therefore damsell kept doore sayde art thou also one man disciple sayeth 18 minister seruaunts stoode made fire coales colde warmed themselues 19 simon peter stoode also among warmed himselfe 15 disciple deceiued wyth light coniecture thought disciple iohn witte hee vseth conceale hys owne name speaketh came iohn simple fisher manne acquainted familiarly wyth proude high priest howe coulde bee hee shoulde frequent house highe prieste seeinge hee alwayes accompanye christe likely none twelue hee called disciple hee embraced doctrine sonne god iohn curious disposinge hystorye hee thinketh sufficient gather briefe summe hee hathe shewed peter hadde denied christe hee intermingleth certaine thinges afterwarde hee retourneth vnto two denial heereby came passe reader lesse attentiue gather first deniall house anna wordes doe signifie suche thyng doe rather clearely expresse highe priestes maide enforced peter deny christe therefore must vnderstande christe broughte vnto high priest came lette disciple whyche knowen gette peter lette hys sake nowe neede doubte bothe followed iesus beinge mooued wyth godlye zeale seeinge christe hymselfe hadde testified hee spared peter hadde beene farre better haue mourned prayed bye corner come abroade sight men seeing weake doeth nowe greedily vsurpe duety iesus hadde remitted vnto hee fainteth confession faith wherein hee oughte haue stoode euen vntill ende therefore must alwayes marke lorde requireth handes least weake take vppon doe thing necessary 17 therefore mayde sayde peter brought high priestes hall hee payed deare hys comming hee enforced denye christe entraunce seeing hee stumbleth filthily firste vanitie boastinge discouered hee hadde made boaste hee woulde bee inuincible champion able ouercome deathe beinge nowe throwen downe voyce one seelye maide threatninge voyce hee throweth away hys weapon yeeldeth beholde token patterne mannes strength vvhat strength soeuer appeareth menne smoake whiche driuen away wyth one blast vvithout battaile wee couragious becommeth v experience sheweth howe foolishly wee proude nothinge yea sathan vseth engine wee selues faine selues vaine terrours whiche trouble v time peter afraide voyce seely woman wee wee oftentimes terrified noyse leafe falleth tree vaine shewe daunger strike peter farre wee ledde away christe daily childish toyes finallye suche strengthe falleth downe flatte wythout ennemie god doeth punishe mannes arrogancie while hee bringeth downe loftie courage menne manne beinge filled wyth power winde onely doeth promise vnto selfe hee shall easily conquer whole worlde yet seeth shadowe thistle hee afraide therefore lette v learne stronge else lorde thy • seemeth bee flatte deniall christe yet peter afraide confesse hee one hys disciple much hee shoulde deny hadde thing doe vvhich must note least manne shoulde thinke slide away dealing sophistically whereas hee doeth depart onely away confession faith 18 simon peter standing euangeliste sayeth peter stoode wyth minister seruaunts fire serueth make hystorie hange togither wee shall see afterward heereby appeareth howe great amasednesse peter carelesly warme himselfe amongest wicked menne seeing hadde denied maister althoughe may hee kept backe wyth feare least went high priestes house shoulde encurre like daunger againe 19 therefore high priest asked iesus disciple doctrine 20 iesus answeared haue spoken openly worlde haue alwayes taught synagogue temple whither iewes come togither secreat haue sayd nothing 21 vvhy doest thou aske mee aske haue hearde haue spoken vnto beholde men knowe thing haue spoken 22 vvhen spoken thing one minister stoode gaue hym blowe cheeke saying answearest thou high priest 23 iesus sayeth vnto haue euill spoken beare witnesse euill well 〈◊〉 thou 24 anna sent bound vnto caiphas hie priest 19 asked iesus hie priest asketh christe beene seditious fellowe deuided churche gatheringe himselfe disciple hee asketh false prophet gone corrupte puritie faith newe peruerse opinion christe hauing executed office teacher taketh hande new defence yet least forsake defending truth sheweth ready defende thing taught neuerthelesse reprooueth impudencie high priest enquireth matter moste manifestly knowen beene doutfull inoughe deny redeemer offered vnto togither promised saluation vnlesse doe also condemne whole exposition lawe 20 haue spoken openly childish errour men thinke men condemned answeare christ handle woord god priuily chamber may doe openly reason tyrannie wicked christe disputeth lawfull vnlawful intent purpose refute impudent wickednesse caiphas notwithstanding place seemeth contrary sentence christe biddeth apostle preach vpon house told care mat 10 27 againe pronounceth granted men heare mystery kingdome god mat 13 11 therefore vouchsafe make twelue partaker grace answeare sayeth spoken thing secreate referred vnto substance whiche alwaies one althoughe vsed diuers forme teaching hee neither speake otherwise amongst disciple might teache thinge neither craftily woulde sette purpose conceale thing people spake priuately fewe vvherfore might good conscience testifie hee freely professed sincerely published summe hys doctrine 22 vvhen spoken thing added cause first may know great furie tyrannicall empire christes enemy secondly discipline vsed amongst priest sitte like iudges neuerthelesse rage like cruell beastes councell gathered togither wherein ought haue beene great grauitie vsed one officer taketh himselfe muche libertie matter handled presence iudges smiteth partie arraigned found guilty nothing vvherfore maruell christes doctrine condemned barbarous session onely equitie banished also humanitie shame 23 haue euill spoken haue offended accuse haue answeared selfe may punished according offence lawfull kinde dealing meete farre order maner modestie vsed iudgements therefore christe complaineth hee great iniurie done hee haue offended hath offended yet deale lawfully violently christe seemeth place obserue commaunded doe else mathewe 5 39 turned right cheeke vnto hadde smitten vppon left answer alwayes required christian patience hee beaten shoulde putte vppe iniurie wythout making doe first suffer contented minde secondly thinking reuenge endeuour rather ouercome euill wyth good spirite sathan enforceth wicked already doe harme meete although man prouoke therefore expounde wordes christ absurdly wrest vnto parte hee commanded pricke forward men newe prickes desirous doe harme onely meaninge euery one v ought rather ready suffer seconde iniurie recompence repaye first vvherefore • cause christian man vniustly hurt may complaine yet minde free wrathe handes cleane reuenge 24 anna sent sentence red perynthesis hee hadde sayde christe brought vnto anna hys house hadde prosecuted narration councell meeting priestes beene holden sayeth nowe caryed vnto high priestes house tence verbe deceiued many rather put preterpluperfectence sent 25 simon peter stoode warmed himselfe therefore sayde vnto art thou also one disciple denied sayd 26 one seruaunts high priest cosen whose eare peter cut sayeth see thee garden 27 therefore peter denied againe immediatly cocke crewe 25 hee denied thys horrible blockishnesse peter touched wyth repentaunce hee hathe denied hys maister hee hardneth hymselfe wyth libertie sin euery man hadde asked one another hee woulde haue beene afrayed denie thousande time behold whether sathan throweth miserable men headlonge hee hath throwen downe constancie minde vvee must also note circumstance euangelistes doe expresse witte vsing cursing hee testifie hee knewe christe doeth befal many daily first fall shall greate afterwarde shall accustome selues offende conscience shall brought sleepe length hath accustomed himselfe contemne god shall thinke nothinge vnlawfull hee shall venture euen vppon vtmost thinges vvherefore nothinge better man take heed himselfe time hee tempted sathan doe beare himselfe euen least poynte whilest hee sounde yet 27 immediately cocke crewe euangeliste maketh mention crowing cocke ende may knowe peter admonished god instant therefore euangelistes say remembred lordes wordes although luke doeth declare mooued crowing cocke onely vntill christe behelde soeuer begun fal motion perswasion sathan shalbe reclaimed voyce signe admonition vntil lord himselfe doe beholde 28 therefore bringe iesus caiphas common hall themselues entered common hal might defiled might eate passeouer 29 therefore pilate went vnto sayde vvhat accusation doe yee bringe man 30 answeared sayde vnto euill door wee woulde haue deliuered vnto thee 31 therefore pilate sayde vnto take yee iudge accordinge owne lawe therefore iewes sayde vnto lawfull v put manne death 32 woorde iesus might fulfilled spoken signifying death die 28 therefore brought iesus examination whereof euangelist speaketh day neuerthelesse doubted fannes euery citie wherwith sette people fire furie people enflamed suche sodaine one consent desire haue christ put death priestes examine power giue iudgement might deliuer iudge oppressed preiudice already knowen inough romanes call well president house iudgement seate iudgement giuen pretorium common hall might defiled religion approoued abstaine pollution pure accordinge prescript lawe may eate lordes passeouer two fault grosse first thinke pollution wythin coulde catche goinge place howe prophane soeuer secondly ouer precise small matter neglecte chiefest whiche polluted vncleane sayeth paule epistle titus first chapter fifteene verse nothinge cleane mindes vncleane hypocrite beinge full malice ambition deceite crueltie couetousnesse almoste infecte bothe heauen earth wyth stinke onely afrayde externall pollution therefore mockage vntollerable goe aboute please god bee polluted wyth touchinge anye vncleane thyng forgetting true puritie vice hypocrisie omitteth carelesly chiefest thinges whilest obserueth ceremony carefully god commaunde iewes obserue rite whyche contained lawe end saue onely mighte accustome themselues loue desire true holinesse moreouer neuer forbidden lawe enter mannes house gentile caueat giuen father least manne shoulde take drawe contagion infection vncleane house vnawares good interpreaters lawe whiche circumspecte straininge gnatte doe stoutly deuoure camell ordinary thinge amongest hypocrite thinke greater wickednesse kill flye manne vvhereunto othervice allyed preferre mennes tradition commaundementes god therefore keepe themselues cleane may rightly eate passeouer include vncleannesse wythin walles common hall neuerthelesse afrayed desire c • aue haue innocent putte death presence heauen earthe furthermore keepe passeouer wyth fained falle reuerence doe onely violate true passeouer sartilegious handes endeuour also ouerwhelme couer eternall destruction much lieth 26 therefore pilate went vnto thys prophane man doeth beare willinglye wyth superstition whyche hee derideth contemneth hee doeth duetye good iudge euen verye issue matter hee biddeth vtter haue accusation priestes hadde hadde authoritye enoughe condemne whome accuse make answeare hee must stande preiudice complaine pilate waye trusteth honestie vvhy say art thou perswaded thine owne accorde hee woorthy death whome wee persecute beholde howe wicked whome god hathe lifted vppe vnto great honour beinge blinded wyth owne glorye renowme doe graunt themselues libertie doe soeuer beholde likewise howe drunken madde pride haue christe bee accounted euill doer doe accuse hym come matter euill dedes hys shall finde saue onely hee healed sicke folkes sortes hee draue deuilles menne hee sette foote agayne hadde palsie lame hee restored sighte blinde hearinge deafe life deade matter went thus truthe themselues euidentlye conuicted sayde euen nowe hardest matter canne bee menne whyche drunken wyth pride awaked may iudge sounde setteled minde 31 accordinge lawe vvee may surelye thinke pilate offended wyth rudenesse violence vpbraideth vnto forme condemning vrged contrary common lawe gentile mannes reason neuerthelesse hee toucheth also boasted hadde lawe giuen god hee sayeth tauntingly take hym neyther woulde haue suffered haue condemned die muche hee shoulde haue sayde hadde power authoritie handes hee shoulde quickely bee punished putte death hys cause knowen thys equitie lawe condemne manne faulte offence whilest wicked doe falsely pretende name god cause holy doctrine slandered enemy world doth greedily catch occasion speake euill lawfull v deceiued thinke iewes doe refuse pilate offer rather knewe hee spake thus vnto mockage take obiecte thou wouldest permit therefore sithens thou art iudge doe thy duetie 32 woorde iesus c euangeliste addeth length conuenient shoulde might bee fulfilled whiche christe hadde foretolde sonne manne shall bee deliuered handes gentile mathewe twentieth chapiter nineteenth verse truely thys principall poynte wee couette reade hystorie deathe christe profite thereby wee looke vnto eternall councell god sonne god arraigned brought throne iudgement seat mortall manne wee thinke done mannes pleasure doe lifte vppe eye vnto god faith must needes bee made ashamed confounded wee know guyltinesse abolished god guiltinesse christe pleased heauenly father thus reconcile mankinde vnto himselfe lifted vppe high cogitation onely boast triumphe without feare shame christes ignominie reproche therfore let v learne euery part hystorie turne eye toward god authour redemption 33 therefore pilate entred againe iudgement hall called iesus sayd vnto art thou king iewes 34 iesus answeared sayest thou thyselfe haue others tolde thee mee 35 pilate answeared iewe thine owne nation high priestes haue deliuered thee hast thou done 36 iesus answeared kingdome worlde kingdome worlde verely minister woulde striue might deliuered iewes nowe kingdome hence 33 therefore hee entred bee thoughte passed manye speaches betweene whiche euangeliste concealeth whiche wee may also easily gather rest euangelist oures standeth principallye vppon one poynte pilate enquired diligentlye whether christe broughte iudgement seat iustlye vniustly coulde nothinge bee done presence people wythoute great doe therefore hee went iudgement hall truely intent acquite christ christ himselfe offereth himselfe condemned hee maye obey father cause hee maketh litle aunswere seeing fauourable iudge one woulde haue giuen eare vnto willingly harde matter pleade owne cause remembreth end came world whither called father therfore holdeth peace willingly may escape death art thou king iewes pilat would neuer haue moued question concerning kingdome vnlesse iewes burdened christ crime pilate taketh odious end hauing ended hee maye acquite partie accused aunswere christe maketh tendeth ende colour accusation containeth refutation made way hee say crime laid charge ridiculously whereof cannot least suspition pilate seemeth haue taken grieuously christe demaunded suspected therefore hee vpbraydeth vnto disdainfully euill soeuer commeth owne nation saieth sit iudge straungers thine owne countreymenne accuse thee therefore cause thou shouldest inwrappe discorde ye might liue quietly romanes yee selues vnto selues cause trouble part wherof enforced suffer 36 kingdome confesseth wordes king yet putteth away purgeth slaunderous reporte muche sufficient proue innocencie denieth disagreement betweene kingdome politike order shuld say falsely accused assayed trouble alter somewhat publike estate haue preached concerning kingdome god spirituall therefore cause ye shoulde suspecte vsurper one desireth attaine kingdome ambition vnlawfull meanes christe vsed defence 〈…〉 pilate doctrine profitable godly 〈◊〉 ende worlde christe kingdome earthlye shuld vnstable subiect falling fashion world passeth nowe called heauenly dooth also defend auouch perpetuitie continuaunce thereof fall whole compasse earth weakened subuerted conscience shal cōtinue neuerthelesse stable take heede vnto christ kingdome onely amongst mouinges shakinges also amidst horrible ruines destruction bee tyrannously vexed wicked yet saluation safetie persisteth whole sound vnto v kingdome christ subiect wil men finally sithence ye world rageth cōtinually continuall stormes kingdome christ separated thence wherein must seeke quietnes peace furthermore taught sorte nature kingdome didde make v happy according fleshe bring v ritches pleasure whatsoeuer wished v present life smel earth world miserable soeuer estate looke yet perfect felicitie remayneth safe v vve doe also learne heere appertaine vnto kingdome namely renewed spirite god doe meditate vppon heauenlye life holynesse righteousnesse although must also note denied kingdome christ worlde know hath place mindes christ saieth also another place kingdome god within luke 17 21 speake properlye kingdome god dwelleth v stranger world estate therof altogeather vnlike seruaunts would surely fight proueth ambitiouslye aspired vnto kingdome man stirreth man taketh weapon hande priuate man doe vsurpe vnto himselfe kingdome must needes ayded seditious person appeareth thing christe therefore followeth hee earthly king heere may question moued whether lawfull defend kingdom christ weapon prince commaunded kisse sonne psal 2 11 onely commaunded submit themselues priuately vnto gouernmente also employ al power haue defend church maintaine godlines first aunswere deale disorderly ignorauntly deduct consequence pure worshippe god doctrine gospell ought bee defended weapon christ defended owne person christ doth onely reason according present fact friuolous iewes slaunderously layd charge secondly although godlye kinges doe defende christes kingdome sword yet done way earthly kingdome woont defended kingdome christ spirituall must grounded doctrine power spirit like sorte edifying thereof finished neither lawes edict men neither yet penalty doe come vnto conscience yet letteth prince may defende kingdome christ accidentally partly whilest ordaine externall discipline partly whilest ayde church againste wicked commeth passe frowardnesse worlde kyngdome christ rather establyshed bloud martyrres helpe ayde weapon 37 therfore pilat said vnto art thou king iesus answered thou saiest king end borne end came world may beare witnesse trueth whosoeuer trueth heareth voice 38 pilate saith vnto trueth said thus went againe vnto iewes said vnto find fault 39 ye haue custome shuld let one loose vnto easter yee let lose vnto king iewes 40 therfore cried al againe saying barabbas barabbas murtherer 37 thou saist although pilat vnderstoode already former answer yt christ chalēg kingdom yet christ affirmeth self sāe thing plainly cōtēt therwith addeth sentēce certain sealing saying whēce gather doctrine kingdome christe common doctrine seeing thought worthie great asseueration auouching general sentence borne cause may bear witnesse truth▪ yet especially applyed vnto circumstance place wordes signifie thus much naturall thing christe speake truth secondly sent father end therfore proper office vvherfore neede feare least bee deceiued beleeuing forasmuch vnpossible teach thing true hath office giuen god desire naturally bred defend truth vvhosoeuer truth christe addeth muche cause might exhort pilate knewe vaine also hee might set doctrine free vniust reproches whereunto subiect shoulde haue said laid charge crime haue professed selfe king vndoubted truth receiue reuerently without doubting whosoeuer endowed right iudgement sound vnderstanding although saith truth see truth naturally asmuch gouerned spirite god 38 vvhat truth doe thinke pilate enquireth curiously profane men sometimes wont greedily desire knowledge vnknowen thing knowing meane season desire intent purpose feede eares doe rather take vttered word lothsomnesse pilate thought small iniurie done christ depriueth knowledge truth see pilate common disease men although euery man conscience doth beare witnesse ignorant yet abide confesse theereby commeth passe moste men doe refuse true doctrine afterward lorde teacher humble doth punish proude haue deserued striking blindnesse pride springeth loathsomenesse doe vouchsafe submit themselues learne men doe challedge themselues readinesse quicknesse wit truth thought common thing side god doth testifie far exceedeth capacitie man minde thing falleth thinges likewise principall point diuinitie concerning curse mankind corrupt nature mortification fleshe newnesse life free reconciliation sacrifice imputation righteousnesse whereby sinner accepted god illumination spirit thing paradox commō sense men doth contemptiblie refuse therfore profit rightly god schoole scarce one amongst ten taketh heed first rudiment principle saue measure hidden wisedome god according owne sense appeareth hereby pilate spake scornefully yt goth summe angrie christ hee boasteth hee bringeth truth light lay hid yet indignation declareth wicked doe neuer chourlishly reiect doctrine gospell touched efficacie therof although pilate went farre yeeldeth submitteth himselfe bee taught yet enforced feele pricking inwardly 39 yee haue custome pilate alwayes tosse minde might deliuer christ death seeing furie people great kept meane way whereby might pacifie mindes angrie thought woulde bee sufficient christ let loose euill doer suffer reproch alwayes afterward therefore choseth barabbas comparing christe hee may mittigate hatred conceiued christ barabbas hated men crueltie offence detestable murtherer luke saith also guiltie crime iewes preferre christ commeth passe • singuler prouidence god meete sonne god deliuered death shamefull price neuerthelesse cast downe extreame ignominie death crucified betweene two theeues barabbas let loose taken sinnes offence men vpon could otherwise bee purged glory resurrection folowed immediately caused death selfe valiant triumph furthermore filthie grosse vice custome president rome deliuer one wicked person easter doone celebrate holinesse day deed nothing el filthie profaning scripture doth testifie abhomination god acquitteth guiltie wicked person therefore farre preposterous pardon please therfore let v learne example nothing preposterous bee desirous worship god inuentions soone men shall begin followe owne imagination neuer make end vntill fallen extreame dotings doe manifestly mocke god therefore lawe rule god worship must bee fet prescript alone chap 19 1 pilate tooke iesus scourged 2 souldiers platted crowne thorne put vppon head put vppon purple garment▪ 3 said haile king iewes smote fist 4 therfore pilat went againe said vnto behold bring forthe vnto yee may know find fault 5 therefore iesus went forth bearing crown thornes purple garment said vnto behold man 6 therefore chiefe priestes officer saw cried saying crucifie crucifie 7 pilate saith vnto take yee crucifie finde fault pilat tooke iesus pilate persisteth purpose yet addeth another reproach former hopeth iewes bee content meane chastisement christ shall scourged wyth whippes laboureth earnestly profiteth nothinge must consider therein heauenly decree whereby christ appoynted vnto death neuerthelesse innocencie oftentimes defended auouched testimony iudg end may know free faulte himselfe made guiltye steede suffereth punishment due men sinnes pylate haue notable example fearefull conscience acquiteth christ mouth cōfesseth fault yet punisheth guiltie menne muste needes carried hither thither drawn contrarye diuerse opinion haue much courage defende inflexible constancy true right v condemne pylate neuerthelesse shame say many worlde hath like pilate whip christ member also doctrine many end may deliuer death labour gospel cause wickedly denye christ thing set christe mocked hee may lead infamous life othersome while gather fewe thinges gospell like doe pull peeces al whole gospell thinke great acte done grosse abuse amē ded better doctrine shuld buried season thē shuld thus scourged shal spring againe despite deuil al tirantes al hardest matter haue restored puritie thereof hath beene corrupted 2 soldiours platting questionlesse done commandement pylate end hee might put sonne god rebuke shame made himselfe king fulfill madnesse iewes beene perswaded lawfully accuse christ yet wickednes wantonnes soldiours dooth goe beyond commaundement iudge like wicked soone haue opportunitie offered doe euill doe catch greedily crueltie nation woonderfull whose mindes dolefull spectacle moue pittie god gouernour al may reconcile worlde vnto himselfe death sonne 6 take ye would deliuer christ handes neyther yet suffer doe vnto thought best doth onely deny hangmanne appeareth reason added immediately saith findeth fault say neuer perswaded shed innocent bloud sake vvhereas priestes officer alone desire haue crucified appeareth thereby suche furye people saue onely inasmuch afterward enflamed fannes 7 iewes answered haue law according law ought die hath made sonne god 8 therfore pilat heard word afraid 9 entred againe common hall said vnto iesus whence art thou iesus gaue • • ere 10 pylat said speakest thou knowest thou haue power crucifie thee power loose thee 11 iesus aunswered thou shouldest haue power mee vnlesse giuen thee aboue therefore hee hath deliuered mee vnto thee hath sinne 7 vvee haue law meaning persecute christe lawe pleasure hatred perceiued pilate touched ouertwhartly spake vnto manne ignoraunt law say permitted lyue owne manner custome relygion dooth suffer anye man vaunt bragge sonne god furthermore accusation altogether without cleake colour yet erred greatly supposition generall doctrine true
