make vp lye say souldier blinde soone receiued sight beleeued therefore canonize amongest saint seeing prayer doe leane vnto patrones often call vppon god pray euer obteine whosoeuer despice christe seeke succour handes saintes worthie bee carryed away diuel vnto night spirites hobgoblin came blood water men deceiued feigning myracle heere naturall thing blood congealed made like vnto water hauing lost readnesse also thing well knowen water within thinne skin nigh midriste deceiued euangelist vrgeth diligently came water blood hee shewe strange thing something contrary order nature intended another thing wit might applie narration testimonyes scripture addeth chiefly faithfull might thence gather teacheth el wit christ came water blood woordes signifieth brought true purgation sinnes true washing forgiuenesse sinnes righteousnesse purity soule figured law two signes sacrifice washing sacrifice blood purge sinnes price pacifie god wrath withall washing testimony true puritie remedy purge vncleannesse wash away filthinesse flesh least faith abide longer element iohn testifieth sith chapter epistle fulfilling grace christe heere bringeth foorth visible signe thing end serue sacrament christe hath left vnto church purging puritie soule consisteth newnesse life shewed vnto v baptisme supper pledge purging finished differ much figure old lawe offer christ present figure lawe shew farre yet vvherefore doe mislike augustine writeth sacramēts flowed christes side washed filthines indeed renued holie life doe wee li • e god redeemed death deliuered giltinesse baptisme holie supper doe bring v vnto christes side wee may draw thence faith fountaine represent 36 yee shall break bone testimonie fet twelfth exodus 46 num 9 12 moses intreateth paschall lambe▪ iohn taketh thing men graunt lambe signe true onely sacrifice whereby church redeemed neither doth whit hinder offered remembrance redemption alreadie past▪ god woulde haue benefite remembred might promise spirituall deliuerance church time come vvherefore 1 cor 5 7 paule doth also applie vnto christ without doubting forme eating lambe moses prescribeth proportion similitude doth faith gather small fruite beholdeth ceremony ye law saluatiō exhibited christ end tendeth iohn drift yt christ true pledge also price redemption wee see fulfilled shewed time past olde people vnder figure passeouer vvhereby iewes also taught must seeke substance thinges christ lawe prefigured performed deed 37 shall see haue thrust wreste place violently goe expound christ according letter neither doth euangelist cite ende rather may shewe christe god complained time past zacharie 12 10 iewes thrust brest god speaketh place maner men signifying hee wounded wickednesse people especially wyth obstinate contempt woorde deadly wounde man whose heart thruste throughe sayeth another place spirite heauy mat 26 38 christ god reuealed flesh iohn sayeth fulfilled openly visible flesh diuine maiestie suffered iewes sort coulde sufter god subiect iniuries men external blasphemy reproches vttered doe come vnto meant expresse howe great sacriledge vngodlinesse men guiltie whilest lifteth vppe selfe vnto heauen stubbernly iohn doeth good cause ascribe vnto iewes done hande souldiour rome like sayd place haue crucified sonne god although touched body one finger nowe question whether god promiseth repentance vnto iewes vnto saluation threatneth come reuenger vvhilest weigh place diligently thinke comprehendeth witte god shall lengthe gather vnto saluation reliques lost desperate nation▪ shall shew vnto contēners horrible vengeance deale knowe woont lesse boldlye mocke prophet babbled without commandement god god sayeth shall escape vnpunyshed length defend owne cause 38 thing ioseph aramathia iesus disciple secreatly feare iewes besought pilate might take downe body iesus pilate suffered ref • came tooke downe body iesus 39 nicodemus came also came vnto iesus first night bringing mixture myrrhe al • e hundred pound weight 40 therefore tooke body iesus wound linnen clothes wyth odour maner iewes burie 41 place crucified garden garden newe tombe wherein neuer man laied 42 layed iesus preparation iewes sepulchre nigh hande 38 ioseph besought pilate iohn setteth downe place howe honourably christ buried iohn nameth two whiche buried christ ioseph nichodemus former whereof desired pilate giue body dead otherwise haue ben left pleasure souldiours mathewe affirmeth riche luke sayeth counsellour order senatours sawe nichodemus great reputation amongest may also easily gather riche great cost hee bestowed bringing mixture therefore richesse hindered hitherto giuing name christ might lesse haue hindered heereafter takinge vppon odious infamous profession euangelist sayeth expresly ioseph kept backe feare professinge hee disciple christe hee repeateth concerninge nichodemus whych wee hadde hee came vnto iesus secreatlye nighte therefore whence hadde suche heroicall fortitude sodaine come abroade extreeme dispaire omitte manifest daunger must necessitie haue incurred thys great matter afrayed take vppon continuall warre wyth nation therefore certaine came passe throughe heauenlye motion gaue due honour vnto christe longe hee liued doe runne vnto carcasse dead brynge odour enbalme christes bodye woulde neuer haue done vnlesse hadde fealt sauour death vvhereby appeareth howe truely christe sayde onlesse wheat corne die remaineth alone deade bringeth foorth frute aboundantly 12 24 wee haue moste manifest testimonie thys place death liuely life sweetenesse smell whyche death christe breathed oute mindes two menne great force easily extinguishe affection fleshe longe loue richesse ambition raigned grace christe vnto vnsauerie nowe whole worlde beginneth vnto vnsauerie lette v knowe prescribed vnto v example wee owe vnto christe two ende might shewe token faith caried body christe constantly thoughe without great daunger vnto graue therefore shamefull filthye • luggishnesse wee defraude confession faith hee raigneth heauenly glorye vvherefore vngodlinesse muche vnexcusable seeinge doe daye denye christe faithlesse dissimulation doe yet notwythstanding pretende example nicodemus confesse like one poynte endeuour meanes possible haue christe buried nowe time burye hym sithens hee ascended vnto right hande father hee maye bee aboue menne aungels euery tongue maye confesse high gouernment philippian 2 9 10 11 secreatlye feare iewes feare place set holye constancie whyche spirite lorde wroughte heart iosephe likelye hee voyde vice feare whereby faithfull take heede themselues auoyde tyrauntes ennemies gospell corrupte vitious weakenesse faith bewrayeth selfe often confession faith suppressed feare vvee must alway marke lorde commaundeth v doe howe farre hee biddeth v goe hee stayeth midst course sheweth beleeueth god hee hath excuse setteth owne life commandement god euangelist vouchsafeth bestow vpon ioseph title name disciple time fearfull durst professe faith worlde know howe gently lorde dealeth fatherly pardoneth faultes neither cause false nicodemites flatter themselues doe hide faith within whilest feigne consent wicked superstition much lyeth deny christes disciple 40 iewes wont christ suffered extreame ignominie vpon crosse god woulde haue buriall honourable might entrance glory resurrection ioseph nicodemus bestow small cost might seeme bee superfluous must looke vnto purpose god also enforce spirite doe sonne honour mighte take v horrour crosse smell sepulchre thing extraordinarie ought taken example againe euangelist saith plainely hee buried manner iewes woordes hee signifieth one ceremony lawe requisite olde people vnto resurrection well made knowen token pledge thereof christ bee vnderpropt help yt might loke cōming y• mediatour constant faith vvherefore must note difference betweene v vnto brightnesse gospell hath shined father vnto whome figure supplie christe absence reason greater pompe rite tollerable whiche shoulde without fault day whiche bury dead sumptuously day doe onely bury dead men also christ himselfe much lyeth king life hauing pulled heauen resurrection hath abrogated old ceremony also great care religion amongest gentile burying tooke beginning father sacrifice seeing hope resurrection follower father ape promise word god soule quickeneth ceremony soone woorde taken away rite soeuer men vse although agree externall shew obseruing holy thinges yet nothing el rotten foolish superstition wee must haue saide day vse sobrietie sparing point immoderate cost doth take away smell christ resurrection 41 place thirde point saide noted historie buriall euangelist expresseth place many cause first came passe rashly without certaine prouidence god body christ laide newe sepulchre although died death men die yet first begotten dead first fruites ryse againe dead new sepulchre giuen ioseph nicodemus another thing head shorte time settyng sunne beginning ye sabboth sought cōmodiousnes place meane god chose contrary mind sepulchree wherein neuer man laid sonne therefore holy men doe like nighnesse place onely cause sabboth might broken god offereth vnto th • thing sought hee might discerne distinguish b • riall sonne common order token circumstance place also serue end resurrection might famous might giue small light historie followeth next chapter chap 20 1 first day sabbothes came mary magdalene earely morning whenas yet darke vnto sepulchre sawe stone taken away sepulchre 2 shee runneth commeth simon peter vnto disciple whō iesus loued saith vnto haue taken lorde sepulchre know haue laide 3 therefore peter disciple wente foorth came sepulchre 4 two ranne together disciple ran peter came first sepulchre 5 stouped downe saw linnen cloathes lying yet hee entred 6 simon peter came following entred sepulchre saw linnen cloathes lying 7 kerchiffe vpon head lying linnen cloathes wrapped together selfe place 8 entred disciple also came first vnto sepulchre saw beleeued 9 knew scripture yet hee must ryse againe dead 1 first day sabboth christ resurrection principall point faith without hope eternall life therefore euangelistes doe stand longer prouing like euangelist gathereth many testimony wherby may fully certified christ risen dead yet may seeme absurde thing hee bringeth foorth substanciall witness beginneth woman meanes fulfilled 1 cor 1 27 god choseth weake worlde may confound wisdome power glory flesh earthly dignitie disciple woman followed christe pleased christ haue first witness resurrection authenticall sufficient authoritie without exception nothing el letted priestes scribe people pilate know certainely christ risen againe grosse voluntarie blindenesse therefore woorthy seeinge see neuerthelesse christe reuealed hymselfe small company goe farther good shewe euangelistes agree togither whose woordes appeareth disagreement first light iohn nameth magdalene alone mathewe two marke three luke setteth downe certaine number sayeth onely woman followed christe galilee came wee maye easily loose knotte thus like mathewe putteth name two woman whiche better knowen famous amongest disciple iohn contented name magdalene alone neuerthelesse hee excludeth yea wee may easily gather woordes shee alone marye sayeth shortly plurall number wee knowe haue layed hym therefore althoughe iohn make mention fellowes yet hee telleth nothinge contrary say vve may easily aunsweare concerninge varietie time vvhen iohn sayeth shee came day vnderstande tooke iourney yet darke came sepulchre light day nighte sunne sette sabboth ended hadde bought odour hither oughte narration bee referred otherwise seemeth shewe contrarietie iohn sayeth marye spake vnto peter onelye luke sayeth shee came vnto eleuen apostle speache seemed vnto fained thing wee may easily aunsweare iohn omitte companion sette purpose peter came vnto sepulchre luke maketh mention peter alone like spake late concerning marye magdalene woman furthermore thought nine disciple kepte backe feare least come abroade company beene seene openly neither doeth whitte hinder whyche luke seemeth graunt despise wordes mary hee addeth immediately peter ranne vvherefore hee meaneth simplie astonied first hearing length come themselues againe peter followed might see whereas luke sayeth christe appeared vnto marye shee hadde tolde disciple sepulchre emptie course narration tourned backewarde whyche appeareth plainely texte hee addeth iohn testifieth came passe shee sawe iesus neither absurditie seeinge common thing amongest hebritians sette downe first later order time first day sabaoth euangelistes doe shewe sort christe rise againe sufficient expounde resurrection made knowen therefore sayeth mary came first day sabaoth woorde woorde one common thing amongest hebritians put one steade first number begin one muche euery seuenth day ordained rest called whole weeke sabaoth giuing honour holinesse daye called rest time name therefore woman came vnto sepulchre morrowe sabaoth much bought odour day yet sun sette secondly seeing gone citie yet darke falleth fearful matter first day sabaoth respecte next sabaoth beginning weeke ende whereof sabaoth therefore simon peter went foorth marueile seeinge suche weake almost faith well disciple woman great zeale surely cannot godlines enforced seke christ therfore remayned seed faith hart yet choked time knewe hadde spirite god doth oftentimes worke elect hidden manner summe must holde hidden roote whiche see fruit proceede although feeling godlinesse confused intangled muche superstition yet doe giue name faith vnproperly conceiued doctrine gospel tended end saue vnto christ seede came length true sincere faith hauing lefte sepulchre ascend vnto heauenly glory christe vvhen scripture speaketh rudiment first faith sayeth christe engendered v againe disciple bee accounted infant almost whilest ignoraunt christe resurrection yet lorde nourisheth vnborne child wombe like child gone little forward death christ brought vpon weakenesse begotten fashioned againe paule speaketh galathians fourth chapter ninthe verse peter made lesse haste goeth first sepulchre lette v learne giuen vnto many hinder ende appeareth forefront beginning vndoubtedly see many feruent hotte beginning faint faile come conflict others thought sluggish take themselues fresh courage 5 hee sawe linnen cloathes lying linnen cloathes thing putte make resurrection christe credible thought body stripped might caried vnto place neither friende foe woulde haue done vvhereas sayeth head wrapped kerchiefe thereby refuted vanitie papistes faine whole body sewed vppe one sheete whiche cause miserable common people woorshippe omitte ignorance latine tongue whereby came passe called cloath couered whole bodye napkin wherewith menne wipe sweat face omit impudencie boast haue hande kerchiefe fiue sixe diuers place grosse lie vntollerable quite contrary historie gospell heereunto added feigned myracle whiche feigned image picture christ body painted vpon linnen cloath pray beene myracle wrought woulde euangelist haue passed ouer without making mention therof reckoneth vp thinges lesse importance diligently therefore let simplicitie sufficient v christe hauing cast away token death meant testifie hee put vpon blessed immortall life 8 hee saw beleeued colde exposition men bring iohn beleeued heard mary wit body christ taken away shall neuer find word beleeue sense especially whereas put simplie without thing added vnto neither let peter iohn returne home againe doubting iohn vsed speech place would note going forward faith nowe luke saith 24 12 peter marueiled hee sawe sepulchre lye sort vvhereby signifieth came greater higher matter mind whiche marie told oftentimes heard christ mouth sawe eye forgotten beeing admonished beholding new thing begin think diuinely christ although yet far pure euident knowledge faith therefore iohn accuseth himselfe whylest hee confesseth vnto hym beginning beleeuing hee sawe signes resurrection christ moreouer hee amplifieth owne brethren fault onely forgotten christe wordes knewe scripture ascribeth want faith vnto ignorance whence may also gather profitable admonition imputed vnto owne sluggishnesse wee know thinges shoulde haue knowen concerning christe haue profited much scripture became v whiche reueale power christe full may fet example farther resurrection christe shewed obscurely darkely manyfest testimony extant attentiue render paule proueth act 13 34 christe ought haue risen agayne god saith iesaias 55 3 mercy promised dauid shall stable vnder kingdome vnskilfull man would thinke nothing appertinent vnto matter paule bringeth whosoeuer doe holde principle faith rightly exercised scripture doe easily knowe howe fitlie reasoneth ende christe may continually establishe vnto v grace god hee must needes liue continually bee many like place whiche need gather nowe therefore let v content three psalm 16 10 reade thou shalt suffer thine holy one see corruption peter paule expounde prophesie christe good cause sithence one child adam whiche subiect corruption himselfe therefore christe immortalitie auouched bee doubted sentence doth belong vnto christ lorde said vnto lord sitte right hande vntill make thy foe thy foote stoole psalm 110 1 death shall destroyed vntill last day therefore kingdome giuen vnto christe vntill ende worlde cannot stand withou life iesaias speaketh plainest 53 8 vvho hath fortolde death christ addeth immediately age shall vndeclarable summe must hold doctrine scripture full perfect pointes whatsoeuer wanting faith ought iustly accounted ignorance thereof 10 therefore disciple went againe vnto owne home 11 mary stood without weeping sepulchre furthermore shee wepte bowed selfe downe sepulchre 12 shee saw two angel sitting white garment one head another feete body iesus laide 13 say vnto woman weepest thou shee saith vnto haue taken away lord know haue laid 14 vvhen saide thus turned backe saw iesus standing knew iesus 15 iesus saith vnto woman weepest thou seekest thou thinking gardiner saith vnto sir thou hast taken away tell mee thou hast laid take away 10 therfore went vve may thinke went home yet doubting mindes although iohn saith hee beleeued yet firme faith confused feeling perceiuing myracle like dumpe traunce vntill better confirmed truly sound faith could conceiued beholding moreouer christ reueale himselfe vnto vntill better awaked earnall dulnesse shewed laudable token zeale making hast vnto sepulchre yet christe hidden becuse sought superstitiously 11 mary stoode euangelist beginneth shew christ appeared woman also disciple make knowen resurruction although one mary mentioned place yet seemeth thing like bee true woman also whereas thinke slid away feare stādeth reason wil flie eschewe contrarietie none said whereas woman stay still sepulchre disciple returned citie greatly bee praysed disciple carry themselues consolation ioy woman occupie themselues superfluous vaine weeping finally superstition togeather carnall affection maketh stay sepulchre 12 saw two angel wonderfull mercy lord forgiueth mary fellowes many assaultes doth vouchesafe small honour sending angel manifesting himselfe length disciple although apostle woman sick one disease yet dulnesse lesse excuseable hauing well throughly taught profited little certainely christ choose woman vnto would reueale himselfe first without apostle shame furthermore vncertaine whether mary knewe angeles shee thought yt men vve know white garment signe heauenly glory christe white cloathing maiestie appeare vnto three disciple mountaine math 17 7 luke sheweth thing angell appeared cornelius act 10 30 neyther denie men east countrie vse linnen garment god shewed singuler vnwonted thing apparrell angel gaue markes whereby might discerned men moreouer matthewe 28 3 compareth countenaunce angell vnto lightning spake vnto woman yet may made afraide onely reason admiration appeareth stood still astonied often reade angel haue appeared visible shape men hauing cloathes graunted vnto rudenesse men yea doe doubt body indeede sometimes superfluous enquire whether two angel onely shape body leaue indifferent sufficient mee man shape giuen thē lorde woman might see heare glorious straunge apparrell whiche distinguishing order men shewe diuine heauenlye thing one head another feate vvhereas matthew maketh mē tion one angell differeth iohn narration spake together marie one vnto embassage committed augustine allegorie firme enough placing angel shew gospel shuld preached rising sunne vnto going downe thereof therefore bee noted christ began glory kingdome maiestie angel honor sepulchre ignominie crosse thereby abolished heauenly maiestie christ doth shine appeare 13 vvoman weepest thou vvee may easily gather euangelistes angell spake thus iohn gathereth summe briefly sufficient testifie declare christ risen sentence mixed chiding comfort angell chideth mary vnportunate weeping yet doth therewithall mixe ioy whilest hee saith shee cause weepe christe risen 14 shee saw iesus standing question may bee moued heere thing came passe mary knoweth iesus ought haue knowen familiarly doe thinke hee appeared straunge fourme doe thinke faulte rather woman eye luke concerning two disciple 24 16 therefore say christe chaunge himselfe diuers shape like proteus god gaue eye vnto men blinde dull sight thereof often hee seeing may see yea haue marie common patterne errours man minde although christe came sight yet wee feigne hath diuers shape sense vnderstanding conceiueth euery thing sooner true christe seeing sight minde selfe deceitfull also bewitched satan worlde least discerne true thing 15 syr thou hast taken away shee calleth syr according common custome nation hebrewes salute husbandman base estate name syr see mary smelleth yet nothing earthly shee desireth onely haue christe body shee may keepe buried omitteth chiefest thing aspire vnto diuine power resurrection wherefore maruell grosse affection bring veile ouer eye 16 iesus saith vnto mary shee turned back saith vnto rabbini say master 17 iesus saith vnto touch yet ascended vnto father go vnto brother tell ascend vnto father father god god 18 mary magdalene came tolde disciple shee seene lord spoken thinges vnto 16 mary christ suffered mary erre short time profitable v vnto certaintie faith hee reclaymeth errour one worde hee spoken vnto speech vnknowen man hauing nowe taken himselfe person master hee calleth disciple name tenth chapter nienth verse good sheepehearde calleth vnto himselfe sheepe flocke name therefore voyce pastour entreth minde marie openeth eye stirreth vp sens moueth shee submitteth selfe vnto christe haue image calling depainted mary true entrance knowledge christ knowes v first secondly inuite v vnto himselfe familiarly common voyce whiche soundeth confusedly men eares voyce wherewith calleth sheepe peculiarly giuen father therefore paule saith galathians 4 9 yee knewe god yee knowen furthermore efficacie worde appeareth thereby marie giueth due honor vnto christ without delay ye word rabboni honourable containeth also profession obedience therefore marie testifieth christes disciple submitteth addicteth selfe vnto vnto master marueilous secret conuersion man minde whenas god maketh quicke sight sodainely dull altogeather blinde furthermore example mary ought serue exhortation many soeuer christe doth inuite vnto himselfe may answere worde rabboni chaldean worde although pronounce rabboni common thing word bee changed turned another straunge tongue asmuch lorde master manner speaking christes time tooke rabbi rabboni master 17 touch seemeth disagree matthew narration writeth plainely woman embraced christ foot seeing would haue disciple grope feale cause forbad mary touch vve may easily answere sobeit know holde woman driuen back frō touching christe busie touching asmuch necessary take away doubting hee forbid touch saw embrace feete busily moderate correct rash zeale sticke corporal presence neither know way meanes enioy liue togeather vppon earth therefore must persuade selues forbidden touch vntill time christ seeme yt retained kept worlde foolish vnseasonable desire vve must also note reason addeth yet ascended vnto father commandeth woman word suspend desire vntill time receiued heauenly glory finally sheweth end resurrection suche ende feigned immagined themselues restored life againe might triumph world rather hee might take possession kingdome promised ascending heauen might gouerne church father hande power spirite therefore meaning wordes estate resurrection full pointes perfect vntill shoulde sit heauen father right hande therfore womē wel cōtent one half resurrection desired haue present world profite doctrine double first must lift vp mindes erre seeking christ second must shake earthly desire flesh whosoeuer wil go toward paul teacheth col 3 1 2 goe vnto brother doe restraine woorde brother vnto kinsfolk christ well iudgement rather haue sent vnto vnto disciple answer iohn testifieth another place beleeued doe thinke christ vouchsafed bestow great honour vpō mention made muste needes graunt mary obediently commanded christ followeth immediately shee came disciple whereby wee gather christe spake moreouer christe knewe disciple gathered togeather one place men doe separate • pinion absurd thing disciple shoulde bee neglected whylest certaine odde fellowes regarded gathered one place dyd stande betweene hope feare furthermore christ seemeth haue borrowed speeche two twentieth psalme 23 written declare thy name vnto brother questionlesse fulfilling prophesie rehearsed place therefore thinke marie sent vnto disciple thinke done vpbraide slowe beleeue truly worthie haue woman bee teacher euen ox ass profited little almost nothing vnder sonne god vsed diligence teaching instructing continually yet milde gentle chasticement whylest christ sendeth disciple thus vnto woman schoole may reclaime vnto himselfe inestimable goodnesse appeareth also hee appointeth woman bee witness vnto apostle resurrection embassage▪ whiche giuen charge onely groundeworke saluation conteineth principall point heauenly wisedome although must also note extraordinarie accidentall thing commaunded tell apostle preached vnto whole world afterward according function enioyned womē apostle therfore falsely gather law place permit woman baptize let bee sufficient v christ shewe vnfolde infinite treasure grace whilest hee make teach apostle yet woulde haue taken example whiche done singuler priuiledge wee may see chiefly mary magdalene whiche captiue seuen diuels much christ lift vp aboue heauens brought hell man obiect cause christ shoulde preferre woman apostle lesse carnall dull answere difference betweene apostle woman put placed wyll iudge againe say sharply chidden onely taught also appointed teacher whole worlde called light men salt earth matthew 5 chapter 13 14 verse filthily fallen meane season pleased lorde shewe token power weake contemptible instrument ascende vnto father word ascend confirmeth doctrine expoūded late▪ wit yt • e rose againe cause might linger stay vpon earth hauing entred heauenly life might drawe faithfull thither summe forbiddeth apostle woorde stay bare resurrection onely willeth goe forewarde vntill come vnto spirituall kingdome heauenly glory vnto god himselfe therefore great force word ascende christe reacheth forth hande vnto maye seeke felicitie anye else saue onely heauen treasure must heart also math 6 21 christe sayeth ascendeth vpward therefore must ascende vnlesse separated addeth ascendeth vnto god doeth easily driue away soeuer sorrowe care apostle might conceiue departure signifieth alwayes present diuine power ascending noted distance place although christ absent body yet god power spred abrode euery doeth manifestly declare shewe spirituall presence ende ascende vnto god saue onely sittinge righte hande hee might raigne heauen earth finally meant speache commende diuine power kingdome least disciple shoulde • ake absence hys fleshe heauily nowe fruite effecte brotherly coniunction mentioned late expressed whilest christe maketh god father common well v himselfe sayeth hee doe ascend vnto father also father vve heare place made partaker good thinges christ foundation hee imparteth maketh common vnto v fountaine selfe good thinges questionlesse vnestimable good thing faithfull may safely surely perswade themselues god christes god father christes father neede feare least hope confidence reproued rashnes grounded christ least proud bragge whiche christe himselfe hath indited vnto v owne mouth furthermore christe calleth god asmuch hauing taken vppon shape seruaunt abased himselfe therefore proper humane nature yet applyed whole person respecte vnitie christ god man touching second member also differ sonne god nature adoption onely stabilitie grace haue cannot shaken anye engine satan may alwaies cal father hath adopted v sonne 19 daye night first sabaoth dores shut disciple gathered together feare iewes came iesus stoode middest saide vnto peace bee vnto 20 hee saide thus hee shewed handes side therefore disciple reioyced seene lorde 21 therfore iesus saith vnto againe peace vnto father hath sente also send 22 said breathed vpon saith vnto receiue holy ghost 23 vvhose sinnes yee shal remit shal remitted vnto whose sinnes ye shal retaine shal retained 19 day night euangeliste declareth christes resurrection proued vnto disciple beholdinge seeing happened without prouidence god gathered togeather one place matter myght surelye certeinelye beleeued vvee muste note howe courteouslye gentlye christe dealte suffer doubt vntil night moreouer hee gaue light bringing vnto pledge new lyfe world wa • darke come togeather signe fayth godly affection yt kepte themselues close doores shutte acknowledge infirmitie although moste stronge valyaunt constant menne someties afrayde yet wee may easilye gather apostle afraide bewrayed want fayth example worth marking although doe behaue themselues valiauntly ought yet doe flatter themselues infirmitie seeke secrete place may escape daunger yet encourage themselues continue together otherwise shuld haue beene scattered abroad one haue beene bolde looke vppon another thus must striue infirmitie fleshe neyther must wee giue place vnto feare whiche prouoketh v faynce fall christ blesseth zeale hee appeareth vnto thus gathered together thomas iustlye depriued common grace brother beecause hee departed banner vnitie like wandring soldiour therefore let feareful learn sharpen exhort themselues correct feare flesh must especially beware feare doe scatter v abroad doores shut circumstaunce added conteineth token christes diuine power whereas think manne hadde vnlocked doores hee entred manner menne altogeather contrary euangelists minde therefore wee muste thus thinke christ entred miraculously hee might shewe token diuinitie hee mighte make disciple attentiue neuerthelesse case graunt true papist affirm body christ came doores shutte holde cause may onelye make glorious bodye like spirite may proue vnmeasurable contained place woordes import thing euangelist saieth entered doores shutte stoode middest disciple notwithstandinge doores shutte entraunce way made hand man vve know peter came prison fast lockte shall therefore say came middest yron plankes therefore away childishe subtelties haue soundnesse bring many toyes dotings let sufficient v christ meant establishe credite resurrection amongst disciple excellēt myracle peace vnto common forme saluation vsed amongst hebrewes vnder woorde peace doe comprehende prosperitie good thinges whiche woont desired vnto blessed life therefore saying importeth much shoulde say wel happily vnto vvhich speake cause menne dispute philosophically concerning peace concorde thys place seeing onely intent purpose christ wish wel disciple 20 shewed handes meete confirmation added might made knowen vnto meanes christe risen againe man thinke vnmeete contrary christes glory beareth woundes yet resurrection lette first consider rose againe hys owne sake secondly soeuer maketh saluation vnto glorious humbled himselfe season maiestie whit abated nowe seeing woundes spoken heere doe serue set forth credite resurrection doe diminish whitte glorye anye manne shal gather heereby christ hath yet side thrust throgh handes pearced shalbe ridiculous asmuche certeine vse woundes temporall vntill apostle fully perswaded risen death vvhen iohn saieth apostle reioyced sawe lord hee giueth v vnderstande al sorow death christ brought apostle driuen away new life hee saith againe peace vnto second salutatiō seemeth tend none end saue lord may heard greatnes weightines thing wherof intreate deserue 21 • father hath sent wordes christ doth cō secrate apostle office whereunto hee ordained appointed sent iudea like cryers commaunded people heare chiefe teacher apostle take vppon continuall office teaching lord maketh embassador may erect kingdom world therefore let continue sure certeine apostle first appointed ordinary minister gospel word import asmuch shuld say hath executed office teacher hitherto therfore sithence hath fulfilled course doth cōmit charg vnto thē meaneth father made teacher ye church cōdition might go rest time might chuse place might supply place whē absent respecte paule ephe 4 11 saith hee made apostle euangelistes pastor gouerne church vntill ende world therefore christe dooth testifie although office teaching temporall yet preaching gospell lasteth small time shall eternall secondlye end doctrine proceedeth mouth apostle maye haue neuer whitte lesse authoritie commaundeth enter function hee father hee giueth person assigneth vnto authoritie meete ministerie established thus obscure men common sorte againe admitte great renoume dignitie yet know whatsoeuer men haue farre inferiour fayth vvherefore without cause christ imparteth vnto apostle authoritie hath receiued father may meanes declare preaching gospel enioined thē man commaundement god hee put place doth leaue principal maistershyppe father would haue remaine power alone therfore continueth continue euer onely teacher church onely difference spake owne mouth long conuersant vpon earth spea •• 〈…〉 apostle therefore succession chri •• 〈…〉 thing thereby • ight remaineth vntouched honour 〈◊〉 decree cannot broken whereby commaunded heare summe christ meant place adorne menne doctrine gospell furthermore wee must note intreateth preaching gospell onely▪ christ sendeth apostle make satisfaction sinnes worlde purchase righteousnes hee himselfe sent father therefore toucheth place peculier thing doth appoint minister pastours gouerne church vppon condition may retaine principall power menne may challenge themselues nothing el seruice 22 breathed vppon mortall manne sitte harde weightie function therefore christ furnisheth apostle grace spirite truely thing passeth man habilitie far gouerne god church bringe message eternall saluation erect kingdome god vppon earth lifte vppe menne vnto heauens vvherefore merueile meete manne founde vnlesse inspired holy ghost manne speake word concerning christ vnlesse spirit directe tongue farre manne sufficient fulfill faythfully hartily partes excellent office glorye belongeth christ alone fashion forme whome hee appointeth teacher church fulnesse spirite powred vppon cause hee may giue euerye one measure againe seeing remaineth onely pastour church must needes shewe forth power spirite mynisters whose diligence vseth vvhich thing also testifie externall signe hee breathed vppon apostle shuld agree vnlesse spirite didde proceede vvherefore sacriledge papist muche detestable take themselues honour whiche proper sonne god theyr horned byshoppes doe boaste breathe spirite belchinge make masse priestes thinge selfe sheweth plainelye enough much stincking breath dooth differ breathing christe make nothinge else ass horse moreouer christe dooth onelye imparte vnto disciple spirite whiche hee receiued hee giueth owne seeing common father therfore vsurpe themselues glorye diuinitie whosoeuer professe giue spirit breathing nowe wee muste note christe furnisheth necessarye gyftes whome hee calleth vnto pastorall office may able discharge duetie function least may come emptie naked vvhich thing true foolishe bragging papystes easilye refuted whylest doe highlye extoll theyr hierarchie holye gouernaunce cannot shewe euen verye leaste sparke holye ghoste bishop haue v beleeue lawfull pastours church consequentlye apostle christes vicares appeareth emptie grace holy ghost certain rule prescribed vnto v place esteeme callinge iudge thereof gouerne churche god see endued holy ghost notwythstanding christe meant chiefly auouche defend dignitye apostolicall order meete authoritie shoulde singular chosen bee firste chiefe preache gospell christe gaue spirite breathinge vppon sendinge holy ghost followed afterwarde seemeth superfluous aunsweare spirite giuen apostle place suche sort onely sprinkled grace endowed wyth perfecte power thereof holy ghoste appeared fiery tongue vppon throughly renewed truely doeth appoynte nowe preache gospell hee sendeth straightway vnto woorke rather else actes 1 4 commaunded rest weigh thing wel doeth much furnishe necessary giftes present time appoynt make instrument spirite againste tyme come vvherfore breathing ought referred extended moste parte vnto great honourable sendinge spirite promised often furthermore christ coulde haue giuen grace vnto apostle secreat inspiration yet would adde visible breathing confirme better christ tooke signe common custome scripture doth commonly cō pare spirit vnto winde reason similitude briefly expounded third chapter let reader marke word also ioyned externall visible signe euen hence doe sacrament borrow force force spirit included voice soundeth eares effect al thing faithful haue gather sacramentes dependeth vpon testimonie word christ breatheth vpon apostle doe receiue blast spirite also saue onely christ promiseth holye ghost like sort put christe baptisme washed bloud old man crucified righteousnes god may reigne v vve fed spiritually holy supper flesh bloud christ vvhence commeth force saue onely promise christ bringeth passe perfourmeth spirit promiseth word therefore let v knowe whatsoeuer sacramentes men haue inuented nothing else meere toyes friuolous pastime signes haue trueth saue onely word god present neuer mocke thus holy thing without wicked blaspheming god destructiō soules must take good heede iuglings satan man obiect found fault popish bishop consecrate masse priest breathing beecause word christ annexed signe may readilye answere christ spak apostle hee might institute continual sacrament church would declare testifie said late spirite commeth alone againe neuer enioyneth office doth also minister power vnto minister furnisheth hability omit masse priest made popery far rather contrary end wit slea christe daily whereas apostle created offer vp men sacrifice sword gospel neuerthelesse must also hold christe alone dooth giue good thing figureth promiseth hee doth bid apostle receiue spirit external breathing frō himselfe 23 vvhose sinnes ye shal remit douted christe doth briefly teacheth 2 cor 5 18 vvhere calleth gospell respect ministery reconciliation gospel containeth many thing god doth principally may receiue men fauour imputing vnto sinnes vvherefore wil shew selues faithful minister gospel must endeuour al diligēce gospell differeth prophane philosophy moste poynt placeth man saluation free forgiuesse sinnes benefites god doe flowe hence god dooth illuminate v regenerate v spirit reformeth fashioneth v owne image hee armeth v inuincible strength world sathan therefore whole doctrine godlines spirituall blinding church stayeth vppon foundation god doth adopt v vnto himselfe freely purged sinnes christ doth enioyne vnto apostle commaundement forgiue sinnes hee dooth translate giue vnto proper forgiue sinnes hee doth resigne vp honour vnto apostle inasmuch benefite authours doeth highly extoll power answeare graunted establishing faith nothinge profite may safely perswade selues sinnes remembred god zacharias calleth knowledge saluation songe luke 1 77 seeing god doeth vse testimonie men proou • conscience shall neuer quiet vnlesse acknowledge god himselfe doeth speake person therefore paule sayeth 2 corint 5 20 exhort ye reconciled vnto god christ beseeche v nowe doe see christe doeth set foorth adorne ministerie enioyneth hys apostle excellent title witte faithful may fully perswaded sure certain heare concerning remission sinnes may make lesse account reconciliation offred voice men god himselfe reach foorth hand heauen church reapeth moste plentifull frute doctrine daily whilest vnderstandeth pastours made promiser eternall saluation shee needeth seeke remission sinnes whiche committed vnto neither ought therefore make small accounte thys incomparable treasure put earthen vessel thanke god hath vouchsafed bestowe great honour vppon men represent person person sonne testifying forgiuenes sin let v know whilest braine sicke men despise embassage tread vnder foot bloud christ againe papist doltish wrest place vnto magicall absolution vnlesse man confesse sin priest eare must hope remission say christ would haue apostle forgiue sinnes cannot obsolue vnlesse knowe matter therefore menne must needes confesse theyr sinnes errour ridiculous whilest passe ouer principall issue matter witte authoritye graunted apostle auouch defend authoritie gospel preaching wherof committed vnto christe dooth appoynte place confessionaries may sifte know euery sinne secret whisperinges lowd preacher gospel may seale grace purging gotten christe heartes faythfull vvherefore must note manner forgiuing sinnes may know power giuen apostle vvhose sinnes ye shal retaine christ addeth second member terrifie contemners gospel may know shal escape scotte free pryde therefore embassage eternal saluation lyfe enioyned apostls armed vengeaunce al wicked refuse saluation offered paule teacheth 2 cor 10 6 latter order true natural end preaching gospell oughte haue beene shewed first reconciled vnto god proper gospell accidentall thing vnbeleeuers adiudged vnto eternall death like sorte paule hee denounceth vengeaunce vnto vnbeleeuers whereof haue spoken late hee addeth immediately obedience shall fulfilled giueth asked wickedly consequently doeth bid feele hand handle wound side gather hereby diligently prouided faith respect vnto tho vnto v also least thing wanting establishing faith dulnes tho wonderful mōstrous content saw christ wold also haue hand witness resurrection stubberne also proud reprochful christ ought least haue confounded shame haue ben afraid sone saw christ thrusteth hand boldly without feare guilty fault may easily gather word euangelist came himselfe time conuicted touching self whilest giue lesse honor word lord meete cōmeth vpon v litle litle vnawares worse stubbernes bringeth cōtempt yea taketh v reuerence vvherefore must take much paine bridle wantonnes wit nature least whilest euery man doth giue himselfe greater liberty resist lawful shut gate faith feeling godlines extinguished 28 lord god thomas awaked length dreame crieth throughe admiration men wont returne vnto themselues haue beene beside themselues lord god abrupt sentence hath greater force doubted brake word enforced shame might therby condemn sluggishnes furthermore sodaine outcry doth shew faith quite extinguished although choked handleth christ diuinity side hand gathereth much sign shew whēce commeth saue returneth sodainly forgetfulnes drousines therfore appeareth true said euen faith semed abolished lie hid hart couered thing doth also befal many sometimes wanton time cast away feare god appeareth faith sone chastned light chastisement god come thēselues againe fiercenesse flesh brought vnder certainly disease sufficient selfe teach godlinesse whence gather soone impediment purged good seede lay hid beginneth appeare vvhereof excellent example dauid see howe carelesly triumpheth hath obtained hys lust men would haue thought faith quite abolished minde time sodainly called way suche short admonition prophet may readily gather small fire although couered yet minde without delay break forth flame touching men guilty euen dispoiled themselues faith al grace holy ghost cōmeth passe vnmeasureable goodnes god elect run hedlōg alienatiō wherfore must take good heed fall away frō faith yet must perswade selues god doth kepe back elect wyth hidden bridle christ alloweth doutles wold haue suffred honor giuē rashly falsly vnto taken frō father yet doth flatly allow th said wherfore one place sufficiēt refute madnes arrius sufficiently altogither name 30 many vnlesse preuention added reader might haue thought iohn omitted none myracles iesus hath perfect ful hystory al thing therfore iohn doth testify first wryte certain thing many vnworthy wordes signifieth vnto v wrote much ought satisfie v abundantly sufficient confirm faith meant preuent vaine curiosity men cannot satisfied beareth much self furthermore iohn knew wel euangelists wrytten seeing intēded nothing lesse abolish wrytings without doubt doth separate narration yet seemeth absurd thing faith foūded grounded myracles ought wholely • eane vnto promise god word answear myracles haue none vse giuē place saue may help shoares vnto faith serue prepare mind men may ye reuerently heare receiue word god know cold slowe attentiuenesse vnlesse pricked forward thing smal authority added vnto doctrine receiued lord reacheth mighty hād heauen vnderprop marke sayeth 16 20 apostle taught lord working togither confirming word signes folowing therfore although faith doth leane properly vnto word god doth looke vnto word vnto marke yet myracles vaine referred vnto word also directe faith thither vve haue sayd else myracles called signes witte lord stirreth v vp consider hys power whilest hee sheweth newe straunge thinge iesus christe vnderstandeth christe promised lawe prophet witte mediatour betweene god men chiefe embassadour father onely restorer worlde authour perfecte felicitie iohn take bare title might therewithall adorne sonne god hee comprehended vnder name christe office whiche prophet doe assigne vnto therefore must consider hee described vnto v place vvhereby doeth plainlye appeare sayde late faith doeth sticke myracles brought straightway vnto worlde one iohn haue sayd proued myracles prophet taught time woord mouth see euangelists themselues doe stande simply reckening vp myracles rather occupied doctrine myracles shoulde themselues procure nothing confused woondering vvherefore meaning wordes thing wrytten may beleeue much faith may holpen myracles addeth sonne god fitte man coulde haue beene founde amongest common sort men doe great thing witte reconcile father vnto v purge sinnes worlde abolish death pull downe kingdome sathan bring vnto v true righteousnesse saluation seeing woorde sonne belongeth vnto christ followeth hee sonne god adoption nature wherefore eternall diuinitie christe contained woorde certainly knoweth christ god suche manifest testimony extant gospell blinde perfecte light woorthy see sunne earth beleeuing yee may haue eternall life effecte faith added also bridle mennes lust desire maye couette knowe thinges sufficient obtaine life wickednesse content eternal saluation desire passe bound kingdom heauen place iohn repeateth principal poynt doctrine obtaine eternal life morning nowe come iesus sloode vppon shoare neuerthelesse disciple knewe iesus 5 iesus sayeth vnto child haue ye mea • answeared 6 hee sayde vnto cast nette right side shippe yee shall finde cast nowe able drawe multitude fish 7 therefore disciple whome iesus loued sayde vnto peter lorde vvhen simon peter hearde lorde girded coate naked cast else sea 8 disciple came shippe farre lande two hundreth cubites drew nette fish 9 therefore soone came lande sawe • cales layed fishe layed vppon breade 10 iesus sayeth vnto bring fish yee caught nowe 11 simon peter went vppe drewe nette vnto la • de full great fish hundreth three fiftie although many net broken 12 iesus sayeth vnto come • ine none disciple durst aske ar • thou seeing knewe lorde 13 therefore iesus came tooke bread giueth fishe likewise 14 nowe thirde time iesus shewed himselfe disciple risen deade 1 afterwarde shewed himselfe euangelist standeth yet vppon proouing resurrection christe telleth appeared vnto seuen disciple tiberias called see maner hebrewes 3 goe fishe vvhereas peter giueth himselfe fishinge ought thought contrary office ordained apostle breathing sayd late stayed vntill time indued • ewe power yet commaunded exercise office teaching onely admonished calling come rest might vnderstand chosen vaine beginninge meane doe woont became priuate men paule get liuing wyth handes middest course preaching another maner respecte time deuided manuall labour coulde drawe away teaching peter companion doe giue themselues wh • lelye fishing free maner publike function tooke nothing night christe suf • ered take paynes vaine night make knowen sette • oorth credite myracle caught thing christes power shoulde haue beene manifestly knowen continuall successe whilest labouring vain night sodainly enioy great draught haue iust occasion giuen acknowledge grace lorde god doeth also oftentimes exercise faithfull lyke sorte may commende vnto blessing shoulde alwayes haue good successe often set hād worke man almost would thanke blessing god hee hath rewarde recompence worke men would make boast owne industrie kisse owne handes whereas wearye themselues sometime vaine reape better frute afterwarde enforced acknowledge extraordinarie thing commeth passe begin giue praise prosperous successe vnto grace god 6 cast net right side christ doth commaund according right authority lord maister counselieth one cōmon people ye disciple hauing nede counsel readily obey though know heard thing first casting woulde haue obeyed readily▪ whiche speake cause least man shoulde maruel duetiful seeing already ta •• ed long vaine wearisomnesse although small testimony patiēce labour day light though bad successe night surely must constantly waite blessing god may giue place nothinge preposterous pluck back hand frō worke straightway vnlesse appeare frutefull peter nakednesse doth testifie laboured seriously refuse make triall new castinge least neglecte anye opportunitie obey christe commandement cannot ascribed vnto faithe heare manne whome knowe nowe calling vnto v troublesome labour take seemeth v barren yet lorde exhorteth v goe forwarde constantly must good courage shall haue length happy successe yet due time 7 therefore disciple euangelist teacheth owne example often thinges fall better looked must lift vp mindes vnto god must straightway remember benefite came grace authour goodnesse godly acknowledging god grace engrafted minde iohn brought vnto knowledge christ also knoweth christe sight perswaded aboundance fish offered god gathereth christ whome hand directed like faith first iohn peter passeth zeale throweth himselfe lake setting part respecte daunger rest doe followe shippe come vnto christe length peter • caryed singuler zeale aboue rest douted whether came banke walking swimming lette sufficient v knowe tooke iourney hauinge left shippe headlong force rashnesse went rest according measure zeale able drawe firste christeshewed one token hys power suche plentifull draught fish shewed another yt kept net whole hidden power must needes haue burst otherwise heereunto added circumstaunces disciple finde hotte coales vpon banke fish also breade laied ready touching number fish must seeke high mysterie augustine doth subtilly make forge law gospel number recited manne doe well throughly examine shall finde childish toye 10 bring fish although net filled moment without great labour yet christe assigneth draughte vnto call bread yet whilest craue haue giuen v confesse proceedeth god blessing 12 none disciple durst question may letted whether shame proceeding reuerence thing christ sawe doubt ought haue preuented doubting doeth oftentimes else answear none cause shame saue onely euident inoughe christ woont aske concerning doubtful darke matter therefore euangeli • giueth v vnderstande aske christ afraide doe iniurie manifestly reuealed himselfe 14 nowe thirde time number three referred vnto distance time christe hadde already appeared seuen time soeuer done one day comprehended vnder one manifestation therefore signifieth christe appeared vnto disciple diuers time might make resurrection beleeued 15 therefore dinner done iesus sayeth vnto simon peter simon sonne iohn louest thou sayeth vnto yea lord thou knowest loue thee sayeth vnto feede lambes 16 sayeth vnto againe seconde time simon sonne iohn louest thou sayeth vnto yea lord thou knowest loue thee sayeth vnto feede sheepe 17 sayeth vnto thirde time simon sonne iohn louest thou mee peter sorye sayde thirde time leuest thou sayd vnto lorde thou knowest thing thou knowest loue thee iesus sayeth vnto feede sheepe 18 verely verely say vnto thee vvhen thou wast yonger thou girdedst thy selfe walkedst whether thou wouldest thou shalt waxe olde thou shalt stretche thine hande shall girde thee shall leade thee whither thou wilt 19 sayd signifying death glorifie god thus spoken sayeth vnto followe 15 therefore dined euangelist declareth nowe peter restored vnto degree honour whiche hee fell vnfaithfull deniall whereof haue hearde made hym vnwoorthy apostleshippe howe coulde fitte teacher faith fallen away filthily hee made apostle witte iudas sone forsoke place also depriued honor apostleship therefore libertie teaching autoritie also restored vnto lost throgh fault least infamy fal shuld whit hinder christe wipeth away blotteth remembrance thereof kind restoring againe necessary peter also hearer end might stoutly dutie certein calling enioyned againe thē least blot sticking name might occasion despising gospell also profitable v day peter shuld come forth vnto v newe man whose shame abolished might hinder dignitie simon sonne iohn louest thou christ signifieth word man serue church faithfully take paine feedinge flocke vnlesse looke higher vnto men first office feeding selfe painefull troublesome seeing nothing hard keepe menne vnder god yoake whereof many weake many light froward slow sluggish hard churlish vnapt taught satan layeth way stumbling block may thereby discourag good pastor herevnto added vnthankfulnes many cause wearisō ne therfore man shal euer go forward constantly office saue whose heart loue christ shal reigne forgetting addicting wholy vnto may ouercome al impediment paul declareth affected 2 cor 5 14 whē saith loue christ bindeth v considering one died al thē al dead although meaneth loue wherewith christ loued v whereof shewed token death yet adioineth mutual affection ariseth feeling great benefit againe marketh wicked false teacher trouble ye church mark loue lord iesus 1 cor 16 22 therefore let called gouerne church remember couet execute office wel rightly must begin loue christ meane season christ doth testifie plentifully account maketh saluation whilst cōmendeth vnto pastor singularly hee affirmeth vnto token testimonie dearly loue care carefully could effectual thing spoken encourage minister gospel thē heare yt office acceptable christ emploied feeding flock al godly may draw small comforte thence heare deare precious sonne god putteth roume doctrine ought make false teacher litle afraid ouerturne gouernment church shall suffer small punishment christes handes whoe pronounceth violated feede lambes scripture applyeth word feede vnto al manner gouernment metaphorically spiritual gouernment church handeled place profitable note vppon partes office pastour consisteth doubtlesse anye idle dignitie depaynted vnto v place neither dooth christe giue vnto mortall man anye gouernment hee may exercise pleasure confusedly vve haue seene chap 10 christ properly pastor church vve haue also seene taketh name wit gouerneth sheep doctrine saluatiō consequently doth feede true foode soule vseth help men preach doctrine doth also giue name least make partaker therfore accoūted lawful pastor god gouerne church vnder christe head ministerie word whēce may easily gather burdē christ laieth vpon peter shoulder vpon condition hee setteth ouer flock vvherby wickednes romanistes sufficiently plainely refuted wrest place establish tyrannye popedom said say vnto peter al feede sheepe vve haue already declared rather spoken thē rest wit free al sinister note mark might free preach gospel therfore christ maketh pastour thri • e three denial wherby peter purchased eternal infamy abolished may whit hinder apostleship augustine chriso ciril many prudently note nothing giuen peter word like sort common al minister gospel therefore papistes doe vaine hold chief cause alone called especially admit graunt honour giuen 〈◊〉 priuatelye pray wil proue placed primacy admitte chief amongst apostle shal therfore follow streightway vpon vniuersal byshoppe al whole worlde moreouer whatsoeuer peter receiued dooth apperteine vnto pope vnto mahomet right doth boast brag hee peter heire againe manne sound iudgement wyll graunt vnto heritable right giuen set downe christ place yet accounted successour woulde god none v contrary may loue christe haue great care feede flocke loue christ neglected office feeding reiected vnmeete foolish thing boast succession like christe commaunded peter feede meant erect throane idol hangman soules might miserablye torment church hee brieflye teach manner gouernment church allowed visor plucked face al horned byshoppes onely contente stagelye pomp vaine title doe challenge themselues byshoplyke right autoritie 16 feede sheepe christ doth commit al generally aswel peter others fed lamb sheepe defineth place accounteth flock sheepe saith heare voce follow mee voice straunger hear good teacher must diligēce gather al vnto christ cannot discerne betweene sheepe wild beast must v trie whether tamed like wolues sheep yet haue al theyr labour shall profite none elect sheepe easines bee taught faith proceede thence heauenly father deliuereth sonne obey hath chosen creation worlde place teacheth none bee fed saluation doctrine gospel saue meek apt taught christ doth vaine compare disciple vnto lamb sheepe must also note tamed spirite god beares lion nature 17 peter sory vvithout doubt peter perceiue christes drift asking often therfore thinketh accused way answered hearte haue alre • die shewed superfluous repetition againe peter yet tryed sufficiently deeply loue christ must rooted mindes must ouercome innumerable straites learned afterward long vse vaine througly examined furthermore taught person take vpon charge gouerning church sift themselues lightly must examine themselues throughly zeale endowed least recoyle faint middest course al likewise taught must take paciētly time lorde doe examine v roughly hee hath iust cause doe know 18 verily verily say vnto thee christe hath exhorted peter feede sheep doth also arme enter warfare whiche hand doth require faith diligence handes inuincible minde courage danger constancie bearing crosse finally commaundeth readie suffer death need shall require although condition pastours alike yet admonition agreeth belongeth vnto thē respect lord spareth many abstaineth theyr blood content one thing whilest liue cō secrate thēselues faithfully wholy satā doth euer thē stir vp new manifold cōbates must need prepared die whosoeuer doe take vpon office feeding much haue deale onely sheepe also wolues concerning peter christ would haue foretold end might alwayes thinke vpon hee establish doctrine blood whereof made minister although christ seemeth place haue respected also adorned title martyr presence ot • er disciple haue said another manner champion shewed himselfe vvhen 〈◊〉 wast younger age seemeth appointed rest idle wherfore old men set free frō publike burden made discharged souldiers therfore peter might haue promised quiet estate life age contrary christ saith order nature shall bee changed hee liued owne whē young shalbe gouerned another man wil whē old shall suffer violent gouernment haue peter excellent glasse common estate many men liue pleasantly commodiously called christ soone haue giuen name receiued bee disciple least shortly drawen vnto great greeuous combat vnto troublesome life vnto great peril sometimes vnto death selfe although hard estate yet must painfully suffer neuerthelesse ye lord doth temper crosse wherwith haue seruants tryed hee beareth long vntill power waxe rype doth well know infirmitie beyonde meane measure whereof vrgeth hee pardon peter long sawe tender weake therfore let v learne offer selues vnto euen vntill last breath hee giue v strength wherein filthy vnthankfulnes many appeareth meekely lorde dealeth v much doe accustome selues liue delicately scarce one founde amongst hundred doth murmur repine handeled roughly hath long borne wee ought rather haue considered gentlenesse god hee spareth v time christ saith long conuersant vpon earth disciple liued merily present mariage fastinges teares afterwarde prepared math 9 15 another shall girde thee many thinke manner death signified hereby hanged armes spread abroad doe thinke vnder woorde girde externall action simply comprehended wherewith man ordereth himselfe life thou gyrdedst thy selfe thou clothedst thy selfe pleased thee libertie fashioning framing thy apparrell shall taken thee furthermore better know maner death peter suffered beleeue doubtfull fable shall leade thee whither thou wilt sense peter shoulde die bed violence swoord seemeth absurd thing christ saith death shall voluntarie constancie martyr whiche carryed death worthie prayse ought referred vnto disagreement betweene flesh spirite doe neuer obey god free affection world flesh doe drawe v cordes vnto contrary wherefore paule complaineth thus rom 7 19 good woulde doe againe must note feare death naturally engrafted men contrarie nature willing bee dissolued therefore although christe himselfe framed wholy obey god whole heart yet craueth pardoned hee myght die furthermore peter feared torment shoulde proceede crueltie men therefore maruell somewhat afraide death plainely declare thereby obedience perfourmed god suffered death willingly would gladly haue escaped himselfe knew pleased god meanes neither haue beene pacience without suffering mind doctrine profitable knowne styrreth v vp pray coulde neuer ouercome feare death without singuler ayde god therefore remaineth nothing humbly offer selues gouerned serueth stay vp mind least fall fainte quite time fal quake tremble persecution feigne martyr touched feare take themselues matter dispaire owne feare cause infirmitie terrifie v following example like wherof haue tried could triumph ouer enemy trueth without fighting themselues 19 signifying death periphrasis great weight although al godly ought ayme marke may glorifie god aswell life death yet iohn meant adorne affirmatiuely haue tarry till come came passe faulte scriuener • errour interpreter doubtlesse hee could bee deceiued greeke word one letter might easily creepe amongst latinistes might alter whole sense therefore whole sentence interrogation ought read one text christ meant lay hold vpon apostle might keepe within boundes calling nothing thee neither oughtest thou enquire concerning thy fellow office shall become let alone aske onely thy selfe make thy selfe ready follow whither thou art called care brother superfluous ought haue measure bee care curiositie hindereth v therefore let euery
